IAST: agniṁ naro dīdhitibhir araṇyor hastacyutī janayanta praśastam
Griffith: THE men from fire-sticks, with their hands' swift movement, have, in deep thought, engendered glorious Ag
Devanāgarī: अग्निं नरो दीधितिभिररण्योर्हस्तच्युती जनयन्त प्रशस्तम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | naraḥ | dīdhiti-bhiḥ | araṇyoḥ | hasta-cyutī | janayanta | pra-śastam || dūre-dr̥śam | gr̥ha-patim | atharyum ||7.1.1||

IAST: dūredṛśaṁ gṛhapatim atharyum
Griffith: Far-seen, with pointed flame, Lord of the homestead.
Devanāgarī: दूरेदृशं गृहपतिमथर्युम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | naraḥ | dīdhiti-bhiḥ | araṇyoḥ | hasta-cyutī | janayanta | pra-śastam || dūre-dr̥śam | gr̥ha-patim | atharyum ||7.1.1||

IAST: tam agnim aste vasavo ny ṛṇvan supraticakṣam avase kutaś cit
Griffith: The Vasus set that Agni in the dwelling, fair to behold, for help from every quarter:
Devanāgarī: तमग्निमस्ते वसवो न्यृण्वन्सुप्रतिचक्षमवसे कुतश्चित्
pada pāṭha: tam | agnim | aste | vasavaḥ | ni | r̥ṇvan | su-praticakṣam | avase | kutaḥ | cit || dakṣāyyaḥ | yaḥ | dame | āsa | nityaḥ ||7.1.2||

IAST: dakṣāyyo yo dama āsa nityaḥ
Griffith: Who, in the home for ever, must be honoured.
Devanāgarī: दक्षाय्यो यो दम आस नित्यः
pada pāṭha: tam | agnim | aste | vasavaḥ | ni | r̥ṇvan | su-praticakṣam | avase | kutaḥ | cit || dakṣāyyaḥ | yaḥ | dame | āsa | nityaḥ ||7.1.2||

IAST: preddho agne dīdihi puro no 'jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha
Griffith: Shine thou before us, Agni, well-enkindled, with flame, Most Youthful God, that never fadeth.
Devanāgarī: प्रेद्धो अग्ने दीदिहि पुरो नोऽजस्रया सूर्म्या यविष्ठ
pada pāṭha: pra-iddhaḥ | agne | dīdihi | puraḥ | naḥ | ajasrayā | sūrmyā | yaviṣṭha || tvām | śaśvantaḥ | upa | yanti | vājāḥ ||7.1.3||

IAST: tvāṁ śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ
Griffith: To thee come all our sacrificial viands.
Devanāgarī: त्वां शश्वन्त उप यन्ति वाजाः
pada pāṭha: pra-iddhaḥ | agne | dīdihi | puraḥ | naḥ | ajasrayā | sūrmyā | yaviṣṭha || tvām | śaśvantaḥ | upa | yanti | vājāḥ ||7.1.3||

IAST: pra te agnayo 'gnibhyo varaṁ niḥ suvīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ
Griffith: Among all fires these fires have shone most brightly, splendid with light, begirt by noble heroes,
Devanāgarī: प्र ते अग्नयोऽग्निभ्यो वरं निः सुवीरासः शोशुचन्त द्युमन्तः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | agnayaḥ | agni-bhyaḥ | varam | niḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | śośucanta | dyu-mantaḥ || yatra | naraḥ | sam-āsate | su-jātāḥ ||7.1.4||

IAST: yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ
Griffith: Where men of lofty birth sit down together.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा नरः समासते सुजाताः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | agnayaḥ | agni-bhyaḥ | varam | niḥ | su-vīrāsaḥ | śośucanta | dyu-mantaḥ || yatra | naraḥ | sam-āsate | su-jātāḥ ||7.1.4||

IAST: dā no agne dhiyā rayiṁ suvīraṁ svapatyaṁ sahasya praśastam
Griffith: Victorious Agni, grant us wealth with wisdom, wealth with brave sons, famous and independent,
Devanāgarī: दा नो अग्ने धिया रयिं सुवीरं स्वपत्यं सहस्य प्रशस्तम्
pada pāṭha: dāḥ | naḥ | agne | dhiyā | rayim | su-vīram | su-apatyam | sahasya | pra-śastam || na | yam | yāvā | tarati | yātu-māvān ||7.1.5||

IAST: na yaṁ yāvā tarati yātumāvān
Griffith: Which not a foe who deals in magic conquers.
Devanāgarī: न यं यावा तरति यातुमावान्
pada pāṭha: dāḥ | naḥ | agne | dhiyā | rayim | su-vīram | su-apatyam | sahasya | pra-śastam || na | yam | yāvā | tarati | yātu-māvān ||7.1.5||

IAST: upa yam eti yuvatiḥ sudakṣaṁ doṣā vastor haviṣmatī ghṛtācī
Griffith: To whom, the Strong, at morn and eve comes, maid-like, the ladle dropping oil, with its oblation.
Devanāgarī: उप यमेति युवतिः सुदक्षं दोषा वस्तोर्हविष्मती घृताची
pada pāṭha: upa | yam | eti | yuvatiḥ | su-dakṣam | doṣā | vastoḥ | haviṣmatī | ghr̥tācī || upa | svā | enam | aramatiḥ | vasu-yuḥ ||7.1.6||

IAST: upa svainam aramatir vasūyuḥ
Griffith: Wealth-seeking comes to him his own devotion.
Devanāgarī: उप स्वैनमरमतिर्वसूयुः
pada pāṭha: upa | yam | eti | yuvatiḥ | su-dakṣam | doṣā | vastoḥ | haviṣmatī | ghr̥tācī || upa | svā | enam | aramatiḥ | vasu-yuḥ ||7.1.6||

IAST: viśvā agne 'pa dahārātīr yebhis tapobhir adaho jarūtham
Griffith: Burn up all malice with those flames, O Agni, wherewith of old thou burntest up Jarutha,
Devanāgarī: विश्वा अग्नेऽप दहारातीर्येभिस्तपोभिरदहो जरूथम्
pada pāṭha: viśvāḥ | agne | apa | daha | arātīḥ | yebhiḥ | tapaḥ-bhiḥ | adahaḥ | jarūtham || pra | ni-svaram | cātayasva | amīvām ||7.1.7||

IAST: pra nisvaraṁ cātayasvāmīvām
Griffith: And drive away in silence pain and sickness.
Devanāgarī: प्र निस्वरं चातयस्वामीवाम्
pada pāṭha: viśvāḥ | agne | apa | daha | arātīḥ | yebhiḥ | tapaḥ-bhiḥ | adahaḥ | jarūtham || pra | ni-svaram | cātayasva | amīvām ||7.1.7||

IAST: ā yas te agna idhate anīkaṁ vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivaḥ pāvaka
Griffith: With him who lighteth up thy splendour, Agni, excellent, pure, refulgent, Purifier,
Devanāgarī: आ यस्ते अग्न इधते अनीकं वसिष्ठ शुक्र दीदिवः पावक
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | te | agne | idhate | anīkam | vasiṣṭha | śukra | dīdi-vaḥ | pāvaka || uto iti | naḥ | ebhiḥ | stavathaiḥ | iha | syāḥ ||7.1.8||

IAST: uto na ebhiḥ stavathair iha syāḥ
Griffith: Be present, and with us through these our praises.
Devanāgarī: उतो न एभिः स्तवथैरिह स्याः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | te | agne | idhate | anīkam | vasiṣṭha | śukra | dīdi-vaḥ | pāvaka || uto iti | naḥ | ebhiḥ | stavathaiḥ | iha | syāḥ ||7.1.8||

IAST: vi ye te agne bhejire anīkam martā naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā
Griffith: Agni, the patriarchal men, the mortals who have in many places spread thy lustre,-
Devanāgarī: वि ये ते अग्ने भेजिरे अनीकं मर्ता नरः पित्र्यासः पुरुत्रा
pada pāṭha: vi | ye | te | agne | bhejire | anīkam | martāḥ | naraḥ | pitryāsaḥ | puru-trā || uto iti | naḥ | ebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | iha | syāḥ ||7.1.9||

IAST: uto na ebhiḥ sumanā iha syāḥ
Griffith: Be gracious to us here for their sake also.
Devanāgarī: उतो न एभिः सुमना इह स्याः
pada pāṭha: vi | ye | te | agne | bhejire | anīkam | martāḥ | naraḥ | pitryāsaḥ | puru-trā || uto iti | naḥ | ebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | iha | syāḥ ||7.1.9||

IAST: ime naro vṛtrahatyeṣu śūrā viśvā adevīr abhi santu māyāḥ
Griffith: Let these men, heroes in the fight with foemen, prevail against all godless arts of 4magic,-
Devanāgarī: इमे नरो वृत्रहत्येषु शूरा विश्वा अदेवीरभि सन्तु मायाः
pada pāṭha: ime | naraḥ | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | śūrāḥ | viśvāḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | santu | māyāḥ || ye | me | dhiyam | panayanta | pra-śastām ||7.1.10||

IAST: ye me dhiyam panayanta praśastām
Griffith: These who ipprove the noble song I sing thee.
Devanāgarī: ये मे धियं पनयन्त प्रशस्ताम्
pada pāṭha: ime | naraḥ | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | śūrāḥ | viśvāḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | santu | māyāḥ || ye | me | dhiyam | panayanta | pra-śastām ||7.1.10||

IAST: mā śūne agne ni ṣadāma nṛṇām māśeṣaso 'vīratā pari tvā
Griffith: Let us not sit in want of men, O Agni, without descendants, heroleu, about thee:
Devanāgarī: मा शूने अग्ने नि षदाम नृणां माशेषसोऽवीरता परि त्वा
pada pāṭha: mā | śūne | agne | ni | sadāma | nr̥ṇām | mā | aśeṣasaḥ | avīratā | pari | tvā || prajā-vatīṣu | duryāsu | durya ||7.1.11||

IAST: prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya
Griffith: But, O House-Friend, in houses full of children.
Devanāgarī: प्रजावतीषु दुर्यासु दुर्य
pada pāṭha: mā | śūne | agne | ni | sadāma | nr̥ṇām | mā | aśeṣasaḥ | avīratā | pari | tvā || prajā-vatīṣu | duryāsu | durya ||7.1.11||

IAST: yam aśvī nityam upayāti yajñam prajāvantaṁ svapatyaṁ kṣayaṁ naḥ
Griffith: By sacrifice which the Steeds' Lord ever visits, there make our dwelling rich in seed and offspring,
Devanāgarī: यमश्वी नित्यमुपयाति यज्ञं प्रजावन्तं स्वपत्यं क्षयं नः
pada pāṭha: yam | aśvī | nityam | upa-yāti | yajñam | prajā-vantam | su-apatyam | kṣayam | naḥ || sva-janmanā | śeṣasā | vavr̥dhānam ||7.1.12||

IAST: svajanmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam
Griffith: Increasing still with lineal successors.
Devanāgarī: स्वजन्मना शेषसा वावृधानम्
pada pāṭha: yam | aśvī | nityam | upa-yāti | yajñam | prajā-vantam | su-apatyam | kṣayam | naḥ || sva-janmanā | śeṣasā | vavr̥dhānam ||7.1.12||

IAST: pāhi no agne rakṣaso ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrter araruṣo aghāyoḥ
Griffith: Guard us, O Agni, from the hated demon, guard us from malice of the churlish sinner:
Devanāgarī: पाहि नो अग्ने रक्षसो अजुष्टात्पाहि धूर्तेरररुषो अघायोः
pada pāṭha: pāhi | naḥ | agne | rakṣasaḥ | ajuṣṭāt | pāhi | dhūrteḥ | araruṣaḥ | agha-yoḥ || tvā | yujā | pr̥tanā-yūn | abhi | syām ||7.1.13||

IAST: tvā yujā pṛtanāyūm̐r abhi ṣyām
Griffith: Allied with thee may I subdue assailants.
Devanāgarī: त्वा युजा पृतनायूँरभि ष्याम्
pada pāṭha: pāhi | naḥ | agne | rakṣasaḥ | ajuṣṭāt | pāhi | dhūrteḥ | araruṣaḥ | agha-yoḥ || tvā | yujā | pr̥tanā-yūn | abhi | syām ||7.1.13||

IAST: sed agnir agnīm̐r aty astv anyān yatra vājī tanayo vīḻupāṇiḥ
Griffith: May this same fire of mine surpass all others, this fire where offspring, vigorous and firm-handed,
Devanāgarī: सेदग्निरग्नीँरत्यस्त्वन्यान्यत्र वाजी तनयो वीळुपाणिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agniḥ | agnīn | ati | astu | anyān | yatra | vājī | tanayaḥ | vīḷu-pāṇiḥ || sahasra-pāthāḥ | akṣarā | sam-eti ||7.1.14||

IAST: sahasrapāthā akṣarā sameti
Griffith: Wins, on a thousand paths, what ne'er shall perish.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रपाथा अक्षरा समेति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agniḥ | agnīn | ati | astu | anyān | yatra | vājī | tanayaḥ | vīḷu-pāṇiḥ || sahasra-pāthāḥ | akṣarā | sam-eti ||7.1.14||

IAST: sed agnir yo vanuṣyato nipāti sameddhāram aṁhasa uruṣyāt
Griffith: This is that Agni, saviour from the foeman, who guards the kindler of the flame from sorrow:
Devanāgarī: सेदग्निर्यो वनुष्यतो निपाति समेद्धारमंहस उरुष्यात्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agniḥ | yaḥ | vanuṣyataḥ | ni-pāti | sam-eddhāram | aṁhasaḥ | uruṣyāt || su-jātāsaḥ | pari | caranti | vīrāḥ ||7.1.15||

IAST: sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ
Griffith: Heroes of noble lineage serve and tend him.
Devanāgarī: सुजातासः परि चरन्ति वीराः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agniḥ | yaḥ | vanuṣyataḥ | ni-pāti | sam-eddhāram | aṁhasaḥ | uruṣyāt || su-jātāsaḥ | pari | caranti | vīrāḥ ||7.1.15||

IAST: ayaṁ so agnir āhutaḥ purutrā yam īśānaḥ sam id indhe haviṣmān
Griffith: This is that Agni, served in many places, whom the rich lord who brings oblation kindles,
Devanāgarī: अयं सो अग्निराहुतः पुरुत्रा यमीशानः समिदिन्धे हविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | agniḥ | ā-hutaḥ | puru-trā | yam | īśānaḥ | sam | it | indhe | haviṣmān || pari | yam | eti | adhvareṣu | hotā ||7.1.16||

IAST: pari yam ety adhvareṣu hotā
Griffith: And round him goes the priest at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: परि यमेत्यध्वरेषु होता
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | agniḥ | ā-hutaḥ | puru-trā | yam | īśānaḥ | sam | it | indhe | haviṣmān || pari | yam | eti | adhvareṣu | hotā ||7.1.16||

IAST: tve agna āhavanāni bhūrīśānāsa ā juhuyāma nityā
Griffith: Agni, may we with riches in possession bring thee continual ofierings in abundance,
Devanāgarī: त्वे अग्न आहवनानि भूरीशानास आ जुहुयाम नित्या
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | ā-havanāni | bhūri | īśānāsaḥ | ā | juhuyāma | nityā || ubhā | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | vahatū iti | miyedhe ||7.1.17||

IAST: ubhā kṛṇvanto vahatū miyedhe
Griffith: Using both means to draw thee to our worship.
Devanāgarī: उभा कृण्वन्तो वहतू मियेधे
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | ā-havanāni | bhūri | īśānāsaḥ | ā | juhuyāma | nityā || ubhā | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | vahatū iti | miyedhe ||7.1.17||

IAST: imo agne vītatamāni havyājasro vakṣi devatātim accha
Griffith: Agni, bear thou, Eternal, these most welcome oblations to the Deities' assembly:
Devanāgarī: इमो अग्ने वीततमानि हव्याजस्रो वक्षि देवतातिमच्छ
pada pāṭha: imo iti | agne | vīta-tamāni | havyā | ajasraḥ | vakṣi | deva-tātim | iccha || prati | naḥ | īm | surabhīṇi | vyantu ||7.1.18||

IAST: prati na īṁ surabhīṇi vyantu
Griffith: Let them enjoy our very fragrant presents.
Devanāgarī: प्रति न ईं सुरभीणि व्यन्तु
pada pāṭha: imo iti | agne | vīta-tamāni | havyā | ajasraḥ | vakṣi | deva-tātim | iccha || prati | naḥ | īm | surabhīṇi | vyantu ||7.1.18||

IAST: mā no agne 'vīrate parā dā durvāsase 'mataye mā no asyai
Griffith: Give us not up, Agni, to want of heroes, to wretched clothes, to need, to destitution.
Devanāgarī: मा नो अग्नेऽवीरते परा दा दुर्वाससेऽमतये मा नो अस्यै
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | avīrate | parā | dāḥ | duḥ-vāsase | amataye | mā | naḥ | asyai || mā | naḥ | kṣudhe | mā | rakṣase | r̥ta-vaḥ | mā | naḥ | dame | mā | vane | ā | juhūrthāḥ ||7.1.19||

IAST: mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣasa ṛtāvo mā no dame mā vana ā juhūrthāḥ
Griffith: Yield us not, Holy One, to fiend or hunger; injure us not at home or in the forest.
Devanāgarī: मा नः क्षुधे मा रक्षस ऋतावो मा नो दमे मा वन आ जुहूर्थाः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | avīrate | parā | dāḥ | duḥ-vāsase | amataye | mā | naḥ | asyai || mā | naḥ | kṣudhe | mā | rakṣase | r̥ta-vaḥ | mā | naḥ | dame | mā | vane | ā | juhūrthāḥ ||7.1.19||

IAST: nū me brahmāṇy agna uc chaśādhi tvaṁ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
Griffith: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on our chiefs and nobles.
Devanāgarī: नू मे ब्रह्माण्यग्न उच्छशाधि त्वं देव मघवद्भ्यः सुषूदः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | brahmāṇi | agne | ut | śaśādhi | tvam | deva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | susūdaḥ || rātau | syāma | ubhayāsaḥ | ā | te | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.1.20||

IAST: rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: रातौ स्यामोभयास आ ते यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | brahmāṇi | agne | ut | śaśādhi | tvam | deva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | susūdaḥ || rātau | syāma | ubhayāsaḥ | ā | te | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.1.20||

IAST: tvam agne suhavo raṇvasaṁdṛk sudītī sūno sahaso didīhi
Griffith: Thou Agni, swift to hear, art fair of aspect: beam forth, O Son of Strength, in full effulgence.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने सुहवो रण्वसंदृक्सुदीती सूनो सहसो दिदीहि
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | su-havaḥ | raṇva-saṁdr̥k | su-dītī | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | didīhi || mā | tve iti | sacā | tanaye | nitye | ā | dhak | mā | vīraḥ | asmat | naryaḥ | vi | dāsīt ||7.1.21||

IAST: mā tve sacā tanaye nitya ā dhaṅ mā vīro asman naryo vi dāsīt
Griffith: Let me not want, with thee, a son for ever: let not a manly hero ever fail us.
Devanāgarī: मा त्वे सचा तनये नित्य आ धङ्मा वीरो अस्मन्नर्यो वि दासीत्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | su-havaḥ | raṇva-saṁdr̥k | su-dītī | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | didīhi || mā | tve iti | sacā | tanaye | nitye | ā | dhak | mā | vīraḥ | asmat | naryaḥ | vi | dāsīt ||7.1.21||

IAST: mā no agne durbhṛtaye sacaiṣu deveddheṣv agniṣu pra vocaḥ
Griffith: Condemn us not to indigence, O Agni, beside these flaming fires which Gods have kindled;
Devanāgarī: मा नो अग्ने दुर्भृतये सचैषु देवेद्धेष्वग्निषु प्र वोचः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | duḥ-bhr̥taye | sacā | eṣu | deva-iddheṣu | agniṣu | pra | vocaḥ || mā | te | asmān | duḥ-matayaḥ | bhr̥māt | cit | devasya | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naśanta ||7.1.22||

IAST: mā te asmān durmatayo bhṛmāc cid devasya sūno sahaso naśanta
Griffith: Nor, even after fault, let thy displeasure, thine as a God, O Son of Strength, o'ertake us.
Devanāgarī: मा ते अस्मान्दुर्मतयो भृमाच्चिद्देवस्य सूनो सहसो नशन्त
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | agne | duḥ-bhr̥taye | sacā | eṣu | deva-iddheṣu | agniṣu | pra | vocaḥ || mā | te | asmān | duḥ-matayaḥ | bhr̥māt | cit | devasya | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naśanta ||7.1.22||

IAST: sa marto agne svanīka revān amartye ya ājuhoti havyam
Griffith: O Agni, fair of face, the wealthy mortal who to the Immortal offers his oblation.
Devanāgarī: स मर्तो अग्ने स्वनीक रेवानमर्त्ये य आजुहोति हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | martaḥ | agne | su-anīka | revān | amartye | yaḥ | ā-juhoti | havyam || saḥ | devatā | vasu-vanim | dadhāti | yam | sūriḥ | arthī | pr̥cchamānaḥ | eti ||7.1.23||

IAST: sa devatā vasuvaniṁ dadhāti yaṁ sūrir arthī pṛcchamāna eti
Griffith: Hath him who wins him treasure by his Godhead, to whom the prince, in need, goes supplicating.
Devanāgarī: स देवता वसुवनिं दधाति यं सूरिरर्थी पृच्छमान एति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | martaḥ | agne | su-anīka | revān | amartye | yaḥ | ā-juhoti | havyam || saḥ | devatā | vasu-vanim | dadhāti | yam | sūriḥ | arthī | pr̥cchamānaḥ | eti ||7.1.23||

IAST: maho no agne suvitasya vidvān rayiṁ sūribhya ā vahā bṛhantam
Griffith: Knowing our chief felicity, O Agni, bring hither ample riches to our nobles,
Devanāgarī: महो नो अग्ने सुवितस्य विद्वान्रयिं सूरिभ्य आ वहा बृहन्तम्
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | naḥ | agne | suvitasya | vidvān | rayim | sūri-bhyaḥ | ā | vaha | br̥hantam || yena | vayam | sahasā-van | madema | avi-kṣitāsaḥ | āyuṣā | su-vīrāḥ ||7.1.24||

IAST: yena vayaṁ sahasāvan mademāvikṣitāsa āyuṣā suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Wherewith we may enjoy ourselves, O Victor, with undiminished life and hero children.
Devanāgarī: येन वयं सहसावन्मदेमाविक्षितास आयुषा सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | naḥ | agne | suvitasya | vidvān | rayim | sūri-bhyaḥ | ā | vaha | br̥hantam || yena | vayam | sahasā-van | madema | avi-kṣitāsaḥ | āyuṣā | su-vīrāḥ ||7.1.24||

IAST: nū me brahmāṇy agna uc chaśādhi tvaṁ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
Griffith: Give strength and power to these my prayers, O Agni; O God, pour blessings on bur chiefs and nobles.
Devanāgarī: नू मे ब्रह्माण्यग्न उच्छशाधि त्वं देव मघवद्भ्यः सुषूदः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | brahmāṇi | agne | ut | śaśādhi | tvam | deva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | susūdaḥ || rātau | syāma | ubhayāsaḥ | ā | te | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.1.25||

IAST: rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Grant that both we and they may share thy bounty. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: रातौ स्यामोभयास आ ते यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | brahmāṇi | agne | ut | śaśādhi | tvam | deva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | susūdaḥ || rātau | syāma | ubhayāsaḥ | ā | te | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.1.25||

IAST: juṣasva naḥ samidham agne adya śocā bṛhad yajataṁ dhūmam ṛṇvan
Griffith: GLADLY accept, this day, our fuel, Agni: send up thy sacred smoke and shine sublimely.
Devanāgarī: जुषस्व नः समिधमग्ने अद्य शोचा बृहद्यजतं धूममृण्वन्
pada pāṭha: juṣasva | naḥ | sam-idham | agne | adya | śoca | br̥hat | yajatam | dhūmam | r̥ṇvan || upa | spr̥śa | divyam | sānu | stūpaiḥ | sam | raśmi-bhiḥ | tatanaḥ | sūryasya ||7.2.1||

IAST: upa spṛśa divyaṁ sānu stūpaiḥ saṁ raśmibhis tatanaḥ sūryasya
Griffith: Touch the celestial summits with thy columns, and overspread thee with the rays of Surya.
Devanāgarī: उप स्पृश दिव्यं सानु स्तूपैः सं रश्मिभिस्ततनः सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: juṣasva | naḥ | sam-idham | agne | adya | śoca | br̥hat | yajatam | dhūmam | r̥ṇvan || upa | spr̥śa | divyam | sānu | stūpaiḥ | sam | raśmi-bhiḥ | tatanaḥ | sūryasya ||7.2.1||

IAST: narāśaṁsasya mahimānam eṣām upa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ
Griffith: With sacrifice to these we men will honour the majesty of holy Narasamsa-
Devanāgarī: नराशंसस्य महिमानमेषामुप स्तोषाम यजतस्य यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsasya | mahimānam | eṣām | upa | stoṣāma | yajatasya | yajñaiḥ || ye | su-kratavaḥ | śucayaḥ | dhiyam-dhāḥ | svadanti | devāḥ | ubhayāni | havyā ||7.2.2||

IAST: ye sukratavaḥ śucayo dhiyaṁdhāḥ svadanti devā ubhayāni havyā
Griffith: To these the pure, most wise, the thought. inspirers, Gods who enjoy both sorts of our oblations.
Devanāgarī: ये सुक्रतवः शुचयो धियंधाः स्वदन्ति देवा उभयानि हव्या
pada pāṭha: narāśaṁsasya | mahimānam | eṣām | upa | stoṣāma | yajatasya | yajñaiḥ || ye | su-kratavaḥ | śucayaḥ | dhiyam-dhāḥ | svadanti | devāḥ | ubhayāni | havyā ||7.2.2||

IAST: īḻenyaṁ vo asuraṁ sudakṣam antar dūtaṁ rodasī satyavācam
Griffith: We will extol at sacrifice for ever, as men may do, Agni whom Manu kindled,
Devanāgarī: ईळेन्यं वो असुरं सुदक्षमन्तर्दूतं रोदसी सत्यवाचम्
pada pāṭha: īḷenyam | vaḥ | asuram | su-dakṣam | antaḥ | dūtam | rodasī iti | satya-vācam || manuṣvat | agnim | manunā | sam-iddham | sam | adhvarāya | sadam | it | mahema ||7.2.3||

IAST: manuṣvad agnim manunā samiddhaṁ sam adhvarāya sadam in mahema
Griffith: Your very skilful Asura, meet for worship, envoy between both worlds, the truthful speaker.
Devanāgarī: मनुष्वदग्निं मनुना समिद्धं समध्वराय सदमिन्महेम
pada pāṭha: īḷenyam | vaḥ | asuram | su-dakṣam | antaḥ | dūtam | rodasī iti | satya-vācam || manuṣvat | agnim | manunā | sam-iddham | sam | adhvarāya | sadam | it | mahema ||7.2.3||

IAST: saparyavo bharamāṇā abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhir agnau
Griffith: Bearing the sacred grass, the men who serve him strew it with reverence, on their knees, by Agni.
Devanāgarī: सपर्यवो भरमाणा अभिज्ञु प्र वृञ्जते नमसा बर्हिरग्नौ
pada pāṭha: saparyavaḥ | bharamāṇāḥ | abhi-jñu | pra | vr̥ñjate | namasā | barhiḥ | agnau || ā-juhvānāḥ | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | pr̥ṣat-vat | adhvaryavaḥ | haviṣā | marjayadhvam ||7.2.4||

IAST: ājuhvānā ghṛtapṛṣṭham pṛṣadvad adhvaryavo haviṣā marjayadhvam
Griffith: Calling him to the spotted grass, oil-sprinkled, adorn him, ye Adhvaryus, with oblation.
Devanāgarī: आजुह्वाना घृतपृष्ठं पृषद्वदध्वर्यवो हविषा मर्जयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: saparyavaḥ | bharamāṇāḥ | abhi-jñu | pra | vr̥ñjate | namasā | barhiḥ | agnau || ā-juhvānāḥ | ghr̥ta-pr̥ṣṭham | pr̥ṣat-vat | adhvaryavaḥ | haviṣā | marjayadhvam ||7.2.4||

IAST: svādhyo vi duro devayanto 'śiśrayū rathayur devatātā
Griffith: With holy thoughts the pious have thrown open Doors fain for chariots in the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: स्वाध्यो वि दुरो देवयन्तोऽशिश्रयू रथयुर्देवताता
pada pāṭha: su-ādhyaḥ | vi | duraḥ | deva-yantaḥ | aśiśrayuḥ | ratha-yuḥ | deva-tātā || pūrvī iti | śiśum | na | mātarā | rihāṇe iti | sam | agruvaḥ | na | samaneṣu | añjan ||7.2.5||

IAST: pūrvī śiśuṁ na mātarā rihāṇe sam agruvo na samaneṣv añjan
Griffith: Like two full mother cows who lick their youngling, like maidens for the gathering, they adorn them.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वी शिशुं न मातरा रिहाणे समग्रुवो न समनेष्वञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: su-ādhyaḥ | vi | duraḥ | deva-yantaḥ | aśiśrayuḥ | ratha-yuḥ | deva-tātā || pūrvī iti | śiśum | na | mātarā | rihāṇe iti | sam | agruvaḥ | na | samaneṣu | añjan ||7.2.5||

IAST: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī na uṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ
Griffith: And let the two exalted Heavenly Ladies, Morning and Night, like a cow good at milking,
Devanāgarī: उत योषणे दिव्ये मही न उषासानक्ता सुदुघेव धेनुः
pada pāṭha: uta | yoṣaṇe iti | divye iti | mahī iti | naḥ | uṣasānaktā | sudughā-iva | dhenuḥ || barhi-sadā | puruhūte iti puru-hūte | maghonī iti | ā | yajñiye iti | suvitāya | śrayetām ||7.2.6||

IAST: barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām
Griffith: Come, much-invoked, and on our grass be seated ' wealthy, deserving worship, for our welfare.
Devanāgarī: बर्हिषदा पुरुहूते मघोनी आ यज्ञिये सुविताय श्रयेताम्
pada pāṭha: uta | yoṣaṇe iti | divye iti | mahī iti | naḥ | uṣasānaktā | sudughā-iva | dhenuḥ || barhi-sadā | puruhūte iti puru-hūte | maghonī iti | ā | yajñiye iti | suvitāya | śrayetām ||7.2.6||

IAST: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vāṁ jātavedasā yajadhyai
Griffith: You, Bards and Singers at men's sacrifices, both filled with wisdom, I incline to worship.
Devanāgarī: विप्रा यज्ञेषु मानुषेषु कारू मन्ये वां जातवेदसा यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: viprā | yajñeṣu | mānuṣeṣu | kārū iti | manye | vām | jāta-vedasā | yajadhyai || ūrdhvam | naḥ | adhvaram | kr̥tam | haveṣu | tā | deveṣu | vanathaḥ | vāryāṇi ||7.2.7||

IAST: ūrdhvaṁ no adhvaraṁ kṛtaṁ haveṣu tā deveṣu vanatho vāryāṇi
Griffith: Send up our offerings when we call upon you, and so among the Gods obtain us treasures.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं नो अध्वरं कृतं हवेषु ता देवेषु वनथो वार्याणि
pada pāṭha: viprā | yajñeṣu | mānuṣeṣu | kārū iti | manye | vām | jāta-vedasā | yajadhyai || ūrdhvam | naḥ | adhvaram | kr̥tam | haveṣu | tā | deveṣu | vanathaḥ | vāryāṇi ||7.2.7||

IAST: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḻā devair manuṣyebhir agniḥ
Griffith: May Bharati with all her Sisters, Ila accordant with the Gods, with mortals Agni,
Devanāgarī: आ भारती भारतीभिः सजोषा इळा देवैर्मनुष्येभिरग्निः
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāratī | bhāratībhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | iḷā | devaiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ || sarasvatī | sārasvatebhiḥ | arvāk | tisraḥ | devīḥ | barhiḥ | ā | idam | sadantu ||7.2.8||

IAST: sarasvatī sārasvatebhir arvāk tisro devīr barhir edaṁ sadantu
Griffith: Sarasvati with all her kindred Rivers, come to this grass, Three Goddesses, and seat them.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वती सारस्वतेभिरर्वाक्तिस्रो देवीर्बर्हिरेदं सदन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | bhāratī | bhāratībhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | iḷā | devaiḥ | manuṣyebhiḥ | agniḥ || sarasvatī | sārasvatebhiḥ | arvāk | tisraḥ | devīḥ | barhiḥ | ā | idam | sadantu ||7.2.8||

IAST: tan nas turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva
Griffith: Well pleased with us do thou, O God, O Tvastar, give ready issue to our procreant vigour,
Devanāgarī: तन्नस्तुरीपमध पोषयित्नु देव त्वष्टर्वि रराणः स्यस्व
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | turīpam | adha | poṣayitnu | deva | tvaṣṭaḥ | vi | rarāṇaḥ | syasveti syasva || yataḥ | vīraḥ | karmaṇyaḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | yukta-grāvā | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ ||7.2.9||

IAST: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktagrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ
Griffith: Whence springs the hero, powerful, skilled in action, lover of Gods, adjuster of the press-stones.
Devanāgarī: यतो वीरः कर्मण्यः सुदक्षो युक्तग्रावा जायते देवकामः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | turīpam | adha | poṣayitnu | deva | tvaṣṭaḥ | vi | rarāṇaḥ | syasveti syasva || yataḥ | vīraḥ | karmaṇyaḥ | su-dakṣaḥ | yukta-grāvā | jāyate | deva-kāmaḥ ||7.2.9||

IAST: vanaspate 'va sṛjopa devān agnir haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
Griffith: Send to the Gods the oblation, Lord of Forests, and let the Immolator, Agni, dress it.
Devanāgarī: वनस्पतेऽव सृजोप देवानग्निर्हविः शमिता सूदयाति
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | ava | sr̥ja | upa | devān | agniḥ | haviḥ | śamitā | sūdayāti || saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hotā | satya-taraḥ | yajāti | yathā | devānām | janimāni | veda ||7.2.10||

IAST: sed u hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṁ janimāni veda
Griffith: He as the truer Priest shall offer worship, for the God'sgenerations well he knoweth.
Devanāgarī: सेदु होता सत्यतरो यजाति यथा देवानां जनिमानि वेद
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | ava | sr̥ja | upa | devān | agniḥ | haviḥ | śamitā | sūdayāti || saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | hotā | satya-taraḥ | yajāti | yathā | devānām | janimāni | veda ||7.2.10||

IAST: ā yāhy agne samidhāno arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṁ turebhiḥ
Griffith: Come thou to us, O Agni, duly kindled, together with the potent Gods and Indra.
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने समिधानो अर्वाङिन्द्रेण देवैः सरथं तुरेभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | arvāṅ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | turebhiḥ || barhiḥ | naḥ | āstām | aditiḥ | su-putrā | svāhā | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | mādayantām ||7.2.11||

IAST: barhir na āstām aditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām
Griffith: On this our grass sit Aditi, happy Mother, and let our Hail! delight the Gods Immortal.
Devanāgarī: बर्हिर्न आस्तामदितिः सुपुत्रा स्वाहा देवा अमृता मादयन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | arvāṅ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | sa-ratham | turebhiḥ || barhiḥ | naḥ | āstām | aditiḥ | su-putrā | svāhā | devāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | mādayantām ||7.2.11||

IAST: agniṁ vo devam agnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṁ dūtam adhvare kṛṇudhvam
Griffith: ASSOCIATE with fires, make your God Agni envoy at sacrifice, best skilled in worship,
Devanāgarī: अग्निं वो देवमग्निभिः सजोषा यजिष्ठं दूतमध्वरे कृणुध्वम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | devam | agni-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | yajiṣṭham | dūtam | adhvare | kr̥ṇudhvam || yaḥ | martyeṣu | ni-dhruviḥ | r̥ta-vā | tapuḥ-mūrdhā | ghr̥ta-annaḥ | pāvakaḥ ||7.3.1||

IAST: yo martyeṣu nidhruvir ṛtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ
Griffith: Established firm among mankind, the Holy, flame-crowned and fed with oil, the Purifier.
Devanāgarī: यो मर्त्येषु निध्रुविरृतावा तपुर्मूर्धा घृतान्नः पावकः
pada pāṭha: agnim | vaḥ | devam | agni-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | yajiṣṭham | dūtam | adhvare | kr̥ṇudhvam || yaḥ | martyeṣu | ni-dhruviḥ | r̥ta-vā | tapuḥ-mūrdhā | ghr̥ta-annaḥ | pāvakaḥ ||7.3.1||

IAST: prothad aśvo na yavase 'viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṁvaraṇād vy asthāt
Griffith: Like a steed neighing eager for the pasture, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure:
Devanāgarī: प्रोथदश्वो न यवसेऽविष्यन्यदा महः संवरणाद्व्यस्थात्
pada pāṭha: prothat | aśvaḥ | na | yavase | aviṣyan | yadā | mahaḥ | sam-varaṇāt | vi | asthāt || āt | asya | vātaḥ | anu | vāti | śociḥ | adha | sma | te | vrajanam | kr̥ṣṇam | asti ||7.3.2||

IAST: ād asya vāto anu vāti śocir adha sma te vrajanaṁ kṛṣṇam asti
Griffith: Then the wind following blows upon his splendour, and, straight, the path is black which thou hast trave
Devanāgarī: आदस्य वातो अनु वाति शोचिरध स्म ते व्रजनं कृष्णमस्ति
pada pāṭha: prothat | aśvaḥ | na | yavase | aviṣyan | yadā | mahaḥ | sam-varaṇāt | vi | asthāt || āt | asya | vātaḥ | anu | vāti | śociḥ | adha | sma | te | vrajanam | kr̥ṣṇam | asti ||7.3.2||

IAST: ud yasya te navajātasya vṛṣṇo 'gne caranty ajarā idhānāḥ
Griffith: From thee a Bull but newly born, O Agni, the kindled everlasting flames rise upward.
Devanāgarī: उद्यस्य ते नवजातस्य वृष्णोऽग्ने चरन्त्यजरा इधानाः
pada pāṭha: ut | yasya | te | nava-jātasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | agne | caranti | ajarāḥ | idhānāḥ || accha | dyām | aruṣaḥ | dhūmaḥ | eti | sam | dūtaḥ | agne | īyase | hi | devān ||7.3.3||

IAST: acchā dyām aruṣo dhūma eti saṁ dūto agna īyase hi devān
Griffith: Aloft to heaven thy ruddy smoke ascendeth: Agni, thou speedest to the Gods as envoy.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा द्यामरुषो धूम एति सं दूतो अग्न ईयसे हि देवान्
pada pāṭha: ut | yasya | te | nava-jātasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | agne | caranti | ajarāḥ | idhānāḥ || accha | dyām | aruṣaḥ | dhūmaḥ | eti | sam | dūtaḥ | agne | īyase | hi | devān ||7.3.3||

IAST: vi yasya te pṛthivyām pājo aśret tṛṣu yad annā samavṛkta jambhaiḥ
Griffith: Thou whose fresh lustre o'er the earth advanceth when greedily with thy jaws thy food thou eatest.
Devanāgarī: वि यस्य ते पृथिव्यां पाजो अश्रेत्तृषु यदन्ना समवृक्त जम्भैः
pada pāṭha: vi | yasya | te | pr̥thivyām | pājaḥ | aśret | tr̥ṣu | yat | annā | sam-avr̥kta | jambhaiḥ || senā-iva | sr̥ṣṭā | pra-sitiḥ | te | eti | yavam | na | dasma | juhvā | vivekṣi ||7.3.4||

IAST: seneva sṛṣṭā prasitiṣ ṭa eti yavaṁ na dasma juhvā vivekṣi
Griffith: Like a host hurried onward comes thy lasso: fierce, with thy tongue thou piercest, as 'twere barley.
Devanāgarī: सेनेव सृष्टा प्रसितिष्ट एति यवं न दस्म जुह्वा विवेक्षि
pada pāṭha: vi | yasya | te | pr̥thivyām | pājaḥ | aśret | tr̥ṣu | yat | annā | sam-avr̥kta | jambhaiḥ || senā-iva | sr̥ṣṭā | pra-sitiḥ | te | eti | yavam | na | dasma | juhvā | vivekṣi ||7.3.4||

IAST: tam id doṣā tam uṣasi yaviṣṭham agnim atyaṁ na marjayanta naraḥ
Griffith: The men have decked him both at eve and morning, Most Youthful Agni, as they tend a courser.
Devanāgarī: तमिद्दोषा तमुषसि यविष्ठमग्निमत्यं न मर्जयन्त नरः
pada pāṭha: tam | it | doṣā | tam | uṣasi | yaviṣṭham | agnim | atyam | na | marjayanta | naraḥ || ni-śiśānāḥ | atithim | asya | yonau | dīdāya | śociḥ | ā-hutasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||7.3.5||

IAST: niśiśānā atithim asya yonau dīdāya śocir āhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ
Griffith: They kindle him, a guest within his dwelling: bright shines the splendour of the worshipped Hero.
Devanāgarī: निशिशाना अतिथिमस्य योनौ दीदाय शोचिराहुतस्य वृष्णः
pada pāṭha: tam | it | doṣā | tam | uṣasi | yaviṣṭham | agnim | atyam | na | marjayanta | naraḥ || ni-śiśānāḥ | atithim | asya | yonau | dīdāya | śociḥ | ā-hutasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ ||7.3.5||

IAST: susaṁdṛk te svanīka pratīkaṁ vi yad rukmo na rocasa upāke
Griffith: O fair of face, beautiful is thine aspect when, very near at hand, like gold thou gleamest,
Devanāgarī: सुसंदृक्ते स्वनीक प्रतीकं वि यद्रुक्मो न रोचस उपाके
pada pāṭha: su-saṁdr̥k | te | su-anīka | pratīkam | vi | yat | rukmaḥ | na | rocase | upāke || divaḥ | na | te | tanyatuḥ | eti | śuṣmaḥ | citraḥ | na | sūraḥ | prati | cakṣi | bhānum ||7.3.6||

IAST: divo na te tanyatur eti śuṣmaś citro na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum
Griffith: Like Heaven's thundering roar thy might approaches, and like the wondrous Sun thy light thou showest.
Devanāgarī: दिवो न ते तन्यतुरेति शुष्मश्चित्रो न सूरः प्रति चक्षि भानुम्
pada pāṭha: su-saṁdr̥k | te | su-anīka | pratīkam | vi | yat | rukmaḥ | na | rocase | upāke || divaḥ | na | te | tanyatuḥ | eti | śuṣmaḥ | citraḥ | na | sūraḥ | prati | cakṣi | bhānum ||7.3.6||

IAST: yathā vaḥ svāhāgnaye dāśema parīḻābhir ghṛtavadbhiś ca havyaiḥ
Griffith: That we may worship, with your Hail to Agni! with sacrificial cakes and fat oblations,
Devanāgarī: यथा वः स्वाहाग्नये दाशेम परीळाभिर्घृतवद्भिश्च हव्यैः
pada pāṭha: yathā | vaḥ | svāhā | agnaye | dāśema | pari | iḷābhiḥ | ghr̥tavat-bhiḥ | ca | havyaiḥ || tebhiḥ | naḥ | agne | amitaiḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | āyasībhiḥ | ni | pāhi ||7.3.7||

IAST: tebhir no agne amitair mahobhiḥ śatam pūrbhir āyasībhir ni pāhi
Griffith: Guard us, O Agni, with those boundless glories as with a hundred fortresses of iron.
Devanāgarī: तेभिर्नो अग्ने अमितैर्महोभिः शतं पूर्भिरायसीभिर्नि पाहि
pada pāṭha: yathā | vaḥ | svāhā | agnaye | dāśema | pari | iḷābhiḥ | ghr̥tavat-bhiḥ | ca | havyaiḥ || tebhiḥ | naḥ | agne | amitaiḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | āyasībhiḥ | ni | pāhi ||7.3.7||

IAST: yā vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭā giro vā yābhir nṛvatīr uruṣyāḥ
Griffith: Thine are resistless songs for him who offers, and hero-giving hymns wherewith thou savest;
Devanāgarī: या वा ते सन्ति दाशुषे अधृष्टा गिरो वा याभिर्नृवतीरुरुष्याः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vā | te | santi | dāśuṣe | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ | giraḥ | vā | yābhiḥ | nr̥-vatīḥ | uruṣyāḥ || tābhiḥ | naḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | ni | pāhi | smat | sūrīn | jaritr̥̄n | jāta-vedaḥ ||7.3.8||

IAST: tābhir naḥ sūno sahaso ni pāhi smat sūrīñ jaritṝñ jātavedaḥ
Griffith: With these, O Son of Strength, O Jatavedas, guard us, preserve these princes and the singers.
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्नः सूनो सहसो नि पाहि स्मत्सूरीञ्जरितॄञ्जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vā | te | santi | dāśuṣe | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ | giraḥ | vā | yābhiḥ | nr̥-vatīḥ | uruṣyāḥ || tābhiḥ | naḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | ni | pāhi | smat | sūrīn | jaritr̥̄n | jāta-vedaḥ ||7.3.8||

IAST: nir yat pūteva svadhitiḥ śucir gāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ
Griffith: When forth he cometh, like an axe new-sharpened, pure in his form, resplendent in his body,
Devanāgarī: निर्यत्पूतेव स्वधितिः शुचिर्गात्स्वया कृपा तन्वा रोचमानः
pada pāṭha: niḥ | yat | pūtā-iva | sva-dhitiḥ | śuciḥ | gāt | svayā | kr̥pā | tanvā | rocamānaḥ || ā | yaḥ | mātroḥ | uśenyaḥ | janiṣṭa | deva-yajyāya | su-kratuḥ | pāvakaḥ ||7.3.9||

IAST: ā yo mātror uśenyo janiṣṭa devayajyāya sukratuḥ pāvakaḥ
Griffith: Sprung, sought with eager longing, from his Parents, for the Gods' worship, Sage and Purifier:
Devanāgarī: आ यो मात्रोरुशेन्यो जनिष्ट देवयज्याय सुक्रतुः पावकः
pada pāṭha: niḥ | yat | pūtā-iva | sva-dhitiḥ | śuciḥ | gāt | svayā | kr̥pā | tanvā | rocamānaḥ || ā | yaḥ | mātroḥ | uśenyaḥ | janiṣṭa | deva-yajyāya | su-kratuḥ | pāvakaḥ ||7.3.9||

IAST: etā no agne saubhagā didīhy api kratuṁ sucetasaṁ vatema
Griffith: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding.
Devanāgarī: एता नो अग्ने सौभगा दिदीह्यपि क्रतुं सुचेतसं वतेम
pada pāṭha: etā | naḥ | agne | saubhagā | didīhi | api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatema || viśvā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | ca | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.3.10||

IAST: viśvā stotṛbhyo gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा स्तोतृभ्यो गृणते च सन्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: etā | naḥ | agne | saubhagā | didīhi | api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatema || viśvā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | ca | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.3.10||

IAST: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvaṁ havyam matiṁ cāgnaye supūtam
Griffith: BRING forth your gifts to his refulgent splendour, your hymn as purest offering to Agni,
Devanāgarī: प्र वः शुक्राय भानवे भरध्वं हव्यं मतिं चाग्नये सुपूतम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | śukrāya | bhānave | bharadhvam | havyam | matim | ca | agnaye | su-pūtam || yaḥ | daivyāni | mānuṣā | janūṁṣi | antaḥ | viśvāni | vidmanā | jigāti ||7.4.1||

IAST: yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūṁṣy antar viśvāni vidmanā jigāti
Griffith: To him who goes as messenger with knowledge between all songs of men and Gods in heaven.
Devanāgarī: यो दैव्यानि मानुषा जनूंष्यन्तर्विश्वानि विद्मना जिगाति
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | śukrāya | bhānave | bharadhvam | havyam | matim | ca | agnaye | su-pūtam || yaḥ | daivyāni | mānuṣā | janūṁṣi | antaḥ | viśvāni | vidmanā | jigāti ||7.4.1||

IAST: sa gṛtso agnis taruṇaś cid astu yato yaviṣṭho ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ
Griffith: Wise must this Agni be, though young and tender, since he was born, Most Youthful, of his Mother;
Devanāgarī: स गृत्सो अग्निस्तरुणश्चिदस्तु यतो यविष्ठो अजनिष्ट मातुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gr̥tsaḥ | agniḥ | taruṇaḥ | cit | astu | yataḥ | yaviṣṭhaḥ | ajaniṣṭa | mātuḥ || sam | yaḥ | vanā | yuvate | śuci-dan | bhūri | cit | annā | sam | it | atti | sadyaḥ ||7.4.2||

IAST: saṁ yo vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cid annā sam id atti sadyaḥ
Griffith: He who with bright teeth seizeth fast the forests, and eats his food, though plenteous, in a moment.
Devanāgarī: सं यो वना युवते शुचिदन्भूरि चिदन्ना समिदत्ति सद्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gr̥tsaḥ | agniḥ | taruṇaḥ | cit | astu | yataḥ | yaviṣṭhaḥ | ajaniṣṭa | mātuḥ || sam | yaḥ | vanā | yuvate | śuci-dan | bhūri | cit | annā | sam | it | atti | sadyaḥ ||7.4.2||

IAST: asya devasya saṁsady anīke yam martāsaḥ śyetaṁ jagṛbhre
Griffith: Before his presence must we all assemble, this God's whom men have seized in his white splendour.
Devanāgarī: अस्य देवस्य संसद्यनीके यं मर्तासः श्येतं जगृभ्रे
pada pāṭha: asya | devasya | sam-sadi | anīke | yam | martāsaḥ | śyetam | jagr̥bhre || ni | yaḥ | gr̥bham | pauruṣeyīm | uvoca | duḥ-okam | agniḥ | āyave | śuśoca ||7.4.3||

IAST: ni yo gṛbham pauruṣeyīm uvoca durokam agnir āyave śuśoca
Griffith: This Agni who hath brooked that men should seize him hath shone for man with glow insufferable.
Devanāgarī: नि यो गृभं पौरुषेयीमुवोच दुरोकमग्निरायवे शुशोच
pada pāṭha: asya | devasya | sam-sadi | anīke | yam | martāsaḥ | śyetam | jagr̥bhre || ni | yaḥ | gr̥bham | pauruṣeyīm | uvoca | duḥ-okam | agniḥ | āyave | śuśoca ||7.4.3||

IAST: ayaṁ kavir akaviṣu pracetā marteṣv agnir amṛto ni dhāyi
Griffith: Far-seeing hath this Agni been established, deathless mid mortals, wise among the foolish.
Devanāgarī: अयं कविरकविषु प्रचेता मर्तेष्वग्निरमृतो नि धायि
pada pāṭha: ayam | kaviḥ | akaviṣu | pra-cetāḥ | marteṣu | agniḥ | amr̥taḥ | ni | dhāyi || saḥ | mā | naḥ | atra | juhuraḥ | sahasvaḥ | sadā | tve iti | su-manasaḥ | syāma ||7.4.4||

IAST: sa mā no atra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma
Griffith: Here, O victorious God, forbear to harm us: may weforever share thy gracious favour.
Devanāgarī: स मा नो अत्र जुहुरः सहस्वः सदा त्वे सुमनसः स्याम
pada pāṭha: ayam | kaviḥ | akaviṣu | pra-cetāḥ | marteṣu | agniḥ | amr̥taḥ | ni | dhāyi || saḥ | mā | naḥ | atra | juhuraḥ | sahasvaḥ | sadā | tve iti | su-manasaḥ | syāma ||7.4.4||

IAST: ā yo yoniṁ devakṛtaṁ sasāda kratvā hy agnir amṛtām̐ atārīt
Griffith: He who hath occupied his God-made dwelling, Agni, in wisdom hath surpassed Immortals.
Devanāgarī: आ यो योनिं देवकृतं ससाद क्रत्वा ह्यग्निरमृताँ अतारीत्
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | yonim | deva-kr̥tam | sasāda | kratvā | hi | agniḥ | amr̥tān | atārīt || tam | oṣadhīḥ | ca | vaninaḥ | ca | garbham | bhūmiḥ | ca | viśva-dhāyasam | bibharti ||7.4.5||

IAST: tam oṣadhīś ca vaninaś ca garbham bhūmiś ca viśvadhāyasam bibharti
Griffith: A Babe unborn, the plants and trees support him, and the earth beareth him the All-sustainer.
Devanāgarī: तमोषधीश्च वनिनश्च गर्भं भूमिश्च विश्वधायसं बिभर्ति
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | yonim | deva-kr̥tam | sasāda | kratvā | hi | agniḥ | amr̥tān | atārīt || tam | oṣadhīḥ | ca | vaninaḥ | ca | garbham | bhūmiḥ | ca | viśva-dhāyasam | bibharti ||7.4.5||

IAST: īśe hy agnir amṛtasya bhūrer īśe rāyaḥ suvīryasya dātoḥ
Griffith: Agni is Lord of Amrta. in abundance, Lord of the gift of wealth and hero valour,
Devanāgarī: ईशे ह्यग्निरमृतस्य भूरेरीशे रायः सुवीर्यस्य दातोः
pada pāṭha: īśe | hi | agniḥ | amr̥tasya | bhūreḥ | īśe | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | dātoḥ || mā | tvā | vayam | sahasā-van | avīrāḥ | mā | apsavaḥ | pari | sadāma | mā | aduvaḥ ||7.4.6||

IAST: mā tvā vayaṁ sahasāvann avīrā māpsavaḥ pari ṣadāma māduvaḥ
Griffith: Victorious God, let us not sit about thee like men devoid of strength, beauty, and worship.
Devanāgarī: मा त्वा वयं सहसावन्नवीरा माप्सवः परि षदाम मादुवः
pada pāṭha: īśe | hi | agniḥ | amr̥tasya | bhūreḥ | īśe | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | dātoḥ || mā | tvā | vayam | sahasā-van | avīrāḥ | mā | apsavaḥ | pari | sadāma | mā | aduvaḥ ||7.4.6||

IAST: pariṣadyaṁ hy araṇasya rekṇo nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: The foeman's treasure may be won with labour: may we be masters of our own possessions.
Devanāgarī: परिषद्यं ह्यरणस्य रेक्णो नित्यस्य रायः पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: pari-sadyam | hi | araṇasya | rekṇaḥ | nityasya | rāyaḥ | patayaḥ | syāma || na | śeṣaḥ | agne | anya-jātam | asti | acetānasya | mā | pathaḥ | vi | dukṣaḥ ||7.4.7||

IAST: na śeṣo agne anyajātam asty acetānasya mā patho vi dukṣaḥ
Griffith: Agni, no son is he who springs from others: lengthen not out the pathways of the foolish.
Devanāgarī: न शेषो अग्ने अन्यजातमस्त्यचेतानस्य मा पथो वि दुक्षः
pada pāṭha: pari-sadyam | hi | araṇasya | rekṇaḥ | nityasya | rāyaḥ | patayaḥ | syāma || na | śeṣaḥ | agne | anya-jātam | asti | acetānasya | mā | pathaḥ | vi | dukṣaḥ ||7.4.7||

IAST: nahi grabhāyāraṇaḥ suśevo 'nyodaryo manasā mantavā u
Griffith: Unwelcome for adoption is the stranger, one to be thought of as another's offipring,
Devanāgarī: नहि ग्रभायारणः सुशेवोऽन्योदर्यो मनसा मन्तवा उ
pada pāṭha: nahi | grabhāya | araṇaḥ | su-śevaḥ | anya-udaryaḥ | manasā | mantavai | ūm̐ iti || adha | cit | okaḥ | punaḥ | it | saḥ | eti | ā | naḥ | vājī | abhīṣāṭ | etu | navyaḥ ||7.4.8||

IAST: adhā cid okaḥ punar it sa ety ā no vājy abhīṣāḻ etu navyaḥ
Griffith: Though grown familiar by continual presence. May our strong hero come, freshly triumphant.
Devanāgarī: अधा चिदोकः पुनरित्स एत्या नो वाज्यभीषाळेतु नव्यः
pada pāṭha: nahi | grabhāya | araṇaḥ | su-śevaḥ | anya-udaryaḥ | manasā | mantavai | ūm̐ iti || adha | cit | okaḥ | punaḥ | it | saḥ | eti | ā | naḥ | vājī | abhīṣāṭ | etu | navyaḥ ||7.4.8||

IAST: tvam agne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvann avadyāt
Griffith: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us O thou Victor, from dishonour.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि त्वमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pāhi | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | sahasā-van | avadyāt || sam | tvā | dhvasman-vat | abhi | etu | pāthaḥ | sam | rayiḥ | spr̥hayāyyaḥ | sahasrī ||7.4.9||

IAST: saṁ tvā dhvasmanvad abhy etu pāthaḥ saṁ rayiḥ spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī
Griffith: Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable, in thousands.
Devanāgarī: सं त्वा ध्वस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयिः स्पृहयाय्यः सहस्री
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pāhi | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | sahasā-van | avadyāt || sam | tvā | dhvasman-vat | abhi | etu | pāthaḥ | sam | rayiḥ | spr̥hayāyyaḥ | sahasrī ||7.4.9||

IAST: etā no agne saubhagā didīhy api kratuṁ sucetasaṁ vatema
Griffith: Shine this felicity on us, O Agni: may we attain to perfect understanding.
Devanāgarī: एता नो अग्ने सौभगा दिदीह्यपि क्रतुं सुचेतसं वतेम
pada pāṭha: etā | naḥ | agne | saubhagā | didīhi | api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatema || viśvā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | ca | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.4.10||

IAST: viśvā stotṛbhyo gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: All happiness be theirs who sing and praise thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा स्तोतृभ्यो गृणते च सन्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: etā | naḥ | agne | saubhagā | didīhi | api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatema || viśvā | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | ca | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.4.10||

IAST: prāgnaye tavase bharadhvaṁ giraṁ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: BRING forth your song of praise to mighty Agni, the speedy messenger of earth and heaven,
Devanāgarī: प्राग्नये तवसे भरध्वं गिरं दिवो अरतये पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | tavase | bharadhvam | giram | divaḥ | arataye | pr̥thivyāḥ || yaḥ | viśveṣām | amr̥tānām | upa-sthe | vaiśvānaraḥ | vavr̥dhe | jāgr̥vat-bhiḥ ||7.5.1||

IAST: yo viśveṣām amṛtānām upasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāgṛvadbhiḥ
Griffith: Vaisvanara, who, with those who wake, hath waxen great in the lap of all the Gods Immortal.
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वेषाममृतानामुपस्थे वैश्वानरो वावृधे जागृवद्भिः
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | tavase | bharadhvam | giram | divaḥ | arataye | pr̥thivyāḥ || yaḥ | viśveṣām | amr̥tānām | upa-sthe | vaiśvānaraḥ | vavr̥dhe | jāgr̥vat-bhiḥ ||7.5.1||

IAST: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyy agniḥ pṛthivyāṁ netā sindhūnāṁ vṛṣabhaḥ stiyānām
Griffith: Sought in the heavens, on earth is Agni stablished, leader of rivers, Bull of standing waters.
Devanāgarī: पृष्टो दिवि धाय्यग्निः पृथिव्यां नेता सिन्धूनां वृषभः स्तियानाम्
pada pāṭha: pr̥ṣṭaḥ | divi | dhāyi | agniḥ | pr̥thivyām | netā | sindhūnām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | stiyānām || saḥ | mānuṣīḥ | abhi | viśaḥ | vi | bhāti | vaiśvānaraḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | vareṇa ||7.5.2||

IAST: sa mānuṣīr abhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa
Griffith: Vaisvanara when he hath grown in glory, shines on the tribes of men with light and treasure.
Devanāgarī: स मानुषीरभि विशो वि भाति वैश्वानरो वावृधानो वरेण
pada pāṭha: pr̥ṣṭaḥ | divi | dhāyi | agniḥ | pr̥thivyām | netā | sindhūnām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | stiyānām || saḥ | mānuṣīḥ | abhi | viśaḥ | vi | bhāti | vaiśvānaraḥ | vavr̥dhānaḥ | vareṇa ||7.5.2||

IAST: tvad bhiyā viśa āyann asiknīr asamanā jahatīr bhojanāni
Griffith: For fear of thee forth fled the dark-hued races, scattered abroad, deserting their possessions,
Devanāgarī: त्वद्भिया विश आयन्नसिक्नीरसमना जहतीर्भोजनानि
pada pāṭha: tvat | bhiyā | viśaḥ | āyan | asiknīḥ | asamanāḥ | jahatīḥ | bhojanāni || vaiśvānara | pūrave | śośucānaḥ | puraḥ | yat | agne | darayan | adīdeḥ ||7.5.3||

IAST: vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yad agne darayann adīdeḥ
Griffith: When, glowing, O Vaisvanara, for Puru, thou Agni didst light up and rend their castles.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर पूरवे शोशुचानः पुरो यदग्ने दरयन्नदीदेः
pada pāṭha: tvat | bhiyā | viśaḥ | āyan | asiknīḥ | asamanāḥ | jahatīḥ | bhojanāni || vaiśvānara | pūrave | śośucānaḥ | puraḥ | yat | agne | darayan | adīdeḥ ||7.5.3||

IAST: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaur vaiśvānara vratam agne sacanta
Griffith: Agni Vaisvanara, both Earth and Heaven submit them to thy threefold jurisdiction.
Devanāgarī: तव त्रिधातु पृथिवी उत द्यौर्वैश्वानर व्रतमग्ने सचन्त
pada pāṭha: tava | tri-dhātu | pr̥thivī | uta | dyauḥ | vaiśvānara | vratam | agne | sacanta || tvam | bhāsā | rodasī iti | ā | tatantha | ajasreṇa | śociṣā | śośucānaḥ ||7.5.4||

IAST: tvam bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ
Griffith: Refulgent in thine undecaying lustre thou hast invested both the worlds with splendour.
Devanāgarī: त्वं भासा रोदसी आ ततन्थाजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचानः
pada pāṭha: tava | tri-dhātu | pr̥thivī | uta | dyauḥ | vaiśvānara | vratam | agne | sacanta || tvam | bhāsā | rodasī iti | ā | tatantha | ajasreṇa | śociṣā | śośucānaḥ ||7.5.4||

IAST: tvām agne harito vāvaśānā giraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ
Griffith: Agni, the tawny horses, loudly neighing our resonant hymns that drop with oil, attend thee;
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने हरितो वावशाना गिरः सचन्ते धुनयो घृताचीः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | haritaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | giraḥ | sacante | dhunayaḥ | ghr̥tācīḥ || patim | kr̥ṣṭīnām | rathyam | rayīṇām | vaiśvānaram | uṣasām | ketum | ahnām ||7.5.5||

IAST: patiṁ kṛṣṭīnāṁ rathyaṁ rayīṇāṁ vaiśvānaram uṣasāṁ ketum ahnām
Griffith: Lord of the tribes, our Charioteer of riches, Ensign of days, Vaisvanara of mornings.
Devanāgarī: पतिं कृष्टीनां रथ्यं रयीणां वैश्वानरमुषसां केतुमह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | haritaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | giraḥ | sacante | dhunayaḥ | ghr̥tācīḥ || patim | kr̥ṣṭīnām | rathyam | rayīṇām | vaiśvānaram | uṣasām | ketum | ahnām ||7.5.5||

IAST: tve asuryaṁ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṁ hi te mitramaho juṣanta
Griffith: In thee, O bright as Mitra, Vasus seated the might of Aduras, for they loved thy spirit.
Devanāgarī: त्वे असुर्यं वसवो न्यृण्वन्क्रतुं हि ते मित्रमहो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: tve iti | asuryam | vasavaḥ | ni | r̥ṇvan | kratum | hi | te | mitra-mahaḥ | juṣanta || tvam | dasyūn | okasaḥ | agne | ājaḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | janayan | āryāya ||7.5.6||

IAST: tvaṁ dasyūm̐r okaso agna āja uru jyotir janayann āryāya
Griffith: Thou dravest Dasyus from their home, O Agni, and broughtest forth broad light to light the Arya.
Devanāgarī: त्वं दस्यूँरोकसो अग्न आज उरु ज्योतिर्जनयन्नार्याय
pada pāṭha: tve iti | asuryam | vasavaḥ | ni | r̥ṇvan | kratum | hi | te | mitra-mahaḥ | juṣanta || tvam | dasyūn | okasaḥ | agne | ājaḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | janayan | āryāya ||7.5.6||

IAST: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyur na pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ
Griffith: Born in the loftiest heaven thou in a moment reachest, like wind, the place where Gods inhabit.
Devanāgarī: स जायमानः परमे व्योमन्वायुर्न पाथः परि पासि सद्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyamānaḥ | parame | vi-oman | vāyuḥ | na | pāthaḥ | pari | pāsi | sadyaḥ || tvam | bhuvanā | janayan | abhi | kran | apatyāya | jāta-vedaḥ | daśasyan ||7.5.7||

IAST: tvam bhuvanā janayann abhi krann apatyāya jātavedo daśasyan
Griffith: Thou, favouring thine offspring, roaredst loudly when giving life to creatures, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: त्वं भुवना जनयन्नभि क्रन्नपत्याय जातवेदो दशस्यन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyamānaḥ | parame | vi-oman | vāyuḥ | na | pāthaḥ | pari | pāsi | sadyaḥ || tvam | bhuvanā | janayan | abhi | kran | apatyāya | jāta-vedaḥ | daśasyan ||7.5.7||

IAST: tām agne asme iṣam erayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṁ jātavedaḥ
Griffith: Send us that strength, Vaisvanara, send it, Agni, that strength, O Jatavedas, full of splendour,
Devanāgarī: तामग्ने अस्मे इषमेरयस्व वैश्वानर द्युमतीं जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: tām | agne | asme iti | iṣam | ā | īrayasva | vaiśvānara | dyu-matīm | jāta-vedaḥ || yayā | rādhaḥ | pinvasi | viśva-vāra | pr̥thu | śravaḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||7.5.8||

IAST: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: Wherewith, all-bounteous God, thou pourest riches, as fame wide-spreading, on the man who offers.
Devanāgarī: यया राधः पिन्वसि विश्ववार पृथु श्रवो दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: tām | agne | asme iti | iṣam | ā | īrayasva | vaiśvānara | dyu-matīm | jāta-vedaḥ || yayā | rādhaḥ | pinvasi | viśva-vāra | pr̥thu | śravaḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||7.5.8||

IAST: taṁ no agne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṁ rayiṁ ni vājaṁ śrutyaṁ yuvasva
Griffith: Agni, bestow upon our chiefs and nobles that famous power, that wealth which feedeth many.
Devanāgarī: तं नो अग्ने मघवद्भ्यः पुरुक्षुं रयिं नि वाजं श्रुत्यं युवस्व
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | agne | maghavat-bhyaḥ | puru-kṣum | rayim | ni | vājam | śrutyam | yuvasva || vaiśvānara | mahi | naḥ | śarma | yaccha | rudrebhiḥ | agne | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.5.9||

IAST: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yaccha rudrebhir agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: Accordant with the Vasus and the Rudras, Agni, Vaisvanara, give us sure protection.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर महि नः शर्म यच्छ रुद्रेभिरग्ने वसुभिः सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | agne | maghavat-bhyaḥ | puru-kṣum | rayim | ni | vājam | śrutyam | yuvasva || vaiśvānara | mahi | naḥ | śarma | yaccha | rudrebhiḥ | agne | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.5.9||

IAST: pra samrājo asurasya praśastim puṁsaḥ kṛṣṭīnām anumādyasya
Griffith: PRAISE of the Asura, high imperial Ruler, the Manly One in whom the folk shall triumph-
Devanāgarī: प्र सम्राजो असुरस्य प्रशस्तिं पुंसः कृष्टीनामनुमाद्यस्य
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rājaḥ | asurasya | pra-śastim | puṁsaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīnām | anu-mādyasya || indrasya-iva | pra | tavasaḥ | kr̥tāni | vande | dārum | vandamānaḥ | vivakmi ||7.6.1||

IAST: indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṁ vandamāno vivakmi
Griffith: I laud his deeds who is as strong as Indra, and lauding celebrate the Fort-destroyer.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्येव प्र तवसस्कृतानि वन्दे दारुं वन्दमानो विवक्मि
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rājaḥ | asurasya | pra-śastim | puṁsaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīnām | anu-mādyasya || indrasya-iva | pra | tavasaḥ | kr̥tāni | vande | dārum | vandamānaḥ | vivakmi ||7.6.1||

IAST: kaviṁ ketuṁ dhāsim bhānum adrer hinvanti śaṁ rājyaṁ rodasyoḥ
Griffith: Sage, Sing, Food, Light,-they bring him from the mountain, the blessed Sovran of the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: कविं केतुं धासिं भानुमद्रेर्हिन्वन्ति शं राज्यं रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: kavim | ketum | dhāsim | bhānum | adreḥ | hinvanti | śam | rājyam | rodasyoḥ || puram-darasya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ā | vivāse | agneḥ | vratāni | pūrvyā | mahāni ||7.6.2||

IAST: puraṁdarasya gīrbhir ā vivāse 'gner vratāni pūrvyā mahāni
Griffith: I decorate with songs the mighty actions which Agni, Fort-destroyer, did aforetime.
Devanāgarī: पुरंदरस्य गीर्भिरा विवासेऽग्नेर्व्रतानि पूर्व्या महानि
pada pāṭha: kavim | ketum | dhāsim | bhānum | adreḥ | hinvanti | śam | rājyam | rodasyoḥ || puram-darasya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ā | vivāse | agneḥ | vratāni | pūrvyā | mahāni ||7.6.2||

IAST: ny akratūn grathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīm̐r aśraddhām̐ avṛdhām̐ ayajñān
Griffith: The foolish, faithless, rudely-speaking niggards, without belief or sacrifice or worship,-
Devanāgarī: न्यक्रतून्ग्रथिनो मृध्रवाचः पणीँरश्रद्धाँ अवृधाँ अयज्ञान्
pada pāṭha: ni | akratūn | grathinaḥ | mr̥dhra-vācaḥ | paṇīn | aśraddhān | avr̥dhān | ayajñān || pra-pra | tān | dasyūn | agniḥ | vivāya | pūrvaḥ | cakāra | aparān | ayajyūn ||7.6.3||

IAST: pra-pra tān dasyūm̐r agnir vivāya pūrvaś cakārāparām̐ ayajyūn
Griffith: Far far sway hath Agni chased those Dasytis, and, in the cast, hath turned the godless westward.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्र तान्दस्यूँरग्निर्विवाय पूर्वश्चकारापराँ अयज्यून्
pada pāṭha: ni | akratūn | grathinaḥ | mr̥dhra-vācaḥ | paṇīn | aśraddhān | avr̥dhān | ayajñān || pra-pra | tān | dasyūn | agniḥ | vivāya | pūrvaḥ | cakāra | aparān | ayajyūn ||7.6.3||

IAST: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīś cakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: Him who brought eastward, manliest with his prowess, the Maids rejoicing in the western darkness,
Devanāgarī: यो अपाचीने तमसि मदन्तीः प्राचीश्चकार नृतमः शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | apācīne | tamasi | madantīḥ | prācīḥ | cakāra | nr̥-tamaḥ | śacībhiḥ || tam | īśānam | vasvaḥ | agnim | gr̥ṇīṣe | anānatam | damayantam | pr̥tanyūn ||7.6.4||

IAST: tam īśānaṁ vasvo agniṁ gṛṇīṣe 'nānataṁ damayantam pṛtanyūn
Griffith: That Agni I extol, the Lord of riches, unyielding tamer of assailing foemen.
Devanāgarī: तमीशानं वस्वो अग्निं गृणीषेऽनानतं दमयन्तं पृतन्यून्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | apācīne | tamasi | madantīḥ | prācīḥ | cakāra | nr̥-tamaḥ | śacībhiḥ || tam | īśānam | vasvaḥ | agnim | gr̥ṇīṣe | anānatam | damayantam | pr̥tanyūn ||7.6.4||

IAST: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnair yo aryapatnīr uṣasaś cakāra
Griffith: Him who brake down the walls with deadly weapons, and gave the Mornings to anoble Husband,
Devanāgarī: यो देह्यो अनमयद्वधस्नैर्यो अर्यपत्नीरुषसश्चकार
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dehyaḥ | anamayat | vadha-snaiḥ | yaḥ | arya-patnīḥ | uṣasaḥ | cakāra || saḥ | ni-rudhya | nahuṣaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ | viśaḥ | cakre | bali-hr̥taḥ | sahaḥ-bhiḥ ||7.6.5||

IAST: sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yahvo agnir viśaś cakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ
Griffith: Young Agni, who with conquering strength subduing the tribes of Nahus made them bring their tribute.
Devanāgarī: स निरुध्या नहुषो यह्वो अग्निर्विशश्चक्रे बलिहृतः सहोभिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | dehyaḥ | anamayat | vadha-snaiḥ | yaḥ | arya-patnīḥ | uṣasaḥ | cakāra || saḥ | ni-rudhya | nahuṣaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ | viśaḥ | cakre | bali-hr̥taḥ | sahaḥ-bhiḥ ||7.6.5||

IAST: yasya śarmann upa viśve janāsa evais tasthuḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: In whose protection all men rest by nature, desiring to enjoy his gracious favour-
Devanāgarī: यस्य शर्मन्नुप विश्वे जनास एवैस्तस्थुः सुमतिं भिक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: yasya | śarman | upa | viśve | janāsaḥ | evaiḥ | tasthuḥ | su-matim | bhikṣamāṇāḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | varam | ā | rodasyoḥ | ā | agniḥ | sasāda | pitroḥ | upa-stham ||7.6.6||

IAST: vaiśvānaro varam ā rodasyor āgniḥ sasāda pitror upastham
Griffith: Agni Vaisvanara in his Parents, bosom hath found the choicest seat in earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरो वरमा रोदस्योराग्निः ससाद पित्रोरुपस्थम्
pada pāṭha: yasya | śarman | upa | viśve | janāsaḥ | evaiḥ | tasthuḥ | su-matim | bhikṣamāṇāḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | varam | ā | rodasyoḥ | ā | agniḥ | sasāda | pitroḥ | upa-stham ||7.6.6||

IAST: ā devo dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānara uditā sūryasya
Griffith: Vaisvanara the God, at the sun's setting, hath taken to himself deep-hidden treasures:
Devanāgarī: आ देवो ददे बुध्न्या वसूनि वैश्वानर उदिता सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: ā | devaḥ | dade | budhnyā | vasūni | vaiśvānaraḥ | ut-itā | sūryasya || ā | samudrāt | avarāt | ā | parasmāt | ā | agniḥ | dade | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||7.6.7||

IAST: ā samudrād avarād ā parasmād āgnir dade diva ā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: Agni hath taken them from earth and heaven, from the sea under and the sea above us.
Devanāgarī: आ समुद्रादवरादा परस्मादाग्निर्ददे दिव आ पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: ā | devaḥ | dade | budhnyā | vasūni | vaiśvānaraḥ | ut-itā | sūryasya || ā | samudrāt | avarāt | ā | parasmāt | ā | agniḥ | dade | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ ||7.6.7||

IAST: pra vo devaṁ cit sahasānam agnim aśvaṁ na vājinaṁ hiṣe namobhiḥ
Griffith: I SEND forth even your God, victorious Agni, like a strong courser, with mine adoration.
Devanāgarī: प्र वो देवं चित्सहसानमग्निमश्वं न वाजिनं हिषे नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | devam | cit | sahasānam | agnim | aśvam | na | vājinam | hiṣe | namaḥ-bhiḥ || bhava | naḥ | dūtaḥ | adhvarasya | vidvān | tmanā | deveṣu | vivide | mita-druḥ ||7.7.1||

IAST: bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ
Griffith: Herald of sacrifice be he who knoweth he hath reached Gods, himself, with measured motion.
Devanāgarī: भवा नो दूतो अध्वरस्य विद्वान्त्मना देवेषु विविदे मितद्रुः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | devam | cit | sahasānam | agnim | aśvam | na | vājinam | hiṣe | namaḥ-bhiḥ || bhava | naḥ | dūtaḥ | adhvarasya | vidvān | tmanā | deveṣu | vivide | mita-druḥ ||7.7.1||

IAST: ā yāhy agne pathyā anu svā mandro devānāṁ sakhyaṁ juṣāṇaḥ
Griffith: By paths that are thine own come hither, Agni, joyous, delighting in the Gods' alliance,
Devanāgarī: आ याह्यग्ने पथ्या अनु स्वा मन्द्रो देवानां सख्यं जुषाणः
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | pathyāḥ | anu | svāḥ | mandraḥ | devānām | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ || ā | sānu | śuṣmaiḥ | nadayan | pr̥thivyāḥ | jambhebhiḥ | viśvam | uśadhak | vanāni ||7.7.2||

IAST: ā sānu śuṣmair nadayan pṛthivyā jambhebhir viśvam uśadhag vanāni
Griffith: Making the heights of earth roar with thy fury, burning with eager teeth the woods and forests.
Devanāgarī: आ सानु शुष्मैर्नदयन्पृथिव्या जम्भेभिर्विश्वमुशधग्वनानि
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | agne | pathyāḥ | anu | svāḥ | mandraḥ | devānām | sakhyam | juṣāṇaḥ || ā | sānu | śuṣmaiḥ | nadayan | pr̥thivyāḥ | jambhebhiḥ | viśvam | uśadhak | vanāni ||7.7.2||

IAST: prācīno yajñaḥ sudhitaṁ hi barhiḥ prīṇīte agnir īḻito na hotā
Griffith: The grass is strewn; the sacrifice advances adored as Priest, Agni is made propitious,
Devanāgarī: प्राचीनो यज्ञः सुधितं हि बर्हिः प्रीणीते अग्निरीळितो न होता
pada pāṭha: prācīnaḥ | yajñaḥ | su-dhitam | hi | barhiḥ | prīṇīte | agniḥ | īḷitaḥ | na | hotā || ā | mātarā | viśvavāre iti viśva-vāre | huvānaḥ | yataḥ | yaviṣṭha | jajñiṣe | su-śevaḥ ||7.7.3||

IAST: ā mātarā viśvavāre huvāno yato yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe suśevaḥ
Griffith: Invoking both All-boon-bestowing Mothers of whom, Most Youthful! thou wast born to help us.
Devanāgarī: आ मातरा विश्ववारे हुवानो यतो यविष्ठ जज्ञिषे सुशेवः
pada pāṭha: prācīnaḥ | yajñaḥ | su-dhitam | hi | barhiḥ | prīṇīte | agniḥ | īḷitaḥ | na | hotā || ā | mātarā | viśvavāre iti viśva-vāre | huvānaḥ | yataḥ | yaviṣṭha | jajñiṣe | su-śevaḥ ||7.7.3||

IAST: sadyo adhvare rathiraṁ jananta mānuṣāso vicetaso ya eṣām
Griffith: Forthwith the men, the best of these for wisdom, have made him leader in the solemn worship.
Devanāgarī: सद्यो अध्वरे रथिरं जनन्त मानुषासो विचेतसो य एषाम्
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | adhvare | rathiram | jananta | mānuṣāsaḥ | vi-cetasaḥ | yaḥ | eṣām || viśām | adhāyi | viśpatiḥ | duroṇe | agniḥ | mandraḥ | madhu-vacāḥ | r̥ta-vā ||7.7.4||

IAST: viśām adhāyi viśpatir duroṇe 'gnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā
Griffith: As Lord in homes of men is Agni stablished, the Holy One, the joyous, sweetly speaking.
Devanāgarī: विशामधायि विश्पतिर्दुरोणेऽग्निर्मन्द्रो मधुवचा ऋतावा
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | adhvare | rathiram | jananta | mānuṣāsaḥ | vi-cetasaḥ | yaḥ | eṣām || viśām | adhāyi | viśpatiḥ | duroṇe | agniḥ | mandraḥ | madhu-vacāḥ | r̥ta-vā ||7.7.4||

IAST: asādi vṛto vahnir ājaganvān agnir brahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā
Griffith: He hath come, chosen bearer, and is seated in man's home, Brahman, Agni, the Supporter,
Devanāgarī: असादि वृतो वह्निराजगन्वानग्निर्ब्रह्मा नृषदने विधर्ता
pada pāṭha: asādi | vr̥taḥ | vahniḥ | ā-jaganvān | agniḥ | brahmā | nr̥-sadane | vi-dhartā || dyauḥ | ca | yam | pr̥thivī | vavr̥dhāte iti | ā | yam | hotā | yajati | viśva-vāram ||7.7.5||

IAST: dyauś ca yam pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yaṁ hotā yajati viśvavāram
Griffith: He whom both Heaven anct Earth exalt and strengthenwhom, Giver of all boons, the Hotar worships.
Devanāgarī: द्यौश्च यं पृथिवी वावृधाते आ यं होता यजति विश्ववारम्
pada pāṭha: asādi | vr̥taḥ | vahniḥ | ā-jaganvān | agniḥ | brahmā | nr̥-sadane | vi-dhartā || dyauḥ | ca | yam | pr̥thivī | vavr̥dhāte iti | ā | yam | hotā | yajati | viśva-vāram ||7.7.5||

IAST: ete dyumnebhir viśvam ātiranta mantraṁ ye vāraṁ naryā atakṣan
Griffith: These have passed all in glory, who, the manly, have wrought with skill the hymn of adoration;
Devanāgarī: एते द्युम्नेभिर्विश्वमातिरन्त मन्त्रं ये वारं नर्या अतक्षन्
pada pāṭha: ete | dyumnebhiḥ | viśvam | ā | atiranta | mantram | ye | vā | aram | naryāḥ | atakṣan || pra | ye | viśaḥ | tiranta | śroṣamāṇāḥ | ā | ye | me | asya | dīdhayan | r̥tasya ||7.7.6||

IAST: pra ye viśas tiranta śroṣamāṇā ā ye me asya dīdhayann ṛtasya
Griffith: Who, listening, have advanced the people's welfare, and set their thoughts on this my holy statute.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये विशस्तिरन्त श्रोषमाणा आ ये मे अस्य दीधयन्नृतस्य
pada pāṭha: ete | dyumnebhiḥ | viśvam | ā | atiranta | mantram | ye | vā | aram | naryāḥ | atakṣan || pra | ye | viśaḥ | tiranta | śroṣamāṇāḥ | ā | ye | me | asya | dīdhayan | r̥tasya ||7.7.6||

IAST: nū tvām agna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṁ sūno sahaso vasūnām
Griffith: We, the Vasisthas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and treasure.
Devanāgarī: नू त्वामग्न ईमहे वसिष्ठा ईशानं सूनो सहसो वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: nu | tvām | agne | īmahe | vasiṣṭhāḥ | īśānam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vasūnām || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ānaṭ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.7.7||

IAST: iṣaṁ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषं स्तोतृभ्यो मघवद्भ्य आनड्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | tvām | agne | īmahe | vasiṣṭhāḥ | īśānam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vasūnām || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ānaṭ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.7.7||

IAST: indhe rājā sam aryo namobhir yasya pratīkam āhutaṁ ghṛtena
Griffith: THE King whose face is decked with oil is kindled with homage offered by his faithful servant.
Devanāgarī: इन्धे राजा समर्यो नमोभिर्यस्य प्रतीकमाहुतं घृतेन
pada pāṭha: indhe | rājā | sam | aryaḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ | yasya | pratīkam | ā-hutam | ghr̥tena || naraḥ | havyebhiḥ | īḷate | sa-bādhaḥ | ā | agniḥ | agre | uṣasām | aśoci ||7.8.1||

IAST: naro havyebhir īḻate sabādha āgnir agra uṣasām aśoci
Griffith: The men, the priests adore him with oblations. Agni hath shone forth when the dawn is breaking.
Devanāgarī: नरो हव्येभिरीळते सबाध आग्निरग्र उषसामशोचि
pada pāṭha: indhe | rājā | sam | aryaḥ | namaḥ-bhiḥ | yasya | pratīkam | ā-hutam | ghr̥tena || naraḥ | havyebhiḥ | īḷate | sa-bādhaḥ | ā | agniḥ | agre | uṣasām | aśoci ||7.8.1||

IAST: ayam u ṣya sumahām̐ avedi hotā mandro manuṣo yahvo agniḥ
Griffith: Yea, he hath been acknowledged as most mighty, the joyous Priest of men, the youthful Agni.
Devanāgarī: अयमु ष्य सुमहाँ अवेदि होता मन्द्रो मनुषो यह्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | su-mahān | avedi | hotā | mandraḥ | manuṣaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ || vi | bhāḥ | akarityakaḥ | sasr̥jānaḥ | pr̥thivyām | kr̥ṣṇa-paviḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | vavakṣe ||7.8.2||

IAST: vi bhā akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyāṁ kṛṣṇapavir oṣadhībhir vavakṣe
Griffith: He, spreading o'er the earth, made light around him, and grew among the plants with blackened fellies..
Devanāgarī: वि भा अकः ससृजानः पृथिव्यां कृष्णपविरोषधीभिर्ववक्षे
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | su-mahān | avedi | hotā | mandraḥ | manuṣaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ || vi | bhāḥ | akarityakaḥ | sasr̥jānaḥ | pr̥thivyām | kr̥ṣṇa-paviḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | vavakṣe ||7.8.2||

IAST: kayā no agne vi vasaḥ suvṛktiṁ kām u svadhām ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ
Griffith: How dost thou decorate our hymn, O Agni? What power dost thou exert when thou art lauded?
Devanāgarī: कया नो अग्ने वि वसः सुवृक्तिं कामु स्वधामृणवः शस्यमानः
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | agne | vi | vasaḥ | su-vr̥ktim | kām | ūm̐ iti | svadhām | r̥ṇavaḥ | śasyamānaḥ || kadā | bhavema | patayaḥ | su-datra | rāyaḥ | vantāraḥ | dustarasya | sādhoḥ ||7.8.3||

IAST: kadā bhavema patayaḥ sudatra rāyo vantāro duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ
Griffith: When, Bounteous God, may we be lords of riches, winners of precious wealth which none may conquer?
Devanāgarī: कदा भवेम पतयः सुदत्र रायो वन्तारो दुष्टरस्य साधोः
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | agne | vi | vasaḥ | su-vr̥ktim | kām | ūm̐ iti | svadhām | r̥ṇavaḥ | śasyamānaḥ || kadā | bhavema | patayaḥ | su-datra | rāyaḥ | vantāraḥ | dustarasya | sādhoḥ ||7.8.3||

IAST: pra-prāyam agnir bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocate bṛhad bhāḥ
Griffith: Far famed is this the Bharata's own Agni he shineth like the Sun with lofty splendour.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्रायमग्निर्भरतस्य शृण्वे वि यत्सूर्यो न रोचते बृहद्भाः
pada pāṭha: pra-pra | ayam | agniḥ | bharatasya | śr̥ṇve | vi | yat | sūryaḥ | na | rocate | br̥hat | bhāḥ || abhi | yaḥ | pūrum | pr̥tanāsu | tasthau | dyutānaḥ | daivyaḥ | atithiḥ | śuśoca ||7.8.4||

IAST: abhi yaḥ pūrum pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutāno daivyo atithiḥ śuśoca
Griffith: He who hath vanquished Puru in the battle, the heavenly guest hath glowed in full refulgence.
Devanāgarī: अभि यः पूरुं पृतनासु तस्थौ द्युतानो दैव्यो अतिथिः शुशोच
pada pāṭha: pra-pra | ayam | agniḥ | bharatasya | śr̥ṇve | vi | yat | sūryaḥ | na | rocate | br̥hat | bhāḥ || abhi | yaḥ | pūrum | pr̥tanāsu | tasthau | dyutānaḥ | daivyaḥ | atithiḥ | śuśoca ||7.8.4||

IAST: asann it tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvo viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ
Griffith: Full many oblations are in thee collected: with all thine aspects thou hast waxen gracious.
Devanāgarī: असन्नित्त्वे आहवनानि भूरि भुवो विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः
pada pāṭha: asan | it | tve iti | ā-havanāni | bhūri | bhuvaḥ | viśvebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | anīkaiḥ || stutaḥ | cit | agne | śr̥ṇviṣe | gr̥ṇānaḥ | svayam | vardhasva | tanvam | su-jāta ||7.8.5||

IAST: stutaś cid agne śṛṇviṣe gṛṇānaḥ svayaṁ vardhasva tanvaṁ sujāta
Griffith: Thou art already famed as praised and lauded, yet still, O nobly born, increase thy body.
Devanāgarī: स्तुतश्चिदग्ने शृण्विषे गृणानः स्वयं वर्धस्व तन्वं सुजात
pada pāṭha: asan | it | tve iti | ā-havanāni | bhūri | bhuvaḥ | viśvebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | anīkaiḥ || stutaḥ | cit | agne | śr̥ṇviṣe | gr̥ṇānaḥ | svayam | vardhasva | tanvam | su-jāta ||7.8.5||

IAST: idaṁ vacaḥ śatasāḥ saṁsahasram ud agnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ
Griffith: Be this my song, that winneth countless treasure, engendered with redoubled force for Agni,
Devanāgarī: इदं वचः शतसाः संसहस्रमुदग्नये जनिषीष्ट द्विबर्हाः
pada pāṭha: idam | vacaḥ | śata-sāḥ | sam-sahasram | ut | agnaye | janiṣīṣṭa | dvi-barhāḥ || śam | yat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | āpaye | bhavāti | dyu-mat | amīva-cātanam | rakṣaḥ-hā ||7.8.6||

IAST: śaṁ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavāti dyumad amīvacātanaṁ rakṣohā
Griffith: That, splendid, chasing sickness, slaying demons, it may delight our friend and bless the singers.
Devanāgarī: शं यत्स्तोतृभ्य आपये भवाति द्युमदमीवचातनं रक्षोहा
pada pāṭha: idam | vacaḥ | śata-sāḥ | sam-sahasram | ut | agnaye | janiṣīṣṭa | dvi-barhāḥ || śam | yat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | āpaye | bhavāti | dyu-mat | amīva-cātanam | rakṣaḥ-hā ||7.8.6||

IAST: nū tvām agna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṁ sūno sahaso vasūnām
Griffith: We, the Vasisthas, now implore thee, Agni, O Son of Strength, the Lord of wealth and riches.
Devanāgarī: नू त्वामग्न ईमहे वसिष्ठा ईशानं सूनो सहसो वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: nu | tvām | agne | īmahe | vasiṣṭhāḥ | īśānam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vasūnām || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ānaṭ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.8.7||

IAST: iṣaṁ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Thou hast brought food to singers and to nobles. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषं स्तोतृभ्यो मघवद्भ्य आनड्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | tvām | agne | īmahe | vasiṣṭhāḥ | īśānam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vasūnām || iṣam | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ānaṭ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.8.7||

IAST: abodhi jāra uṣasām upasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ
Griffith: ROUSED from their bosom is the Dawns' beloved, the joyous Priest, most sapient, Purifier.
Devanāgarī: अबोधि जार उषसामुपस्थाद्धोता मन्द्रः कवितमः पावकः
pada pāṭha: abodhi | jāraḥ | uṣasām | upa-sthāt | hotā | mandraḥ | kavi-tamaḥ | pāvakaḥ || dadhāti | ketum | ubhayasya | jantoḥ | havyā | deveṣu | draviṇam | sukr̥t-su ||7.9.1||

IAST: dadhāti ketum ubhayasya jantor havyā deveṣu draviṇaṁ sukṛtsu
Griffith: He gives a signal both to Gods and mortals, to Gods oblations, riches to the pious.
Devanāgarī: दधाति केतुमुभयस्य जन्तोर्हव्या देवेषु द्रविणं सुकृत्सु
pada pāṭha: abodhi | jāraḥ | uṣasām | upa-sthāt | hotā | mandraḥ | kavi-tamaḥ | pāvakaḥ || dadhāti | ketum | ubhayasya | jantoḥ | havyā | deveṣu | draviṇam | sukr̥t-su ||7.9.1||

IAST: sa sukratur yo vi duraḥ paṇīnām punāno arkam purubhojasaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Most wise is he who, forcing doors of Panis, brought the bright Sun to us who feedeth many.
Devanāgarī: स सुक्रतुर्यो वि दुरः पणीनां पुनानो अर्कं पुरुभोजसं नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | yaḥ | vi | duraḥ | paṇīnām | punānaḥ | arkam | puru-bhojasam | naḥ || hotā | mandraḥ | viśām | damūnāḥ | tiraḥ | tamaḥ | dadr̥śe | rāmyāṇām ||7.9.2||

IAST: hotā mandro viśāṁ damūnās tiras tamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām
Griffith: The cheerful Priest, men's Friend and home-companion, through still night's darkness he is made apparen
Devanāgarī: होता मन्द्रो विशां दमूनास्तिरस्तमो ददृशे राम्याणाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | yaḥ | vi | duraḥ | paṇīnām | punānaḥ | arkam | puru-bhojasam | naḥ || hotā | mandraḥ | viśām | damūnāḥ | tiraḥ | tamaḥ | dadr̥śe | rāmyāṇām ||7.9.2||

IAST: amūraḥ kavir aditir vivasvān susaṁsan mitro atithiḥ śivo naḥ
Griffith: Wise, ne.'er deceived, uncircumscribed, refulgent, our gracious guest, a Friend with good attendants,
Devanāgarī: अमूरः कविरदितिर्विवस्वान्सुसंसन्मित्रो अतिथिः शिवो नः
pada pāṭha: amūraḥ | kaviḥ | aditiḥ | vivasvān | su-saṁsat | mitraḥ | atithiḥ | śivaḥ | naḥ || citra-bhānuḥ | uṣasām | bhāti | agre | apām | garbhaḥ | pra-svaḥ | ā | viveśa ||7.9.3||

IAST: citrabhānur uṣasām bhāty agre 'pāṁ garbhaḥ prasva ā viveśa
Griffith: Shines forth with wondrous light before the Mornings; the young plants hath he entered, Child of Waters
Devanāgarī: चित्रभानुरुषसां भात्यग्रेऽपां गर्भः प्रस्व आ विवेश
pada pāṭha: amūraḥ | kaviḥ | aditiḥ | vivasvān | su-saṁsat | mitraḥ | atithiḥ | śivaḥ | naḥ || citra-bhānuḥ | uṣasām | bhāti | agre | apām | garbhaḥ | pra-svaḥ | ā | viveśa ||7.9.3||

IAST: īḻenyo vo manuṣo yugeṣu samanagā aśucaj jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Seeking our gatherings, he, your Jatavedas, hath shone adorable through human ages,
Devanāgarī: ईळेन्यो वो मनुषो युगेषु समनगा अशुचज्जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: īḷenyaḥ | vaḥ | manuṣaḥ | yugeṣu | samana-gāḥ | aśucat | jāta-vedāḥ || su-saṁdr̥śā | bhānunā | yaḥ | vi-bhāti | prati | gāvaḥ | sam-idhānam | budhanta ||7.9.4||

IAST: susaṁdṛśā bhānunā yo vibhāti prati gāvaḥ samidhānam budhanta
Griffith: Who gleams refulgent with his lovely lustre: the kine have waked to meet him when enkindled.
Devanāgarī: सुसंदृशा भानुना यो विभाति प्रति गावः समिधानं बुधन्त
pada pāṭha: īḷenyaḥ | vaḥ | manuṣaḥ | yugeṣu | samana-gāḥ | aśucat | jāta-vedāḥ || su-saṁdr̥śā | bhānunā | yaḥ | vi-bhāti | prati | gāvaḥ | sam-idhānam | budhanta ||7.9.4||

IAST: agne yāhi dūtyam mā riṣaṇyo devām̐ acchā brahmakṛtā gaṇena
Griffith: Go on thy message to the Gods, and fail not, O Agni, with their band who pray and worship.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने याहि दूत्यं मा रिषण्यो देवाँ अच्छा ब्रह्मकृता गणेन
pada pāṭha: agne | yāhi | dūtyam | mā | riṣaṇyaḥ | devān | accha | brahma-kr̥tā | gaṇena || sarasvatīm | marutaḥ | aśvinā | apaḥ | yakṣi | devān | ratna-dheyāya | viśvān ||7.9.5||

IAST: sarasvatīm maruto aśvināpo yakṣi devān ratnadheyāya viśvān
Griffith: Bring all the Gods that they may give us riches, Sarasvati, the Maruts, Asvins, Waters.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वतीं मरुतो अश्विनापो यक्षि देवान्रत्नधेयाय विश्वान्
pada pāṭha: agne | yāhi | dūtyam | mā | riṣaṇyaḥ | devān | accha | brahma-kr̥tā | gaṇena || sarasvatīm | marutaḥ | aśvinā | apaḥ | yakṣi | devān | ratna-dheyāya | viśvān ||7.9.5||

IAST: tvām agne samidhāno vasiṣṭho jarūthaṁ han yakṣi rāye puraṁdhim
Griffith: Vasistha, when enkindling thee, O Agni, hath slain jarutha. Give us wealth in plenty.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने समिधानो वसिष्ठो जरूथं हन्यक्षि राये पुरंधिम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ | jarūtham | han | yakṣi | rāye | puram-dhim || puru-nīthā | jāta-vedaḥ | jarasva | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.9.6||

IAST: puruṇīthā jātavedo jarasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Sing praise in choral song, O Jatavedas. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: पुरुणीथा जातवेदो जरस्व यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | sam-idhānaḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ | jarūtham | han | yakṣi | rāye | puram-dhim || puru-nīthā | jāta-vedaḥ | jarasva | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.9.6||

IAST: uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyac chośucānaḥ
Griffith: HE hath sent forth, bright, radiant, and refulgent, like the Dawn's Lover, his far-spreading lustre.
Devanāgarī: उषो न जारः पृथु पाजो अश्रेद्दविद्युतद्दीद्यच्छोशुचानः
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | na | jāraḥ | pr̥thu | pājaḥ | aśret | davidyutat | dīdyat | śośucānaḥ || vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | śuciḥ | ā | bhāti | bhāsā | dhiyaḥ | hinvānaḥ | uśatīḥ | ajīgariti ||7.10.1||

IAST: vṛṣā hariḥ śucir ā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīr ajīgaḥ
Griffith: Pure in his splendour shines the golden Hero: our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.
Devanāgarī: वृषा हरिः शुचिरा भाति भासा धियो हिन्वान उशतीरजीगः
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | na | jāraḥ | pr̥thu | pājaḥ | aśret | davidyutat | dīdyat | śośucānaḥ || vr̥ṣā | hariḥ | śuciḥ | ā | bhāti | bhāsā | dhiyaḥ | hinvānaḥ | uśatīḥ | ajīgariti ||7.10.1||

IAST: svar ṇa vastor uṣasām aroci yajñaṁ tanvānā uśijo na manma
Griffith: He, like the Sun, hath shone while Morn is breaking, and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises,
Devanāgarī: स्वर्ण वस्तोरुषसामरोचि यज्ञं तन्वाना उशिजो न मन्म
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | na | vastoḥ | uṣasām | aroci | yajñam | tanvānāḥ | uśijaḥ | na | manma || agniḥ | janmāni | devaḥ | ā | vi | vidvān | dravat | dūtaḥ | deva-yāvā | vaniṣṭhaḥ ||7.10.2||

IAST: agnir janmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the God, who knows their generations and visits Gods, most bounteous, rapid envoy.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्जन्मानि देव आ वि विद्वान्द्रवद्दूतो देवयावा वनिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | na | vastoḥ | uṣasām | aroci | yajñam | tanvānāḥ | uśijaḥ | na | manma || agniḥ | janmāni | devaḥ | ā | vi | vidvān | dravat | dūtaḥ | deva-yāvā | vaniṣṭhaḥ ||7.10.2||

IAST: acchā giro matayo devayantīr agniṁ yanti draviṇam bhikṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: Our songs and holy hymns go forth to Agni, seeking the God and asking him for riches,
Devanāgarī: अच्छा गिरो मतयो देवयन्तीरग्निं यन्ति द्रविणं भिक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: accha | giraḥ | matayaḥ | deva-yantīḥ | agnim | yanti | draviṇam | bhikṣamāṇāḥ || su-saṁdr̥śam | su-pratīkam | su-añcam | havya-vāham | aratim | mānuṣāṇām ||7.10.3||

IAST: susaṁdṛśaṁ supratīkaṁ svañcaṁ havyavāham aratim mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: Him fair to see, of goodly aspect, mighty, men's messenger who carries their oblations.
Devanāgarī: सुसंदृशं सुप्रतीकं स्वञ्चं हव्यवाहमरतिं मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: accha | giraḥ | matayaḥ | deva-yantīḥ | agnim | yanti | draviṇam | bhikṣamāṇāḥ || su-saṁdr̥śam | su-pratīkam | su-añcam | havya-vāham | aratim | mānuṣāṇām ||7.10.3||

IAST: indraṁ no agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṁ rudrebhir ā vahā bṛhantam
Griffith: joined with the Vasus, Agni, bring thou Indra bring hither mighty Rudra with the Rudras,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं नो अग्ने वसुभिः सजोषा रुद्रं रुद्रेभिरा वहा बृहन्तम्
pada pāṭha: indram | naḥ | agne | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | rudram | rudrebhiḥ | ā | vaha | br̥hantam || ādityebhiḥ | aditim | viśva-janyām | br̥haspatim | r̥kva-bhiḥ | viśva-vāram ||7.10.4||

IAST: ādityebhir aditiṁ viśvajanyām bṛhaspatim ṛkvabhir viśvavāram
Griffith: Aditi good to all men with Adityas, Brhaspati All-bounteous, with the Singers.
Devanāgarī: आदित्येभिरदितिं विश्वजन्यां बृहस्पतिमृक्वभिर्विश्ववारम्
pada pāṭha: indram | naḥ | agne | vasu-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | rudram | rudrebhiḥ | ā | vaha | br̥hantam || ādityebhiḥ | aditim | viśva-janyām | br̥haspatim | r̥kva-bhiḥ | viśva-vāram ||7.10.4||

IAST: mandraṁ hotāram uśijo yaviṣṭham agniṁ viśa īḻate adhvareṣu
Griffith: Men eagerly implore at sacrifices Agni, Most Youthful God, the joyous Herald.
Devanāgarī: मन्द्रं होतारमुशिजो यविष्ठमग्निं विश ईळते अध्वरेषु
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | uśijaḥ | yaviṣṭham | agnim | viśaḥ | īḷate | adhvareṣu || saḥ | hi | kṣapā-vān | abhavat | rayīṇām | atandraḥ | dūtaḥ | yajathāya | devān ||7.10.5||

IAST: sa hi kṣapāvām̐ abhavad rayīṇām atandro dūto yajathāya devān
Griffith: For he is Lord and Ruler over riches, and for Gods' worship an unwearied envoy.
Devanāgarī: स हि क्षपावाँ अभवद्रयीणामतन्द्रो दूतो यजथाय देवान्
pada pāṭha: mandram | hotāram | uśijaḥ | yaviṣṭham | agnim | viśaḥ | īḷate | adhvareṣu || saḥ | hi | kṣapā-vān | abhavat | rayīṇām | atandraḥ | dūtaḥ | yajathāya | devān ||7.10.5||

IAST: mahām̐ asy adhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvad amṛtā mādayante
Griffith: GREAT art thou, Agni, sacrifice's Herald: not without thee are deathless Gods made joyful.
Devanāgarī: महाँ अस्यध्वरस्य प्रकेतो न ऋते त्वदमृता मादयन्ते
pada pāṭha: mahān | asi | adhvarasya | pra-ketaḥ | na | r̥te | tvat | amr̥tāḥ | mādayante || ā | viśvebhiḥ | sa-ratham | yāhi | devaiḥ | ni | agne | hotā | prathamaḥ | sada | iha ||7.11.1||

IAST: ā viśvebhiḥ sarathaṁ yāhi devair ny agne hotā prathamaḥ sadeha
Griffith: Come hither with all Deities about thee here take thy seat, the first, as Priest, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वेभिः सरथं याहि देवैर्न्यग्ने होता प्रथमः सदेह
pada pāṭha: mahān | asi | adhvarasya | pra-ketaḥ | na | r̥te | tvat | amr̥tāḥ | mādayante || ā | viśvebhiḥ | sa-ratham | yāhi | devaiḥ | ni | agne | hotā | prathamaḥ | sada | iha ||7.11.1||

IAST: tvām īḻate ajiraṁ dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadam in mānuṣāsaḥ
Griffith: Men with oblations evermore entreat thee, the swift, to undertake an envoy's duty.
Devanāgarī: त्वामीळते अजिरं दूत्याय हविष्मन्तः सदमिन्मानुषासः
pada pāṭha: tvām | īḷate | ajiram | dūtyāya | haviṣmantaḥ | sadam | it | mānuṣāsaḥ || yasya | devaiḥ | ā | asadaḥ | barhiḥ | agne | ahāni | asmai | su-dinā | bhavanti ||7.11.2||

IAST: yasya devair āsado barhir agne 'hāny asmai sudinā bhavanti
Griffith: He on whose sacred grass with Gods thou sittest, to him, O Agni, are the days propitious.
Devanāgarī: यस्य देवैरासदो बर्हिरग्नेऽहान्यस्मै सुदिना भवन्ति
pada pāṭha: tvām | īḷate | ajiram | dūtyāya | haviṣmantaḥ | sadam | it | mānuṣāsaḥ || yasya | devaiḥ | ā | asadaḥ | barhiḥ | agne | ahāni | asmai | su-dinā | bhavanti ||7.11.2||

IAST: triś cid aktoḥ pra cikitur vasūni tve antar dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: Three times a day in thee are shown the treasures sent for the mortal who presents oblation.
Devanāgarī: त्रिश्चिदक्तोः प्र चिकितुर्वसूनि त्वे अन्तर्दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: triḥ | cit | aktoḥ | pra | cikituḥ | vasūni | tve iti | antaḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya || manuṣvat | agne | iha | yakṣi | devān | bhava | naḥ | dūtaḥ | abhiśasti-pāvā ||7.11.3||

IAST: manuṣvad agna iha yakṣi devān bhavā no dūto abhiśastipāvā
Griffith: Bring the Gods hither like a man, O Agni: be thou our envoy, guarding us from curses.
Devanāgarī: मनुष्वदग्न इह यक्षि देवान्भवा नो दूतो अभिशस्तिपावा
