pada pāṭha: triḥ | cit | aktoḥ | pra | cikituḥ | vasūni | tve iti | antaḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya || manuṣvat | agne | iha | yakṣi | devān | bhava | naḥ | dūtaḥ | abhiśasti-pāvā ||7.11.3||

IAST: agnir īśe bṛhato adhvarasyāgnir viśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya
Griffith: Lord of the lofty sacrifice is Agni, Agni is Lord of every gift presented.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरीशे बृहतो अध्वरस्याग्निर्विश्वस्य हविषः कृतस्य
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | br̥hataḥ | adhvarasya | agniḥ | viśvasya | haviṣaḥ | kr̥tasya || kratum | hi | asya | vasavaḥ | juṣanta | atha | devāḥ | dadhire | havya-vāham ||7.11.4||

IAST: kratuṁ hy asya vasavo juṣantāthā devā dadhire havyavāham
Griffith: The Vasus were contented with his wisdom, so the Gods made him their oblationbearer.
Devanāgarī: क्रतुं ह्यस्य वसवो जुषन्ताथा देवा दधिरे हव्यवाहम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | br̥hataḥ | adhvarasya | agniḥ | viśvasya | haviṣaḥ | kr̥tasya || kratum | hi | asya | vasavaḥ | juṣanta | atha | devāḥ | dadhire | havya-vāham ||7.11.4||

IAST: āgne vaha haviradyāya devān indrajyeṣṭhāsa iha mādayantām
Griffith: O Agni, bring the Gods to taste our presents: with Indra leading, here let them be joyful.
Devanāgarī: आग्ने वह हविरद्याय देवानिन्द्रज्येष्ठास इह मादयन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | vaha | haviḥ-adyāya | devān | indra-jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | iha | mādayantām || imam | yajñam | divi | deveṣu | dhehi | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.11.5||

IAST: imaṁ yajñaṁ divi deveṣu dhehi yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Convey this sacrifice to Gods in heaven. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इमं यज्ञं दिवि देवेषु धेहि यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | vaha | haviḥ-adyāya | devān | indra-jyeṣṭhāsaḥ | iha | mādayantām || imam | yajñam | divi | deveṣu | dhehi | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.11.5||

IAST: aganma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṁ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe
Griffith: WE with great reverence have approached The Youngest who hath shone forth well-kindled in his dwelling,
Devanāgarī: अगन्म महा नमसा यविष्ठं यो दीदाय समिद्धः स्वे दुरोणे
pada pāṭha: aganma | mahā | namasā | yaviṣṭham | yaḥ | dīdāya | sam-iddhaḥ | sve | duroṇe || citra-bhānum | rodasī iti | antaḥ | urvī iti | su-āhutam | viśvataḥ | pratyañcam ||7.12.1||

IAST: citrabhānuṁ rodasī antar urvī svāhutaṁ viśvataḥ pratyañcam
Griffith: With wondrous light between wide earth and heaven, well-worshipped, looking forth in all directions.
Devanāgarī: चित्रभानुं रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी स्वाहुतं विश्वतः प्रत्यञ्चम्
pada pāṭha: aganma | mahā | namasā | yaviṣṭham | yaḥ | dīdāya | sam-iddhaḥ | sve | duroṇe || citra-bhānum | rodasī iti | antaḥ | urvī iti | su-āhutam | viśvataḥ | pratyañcam ||7.12.1||

IAST: sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvān agniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Through his great might o'ercoming all misfortunes, praised in the house is Agni Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: स मह्ना विश्वा दुरितानि साह्वानग्निः ष्टवे दम आ जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mahnā | viśvā | duḥ-itāni | sāhvān | agniḥ | stave | dame | ā | jāta-vedāḥ || saḥ | naḥ | rakṣiṣat | duḥ-itāt | avadyāt | asmān | gr̥ṇataḥ | uta | naḥ | maghonaḥ ||7.12.2||

IAST: sa no rakṣiṣad duritād avadyād asmān gṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ
Griffith: May he protect us from disgrace and trouble, both us who laud him and our noble patrons.
Devanāgarī: स नो रक्षिषद्दुरितादवद्यादस्मान्गृणत उत नो मघोनः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mahnā | viśvā | duḥ-itāni | sāhvān | agniḥ | stave | dame | ā | jāta-vedāḥ || saḥ | naḥ | rakṣiṣat | duḥ-itāt | avadyāt | asmān | gr̥ṇataḥ | uta | naḥ | maghonaḥ ||7.12.2||

IAST: tvaṁ varuṇa uta mitro agne tvāṁ vardhanti matibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: O Agni, thou art Varuna and Mitra: Vasisthas with their holy hymns exalt thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वरुण उत मित्रो अग्ने त्वां वर्धन्ति मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | varuṇaḥ | uta | mitraḥ | agne | tvām | vardhanti | mati-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || tve iti | vasu | su-sananāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.12.3||

IAST: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: With thee be most abundant gain of treasure. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: त्वे वसु सुषणनानि सन्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: tvam | varuṇaḥ | uta | mitraḥ | agne | tvām | vardhanti | mati-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || tve iti | vasu | su-sananāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.12.3||

IAST: prāgnaye viśvaśuce dhiyaṁdhe 'suraghne manma dhītim bharadhvam
Griffith: BRING song and hymn to Agni, Asura-slayer, enlightener of all and thought-bestower.
Devanāgarī: प्राग्नये विश्वशुचे धियंधेऽसुरघ्ने मन्म धीतिं भरध्वम्
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | viśva-śuce | dhiyam-dhe | asura-ghne | manma | dhītim | bharadhvam || bhare | haviḥ | na | barhiṣi | prīṇānaḥ | vaiśvānarāya | yataye | matīnām ||7.13.1||

IAST: bhare havir na barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām
Griffith: Like an oblation on the grass, to please him, I bring this to Vaisvanara, hymn-inspirer.
Devanāgarī: भरे हविर्न बर्हिषि प्रीणानो वैश्वानराय यतये मतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | agnaye | viśva-śuce | dhiyam-dhe | asura-ghne | manma | dhītim | bharadhvam || bhare | haviḥ | na | barhiṣi | prīṇānaḥ | vaiśvānarāya | yataye | matīnām ||7.13.1||

IAST: tvam agne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ
Griffith: Thou with thy flame, O Agni, brightly glowing, hast at thy birth filled full the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने शोचिषा शोशुचान आ रोदसी अपृणा जायमानः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | śociṣā | śośucānaḥ | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāḥ | jāyamānaḥ || tvam | devān | abhi-śasteḥ | amuñcaḥ | vaiśvānara | jāta-vedaḥ | mahi-tvā ||7.13.2||

IAST: tvaṁ devām̐ abhiśaster amuñco vaiśvānara jātavedo mahitvā
Griffith: TIOU with thy might, Vaisvanara Jatavedas, settest the Gods free frodi the curse that bound them.
Devanāgarī: त्वं देवाँ अभिशस्तेरमुञ्चो वैश्वानर जातवेदो महित्वा
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | śociṣā | śośucānaḥ | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāḥ | jāyamānaḥ || tvam | devān | abhi-śasteḥ | amuñcaḥ | vaiśvānara | jāta-vedaḥ | mahi-tvā ||7.13.2||

IAST: jāto yad agne bhuvanā vy akhyaḥ paśūn na gopā iryaḥ parijmā
Griffith: Agni, when, born thou lookedst on all creatures, like a brisk herdsman moving round his cattle.
Devanāgarī: जातो यदग्ने भुवना व्यख्यः पशून्न गोपा इर्यः परिज्मा
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | yat | agne | bhuvanā | vi | akhyaḥ | paśūn | na | gopāḥ | iryaḥ | pari-jmā || vaiśvānara | brahmaṇe | vinda | gātum | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.13.3||

IAST: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda gātuṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: The path to prayer, Vaisvanara, thou foundest. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर ब्रह्मणे विन्द गातुं यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: jātaḥ | yat | agne | bhuvanā | vi | akhyaḥ | paśūn | na | gopāḥ | iryaḥ | pari-jmā || vaiśvānara | brahmaṇe | vinda | gātum | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.13.3||

IAST: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ
Griffith: WITH reverence and with offered gifts serve we the God whose flame is bright:
Devanāgarī: समिधा जातवेदसे देवाय देवहूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | jāta-vedase | devāya | devahūti-bhiḥ || haviḥ-bhiḥ | śukra-śociṣe | namasvinaḥ | vayam | dāśema | agnaye ||7.14.1||

IAST: havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṁ dāśemāgnaye
Griffith: Let us bring Jatavedas fuel, and adore Agni when we invoke the Gods.
Devanāgarī: हविर्भिः शुक्रशोचिषे नमस्विनो वयं दाशेमाग्नये
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | jāta-vedase | devāya | devahūti-bhiḥ || haviḥ-bhiḥ | śukra-śociṣe | namasvinaḥ | vayam | dāśema | agnaye ||7.14.1||

IAST: vayaṁ te agne samidhā vidhema vayaṁ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra
Griffith: Agni, may we perform thy rites with fuel, and honour thee, O Holy one, with praises:
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम वयं दाशेम सुष्टुती यजत्र
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | agne | sam-idhā | vidhema | vayam | dāśema | su-stutī | yajatra || vayam | ghr̥tena | adhvarasya | hotaḥ | vayam | deva | haviṣā | bhadra-śoce ||7.14.2||

IAST: vayaṁ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotar vayaṁ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce
Griffith: Honour thee, Priest of sacrifice! with butter, thee, God of blessed light! with our oblation.
Devanāgarī: वयं घृतेनाध्वरस्य होतर्वयं देव हविषा भद्रशोचे
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | agne | sam-idhā | vidhema | vayam | dāśema | su-stutī | yajatra || vayam | ghr̥tena | adhvarasya | hotaḥ | vayam | deva | haviṣā | bhadra-śoce ||7.14.2||

IAST: ā no devebhir upa devahūtim agne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtiṁ juṣāṇaḥ
Griffith: Come, Agni, with the Gods to our invoking, come, pleased, to offerings sanctified with Vasat.
Devanāgarī: आ नो देवेभिरुप देवहूतिमग्ने याहि वषट्कृतिं जुषाणः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devebhiḥ | upa | deva-hūtim | agne | yāhi | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tim | juṣāṇaḥ || tubhyam | devāya | dāśataḥ | syāma | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.14.3||

IAST: tubhyaṁ devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May we be his who pays thee, God, due honour. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं देवाय दाशतः स्याम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devebhiḥ | upa | deva-hūtim | agne | yāhi | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tim | juṣāṇaḥ || tubhyam | devāya | dāśataḥ | syāma | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.14.3||

IAST: upasadyāya mīḻhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ
Griffith: OFFER oblations in his mouth, the bounteous God's whom we must serve.
Devanāgarī: उपसद्याय मीळ्हुष आस्ये जुहुता हविः
pada pāṭha: upa-sadyāya | mīḷhuṣe | āsye | juhuta | haviḥ || yaḥ | naḥ | nediṣṭham | āpyam ||7.15.1||

IAST: yo no nediṣṭham āpyam
Griffith: His who is nearest kin to us:
Devanāgarī: यो नो नेदिष्ठमाप्यम्
pada pāṭha: upa-sadyāya | mīḷhuṣe | āsye | juhuta | haviḥ || yaḥ | naḥ | nediṣṭham | āpyam ||7.15.1||

IAST: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīr abhi niṣasāda dame-dame
Griffith: Who for the Fivefold People's take hath seated him in every home
Devanāgarī: यः पञ्च चर्षणीरभि निषसाद दमेदमे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | ni-sasāda | dame-dame || kaviḥ | gr̥ha-patiḥ | yuvā ||7.15.2||

IAST: kavir gṛhapatir yuvā
Griffith: Wise, Youthful, Master of the house.
Devanāgarī: कविर्गृहपतिर्युवा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | pañca | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi | ni-sasāda | dame-dame || kaviḥ | gr̥ha-patiḥ | yuvā ||7.15.2||

IAST: sa no vedo amātyam agnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ
Griffith: On all sides may that Agni guard our household folk and property;
Devanāgarī: स नो वेदो अमात्यमग्नी रक्षतु विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vedaḥ | amātyam | agniḥ | rakṣatu | viśvataḥ || uta | asmān | pātu | aṁhasaḥ ||7.15.3||

IAST: utāsmān pātv aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: May he deliver us from woe.
Devanāgarī: उतास्मान्पात्वंहसः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vedaḥ | amātyam | agniḥ | rakṣatu | viśvataḥ || uta | asmān | pātu | aṁhasaḥ ||7.15.3||

IAST: navaṁ nu stomam agnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam
Griffith: I have begotten this new hymn for Agni, Falcon of the sky:
Devanāgarī: नवं नु स्तोममग्नये दिवः श्येनाय जीजनम्
pada pāṭha: navam | nu | stomam | agnaye | divaḥ | śyenāya | jījanam || vasvaḥ | kuvit | vanāti | naḥ ||7.15.4||

IAST: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ
Griffith: Will he not give us of his wealth?
Devanāgarī: वस्वः कुविद्वनाति नः
pada pāṭha: navam | nu | stomam | agnaye | divaḥ | śyenāya | jījanam || vasvaḥ | kuvit | vanāti | naḥ ||7.15.4||

IAST: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayir vīravato yathā
Griffith: Whose lories when he glows in front of sacrite are fair to see,
Devanāgarī: स्पार्हा यस्य श्रियो दृशे रयिर्वीरवतो यथा
pada pāṭha: spārhāḥ | yasya | śriyaḥ | dr̥śe | rayiḥ | vīra-vataḥ | yathā || agre | yajñasya | śocataḥ ||7.15.5||

IAST: agre yajñasya śocataḥ
Griffith: Like wealth of one with hero sons.
Devanāgarī: अग्रे यज्ञस्य शोचतः
pada pāṭha: spārhāḥ | yasya | śriyaḥ | dr̥śe | rayiḥ | vīra-vataḥ | yathā || agre | yajñasya | śocataḥ ||7.15.5||

IAST: semāṁ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtim agnir juṣata no giraḥ
Griffith: May he enjoy this hallowed gift, Agni accept our songs, who bears
Devanāgarī: सेमां वेतु वषट्कृतिमग्निर्जुषत नो गिरः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | imām | vetu | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tim | agniḥ | juṣata | naḥ | giraḥ || yajiṣṭhaḥ | havya-vāhanaḥ ||7.15.6||

IAST: yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ
Griffith: Oblations, best of worshippers.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठो हव्यवाहनः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | imām | vetu | vaṣaṭ-kr̥tim | agniḥ | juṣata | naḥ | giraḥ || yajiṣṭhaḥ | havya-vāhanaḥ ||7.15.6||

IAST: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṁ deva dhīmahi
Griffith: Lord of the house, whom men must seek, we set thee down, O Worshipped Onel
Devanāgarī: नि त्वा नक्ष्य विश्पते द्युमन्तं देव धीमहि
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | nakṣya | viśpate | dyu-mantam | deva | dhīmahi || su-vīram | agne | ā-huta ||7.15.7||

IAST: suvīram agna āhuta
Griffith: Bright, rich in heroes, Agni! God
Devanāgarī: सुवीरमग्न आहुत
pada pāṭha: ni | tvā | nakṣya | viśpate | dyu-mantam | deva | dhīmahi || su-vīram | agne | ā-huta ||7.15.7||

IAST: kṣapa usraś ca dīdihi svagnayas tvayā vayam
Griffith: Shine forth at night and morn: through thee with fires are we provided well.
Devanāgarī: क्षप उस्रश्च दीदिहि स्वग्नयस्त्वया वयम्
pada pāṭha: kṣapaḥ | usraḥ | ca | dīdihi | su-agnayaḥ | tvayā | vayam || su-vīraḥ | tvam | asma-yuḥ ||7.15.8||

IAST: suvīras tvam asmayuḥ
Griffith: Thou, rich in heroes, art our Friend.
Devanāgarī: सुवीरस्त्वमस्मयुः
pada pāṭha: kṣapaḥ | usraḥ | ca | dīdihi | su-agnayaḥ | tvayā | vayam || su-vīraḥ | tvam | asma-yuḥ ||7.15.8||

IAST: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: The men come near thee for their gain, the singers with their songs of praise:
Devanāgarī: उप त्वा सातये नरो विप्रासो यन्ति धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | sātaye | naraḥ | viprāsaḥ | yanti | dhīti-bhiḥ || upa | akṣarā | sahasriṇī ||7.15.9||

IAST: upākṣarā sahasriṇī
Griffith: Speech, thousandfold, comes near to thee.
Devanāgarī: उपाक्षरा सहस्रिणी
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | sātaye | naraḥ | viprāsaḥ | yanti | dhīti-bhiḥ || upa | akṣarā | sahasriṇī ||7.15.9||

IAST: agnī rakṣāṁsi sedhati śukraśocir amartyaḥ
Griffith: Bright, Purifier, meet for praise, Immortal with refulgent glow,
Devanāgarī: अग्नी रक्षांसि सेधति शुक्रशोचिरमर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | rakṣāṁsi | sedhati | śukra-śociḥ | amartyaḥ || śuciḥ | pāvakaḥ | īḍyaḥ ||7.15.10||

IAST: śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ
Griffith: Agni drives Raksasas away.
Devanāgarī: शुचिः पावक ईड्यः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | rakṣāṁsi | sedhati | śukra-śociḥ | amartyaḥ || śuciḥ | pāvakaḥ | īḍyaḥ ||7.15.10||

IAST: sa no rādhāṁsy ā bhareśānaḥ sahaso yaho
Griffith: As such, bring us abundant wealth, young Child of Strength, for this thou canst
Devanāgarī: स नो राधांस्या भरेशानः सहसो यहो
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | ā | bhara | īśānaḥ | sahasaḥ | yaho iti || bhagaḥ | ca | dātu | vāryam ||7.15.11||

IAST: bhagaś ca dātu vāryam
Griffith: May Bhaga give us what is choice.
Devanāgarī: भगश्च दातु वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | ā | bhara | īśānaḥ | sahasaḥ | yaho iti || bhagaḥ | ca | dātu | vāryam ||7.15.11||

IAST: tvam agne vīravad yaśo devaś ca savitā bhagaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Agni, givest hero fame: Bhaga and Savitar the God,
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने वीरवद्यशो देवश्च सविता भगः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ | devaḥ | ca | savitā | bhagaḥ || ditiḥ | ca | dāti | vāryam ||7.15.12||

IAST: ditiś ca dāti vāryam
Griffith: And Did give us what is good.
Devanāgarī: दितिश्च दाति वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ | devaḥ | ca | savitā | bhagaḥ || ditiḥ | ca | dāti | vāryam ||7.15.12||

IAST: agne rakṣā ṇo aṁhasaḥ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ
Griffith: Agni, preserve us from distress: consume our enemies, O God,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने रक्षा णो अंहसः प्रति ष्म देव रीषतः
pada pāṭha: agne | rakṣa | naḥ | aṁhasaḥ | prati | sma | deva | riṣataḥ || tapiṣṭhaiḥ | ajaraḥ | daha ||7.15.13||

IAST: tapiṣṭhair ajaro daha
Griffith: Eternal, with the hottest flames.
Devanāgarī: तपिष्ठैरजरो दह
pada pāṭha: agne | rakṣa | naḥ | aṁhasaḥ | prati | sma | deva | riṣataḥ || tapiṣṭhaiḥ | ajaraḥ | daha ||7.15.13||

IAST: adhā mahī na āyasy anādhṛṣṭo nṛpītaye
Griffith: And, irresistible, be thou a mighty iron fort to us,
Devanāgarī: अधा मही न आयस्यनाधृष्टो नृपीतये
pada pāṭha: adha | mahī | naḥ | āyasī | anādhr̥ṣṭaḥ | nr̥-pītaye || pūḥ | bhava | śata-bhujiḥ ||7.15.14||

IAST: pūr bhavā śatabhujiḥ
Griffith: With hundred walls for man's defence.
Devanāgarī: पूर्भवा शतभुजिः
pada pāṭha: adha | mahī | naḥ | āyasī | anādhr̥ṣṭaḥ | nr̥-pītaye || pūḥ | bhava | śata-bhujiḥ ||7.15.14||

IAST: tvaṁ naḥ pāhy aṁhaso doṣāvastar aghāyataḥ
Griffith: Do thou preserve us, eve and morn, from sorrow, from the wicked men,
Devanāgarī: त्वं नः पाह्यंहसो दोषावस्तरघायतः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | doṣā-vastaḥ | agha-yataḥ || divā | naktam | adābhya ||7.15.15||

IAST: divā naktam adābhya
Griffith: Infallible! by day and night.
Devanāgarī: दिवा नक्तमदाभ्य
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | doṣā-vastaḥ | agha-yataḥ || divā | naktam | adābhya ||7.15.15||

IAST: enā vo agniṁ namasorjo napātam ā huve
Griffith: WITH this my reverent hymn I call Agni for you, the Son of Strength,
Devanāgarī: एना वो अग्निं नमसोर्जो नपातमा हुवे
pada pāṭha: enā | vaḥ | agnim | namasā | ūrjaḥ | napātam | ā | huve || priyam | cetiṣṭham | aratim | su-adhvaram | viśvasya | dūtam | amr̥tam ||7.16.1||

IAST: priyaṁ cetiṣṭham aratiṁ svadhvaraṁ viśvasya dūtam amṛtam
Griffith: Dear, wisest envoy, served with noble sacrifice, immortal messenger of all.
Devanāgarī: प्रियं चेतिष्ठमरतिं स्वध्वरं विश्वस्य दूतममृतम्
pada pāṭha: enā | vaḥ | agnim | namasā | ūrjaḥ | napātam | ā | huve || priyam | cetiṣṭham | aratim | su-adhvaram | viśvasya | dūtam | amr̥tam ||7.16.1||

IAST: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ
Griffith: His two red horses, all-supporting, let him yoke: let him, well-worshipped, urge them fast.
Devanāgarī: स योजते अरुषा विश्वभोजसा स दुद्रवत्स्वाहुतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yojate | aruṣā | viśva-bhojasā | saḥ | dudravat | su-āhutaḥ || su-brahmā | yajñaḥ | su-śamī | vasūnām | devam | rādhaḥ | janānām ||7.16.2||

IAST: subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṁ devaṁ rādho janānām
Griffith: Then hath the sacrifice good prayers and happy end, and heavenly gift of wealth to men.
Devanāgarī: सुब्रह्मा यज्ञः सुशमी वसूनां देवं राधो जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yojate | aruṣā | viśva-bhojasā | saḥ | dudravat | su-āhutaḥ || su-brahmā | yajñaḥ | su-śamī | vasūnām | devam | rādhaḥ | janānām ||7.16.2||

IAST: ud asya śocir asthād ājuhvānasya mīḻhuṣaḥ
Griffith: The flame of him the Bountiful, the Much-invoked, hath mounted up,
Devanāgarī: उदस्य शोचिरस्थादाजुह्वानस्य मीळ्हुषः
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | śociḥ | asthāt | ā-juhvānasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ || ut | dhūmāsaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | divi-spr̥śaḥ | sam | agnim | indhate | naraḥ ||7.16.3||

IAST: ud dhūmāso aruṣāso divispṛśaḥ sam agnim indhate naraḥ
Griffith: And his red-coloured smoke-clouds reach and touch the sky: the men are kindling Agni well.
Devanāgarī: उद्धूमासो अरुषासो दिविस्पृशः समग्निमिन्धते नरः
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | śociḥ | asthāt | ā-juhvānasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ || ut | dhūmāsaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | divi-spr̥śaḥ | sam | agnim | indhate | naraḥ ||7.16.3||

IAST: taṁ tvā dūtaṁ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṁ devām̐ ā vītaye vaha
Griffith: Thee, thee Most Glorious One we make our messenger. Bring the Gods hither to the feast.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा दूतं कृण्महे यशस्तमं देवाँ आ वीतये वह
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | dūtam | kr̥ṇmahe | yaśaḥ-tamam | devān | ā | vītaye | vaha || viśvā | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | marta-bhojanā | rāsva | tat | yat | tvā | īmahe ||7.16.4||

IAST: viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe
Griffith: Give us, O Son of Strength, all food that fcedeth man: give that for which we pray to thee.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा सूनो सहसो मर्तभोजना रास्व तद्यत्त्वेमहे
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | dūtam | kr̥ṇmahe | yaśaḥ-tamam | devān | ā | vītaye | vaha || viśvā | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | marta-bhojanā | rāsva | tat | yat | tvā | īmahe ||7.16.4||

IAST: tvam agne gṛhapatis tvaṁ hotā no adhvare
Griffith: Thou, Agni, art the homestead's Lord, our Herald at the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने गृहपतिस्त्वं होता नो अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | gr̥ha-patiḥ | tvam | hotā | naḥ | adhvare || tvam | potā | viśva-vāra | pra-cetāḥ | yakṣi | veṣi | ca | vāryam ||7.16.5||

IAST: tvam potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam
Griffith: Lord of all boons, thou art the Cleanser and a Sage. Pay worship, and enjoy the good.
Devanāgarī: त्वं पोता विश्ववार प्रचेता यक्षि वेषि च वार्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | gr̥ha-patiḥ | tvam | hotā | naḥ | adhvare || tvam | potā | viśva-vāra | pra-cetāḥ | yakṣi | veṣi | ca | vāryam ||7.16.5||

IAST: kṛdhi ratnaṁ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṁ hi ratnadhā asi
Griffith: Give riches to the sacrificer, O Most Wise, for thou art he who granteth wealth.
Devanāgarī: कृधि रत्नं यजमानाय सुक्रतो त्वं हि रत्नधा असि
pada pāṭha: kr̥dhi | ratnam | yajamānāya | sukrato iti su-krato | tvam | hi | ratna-dhāḥ | asi || ā | naḥ | r̥te | śiśīhi | viśvam | r̥tvijam | su-śaṁsaḥ | yaḥ | ca | dakṣate ||7.16.6||

IAST: ā na ṛte śiśīhi viśvam ṛtvijaṁ suśaṁso yaś ca dakṣate
Griffith: Inspire with zeal each priest at this our solemn rite; all who are skilled in singing praise.
Devanāgarī: आ न ऋते शिशीहि विश्वमृत्विजं सुशंसो यश्च दक्षते
pada pāṭha: kr̥dhi | ratnam | yajamānāya | sukrato iti su-krato | tvam | hi | ratna-dhāḥ | asi || ā | naḥ | r̥te | śiśīhi | viśvam | r̥tvijam | su-śaṁsaḥ | yaḥ | ca | dakṣate ||7.16.6||

IAST: tve agne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ
Griffith: O Agni who art worshipped well, dear let our princes he to thee,
Devanāgarī: त्वे अग्ने स्वाहुत प्रियासः सन्तु सूरयः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | su-āhuta | priyāsaḥ | santu | sūrayaḥ || yantāraḥ | ye | magha-vānaḥ | janānām | ūrvān | dayanta | gonām ||7.16.7||

IAST: yantāro ye maghavāno janānām ūrvān dayanta gonām
Griffith: Our wealthy patrons who are governors of men, who part, as gifts, their stalls of kine.
Devanāgarī: यन्तारो ये मघवानो जनानामूर्वान्दयन्त गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: tve iti | agne | su-āhuta | priyāsaḥ | santu | sūrayaḥ || yantāraḥ | ye | magha-vānaḥ | janānām | ūrvān | dayanta | gonām ||7.16.7||

IAST: yeṣām iḻā ghṛtahastā duroṇa ām̐ api prātā niṣīdati
Griffith: They in whose home, her hand bearing the sacred oil, Ila sits down well-satisfied-
Devanāgarī: येषामिळा घृतहस्ता दुरोण आँ अपि प्राता निषीदति
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | iḷā | ghr̥ta-hastā | duroṇe | ā | api | prātā | ni-sīdati || tān | trāyasva | sahasya | druhaḥ | nidaḥ | yaccha | naḥ | śarma | dīrgha-śrut ||7.16.8||

IAST: tām̐s trāyasva sahasya druho nido yacchā naḥ śarma dīrghaśrut
Griffith: Guard them, Victorious God, from slander and from harm. give us a refuge famed afar.
Devanāgarī: ताँस्त्रायस्व सहस्य द्रुहो निदो यच्छा नः शर्म दीर्घश्रुत्
pada pāṭha: yeṣām | iḷā | ghr̥ta-hastā | duroṇe | ā | api | prātā | ni-sīdati || tān | trāyasva | sahasya | druhaḥ | nidaḥ | yaccha | naḥ | śarma | dīrgha-śrut ||7.16.8||

IAST: sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahnir āsā viduṣṭaraḥ
Griffith: Do thou, a Priest with pleasant tongue, most wise, and very near to us,
Devanāgarī: स मन्द्रया च जिह्वया वह्निरासा विदुष्टरः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandrayā | ca | jihvayā | vahniḥ | āsā | viduḥ-taraḥ || agne | rayim | maghavat-bhyaḥ | naḥ | ā | vaha | havya-dātim | ca | sūdaya ||7.16.9||

IAST: agne rayim maghavadbhyo na ā vaha havyadātiṁ ca sūdaya
Griffith: Agni, bring riches hither to our liberal chiefs, and speed the oflering of our gifts.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यो न आ वह हव्यदातिं च सूदय
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandrayā | ca | jihvayā | vahniḥ | āsā | viduḥ-taraḥ || agne | rayim | maghavat-bhyaḥ | naḥ | ā | vaha | havya-dātim | ca | sūdaya ||7.16.9||

IAST: ye rādhāṁsi dadaty aśvyā maghā kāmena śravaso mahaḥ
Griffith: They who bestow as bounty plenteous wealth of steeds, moved by desire of great renown-
Devanāgarī: ये राधांसि ददत्यश्व्या मघा कामेन श्रवसो महः
pada pāṭha: ye | rādhāṁsi | dadati | aśvyā | maghā | kāmena | śravasaḥ | mahaḥ || tān | aṁhasaḥ | pipr̥hi | partr̥-bhiḥ | tvam | śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭhya ||7.16.10||

IAST: tām̐ aṁhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiṣ ṭvaṁ śatam pūrbhir yaviṣṭhya
Griffith: Do thou with saving help preserve them from distress, Most Youthful! with a hundred forts.
Devanāgarī: ताँ अंहसः पिपृहि पर्तृभिष्ट्वं शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ्य
pada pāṭha: ye | rādhāṁsi | dadati | aśvyā | maghā | kāmena | śravasaḥ | mahaḥ || tān | aṁhasaḥ | pipr̥hi | partr̥-bhiḥ | tvam | śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭhya ||7.16.10||

IAST: devo vo draviṇodāḥ pūrṇāṁ vivaṣṭy āsicam
Griffith: The God who gives your wealth demands a full libation poured to him.
Devanāgarī: देवो वो द्रविणोदाः पूर्णां विवष्ट्यासिचम्
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | vaḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | pūrṇām | vivaṣṭi | ā-sicam || ut | vā | siñcadhvam | upa | vā | pr̥ṇadhvam | āt | it | vaḥ | devaḥ | ohate ||7.16.11||

IAST: ud vā siñcadhvam upa vā pṛṇadhvam ād id vo deva ohate
Griffith: Pour ye it forth, then fill the vessel full again: then doth the God pay heed to you.
Devanāgarī: उद्वा सिञ्चध्वमुप वा पृणध्वमादिद्वो देव ओहते
pada pāṭha: devaḥ | vaḥ | draviṇaḥ-dāḥ | pūrṇām | vivaṣṭi | ā-sicam || ut | vā | siñcadhvam | upa | vā | pr̥ṇadhvam | āt | it | vaḥ | devaḥ | ohate ||7.16.11||

IAST: taṁ hotāram adhvarasya pracetasaṁ vahniṁ devā akṛṇvata
Griffith: Him have the Gods appointed Priest of sacrifice, oblation-bearer, passing wise.
Devanāgarī: तं होतारमध्वरस्य प्रचेतसं वह्निं देवा अकृण्वत
pada pāṭha: tam | hotāram | adhvarasya | pra-cetasam | vahnim | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvata || dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | su-vīryam | agniḥ | janāya | dāśuṣe ||7.16.12||

IAST: dadhāti ratnaṁ vidhate suvīryam agnir janāya dāśuṣe
Griffith: Agni gives wealth and valour to the worshipper, to folk who offer up their gifts.
Devanāgarī: दधाति रत्नं विधते सुवीर्यमग्निर्जनाय दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: tam | hotāram | adhvarasya | pra-cetasam | vahnim | devāḥ | akr̥ṇvata || dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | su-vīryam | agniḥ | janāya | dāśuṣe ||7.16.12||

IAST: agne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhir urviyā vi stṛṇītām
Griffith: AGNI, be kindled well with proper fuel, and let the grass be scattered wide about thee.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने भव सुषमिधा समिद्ध उत बर्हिरुर्विया वि स्तृणीताम्
pada pāṭha: agne | bhava | su-samidhā | sam-iddhaḥ | uta | barhiḥ | urviyā | vi | str̥ṇītām ||7.17.1||

IAST: uta dvāra uśatīr vi śrayantām uta devām̐ uśata ā vaheha
Griffith: Let the impatient Portals be thrown open bring thou the Gods impatient to come hither.
Devanāgarī: उत द्वार उशतीर्वि श्रयन्तामुत देवाँ उशत आ वहेह
pada pāṭha: uta | dvāraḥ | uśatīḥ | vi | śrayantām | uta | devān | uśataḥ | ā | vaha | iha ||7.17.2||

IAST: agne vīhi haviṣā yakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
Griffith: Taste, Agni: serve the Gods with our oblation. Offer good sacrifices, Jatavedas!
Devanāgarī: अग्ने वीहि हविषा यक्षि देवान्स्वध्वरा कृणुहि जातवेदः
pada pāṭha: agne | vīhi | haviṣā | yakṣi | devān | su-adhvarā | kr̥ṇuhi | jāta-vedaḥ ||7.17.3||

IAST: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devām̐ amṛtān piprayac ca
Griffith: Let Jatavedas pay fair sacrifices, worship andgratify the Gods Immortal.
Devanāgarī: स्वध्वरा करति जातवेदा यक्षद्देवाँ अमृतान्पिप्रयच्च
pada pāṭha: su-adhvarā | karati | jāta-vedāḥ | yakṣat | devān | amr̥tān | piprayat | ca ||7.17.4||

IAST: vaṁsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantv āśiṣo no adya
Griffith: Wise God, win for us things that are all-goodly, and let the prayers, we pray today be fruitful.
Devanāgarī: वंस्व विश्वा वार्याणि प्रचेतः सत्या भवन्त्वाशिषो नो अद्य
pada pāṭha: vaṁsva | viśvā | vāryāṇi | praceta iti pra-cetaḥ | satyāḥ | bhavantu | ā-śiṣaḥ | naḥ | adya ||7.17.5||

IAST: tvām u te dadhire havyavāhaṁ devāso agna ūrja ā napātam
Griffith: Thee, even thee, the Son of Strength, O Agni, those Gods have made the bearer of oblations.
Devanāgarī: त्वामु ते दधिरे हव्यवाहं देवासो अग्न ऊर्ज आ नपातम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | ūm̐ iti | te | dadhire | havya-vāham | devāsaḥ | agne | ūrjaḥ | ā | napātam ||7.17.6||

IAST: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ
Griffith: To thee the God may we perform our worship: do thou, besought, grant us abundant riches.
Devanāgarī: ते ते देवाय दाशतः स्याम महो नो रत्ना वि दध इयानः
pada pāṭha: te | te | devāya | dāśataḥ | syāma | mahaḥ | naḥ | ratnā | vi | dadhaḥ | iyānaḥ ||7.17.7||

IAST: tve ha yat pitaraś cin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan
Griffith: ALL is with thee, O Indra, all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises.
Devanāgarī: त्वे ह यत्पितरश्चिन्न इन्द्र विश्वा वामा जरितारो असन्वन्
pada pāṭha: tve iti | ha | yat | pitaraḥ | cit | naḥ | indra | viśvā | vāmā | jaritāraḥ | asanvan || tve iti | gāvaḥ | su-dughāḥ | tve iti | hi | aśvāḥ | tvam | vasu | deva-yate | vaniṣṭhaḥ ||7.18.1||

IAST: tve gāvaḥ sudughās tve hy aśvās tvaṁ vasu devayate vaniṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: With thee are milch-kine good to milk, and horses: best winner thou of riches for the pious.
Devanāgarī: त्वे गावः सुदुघास्त्वे ह्यश्वास्त्वं वसु देवयते वनिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | ha | yat | pitaraḥ | cit | naḥ | indra | viśvā | vāmā | jaritāraḥ | asanvan || tve iti | gāvaḥ | su-dughāḥ | tve iti | hi | aśvāḥ | tvam | vasu | deva-yate | vaniṣṭhaḥ ||7.18.1||

IAST: rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣy evāva dyubhir abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san
Griffith: For like a King among his wives thou dwellest: with glories, as a Sage, surround and help us.
Devanāgarī: राजेव हि जनिभिः क्षेष्येवाव द्युभिरभि विदुष्कविः सन्
pada pāṭha: rājā-iva | hi | jani-bhiḥ | kṣeṣi | eva | ava | dyu-bhiḥ | abhi | viduḥ | kaviḥ | san || piśā | giraḥ | magha-van | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | tvā-yataḥ | śiśīhi | rāye | asmān ||7.18.2||

IAST: piśā giro maghavan gobhir aśvais tvāyataḥ śiśīhi rāye asmān
Griffith: Make us, thy servants, strong for wealth, and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.
Devanāgarī: पिशा गिरो मघवन्गोभिरश्वैस्त्वायतः शिशीहि राये अस्मान्
pada pāṭha: rājā-iva | hi | jani-bhiḥ | kṣeṣi | eva | ava | dyu-bhiḥ | abhi | viduḥ | kaviḥ | san || piśā | giraḥ | magha-van | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | tvā-yataḥ | śiśīhi | rāye | asmān ||7.18.2||

IAST: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā giro devayantīr upa sthuḥ
Griffith: Here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ त्वा पस्पृधानासो अत्र मन्द्रा गिरो देवयन्तीरुप स्थुः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | paspr̥dhānāsaḥ | atra | mandrāḥ | giraḥ | deva-yantīḥ | upa | sthuḥ || arvācī | te | pathyā | rāyaḥ | etu | syāma | te | su-matau | indra | śarman ||7.18.3||

IAST: arvācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāv indra śarman
Griffith: Hitherward come thy path that leads to riches: may we find shelter in thy favour, Indra.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाची ते पथ्या राय एतु स्याम ते सुमताविन्द्र शर्मन्
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | paspr̥dhānāsaḥ | atra | mandrāḥ | giraḥ | deva-yantīḥ | upa | sthuḥ || arvācī | te | pathyā | rāyaḥ | etu | syāma | te | su-matau | indra | śarman ||7.18.3||

IAST: dhenuṁ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣann upa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Vasistha hath poured forth his prayers, desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture.
Devanāgarī: धेनुं न त्वा सूयवसे दुदुक्षन्नुप ब्रह्माणि ससृजे वसिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: dhenum | na | tvā | su-yavase | dudhukṣan | upa | brahmāṇi | sasr̥je | vasiṣṭhaḥ || tvām | it | me | go-patim | viśvaḥ | āha | ā | naḥ | indraḥ | su-matim | gantu | accha ||7.18.4||

IAST: tvām in me gopatiṁ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṁ gantv accha
Griffith: All these my people call thee Lord of cattle: may Indra. come unto the prayer we offer.
Devanāgarī: त्वामिन्मे गोपतिं विश्व आहा न इन्द्रः सुमतिं गन्त्वच्छ
pada pāṭha: dhenum | na | tvā | su-yavase | dudhukṣan | upa | brahmāṇi | sasr̥je | vasiṣṭhaḥ || tvām | it | me | go-patim | viśvaḥ | āha | ā | naḥ | indraḥ | su-matim | gantu | accha ||7.18.4||

IAST: arṇāṁsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro gādhāny akṛṇot supārā
Griffith: What though the floods spread widely, Indra made them shallow and easy for Sudas to traverse.
Devanāgarī: अर्णांसि चित्पप्रथाना सुदास इन्द्रो गाधान्यकृणोत्सुपारा
pada pāṭha: arṇāṁsi | cit | paprathānā | su-dāse | indraḥ | gādhāni | akr̥ṇot | su-pārā || śardhantam | śimyum | ucathasya | navyaḥ | śāpam | sindhūnām | akr̥ṇot | aśastīḥ ||7.18.5||

IAST: śardhantaṁ śimyum ucathasya navyaḥ śāpaṁ sindhūnām akṛṇod aśastīḥ
Griffith: He, worthy of our praises, caused the Simyu, foe of our hymn, to curse the rivers' fury.
Devanāgarī: शर्धन्तं शिम्युमुचथस्य नव्यः शापं सिन्धूनामकृणोदशस्तीः
pada pāṭha: arṇāṁsi | cit | paprathānā | su-dāse | indraḥ | gādhāni | akr̥ṇot | su-pārā || śardhantam | śimyum | ucathasya | navyaḥ | śāpam | sindhūnām | akr̥ṇot | aśastīḥ ||7.18.5||

IAST: puroḻā it turvaśo yakṣur āsīd rāye matsyāso niśitā apīva
Griffith: Eager for spoil was Turvasa Purodas, fain to win wealth, like fishes urged by hunger.
Devanāgarī: पुरोळा इत्तुर्वशो यक्षुरासीद्राये मत्स्यासो निशिता अपीव
pada pāṭha: puroḷāḥ | it | turvaśaḥ | yakṣuḥ | āsīt | rāye | matsyāsaḥ | ni-śitāḥ | api-iva || śruṣṭim | cakruḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | druhyavaḥ | ca | sakhā | sakhāyam | atarat | viṣūcoḥ ||7.18.6||

IAST: śruṣṭiṁ cakrur bhṛgavo druhyavaś ca sakhā sakhāyam atarad viṣūcoḥ
Griffith: The Bhrgus and the Druhyus quickly listened: friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्टिं चक्रुर्भृगवो द्रुह्यवश्च सखा सखायमतरद्विषूचोः
pada pāṭha: puroḷāḥ | it | turvaśaḥ | yakṣuḥ | āsīt | rāye | matsyāsaḥ | ni-śitāḥ | api-iva || śruṣṭim | cakruḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | druhyavaḥ | ca | sakhā | sakhāyam | atarat | viṣūcoḥ ||7.18.6||

IAST: ā pakthāso bhalānaso bhanantālināso viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ
Griffith: Together came the Pakthas, the Bhalanas, the Alinas, the Sivas, the Visanins.
Devanāgarī: आ पक्थासो भलानसो भनन्तालिनासो विषाणिनः शिवासः
pada pāṭha: ā | pakthāsaḥ | bhalānasaḥ | bhananta | ā | alināsaḥ | viṣāṇinaḥ | śivāsaḥ || ā | yaḥ | anayat | sadha-māḥ | āryasya | gavyā | tr̥tsu-bhyaḥ | ajagan | yudhā | nr̥̄n ||7.18.7||

IAST: ā yo 'nayat sadhamā āryasya gavyā tṛtsubhyo ajagan yudhā nṝn
Griffith: Yet to the Trtsus came the Arya's Comrade, through love of spoil and heroes' war, to lead them.
Devanāgarī: आ योऽनयत्सधमा आर्यस्य गव्या तृत्सुभ्यो अजगन्युधा नॄन्
pada pāṭha: ā | pakthāsaḥ | bhalānasaḥ | bhananta | ā | alināsaḥ | viṣāṇinaḥ | śivāsaḥ || ā | yaḥ | anayat | sadha-māḥ | āryasya | gavyā | tr̥tsu-bhyaḥ | ajagan | yudhā | nr̥̄n ||7.18.7||

IAST: durādhyo aditiṁ srevayanto 'cetaso vi jagṛbhre paruṣṇīm
Griffith: Fools, in their folly fain to waste her waters, they parted inexhaustible Parusni.
Devanāgarī: दुराध्यो अदितिं स्रेवयन्तोऽचेतसो वि जगृभ्रे परुष्णीम्
pada pāṭha: duḥ-ādhyaḥ | aditim | srevayantaḥ | acetasaḥ | vi | jagr̥bhre | parūṣṇīm || mahnā | avivyak | pr̥thivīm | patyamānaḥ | paśuḥ | kaviḥ | aśayat | cāyamānaḥ ||7.18.8||

IAST: mahnāvivyak pṛthivīm patyamānaḥ paśuṣ kavir aśayac cāyamānaḥ
Griffith: Lord of the Earth, he with his might repressed them: still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.
Devanāgarī: मह्नाविव्यक्पृथिवीं पत्यमानः पशुष्कविरशयच्चायमानः
pada pāṭha: duḥ-ādhyaḥ | aditim | srevayantaḥ | acetasaḥ | vi | jagr̥bhre | parūṣṇīm || mahnā | avivyak | pr̥thivīm | patyamānaḥ | paśuḥ | kaviḥ | aśayat | cāyamānaḥ ||7.18.8||

IAST: īyur arthaṁ na nyartham paruṣṇīm āśuś caned abhipitvaṁ jagāma
Griffith: As to their goal they sped to their destruetion: they sought Parusni; e'en the swift returned not.
Devanāgarī: ईयुरर्थं न न्यर्थं परुष्णीमाशुश्चनेदभिपित्वं जगाम
pada pāṭha: īyuḥ | artham | na | ni-artham | paruṣṇīm | āśuḥ | cana | it | ābhi-pitvam | jagāma || su-dāse | indraḥ | su-tukān | amitrān | arandhayat | mānuṣe | vadhri-vācaḥ ||7.18.9||

IAST: sudāsa indraḥ sutukām̐ amitrān arandhayan mānuṣe vadhrivācaḥ
Griffith: Indra abandoned, to Sudas the manly, the swiftly flying foes, unmanly babblers.
Devanāgarī: सुदास इन्द्रः सुतुकाँ अमित्रानरन्धयन्मानुषे वध्रिवाचः
pada pāṭha: īyuḥ | artham | na | ni-artham | paruṣṇīm | āśuḥ | cana | it | ābhi-pitvam | jagāma || su-dāse | indraḥ | su-tukān | amitrān | arandhayat | mānuṣe | vadhri-vācaḥ ||7.18.9||

IAST: īyur gāvo na yavasād agopā yathākṛtam abhi mitraṁ citāsaḥ
Griffith: They went like kine unherded from the pasture, each clinging to a friend as chance directed.
Devanāgarī: ईयुर्गावो न यवसादगोपा यथाकृतमभि मित्रं चितासः
pada pāṭha: īyuḥ | gāvaḥ | na | yavasāt | agopāḥ | yathā-kr̥tam | abhi | mitram | citāsaḥ || pr̥śni-gāvaḥ | pr̥śni-nipreṣitāsaḥ | śruṣṭim | cakruḥ | ni-yutaḥ | rantayaḥ | ca ||7.18.10||

IAST: pṛśnigāvaḥ pṛśninipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭiṁ cakrur niyuto rantayaś ca
Griffith: They who drive spotted steeds, sent down by Prsni, gave ear, the Warriors and the harnessed horses.
Devanāgarī: पृश्निगावः पृश्निनिप्रेषितासः श्रुष्टिं चक्रुर्नियुतो रन्तयश्च
pada pāṭha: īyuḥ | gāvaḥ | na | yavasāt | agopāḥ | yathā-kr̥tam | abhi | mitram | citāsaḥ || pr̥śni-gāvaḥ | pr̥śni-nipreṣitāsaḥ | śruṣṭim | cakruḥ | ni-yutaḥ | rantayaḥ | ca ||7.18.10||

IAST: ekaṁ ca yo viṁśatiṁ ca śravasyā vaikarṇayor janān rājā ny astaḥ
Griffith: The King who scattered one-and-twenty people of both Vaikarna tribes through lust of glory-
Devanāgarī: एकं च यो विंशतिं च श्रवस्या वैकर्णयोर्जनान्राजा न्यस्तः
pada pāṭha: ekam | ca | yaḥ | viṁśatim | ca | śravasyā | vaikarṇayoḥ | janān | rājā | ni | astarityastaḥ || dasmaḥ | na | sadman | ni | śiśāti | barhiḥ | śūraḥ | sargam | akr̥ṇot | indraḥ | eṣām ||7.18.11||

IAST: dasmo na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sargam akṛṇod indra eṣām
Griffith: As the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber, so hath the Hero Indra, wrought their downfall.
Devanāgarī: दस्मो न सद्मन्नि शिशाति बर्हिः शूरः सर्गमकृणोदिन्द्र एषाम्
pada pāṭha: ekam | ca | yaḥ | viṁśatim | ca | śravasyā | vaikarṇayoḥ | janān | rājā | ni | astarityastaḥ || dasmaḥ | na | sadman | ni | śiśāti | barhiḥ | śūraḥ | sargam | akr̥ṇot | indraḥ | eṣām ||7.18.11||

IAST: adha śrutaṁ kavaṣaṁ vṛddham apsv anu druhyuṁ ni vṛṇag vajrabāhuḥ
Griffith: Thou, thunder-armed, o'erwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient Kavasa and then the Druhyu.
Devanāgarī: अध श्रुतं कवषं वृद्धमप्स्वनु द्रुह्युं नि वृणग्वज्रबाहुः
pada pāṭha: adha | śrutam | kavaṣam | vr̥ddham | ap-su | anu | druhyum | ni | vr̥ṇak | vajra-bāhuḥ || vr̥ṇānāḥ | atra | sakhyāya | sakhyam | tvā-yantaḥ | ye | amadan | anu | tvā ||7.18.12||

IAST: vṛṇānā atra sakhyāya sakhyaṁ tvāyanto ye amadann anu tvā
Griffith: Others here claiming friendship to their friendship, devoted unto thee, in thee were joyful.
Devanāgarī: वृणाना अत्र सख्याय सख्यं त्वायन्तो ये अमदन्ननु त्वा
pada pāṭha: adha | śrutam | kavaṣam | vr̥ddham | ap-su | anu | druhyum | ni | vr̥ṇak | vajra-bāhuḥ || vr̥ṇānāḥ | atra | sakhyāya | sakhyam | tvā-yantaḥ | ye | amadan | anu | tvā ||7.18.12||

IAST: vi sadyo viśvā dṛṁhitāny eṣām indraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardaḥ
Griffith: Indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles.
Devanāgarī: वि सद्यो विश्वा दृंहितान्येषामिन्द्रः पुरः सहसा सप्त दर्दः
pada pāṭha: vi | sadyaḥ | viśvā | dr̥ṁhitāni | eṣām | indraḥ | puraḥ | sahasā | sapta | dardariti dardaḥ || vi | ānavasya | tr̥tsave | gayam | bhāk | jeṣma | pūrum | vidathe | mr̥dhra-vācam ||7.18.13||

IAST: vy ānavasya tṛtsave gayam bhāg jeṣma pūruṁ vidathe mṛdhravācam
Griffith: The goods of Anu's son he gave to Trtsu. May we in sacrifice conquer scorned Puru.
Devanāgarī: व्यानवस्य तृत्सवे गयं भाग्जेष्म पूरुं विदथे मृध्रवाचम्
pada pāṭha: vi | sadyaḥ | viśvā | dr̥ṁhitāni | eṣām | indraḥ | puraḥ | sahasā | sapta | dardariti dardaḥ || vi | ānavasya | tr̥tsave | gayam | bhāk | jeṣma | pūrum | vidathe | mr̥dhra-vācam ||7.18.13||

IAST: ni gavyavo 'navo druhyavaś ca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaṭ sahasrā
Griffith: The Anavas and Druhyus, seeking booty, have slept, the sixty hundred, yea, six thousand,
Devanāgarī: नि गव्यवोऽनवो द्रुह्यवश्च षष्टिः शता सुषुपुः षट् सहस्रा
pada pāṭha: ni | gavyavaḥ | anavaḥ | duhyavaḥ | ca | ṣaṣṭiḥ | śatā | susupuḥ | ṣaṭ | sahasrā || ṣaṣṭiḥ | vīrāsaḥ | adhi | ṣaṭ | duvaḥ-yu | viśvā | it | indrasya | vīryā | kr̥tāni ||7.18.14||

IAST: ṣaṣṭir vīrāso adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśved indrasya vīryā kṛtāni
Griffith: And six-and-sixty heroes. For the pious were all these mighty exploits done by Indra.
Devanāgarī: षष्टिर्वीरासो अधि षड्दुवोयु विश्वेदिन्द्रस्य वीर्या कृतानि
pada pāṭha: ni | gavyavaḥ | anavaḥ | duhyavaḥ | ca | ṣaṣṭiḥ | śatā | susupuḥ | ṣaṭ | sahasrā || ṣaṣṭiḥ | vīrāsaḥ | adhi | ṣaṭ | duvaḥ-yu | viśvā | it | indrasya | vīryā | kr̥tāni ||7.18.14||

IAST: indreṇaite tṛtsavo veviṣāṇā āpo na sṛṣṭā adhavanta nīcīḥ
Griffith: These Trtsus under Indra's careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रेणैते तृत्सवो वेविषाणा आपो न सृष्टा अधवन्त नीचीः
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | ete | tr̥tsavaḥ | veviṣāṇāḥ | āpaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭāḥ | adhavanta | nīcīḥ || duḥ-mitrāsaḥ | prakala-vit | mimānāḥ | jahuḥ | viśvāni | bhojanā | su-dāse ||7.18.15||

IAST: durmitrāsaḥ prakalavin mimānā jahur viśvāni bhojanā sudāse
Griffith: The foemen, measuring exceeding closely, abandoned to Sudas all their provisions.
Devanāgarī: दुर्मित्रासः प्रकलविन्मिमाना जहुर्विश्वानि भोजना सुदासे
pada pāṭha: indreṇa | ete | tr̥tsavaḥ | veviṣāṇāḥ | āpaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭāḥ | adhavanta | nīcīḥ || duḥ-mitrāsaḥ | prakala-vit | mimānāḥ | jahuḥ | viśvāni | bhojanā | su-dāse ||7.18.15||

IAST: ardhaṁ vīrasya śṛtapām anindram parā śardhantaṁ nunude abhi kṣām
Griffith: The hero's side who drank the dressed oblation, Indra's denier, far o'er earth he scattered.
Devanāgarī: अर्धं वीरस्य शृतपामनिन्द्रं परा शर्धन्तं नुनुदे अभि क्षाम्
pada pāṭha: ardham | vīrasya | śr̥ta-pām | anindram | parā | śardhantam | nunude | abhi | kṣām || indraḥ | manyum | manyu-myaḥ | mimāya | bheje | pathaḥ | vartanim | patyamānaḥ ||7.18.16||

IAST: indro manyum manyumyo mimāya bheje patho vartanim patyamānaḥ
Griffith: Indra brought down the fierce destroyer's fury. He gave them various roads, the path's Controller.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो मन्युं मन्युम्यो मिमाय भेजे पथो वर्तनिं पत्यमानः
pada pāṭha: ardham | vīrasya | śr̥ta-pām | anindram | parā | śardhantam | nunude | abhi | kṣām || indraḥ | manyum | manyu-myaḥ | mimāya | bheje | pathaḥ | vartanim | patyamānaḥ ||7.18.16||

IAST: ādhreṇa cit tad v ekaṁ cakāra siṁhyaṁ cit petvenā jaghāna
Griffith: E'en with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit: e'en with a goat he did to death a lion.
Devanāgarī: आध्रेण चित्तद्वेकं चकार सिंह्यं चित्पेत्वेना जघान
pada pāṭha: ādhreṇa | cit | tat | ūm̐ iti | ekam | cakāra | siṁhyam | cit | petvena | jaghāna || ava | sraktīḥ | veśyā | avr̥ścat | indraḥ | pra | ayacchat | viśvā | bhojanā | su-dāse ||7.18.17||

IAST: ava sraktīr veśyāvṛścad indraḥ prāyacchad viśvā bhojanā sudāse
Griffith: He pared the pillar's angles with a needle. Thus to Sudas Indra gave all provisions.
Devanāgarī: अव स्रक्तीर्वेश्यावृश्चदिन्द्रः प्रायच्छद्विश्वा भोजना सुदासे
pada pāṭha: ādhreṇa | cit | tat | ūm̐ iti | ekam | cakāra | siṁhyam | cit | petvena | jaghāna || ava | sraktīḥ | veśyā | avr̥ścat | indraḥ | pra | ayacchat | viśvā | bhojanā | su-dāse ||7.18.17||

IAST: śaśvanto hi śatravo rāradhuṣ ṭe bhedasya cic chardhato vinda randhim
Griffith: To thee have all thine enemies submitted: e'en the fierce Bheda hast thou made thy subject.
Devanāgarī: शश्वन्तो हि शत्रवो रारधुष्टे भेदस्य चिच्छर्धतो विन्द रन्धिम्
pada pāṭha: śaśvantaḥ | hi | śatravaḥ | raradhuḥ | te | bhedasya | cit | śardhataḥ | vinda | randhim || martān | enaḥ | stuvataḥ | yaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | tigmam | tasmin | ni | jahi | vajram | indra ||7.18.18||

IAST: martām̐ enaḥ stuvato yaḥ kṛṇoti tigmaṁ tasmin ni jahi vajram indra
Griffith: Cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt, O Indra, on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.
Devanāgarī: मर्ताँ एनः स्तुवतो यः कृणोति तिग्मं तस्मिन्नि जहि वज्रमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: śaśvantaḥ | hi | śatravaḥ | raradhuḥ | te | bhedasya | cit | śardhataḥ | vinda | randhim || martān | enaḥ | stuvataḥ | yaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | tigmam | tasmin | ni | jahi | vajram | indra ||7.18.18||

IAST: āvad indraṁ yamunā tṛtsavaś ca prātra bhedaṁ sarvatātā muṣāyat
Griffith: Yamuna and the Trtsus aided Indra. There he stripped Bheda bare of all his treasures.
Devanāgarī: आवदिन्द्रं यमुना तृत्सवश्च प्रात्र भेदं सर्वताता मुषायत्
pada pāṭha: āvat | indram | yamunā | tr̥tsavaḥ | ca | pra | atra | bhedam | sarva-tātā | muṣāyat || ajāsaḥ | ca | śigravaḥ | yakṣavaḥ | ca | balim | śīrṣāṇi | jabhruḥ | aśvyāni ||7.18.19||

IAST: ajāsaś ca śigravo yakṣavaś ca baliṁ śīrṣāṇi jabhrur aśvyāni
Griffith: The Ajas and the Sigrus and the Yaksus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.
Devanāgarī: अजासश्च शिग्रवो यक्षवश्च बलिं शीर्षाणि जभ्रुरश्व्यानि
pada pāṭha: āvat | indram | yamunā | tr̥tsavaḥ | ca | pra | atra | bhedam | sarva-tātā | muṣāyat || ajāsaḥ | ca | śigravaḥ | yakṣavaḥ | ca | balim | śīrṣāṇi | jabhruḥ | aśvyāni ||7.18.19||

IAST: na ta indra sumatayo na rāyaḥ saṁcakṣe pūrvā uṣaso na nūtnāḥ
Griffith: Not to be scorned, but like Dawns past and recent, O Indra, are thy favours and thy riches.
Devanāgarī: न त इन्द्र सुमतयो न रायः संचक्षे पूर्वा उषसो न नूत्नाः
pada pāṭha: na | te | indra | su-matayaḥ | na | rāyaḥ | sam-cakṣe | pūrvāḥ | uṣasaḥ | na | nūtnāḥ || devakam | cit | mānyamānam | jaghantha | ava | tmanā | br̥hataḥ | śambaram | bhet ||7.18.20||

IAST: devakaṁ cin mānyamānaṁ jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaram bhet
Griffith: Devaka, Manyamana's son, thou slewest, and smotest Sambara from the lofty mountain.
Devanāgarī: देवकं चिन्मान्यमानं जघन्थाव त्मना बृहतः शम्बरं भेत्
pada pāṭha: na | te | indra | su-matayaḥ | na | rāyaḥ | sam-cakṣe | pūrvāḥ | uṣasaḥ | na | nūtnāḥ || devakam | cit | mānyamānam | jaghantha | ava | tmanā | br̥hataḥ | śambaram | bhet ||7.18.20||

IAST: pra ye gṛhād amamadus tvāyā parāśaraḥ śatayātur vasiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: They who, from home, have gladdened thee, thy servants Parasara, Vasistha, Satayatu,
Devanāgarī: प्र ये गृहादममदुस्त्वाया पराशरः शतयातुर्वसिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | gr̥hāt | amamaduḥ | tvā-yā | parā-śaraḥ | śata-yātuḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ || na | te | bhojasya | sakhyam | mr̥ṣanta | adha | sūri-bhyaḥ | su-dinā | vi | ucchān ||7.18.21||

IAST: na te bhojasya sakhyam mṛṣantādhā sūribhyaḥ sudinā vy ucchān
Griffith: Will not forget thy friendship, liberal Giver. So shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.
Devanāgarī: न ते भोजस्य सख्यं मृषन्ताधा सूरिभ्यः सुदिना व्युच्छान्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | gr̥hāt | amamaduḥ | tvā-yā | parā-śaraḥ | śata-yātuḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ || na | te | bhojasya | sakhyam | mr̥ṣanta | adha | sūri-bhyaḥ | su-dinā | vi | ucchān ||7.18.21||

IAST: dve naptur devavataḥ śate gor dvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ
Griffith: Priest-like, with praise, I move around the altar, earning Paijavana's reward, O Agni,
Devanāgarī: द्वे नप्तुर्देववतः शते गोर्द्वा रथा वधूमन्ता सुदासः
pada pāṭha: dve iti | naptuḥ | deva-vataḥ | śate iti | goḥ | dvā | rathā | vadhū-mantā | su-dāsaḥ || arhan | agne | paija-vanasya | dānam | hotā-iva | sadma | pari | emi | rebhan ||7.18.22||

IAST: arhann agne paijavanasya dānaṁ hoteva sadma pary emi rebhan
Griffith: Two hundred cows from Devavan's descendant, two chariots from Sudas with mares to draw them.
Devanāgarī: अर्हन्नग्ने पैजवनस्य दानं होतेव सद्म पर्येमि रेभन्
pada pāṭha: dve iti | naptuḥ | deva-vataḥ | śate iti | goḥ | dvā | rathā | vadhū-mantā | su-dāsaḥ || arhan | agne | paija-vanasya | dānam | hotā-iva | sadma | pari | emi | rebhan ||7.18.22||

IAST: catvāro mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smaddiṣṭayaḥ kṛśanino nireke
Griffith: Gift of Paijavana, four horses bear me in foremost place, trained steeds with pearl to deck them.
Devanāgarī: चत्वारो मा पैजवनस्य दानाः स्मद्दिष्टयः कृशनिनो निरेके
pada pāṭha: catvāraḥ | mā | paija-vanasya | dānāḥ | smat-diṣṭayaḥ | kr̥śaninaḥ | nireke || r̥jrāsaḥ | mā | pr̥thivi-sthāḥ | su-dāsaḥ | tokam | tokāya | śravase | vahanti ||7.18.23||

IAST: ṛjrāso mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsas tokaṁ tokāya śravase vahanti
Griffith: Sudas's brown steeds, firmly-stepping, carry me and my son for progeny and glory.
Devanāgarī: ऋज्रासो मा पृथिविष्ठाः सुदासस्तोकं तोकाय श्रवसे वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: catvāraḥ | mā | paija-vanasya | dānāḥ | smat-diṣṭayaḥ | kr̥śaninaḥ | nireke || r̥jrāsaḥ | mā | pr̥thivi-sthāḥ | su-dāsaḥ | tokam | tokāya | śravase | vahanti ||7.18.23||

IAST: yasya śravo rodasī antar urvī śīrṣṇe-śīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā
Griffith: Him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven, who, as dispenser, gives each chief his portion,
Devanāgarī: यस्य श्रवो रोदसी अन्तरुर्वी शीर्ष्णेशीर्ष्णे विबभाजा विभक्ता
pada pāṭha: yasya | śravaḥ | rodasī iti | antaḥ | urvī iti | śīrṣṇe-śīrṣṇe | vi-babhāja | vi-bhaktā || sapta | it | indram | na | sravataḥ | gr̥ṇanti | ni | yudhyāmadhim | āśiśāt | abhīke ||7.18.24||

IAST: sapted indraṁ na sravato gṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhim aśiśād abhīke
Griffith: Seven flowing Rivers glorify like Indra. He slew Yudhyamadhi in close encounter.
Devanāgarī: सप्तेदिन्द्रं न स्रवतो गृणन्ति नि युध्यामधिमशिशादभीके
pada pāṭha: yasya | śravaḥ | rodasī iti | antaḥ | urvī iti | śīrṣṇe-śīrṣṇe | vi-babhāja | vi-bhaktā || sapta | it | indram | na | sravataḥ | gr̥ṇanti | ni | yudhyāmadhim | āśiśāt | abhīke ||7.18.24||

IAST: imaṁ naro marutaḥ saścatānu divodāsaṁ na pitaraṁ sudāsaḥ
Griffith: Attend on him O ye heroic Maruts as on Sudas's father Divodasa.
Devanāgarī: इमं नरो मरुतः सश्चतानु दिवोदासं न पितरं सुदासः
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saścata | anu | divaḥ-dāsam | na | pitaram | su-dāsaḥ || aviṣṭana | paija-vanasya | ketam | duḥ-naśam | kṣatram | ajaram | duvaḥ-yu ||7.18.25||

IAST: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketaṁ dūṇāśaṁ kṣatram ajaraṁ duvoyu
Griffith: Further Paijavana's desire with favour. Guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टना पैजवनस्य केतं दूणाशं क्षत्रमजरं दुवोयु
pada pāṭha: imam | naraḥ | marutaḥ | saścata | anu | divaḥ-dāsam | na | pitaram | su-dāsaḥ || aviṣṭana | paija-vanasya | ketam | duḥ-naśam | kṣatram | ajaram | duvaḥ-yu ||7.18.25||

IAST: yas tigmaśṛṅgo vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīś cyāvayati pra viśvāḥ
Griffith: HE like a bull with sharpened horns, terrific, singly excites and agitates all the people:
Devanāgarī: यस्तिग्मशृङ्गो वृषभो न भीम एकः कृष्टीश्च्यावयति प्र विश्वाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | cyavayati | pra | viśvāḥ || yaḥ | śaśvataḥ | adāśuṣaḥ | gayasya | pra-yantā | asi | susvi-tarāya | vedaḥ ||7.19.1||

IAST: yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo gayasya prayantāsi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ
Griffith: Thou givest him who largely pours libations his goods who pours not, for his own possession.
Devanāgarī: यः शश्वतो अदाशुषो गयस्य प्रयन्तासि सुष्वितराय वेदः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | cyavayati | pra | viśvāḥ || yaḥ | śaśvataḥ | adāśuṣaḥ | gayasya | pra-yantā | asi | susvi-tarāya | vedaḥ ||7.19.1||

IAST: tvaṁ ha tyad indra kutsam āvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye
Griffith: Thou, verily, Indra, gavest help to Kutsa, willingly giving car to him in battle,
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह त्यदिन्द्र कुत्समावः शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | indra | kutsam | āvaḥ | śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ | tanvā | sa-marye || dāsam | yat | śuṣṇam | kuyavam | ni | asmai | arandhayaḥ | ārjuneyāya | śikṣan ||7.19.2||

IAST: dāsaṁ yac chuṣṇaṁ kuyavaṁ ny asmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan
Griffith: When, aiding Arjuneya, thou subduedst to him both Kuyava and the Dasa Susna.
Devanāgarī: दासं यच्छुष्णं कुयवं न्यस्मा अरन्धय आर्जुनेयाय शिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | tyat | indra | kutsam | āvaḥ | śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ | tanvā | sa-marye || dāsam | yat | śuṣṇam | kuyavam | ni | asmai | arandhayaḥ | ārjuneyāya | śikṣan ||7.19.2||

IAST: tvaṁ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam prāvo viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ sudāsam
Griffith: O Bold One, thou with all thine aids hast boldly holpen Sudas whose offerings were accepted,
Devanāgarī: त्वं धृष्णो धृषता वीतहव्यं प्रावो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सुदासम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dhr̥ṣatā | vīta-havyam | pra | āvaḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | su-dāsam || pra | pauru-kutsim | trasadasyum | āvaḥ | kṣetra-sātā | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | pūrum ||7.19.3||

IAST: pra paurukutsiṁ trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum
Griffith: Puru in winning land and slaying foemen, and Trasadasyu son of Purukutsa.
Devanāgarī: प्र पौरुकुत्सिं त्रसदस्युमावः क्षेत्रसाता वृत्रहत्येषु पूरुम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dhr̥ṣatā | vīta-havyam | pra | āvaḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | su-dāsam || pra | pauru-kutsim | trasadasyum | āvaḥ | kṣetra-sātā | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | pūrum ||7.19.3||

IAST: tvaṁ nṛbhir nṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṁsi
Griffith: At the Gods' banquet, hero-souled! with Heroes, Lord of Bay Steeds, thou slewest many foemen.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नृभिर्नृमणो देववीतौ भूरीणि वृत्रा हर्यश्व हंसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-manaḥ | deva-vītau | bhūrīṇi | vr̥trā | hari-aśva | haṁsi || tvam | ni | dasyum | cumurim | dhunim | ca | asvāpayaḥ | dabhītaye | su-hantu ||7.19.4||

IAST: tvaṁ ni dasyuṁ cumuriṁ dhuniṁ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu
Griffith: Thou sentest in swift death to sleep the Dasyu, both Cumuri and Dhuni, for Dabhiti.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नि दस्युं चुमुरिं धुनिं चास्वापयो दभीतये सुहन्तु
pada pāṭha: tvam | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-manaḥ | deva-vītau | bhūrīṇi | vr̥trā | hari-aśva | haṁsi || tvam | ni | dasyum | cumurim | dhunim | ca | asvāpayaḥ | dabhītaye | su-hantu ||7.19.4||

IAST: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṁ ca sadyaḥ
Griffith: These were thy mighty powers that, Thunder-wielder, thou swiftly crushedst nine-and-ninety castles:
Devanāgarī: तव च्यौत्नानि वज्रहस्त तानि नव यत्पुरो नवतिं च सद्यः
pada pāṭha: tava | cyautnāni | vajra-hasta | tāni | nava | yat | puraḥ | navatim | ca | sadyaḥ || ni-veśane | śata-tamā | aviveṣīḥ | ahan | ca | vr̥tram | namucim | uta | ahan ||7.19.5||

IAST: niveśane śatatamāviveṣīr ahañ ca vṛtraṁ namucim utāhan
Griffith: Thou capturedst the hundredth in thine onslaught; thou slewest Namuci, thou slewest Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: निवेशने शततमाविवेषीरहञ्च वृत्रं नमुचिमुताहन्
pada pāṭha: tava | cyautnāni | vajra-hasta | tāni | nava | yat | puraḥ | navatim | ca | sadyaḥ || ni-veśane | śata-tamā | aviveṣīḥ | ahan | ca | vr̥tram | namucim | uta | ahan ||7.19.5||

IAST: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse
Griffith: Old are the blessings, Indra, which thou gavest Sudas the worshipper who brought oblations.
Devanāgarī: सना ता त इन्द्र भोजनानि रातहव्याय दाशुषे सुदासे
pada pāṭha: sanā | tā | te | indra | bhojanāni | rāta-havyāya | dāśuṣe | su-dāse || vr̥ṣṇe | te | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | yunajmi | vyantu | brahmāṇi | puru-śāka | vājam ||7.19.6||

IAST: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
Griffith: For thee, the Strong, I yoke thy strong Bay Horses: may our prayers reach thee and win strength, Most Mi
Devanāgarī: वृष्णे ते हरी वृषणा युनज्मि व्यन्तु ब्रह्माणि पुरुशाक वाजम्
pada pāṭha: sanā | tā | te | indra | bhojanāni | rāta-havyāya | dāśuṣe | su-dāse || vr̥ṣṇe | te | harī iti | vr̥ṣaṇā | yunajmi | vyantu | brahmāṇi | puru-śāka | vājam ||7.19.6||

IAST: mā te asyāṁ sahasāvan pariṣṭāv aghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai
Griffith: Give us not up, Lord of Bay Horses, Victor, in this thine own assembly, to the wicked.
Devanāgarī: मा ते अस्यां सहसावन्परिष्टावघाय भूम हरिवः परादै
pada pāṭha: mā | te | asyām | sahasā-van | pariṣṭau | aghāya | bhūma | hari-vaḥ | parā-dai || trāyasva | naḥ | avr̥kebhiḥ | varūthaiḥ | tava | priyāsaḥ | sūriṣu | syāma ||7.19.7||

IAST: trāyasva no 'vṛkebhir varūthais tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
Griffith: Deliver us with true and faithful succours: dear may we be to thee among the princes.
Devanāgarī: त्रायस्व नोऽवृकेभिर्वरूथैस्तव प्रियासः सूरिषु स्याम
pada pāṭha: mā | te | asyām | sahasā-van | pariṣṭau | aghāya | bhūma | hari-vaḥ | parā-dai || trāyasva | naḥ | avr̥kebhiḥ | varūthaiḥ | tava | priyāsaḥ | sūriṣu | syāma ||7.19.7||

IAST: priyāsa it te maghavann abhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: May we men, Maghavan, the friends thou lovest, near thee be joyful under thy protection.
Devanāgarī: प्रियास इत्ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरो मदेम शरणे सखायः
pada pāṭha: priyāsaḥ | it | te | magha-van | abhiṣṭau | naraḥ | madema | śaraṇe | sakhāyaḥ || ni | turvaśam | ni | yādvam | śiśīhi | atithi-gvāya | śaṁsyam | kariṣyan ||7.19.8||

IAST: ni turvaśaṁ ni yādvaṁ śiśīhy atithigvāya śaṁsyaṁ kariṣyan
Griffith: Fain to fulfil the wish of Atithigva humble. the pride of Turvasa and Yadva.
Devanāgarī: नि तुर्वशं नि याद्वं शिशीह्यतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन्
pada pāṭha: priyāsaḥ | it | te | magha-van | abhiṣṭau | naraḥ | madema | śaraṇe | sakhāyaḥ || ni | turvaśam | ni | yādvam | śiśīhi | atithi-gvāya | śaṁsyam | kariṣyan ||7.19.8||

IAST: sadyaś cin nu te maghavann abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṁsanty ukthaśāsa ukthā
Griffith: Swiftly, in truth, O Maghavan, about thee men skilled in hymning sing their songs and praises. '
Devanāgarī: सद्यश्चिन्नु ते मघवन्नभिष्टौ नरः शंसन्त्युक्थशास उक्था
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | cit | nu | te | magha-van | abhiṣṭau | naraḥ | śaṁsanti | uktha-śasaḥ | ukthā || ye | te | havebhiḥ | vi | paṇīn | adāśan | asmān | vr̥ṇīṣva | yujyāya | tasmai ||7.19.9||

IAST: ye te havebhir vi paṇīm̐r adāśann asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai
Griffith: Elect us also into their assembly who by their calls on thee despoiled the niggards.
Devanāgarī: ये ते हवेभिर्वि पणीँरदाशन्नस्मान्वृणीष्व युज्याय तस्मै
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | cit | nu | te | magha-van | abhiṣṭau | naraḥ | śaṁsanti | uktha-śasaḥ | ukthā || ye | te | havebhiḥ | vi | paṇīn | adāśan | asmān | vr̥ṇīṣva | yujyāya | tasmai ||7.19.9||

IAST: ete stomā narāṁ nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañco dadato maghāni
Griffith: Thine are these lauds, O manliest of heroes, lauds which revert to us and give us riches.
Devanāgarī: एते स्तोमा नरां नृतम तुभ्यमस्मद्र्यञ्चो ददतो मघानि
pada pāṭha: ete | stomāḥ | narām | nr̥-tama | tubhyam | asmadryañcaḥ | dadataḥ | maghāni || teṣām | indra | vr̥tra-hatye | śivaḥ | bhūḥ | sakhā | ca | śūraḥ | avitā | ca | nr̥ṇām ||7.19.10||

IAST: teṣām indra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro 'vitā ca nṛṇām
Griffith: Favour these, Indra, when they fight with faemen, as Friend and Hero and the heroes' Helper.
Devanāgarī: तेषामिन्द्र वृत्रहत्ये शिवो भूः सखा च शूरोऽविता च नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: ete | stomāḥ | narām | nr̥-tama | tubhyam | asmadryañcaḥ | dadataḥ | maghāni || teṣām | indra | vr̥tra-hatye | śivaḥ | bhūḥ | sakhā | ca | śūraḥ | avitā | ca | nr̥ṇām ||7.19.10||

IAST: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhasva
Griffith: Now, lauded for thine aid, Heroic Indra, sped by our prayer, wax mighty in thy body.
Devanāgarī: नू इन्द्र शूर स्तवमान ऊती ब्रह्मजूतस्तन्वा वावृधस्व
pada pāṭha: nu | indra | śūra | stavamānaḥ | ūtī | brahma-jūtaḥ | tanvā | vavr̥dhasva || upa | naḥ | vājān | mimīhi | upa | stīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.19.11||

IAST: upa no vājān mimīhy upa stīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Apportion to us strength and habitations. Ye Gods, protect us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: उप नो वाजान्मिमीह्युप स्तीन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | indra | śūra | stavamānaḥ | ūtī | brahma-jūtaḥ | tanvā | vavr̥dhasva || upa | naḥ | vājān | mimīhi | upa | stīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.19.11||

IAST: ugro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñ cakrir apo naryo yat kariṣyan
Griffith: STRONG, Godly-natured, born for hero exploit, man's Friend, hedoth whatever deed he willeth.
Devanāgarī: उग्रो जज्ञे वीर्याय स्वधावाञ्चक्रिरपो नर्यो यत्करिष्यन्
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | jajñe | vīryāya | svadhā-vān | cakriḥ | apaḥ | naryaḥ | yat | kariṣyan || jagmiḥ | yuvā | nr̥-sadanam | avaḥ-bhiḥ | trātā | naḥ | indraḥ | enasaḥ | mahaḥ | cit ||7.20.1||

IAST: jagmir yuvā nṛṣadanam avobhis trātā na indra enaso mahaś cit
Griffith: Saving us e'en from great transgression, Indra, the Youthful, visiteth man's home with favour.
Devanāgarī: जग्मिर्युवा नृषदनमवोभिस्त्राता न इन्द्र एनसो महश्चित्
pada pāṭha: ugraḥ | jajñe | vīryāya | svadhā-vān | cakriḥ | apaḥ | naryaḥ | yat | kariṣyan || jagmiḥ | yuvā | nr̥-sadanam | avaḥ-bhiḥ | trātā | naḥ | indraḥ | enasaḥ | mahaḥ | cit ||7.20.1||

IAST: hantā vṛtram indraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāram ūtī
Griffith: Waxing greatness Indra slayeth Vrtra: the Hero with his aid hath helped the singer.
Devanāgarī: हन्ता वृत्रमिन्द्रः शूशुवानः प्रावीन्नु वीरो जरितारमूती
pada pāṭha: hantā | vr̥tram | indraḥ | śūśuvānaḥ | pra | āvīt | nu | vīraḥ | jaritāram | ūtī || kartā | su-dāse | aha | vai | ūm̐ iti | lokam | dātā | vasu | muhuḥ | ā | dāśuṣe | bhūt ||7.20.2||

IAST: kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṁ dātā vasu muhur ā dāśuṣe bhūt
Griffith: He gave Sudas wide room and space, and often hath granted wealth to him who brought oblations.
Devanāgarī: कर्ता सुदासे अह वा उ लोकं दाता वसु मुहुरा दाशुषे भूत्
pada pāṭha: hantā | vr̥tram | indraḥ | śūśuvānaḥ | pra | āvīt | nu | vīraḥ | jaritāram | ūtī || kartā | su-dāse | aha | vai | ūm̐ iti | lokam | dātā | vasu | muhuḥ | ā | dāśuṣe | bhūt ||7.20.2||

IAST: yudhmo anarvā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣem aṣāḻhaḥ
Griffith: Soldier unchecked, war-rousing, battling Hero, unconquered from of old, victorious ever,
Devanāgarī: युध्मो अनर्वा खजकृत्समद्वा शूरः सत्राषाड्जनुषेमषाळ्हः
pada pāṭha: yudhmaḥ | anarvā | khaja-kr̥t | samat-vā | śūraḥ | satrāṣāṭ | januṣā | īm | aṣāḷhaḥ || vi | āse | indraḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | su-ojāḥ | adha | viśvam | śatru-yantam | jaghāna ||7.20.3||

IAST: vy āsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṁ śatrūyantaṁ jaghāna
Griffith: Indra the very strong hath scattered armies; yea, he hath slain each foe who fought against him.
Devanāgarī: व्यास इन्द्रः पृतनाः स्वोजा अधा विश्वं शत्रूयन्तं जघान
pada pāṭha: yudhmaḥ | anarvā | khaja-kr̥t | samat-vā | śūraḥ | satrāṣāṭ | januṣā | īm | aṣāḷhaḥ || vi | āse | indraḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | su-ojāḥ | adha | viśvam | śatru-yantam | jaghāna ||7.20.3||

IAST: ubhe cid indra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhis tuviṣmaḥ
Griffith: Thou with thy greatness hast filled full, O Indra, even both the worlds with might, O thou Most Mighty.
Devanāgarī: उभे चिदिन्द्र रोदसी महित्वा पप्राथ तविषीभिस्तुविष्मः
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | cit | indra | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | ā | paprātha | taviṣībhiḥ | tuviṣmaḥ || ni | vajram | indraḥ | hari-vān | mimikṣan | sam | andhasā | madeṣu | vai | uvoca ||7.20.4||

IAST: ni vajram indro harivān mimikṣan sam andhasā madeṣu vā uvoca
Griffith: Lord of Bays, Indra, brandishing his thunder, is gratified with Soma at the banquet.
Devanāgarī: नि वज्रमिन्द्रो हरिवान्मिमिक्षन्समन्धसा मदेषु वा उवोच
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | cit | indra | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | ā | paprātha | taviṣībhiḥ | tuviṣmaḥ || ni | vajram | indraḥ | hari-vān | mimikṣan | sam | andhasā | madeṣu | vai | uvoca ||7.20.4||

IAST: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṁ raṇāya tam u cin nārī naryaṁ sasūva
Griffith: A Bull begat the Bull for joy of battle, and a strong Mother brought forth him the manly.
Devanāgarī: वृषा जजान वृषणं रणाय तमु चिन्नारी नर्यं ससूव
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | jajāna | vr̥ṣaṇam | raṇāya | tam | ūm̐ iti | cit | nārī | naryam | sasūva || pra | yaḥ | senā-nīḥ | adha | nr̥-bhyaḥ | asti | inaḥ | satvā | go-eṣaṇaḥ | saḥ | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ ||7.20.5||

IAST: pra yaḥ senānīr adha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā gaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ
Griffith: He who is Chief of men, their armies' Leader, is strong Hero, bold, and fain for booty.
Devanāgarī: प्र यः सेनानीरध नृभ्यो अस्तीनः सत्वा गवेषणः स धृष्णुः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | jajāna | vr̥ṣaṇam | raṇāya | tam | ūm̐ iti | cit | nārī | naryam | sasūva || pra | yaḥ | senā-nīḥ | adha | nr̥-bhyaḥ | asti | inaḥ | satvā | go-eṣaṇaḥ | saḥ | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ ||7.20.5||

IAST: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoram āvivāsāt
Griffith: The people falter not, nor suffer sorrow, who win themselves this God's terrific spirit.
Devanāgarī: नू चित्स भ्रेषते जनो न रेषन्मनो यो अस्य घोरमाविवासात्
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | saḥ | bhreṣate | janaḥ | na | reṣat | manaḥ | yaḥ | asya | ghoram | ā-vivāsāt || yajñaiḥ | yaḥ | indre | dadhate | duvāṁsi | kṣayat | saḥ | rāye | r̥ta-pāḥ | r̥te-jāḥ ||7.20.6||

IAST: yajñair ya indre dadhate duvāṁsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ
Griffith: He who with sacrifices worships Indra is lord of wealth, law-born and law's protector.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञैर्य इन्द्रे दधते दुवांसि क्षयत्स राय ऋतपा ऋतेजाः
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | saḥ | bhreṣate | janaḥ | na | reṣat | manaḥ | yaḥ | asya | ghoram | ā-vivāsāt || yajñaiḥ | yaḥ | indre | dadhate | duvāṁsi | kṣayat | saḥ | rāye | r̥ta-pāḥ | r̥te-jāḥ ||7.20.6||

IAST: yad indra pūrvo aparāya śikṣann ayaj jyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam
Griffith: Whene'er the elder fain would help the younger the greater cometh to the lesser's present.
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र पूर्वो अपराय शिक्षन्नयज्ज्यायान्कनीयसो देष्णम्
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | pūrvaḥ | aparāya | śikṣan | ayat | jyāyān | kanīyasaḥ | deṣṇam || amr̥taḥ | it | pari | āsīta | dūram | ā | citra | citryam | bhara | rayim | naḥ ||7.20.7||

IAST: amṛta it pary āsīta dūram ā citra citryam bharā rayiṁ naḥ
Griffith: Shall the Immortal sit aloof' inactive? O Wondrous Indra, bring us wondrous riches.
Devanāgarī: अमृत इत्पर्यासीत दूरमा चित्र चित्र्यं भरा रयिं नः
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | pūrvaḥ | aparāya | śikṣan | ayat | jyāyān | kanīyasaḥ | deṣṇam || amr̥taḥ | it | pari | āsīta | dūram | ā | citra | citryam | bhara | rayim | naḥ ||7.20.7||

IAST: yas ta indra priyo jano dadāśad asan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te
Griffith: Thy dear folk, Indra, who present oblations, are, in chief place, thy friends, O Thunder-wielder.
Devanāgarī: यस्त इन्द्र प्रियो जनो ददाशदसन्निरेके अद्रिवः सखा ते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | indra | priyaḥ | janaḥ | dadāśat | asat | nireke | adri-vaḥ | sakhā | te || vayam | te | asyām | su-matau | caniṣṭhāḥ | syāma | varūthe | aghnataḥ | nr̥-pītau ||7.20.8||

IAST: vayaṁ te asyāṁ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau
Griffith: May we be best content in this thy favour, sheltered by One who slays not, but preserves us.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अस्यां सुमतौ चनिष्ठाः स्याम वरूथे अघ्नतो नृपीतौ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | indra | priyaḥ | janaḥ | dadāśat | asat | nireke | adri-vaḥ | sakhā | te || vayam | te | asyām | su-matau | caniṣṭhāḥ | syāma | varūthe | aghnataḥ | nr̥-pītau ||7.20.8||

IAST: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmur maghavann akrapiṣṭa
Griffith: To thee the mighty hymn hath clamoured loudly, and, Maghavan, the eloquent hath besought thee.
Devanāgarī: एष स्तोमो अचिक्रदद्वृषा त उत स्तामुर्मघवन्नक्रपिष्ट
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | acikradat | vr̥ṣā | te | uta | stāmuḥ | magha-van | akrapiṣṭa || rāyaḥ | kāmaḥ | jaritāram | te | ā | agan | tvam | aṅga | śakra | vasvaḥ | ā | śakaḥ | naḥ ||7.20.9||

IAST: rāyas kāmo jaritāraṁ ta āgan tvam aṅga śakra vasva ā śako naḥ
Griffith: Desire of wealth hath come upon thy singer: help us then, gakra, to our share of riches.
Devanāgarī: रायस्कामो जरितारं त आगन्त्वमङ्ग शक्र वस्व आ शको नः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | acikradat | vr̥ṣā | te | uta | stāmuḥ | magha-van | akrapiṣṭa || rāyaḥ | kāmaḥ | jaritāram | te | ā | agan | tvam | aṅga | śakra | vasvaḥ | ā | śakaḥ | naḥ ||7.20.9||

IAST: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhās tmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti
Griffith: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us.
Devanāgarī: स न इन्द्र त्वयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | indra | tva-yatāyai | iṣe | dhāḥ | tmanā | ca | ye | magha-vānaḥ | junanti || vasvī | su | te | jaritre | astu | śaktiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.20.10||

IAST: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | indra | tva-yatāyai | iṣe | dhāḥ | tmanā | ca | ye | magha-vānaḥ | junanti || vasvī | su | te | jaritre | astu | śaktiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.20.10||

IAST: asāvi devaṁ goṛjīkam andho ny asminn indro januṣem uvoca
Griffith: PRESSED is the juice divine with milk commingled: thereto hath Indra ever been accustomed.
Devanāgarī: असावि देवं गोऋजीकमन्धो न्यस्मिन्निन्द्रो जनुषेमुवोच
pada pāṭha: asāvi | devam | go-r̥jīkam | andhaḥ | ni | asmin | indraḥ | januṣā | īm | uvoca || bodhāmasi | tvā | hari-aśva | yajñaiḥ | bodha | naḥ | stomam | andhasaḥ | madeṣu ||7.21.1||

IAST: bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñair bodhā naḥ stomam andhaso madeṣu
Griffith: We wake thee, Lord of Bays, with sacrifices: mark this our laud in the wild joy of Soma.
Devanāgarī: बोधामसि त्वा हर्यश्व यज्ञैर्बोधा नः स्तोममन्धसो मदेषु
pada pāṭha: asāvi | devam | go-r̥jīkam | andhaḥ | ni | asmin | indraḥ | januṣā | īm | uvoca || bodhāmasi | tvā | hari-aśva | yajñaiḥ | bodha | naḥ | stomam | andhasaḥ | madeṣu ||7.21.1||

IAST: pra yanti yajñaṁ vipayanti barhiḥ somamādo vidathe dudhravācaḥ
Griffith: On to the rite they move, the grass they scatter, these Soma-drinkers eloquent in synod.
Devanāgarī: प्र यन्ति यज्ञं विपयन्ति बर्हिः सोममादो विदथे दुध्रवाचः
pada pāṭha: pra | yanti | yajñam | vipayanti | barhiḥ | soma-mādaḥ | vidathe | dudhra-vācaḥ || ni | ūm̐ iti | bhriyante | yaśasaḥ | gr̥bhāt | ā | dūre-upabdaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | nr̥-sācaḥ ||7.21.2||

IAST: ny u bhriyante yaśaso gṛbhād ā dūraüpabdo vṛṣaṇo nṛṣācaḥ
Griffith: Hither, for men to grasp, are brought the press-stones, far-thundering, famous, strong, that wait on he
Devanāgarī: न्यु भ्रियन्ते यशसो गृभादा दूर‍उपब्दो वृषणो नृषाचः
pada pāṭha: pra | yanti | yajñam | vipayanti | barhiḥ | soma-mādaḥ | vidathe | dudhra-vācaḥ || ni | ūm̐ iti | bhriyante | yaśasaḥ | gr̥bhāt | ā | dūre-upabdaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | nr̥-sācaḥ ||7.21.2||

IAST: tvam indra sravitavā apas kaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Indra, thou settest free the many waters that were encompassed, Hero, by the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्र स्रवितवा अपस्कः परिष्ठिता अहिना शूर पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sravitavai | apaḥ | kariti kaḥ | pari-sthitāḥ | ahinā | śūra | pūrvīḥ || tvat | vāvakre | rathyaḥ | na | dhenāḥ | rejante | viśvā | kr̥trimāṇi | bhīṣā ||7.21.3||

IAST: tvad vāvakre rathyo na dhenā rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā
Griffith: Down rolled, as if on chariots borne, the rivers: through fear of thee all things created tremble.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्वावक्रे रथ्यो न धेना रेजन्ते विश्वा कृत्रिमाणि भीषा
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sravitavai | apaḥ | kariti kaḥ | pari-sthitāḥ | ahinā | śūra | pūrvīḥ || tvat | vāvakre | rathyaḥ | na | dhenāḥ | rejante | viśvā | kr̥trimāṇi | bhīṣā ||7.21.3||

IAST: bhīmo viveṣāyudhebhir eṣām apāṁsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān
Griffith: Skilled in all manly deeds the God terrific hath with his weapons mastered these opponents.
Devanāgarī: भीमो विवेषायुधेभिरेषामपांसि विश्वा नर्याणि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: bhīmaḥ | viveṣa | āyudhebhiḥ | eṣām | apāṁsi | viśvā | naryāṇi | vidvān || indraḥ | puraḥ | jarhr̥ṣāṇaḥ | vi | dūdhot | vi | vajra-hastaḥ | mahinā | jaghāna ||7.21.4||

IAST: indraḥ puro jarhṛṣāṇo vi dūdhod vi vajrahasto mahinā jaghāna
Griffith: Indra in rapturous joy shook down their castles he slew them in his might, the Thunder-wielder.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः पुरो जर्हृषाणो वि दूधोद्वि वज्रहस्तो महिना जघान
pada pāṭha: bhīmaḥ | viveṣa | āyudhebhiḥ | eṣām | apāṁsi | viśvā | naryāṇi | vidvān || indraḥ | puraḥ | jarhr̥ṣāṇaḥ | vi | dūdhot | vi | vajra-hastaḥ | mahinā | jaghāna ||7.21.4||

IAST: na yātava indra jūjuvur no na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ
Griffith: No evil spirits have impelled us, Indra, nor fiends, O Mightiest God, with their devices.
Devanāgarī: न यातव इन्द्र जूजुवुर्नो न वन्दना शविष्ठ वेद्याभिः
pada pāṭha: na | yātavaḥ | indra | jūjuvuḥ | naḥ | na | vandanā | śaviṣṭha | vedyābhiḥ || saḥ | śardhat | aryaḥ | viṣuṇasya | jantoḥ | mā | śiśna-devāḥ | api | guḥ | r̥tam | naḥ ||7.21.5||

IAST: sa śardhad aryo viṣuṇasya jantor mā śiśnadevā api gur ṛtaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Let our true God subdue the hostile rabble: let not the lewd approach our holy worship.
Devanāgarī: स शर्धदर्यो विषुणस्य जन्तोर्मा शिश्नदेवा अपि गुरृतं नः
pada pāṭha: na | yātavaḥ | indra | jūjuvuḥ | naḥ | na | vandanā | śaviṣṭha | vedyābhiḥ || saḥ | śardhat | aryaḥ | viṣuṇasya | jantoḥ | mā | śiśna-devāḥ | api | guḥ | r̥tam | naḥ ||7.21.5||

IAST: abhi kratvendra bhūr adha jman na te vivyaṅ mahimānaṁ rajāṁsi
Griffith: Thou in thy strength surpassest Earth and Heaven: the regions comprehend not all thy greatness.
Devanāgarī: अभि क्रत्वेन्द्र भूरध ज्मन्न ते विव्यङ्महिमानं रजांसि
pada pāṭha: abhi | kratvā | indra | bhūḥ | adha | jman | na | te | vivyak | mahimānam | rajāṁsi || svena | hi | vr̥tram | śavasā | jaghantha | na | śatruḥ | antam | vividat | yudhā | te ||7.21.6||

IAST: svenā hi vṛtraṁ śavasā jaghantha na śatrur antaṁ vividad yudhā te
Griffith: With thine own power and might thou slewest Vrtra: no foe hath found the end of thee in battle.
Devanāgarī: स्वेना हि वृत्रं शवसा जघन्थ न शत्रुरन्तं विविदद्युधा ते
pada pāṭha: abhi | kratvā | indra | bhūḥ | adha | jman | na | te | vivyak | mahimānam | rajāṁsi || svena | hi | vr̥tram | śavasā | jaghantha | na | śatruḥ | antam | vividat | yudhā | te ||7.21.6||

IAST: devāś cit te asuryāya pūrve 'nu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṁsi
Griffith: Even the earlier Deities submitted their powers to thy supreme divine dominion.
Devanāgarī: देवाश्चित्ते असुर्याय पूर्वेऽनु क्षत्राय ममिरे सहांसि
pada pāṭha: devāḥ | cit | te | asuryāya | pūrve | anu | kṣatrāya | mamire | sahāṁsi || indraḥ | maghāni | dayate | vi-sahya | indram | vājasya | johuvanta | sātau ||7.21.7||

IAST: indro maghāni dayate viṣahyendraṁ vājasya johuvanta sātau
Griffith: Indra wins wealth and deals it out to other's: men in the strife for booty call on Indra.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो मघानि दयते विषह्येन्द्रं वाजस्य जोहुवन्त सातौ
pada pāṭha: devāḥ | cit | te | asuryāya | pūrve | anu | kṣatrāya | mamire | sahāṁsi || indraḥ | maghāni | dayate | vi-sahya | indram | vājasya | johuvanta | sātau ||7.21.7||

IAST: kīriś cid dhi tvām avase juhāveśānam indra saubhagasya bhūreḥ
Griffith: The humble hath invoked thee for protection, thee, Lord of great felicity, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: कीरिश्चिद्धि त्वामवसे जुहावेशानमिन्द्र सौभगस्य भूरेः
pada pāṭha: kīriḥ | cit | hi | tvām | avase | juhāva | īśānam | indra | saubhagasya | bhūreḥ || avaḥ | babhūtha | śatam-ūte | asme iti | abhi-kṣattuḥ | tvā-vataḥ | varūtā ||7.21.8||

IAST: avo babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattus tvāvato varūtā
Griffith: Thou with a hundred aids hast been our Helper: one who brings gifts like thee hath his defender.
Devanāgarī: अवो बभूथ शतमूते अस्मे अभिक्षत्तुस्त्वावतो वरूता
pada pāṭha: kīriḥ | cit | hi | tvām | avase | juhāva | īśānam | indra | saubhagasya | bhūreḥ || avaḥ | babhūtha | śatam-ūte | asme iti | abhi-kṣattuḥ | tvā-vataḥ | varūtā ||7.21.8||

IAST: sakhāyas ta indra viśvaha syāma namovṛdhāso mahinā tarutra
Griffith: May we, O Indra, be thy friends for ever, eagerly, Conqueror, yielding greater homage.
Devanāgarī: सखायस्त इन्द्र विश्वह स्याम नमोवृधासो महिना तरुत्र
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | te | indra | viśvaha | syāma | namaḥ-vr̥dhāsaḥ | mahinā | tarutra || vanvantu | sma | te | avasā | sam-īke | abhi-itim | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | śavāṁsi ||7.21.9||

IAST: vanvantu smā te 'vasā samīke 'bhītim aryo vanuṣāṁ śavāṁsi
Griffith: May, through thy grace, the strength of us who battle quell in the shock the onset of the foeman.
Devanāgarī: वन्वन्तु स्मा तेऽवसा समीकेऽभीतिमर्यो वनुषां शवांसि
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | te | indra | viśvaha | syāma | namaḥ-vr̥dhāsaḥ | mahinā | tarutra || vanvantu | sma | te | avasā | sam-īke | abhi-itim | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | śavāṁsi ||7.21.9||

IAST: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhās tmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti
Griffith: Place us by food which thou hast given, O Indra, us and the wealthy patrons who command us.
Devanāgarī: स न इन्द्र त्वयताया इषे धास्त्मना च ये मघवानो जुनन्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | indra | tva-yatāyai | iṣe | dhāḥ | tmanā | ca | ye | magha-vānaḥ | junanti || vasvī | su | te | jaritre | astu | śaktiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.21.10||

IAST: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Let thy great power bring good to him who lauds thee. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वस्वी षु ते जरित्रे अस्तु शक्तिर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | indra | tva-yatāyai | iṣe | dhāḥ | tmanā | ca | ye | magha-vānaḥ | junanti || vasvī | su | te | jaritre | astu | śaktiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.21.10||

IAST: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yaṁ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ
Griffith: DRINK Soma, Lord of Bays, and let it cheer thee: Indra, the stone, like a well guided courser,
Devanāgarī: पिबा सोममिन्द्र मन्दतु त्वा यं ते सुषाव हर्यश्वाद्रिः
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | indra | mandatu | tvā | yam | te | susāva | hari-aśva | adriḥ || sotuḥ | bāhu-bhyām | su-yataḥ | na | arvā ||7.22.1||

IAST: sotur bāhubhyāṁ suyato nārvā
Griffith: Directed by the presser's arms hath pressed it.
Devanāgarī: सोतुर्बाहुभ्यां सुयतो नार्वा
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | indra | mandatu | tvā | yam | te | susāva | hari-aśva | adriḥ || sotuḥ | bāhu-bhyām | su-yataḥ | na | arvā ||7.22.1||

IAST: yas te mado yujyaś cārur asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṁsi
Griffith: So let the draught of joy, thy dear companion, by which, O Lord of Bays, thou slayest foemen,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते मदो युज्यश्चारुरस्ति येन वृत्राणि हर्यश्व हंसि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | yujyaḥ | cāruḥ | asti | yena | vr̥trāṇi | hari-aśva | haṁsi || saḥ | tvām | indra | prabhuvaso iti prabhu-vaso | mamattu ||7.22.2||

IAST: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu
Griffith: Delight thee, Indra, Lord of princely treasures.
Devanāgarī: स त्वामिन्द्र प्रभूवसो ममत्तु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | yujyaḥ | cāruḥ | asti | yena | vr̥trāṇi | hari-aśva | haṁsi || saḥ | tvām | indra | prabhuvaso iti prabhu-vaso | mamattu ||7.22.2||

IAST: bodhā su me maghavan vācam emāṁ yāṁ te vasiṣṭho arcati praśastim
Griffith: Mark closely, Maghavan, the words I utter, this eulogy recited by Vasistha:
Devanāgarī: बोधा सु मे मघवन्वाचमेमां यां ते वसिष्ठो अर्चति प्रशस्तिम्
pada pāṭha: bodha | su | me | magha-van | vācam | ā | imām | yām | te | vasiṣṭhaḥ | arcati | pra-śastim || imā | brahma | sadha-māde | juṣasva ||7.22.3||

IAST: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
Griffith: Accept the prayers I offer at thy banquet.
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्म सधमादे जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: bodha | su | me | magha-van | vācam | ā | imām | yām | te | vasiṣṭhaḥ | arcati | pra-śastim || imā | brahma | sadha-māde | juṣasva ||7.22.3||

IAST: śrudhī havaṁ vipipānasyādrer bodhā viprasyārcato manīṣām
Griffith: Hear thou the call of the juice-drinking press-stone: hear thou the Brahman's hymn who sings and lauds the
Devanāgarī: श्रुधी हवं विपिपानस्याद्रेर्बोधा विप्रस्यार्चतो मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | vi-pipānasya | adreḥ | bodha | viprasya | arcataḥ | manīṣām || kr̥ṣva | duvāṁsi | antamā | sacā | imā ||7.22.4||

IAST: kṛṣvā duvāṁsy antamā sacemā
Griffith: Take to thine inmost self these adorations.
Devanāgarī: कृष्वा दुवांस्यन्तमा सचेमा
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | havam | vi-pipānasya | adreḥ | bodha | viprasya | arcataḥ | manīṣām || kr̥ṣva | duvāṁsi | antamā | sacā | imā ||7.22.4||

IAST: na te giro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutim asuryasya vidvān
Griffith: I know and ne'er forget the hymns and praises of thee, the Conqueror, and thy strength immortal.
Devanāgarī: न ते गिरो अपि मृष्ये तुरस्य न सुष्टुतिमसुर्यस्य विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: na | te | giraḥ | api | mr̥ṣye | turasya | na | su-stutim | asuryasya | vidvān || sadā | te | nāma | sva-yaśaḥ | vivakmi ||7.22.5||

IAST: sadā te nāma svayaśo vivakmi
Griffith: Thy name I ever utter. Self-Refulgent
Devanāgarī: सदा ते नाम स्वयशो विवक्मि
pada pāṭha: na | te | giraḥ | api | mr̥ṣye | turasya | na | su-stutim | asuryasya | vidvān || sadā | te | nāma | sva-yaśaḥ | vivakmi ||7.22.5||

IAST: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvām it
Griffith: Among mankind many are thy libations, and many a time the pious sageinvokes thee.
Devanāgarī: भूरि हि ते सवना मानुषेषु भूरि मनीषी हवते त्वामित्
pada pāṭha: bhūri | hi | te | savanā | mānuṣeṣu | bhūri | manīṣī | havate | tvām | it || mā | āre | asmat | magha-van | jyok | kariti kaḥ ||7.22.6||

IAST: māre asman maghavañ jyok kaḥ
Griffith: O Maghavan, be not long distant from us.
Devanāgarī: मारे अस्मन्मघवञ्ज्योक्कः
pada pāṭha: bhūri | hi | te | savanā | mānuṣeṣu | bhūri | manīṣī | havate | tvām | it || mā | āre | asmat | magha-van | jyok | kariti kaḥ ||7.22.6||

IAST: tubhyed imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi
Griffith: All these libations are for thee, O Hero: to thee I offer these my prayers. that strengthen.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्येदिमा सवना शूर विश्वा तुभ्यं ब्रह्माणि वर्धना कृणोमि
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | imā | savanā | śūra | viśvā | tubhyam | brahmāṇi | vardhanā | kr̥ṇomi || tvam | nr̥-bhiḥ | havyaḥ | viśvadhā | asi ||7.22.7||

IAST: tvaṁ nṛbhir havyo viśvadhāsi
Griffith: Ever, in every place, must men invoke thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नृभिर्हव्यो विश्वधासि
pada pāṭha: tubhya | it | imā | savanā | śūra | viśvā | tubhyam | brahmāṇi | vardhanā | kr̥ṇomi || tvam | nr̥-bhiḥ | havyaḥ | viśvadhā | asi ||7.22.7||

IAST: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmod aśnuvanti mahimānam ugra
