Griffith: Never do men attain, O Wonder-Worker, thy greatness, Mighty One, who must be lauded,
Devanāgarī: नू चिन्नु ते मन्यमानस्य दस्मोदश्नुवन्ति महिमानमुग्र
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | nu | te | manyamānasya | dasma | ut | aśnuvanti | mahimānam | ugra || na | vīryam | indra | te | na | rādhaḥ ||7.22.8||

IAST: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ
Griffith: Nor, Indra, thine heroic power and bounty.
Devanāgarī: न वीर्यमिन्द्र ते न राधः
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | nu | te | manyamānasya | dasma | ut | aśnuvanti | mahimānam | ugra || na | vīryam | indra | te | na | rādhaḥ ||7.22.8||

IAST: ye ca pūrva ṛṣayo ye ca nūtnā indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ
Griffith: Among all Rsis, Indra, old and recent, who have engendered hymns as sacred singers,
Devanāgarī: ये च पूर्व ऋषयो ये च नूत्ना इन्द्र ब्रह्माणि जनयन्त विप्राः
pada pāṭha: ye | ca | pūrve | r̥ṣayaḥ | ye | ca | nūtnāḥ | indra | brahmāṇi | janayanta | viprāḥ || asme iti | te | santu | sakhyā | śivāni | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.22.9||

IAST: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Even with us be thine auspicious friendships. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे ते सन्तु सख्या शिवानि यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ye | ca | pūrve | r̥ṣayaḥ | ye | ca | nūtnāḥ | indra | brahmāṇi | janayanta | viprāḥ || asme iti | te | santu | sakhyā | śivāni | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.22.9||

IAST: ud u brahmāṇy airata śravasyendraṁ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha
Griffith: PRAYERS have been offered up through love of glory: Vasistha, honour Indra in the battle.
Devanāgarī: उदु ब्रह्माण्यैरत श्रवस्येन्द्रं समर्ये महया वसिष्ठ
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | brahmāṇi | airata | śravasyā | indram | sa-marye | mahaya | vasiṣṭha || ā | yaḥ | viśvāni | śavasā | tatāna | upa-śrotā | me | īvataḥ | vacāṁsi ||7.23.1||

IAST: ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṁsi
Griffith: He who with might extends through all existence hears words which I, his faithful servant, utter.
Devanāgarī: आ यो विश्वानि शवसा ततानोपश्रोता म ईवतो वचांसि
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | brahmāṇi | airata | śravasyā | indram | sa-marye | mahaya | vasiṣṭha || ā | yaḥ | viśvāni | śavasā | tatāna | upa-śrotā | me | īvataḥ | vacāṁsi ||7.23.1||

IAST: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmir irajyanta yac churudho vivāci
Griffith: A cry was raised which reached the Gods, O Indra, a cry to them to send us strength in combat.
Devanāgarī: अयामि घोष इन्द्र देवजामिरिरज्यन्त यच्छुरुधो विवाचि
pada pāṭha: ayāmi | ghoṣaḥ | indra | deva-jāmiḥ | irajyanta | yat | śurudhaḥ | vi-vāci || nahi | svam | āyuḥ | cikite | janeṣu | tāni | it | aṁhāṁsi | ati | parṣi | asmān ||7.23.2||

IAST: nahi svam āyuś cikite janeṣu tānīd aṁhāṁsy ati parṣy asmān
Griffith: None among men knows his own life's duration: bear us in safety over these our troubles.
Devanāgarī: नहि स्वमायुश्चिकिते जनेषु तानीदंहांस्यति पर्ष्यस्मान्
pada pāṭha: ayāmi | ghoṣaḥ | indra | deva-jāmiḥ | irajyanta | yat | śurudhaḥ | vi-vāci || nahi | svam | āyuḥ | cikite | janeṣu | tāni | it | aṁhāṁsi | ati | parṣi | asmān ||7.23.2||

IAST: yuje rathaṁ gaveṣaṇaṁ haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ
Griffith: The Bays, the booty-seeking car I harness: my prayers have reached him who accepts them gladly.
Devanāgarī: युजे रथं गवेषणं हरिभ्यामुप ब्रह्माणि जुजुषाणमस्थुः
pada pāṭha: yuje | ratham | go-eṣaṇam | hari-bhyām | upa | brahmāṇi | jujuṣāṇam | asthuḥ || vi | bādhiṣṭa | syaḥ | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | aprati | jaghanvān ||7.23.3||

IAST: vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghanvān
Griffith: Indra, when he had slain resistless foemen, forced with his might the two world-halves asunder.
Devanāgarī: वि बाधिष्ट स्य रोदसी महित्वेन्द्रो वृत्राण्यप्रती जघन्वान्
pada pāṭha: yuje | ratham | go-eṣaṇam | hari-bhyām | upa | brahmāṇi | jujuṣāṇam | asthuḥ || vi | bādhiṣṭa | syaḥ | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | aprati | jaghanvān ||7.23.3||

IAST: āpaś cit pipyuḥ staryo na gāvo nakṣann ṛtaṁ jaritāras ta indra
Griffith: Like barren cows, moreover, swelled the waters: the singen sought thy holy rite, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चित्पिप्युः स्तर्यो न गावो नक्षन्नृतं जरितारस्त इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | cit | pipyuḥ | staryaḥ | na | gāvaḥ | nakṣan | r̥tam | jaritāraḥ | te | indra || yāhi | vāyuḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | naḥ | accha | tvam | hi | dhībhiḥ | dayase | vi | vājān ||7.23.4||

IAST: yāhi vāyur na niyuto no acchā tvaṁ hi dhībhir dayase vi vājān
Griffith: Come unto us as with his team comes Vayu: thou, through our solemn hymns bestowest booty.
Devanāgarī: याहि वायुर्न नियुतो नो अच्छा त्वं हि धीभिर्दयसे वि वाजान्
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | cit | pipyuḥ | staryaḥ | na | gāvaḥ | nakṣan | r̥tam | jaritāraḥ | te | indra || yāhi | vāyuḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | naḥ | accha | tvam | hi | dhībhiḥ | dayase | vi | vājān ||7.23.4||

IAST: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṁ tuvirādhasaṁ jaritre
Griffith: So may these gladdening draughts rejoice thee, Indra, the Mighty, very bounteous to the singer.
Devanāgarī: ते त्वा मदा इन्द्र मादयन्तु शुष्मिणं तुविराधसं जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: te | tvā | madāḥ | indra | mādayantu | śuṣmiṇam | tuvi-rādhasam | jaritre || ekaḥ | deva-trā | dayase | hi | martān | asmin | śūra | savane | mādayasva ||7.23.5||

IAST: eko devatrā dayase hi martān asmiñ chūra savane mādayasva
Griffith: Alone among the Gods thou pitiest mortals: O Hero, make thee glad at this libation.
Devanāgarī: एको देवत्रा दयसे हि मर्तानस्मिञ्छूर सवने मादयस्व
pada pāṭha: te | tvā | madāḥ | indra | mādayantu | śuṣmiṇam | tuvi-rādhasam | jaritre || ekaḥ | deva-trā | dayase | hi | martān | asmin | śūra | savane | mādayasva ||7.23.5||

IAST: eved indraṁ vṛṣaṇaṁ vajrabāhuṁ vasiṣṭhāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ
Griffith: Thus the Vasisthas glorify with praises Indra, the Powerful whose arm wields thunder.
Devanāgarī: एवेदिन्द्रं वृषणं वज्रबाहुं वसिष्ठासो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indram | vr̥ṣaṇam | vajra-bāhum | vasiṣṭhāsaḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || saḥ | naḥ | stutaḥ | vīra-vat | dhātu | go-mat | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.23.6||

IAST: sa naḥ stuto vīravad dhātu gomad yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Praised, may he guard our wealth in kine and heroes. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.
Devanāgarī: स नः स्तुतो वीरवद्धातु गोमद्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indram | vr̥ṣaṇam | vajra-bāhum | vasiṣṭhāsaḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || saḥ | naḥ | stutaḥ | vīra-vat | dhātu | go-mat | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.23.6||

IAST: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tam ā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi
Griffith: A HOME is made for thee to dwell in, Indra: O Much-invoked, go thitherwith the heroes.
Devanāgarī: योनिष्ट इन्द्र सदने अकारि तमा नृभिः पुरुहूत प्र याहि
pada pāṭha: yoniḥ | te | indra | sadane | akāri | tam | ā | nr̥-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | pra | yāhi || asaḥ | yathā | naḥ | avitā | vr̥dhe | ca | dadaḥ | vasūni | mamadaḥ | ca | somaiḥ ||7.24.1||

IAST: aso yathā no 'vitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaś ca somaiḥ
Griffith: That thou, to prosper us, mayst be our Helper, vouchsafe us wealth, rejoice with draughts of Soma.
Devanāgarī: असो यथा नोऽविता वृधे च ददो वसूनि ममदश्च सोमैः
pada pāṭha: yoniḥ | te | indra | sadane | akāri | tam | ā | nr̥-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | pra | yāhi || asaḥ | yathā | naḥ | avitā | vr̥dhe | ca | dadaḥ | vasūni | mamadaḥ | ca | somaiḥ ||7.24.1||

IAST: gṛbhītaṁ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni
Griffith: Indra, thy wish, twice-strong, is comprehended: pressed is the Soma, poured are pleasant juices.
Devanāgarī: गृभीतं ते मन इन्द्र द्विबर्हाः सुतः सोमः परिषिक्ता मधूनि
pada pāṭha: gr̥bhītam | te | manaḥ | indra | dvi-barhāḥ | sutaḥ | somaḥ | pari-siktā | madhūni || visr̥ṣṭa-dhenā | bharate | su-vr̥ktiḥ | iyam | indram | johuvatī | manīṣā ||7.24.2||

IAST: visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktir iyam indraṁ johuvatī manīṣā
Griffith: This hymn of praise, from loosened tongue, made perfect, draws Indra to itself with loud invoking.
Devanāgarī: विसृष्टधेना भरते सुवृक्तिरियमिन्द्रं जोहुवती मनीषा
pada pāṭha: gr̥bhītam | te | manaḥ | indra | dvi-barhāḥ | sutaḥ | somaḥ | pari-siktā | madhūni || visr̥ṣṭa-dhenā | bharate | su-vr̥ktiḥ | iyam | indram | johuvatī | manīṣā ||7.24.2||

IAST: ā no diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣinn idam barhiḥ somapeyāya yāhi
Griffith: Come, thou Impetuous; God, from earth or heaven; come to our holy grass to drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: आ नो दिव आ पृथिव्या ऋजीषिन्निदं बर्हिः सोमपेयाय याहि
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | r̥jīṣin | idam | barhiḥ | soma-peyāya | yāhi || vahantu | tvā | harayaḥ | madryañcam | āṅgūṣam | accha | tavasam | madāya ||7.24.3||

IAST: vahantu tvā harayo madryañcam āṅgūṣam acchā tavasam madāya
Griffith: Hither to me let thy Bay Horses bring thee to listen to our hymns and make thee joyful.
Devanāgarī: वहन्तु त्वा हरयो मद्र्यञ्चमाङ्गूषमच्छा तवसं मदाय
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | r̥jīṣin | idam | barhiḥ | soma-peyāya | yāhi || vahantu | tvā | harayaḥ | madryañcam | āṅgūṣam | accha | tavasam | madāya ||7.24.3||

IAST: ā no viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ sajoṣā brahma juṣāṇo haryaśva yāhi
Griffith: Come unto us with all thine aids, accordant, Lord of Bay Steeds, accepting our devotions,
Devanāgarī: आ नो विश्वाभिरूतिभिः सजोषा ब्रह्म जुषाणो हर्यश्व याहि
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | brahma | juṣāṇaḥ | hari-aśva | yāhi || varīvr̥jat | sthavirebhiḥ | su-śipra | asme iti | dadhat | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indra ||7.24.4||

IAST: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ suśiprāsme dadhad vṛṣaṇaṁ śuṣmam indra
Griffith: Fair-helmeted, o'ercoming with the mighty, and lending us the strength of bulls, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: वरीवृजत्स्थविरेभिः सुशिप्रास्मे दधद्वृषणं शुष्ममिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | brahma | juṣāṇaḥ | hari-aśva | yāhi || varīvr̥jat | sthavirebhiḥ | su-śipra | asme iti | dadhat | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indra ||7.24.4||

IAST: eṣa stomo maha ugrāya vāhe dhurīvātyo na vājayann adhāyi
Griffith: As to the chariot pole a vigorous courser, this laud is brought to the great strong Upholder.
Devanāgarī: एष स्तोमो मह उग्राय वाहे धुरीवात्यो न वाजयन्नधायि
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | mahe | ugrāya | vāhe | dhuri-iva | atyaḥ | na | vājayan | adhāyi || indra | tvā | ayam | arkaḥ | īṭṭe | vasūnām | divi-iva | dyām | adhi | naḥ | śromatam | dhāḥ ||7.24.5||

IAST: indra tvāyam arka īṭṭe vasūnāṁ divīva dyām adhi naḥ śromataṁ dhāḥ
Griffith: This hymn solicits wealth of thee: in heaven, as 'twere above the sky, set thou our glory.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्वायमर्क ईट्टे वसूनां दिवीव द्यामधि नः श्रोमतं धाः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | mahe | ugrāya | vāhe | dhuri-iva | atyaḥ | na | vājayan | adhāyi || indra | tvā | ayam | arkaḥ | īṭṭe | vasūnām | divi-iva | dyām | adhi | naḥ | śromatam | dhāḥ ||7.24.5||

IAST: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṁ sumatiṁ vevidāma
Griffith: With precious things. O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour.
Devanāgarī: एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य पूर्धि प्र ते महीं सुमतिं वेविदाम
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | vāryasya | pūrdhi | pra | te | mahīm | su-matim | vevidāma || iṣam | pinva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vīrām | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.24.6||

IAST: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषं पिन्व मघवद्भ्यः सुवीरां यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | vāryasya | pūrdhi | pra | te | mahīm | su-matim | vevidāma || iṣam | pinva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vīrām | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.24.6||

IAST: ā te maha indroty ugra samanyavo yat samaranta senāḥ
Griffith: WHEN with thy mighty help, O potent Indra, the armies rush together in their fury.
Devanāgarī: आ ते मह इन्द्रोत्युग्र समन्यवो यत्समरन्त सेनाः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | mahaḥ | indra | ūtī | ugra | sa-manyavaḥ | yat | sam-aranta | senāḥ || patāti | didyut | naryasya | bāhvoḥ | mā | te | manaḥ | viṣvadryak | vi | cārīt ||7.25.1||

IAST: patāti didyun naryasya bāhvor mā te mano viṣvadryag vi cārīt
Griffith: When from the strong man's arm the lightning flieth, let not the mind go forth to side with others.
Devanāgarī: पताति दिद्युन्नर्यस्य बाह्वोर्मा ते मनो विष्वद्र्यग्वि चारीत्
pada pāṭha: ā | te | mahaḥ | indra | ūtī | ugra | sa-manyavaḥ | yat | sam-aranta | senāḥ || patāti | didyut | naryasya | bāhvoḥ | mā | te | manaḥ | viṣvadryak | vi | cārīt ||7.25.1||

IAST: ni durga indra śnathihy amitrām̐ abhi ye no martāso amanti
Griffith: O Indra, where the ground is hard to traverse, smite down our foes, the mortals who assail us,
Devanāgarī: नि दुर्ग इन्द्र श्नथिह्यमित्राँ अभि ये नो मर्तासो अमन्ति
pada pāṭha: ni | duḥ-ge | indra | śnathihi | amitrān | abhi | ye | naḥ | martāsaḥ | amanti || āre | tam | śaṁsam | kr̥ṇuhi | ninitsoḥ | ā | naḥ | bhara | sam-bharaṇam | vasūnām ||7.25.2||

IAST: āre taṁ śaṁsaṁ kṛṇuhi ninitsor ā no bhara sambharaṇaṁ vasūnām
Griffith: Keep far from us the curse of the reviler: bring us accumulated store of treasures.
Devanāgarī: आरे तं शंसं कृणुहि निनित्सोरा नो भर सम्भरणं वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ni | duḥ-ge | indra | śnathihi | amitrān | abhi | ye | naḥ | martāsaḥ | amanti || āre | tam | śaṁsam | kr̥ṇuhi | ninitsoḥ | ā | naḥ | bhara | sam-bharaṇam | vasūnām ||7.25.2||

IAST: śataṁ te śiprinn ūtayaḥ sudāse sahasraṁ śaṁsā uta rātir astu
Griffith: God of the fair helm, give Sudas a hundred succours, a thousand blessings, and thy bounty.
Devanāgarī: शतं ते शिप्रिन्नूतयः सुदासे सहस्रं शंसा उत रातिरस्तु
pada pāṭha: śatam | te | śiprin | ūtayaḥ | su-dāse | sahasram | śaṁsāḥ | uta | rātiḥ | astu || jahi | vadhaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | martyasya | asme iti | dyumnam | adhi | ratnam | ca | dhehi ||7.25.3||

IAST: jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasyāsme dyumnam adhi ratnaṁ ca dhehi
Griffith: Strike down the weapon of our mortal foeman: bestow upon us splendid fame and riches.
Devanāgarī: जहि वधर्वनुषो मर्त्यस्यास्मे द्युम्नमधि रत्नं च धेहि
pada pāṭha: śatam | te | śiprin | ūtayaḥ | su-dāse | sahasram | śaṁsāḥ | uta | rātiḥ | astu || jahi | vadhaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | martyasya | asme iti | dyumnam | adhi | ratnam | ca | dhehi ||7.25.3||

IAST: tvāvato hīndra kratve asmi tvāvato 'vituḥ śūra rātau
Griffith: I wait the power of one like thee, O Indra, gifts of a Helper such as thou art, Hero.
Devanāgarī: त्वावतो हीन्द्र क्रत्वे अस्मि त्वावतोऽवितुः शूर रातौ
pada pāṭha: tvā-vataḥ | hi | indra | kratve | asmi | tvā-vataḥ | avituḥ | śūra | rātau || viśvā | it | ahāni | taviṣī-vaḥ | ugra | okaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | hari-vaḥ | na | mardhīḥ ||7.25.4||

IAST: viśved ahāni taviṣīva ugram̐ okaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivo na mardhīḥ
Griffith: Strong, Mighty God, dwell with me now and ever: Lord of Bay Horses, do not thou desert us.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेदहानि तविषीव उग्रँ ओकः कृणुष्व हरिवो न मर्धीः
pada pāṭha: tvā-vataḥ | hi | indra | kratve | asmi | tvā-vataḥ | avituḥ | śūra | rātau || viśvā | it | ahāni | taviṣī-vaḥ | ugra | okaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | hari-vaḥ | na | mardhīḥ ||7.25.4||

IAST: kutsā ete haryaśvāya śūṣam indre saho devajūtam iyānāḥ
Griffith: Here are the Kutsas supplicating Indra for might, the Lord of Bays for God-sent conquest.
Devanāgarī: कुत्सा एते हर्यश्वाय शूषमिन्द्रे सहो देवजूतमियानाः
pada pāṭha: kutsāḥ | ete | haryi-aśvāya | śūṣam | indre | sahaḥ | deva-jūtam | iyānāḥ || satrā | kr̥dhi | su-hanā | śūra | vr̥trā | vayam | tarutrāḥ | sanuyāma | vājam ||7.25.5||

IAST: satrā kṛdhi suhanā śūra vṛtrā vayaṁ tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam
Griffith: Make our foes ever easy to be vanquished: may we, victorious, win the spoil, O Hero.
Devanāgarī: सत्रा कृधि सुहना शूर वृत्रा वयं तरुत्राः सनुयाम वाजम्
pada pāṭha: kutsāḥ | ete | haryi-aśvāya | śūṣam | indre | sahaḥ | deva-jūtam | iyānāḥ || satrā | kr̥dhi | su-hanā | śūra | vr̥trā | vayam | tarutrāḥ | sanuyāma | vājam ||7.25.5||

IAST: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṁ sumatiṁ vevidāma
Griffith: With precious things, O Indra, thus content us: may we attain to thine exalted favour.
Devanāgarī: एवा न इन्द्र वार्यस्य पूर्धि प्र ते महीं सुमतिं वेविदाम
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | vāryasya | pūrdhi | pra | te | mahīm | su-matim | vevidāma || iṣam | pinva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vīrām | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.25.6||

IAST: iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Send our chiefs plenteous food with hero children. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषं पिन्व मघवद्भ्यः सुवीरां यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indra | vāryasya | pūrdhi | pra | te | mahīm | su-matim | vevidāma || iṣam | pinva | maghavat-bhyaḥ | su-vīrām | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.25.6||

IAST: na soma indram asuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṁ sutāsaḥ
Griffith: SOMA unpressed ne'er gladdened liberal Indra, no juices pressed without a prayer have pleased him.
Devanāgarī: न सोम इन्द्रमसुतो ममाद नाब्रह्माणो मघवानं सुतासः
pada pāṭha: na | somaḥ | indram | asutaḥ | mamāda | na | abrahmāṇaḥ | magha-vānam | sutāsaḥ || tasmai | uktham | janaye | yat | jujoṣat | nr̥-vat | navīyaḥ | śr̥ṇavat | yathā | naḥ ||7.26.1||

IAST: tasmā ukthaṁ janaye yaj jujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ
Griffith: I generate a laud that shall delight him, new and heroic, so that he may hear us.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा उक्थं जनये यज्जुजोषन्नृवन्नवीयः शृणवद्यथा नः
pada pāṭha: na | somaḥ | indram | asutaḥ | mamāda | na | abrahmāṇaḥ | magha-vānam | sutāsaḥ || tasmai | uktham | janaye | yat | jujoṣat | nr̥-vat | navīyaḥ | śr̥ṇavat | yathā | naḥ ||7.26.1||

IAST: uktha-ukthe soma indram mamāda nīthe-nīthe maghavānaṁ sutāsaḥ
Griffith: At every laud the Soma gladdens Indra: pressed juices please him as each psalm is chanted,
Devanāgarī: उक्थौक्थे सोम इन्द्रं ममाद नीथेनीथे मघवानं सुतासः
pada pāṭha: ukthe-ukthe | somaḥ | indram | mamāda | nīthe-nīthe | magha-vānam | sutāsaḥ || yat | īm | sa-bādhaḥ | pitaram | na | putrāḥ | samāna-dakṣāḥ | avase | havante ||7.26.2||

IAST: yad īṁ sabādhaḥ pitaraṁ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante
Griffith: What time the priests with one united effort call him to aid, as sons invoke their father.
Devanāgarī: यदीं सबाधः पितरं न पुत्राः समानदक्षा अवसे हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: ukthe-ukthe | somaḥ | indram | mamāda | nīthe-nīthe | magha-vānam | sutāsaḥ || yat | īm | sa-bādhaḥ | pitaram | na | putrāḥ | samāna-dakṣāḥ | avase | havante ||7.26.2||

IAST: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnam anyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu
Griffith: These deeds he did; let him achieve new exploits, such as the priests declare at their libations.
Devanāgarī: चकार ता कृणवन्नूनमन्या यानि ब्रुवन्ति वेधसः सुतेषु
pada pāṭha: cakāra | tā | kr̥ṇavat | nūnam | anyā | yāni | bruvanti | vedhasaḥ | suteṣu || janīḥ-iva | patiḥ | ekaḥ | samānaḥ | ni | mamr̥je | puraḥ | indraḥ | su | sarvāḥ ||7.26.3||

IAST: janīr iva patir ekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥ su sarvāḥ
Griffith: Indra hath taken and possessed all castles, like as one common husband doth his spouses.
Devanāgarī: जनीरिव पतिरेकः समानो नि मामृजे पुर इन्द्रः सु सर्वाः
pada pāṭha: cakāra | tā | kr̥ṇavat | nūnam | anyā | yāni | bruvanti | vedhasaḥ | suteṣu || janīḥ-iva | patiḥ | ekaḥ | samānaḥ | ni | mamr̥je | puraḥ | indraḥ | su | sarvāḥ ||7.26.3||

IAST: evā tam āhur uta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇir maghānām
Griffith: Even thus have they declared him. Famed is Indra as Conqueror, sole distributer of treasures;
Devanāgarī: एवा तमाहुरुत शृण्व इन्द्र एको विभक्ता तरणिर्मघानाम्
pada pāṭha: eva | tam | āhuḥ | uta | śr̥ṇve | indraḥ | ekaḥ | vi-bhaktā | taraṇiḥ | maghānām || mithaḥ-turaḥ | ūtayaḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | asme iti | bhadrāṇi | saścata | priyāṇi ||7.26.4||

IAST: mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrvīr asme bhadrāṇi saścata priyāṇi
Griffith: Whose many succours come in close succession. May dear delightful benefits attend us.
Devanāgarī: मिथस्तुर ऊतयो यस्य पूर्वीरस्मे भद्राणि सश्चत प्रियाणि
pada pāṭha: eva | tam | āhuḥ | uta | śr̥ṇve | indraḥ | ekaḥ | vi-bhaktā | taraṇiḥ | maghānām || mithaḥ-turaḥ | ūtayaḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | asme iti | bhadrāṇi | saścata | priyāṇi ||7.26.4||

IAST: evā vasiṣṭha indram ūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṁ vṛṣabhaṁ sute gṛṇāti
Griffith: Thus, to bring help to men, Vasistha laudeth Indra, the peoples' Hero, at libation.
Devanāgarī: एवा वसिष्ठ इन्द्रमूतये नॄन्कृष्टीनां वृषभं सुते गृणाति
pada pāṭha: eva | vasiṣṭhaḥ | indram | ūtaye | nr̥̄n | kr̥ṣṭīnām | vr̥ṣabham | sute | gr̥ṇāti || sahasriṇaḥ | upa | naḥ | māhi | vājān | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.26.5||

IAST: sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Bestow upon us strength and wealth in thousands. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रिण उप नो माहि वाजान्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | vasiṣṭhaḥ | indram | ūtaye | nr̥̄n | kr̥ṣṭīnām | vr̥ṣabham | sute | gr̥ṇāti || sahasriṇaḥ | upa | naḥ | māhi | vājān | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.26.5||

IAST: indraṁ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyas tāḥ
Griffith: MEN call on Indra in the armed encounter that he may make the hymns they sing decisive.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं नरो नेमधिता हवन्ते यत्पार्या युनजते धियस्ताः
pada pāṭha: indram | naraḥ | nema-dhitā | havante | yat | pāryāḥ | yunajate | dhiyaḥ | tāḥ || śūraḥ | nr̥-sātā | śavasaḥ | cakānaḥ | ā | go-mati | vraje | bhaja | tvam | naḥ ||7.27.1||

IAST: śūro nṛṣātā śavasaś cakāna ā gomati vraje bhajā tvaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Hero, rejoicing in thy might, in combat give us a portion of the stall of cattle,
Devanāgarī: शूरो नृषाता शवसश्चकान आ गोमति व्रजे भजा त्वं नः
pada pāṭha: indram | naraḥ | nema-dhitā | havante | yat | pāryāḥ | yunajate | dhiyaḥ | tāḥ || śūraḥ | nr̥-sātā | śavasaḥ | cakānaḥ | ā | go-mati | vraje | bhaja | tvam | naḥ ||7.27.1||

IAST: ya indra śuṣmo maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūta nṛbhyaḥ
Griffith: Grant, Indra Maghavan, invoked of many, to these my friends the strength which thou possessest.
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्र शुष्मो मघवन्ते अस्ति शिक्षा सखिभ्यः पुरुहूत नृभ्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indra | śuṣmaḥ | magha-van | te | asti | śikṣa | sakhi-bhyaḥ | puru-hūta | nr̥-bhyaḥ || tvam | hi | dr̥ḷhā | magha-van | vi-cetāḥ | apa | vr̥dhi | pari-vr̥tam | na | rādhaḥ ||7.27.2||

IAST: tvaṁ hi dṛḻhā maghavan vicetā apā vṛdhi parivṛtaṁ na rādhaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Maghavan, hast rent strong places open: unclose for us, Wise God, thy hidden bounty.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि दृळ्हा मघवन्विचेता अपा वृधि परिवृतं न राधः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indra | śuṣmaḥ | magha-van | te | asti | śikṣa | sakhi-bhyaḥ | puru-hūta | nr̥-bhyaḥ || tvam | hi | dr̥ḷhā | magha-van | vi-cetāḥ | apa | vr̥dhi | pari-vr̥tam | na | rādhaḥ ||7.27.2||

IAST: indro rājā jagataś carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpaṁ yad asti
Griffith: King of the living world, of men, is Indra, of all in varied form that earth containeth.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो राजा जगतश्चर्षणीनामधि क्षमि विषुरूपं यदस्ति
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | rājā | jagataḥ | carṣaṇīnām | adhi | kṣami | viṣu-rūpam | yat | asti || tataḥ | dadāti | dāśuṣe | vasūni | codat | rādhaḥ | upa-stutaḥ | cit | arvāk ||7.27.3||

IAST: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaś cid arvāk
Griffith: Thence to the worshipper he giveth riches: may he enrich us also when we laud him.
Devanāgarī: ततो ददाति दाशुषे वसूनि चोदद्राध उपस्तुतश्चिदर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | rājā | jagataḥ | carṣaṇīnām | adhi | kṣami | viṣu-rūpam | yat | asti || tataḥ | dadāti | dāśuṣe | vasūni | codat | rādhaḥ | upa-stutaḥ | cit | arvāk ||7.27.3||

IAST: nū cin na indro maghavā sahūtī dāno vājaṁ ni yamate na ūtī
Griffith: Maghavan Indra, when we all invoke him, bountiful ever sendeth strength to aid us:
Devanāgarī: नू चिन्न इन्द्रो मघवा सहूती दानो वाजं नि यमते न ऊती
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | naḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | sa-hūtī | dānaḥ | vājam | ni | yamate | naḥ | ūtī || anūnā | yasya | dakṣiṇā | pīpāya | vāmam | nr̥-bhyaḥ | abhi-vītā | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||7.27.4||

IAST: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmaṁ nṛbhyo abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: Whose perfect guerdon, never failing, bringeth wealth to the men, to friends the thing they covet.
Devanāgarī: अनूना यस्य दक्षिणा पीपाय वामं नृभ्यो अभिवीता सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: nu | cit | naḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | sa-hūtī | dānaḥ | vājam | ni | yamate | naḥ | ūtī || anūnā | yasya | dakṣiṇā | pīpāya | vāmam | nr̥-bhyaḥ | abhi-vītā | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||7.27.4||

IAST: nū indra rāye varivas kṛdhī na ā te mano vavṛtyāma maghāya
Griffith: Quick, Indra, give us room and way to riches, and let us bring thy mind to grant us treasures,
Devanāgarī: नू इन्द्र राये वरिवस्कृधी न आ ते मनो ववृत्याम मघाय
pada pāṭha: nu | indra | rāye | varivaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | ā | te | manaḥ | vavr̥tyāma | maghāya || go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | vyantaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.27.5||

IAST: gomad aśvāvad rathavad vyanto yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: That we may win us cars and Steeds and cattle. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: गोमदश्वावद्रथवद्व्यन्तो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | indra | rāye | varivaḥ | kr̥dhi | naḥ | ā | te | manaḥ | vavr̥tyāma | maghāya || go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | vyantaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.27.5||

IAST: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvān arvāñcas te harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ
Griffith: COME to our prayers, O Indra, thou who knowest: let thy Bay Steeds be yoked and guided hither.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मा ण इन्द्रोप याहि विद्वानर्वाञ्चस्ते हरयः सन्तु युक्ताः
pada pāṭha: brahma | naḥ | indra | upa | yāhi | vidvān | arvāñcaḥ | te | harayaḥ | santu | yuktāḥ || viśve | cit | hi | tvā | vi-havanta | martāḥ | asmākam | it | śr̥ṇuhi | viśvam-inva ||7.28.1||

IAST: viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākam ic chṛṇuhi viśvaminva
Griffith: Though mortal men on every side invoke thee, still give thine ear to us, O All-impeller.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे चिद्धि त्वा विहवन्त मर्ता अस्माकमिच्छृणुहि विश्वमिन्व
pada pāṭha: brahma | naḥ | indra | upa | yāhi | vidvān | arvāñcaḥ | te | harayaḥ | santu | yuktāḥ || viśve | cit | hi | tvā | vi-havanta | martāḥ | asmākam | it | śr̥ṇuhi | viśvam-inva ||7.28.1||

IAST: havaṁ ta indra mahimā vy ānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinn ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: Thy greatness reacheth to our invocation, the sages' prayer which, Potent God, thou guardest.
Devanāgarī: हवं त इन्द्र महिमा व्यानड्ब्रह्म यत्पासि शवसिन्नृषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: havam | te | indra | mahimā | vi | ānaṭ | brahma | yat | pāsi | śavasin | r̥ṣīṇām || ā | yat | vajram | dadhiṣe | haste | ugra | ghoraḥ | san | kratvā | janiṣṭhāḥ | aṣāḷhaḥ ||7.28.2||

IAST: ā yad vajraṁ dadhiṣe hasta ugra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhā aṣāḻhaḥ
Griffith: What time thy hand, O Mighty, holds the thunder, awful in strength thou hast become resistless.
Devanāgarī: आ यद्वज्रं दधिषे हस्त उग्र घोरः सन्क्रत्वा जनिष्ठा अषाळ्हः
pada pāṭha: havam | te | indra | mahimā | vi | ānaṭ | brahma | yat | pāsi | śavasin | r̥ṣīṇām || ā | yat | vajram | dadhiṣe | haste | ugra | ghoraḥ | san | kratvā | janiṣṭhāḥ | aṣāḷhaḥ ||7.28.2||

IAST: tava praṇītīndra johuvānān saṁ yan nṝn na rodasī ninetha
Griffith: What time thou drewest both world-halves together, like heroes led by thee who call each other-
Devanāgarī: तव प्रणीतीन्द्र जोहुवानान्सं यन्नॄन्न रोदसी निनेथ
pada pāṭha: tava | pra-nītī | indra | johuvānān | sam | yat | nr̥̄n | na | rodasī iti | ninetha || mahe | kṣatrāya | śavase | hi | jajñe | atūtujim | cit | tūtujiḥ | aśiśnat ||7.28.3||

IAST: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe 'tūtujiṁ cit tūtujir aśiśnat
Griffith: For thou wast born for strength and high dominion-then e'en the active overthrew the sluggish.
Devanāgarī: महे क्षत्राय शवसे हि जज्ञेऽतूतुजिं चित्तूतुजिरशिश्नत्
pada pāṭha: tava | pra-nītī | indra | johuvānān | sam | yat | nr̥̄n | na | rodasī iti | ninetha || mahe | kṣatrāya | śavase | hi | jajñe | atūtujim | cit | tūtujiḥ | aśiśnat ||7.28.3||

IAST: ebhir na indrāhabhir daśasya durmitrāso hi kṣitayaḥ pavante
Griffith: Honour us in these present days, O Indra, for hostile men are making expiation.
Devanāgarī: एभिर्न इन्द्राहभिर्दशस्य दुर्मित्रासो हि क्षितयः पवन्ते
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | naḥ | indra | aha-bhiḥ | daśasya | duḥ-mitrāsaḥ | hi | kṣitayaḥ | pavante || prati | yat | caṣṭe | anr̥tam | anenāḥ | ava | dvitā | varuṇaḥ | māyī | naḥ | sāt ||7.28.4||

IAST: prati yac caṣṭe anṛtam anenā ava dvitā varuṇo māyī naḥ sāt
Griffith: Our sin that sinless Varuna discovered, the Wondrous-Wise hath long ago forgiven.
Devanāgarī: प्रति यच्चष्टे अनृतमनेना अव द्विता वरुणो मायी नः सात्
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | naḥ | indra | aha-bhiḥ | daśasya | duḥ-mitrāsaḥ | hi | kṣitayaḥ | pavante || prati | yat | caṣṭe | anr̥tam | anenāḥ | ava | dvitā | varuṇaḥ | māyī | naḥ | sāt ||7.28.4||

IAST: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ
Griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches,
Devanāgarī: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद्ददन्नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.28.5||

IAST: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: यो अर्चतो ब्रह्मकृतिमविष्ठो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.28.5||

IAST: ayaṁ soma indra tubhyaṁ sunva ā tu pra yāhi harivas tadokāḥ
Griffith: THIS Soma hath been pressed for thee, O Indra: come hither, Lord of Bays, for this thou lovest.
Devanāgarī: अयं सोम इन्द्र तुभ्यं सुन्व आ तु प्र याहि हरिवस्तदोकाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | indra | tubhyam | sunve | ā | tu | pra | yāhi | hari-vaḥ | tat-okāḥ || piba | tu | asya | su-sutasya | cāroḥ | dadaḥ | maghāni | magha-van | iyānaḥ ||7.29.1||

IAST: pibā tv asya suṣutasya cāror dado maghāni maghavann iyānaḥ
Griffith: Drink of this fair, this well-effused libation: Maghavan, give us wealth when we implore thee.
Devanāgarī: पिबा त्वस्य सुषुतस्य चारोर्ददो मघानि मघवन्नियानः
pada pāṭha: ayam | somaḥ | indra | tubhyam | sunve | ā | tu | pra | yāhi | hari-vaḥ | tat-okāḥ || piba | tu | asya | su-sutasya | cāroḥ | dadaḥ | maghāni | magha-van | iyānaḥ ||7.29.1||

IAST: brahman vīra brahmakṛtiṁ juṣāṇo 'rvācīno haribhir yāhi tūyam
Griffith: Come to us quickly with thy Bay Steeds, Hero, come to our prayer, accepting our devotion.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मन्वीर ब्रह्मकृतिं जुषाणोऽर्वाचीनो हरिभिर्याहि तूयम्
pada pāṭha: brahman | vīra | brahma-kr̥tim | juṣāṇaḥ | arvācīnaḥ | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam || asmin | ūm̐ iti | su | savane | mādayasva | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇavaḥ | imā | naḥ ||7.29.2||

IAST: asminn ū ṣu savane mādayasvopa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā naḥ
Griffith: Enjoy thyself aright at this libation, and listen thou unto the prayers we offer.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्नू षु सवने मादयस्वोप ब्रह्माणि शृणव इमा नः
pada pāṭha: brahman | vīra | brahma-kr̥tim | juṣāṇaḥ | arvācīnaḥ | hari-bhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam || asmin | ūm̐ iti | su | savane | mādayasva | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇavaḥ | imā | naḥ ||7.29.2||

IAST: kā te asty araṁkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnaṁ te maghavan dāśema
Griffith: What satisfaction do our hymns afford thee? When, Maghavan? Now let us do thee service.
Devanāgarī: का ते अस्त्यरंकृतिः सूक्तैः कदा नूनं ते मघवन्दाशेम
pada pāṭha: kā | te | asti | aram-kr̥tiḥ | su-uktaiḥ | kadā | nūnam | te | magha-van | dāśema || viśvāḥ | matīḥ | ā | tatane | tvā-yā | adha | me | indra | śr̥ṇavaḥ | havā | imā ||7.29.3||

IAST: viśvā matīr ā tatane tvāyādhā ma indra śṛṇavo havemā
Griffith: Hymns, only hymns, with love for thee, I weave thee: then hear, O Indra, these mine invocations.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा मतीरा ततने त्वायाधा म इन्द्र शृणवो हवेमा
pada pāṭha: kā | te | asti | aram-kr̥tiḥ | su-uktaiḥ | kadā | nūnam | te | magha-van | dāśema || viśvāḥ | matīḥ | ā | tatane | tvā-yā | adha | me | indra | śr̥ṇavaḥ | havā | imā ||7.29.3||

IAST: uto ghā te puruṣyā id āsan yeṣām pūrveṣām aśṛṇor ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: They, verily, were also human beings whom thou wast wont to hear, those earlier sages.
Devanāgarī: उतो घा ते पुरुष्या इदासन्येषां पूर्वेषामशृणोरृषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: uto iti | gha | te | puruṣyāḥ | it | āsan | yeṣām | pūrveṣām | aśr̥ṇoḥ | r̥ṣīṇām || adha | aham | tvā | magha-van | johavīmi | tvam | naḥ | indra | asi | pra-matiḥ | pitā-iva ||7.29.4||

IAST: adhāhaṁ tvā maghavañ johavīmi tvaṁ na indrāsi pramatiḥ piteva
Griffith: Hence I, O Indra Maghavan, invoke thee: thou art our Providence, even as a Father.
Devanāgarī: अधाहं त्वा मघवञ्जोहवीमि त्वं न इन्द्रासि प्रमतिः पितेव
pada pāṭha: uto iti | gha | te | puruṣyāḥ | it | āsan | yeṣām | pūrveṣām | aśr̥ṇoḥ | r̥ṣīṇām || adha | aham | tvā | magha-van | johavīmi | tvam | naḥ | indra | asi | pra-matiḥ | pitā-iva ||7.29.4||

IAST: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ
Griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra, that he may grant us gifts of ample riches,
Devanāgarī: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद्ददन्नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rayaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.29.5||

IAST: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: यो अर्चतो ब्रह्मकृतिमविष्ठो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rayaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.29.5||

IAST: ā no deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhavā vṛdha indra rāyo asya
Griffith: WITH power and strength, O Mighty God, approach us: be the augmenter, Indra, of these riches;
Devanāgarī: आ नो देव शवसा याहि शुष्मिन्भवा वृध इन्द्र रायो अस्य
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | deva | śavasā | yāhi | śuṣmin | bhava | vr̥dhaḥ | indra | rāyaḥ | asya || mahe | nr̥mṇāya | nr̥-pate | su-vajra | mahi | kṣatrāya | pauṁsyāya | śūra ||7.30.1||

IAST: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate suvajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṁsyāya śūra
Griffith: Strong Thunderer, Lord of men, for potent valour, for manly exploit and for high dominion.
Devanāgarī: महे नृम्णाय नृपते सुवज्र महि क्षत्राय पौंस्याय शूर
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | deva | śavasā | yāhi | śuṣmin | bhava | vr̥dhaḥ | indra | rāyaḥ | asya || mahe | nr̥mṇāya | nr̥-pate | su-vajra | mahi | kṣatrāya | pauṁsyāya | śūra ||7.30.1||

IAST: havanta u tvā havyaṁ vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau
Griffith: Thee, worth invoking, in the din of battle, heroes invoke in fray for life and sunlight.
Devanāgarī: हवन्त उ त्वा हव्यं विवाचि तनूषु शूराः सूर्यस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: havante | ūm̐ iti | tvā | havyam | vi-vāci | tanūṣu | śūrāḥ | sūryasya | sātau || tvam | viśveṣu | senyaḥ | janeṣu | tvam | vr̥trāṇi | randhaya | su-hantu ||7.30.2||

IAST: tvaṁ viśveṣu senyo janeṣu tvaṁ vṛtrāṇi randhayā suhantu
Griffith: Among all people thou art foremost fighter: give up our enemies to easy slaughter.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विश्वेषु सेन्यो जनेषु त्वं वृत्राणि रन्धया सुहन्तु
pada pāṭha: havante | ūm̐ iti | tvā | havyam | vi-vāci | tanūṣu | śūrāḥ | sūryasya | sātau || tvam | viśveṣu | senyaḥ | janeṣu | tvam | vr̥trāṇi | randhaya | su-hantu ||7.30.2||

IAST: ahā yad indra sudinā vyucchān dadho yat ketum upamaṁ samatsu
Griffith: When fair bright days shall dawn on us, O Indra, and thou shalt bring thy banner near in battle,
Devanāgarī: अहा यदिन्द्र सुदिना व्युच्छान्दधो यत्केतुमुपमं समत्सु
pada pāṭha: ahā | yat | indra | su-dinā | vi-ucchān | dadhaḥ | yat | ketum | upa-mam | samat-su || ni | agniḥ | sīdat | asuraḥ | na | hotā | huvānaḥ | atra | su-bhagāya | devān ||7.30.3||

IAST: ny agniḥ sīdad asuro na hotā huvāno atra subhagāya devān
Griffith: Agni the Asura shall sit as Herald, calling Gods hither for our great good fortune.
Devanāgarī: न्यग्निः सीददसुरो न होता हुवानो अत्र सुभगाय देवान्
pada pāṭha: ahā | yat | indra | su-dinā | vi-ucchān | dadhaḥ | yat | ketum | upa-mam | samat-su || ni | agniḥ | sīdat | asuraḥ | na | hotā | huvānaḥ | atra | su-bhagāya | devān ||7.30.3||

IAST: vayaṁ te ta indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadato maghāni
Griffith: Thine are we, Indra, thine, both these who praise thee, and those who give rich gifts, O God and Hero.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते त इन्द्र ये च देव स्तवन्त शूर ददतो मघानि
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | te | indra | ye | ca | deva | stavanta | śūra | dadataḥ | maghāni || yaccha | sūri-bhyaḥ | upa-mam | varūtham | su-ābhuvaḥ | jaraṇām | aśnavanta ||7.30.4||

IAST: yacchā sūribhya upamaṁ varūthaṁ svābhuvo jaraṇām aśnavanta
Griffith: Grant to our princes excellent protection, may they wax old and still be strong and happy.
Devanāgarī: यच्छा सूरिभ्य उपमं वरूथं स्वाभुवो जरणामश्नवन्त
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | te | indra | ye | ca | deva | stavanta | śūra | dadataḥ | maghāni || yaccha | sūri-bhyaḥ | upa-mam | varūtham | su-ābhuvaḥ | jaraṇām | aśnavanta ||7.30.4||

IAST: vocemed indram maghavānam enam maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadan naḥ
Griffith: We will address this liberal Lord, this Indra that he may grant us gifts of ample riches:
Devanāgarī: वोचेमेदिन्द्रं मघवानमेनं महो रायो राधसो यद्ददन्नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.30.5||

IAST: yo arcato brahmakṛtim aviṣṭho yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Best favourer of the singer's prayer and praises. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: यो अर्चतो ब्रह्मकृतिमविष्ठो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vocema | it | indram | magha-vānam | enam | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | rādhasaḥ | yat | dadat | naḥ || yaḥ | arcataḥ | brahma-kr̥tim | aviṣṭhaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.30.5||

IAST: pra va indrāya mādanaṁ haryaśvāya gāyata
Griffith: SING ye a song, to make him glad, to Indra, Lord of Tawny Steeds,
Devanāgarī: प्र व इन्द्राय मादनं हर्यश्वाय गायत
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | indrāya | mādanam | hari-aśvāya | gāyata || sakhāyaḥ | soma-pāvne ||7.31.1||

IAST: sakhāyaḥ somapāvne
Griffith: The Soma-drinker, O my friends.
Devanāgarī: सखायः सोमपाव्ने
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | indrāya | mādanam | hari-aśvāya | gāyata || sakhāyaḥ | soma-pāvne ||7.31.1||

IAST: śaṁsed ukthaṁ sudānava uta dyukṣaṁ yathā naraḥ
Griffith: To him the Bounteous say the laud, and let us glorify,
Devanāgarī: शंसेदुक्थं सुदानव उत द्युक्षं यथा नरः
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | it | uktham | su-dānave | uta | dyukṣam | yathā | naraḥ || cakr̥ma | satya-rādhase ||7.31.2||

IAST: cakṛmā satyarādhase
Griffith: as men May do, the Giver of true gifts.
Devanāgarī: चकृमा सत्यराधसे
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | it | uktham | su-dānave | uta | dyukṣam | yathā | naraḥ || cakr̥ma | satya-rādhase ||7.31.2||

IAST: tvaṁ na indra vājayus tvaṁ gavyuḥ śatakrato
Griffith: O Indra, Lord of boundless might, for us thou winnest strength and kine,
Devanāgarī: त्वं न इन्द्र वाजयुस्त्वं गव्युः शतक्रतो
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | vāja-yuḥ | tvam | gavyuḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || tvam | hiraṇya-yuḥ | vaso iti ||7.31.3||

IAST: tvaṁ hiraṇyayur vaso
Griffith: Thou winnest gold for us, Good Lord.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हिरण्ययुर्वसो
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | indra | vāja-yuḥ | tvam | gavyuḥ | śatakrato iti śata-krato || tvam | hiraṇya-yuḥ | vaso iti ||7.31.3||

IAST: vayam indra tvāyavo 'bhi pra ṇonumo vṛṣan
Griffith: Faithful to thee we loudly sing, heroic Indra, songs to thee:
Devanāgarī: वयमिन्द्र त्वायवोऽभि प्र णोनुमो वृषन्
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | abhi | pra | nonumaḥ | vr̥ṣan || viddhi | tu | asya | naḥ | vaso iti ||7.31.4||

IAST: viddhī tv asya no vaso
Griffith: Mark, O Good Lord, this act of ours.
Devanāgarī: विद्धी त्वस्य नो वसो
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tvā-yavaḥ | abhi | pra | nonumaḥ | vr̥ṣan || viddhi | tu | asya | naḥ | vaso iti ||7.31.4||

IAST: mā no nide ca vaktave 'ryo randhīr arāvṇe
Griffith: Give us not up to man's reproach, to foeman's hateful calumny:
Devanāgarī: मा नो निदे च वक्तवेऽर्यो रन्धीरराव्णे
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | nide | ca | vaktave | aryaḥ | randhīḥ | arāvṇe || tve iti | api | kratuḥ | mama ||7.31.5||

IAST: tve api kratur mama
Griffith: In thee alone is all my strength.
Devanāgarī: त्वे अपि क्रतुर्मम
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | nide | ca | vaktave | aryaḥ | randhīḥ | arāvṇe || tve iti | api | kratuḥ | mama ||7.31.5||

IAST: tvaṁ varmāsi saprathaḥ puroyodhaś ca vṛtrahan
Griffith: Thou art mine ample coat of mail, my Champion, Vrtra-Slayer, thou:
Devanāgarī: त्वं वर्मासि सप्रथः पुरोयोधश्च वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | varma | asi | sa-prathaḥ | puraḥ-yodhaḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || tvayā | prati | bruve | yujā ||7.31.6||

IAST: tvayā prati bruve yujā
Griffith: With thee for Friend I brave the foe.
Devanāgarī: त्वया प्रति ब्रुवे युजा
pada pāṭha: tvam | varma | asi | sa-prathaḥ | puraḥ-yodhaḥ | ca | vr̥tra-han || tvayā | prati | bruve | yujā ||7.31.6||

IAST: mahām̐ utāsi yasya te 'nu svadhāvarī sahaḥ
Griffith: Yea, great art thou whose conquering might two independent Powers confess.
Devanāgarī: महाँ उतासि यस्य तेऽनु स्वधावरी सहः
pada pāṭha: mahān | uta | asi | yasya | te | anu | svadhāvarī iti svadhā-varī | sahaḥ || mamnāte iti | indra | rodasī iti ||7.31.7||

IAST: mamnāte indra rodasī
Griffith: The Heaven, O India, and the Earth.
Devanāgarī: मम्नाते इन्द्र रोदसी
pada pāṭha: mahān | uta | asi | yasya | te | anu | svadhāvarī iti svadhā-varī | sahaḥ || mamnāte iti | indra | rodasī iti ||7.31.7||

IAST: taṁ tvā marutvatī pari bhuvad vāṇī sayāvarī
Griffith: So let the voice surround thee, which attends the Maruts on their way,
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा मरुत्वती परि भुवद्वाणी सयावरी
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | marutvatī | pari | bhuvat | vāṇī | sa-yāvarī || nakṣamāṇā | saha | dyu-bhiḥ ||7.31.8||

IAST: nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ
Griffith: Reaching thee with the rays of light.
Devanāgarī: नक्षमाणा सह द्युभिः
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | marutvatī | pari | bhuvat | vāṇī | sa-yāvarī || nakṣamāṇā | saha | dyu-bhiḥ ||7.31.8||

IAST: ūrdhvāsas tvānv indavo bhuvan dasmam upa dyavi
Griffith: Let the ascending drops attain to thee, the Wondrous God, in heaven:
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वासस्त्वान्विन्दवो भुवन्दस्ममुप द्यवि
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvāsaḥ | tvā | anu | indavaḥ | bhuvan | dasmam | upa | dyavi || sam | te | namanta | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||7.31.9||

IAST: saṁ te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: Let all the folk bow down to thee.
Devanāgarī: सं ते नमन्त कृष्टयः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvāsaḥ | tvā | anu | indavaḥ | bhuvan | dasmam | upa | dyavi || sam | te | namanta | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ ||7.31.9||

IAST: pra vo mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatiṁ kṛṇudhvam
Griffith: Bring to the Wise, the Great, who waxeth mighty, your offerings, and make ready your devotion;
Devanāgarī: प्र वो महे महिवृधे भरध्वं प्रचेतसे प्र सुमतिं कृणुध्वम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahe | mahi-vr̥dhe | bharadhvam | pra-cetase | pra | su-matim | kr̥ṇudhvam || viśaḥ | pūrvīḥ | pra | cara | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||7.31.10||

IAST: viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra carā carṣaṇiprāḥ
Griffith: To many clans he goeth, man's controller.
Devanāgarī: विशः पूर्वीः प्र चरा चर्षणिप्राः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahe | mahi-vr̥dhe | bharadhvam | pra-cetase | pra | su-matim | kr̥ṇudhvam || viśaḥ | pūrvīḥ | pra | cara | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||7.31.10||

IAST: uruvyacase mahine suvṛktim indrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ
Griffith: For Indra, the sublime, the far-pervading, have singers generated prayer and praises:
Devanāgarī: उरुव्यचसे महिने सुवृक्तिमिन्द्राय ब्रह्म जनयन्त विप्राः
pada pāṭha: uru-vyacase | mahine | su-vr̥ktim | indrāya | brahma | janayanta | viprāḥ || tasya | vratāni | na | minanti | dhīrāḥ ||7.31.11||

IAST: tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ
Griffith: The sages never violate his statutes.
Devanāgarī: तस्य व्रतानि न मिनन्ति धीराः
pada pāṭha: uru-vyacase | mahine | su-vr̥ktim | indrāya | brahma | janayanta | viprāḥ || tasya | vratāni | na | minanti | dhīrāḥ ||7.31.11||

IAST: indraṁ vāṇīr anuttamanyum eva satrā rājānaṁ dadhire sahadhyai
Griffith: The choirs have stablished Indra King for ever, for victory, him whose anger is resistless:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वाणीरनुत्तमन्युमेव सत्रा राजानं दधिरे सहध्यै
pada pāṭha: indram | vāṇīḥ | anutta-manyum | eva | satrā | rājānam | dadhire | sahadhyai || hari-aśvāya | barhaya | sam | āpīn ||7.31.12||

IAST: haryaśvāya barhayā sam āpīn
Griffith: And, for the Bays' Lord, strengthened those he loveth.
Devanāgarī: हर्यश्वाय बर्हया समापीन्
pada pāṭha: indram | vāṇīḥ | anutta-manyum | eva | satrā | rājānam | dadhire | sahadhyai || hari-aśvāya | barhaya | sam | āpīn ||7.31.12||

IAST: mo ṣu tvā vāghataś canāre asman ni rīraman
Griffith: LET none, no, not thy worshippers, delay thee far away from us.
Devanāgarī: मो षु त्वा वाघतश्चनारे अस्मन्नि रीरमन्
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | tvā | vāghataḥ | cana | āre | asmat | ni | rīraman || ārāttāt | cit | sadha-mādam | naḥ | ā | gahi | iha | vā | san | upa | śrudhi ||7.32.1||

IAST: ārāttāc cit sadhamādaṁ na ā gahīha vā sann upa śrudhi
Griffith: Even from far away come thou unto our feast, or listen if already here.
Devanāgarī: आरात्ताच्चित्सधमादं न आ गहीह वा सन्नुप श्रुधि
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | tvā | vāghataḥ | cana | āre | asmat | ni | rīraman || ārāttāt | cit | sadha-mādam | naḥ | ā | gahi | iha | vā | san | upa | śrudhi ||7.32.1||

IAST: ime hi te brahmakṛtaḥ sute sacā madhau na makṣa āsate
Griffith: For here, like flies on honey, these who pray to thee sit by the juice that they have poured.
Devanāgarī: इमे हि ते ब्रह्मकृतः सुते सचा मधौ न मक्ष आसते
pada pāṭha: ime | hi | te | brahma-kr̥taḥ | sute | sacā | madhau | na | makṣaḥ | āsate || indre | kāmam | jaritāraḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | rathe | na | pādam | ā | dadhuḥ ||7.32.2||

IAST: indre kāmaṁ jaritāro vasūyavo rathe na pādam ā dadhuḥ
Griffith: Wealth-craving singers have on Indra set their hope, as men set foot upon a car.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रे कामं जरितारो वसूयवो रथे न पादमा दधुः
pada pāṭha: ime | hi | te | brahma-kr̥taḥ | sute | sacā | madhau | na | makṣaḥ | āsate || indre | kāmam | jaritāraḥ | vasu-yavaḥ | rathe | na | pādam | ā | dadhuḥ ||7.32.2||

IAST: rāyaskāmo vajrahastaṁ sudakṣiṇam putro na pitaraṁ huve
Griffith: Longing for wealth I call on him, the Thunderer with the strong right hand,
Devanāgarī: रायस्कामो वज्रहस्तं सुदक्षिणं पुत्रो न पितरं हुवे
pada pāṭha: rāyaḥ-kāmaḥ | vajra-hastam | su-dakṣiṇam | putraḥ | na | pitaram | huve ||7.32.3||

IAST: ima indrāya sunvire somāso dadhyāśiraḥ
Griffith: These Soma juices, mixed with curd, have been expressed for Indra here.
Devanāgarī: ताँ आ मदाय वज्रहस्त पीतये हरिभ्यां याह्योक आ
pada pāṭha: ime | indrāya | sunvire | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || tān | ā | madāya | vajra-hasta | pītaye | hari-bhyām | yāhi | okaḥ | ā ||7.32.4||

IAST: tām̐ ā madāya vajrahasta pītaye haribhyāṁ yāhy oka ā
Griffith: Come with thy Bay Steeds, Thunder-wielder, to our home, to drink them till they make thee glad.
Devanāgarī: इम इन्द्राय सुन्विरे सोमासो दध्याशिरः
pada pāṭha: ime | indrāya | sunvire | somāsaḥ | dadhi-āśiraḥ || tān | ā | madāya | vajra-hasta | pītaye | hari-bhyām | yāhi | okaḥ | ā ||7.32.4||

IAST: śravac chrutkarṇa īyate vasūnāṁ nū cin no mardhiṣad giraḥ
Griffith: May he whose ear is open hear us. He is asked for wealth: will he despise our prayer?
Devanāgarī: सद्यश्चिद्यः सहस्राणि शता ददन्नकिर्दित्सन्तमा मिनत्
pada pāṭha: śravat | śrut-karṇaḥ | īyate | vasūnām | nu | cit | naḥ | mardhiṣat | giraḥ || sadyaḥ | cit | yaḥ | sahasrāṇi | śatā | dadat | nakiḥ | ditsantam | ā | minat ||7.32.5||

IAST: sadyaś cid yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadan nakir ditsantam ā minat
Griffith: Him who bestows at once a hundred thousand gifts none shall restrain when he would give.
Devanāgarī: श्रवच्छ्रुत्कर्ण ईयते वसूनां नू चिन्नो मर्धिषद्गिरः
pada pāṭha: śravat | śrut-karṇaḥ | īyate | vasūnām | nu | cit | naḥ | mardhiṣat | giraḥ || sadyaḥ | cit | yaḥ | sahasrāṇi | śatā | dadat | nakiḥ | ditsantam | ā | minat ||7.32.5||

IAST: sa vīro apratiṣkuta indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: The hero never checked by men hath gained his strength through Indra, he
Devanāgarī: यस्ते गभीरा सवनानि वृत्रहन्सुनोत्या च धावति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vīraḥ | aprati-skutaḥ | indreṇa | śūśuve | nr̥-bhiḥ || yaḥ | te | gabhīrā | savanāni | vr̥tra-han | sunoti | ā | ca | dhāvati ||7.32.6||

IAST: yas te gabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunoty ā ca dhāvati
Griffith: Who presses out and pours his deep libations forth, O Vrtra-slayer, unto thee.
Devanāgarī: स वीरो अप्रतिष्कुत इन्द्रेण शूशुवे नृभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vīraḥ | aprati-skutaḥ | indreṇa | śūśuve | nr̥-bhiḥ || yaḥ | te | gabhīrā | savanāni | vr̥tra-han | sunoti | ā | ca | dhāvati ||7.32.6||

IAST: bhavā varūtham maghavan maghonāṁ yat samajāsi śardhataḥ
Griffith: When thou dost drive the fighting men together be, thou Mighty One, the mighty's shield.
Devanāgarī: वि त्वाहतस्य वेदनं भजेमह्या दूणाशो भरा गयम्
pada pāṭha: bhava | varūtham | magha-van | maghonām | yat | sam-ajāsi | śardhataḥ || vi | tvā-hatasya | vedanam | bhajemahi | ā | duḥ-naśaḥ | bhara | gayam ||7.32.7||

IAST: vi tvāhatasya vedanam bhajemahy ā dūṇāśo bharā gayam
Griffith: May we divide the wealth of him whom thou hast slain: bring us, Unreachable, his goods.
Devanāgarī: भवा वरूथं मघवन्मघोनां यत्समजासि शर्धतः
pada pāṭha: bhava | varūtham | magha-van | maghonām | yat | sam-ajāsi | śardhataḥ || vi | tvā-hatasya | vedanam | bhajemahi | ā | duḥ-naśaḥ | bhara | gayam ||7.32.7||

IAST: sunotā somapāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe
Griffith: For Indra, Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, press the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: पचता पक्तीरवसे कृणुध्वमित्पृणन्नित्पृणते मयः
pada pāṭha: sunota | soma-pāvne | somam | indrāya | vajriṇe || pacata | paktīḥ | avase | kr̥ṇudhvam | it | pr̥ṇan | it | pr̥ṇate | mayaḥ ||7.32.8||

IAST: pacatā paktīr avase kṛṇudhvam it pṛṇann it pṛṇate mayaḥ
Griffith: Make ready your dressed meats: cause him to favour us. The Giver blesses him who gives.
Devanāgarī: सुनोता सोमपाव्ने सोममिन्द्राय वज्रिणे
pada pāṭha: sunota | soma-pāvne | somam | indrāya | vajriṇe || pacata | paktīḥ | avase | kr̥ṇudhvam | it | pr̥ṇan | it | pr̥ṇate | mayaḥ ||7.32.8||

IAST: mā sredhata somino dakṣatā mahe kṛṇudhvaṁ rāya ātuje
Griffith: Grudge not, ye Soma pourers; stir you, pay the rites, for wealth, to the great Conqueror.
Devanāgarī: तरणिरिज्जयति क्षेति पुष्यति न देवासः कवत्नवे
pada pāṭha: mā | sredhata | sominaḥ | dakṣata | mahe | kr̥ṇudhvam | rāye | ā-tuje || taraṇiḥ | it | jayati | kṣeti | puṣyati | na | devāsaḥ | kavatnave ||7.32.9||

IAST: taraṇir ij jayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave
Griffith: Only the active conquers dwells in peace, and thrives: not for the niggard are the Gods.
Devanāgarī: मा स्रेधत सोमिनो दक्षता महे कृणुध्वं राय आतुजे
pada pāṭha: mā | sredhata | sominaḥ | dakṣata | mahe | kr̥ṇudhvam | rāye | ā-tuje || taraṇiḥ | it | jayati | kṣeti | puṣyati | na | devāsaḥ | kavatnave ||7.32.9||

IAST: nakiḥ sudāso ratham pary āsa na rīramat
Griffith: No one hath overturned or stayed the car of him who freely gives.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो यस्याविता यस्य मरुतो गमत्स गोमति व्रजे
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | su-dāsaḥ | ratham | pari | āsa | na | rīramat || indraḥ | yasya | avitā | yasya | marutaḥ | gamat | saḥ | go-mati | vraje ||7.32.10||

IAST: indro yasyāvitā yasya maruto gamat sa gomati vraje
Griffith: The man whom Indra and the Marut host defend comes to a stable full of kine.
Devanāgarī: नकिः सुदासो रथं पर्यास न रीरमत्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | su-dāsaḥ | ratham | pari | āsa | na | rīramat || indraḥ | yasya | avitā | yasya | marutaḥ | gamat | saḥ | go-mati | vraje ||7.32.10||

IAST: gamad vājaṁ vājayann indra martyo yasya tvam avitā bhuvaḥ
Griffith: Indra, that man when fighting shall obtain the spoil, whose strong defender thou wilt be.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं बोध्यविता रथानामस्माकं शूर नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: gamat | vājam | vājayan | indra | martyaḥ | yasya | tvam | avitā | bhuvaḥ || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | rathānām | asmākam | śūra | nr̥ṇām ||7.32.11||

IAST: asmākam bodhy avitā rathānām asmākaṁ śūra nṛṇām
Griffith: Be thou the gracious helper, Hero I of our cars, be thou the helper of our men.
Devanāgarī: गमद्वाजं वाजयन्निन्द्र मर्त्यो यस्य त्वमविता भुवः
pada pāṭha: gamat | vājam | vājayan | indra | martyaḥ | yasya | tvam | avitā | bhuvaḥ || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | rathānām | asmākam | śūra | nr̥ṇām ||7.32.11||

IAST: ud in nv asya ricyate 'ṁśo dhanaṁ na jigyuṣaḥ
Griffith: His portion is exceeding great like a victorious soldier's spoil.
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्रो हरिवान्न दभन्ति तं रिपो दक्षं दधाति सोमिनि
pada pāṭha: ut | it | nu | asya | ricyate | aṁśaḥ | dhanam | na | jigyuṣaḥ || yaḥ | indraḥ | hari-vān | na | dabhanti | tam | ripaḥ | dakṣam | dadhāti | somini ||7.32.12||

IAST: ya indro harivān na dabhanti taṁ ripo dakṣaṁ dadhāti somini
Griffith: Him who is Indra, Lord of Bays, no foes subdue. He gives the Soma-pourer strength.
Devanāgarī: उदिन्न्वस्य रिच्यतेंऽशो धनं न जिग्युषः
pada pāṭha: ut | it | nu | asya | ricyate | aṁśaḥ | dhanam | na | jigyuṣaḥ || yaḥ | indraḥ | hari-vān | na | dabhanti | tam | ripaḥ | dakṣam | dadhāti | somini ||7.32.12||

IAST: mantram akharvaṁ sudhitaṁ supeśasaṁ dadhāta yajñiyeṣv ā
Griffith: Make for the Holy Gods a hymn that is not mean, but well-arranged and fair of form.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीश्चन प्रसितयस्तरन्ति तं य इन्द्रे कर्मणा भुवत्
pada pāṭha: mantram | akharvam | su-dhitam | su-peśasam | dadhāta | yajñiyeṣu | ā || pūrvīḥ | cana | pra-sitayaḥ | taranti | tam | yaḥ | indre | karmaṇā | bhuvat ||7.32.13||

IAST: pūrvīś cana prasitayas taranti taṁ ya indre karmaṇā bhuvat
Griffith: Even many snares and bonds subdue not him who dwells with Indra through his sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: मन्त्रमखर्वं सुधितं सुपेशसं दधात यज्ञियेष्वा
pada pāṭha: mantram | akharvam | su-dhitam | su-peśasam | dadhāta | yajñiyeṣu | ā || pūrvīḥ | cana | pra-sitayaḥ | taranti | tam | yaḥ | indre | karmaṇā | bhuvat ||7.32.13||

IAST: kas tam indra tvāvasum ā martyo dadharṣati
Griffith: Indra, what mortal will attack the man who hath his wealth in thee?
Devanāgarī: श्रद्धा इत्ते मघवन्पार्ये दिवि वाजी वाजं सिषासति
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | tam | indra | tvā-vasum | ā | martyaḥ | dadharṣati || śraddhā | it | te | magha-van | pārye | divi | vājī | vājam | sisāsati ||7.32.14||

IAST: śraddhā it te maghavan pārye divi vājī vājaṁ siṣāsati
Griffith: The strong will win the spoil on the decisive day through faith in thee, O Maghavan.
Devanāgarī: कस्तमिन्द्र त्वावसुमा मर्त्यो दधर्षति
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | tam | indra | tvā-vasum | ā | martyaḥ | dadharṣati || śraddhā | it | te | magha-van | pārye | divi | vājī | vājam | sisāsati ||7.32.14||

IAST: maghonaḥ sma vṛtrahatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu
Griffith: In battles with the foe urge on our mighty ones who give the treasures dear to thee,
Devanāgarī: तव प्रणीती हर्यश्व सूरिभिर्विश्वा तरेम दुरिता
pada pāṭha: maghonaḥ | sma | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | codaya | ye | dadati | priyā | vasu || tava | pra-nītī | hari-aśva | sūri-bhiḥ | viśvā | tarema | duḥ-itā ||7.32.15||

IAST: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhir viśvā tarema duritā
Griffith: And may we with our princes, Lord of Tawny Steeds! pass through all peril, led by thee.
Devanāgarī: मघोनः स्म वृत्रहत्येषु चोदय ये ददति प्रिया वसु
pada pāṭha: maghonaḥ | sma | vr̥tra-hatyeṣu | codaya | ye | dadati | priyā | vasu || tava | pra-nītī | hari-aśva | sūri-bhiḥ | viśvā | tarema | duḥ-itā ||7.32.15||

IAST: taved indrāvamaṁ vasu tvam puṣyasi madhyamam
Griffith: Thine, Indra, is the lowest wealth, thou cherishest the mid-most wealth,
Devanāgarī: सत्रा विश्वस्य परमस्य राजसि नकिष्ट्वा गोषु वृण्वते
pada pāṭha: tava | it | indra | avamam | vasu | tvam | puṣyasi | madhyamam || satrā | viśvasya | paramasya | rājasi | nakiḥ | tvā | goṣu | vr̥ṇvate ||7.32.16||

IAST: satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakiṣ ṭvā goṣu vṛṇvate
Griffith: Thou ever rulest all the highest: in the fray for cattle none resisteth thee.
Devanāgarī: तवेदिन्द्रावमं वसु त्वं पुष्यसि मध्यमम्
pada pāṭha: tava | it | indra | avamam | vasu | tvam | puṣyasi | madhyamam || satrā | viśvasya | paramasya | rājasi | nakiḥ | tvā | goṣu | vr̥ṇvate ||7.32.16||

IAST: tvaṁ viśvasya dhanadā asi śruto ya īm bhavanty ājayaḥ
Griffith: Thou art renowned as giving wealth to every one in all the battles that are fought.
Devanāgarī: तवायं विश्वः पुरुहूत पार्थिवोऽवस्युर्नाम भिक्षते
pada pāṭha: tvam | viśvasya | dhana-dāḥ | asi | śrutaḥ | ye | īm | bhavanti | ājayaḥ || tava | ayam | viśvaḥ | puru-hūta | pārthivaḥ | avasyuḥ | nāma | bhikṣate ||7.32.17||

IAST: tavāyaṁ viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivo 'vasyur nāma bhikṣate
Griffith: Craving protection, all these people of the earth, O Much-invoked, implore thy name.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विश्वस्य धनदा असि श्रुतो य ईं भवन्त्याजयः
pada pāṭha: tvam | viśvasya | dhana-dāḥ | asi | śrutaḥ | ye | īm | bhavanti | ājayaḥ || tava | ayam | viśvaḥ | puru-hūta | pārthivaḥ | avasyuḥ | nāma | bhikṣate ||7.32.17||

IAST: yad indra yāvatas tvam etāvad aham īśīya
Griffith: If I, O Indra, were the Lord of riches ample as thine own,
Devanāgarī: स्तोतारमिद्दिधिषेय रदावसो न पापत्वाय रासीय
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | yāvataḥ | tvam | etāvat | aham | īśīya || stotāram | it | didhiṣeya | radavaso iti rada-vaso | na | pāpa-tvāya | rāsīya ||7.32.18||

IAST: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya
Griffith: I should support the singer, God. who givest wealth! and not abandon him to woe.
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र यावतस्त्वमेतावदहमीशीय
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | yāvataḥ | tvam | etāvat | aham | īśīya || stotāram | it | didhiṣeya | radavaso iti rada-vaso | na | pāpa-tvāya | rāsīya ||7.32.18||

IAST: śikṣeyam in mahayate dive-dive rāya ā kuhacidvide
Griffith: Each day would I enrich the man who sang my praise, in whatsoever place he were.
Devanāgarī: नहि त्वदन्यन्मघवन्न आप्यं वस्यो अस्ति पिता चन
pada pāṭha: śikṣeyam | it | maha-yate | dive-dive | rāyaḥ | ā | kuhacit-vide || nahi | tvat | anyat | magha-van | naḥ | āpyam | vasyaḥ | asti | pitā | cana ||7.32.19||

IAST: nahi tvad anyan maghavan na āpyaṁ vasyo asti pitā cana
Griffith: No kinship is there better, Maghavan, than thine: a father even is no more.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षेयमिन्महयते दिवेदिवे राय आ कुहचिद्विदे
pada pāṭha: śikṣeyam | it | maha-yate | dive-dive | rāyaḥ | ā | kuhacit-vide || nahi | tvat | anyat | magha-van | naḥ | āpyam | vasyaḥ | asti | pitā | cana ||7.32.19||

IAST: taraṇir it siṣāsati vājam puraṁdhyā yujā
Griffith: With Plenty for his true ally the active man will gain the spoil.
Devanāgarī: आ व इन्द्रं पुरुहूतं नमे गिरा नेमिं तष्टेव सुद्र्वम्
pada pāṭha: taraṇiḥ | it | sisāsati | vājam | puram-dhyā | yujā || ā | vaḥ | indram | puru-hūtam | name | girā | nemim | taṣṭā-iva | su-drvam ||7.32.20||

IAST: ā va indram puruhūtaṁ name girā nemiṁ taṣṭeva sudrvam
Griffith: Your Indra, Much-invoked, I bend with song, as bends a wright his wheel of solid wood.
Devanāgarī: तरणिरित्सिषासति वाजं पुरंध्या युजा
pada pāṭha: taraṇiḥ | it | sisāsati | vājam | puram-dhyā | yujā || ā | vaḥ | indram | puru-hūtam | name | girā | nemim | taṣṭā-iva | su-drvam ||7.32.20||

IAST: na duṣṭutī martyo vindate vasu na sredhantaṁ rayir naśat
Griffith: A moral wins no riches by unworthy praise: wealth comes not to the niggard churl.
Devanāgarī: सुशक्तिरिन्मघवन्तुभ्यं मावते देष्णं यत्पार्ये दिवि
pada pāṭha: na | duḥ-stutī | martyaḥ | vindate | vasu | na | sredhantam | rayiḥ | naśat || su-śaktiḥ | it | magha-van | tubhyam | mā-vate | deṣṇam | yat | pārye | divi ||7.32.21||

IAST: suśaktir in maghavan tubhyam māvate deṣṇaṁ yat pārye divi
Griffith: Light is the task to give, O Maghavan, to one like me on the decisive day.
Devanāgarī: न दुष्टुती मर्त्यो विन्दते वसु न स्रेधन्तं रयिर्नशत्
pada pāṭha: na | duḥ-stutī | martyaḥ | vindate | vasu | na | sredhantam | rayiḥ | naśat || su-śaktiḥ | it | magha-van | tubhyam | mā-vate | deṣṇam | yat | pārye | divi ||7.32.21||

IAST: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ
Griffith: Like kine unmilked we call aloud, Hero, to thee, and sing thy praise,
Devanāgarī: ईशानमस्य जगतः स्वर्दृशमीशानमिन्द्र तस्थुषः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | śūra | nonumaḥ | adugdhāḥ-iva | dhenavaḥ || īśānam | asya | jagataḥ | svaḥ-dr̥śam | īśānam | indra | tasthuṣaḥ ||7.32.22||

IAST: īśānam asya jagataḥ svardṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ
Griffith: Looker on heavenly light, Lord of this moving world, Lord, Indra, of what moveth not.
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा शूर नोनुमोऽदुग्धा इव धेनवः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | śūra | nonumaḥ | adugdhāḥ-iva | dhenavaḥ || īśānam | asya | jagataḥ | svaḥ-dr̥śam | īśānam | indra | tasthuṣaḥ ||7.32.22||

IAST: na tvāvām̐ anyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate
Griffith: None other like to thee, of earth or of the heavens, hath been or ever will be born.
Devanāgarī: अश्वायन्तो मघवन्निन्द्र वाजिनो गव्यन्तस्त्वा हवामहे
pada pāṭha: na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | divyaḥ | na | pārthivaḥ | na | jātaḥ | na | janiṣyate || aśva-yantaḥ | magha-van | indra | vājinaḥ | gavyantaḥ | tvā | havāmahe ||7.32.23||

IAST: aśvāyanto maghavann indra vājino gavyantas tvā havāmahe
Griffith: Desiring horses, Indra Maghavan! and kine, as men of might we call on thee.
Devanāgarī: न त्वावाँ अन्यो दिव्यो न पार्थिवो न जातो न जनिष्यते
pada pāṭha: na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | divyaḥ | na | pārthivaḥ | na | jātaḥ | na | janiṣyate || aśva-yantaḥ | magha-van | indra | vājinaḥ | gavyantaḥ | tvā | havāmahe ||7.32.23||

IAST: abhī ṣatas tad ā bharendra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ
Griffith: Bring, Indra, the Victorious Ones; bring, elder thou, the younger host.
Devanāgarī: पुरूवसुर्हि मघवन्सनादसि भरेभरे च हव्यः
pada pāṭha: abhi | sataḥ | tat | ā | bhara | indra | jyāyaḥ | kanīyasaḥ || puru-vasuḥ | hi | magha-van | sanāt | asi | bhare-bhare | ca | havyaḥ ||7.32.24||

IAST: purūvasur hi maghavan sanād asi bhare-bhare ca havyaḥ
Griffith: For, Maghavan, thou art rich in treasures from of old, and must be called in every fight.
Devanāgarī: अभी षतस्तदा भरेन्द्र ज्यायः कनीयसः
pada pāṭha: abhi | sataḥ | tat | ā | bhara | indra | jyāyaḥ | kanīyasaḥ || puru-vasuḥ | hi | magha-van | sanāt | asi | bhare-bhare | ca | havyaḥ ||7.32.24||

IAST: parā ṇudasva maghavann amitrān suvedā no vasū kṛdhi
Griffith: Drive thou away our enemies, O Maghavan: make riches easy to be won.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने भवा वृधः सखीनाम्
pada pāṭha: parā | nudasva | magha-van | amitrān | su-vedā | naḥ | vasu | kr̥dhi || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | mahā-dhane | bhava | vr̥dhaḥ | sakhīnām ||7.32.25||

IAST: asmākam bodhy avitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām
Griffith: Be thou our good Protector in the strife for spoil: Cherisher of our friends be thou.
Devanāgarī: परा णुदस्व मघवन्नमित्रान्सुवेदा नो वसू कृधि
pada pāṭha: parā | nudasva | magha-van | amitrān | su-vedā | naḥ | vasu | kr̥dhi || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | mahā-dhane | bhava | vr̥dhaḥ | sakhīnām ||7.32.25||

IAST: indra kratuṁ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā
Griffith: O Indra, give us wisdom as a sire gives wisdom to his sons.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षा णो अस्मिन्पुरुहूत यामनि जीवा ज्योतिरशीमहि
pada pāṭha: indra | kratum | naḥ | ā | bhara | pitā | putrebhyaḥ | yathā || śikṣa | naḥ | asmin | puru-hūta | yāmani | jīvāḥ | jyotiḥ | aśīmahi ||7.32.26||

IAST: śikṣā ṇo asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotir aśīmahi
Griffith: Guide us, O Much-invoked, in this our way may we still live and look upon the light.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र क्रतुं न आ भर पिता पुत्रेभ्यो यथा
pada pāṭha: indra | kratum | naḥ | ā | bhara | pitā | putrebhyaḥ | yathā || śikṣa | naḥ | asmin | puru-hūta | yāmani | jīvāḥ | jyotiḥ | aśīmahi ||7.32.26||

IAST: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyo māśivāso ava kramuḥ
Griffith: Grant that no mighty foes, unknown, malevolent, unhallowed, tread us to the ground.
Devanāgarī: त्वया वयं प्रवतः शश्वतीरपोऽति शूर तरामसि
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | ajñātāḥ | vr̥janāḥ | duḥ-ādhyaḥ | mā | aśivāsaḥ | ava | kramuḥ || tvayā | vayam | pra-vataḥ | śaśvatīḥ | apaḥ | ati | śūra | tarāmasi ||7.32.27||

IAST: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīr apo 'ti śūra tarāmasi
Griffith: With thine assistance, Hero, may we ass through all the waters that are rul`ng down.
Devanāgarī: मा नो अज्ञाता वृजना दुराध्यो माशिवासो अव क्रमुः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | ajñātāḥ | vr̥janāḥ | duḥ-ādhyaḥ | mā | aśivāsaḥ | ava | kramuḥ || tvayā | vayam | pra-vataḥ | śaśvatīḥ | apaḥ | ati | śūra | tarāmasi ||7.32.27||

IAST: śvityañco mā dakṣiṇataskapardā dhiyaṁjinvāso abhi hi pramanduḥ
Griffith: THESE who wear hair-knots on the right, the movers of holy thought, white-robed, have won me over.
Devanāgarī: श्वित्यञ्चो मा दक्षिणतस्कपर्दा धियंजिन्वासो अभि हि प्रमन्दुः
pada pāṭha: śvityañcaḥ | mā | dakṣiṇataḥ-kapardāḥ | dhiyam-jinvāsaḥ | abhi | hi | pra-manduḥ || ut-tiṣṭhan | voce | pari | barhiṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | na | me | dūrāt | avitave | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.1||

IAST: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrād avitave vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: I warned the men, when from the grass I raised me, Not from afar can my Vasisthas help you.
Devanāgarī: उत्तिष्ठन्वोचे परि बर्हिषो नॄन्न मे दूरादवितवे वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: śvityañcaḥ | mā | dakṣiṇataḥ-kapardāḥ | dhiyam-jinvāsaḥ | abhi | hi | pra-manduḥ || ut-tiṣṭhan | voce | pari | barhiṣaḥ | nr̥̄n | na | me | dūrāt | avitave | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.1||

IAST: dūrād indram anayann ā sutena tiro vaiśantam ati pāntam ugram
Griffith: With soma they brought Indra from a distance, Over Vaisanta, from the strong libation.
Devanāgarī: दूरादिन्द्रमनयन्ना सुतेन तिरो वैशन्तमति पान्तमुग्रम्
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | indram | anayan | ā | sutena | tiraḥ | vaiśantam | ati | pāntam | ugram || pāśa-dyumnasya | vāyatasya | somāt | sutāt | indraḥ | avr̥ṇīta | vasiṣṭhān ||7.33.2||

IAST: pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutād indro 'vṛṇītā vasiṣṭhān
Griffith: Indra preferred Vasisthas to the Soma pressed by the son of Vayata, Pasadyumna.
Devanāgarī: पाशद्युम्नस्य वायतस्य सोमात्सुतादिन्द्रोऽवृणीता वसिष्ठान्
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | indram | anayan | ā | sutena | tiraḥ | vaiśantam | ati | pāntam | ugram || pāśa-dyumnasya | vāyatasya | somāt | sutāt | indraḥ | avr̥ṇīta | vasiṣṭhān ||7.33.2||

IAST: even nu kaṁ sindhum ebhis tatāreven nu kam bhedam ebhir jaghāna
Griffith: So, verily, with these he crossed the river, in company with these he slaughtered Bheda.
Devanāgarī: एवेन्नु कं सिन्धुमेभिस्ततारेवेन्नु कं भेदमेभिर्जघान
pada pāṭha: eva | it | nu | kam | sindhum | ebhiḥ | tatāra | eva | it | nu | kam | bhedam | ebhiḥ | jaghāna || eva | it | nu | kam | dāśa-rājñe | su-dāsam | pra | āvat | indraḥ | brahmaṇā | vaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.3||

IAST: even nu kaṁ dāśarājñe sudāsam prāvad indro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: So in the fight with the Ten Kings, Vasisthas! did Indra help Sudas through your devotions.
Devanāgarī: एवेन्नु कं दाशराज्ञे सुदासं प्रावदिन्द्रो ब्रह्मणा वो वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: eva | it | nu | kam | sindhum | ebhiḥ | tatāra | eva | it | nu | kam | bhedam | ebhiḥ | jaghāna || eva | it | nu | kam | dāśa-rājñe | su-dāsam | pra | āvat | indraḥ | brahmaṇā | vaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.3||

IAST: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇām akṣam avyayaṁ na kilā riṣātha
Griffith: I gladly, men I with prayer prayed by our fathers have fixed your axle: ye shall not be injured:
Devanāgarī: जुष्टी नरो ब्रह्मणा वः पितॄणामक्षमव्ययं न किला रिषाथ
pada pāṭha: juṣṭī | naraḥ | brahmaṇā | vaḥ | pitr̥̄ṇām | akṣam | avyayam | na | kila | riṣātha || yat | śakvarīṣu | br̥hatā | raveṇa | indre | śuṣmam | adadhāta | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.4||

IAST: yac chakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmam adadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Since, when ye sang aloud the Sakvari verses, Vasisthas! ye invigorated Indra.
Devanāgarī: यच्छक्वरीषु बृहता रवेणेन्द्रे शुष्ममदधाता वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: juṣṭī | naraḥ | brahmaṇā | vaḥ | pitr̥̄ṇām | akṣam | avyayam | na | kila | riṣātha || yat | śakvarīṣu | br̥hatā | raveṇa | indre | śuṣmam | adadhāta | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.4||

IAST: ud dyām ivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso 'dīdhayur dāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ
Griffith: Like thirsty men they looked to heaven, in battle with the Ten Kings, surrounded and imploring.
Devanāgarī: उद्द्यामिवेत्तृष्णजो नाथितासोऽदीधयुर्दाशराज्ञे वृतासः
pada pāṭha: ut | dyām-iva | it | tr̥ṣṇa-jaḥ | nāthitāsaḥ | adīdhayuḥ | dāśa-rājñe | vr̥tāsaḥ || vasiṣṭhasya | stuvataḥ | indraḥ | aśrot | urum | tr̥tsu-bhyaḥ | akr̥ṇot | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.33.5||

IAST: vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśrod uruṁ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇod u lokam
Griffith: Then Indra heard Vasistha as he praised him, and gave the Trtsus ample room and freedom.
Devanāgarī: वसिष्ठस्य स्तुवत इन्द्रो अश्रोदुरुं तृत्सुभ्यो अकृणोदु लोकम्
pada pāṭha: ut | dyām-iva | it | tr̥ṣṇa-jaḥ | nāthitāsaḥ | adīdhayuḥ | dāśa-rājñe | vr̥tāsaḥ || vasiṣṭhasya | stuvataḥ | indraḥ | aśrot | urum | tr̥tsu-bhyaḥ | akr̥ṇot | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.33.5||

IAST: daṇḍā ived goajanāsa āsan paricchinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ
Griffith: Like sticks and staves wherewith they drive the cattle, Stripped bare, the Bharatas were found defenceless
Devanāgarī: दण्डा इवेद्गोअजनास आसन्परिच्छिन्ना भरता अर्भकासः
pada pāṭha: daṇḍāḥ-iva | it | go-ajanāsaḥ | āsan | pari-chinnāḥ | bharatāḥ | arbhakāsaḥ || abhavat | ca | puraḥ-etā | vasiṣṭhaḥ | āt | it | tr̥tsūnām | viśaḥ | aprathanta ||7.33.6||

IAST: abhavac ca puraetā vasiṣṭha ād it tṛtsūnāṁ viśo aprathanta
Griffith: Vasistha then became their chief and leader: then widely. were the Trtsus' clans extended.
Devanāgarī: अभवच्च पुरएता वसिष्ठ आदित्तृत्सूनां विशो अप्रथन्त
pada pāṭha: daṇḍāḥ-iva | it | go-ajanāsaḥ | āsan | pari-chinnāḥ | bharatāḥ | arbhakāsaḥ || abhavat | ca | puraḥ-etā | vasiṣṭhaḥ | āt | it | tr̥tsūnām | viśaḥ | aprathanta ||7.33.6||

IAST: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retas tisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiragrāḥ
Griffith: Three fertilize the worlds with genial moisture: three noble Creatures cast a light before them.
Devanāgarī: त्रयः कृण्वन्ति भुवनेषु रेतस्तिस्रः प्रजा आर्या ज्योतिरग्राः
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | kr̥ṇvanti | bhuvaneṣu | retaḥ | tisraḥ | pra-jāḥ | āryāḥ | jyotiḥ-agrāḥ || trayaḥ | gharmāsaḥ | uṣasam | sacante | sarvān | it | tān | anu | viduḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.7||

IAST: trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṁ sacante sarvām̐ it tām̐ anu vidur vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Three that give warmth to all attend the morning. All these have they discovered, these Vasisthas.
Devanāgarī: त्रयो घर्मास उषसं सचन्ते सर्वाँ इत्ताँ अनु विदुर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: trayaḥ | kr̥ṇvanti | bhuvaneṣu | retaḥ | tisraḥ | pra-jāḥ | āryāḥ | jyotiḥ-agrāḥ || trayaḥ | gharmāsaḥ | uṣasam | sacante | sarvān | it | tān | anu | viduḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.7||

IAST: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotir eṣāṁ samudrasyeva mahimā gabhīraḥ
Griffith: Like the Sun's growing glory is their splendour, and like the sea's is their unflathomed greatness.
Devanāgarī: सूर्यस्येव वक्षथो ज्योतिरेषां समुद्रस्येव महिमा गभीरः
pada pāṭha: sūryasya-iva | vakṣathaḥ | jyotiḥ | eṣām | samudrasya-iva | mahimā | gabhīraḥ || vātasya-iva | pra-javaḥ | na | anyena | stomaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ | anu-etave | vaḥ ||7.33.8||

IAST: vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ
Griffith: Their course is like the wind's. Your laud, Vasisthas, can never be attained by any other.
Devanāgarī: वातस्येव प्रजवो नान्येन स्तोमो वसिष्ठा अन्वेतवे वः
pada pāṭha: sūryasya-iva | vakṣathaḥ | jyotiḥ | eṣām | samudrasya-iva | mahimā | gabhīraḥ || vātasya-iva | pra-javaḥ | na | anyena | stomaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ | anu-etave | vaḥ ||7.33.8||

IAST: ta in niṇyaṁ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśam abhi saṁ caranti
Griffith: They with perceptions of the heart in secret resort to that which spreads a thousand branches.
Devanāgarī: त इन्निण्यं हृदयस्य प्रकेतैः सहस्रवल्शमभि सं चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: te | it | niṇyam | hr̥dayasya | pra-ketaiḥ | sahasra-valśam | abhi | sam | caranti || yamena | tatam | pari-dhim | vayantaḥ | apsarasaḥ | upa | seduḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.9||

IAST: yamena tatam paridhiṁ vayanto 'psarasa upa sedur vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: The Apsaras brought hither the Vasisthas wearing the vesture spun for them by Yama.
Devanāgarī: यमेन ततं परिधिं वयन्तोऽप्सरस उप सेदुर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: te | it | niṇyam | hr̥dayasya | pra-ketaiḥ | sahasra-valśam | abhi | sam | caranti || yamena | tatam | pari-dhim | vayantaḥ | apsarasaḥ | upa | seduḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.33.9||

IAST: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṁjihānam mitrāvaruṇā yad apaśyatāṁ tvā
Griffith: A form of lustre springing from the lightning wast thou, when Varuna and Mitra saw thee.
Devanāgarī: विद्युतो ज्योतिः परि संजिहानं मित्रावरुणा यदपश्यतां त्वा
pada pāṭha: vi-dyutaḥ | jyotiḥ | pari | sam-jihānam | mitrāvaruṇā | yat | apaśyatām | tvā || tat | te | janma | uta | ekam | vasiṣṭha | agastyaḥ | yat | tvā | viśaḥ | ā-jabhāra ||7.33.10||

IAST: tat te janmotaikaṁ vasiṣṭhāgastyo yat tvā viśa ājabhāra
Griffith: Tliy one and only birth was then, Vasistha, when from thy stock Agastya brought thee hither.
Devanāgarī: तत्ते जन्मोतैकं वसिष्ठागस्त्यो यत्त्वा विश आजभार
pada pāṭha: vi-dyutaḥ | jyotiḥ | pari | sam-jihānam | mitrāvaruṇā | yat | apaśyatām | tvā || tat | te | janma | uta | ekam | vasiṣṭha | agastyaḥ | yat | tvā | viśaḥ | ā-jabhāra ||7.33.10||

IAST: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorvaśyā brahman manaso 'dhi jātaḥ
Griffith: Born of their love for Urvasi, Vasistha thou, priest, art son of Varuna and Mitra;
Devanāgarī: उतासि मैत्रावरुणो वसिष्ठोर्वश्या ब्रह्मन्मनसोऽधि जातः
pada pāṭha: uta | asi | maitrāvaruṇaḥ | vasiṣṭha | urvaśyāḥ | brahman | manasaḥ | adhi | jātaḥ || drapsam | skannam | brahmaṇā | daivyena | viśve | devāḥ | puṣkare | tvā | adadanta ||7.33.11||

IAST: drapsaṁ skannam brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta
Griffith: And as a fallen drop, in heavenly fervour, all the Gods laid thee on a lotus-blossorn.
Devanāgarī: द्रप्सं स्कन्नं ब्रह्मणा दैव्येन विश्वे देवाः पुष्करे त्वाददन्त
pada pāṭha: uta | asi | maitrāvaruṇaḥ | vasiṣṭha | urvaśyāḥ | brahman | manasaḥ | adhi | jātaḥ || drapsam | skannam | brahmaṇā | daivyena | viśve | devāḥ | puṣkare | tvā | adadanta ||7.33.11||

IAST: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ
Griffith: He thinker, knower both of earth and heaven, endowed with many a gift, bestowing thousands,
Devanāgarī: स प्रकेत उभयस्य प्रविद्वान्सहस्रदान उत वा सदानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pra-ketaḥ | ubhayasya | pra-vidvān | sahasra-dānaḥ | uta | vā | sa-dānaḥ || yamena | tatam | pari-dhim | vayiṣyan | apsarasaḥ | pari | jajñe | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.33.12||

IAST: yamena tatam paridhiṁ vayiṣyann apsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Destined to wear the vesture spun by Yama, sprang from the Apsaras to life, Vasistha.
Devanāgarī: यमेन ततं परिधिं वयिष्यन्नप्सरसः परि जज्ञे वसिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pra-ketaḥ | ubhayasya | pra-vidvān | sahasra-dānaḥ | uta | vā | sa-dānaḥ || yamena | tatam | pari-dhim | vayiṣyan | apsarasaḥ | pari | jajñe | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.33.12||

IAST: satre ha jātāv iṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam
Griffith: Born at the sacrifice, urged by adorations, both with a common flow bedewed the pitcher.
Devanāgarī: सत्रे ह जाताविषिता नमोभिः कुम्भे रेतः सिषिचतुः समानम्
pada pāṭha: satre | ha | jātau | iṣitā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | kumbhe | retaḥ | sisicatuḥ | samānam || tataḥ | ha | mānaḥ | ut | iyāya | madhyāt | tataḥ | jātam | r̥ṣim | āhuḥ | vasiṣṭham ||7.33.13||

IAST: tato ha māna ud iyāya madhyāt tato jātam ṛṣim āhur vasiṣṭham
Griffith: Then from the midst thereof there rose up Mana, and thence they say was born the sage Vasistha.
Devanāgarī: ततो ह मान उदियाय मध्यात्ततो जातमृषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: satre | ha | jātau | iṣitā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | kumbhe | retaḥ | sisicatuḥ | samānam || tataḥ | ha | mānaḥ | ut | iyāya | madhyāt | tataḥ | jātam | r̥ṣim | āhuḥ | vasiṣṭham ||7.33.13||

IAST: ukthabhṛtaṁ sāmabhṛtam bibharti grāvāṇam bibhrat pra vadāty agre
Griffith: He brings the bearer of the laud and Saman: first shall he speak bringing the stone for pressing.
Devanāgarī: उक्थभृतं सामभृतं बिभर्ति ग्रावाणं बिभ्रत्प्र वदात्यग्रे
pada pāṭha: uktha-bhr̥tam | sāma-bhr̥tam | bibharti | grāvāṇam | bibhrat | pra | vadāti | agre || upa | enam | ādhvam | su-manasyamānāḥ | ā | vaḥ | gacchāti | pra-tr̥daḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.33.14||

IAST: upainam ādhvaṁ sumanasyamānā ā vo gacchāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: With grateful hearts in reverence approach him: to you, O Pratrdas, Vasistha cometh.
Devanāgarī: उपैनमाध्वं सुमनस्यमाना आ वो गच्छाति प्रतृदो वसिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: uktha-bhr̥tam | sāma-bhr̥tam | bibharti | grāvāṇam | bibhrat | pra | vadāti | agre || upa | enam | ādhvam | su-manasyamānāḥ | ā | vaḥ | gacchāti | pra-tr̥daḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.33.14||

IAST: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī
Griffith: MAY our divine and brilliant hymn go forth, like a swift chariot wrought and fashioned well.
Devanāgarī: प्र शुक्रैतु देवी मनीषा अस्मत्सुतष्टो रथो न वाजी
pada pāṭha: pra | śukrā | etu | devī | manīṣā | asmat | su-taṣṭaḥ | rathaḥ | na | vājī ||7.34.1||

IAST: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṁ śṛṇvanty āpo adha kṣarantīḥ
Griffith: The waters listen as they flow along: they know the origin of heaven and earth.
Devanāgarī: विदुः पृथिव्या दिवो जनित्रं शृण्वन्त्यापो अध क्षरन्तीः
pada pāṭha: viduḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | divaḥ | janitram | śr̥ṇvanti | āpaḥ | adha | kṣarantīḥ ||7.34.2||

IAST: āpaś cid asmai pinvanta pṛthvīr vṛtreṣu śūrā maṁsanta ugrāḥ
Griffith: Yea, the broad waters swell their flood ior him: of him strong heroes think amid their foes.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चिदस्मै पिन्वन्त पृथ्वीर्वृत्रेषु शूरा मंसन्त उग्राः
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | cit | asmai | pinvanta | pr̥thvīḥ | vr̥treṣu | śūrāḥ | maṁsante | ugrāḥ ||7.34.3||

IAST: ā dhūrṣv asmai dadhātāśvān indro na vajrī hiraṇyabāhuḥ
Griffith: Set ye for him the coursers to the pole: like Indra Thunderer is the Golden-armed.
Devanāgarī: आ धूर्ष्वस्मै दधाताश्वानिन्द्रो न वज्री हिरण्यबाहुः
pada pāṭha: ā | dhūḥ-su | asmai | dadhāta | aśvān | indraḥ | na | vajrī | hiraṇya-bāhuḥ ||7.34.4||

IAST: abhi pra sthātāheva yajñaṁ yāteva patman tmanā hinota
Griffith: Arouse you, like the days, to sacrifice speed gladly like a traveller on the way.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्र स्थाताहेव यज्ञं यातेव पत्मन्त्मना हिनोत
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | sthāta | aha-iva | yajñam | yātā-iva | patman | tmanā | hinota ||7.34.5||

IAST: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñaṁ dadhāta ketuṁ janāya vīram
Griffith: Go swift to battles, to the sacrifice: set up a flag, a hero for the folk.
Devanāgarī: त्मना समत्सु हिनोत यज्ञं दधात केतुं जनाय वीरम्
pada pāṭha: tmanā | samat-su | hinota | yajñam | dadhāta | ketum | janāya | vīram ||7.34.6||

IAST: ud asya śuṣmād bhānur nārta bibharti bhāram pṛthivī na bhūma
Griffith: Up from his strength hath risen as 'twere a light: it bears the load as earth bears living things.
Devanāgarī: उदस्य शुष्माद्भानुर्नार्त बिभर्ति भारं पृथिवी न भूम
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | śuṣmāt | bhānuḥ | na | ārta | bibharti | bhāram | pr̥thivī | na | bhūma ||7.34.7||

IAST: hvayāmi devām̐ ayātur agne sādhann ṛtena dhiyaṁ dadhāmi
Griffith: Agni, no demon I invoke the Gods: by law completing it, I form a hymn.
Devanāgarī: ह्वयामि देवाँ अयातुरग्ने साधन्नृतेन धियं दधामि
pada pāṭha: hvayāmi | devān | ayātuḥ | agne | sādhan | r̥tena | dhiyam | dadhāmi ||7.34.8||

IAST: abhi vo devīṁ dhiyaṁ dadhidhvam pra vo devatrā vācaṁ kṛṇudhvam
Griffith: Closely albout you lay your heavenly song, and send your voice to where the Gods abide.
Devanāgarī: अभि वो देवीं धियं दधिध्वं प्र वो देवत्रा वाचं कृणुध्वम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | vaḥ | devīm | dhiyam | dadhidhvam | pra | vaḥ | deva-trā | vācam | kr̥ṇudhvam ||7.34.9||

IAST: ā caṣṭa āsām pātho nadīnāṁ varuṇa ugraḥ sahasracakṣāḥ
Griffith: Varuna, Mighty, with a thousand eyes, beholds the paths wherein these rivers run.
Devanāgarī: आ चष्ट आसां पाथो नदीनां वरुण उग्रः सहस्रचक्षाः
pada pāṭha: ā | caṣṭe | āsām | pāthaḥ | nadīnām | varuṇaḥ | ugraḥ | sahasra-cakṣāḥ ||7.34.10||

IAST: rājā rāṣṭrānām peśo nadīnām anuttam asmai kṣatraṁ viśvāyu
Griffith: He, King of kings, the glory of the floods, o'er all that liveth hath resistless sway.
Devanāgarī: राजा राष्ट्रानां पेशो नदीनामनुत्तमस्मै क्षत्रं विश्वायु
pada pāṭha: rājā | rāṣṭrānām | peśaḥ | nadīnām | anuttam | asmai | kṣatram | viśva-āyu ||7.34.11||

IAST: aviṣṭo asmān viśvāsu vikṣv adyuṁ kṛṇota śaṁsaṁ ninitsoḥ
Griffith: May he assist us among all the tribes, and make the envier's praise devoid of light.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टो अस्मान्विश्वासु विक्ष्वद्युं कृणोत शंसं निनित्सोः
pada pāṭha: aviṣṭo iti | asmān | viśvāsu | vikṣu | adyum | kr̥ṇota | śaṁsam | ninitsoḥ ||7.34.12||

IAST: vy etu didyud dviṣām aśevā yuyota viṣvag rapas tanūnām
Griffith: May the foes' threatening arrow pass us by: may he put far from us our bodies' sin.
Devanāgarī: व्येतु दिद्युद्द्विषामशेवा युयोत विष्वग्रपस्तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: vi | etu | didyut | dviṣām | aśevā | yuyota | viṣvak | rapaḥ | tanūnām ||7.34.13||

IAST: avīn no agnir havyān namobhiḥ preṣṭho asmā adhāyi stomaḥ
