Griffith: Agni, oblation-cater, through our prayers aid us: to him our dearest laud is brought.
Devanāgarī: अवीन्नो अग्निर्हव्यान्नमोभिः प्रेष्ठो अस्मा अधायि स्तोमः
pada pāṭha: avīt | naḥ | agniḥ | havya-at | namaḥ-bhiḥ | preṣṭhaḥ | asmai | adhāyi | stomaḥ ||7.34.14||

IAST: sajūr devebhir apāṁ napātaṁ sakhāyaṁ kṛdhvaṁ śivo no astu
Griffith: Accordant with the Gods choose for our Friend the Waters' Child: may he be good to us.
Devanāgarī: सजूर्देवेभिरपां नपातं सखायं कृध्वं शिवो नो अस्तु
pada pāṭha: sa-jūḥ | devebhiḥ | apām | napātam | sakhāyam | kr̥dhvam | śivaḥ | naḥ | astu ||7.34.15||

IAST: abjām ukthair ahiṁ gṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnāṁ rajaḥsu ṣīdan
Griffith: With lauds I sing the Dragon born of floods: he sits beneath the streams in middle air.
Devanāgarī: अब्जामुक्थैरहिं गृणीषे बुध्ने नदीनां रजस्सु षीदन्
pada pāṭha: ap-jām | ukthaiḥ | ahim | gr̥ṇīṣe | budhne | nadīnām | rajaḥ-su | sīdan ||7.34.16||

IAST: mā no 'hir budhnyo riṣe dhān mā yajño asya sridhad ṛtāyoḥ
Griffith: Ne'er may the Dragon of the Deep harm us: ne'er fail this faithful servant's sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: मा नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यो रिषे धान्मा यज्ञो अस्य स्रिधदृतायोः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | riṣe | dhāt | mā | yajñaḥ | asya | sridhat | r̥ta-yoḥ ||7.34.17||

IAST: uta na eṣu nṛṣu śravo dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhanto aryaḥ
Griffith: To these our heroes may they grant renown: may pious men march boldly on to wealth.
Devanāgarī: उत न एषु नृषु श्रवो धुः प्र राये यन्तु शर्धन्तो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | eṣu | nr̥ṣu | śravaḥ | dhuḥ | pra | rāye | yantu | śardhantaḥ | aryaḥ ||7.34.18||

IAST: tapanti śatruṁ svar ṇa bhūmā mahāsenāso amebhir eṣām
Griffith: Leading great hosts, with fierce attacks of these, they burn their foes as the Sun burns the earth.
Devanāgarī: तपन्ति शत्रुं स्वर्ण भूमा महासेनासो अमेभिरेषाम्
pada pāṭha: tapanti | śatrum | svaḥ | na | bhūma | mahā-senāsaḥ | amebhiḥ | eṣām ||7.34.19||

IAST: ā yan naḥ patnīr gamanty acchā tvaṣṭā supāṇir dadhātu vīrān
Griffith: What time our wives draw near to us, may he, left-handed Tvastar, give us hero sons.
Devanāgarī: आ यन्नः पत्नीर्गमन्त्यच्छा त्वष्टा सुपाणिर्दधातु वीरान्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | naḥ | patnīḥ | gamanti | accha | tvaṣṭā | su-pāṇiḥ | dadhātu | vīrān ||7.34.20||

IAST: prati naḥ stomaṁ tvaṣṭā juṣeta syād asme aramatir vasūyuḥ
Griffith: May Tvastar find our hymn acceptable, and may Aramati, seeking wealth, be ours.
Devanāgarī: प्रति नः स्तोमं त्वष्टा जुषेत स्यादस्मे अरमतिर्वसूयुः
pada pāṭha: prati | naḥ | stomam | tvaṣṭā | juṣeta | syāt | asme iti | aramatiḥ | vasu-yuḥ ||7.34.21||

IAST: tā no rāsan rātiṣāco vasūny ā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu
Griffith: May they who lavish gifts bestow those treasures: may Rodasi and Varunani listen.
Devanāgarī: वरूत्रीभिः सुशरणो नो अस्तु त्वष्टा सुदत्रो वि दधातु रायः
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | rāsan | rāti-sācaḥ | vasūni | ā | rodasī iti | varuṇānī | śr̥ṇotu || varūtrībhiḥ | su-śaraṇaḥ | naḥ | astu | tvaṣṭā | su-datraḥ | vi | dadhātu | rāyaḥ ||7.34.22||

IAST: varūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇo no astu tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyaḥ
Griffith: May he, with the Varutris, be our refuge, may bountiful Tvastar give us store of riches.
Devanāgarī: ता नो रासन्रातिषाचो वसून्या रोदसी वरुणानी शृणोतु
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | rāsan | rāti-sācaḥ | vasūni | ā | rodasī iti | varuṇānī | śr̥ṇotu || varūtrībhiḥ | su-śaraṇaḥ | naḥ | astu | tvaṣṭā | su-datraḥ | vi | dadhātu | rāyaḥ ||7.34.22||

IAST: tan no rāyaḥ parvatās tan na āpas tad rātiṣāca oṣadhīr uta dyauḥ
Griffith: So may rich Mountains and the liberal Waters, so may all Herbs that grow on ground, and Heaven,
Devanāgarī: वनस्पतिभिः पृथिवी सजोषा उभे रोदसी परि पासतो नः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | rāyaḥ | parvatāḥ | tat | naḥ | āpaḥ | tat | rāti-sācaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | dyauḥ || vanaspati-bhiḥ | pr̥thivī | sa-joṣāḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | pari | pāsataḥ | naḥ ||7.34.23||

IAST: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣā ubhe rodasī pari pāsato naḥ
Griffith: And Earth accordant with the Forest-Sovrans, and both the World-halves round about protect us.
Devanāgarī: तन्नो रायः पर्वतास्तन्न आपस्तद्रातिषाच ओषधीरुत द्यौः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | rāyaḥ | parvatāḥ | tat | naḥ | āpaḥ | tat | rāti-sācaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | uta | dyauḥ || vanaspati-bhiḥ | pr̥thivī | sa-joṣāḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | pari | pāsataḥ | naḥ ||7.34.23||

IAST: anu tad urvī rodasī jihātām anu dyukṣo varuṇa indrasakhā
Griffith: To this may both the wide Worlds lend approval, and Varuna in heaven, whose Friend is Indra.
Devanāgarī: अनु विश्वे मरुतो ये सहासो रायः स्याम धरुणं धियध्यै
pada pāṭha: anu | tat | urvī iti | rodasī iti | jihātām | anu | dyukṣaḥ | varuṇaḥ | indra-sakhā || anu | viśve | marutaḥ | ye | sahāsaḥ | rāyaḥ | syāma | dharuṇam | dhiyadhyai ||7.34.24||

IAST: anu viśve maruto ye sahāso rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇaṁ dhiyadhyai
Griffith: May all the Maruts give consent, the Victors, that we may hold great wealth in firm possession.
Devanāgarī: अनु तदुर्वी रोदसी जिहातामनु द्युक्षो वरुण इन्द्रसखा
pada pāṭha: anu | tat | urvī iti | rodasī iti | jihātām | anu | dyukṣaḥ | varuṇaḥ | indra-sakhā || anu | viśve | marutaḥ | ye | sahāsaḥ | rāyaḥ | syāma | dharuṇam | dhiyadhyai ||7.34.24||

IAST: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnir āpa oṣadhīr vanino juṣanta
Griffith: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, and Agni, Waters, Herbs, Trees accept the praise we offer.
Devanāgarī: शर्मन्स्याम मरुतामुपस्थे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | juṣanta || śarman | syāma | marutām | upa-sthe | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.34.25||

IAST: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May we find refuge in the Marut's bosom. Protect us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: तन्न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निराप ओषधीर्वनिनो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | juṣanta || śarman | syāma | marutām | upa-sthe | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.34.25||

IAST: śaṁ na indrāgnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śaṁ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā
Griffith: BEFRIEND us with their aids Indra and Agni, Indra and Varuna who receive oblations!
Devanāgarī: शं न इन्द्राग्नी भवतामवोभिः शं न इन्द्रावरुणा रातहव्या
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | indrāgnī iti | bhavatām | avaḥ-bhiḥ | śam | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | rāta-havyā || śam | indrāsomā | suvitāya | śam | yoḥ | śam | naḥ | indrāpūṣaṇā | vāja-sātau ||7.35.1||

IAST: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śaṁ yoḥ śaṁ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau
Griffith: Indra and Soma give health, strength and comfort, Indra and Pusan be our help in battle.
Devanāgarī: शमिन्द्रासोमा सुविताय शं योः शं न इन्द्रापूषणा वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | indrāgnī iti | bhavatām | avaḥ-bhiḥ | śam | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | rāta-havyā || śam | indrāsomā | suvitāya | śam | yoḥ | śam | naḥ | indrāpūṣaṇā | vāja-sātau ||7.35.1||

IAST: śaṁ no bhagaḥ śam u naḥ śaṁso astu śaṁ naḥ puraṁdhiḥ śam u santu rāyaḥ
Griffith: Auspicious Friends to us be Bhaga, Sathsa, auspicious be Purandhi aid all Riches;
Devanāgarī: शं नो भगः शमु नः शंसो अस्तु शं नः पुरंधिः शमु सन्तु रायः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhagaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | śaṁsaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | puram-dhiḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | rāyaḥ || śam | naḥ | satyasya | su-yamasya | śaṁsaḥ | śam | naḥ | aryamā | puru-jātaḥ | astu ||7.35.2||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṁsaḥ śaṁ no aryamā purujāto astu
Griffith: The blessing of the true and well-conducted, and Aryaman in many forms apparent.
Devanāgarī: शं नः सत्यस्य सुयमस्य शंसः शं नो अर्यमा पुरुजातो अस्तु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhagaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | śaṁsaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | puram-dhiḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | rāyaḥ || śam | naḥ | satyasya | su-yamasya | śaṁsaḥ | śam | naḥ | aryamā | puru-jātaḥ | astu ||7.35.2||

IAST: śaṁ no dhātā śam u dhartā no astu śaṁ na urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ
Griffith: Kind unto us he Maker and Sustainer, and the far-reaching Pair with God-like natures.
Devanāgarī: शं नो धाता शमु धर्ता नो अस्तु शं न उरूची भवतु स्वधाभिः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | dhātā | śam | ūm̐ iti | dhartā | naḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | urūcī | bhavatu | svadhābhiḥ || śam | rodasī iti | br̥hatī iti | śam | naḥ | adriḥ | śam | naḥ | devānām | su-havāni | santu ||7.35.3||

IAST: śaṁ rodasī bṛhatī śaṁ no adriḥ śaṁ no devānāṁ suhavāni santu
Griffith: Auspicious unto us be Earth and Heaven, the Mountain, and the Gods' fair invocations.
Devanāgarī: शं रोदसी बृहती शं नो अद्रिः शं नो देवानां सुहवानि सन्तु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | dhātā | śam | ūm̐ iti | dhartā | naḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | urūcī | bhavatu | svadhābhiḥ || śam | rodasī iti | br̥hatī iti | śam | naḥ | adriḥ | śam | naḥ | devānām | su-havāni | santu ||7.35.3||

IAST: śaṁ no agnir jyotiranīko astu śaṁ no mitrāvaruṇāv aśvinā śam
Griffith: Favour us Agni with his face of splendour, and Varuva and Mitra and the Asvins.
Devanāgarī: शं नो अग्निर्ज्योतिरनीको अस्तु शं नो मित्रावरुणावश्विना शम्
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | agniḥ | jyotiḥ-anīkaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | aśvinā | śam || śam | naḥ | su-kr̥tām | su-kr̥tāni | santu | śam | naḥ | iṣiraḥ | abhi | vātu | vātaḥ ||7.35.4||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ sukṛtāṁ sukṛtāni santu śaṁ na iṣiro abhi vātu vātaḥ
Griffith: Favour us noble actions of the pious, impetuous vita blow on us with favour.
Devanāgarī: शं नः सुकृतां सुकृतानि सन्तु शं न इषिरो अभि वातु वातः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | agniḥ | jyotiḥ-anīkaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | aśvinā | śam || śam | naḥ | su-kr̥tām | su-kr̥tāni | santu | śam | naḥ | iṣiraḥ | abhi | vātu | vātaḥ ||7.35.4||

IAST: śaṁ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śam antarikṣaṁ dṛśaye no astu
Griffith: Early invoked, may Heaven and Earth be friendly, and Air's mid-region good for us to look on.
Devanāgarī: शं नो द्यावापृथिवी पूर्वहूतौ शमन्तरिक्षं दृशये नो अस्तु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pūrva-hūtau | śam | antarikṣam | dr̥śaye | naḥ | astu || śam | naḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | rajasaḥ | patiḥ | astu | jiṣṇuḥ ||7.35.5||

IAST: śaṁ na oṣadhīr vanino bhavantu śaṁ no rajasas patir astu jiṣṇuḥ
Griffith: To us may Herbs and Forest-Trees be gracious, gracious the Lord Victorious of the region.
Devanāgarī: शं न ओषधीर्वनिनो भवन्तु शं नो रजसस्पतिरस्तु जिष्णुः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | pūrva-hūtau | śam | antarikṣam | dr̥śaye | naḥ | astu || śam | naḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | rajasaḥ | patiḥ | astu | jiṣṇuḥ ||7.35.5||

IAST: śaṁ na indro vasubhir devo astu śam ādityebhir varuṇaḥ suśaṁsaḥ
Griffith: Be the God Indra with the Vasus friendly, and, with Adityas, Varuna who blesseth.
Devanāgarī: शं न इन्द्रो वसुभिर्देवो अस्तु शमादित्येभिर्वरुणः सुशंसः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | devaḥ | astu | śam | ādityebhiḥ | varuṇaḥ | su-śaṁsaḥ || śam | naḥ | rudraḥ | rudrebhiḥ | jalāṣaḥ | śam | naḥ | tvaṣṭā | gnābhiḥ | iha | śr̥ṇotu ||7.35.6||

IAST: śaṁ no rudro rudrebhir jalāṣaḥ śaṁ nas tvaṣṭā gnābhir iha śṛṇotu
Griffith: Kind, with the Rudras, be the Healer Rudra, and, with the Dames, may Tvastar kindly listen.
Devanāgarī: शं नो रुद्रो रुद्रेभिर्जलाषः शं नस्त्वष्टा ग्नाभिरिह शृणोतु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | devaḥ | astu | śam | ādityebhiḥ | varuṇaḥ | su-śaṁsaḥ || śam | naḥ | rudraḥ | rudrebhiḥ | jalāṣaḥ | śam | naḥ | tvaṣṭā | gnābhiḥ | iha | śr̥ṇotu ||7.35.6||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṁ naḥ śaṁ no grāvāṇaḥ śam u santu yajñāḥ
Griffith: Blest unto us be Soma, and devotions, blest be the Sacrifice, the Stones for pressing.
Devanāgarī: शं नः सोमो भवतु ब्रह्म शं नः शं नो ग्रावाणः शमु सन्तु यज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | somaḥ | bhavatu | brahma | śam | naḥ | śam | naḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | yajñāḥ || śam | naḥ | svarūṇām | mitayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | pra-svaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | astu | vediḥ ||7.35.7||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ svarūṇām mitayo bhavantu śaṁ naḥ prasvaḥ śam v astu vediḥ
Griffith: Blest be the fixing of the sacred Pillars, blest be the tender Grass and blest the Altar.
Devanāgarī: शं नः स्वरूणां मितयो भवन्तु शं नः प्रस्वः शम्वस्तु वेदिः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | somaḥ | bhavatu | brahma | śam | naḥ | śam | naḥ | grāvāṇaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | yajñāḥ || śam | naḥ | svarūṇām | mitayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | pra-svaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | astu | vediḥ ||7.35.7||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā ud etu śaṁ naś catasraḥ pradiśo bhavantu
Griffith: May the far-seeing Sun rise up to bless us: be the four Quarters of the sky auspicious.
Devanāgarī: शं नः सूर्य उरुचक्षा उदेतु शं नश्चतस्रः प्रदिशो भवन्तु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | sūryaḥ | uru-cakṣāḥ | ut | etu | śam | naḥ | catasraḥ | pra-diśaḥ | bhavantu || śam | naḥ | parvatāḥ | dhruvayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | sindhavaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | āpaḥ ||7.35.8||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṁ naḥ sindhavaḥ śam u santv āpaḥ
Griffith: Auspicious be the firmly-seated Mountains, auspicious be the Rivers and the Waters.
Devanāgarī: शं नः पर्वता ध्रुवयो भवन्तु शं नः सिन्धवः शमु सन्त्वापः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | sūryaḥ | uru-cakṣāḥ | ut | etu | śam | naḥ | catasraḥ | pra-diśaḥ | bhavantu || śam | naḥ | parvatāḥ | dhruvayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | sindhavaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | āpaḥ ||7.35.8||

IAST: śaṁ no aditir bhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṁ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ
Griffith: May Adid through holy works be gracioas, and may the Maruts, loud in song, be friendly.
Devanāgarī: शं नो अदितिर्भवतु व्रतेभिः शं नो भवन्तु मरुतः स्वर्काः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | aditiḥ | bhavatu | vratebhiḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | marutaḥ | su-arkāḥ || śam | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | pūṣā | naḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | bhavitram | śam | ūm̐ iti | astu | vāyuḥ ||7.35.9||

IAST: śaṁ no viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā no astu śaṁ no bhavitraṁ śam v astu vāyuḥ
Griffith: May Visnu give felicity, and Pusan, the Air that cherisheth our life, and Vayu.
Devanāgarī: शं नो विष्णुः शमु पूषा नो अस्तु शं नो भवित्रं शम्वस्तु वायुः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | aditiḥ | bhavatu | vratebhiḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | marutaḥ | su-arkāḥ || śam | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | pūṣā | naḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | bhavitram | śam | ūm̐ iti | astu | vāyuḥ ||7.35.9||

IAST: śaṁ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṁ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ
Griffith: Prosper us Savitar, the God who rescues, and let the radiant Mornings be propitious.
Devanāgarī: शं नो देवः सविता त्रायमाणः शं नो भवन्तूषसो विभातीः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | trāyamāṇaḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ || śam | naḥ | parjanyaḥ | bhavatu | pra-jābhyaḥ | śam | naḥ | kṣetrasya | patiḥ | astu | śam-bhuḥ ||7.35.10||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṁ naḥ kṣetrasya patir astu śambhuḥ
Griffith: Auspicious to all creatures be Parjanya, auspicious be the field's benign Protector.
Devanāgarī: शं नः पर्जन्यो भवतु प्रजाभ्यः शं नः क्षेत्रस्य पतिरस्तु शम्भुः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | trāyamāṇaḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ || śam | naḥ | parjanyaḥ | bhavatu | pra-jābhyaḥ | śam | naḥ | kṣetrasya | patiḥ | astu | śam-bhuḥ ||7.35.10||

IAST: śaṁ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṁ sarasvatī saha dhībhir astu
Griffith: May all the fellowship of Gods befriend us, Sarasvati, with Holy Thoughts, be gracious.
Devanāgarī: शं नो देवा विश्वदेवा भवन्तु शं सरस्वती सह धीभिरस्तु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | devāḥ | viśva-devāḥ | bhavantu | śam | sarasvatī | saha | dhībhiḥ | astu || śam | abhi-sācaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | rāti-sācaḥ | śam | naḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāḥ | śam | naḥ | apyāḥ ||7.35.11||

IAST: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śaṁ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṁ no apyāḥ
Griffith: Friendly be they, the Liberal Ones who seek us, yea, those who dwell in heaven, on earth, in waters.
Devanāgarī: शमभिषाचः शमु रातिषाचः शं नो दिव्याः पार्थिवाः शं नो अप्याः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | devāḥ | viśva-devāḥ | bhavantu | śam | sarasvatī | saha | dhībhiḥ | astu || śam | abhi-sācaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | rāti-sācaḥ | śam | naḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāḥ | śam | naḥ | apyāḥ ||7.35.11||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṁ no arvantaḥ śam u santu gāvaḥ
Griffith: May the great Lords of Truth protect and aid us: blest to us be our horses and our cattle.
Devanāgarī: शं नः सत्यस्य पतयो भवन्तु शं नो अर्वन्तः शमु सन्तु गावः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | satyasya | patayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | arvantaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | gāvaḥ || śam | naḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | su-hastāḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | pitaraḥ | haveṣu ||7.35.12||

IAST: śaṁ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṁ no bhavantu pitaro haveṣu
Griffith: Kind be the pious skilful-handed Rbhus, kind be the Fathers at our invocations.
Devanāgarī: शं न ऋभवः सुकृतः सुहस्ताः शं नो भवन्तु पितरो हवेषु
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | satyasya | patayaḥ | bhavantu | śam | naḥ | arvantaḥ | śam | ūm̐ iti | santu | gāvaḥ || śam | naḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | su-hastāḥ | śam | naḥ | bhavantu | pitaraḥ | haveṣu ||7.35.12||

IAST: śaṁ no aja ekapād devo astu śaṁ no 'hir budhnyaḥ śaṁ samudraḥ
Griffith: May Aja-Ekapad, the God, be gracious, gracious the Dragon of the Deep, and Ocean.
Devanāgarī: शं नो अज एकपाद्देवो अस्तु शं नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यः शं समुद्रः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | devaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | śam | samudraḥ || śam | naḥ | apām | napāt | peruḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | pr̥śniḥ | bhavatu | deva-gopā ||7.35.13||

IAST: śaṁ no apāṁ napāt perur astu śaṁ naḥ pṛśnir bhavatu devagopā
Griffith: Gracious be he the swelling Child of Waters, gracious be Prsni who hath Gods to guard her.
Devanāgarī: शं नो अपां नपात्पेरुरस्तु शं नः पृश्निर्भवतु देवगोपा
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | devaḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | śam | samudraḥ || śam | naḥ | apām | napāt | peruḥ | astu | śam | naḥ | pr̥śniḥ | bhavatu | deva-gopā ||7.35.13||

IAST: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantedam brahma kriyamāṇaṁ navīyaḥ
Griffith: So may the Rudras, Vasus, and Adityas accept the new hymn which we now are making.
Devanāgarī: आदित्या रुद्रा वसवो जुषन्तेदं ब्रह्म क्रियमाणं नवीयः
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | rudrāḥ | vasavaḥ | juṣanta | idam | brahma | kriyamāṇam | navīyaḥ || śr̥ṇvantu | naḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | go-jātāḥ | uta | ye | yajñiyāsaḥ ||7.35.14||

IAST: śṛṇvantu no divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
Griffith: May all the Holy Ones of earth and heaven, and the Cow's offipring hear our invocation.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तु नो दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता उत ये यज्ञियासः
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | rudrāḥ | vasavaḥ | juṣanta | idam | brahma | kriyamāṇam | navīyaḥ || śr̥ṇvantu | naḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | go-jātāḥ | uta | ye | yajñiyāsaḥ ||7.35.14||

IAST: ye devānāṁ yajñiyā yajñiyānām manor yajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: They who of Holy Gods are very holy, Immortal, knowing Law, whom man must worship,-
Devanāgarī: ये देवानां यज्ञिया यज्ञियानां मनोर्यजत्रा अमृता ऋतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: ye | devānām | yajñiyāḥ | yajñiyānām | manoḥ | yajatrāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || te | naḥ | rāsantām | uru-gāyam | adya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.35.15||

IAST: te no rāsantām urugāyam adya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these to-day give us broad paths to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: ते नो रासन्तामुरुगायमद्य यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ye | devānām | yajñiyāḥ | yajñiyānām | manoḥ | yajatrāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || te | naḥ | rāsantām | uru-gāyam | adya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.35.15||

IAST: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo gāḥ
Griffith: LET the prayer issue from the seat of Order, for Surya with his beams hath loosed the cattle.
Devanāgarī: प्र ब्रह्मैतु सदनादृतस्य वि रश्मिभिः ससृजे सूर्यो गाः
pada pāṭha: pra | brahma | etu | sadanāt | r̥tasya | vi | raśmi-bhiḥ | sasr̥je | sūryaḥ | gāḥ || vi | sānunā | pr̥thivī | sasre | urvī | pr̥thu | pratīkam | adhi | ā | īdhe | agniḥ ||7.36.1||

IAST: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urvī pṛthu pratīkam adhy edhe agniḥ
Griffith: With lofty ridges earth is far extended, and Agni's flame hath lit the spacious surface.
Devanāgarī: वि सानुना पृथिवी सस्र उर्वी पृथु प्रतीकमध्येधे अग्निः
pada pāṭha: pra | brahma | etu | sadanāt | r̥tasya | vi | raśmi-bhiḥ | sasr̥je | sūryaḥ | gāḥ || vi | sānunā | pr̥thivī | sasre | urvī | pr̥thu | pratīkam | adhi | ā | īdhe | agniḥ ||7.36.1||

IAST: imāṁ vām mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktim iṣaṁ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ
Griffith: O Asuras, O Varuna and Mitra, this hymn to you, like food, anew I offer.
Devanāgarī: इमां वां मित्रावरुणा सुवृक्तिमिषं न कृण्वे असुरा नवीयः
pada pāṭha: imām | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | su-vr̥ktim | iṣam | na | kr̥ṇve | asurā | navīyaḥ || inaḥ | vām | anyaḥ | pada-vīḥ | adabdhaḥ | janam | ca | mitraḥ | yatati | bruvāṇaḥ ||7.36.2||

IAST: ino vām anyaḥ padavīr adabdho janaṁ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ
Griffith: One of you is a strong unerring Leader, and Mitra, speaking, stirreth men to labour.
Devanāgarī: इनो वामन्यः पदवीरदब्धो जनं च मित्रो यतति ब्रुवाणः
pada pāṭha: imām | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | su-vr̥ktim | iṣam | na | kr̥ṇve | asurā | navīyaḥ || inaḥ | vām | anyaḥ | pada-vīḥ | adabdhaḥ | janam | ca | mitraḥ | yatati | bruvāṇaḥ ||7.36.2||

IAST: ā vātasya dhrajato ranta ityā apīpayanta dhenavo na sūdāḥ
Griffith: The movements of the gliding wind come hither: like cows, the springs are filled to overflowing.
Devanāgarī: आ वातस्य ध्रजतो रन्त इत्या अपीपयन्त धेनवो न सूदाः
pada pāṭha: ā | vātasya | dhrajataḥ | rante | ityāḥ | apīpayanta | dhenavaḥ | na | sūdāḥ || mahaḥ | divaḥ | sadane | jāyamānaḥ | acikradat | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sasmin | ūdhan ||7.36.3||

IAST: maho divaḥ sadane jāyamāno 'cikradad vṛṣabhaḥ sasminn ūdhan
Griffith: Born in the station e'en of lofty heaven the Bull hath loudly bellowed in this region.
Devanāgarī: महो दिवः सदने जायमानोऽचिक्रदद्वृषभः सस्मिन्नूधन्
pada pāṭha: ā | vātasya | dhrajataḥ | rante | ityāḥ | apīpayanta | dhenavaḥ | na | sūdāḥ || mahaḥ | divaḥ | sadane | jāyamānaḥ | acikradat | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | sasmin | ūdhan ||7.36.3||

IAST: girā ya etā yunajad dharī ta indra priyā surathā śūra dhāyū
Griffith: May I bring hither with my song, O Indra, wise Aryaman who yokes thy dear Bay Horses,
Devanāgarī: गिरा य एता युनजद्धरी त इन्द्र प्रिया सुरथा शूर धायू
pada pāṭha: girā | yaḥ | etā | yunajat | harī iti | te | indra | priyā | su-rathā | śūra | dhāyū iti || pra | yaḥ | manyum | ririkṣataḥ | mināti | ā | su-kratum | aryamaṇam | vavr̥tyām ||7.36.4||

IAST: pra yo manyuṁ ririkṣato mināty ā sukratum aryamaṇaṁ vavṛtyām
Griffith: Voracious, with thy noble car, O Hero, him who defeats the wrath of the malicious.
Devanāgarī: प्र यो मन्युं रिरिक्षतो मिनात्या सुक्रतुमर्यमणं ववृत्याम्
pada pāṭha: girā | yaḥ | etā | yunajat | harī iti | te | indra | priyā | su-rathā | śūra | dhāyū iti || pra | yaḥ | manyum | ririkṣataḥ | mināti | ā | su-kratum | aryamaṇam | vavr̥tyām ||7.36.4||

IAST: yajante asya sakhyaṁ vayaś ca namasvinaḥ sva ṛtasya dhāman
Griffith: In their own place of sacrifice adorers worship to gain long life and win his friendship.
Devanāgarī: यजन्ते अस्य सख्यं वयश्च नमस्विनः स्व ऋतस्य धामन्
pada pāṭha: yajante | asya | sakhyam | vayaḥ | ca | namasvinaḥ | sve | r̥tasya | dhāman || vi | pr̥kṣaḥ | bābadhe | nr̥-bhiḥ | stavānaḥ | idam | namaḥ | rudrāya | preṣṭham ||7.36.5||

IAST: vi pṛkṣo bābadhe nṛbhiḥ stavāna idaṁ namo rudrāya preṣṭham
Griffith: He hath poured food on men when they have praised him; be this, the dearest reverence, paid to Rudra.
Devanāgarī: वि पृक्षो बाबधे नृभिः स्तवान इदं नमो रुद्राय प्रेष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: yajante | asya | sakhyam | vayaḥ | ca | namasvinaḥ | sve | r̥tasya | dhāman || vi | pr̥kṣaḥ | bābadhe | nr̥-bhiḥ | stavānaḥ | idam | namaḥ | rudrāya | preṣṭham ||7.36.5||

IAST: ā yat sākaṁ yaśaso vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhumātā
Griffith: Coming together, glorious, loudly roaring - Sarasvati, Mother of Floods, the seventh-
Devanāgarī: आ यत्साकं यशसो वावशानाः सरस्वती सप्तथी सिन्धुमाता
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | sākam | yaśasaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | sarasvatī | saptathī | sindhu-mātā || yāḥ | susvayanta | su-dughāḥ | su-dhārāḥ | abhi | svena | payasā | pīpyānāḥ ||7.36.6||

IAST: yāḥ suṣvayanta sudughāḥ sudhārā abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ
Griffith: With copious milk, with fair streams, strongly flowing, full swelling with the volume of their water;
Devanāgarī: याः सुष्वयन्त सुदुघाः सुधारा अभि स्वेन पयसा पीप्यानाः
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | sākam | yaśasaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ | sarasvatī | saptathī | sindhu-mātā || yāḥ | susvayanta | su-dughāḥ | su-dhārāḥ | abhi | svena | payasā | pīpyānāḥ ||7.36.6||

IAST: uta tye no maruto mandasānā dhiyaṁ tokaṁ ca vājino 'vantu
Griffith: And may the mighty Maruts, too, rejoicing, aid our devotion and protect our offspring.
Devanāgarī: उत त्ये नो मरुतो मन्दसाना धियं तोकं च वाजिनोऽवन्तु
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | naḥ | marutaḥ | mandasānāḥ | dhiyam | tokam | ca | vājinaḥ | avantu || mā | naḥ | pari | khyat | akṣarā | carantī | avīvr̥dhan | yujyam | te | rayim | naḥ ||7.36.7||

IAST: mā naḥ pari khyad akṣarā caranty avīvṛdhan yujyaṁ te rayiṁ naḥ
Griffith: Let not swift-moving Aksara neglect us: they have increased our own appropriate riches,
Devanāgarī: मा नः परि ख्यदक्षरा चरन्त्यवीवृधन्युज्यं ते रयिं नः
pada pāṭha: uta | tye | naḥ | marutaḥ | mandasānāḥ | dhiyam | tokam | ca | vājinaḥ | avantu || mā | naḥ | pari | khyat | akṣarā | carantī | avīvr̥dhan | yujyam | te | rayim | naḥ ||7.36.7||

IAST: pra vo mahīm aramatiṁ kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇaṁ vidathyaṁ na vīram
Griffith: Bring ye the great Aramati before you, and Pusan as the Hero of the synod,
Devanāgarī: प्र वो महीमरमतिं कृणुध्वं प्र पूषणं विदथ्यं न वीरम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahīm | aramatim | kr̥ṇudhvam | pra | pūṣaṇam | vidathyam | na | vīram || bhagam | dhiyaḥ | avitāram | naḥ | asyāḥ | śātau | vājam | rāti-sācam | puram-dhim ||7.36.8||

IAST: bhagaṁ dhiyo 'vitāraṁ no asyāḥ sātau vājaṁ rātiṣācam puraṁdhim
Griffith: Bhaga who looks upon this hymn with favour, and, as our strength, the bountiful Purandbi.
Devanāgarī: भगं धियोऽवितारं नो अस्याः सातौ वाजं रातिषाचं पुरंधिम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | mahīm | aramatim | kr̥ṇudhvam | pra | pūṣaṇam | vidathyam | na | vīram || bhagam | dhiyaḥ | avitāram | naḥ | asyāḥ | śātau | vājam | rāti-sācam | puram-dhim ||7.36.8||

IAST: acchāyaṁ vo marutaḥ śloka etv acchā viṣṇuṁ niṣiktapām avobhiḥ
Griffith: May this our song of praise reach you, O Maruts, and Visnu guardian of the future infant.
Devanāgarī: अच्छायं वो मरुतः श्लोक एत्वच्छा विष्णुं निषिक्तपामवोभिः
pada pāṭha: accha | ayam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | ślokaḥ | etu | accha | viṣṇum | nisikta-pām | avaḥ-bhiḥ || uta | pra-jāyai | gr̥ṇate | vayaḥ | dhuḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.36.9||

IAST: uta prajāyai gṛṇate vayo dhur yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May they vouchsafe the singer strength for offspring. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: उत प्रजायै गृणते वयो धुर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: accha | ayam | vaḥ | marutaḥ | ślokaḥ | etu | accha | viṣṇum | nisikta-pām | avaḥ-bhiḥ || uta | pra-jāyai | gr̥ṇate | vayaḥ | dhuḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.36.9||

IAST: ā vo vāhiṣṭho vahatu stavadhyai ratho vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktaḥ
Griffith: LET your best-bearing car that must be lauded, ne'er injured, bring you Vajas and Rbhuksans.
Devanāgarī: आ वो वाहिष्ठो वहतु स्तवध्यै रथो वाजा ऋभुक्षणो अमृक्तः
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | vahatu | stavadhyai | rathaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | amr̥ktaḥ || abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaiḥ | savaneṣu | somaiḥ | made | su-śiprāḥ | maha-bhiḥ | pr̥ṇadhvam ||7.37.1||

IAST: abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somair made suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam
Griffith: Fill you, fair-helmeted! with mighty Soma, thrice-mixed, at our libations to delight you.
Devanāgarī: अभि त्रिपृष्ठैः सवनेषु सोमैर्मदे सुशिप्रा महभिः पृणध्वम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | vahatu | stavadhyai | rathaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | amr̥ktaḥ || abhi | tri-pr̥ṣṭhaiḥ | savaneṣu | somaiḥ | made | su-śiprāḥ | maha-bhiḥ | pr̥ṇadhvam ||7.37.1||

IAST: yūyaṁ ha ratnam maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam
Griffith: Ye who behold the light of heaven, Rbhuksans, give our rich patrons unmolested riches.
Devanāgarī: यूयं ह रत्नं मघवत्सु धत्थ स्वर्दृश ऋभुक्षणो अमृक्तम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | ha | ratnam | maghavat-su | dhattha | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | amr̥ktam || sam | yajñeṣu | svadhā-vantaḥ | pibadhvam | vi | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | mati-bhiḥ | dayadhvam ||7.37.2||

IAST: saṁ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṁ vi no rādhāṁsi matibhir dayadhvam
Griffith: Drink, heavenly-natured. at our sacrifices, and give us bounties for the hymns we sing you.
Devanāgarī: सं यज्ञेषु स्वधावन्तः पिबध्वं वि नो राधांसि मतिभिर्दयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | ha | ratnam | maghavat-su | dhattha | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | amr̥ktam || sam | yajñeṣu | svadhā-vantaḥ | pibadhvam | vi | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | mati-bhiḥ | dayadhvam ||7.37.2||

IAST: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇam maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāge
Griffith: For thou, O Bounteous One, art used to giving, at parting treasure whether small or ample.
Devanāgarī: उवोचिथ हि मघवन्देष्णं महो अर्भस्य वसुनो विभागे
pada pāṭha: uvocitha | hi | magha-van | deṣṇam | mahaḥ | arbhasya | vasunaḥ | vi-bhāge || ubhā | te | pūrṇā | vasunā | gabhastī iti | na | sūnr̥tā | ni | yamate | vasavyā ||7.37.3||

IAST: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā gabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā
Griffith: Filled full are both thine arms with great possessions: thy goodness keeps thee not from granting riches
Devanāgarī: उभा ते पूर्णा वसुना गभस्ती न सूनृता नि यमते वसव्या
pada pāṭha: uvocitha | hi | magha-van | deṣṇam | mahaḥ | arbhasya | vasunaḥ | vi-bhāge || ubhā | te | pūrṇā | vasunā | gabhastī iti | na | sūnr̥tā | ni | yamate | vasavyā ||7.37.3||

IAST: tvam indra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhur astam eṣy ṛkvā
Griffith: Indra, high-famed, as Vaja and Rbhuksans, thou goest working, singing to the dwelling.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्र स्वयशा ऋभुक्षा वाजो न साधुरस्तमेष्यृक्वा
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sva-yaśāḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | na | sādhuḥ | astam | eṣi | r̥kvā || vayam | nu | te | dāśvāṁsaḥ | syāma | brahma | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | hari-vaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.37.4||

IAST: vayaṁ nu te dāśvāṁsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, this day may we Vasisthas offer our prayers to thee and bring oblations.
Devanāgarī: वयं नु ते दाश्वांसः स्याम ब्रह्म कृण्वन्तो हरिवो वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | indra | sva-yaśāḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | na | sādhuḥ | astam | eṣi | r̥kvā || vayam | nu | te | dāśvāṁsaḥ | syāma | brahma | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | hari-vaḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ ||7.37.4||

IAST: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhir viveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ
Griffith: Thou winnest swift advancement for thy servant, through hymns, Lord of Bay Steeds, which thou hast favoure
Devanāgarī: सनितासि प्रवतो दाशुषे चिद्याभिर्विवेषो हर्यश्व धीभिः
pada pāṭha: sanitā | asi | pra-vataḥ | dāśuṣe | cit | yābhiḥ | viveṣaḥ | hari-aśva | dhībhiḥ || vavanma | nu | te | yujyābhiḥ | ūtī | kadā | naḥ | indra | rāyaḥ | ā | daśasyeḥ ||7.37.5||

IAST: vavanmā nu te yujyābhir ūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ
Griffith: For thee with friendly succour have we battled, and when, O Indra, wilt thou grant us riches?
Devanāgarī: ववन्मा नु ते युज्याभिरूती कदा न इन्द्र राय आ दशस्येः
pada pāṭha: sanitā | asi | pra-vataḥ | dāśuṣe | cit | yābhiḥ | viveṣaḥ | hari-aśva | dhībhiḥ || vavanma | nu | te | yujyābhiḥ | ūtī | kadā | naḥ | indra | rāyaḥ | ā | daśasyeḥ ||7.37.5||

IAST: vāsayasīva vedhasas tvaṁ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ
Griffith: To us thy priests a home, as 'twere, thou givest: when, Indra wilt thou recognize our praises?
Devanāgarī: वासयसीव वेधसस्त्वं नः कदा न इन्द्र वचसो बुबोधः
pada pāṭha: vāsayasi-iva | vedhasaḥ | tvam | naḥ | kadā | naḥ | indra | vacasaḥ | bubodhaḥ || astam | tātyā | dhiyā | rayim | su-vīram | pr̥kṣaḥ | naḥ | arvā | ni | uhīta | vājī ||7.37.6||

IAST: astaṁ tātyā dhiyā rayiṁ suvīram pṛkṣo no arvā ny uhīta vājī
Griffith: May thy strong Steed, through our ancestral worship, bring food and wealth with heroes to our dwelling.
Devanāgarī: अस्तं तात्या धिया रयिं सुवीरं पृक्षो नो अर्वा न्युहीत वाजी
pada pāṭha: vāsayasi-iva | vedhasaḥ | tvam | naḥ | kadā | naḥ | indra | vacasaḥ | bubodhaḥ || astam | tātyā | dhiyā | rayim | su-vīram | pr̥kṣaḥ | naḥ | arvā | ni | uhīta | vājī ||7.37.6||

IAST: abhi yaṁ devī nirṛtiś cid īśe nakṣanta indraṁ śaradaḥ supṛkṣaḥ
Griffith: Though Nirrti the Goddess reigneth round him, Autumns with food in plenty come to Indra.
Devanāgarī: अभि यं देवी निरृतिश्चिदीशे नक्षन्त इन्द्रं शरदः सुपृक्षः
pada pāṭha: abhi | yam | devī | niḥ-r̥tiḥ | cit | īśe | nakṣante | indram | śaradaḥ | su-pr̥kṣaḥ || upa | tri-bandhuḥ | jarat-aṣṭim | eti | asva-veśam | yam | kr̥ṇavanta | martāḥ ||7.37.7||

IAST: upa tribandhur jaradaṣṭim ety asvaveśaṁ yaṁ kṛṇavanta martāḥ
Griffith: With three close Friends to length of days he cometh, he whom men let not rest at home in quiet.
Devanāgarī: उप त्रिबन्धुर्जरदष्टिमेत्यस्ववेशं यं कृणवन्त मर्ताः
pada pāṭha: abhi | yam | devī | niḥ-r̥tiḥ | cit | īśe | nakṣante | indram | śaradaḥ | su-pr̥kṣaḥ || upa | tri-bandhuḥ | jarat-aṣṭim | eti | asva-veśam | yam | kr̥ṇavanta | martāḥ ||7.37.7||

IAST: ā no rādhāṁsi savitaḥ stavadhyā ā rāyo yantu parvatasya rātau
Griffith: Promise us gifts, O Savitar: may riches come unto us in Parvata's full bounty.
Devanāgarī: आ नो राधांसि सवितः स्तवध्या आ रायो यन्तु पर्वतस्य रातौ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | savitariti | stavadhyai | ā | rāyaḥ | yantu | parvatasya | rātau || sadā | naḥ | divyaḥ | pāyuḥ | sisaktu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.37.8||

IAST: sadā no divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May the Celestial Guardian still attend us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सदा नो दिव्यः पायुः सिषक्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | rādhāṁsi | savitariti | stavadhyai | ā | rāyaḥ | yantu | parvatasya | rātau || sadā | naḥ | divyaḥ | pāyuḥ | sisaktu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.37.8||

IAST: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīm amatiṁ yām aśiśret
Griffith: ON high hath Savitar, this God, extended the golden lustre which he spreads around him.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य देवः सविता ययाम हिरण्ययीममतिं यामशिश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | yayāma | hiraṇyayīm | amatim | yām | aśiśret || nūnam | bhagaḥ | havyaḥ | mānuṣebhiḥ | vi | yaḥ | ratnā | puru-vasuḥ | dadhāti ||7.38.1||

IAST: nūnam bhago havyo mānuṣebhir vi yo ratnā purūvasur dadhāti
Griffith: Now, now must Bhaga be invoked by mortals, Lord of great riches who distributes treasures.
Devanāgarī: नूनं भगो हव्यो मानुषेभिर्वि यो रत्ना पुरूवसुर्दधाति
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | yayāma | hiraṇyayīm | amatim | yām | aśiśret || nūnam | bhagaḥ | havyaḥ | mānuṣebhiḥ | vi | yaḥ | ratnā | puru-vasuḥ | dadhāti ||7.38.1||

IAST: ud u tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhy asya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya
Griffith: Rise up, O Savitar whose hands are golden, and hear this man while sacrifice is offered,
Devanāgarī: उदु तिष्ठ सवितः श्रुध्यस्य हिरण्यपाणे प्रभृतावृतस्य
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tiṣṭha | savitariti | śrudhi | asya | hiraṇya-pāṇe | pra-bhr̥tau | r̥tasya || vi | urvīm | pr̥thvīm | amatim | sr̥jānaḥ | ā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | marta-bhojanam | suvānaḥ ||7.38.2||

IAST: vy urvīm pṛthvīm amatiṁ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṁ suvānaḥ
Griffith: Spreading afar thy broad and wide effulgence, and bringing mortal men the food that feeds them.
Devanāgarī: व्युर्वीं पृथ्वीममतिं सृजान आ नृभ्यो मर्तभोजनं सुवानः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tiṣṭha | savitariti | śrudhi | asya | hiraṇya-pāṇe | pra-bhr̥tau | r̥tasya || vi | urvīm | pr̥thvīm | amatim | sr̥jānaḥ | ā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | marta-bhojanam | suvānaḥ ||7.38.2||

IAST: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yam ā cid viśve vasavo gṛṇanti
Griffith: Let Savitar the God he hymned with praises, to whom the Vasus, even, all sing glory.
Devanāgarī: अपि ष्टुतः सविता देवो अस्तु यमा चिद्विश्वे वसवो गृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: api | stutaḥ | savitā | devaḥ | astu | yam | ā | cit | viśve | vasavaḥ | gr̥ṇanti || saḥ | naḥ | stomān | namasyaḥ | canaḥ | dhāt | viśvebhiḥ | pātu | pāyu-bhiḥ | ni | sūrīn ||7.38.3||

IAST: sa naḥ stomān namasyaś cano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhir ni sūrīn
Griffith: Sweet be our lauds to him whose due is worship: may he with all protection guard our princes.
Devanāgarī: स नः स्तोमान्नमस्यश्चनो धाद्विश्वेभिः पातु पायुभिर्नि सूरीन्
pada pāṭha: api | stutaḥ | savitā | devaḥ | astu | yam | ā | cit | viśve | vasavaḥ | gr̥ṇanti || saḥ | naḥ | stomān | namasyaḥ | canaḥ | dhāt | viśvebhiḥ | pātu | pāyu-bhiḥ | ni | sūrīn ||7.38.3||

IAST: abhi yaṁ devy aditir gṛṇāti savaṁ devasya savitur juṣāṇā
Griffith: Even he whom Aditi the Goddess praises, rejoicing in God Savitar's incitement:
Devanāgarī: अभि यं देव्यदितिर्गृणाति सवं देवस्य सवितुर्जुषाणा
pada pāṭha: abhi | yam | devī | aditiḥ | gr̥ṇāti | savam | devasya | savituḥ | juṣāṇā || abhi | sam-rājaḥ | varuṇaḥ | gr̥ṇanti | abhi | mitrāsaḥ | aryamā | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.38.4||

IAST: abhi samrājo varuṇo gṛṇanty abhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: Even he who praise the high imperial Rulers, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, sing in concert.
Devanāgarī: अभि सम्राजो वरुणो गृणन्त्यभि मित्रासो अर्यमा सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | yam | devī | aditiḥ | gr̥ṇāti | savam | devasya | savituḥ | juṣāṇā || abhi | sam-rājaḥ | varuṇaḥ | gr̥ṇanti | abhi | mitrāsaḥ | aryamā | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.38.4||

IAST: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṁ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: They who come emulous to our oblation, dispensing bounty, from the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: अभि ये मिथो वनुषः सपन्ते रातिं दिवो रातिषाचः पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: abhi | ye | mithaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | sapante | rātim | divaḥ | rāti-sācaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ || ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | uta | naḥ | śr̥ṇotu | varūtrī | ekadhenu-bhiḥ | ni | pātu ||7.38.5||

IAST: ahir budhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtry ekadhenubhir ni pātu
Griffith: May they and Ahibudhnya hear our calling: guard us Varutri with the Ekadhenus.
Devanāgarī: अहिर्बुध्न्य उत नः शृणोतु वरूत्र्येकधेनुभिर्नि पातु
pada pāṭha: abhi | ye | mithaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | sapante | rātim | divaḥ | rāti-sācaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ || ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | uta | naḥ | śr̥ṇotu | varūtrī | ekadhenu-bhiḥ | ni | pātu ||7.38.5||

IAST: anu tan no jāspatir maṁsīṣṭa ratnaṁ devasya savitur iyānaḥ
Griffith: This may the Lord of Life, entreated, grant us,-the wealth which Savitar the God possesses.
Devanāgarī: अनु तन्नो जास्पतिर्मंसीष्ट रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानः
pada pāṭha: anu | tat | naḥ | jāḥpatiḥ | maṁsīṣṭa | ratnam | devasya | savituḥ | iyānaḥ || bhagam | ugraḥ | avase | johavīti | bhagam | anugraḥ | adha | yāti | ratnam ||7.38.6||

IAST: bhagam ugro 'vase johavīti bhagam anugro adha yāti ratnam
Griffith: The mighty calls on Bhaga for protection, on Bhaga calls the weak to give him riches.
Devanāgarī: भगमुग्रोऽवसे जोहवीति भगमनुग्रो अध याति रत्नम्
pada pāṭha: anu | tat | naḥ | jāḥpatiḥ | maṁsīṣṭa | ratnam | devasya | savituḥ | iyānaḥ || bhagam | ugraḥ | avase | johavīti | bhagam | anugraḥ | adha | yāti | ratnam ||7.38.6||

IAST: śaṁ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ
Griffith: Bless us the Vajins when we call, while slowly they move, strong Singers, to the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: शं नो भवन्तु वाजिनो हवेषु देवताता मितद्रवः स्वर्काः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhavantu | vājinaḥ | haveṣu | deva-tātā | mita-dravaḥ | su-arkāḥ || jambhayantaḥ | ahim | vr̥kam | rakṣāṁsi | sanemi | asmat | yuyavan | amīvāḥ ||7.38.7||

IAST: jambhayanto 'hiṁ vṛkaṁ rakṣāṁsi sanemy asmad yuyavann amīvāḥ
Griffith: Crushing the wolf, the serpent, and the demons, may they completely banish all affliction.
Devanāgarī: जम्भयन्तोऽहिं वृकं रक्षांसि सनेम्यस्मद्युयवन्नमीवाः
pada pāṭha: śam | naḥ | bhavantu | vājinaḥ | haveṣu | deva-tātā | mita-dravaḥ | su-arkāḥ || jambhayantaḥ | ahim | vr̥kam | rakṣāṁsi | sanemi | asmat | yuyavan | amīvāḥ ||7.38.7||

IAST: vāje-vāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: Deep-skilled in Law eternal, deathless, Singers, O Vajins, help us in each fray for booty.
Devanāgarī: वाजेवाजेऽवत वाजिनो नो धनेषु विप्रा अमृता ऋतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: vāje-vāje | avata | vājinaḥ | naḥ | dhaneṣu | viprāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || asya | madhvaḥ | pibata | mādayadhvam | tr̥ptāḥ | yāta | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ ||7.38.8||

IAST: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṁ tṛptā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ
Griffith: Drink of this meath, he satisfied, be joyful: then go on paths which Gods are wont to travel.
Devanāgarī: अस्य मध्वः पिबत मादयध्वं तृप्ता यात पथिभिर्देवयानैः
pada pāṭha: vāje-vāje | avata | vājinaḥ | naḥ | dhaneṣu | viprāḥ | amr̥tāḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || asya | madhvaḥ | pibata | mādayadhvam | tr̥ptāḥ | yāta | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ ||7.38.8||

IAST: ūrdhvo agniḥ sumatiṁ vasvo aśret pratīcī jūrṇir devatātim eti
Griffith: AGNI, erect, hath shown enriching favour: the flame goes forward to the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो अग्निः सुमतिं वस्वो अश्रेत्प्रतीची जूर्णिर्देवतातिमेति
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | agniḥ | su-matim | vasvaḥ | aśret | pratīcī | jūrṇiḥ | deva-tātim | eti || bhejāte iti | adrī iti | rathyā-iva | panthām | r̥tam | hotā | naḥ | iṣitaḥ | yajāti ||7.39.1||

IAST: bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthām ṛtaṁ hotā na iṣito yajāti
Griffith: Like car-borne men the stones their path have chosen: let the priest, quickened, celebrate our worship.
Devanāgarī: भेजाते अद्री रथ्येव पन्थामृतं होता न इषितो यजाति
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | agniḥ | su-matim | vasvaḥ | aśret | pratīcī | jūrṇiḥ | deva-tātim | eti || bhejāte iti | adrī iti | rathyā-iva | panthām | r̥tam | hotā | naḥ | iṣitaḥ | yajāti ||7.39.1||

IAST: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhir eṣām ā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte
Griffith: Soft to the tread, their sacred grass is scattered: these go like Kings amid the band around them,
Devanāgarī: प्र वावृजे सुप्रया बर्हिरेषामा विश्पतीव बीरिट इयाते
pada pāṭha: pra | vavr̥je | su-prayāḥ | barhiḥ | eṣām | ā | viśpatī iveti viśpatī-iva | bīriṭe | iyāte iti || viśām | aktoḥ | uṣasaḥ | pūrva-hūtau | vāyuḥ | pūṣā | svastaye | niyutvān ||7.39.2||

IAST: viśām aktor uṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān
Griffith: At the folks early call on Night and Morning,-Vayu, and Pusan with his team, to bless us.
Devanāgarī: विशामक्तोरुषसः पूर्वहूतौ वायुः पूषा स्वस्तये नियुत्वान्
pada pāṭha: pra | vavr̥je | su-prayāḥ | barhiḥ | eṣām | ā | viśpatī iveti viśpatī-iva | bīriṭe | iyāte iti || viśām | aktoḥ | uṣasaḥ | pūrva-hūtau | vāyuḥ | pūṣā | svastaye | niyutvān ||7.39.2||

IAST: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāv antarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ
Griffith: Here on their path the noble Gods proceeded: in the wide firmament the Beauteous decked them.
Devanāgarī: ज्मया अत्र वसवो रन्त देवा उरावन्तरिक्षे मर्जयन्त शुभ्राः
pada pāṭha: jmayāḥ | atra | vasavaḥ | ranta | devāḥ | urau | antarikṣe | marjayanta | śubhrāḥ || arvāk | pathaḥ | uru-jrayaḥ | kr̥ṇudhvam | śrota | dūtasya | jagmuṣaḥ | naḥ | asya ||7.39.3||

IAST: arvāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṁ śrotā dūtasya jagmuṣo no asya
Griffith: Bend your way hither, ye who travel widely: hear this our envoy who hath gone to meet you.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाक्पथ उरुज्रयः कृणुध्वं श्रोता दूतस्य जग्मुषो नो अस्य
pada pāṭha: jmayāḥ | atra | vasavaḥ | ranta | devāḥ | urau | antarikṣe | marjayanta | śubhrāḥ || arvāk | pathaḥ | uru-jrayaḥ | kr̥ṇudhvam | śrota | dūtasya | jagmuṣaḥ | naḥ | asya ||7.39.3||

IAST: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṁ viśve abhi santi devāḥ
Griffith: For they are holy aids at sacrifices: all Gods approach the place of congregation.
Devanāgarī: ते हि यज्ञेषु यज्ञियास ऊमाः सधस्थं विश्वे अभि सन्ति देवाः
pada pāṭha: te | hi | yajñeṣu | yajñiyāsaḥ | ūmāḥ | sadha-stham | viśve | abhi | santi | devāḥ || tān | adhvare | uśataḥ | yakṣi | agne | śruṣṭī | bhagam | nāsatyā | puram-dhim ||7.39.4||

IAST: tām̐ adhvara uśato yakṣy agne śruṣṭī bhagaṁ nāsatyā puraṁdhim
Griffith: Bring these, desirous, to our worship, Agni, swift the Nisatyas, Bhaga, and Purandhi.
Devanāgarī: ताँ अध्वर उशतो यक्ष्यग्ने श्रुष्टी भगं नासत्या पुरंधिम्
pada pāṭha: te | hi | yajñeṣu | yajñiyāsaḥ | ūmāḥ | sadha-stham | viśve | abhi | santi | devāḥ || tān | adhvare | uśataḥ | yakṣi | agne | śruṣṭī | bhagam | nāsatyā | puram-dhim ||7.39.4||

IAST: āgne giro diva ā pṛthivyā mitraṁ vaha varuṇam indram agnim
Griffith: Agni, to these men's hymns, from earth, from heaven, bring Mitra, Varuna, Indra, and Agni,
Devanāgarī: आग्ने गिरो दिव आ पृथिव्या मित्रं वह वरुणमिन्द्रमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | giraḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | mitram | vaha | varuṇam | indram | agnim || ā | aryamaṇam | aditim | viṣṇum | eṣām | sarasvatī | marutaḥ | mādayantām ||7.39.5||

IAST: āryamaṇam aditiṁ viṣṇum eṣāṁ sarasvatī maruto mādayantām
Griffith: And Aryaman, and Aditi, and Visnu. Sarasvati be joyful, and the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: आर्यमणमदितिं विष्णुमेषां सरस्वती मरुतो मादयन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agne | giraḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | mitram | vaha | varuṇam | indram | agnim || ā | aryamaṇam | aditim | viṣṇum | eṣām | sarasvatī | marutaḥ | mādayantām ||7.39.5||

IAST: rare havyam matibhir yajñiyānāṁ nakṣat kāmam martyānām asinvan
Griffith: Even as the holy wish, the gift is offered: may he, unsated, come when men desire him.
Devanāgarī: ररे हव्यं मतिभिर्यज्ञियानां नक्षत्कामं मर्त्यानामसिन्वन्
pada pāṭha: rare | havyam | mati-bhiḥ | yajñiyānām | nakṣat | kāmam | martyānām | asinvan || dhāta | rayim | avi-dasyam | sadā-sām | sakṣīmahi | yujyebhiḥ | nu | devaiḥ ||7.39.6||

IAST: dhātā rayim avidasyaṁ sadāsāṁ sakṣīmahi yujyebhir nu devaiḥ
Griffith: Give never-failing ever-conquering riches: with Gods for our allies may we be victors.
Devanāgarī: धाता रयिमविदस्यं सदासां सक्षीमहि युज्येभिर्नु देवैः
pada pāṭha: rare | havyam | mati-bhiḥ | yajñiyānām | nakṣat | kāmam | martyānām | asinvan || dhāta | rayim | avi-dasyam | sadā-sām | sakṣīmahi | yujyebhiḥ | nu | devaiḥ ||7.39.6||

IAST: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhair ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ
Griffith: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas; and holy Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.
Devanāgarī: नू रोदसी अभिष्टुते वसिष्ठैरृतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | abhistute ityabhi-stute | vasiṣṭhaiḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.39.7||

IAST: yacchantu candrā upamaṁ no arkaṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: यच्छन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कं यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | abhistute ityabhi-stute | vasiṣṭhaiḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.39.7||

IAST: o śruṣṭir vidathyā sam etu prati stomaṁ dadhīmahi turāṇām
Griffith: BE gathered all the audience of the synod: let us begin their praise whose course is rapid.
Devanāgarī: ओ श्रुष्टिर्विदथ्या समेतु प्रति स्तोमं दधीमहि तुराणाम्
pada pāṭha: o iti | śruṣṭiḥ | vidathyā | sam | etu | prati | stomam | dadhīmahi | turāṇām || yat | adya | devaḥ | savitā | suvāti | syāma | asya | ratninaḥ | vi-bhāge ||7.40.1||

IAST: yad adya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāmāsya ratnino vibhāge
Griffith: Whate'er God Savitar this day produces, may we be where the Wealthy One distributes.
Devanāgarī: यदद्य देवः सविता सुवाति स्यामास्य रत्निनो विभागे
pada pāṭha: o iti | śruṣṭiḥ | vidathyā | sam | etu | prati | stomam | dadhīmahi | turāṇām || yat | adya | devaḥ | savitā | suvāti | syāma | asya | ratninaḥ | vi-bhāge ||7.40.1||

IAST: mitras tan no varuṇo rodasī ca dyubhaktam indro aryamā dadātu
Griffith: This, dealt from heaven ' may both the Worlds vouchsafe us, and Varuna, Indra, Aryaman, and Mitra.
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्तन्नो वरुणो रोदसी च द्युभक्तमिन्द्रो अर्यमा ददातु
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | rodasī iti | ca | dyu-bhaktam | indraḥ | aryamā | dadātu || dideṣṭu | devī | aditiḥ | rekṇaḥ | vāyuḥ | ca | yat | niyuvaite iti ni-yuvaite | bhagaḥ | ca ||7.40.2||

IAST: dideṣṭu devy aditī rekṇo vāyuś ca yan niyuvaite bhagaś ca
Griffith: May Goddess Aditi assign us riches, Vayu and Bhaga make them ours for ever.
Devanāgarī: दिदेष्टु देव्यदिती रेक्णो वायुश्च यन्नियुवैते भगश्च
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | rodasī iti | ca | dyu-bhaktam | indraḥ | aryamā | dadātu || dideṣṭu | devī | aditiḥ | rekṇaḥ | vāyuḥ | ca | yat | niyuvaite iti ni-yuvaite | bhagaḥ | ca ||7.40.2||

IAST: sed ugro astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yam martyam pṛṣadaśvā avātha
Griffith: Strong be the man and full of power, O Maruts, whom ye, borne on by spotted coursers, favour.
Devanāgarī: सेदुग्रो अस्तु मरुतः स शुष्मी यं मर्त्यं पृषदश्वा अवाथ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | ugraḥ | astu | marutaḥ | saḥ | śuṣmī | yam | martyam | pr̥ṣat-aśvāḥ | avātha || uta | īm | agniḥ | sarasvatī | junanti | na | tasya | rāyaḥ | pari-etā | asti ||7.40.3||

IAST: utem agniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetāsti
Griffith: Him, too, Sarasvati and Agni further, and there is none to rob him of his riches.
Devanāgarī: उतेमग्निः सरस्वती जुनन्ति न तस्य रायः पर्येतास्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | ugraḥ | astu | marutaḥ | saḥ | śuṣmī | yam | martyam | pr̥ṣat-aśvāḥ | avātha || uta | īm | agniḥ | sarasvatī | junanti | na | tasya | rāyaḥ | pari-etā | asti ||7.40.3||

IAST: ayaṁ hi netā varuṇa ṛtasya mitro rājāno aryamāpo dhuḥ
Griffith: This Varuna is guide of Law, he, Mitra, and Aryaman, the Kings, our work have finished.
Devanāgarī: अयं हि नेता वरुण ऋतस्य मित्रो राजानो अर्यमापो धुः
pada pāṭha: ayam | hi | netā | varuṇaḥ | r̥tasya | mitraḥ | rājānaḥ | aryamā | apaḥ | dhuriti dhuḥ || su-havā | devī | aditiḥ | anarvā | te | naḥ | aṁhaḥ | ati | parṣan | ariṣṭān ||7.40.4||

IAST: suhavā devy aditir anarvā te no aṁho ati parṣann ariṣṭān
Griffith: Divine and foeless Aditi quickly listens. May these deliver us unharmed from trouble.
Devanāgarī: सुहवा देव्यदितिरनर्वा ते नो अंहो अति पर्षन्नरिष्टान्
pada pāṭha: ayam | hi | netā | varuṇaḥ | r̥tasya | mitraḥ | rājānaḥ | aryamā | apaḥ | dhuriti dhuḥ || su-havā | devī | aditiḥ | anarvā | te | naḥ | aṁhaḥ | ati | parṣan | ariṣṭān ||7.40.4||

IAST: asya devasya mīḻhuṣo vayā viṣṇor eṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ
Griffith: With offerings I propitiate the branches of this swift-moving God, the bounteous Visnu.
Devanāgarī: अस्य देवस्य मीळ्हुषो वया विष्णोरेषस्य प्रभृथे हविर्भिः
pada pāṭha: asya | devasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ | vayāḥ | viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | pra-bhr̥the | haviḥ-bhiḥ || vide | hi | rudraḥ | rudriyam | mahi-tvam | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat ||7.40.5||

IAST: vide hi rudro rudriyam mahitvaṁ yāsiṣṭaṁ vartir aśvināv irāvat
Griffith: Hence Rudra gained his Rudra-strength: O Asvins, ye sought the house that hath celestial viands.
Devanāgarī: विदे हि रुद्रो रुद्रियं महित्वं यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत्
pada pāṭha: asya | devasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ | vayāḥ | viṣṇoḥ | eṣasya | pra-bhr̥the | haviḥ-bhiḥ || vide | hi | rudraḥ | rudriyam | mahi-tvam | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat ||7.40.5||

IAST: mātra pūṣann āghṛṇa irasyo varūtrī yad rātiṣācaś ca rāsan
Griffith: Be not thou angry here, O glowing Pusan, for what Varutri and the Bounteous gave us.
Devanāgarī: मात्र पूषन्नाघृण इरस्यो वरूत्री यद्रातिषाचश्च रासन्
pada pāṭha: mā | atra | pūṣan | āghr̥ṇe | irasyaḥ | varūtrī | yat | rāti-sācaḥ | ca | rāsan || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | naḥ | arvantaḥ | ni | pāntu | vr̥ṣṭim | pari-jmā | vātaḥ | dadātu ||7.40.6||

IAST: mayobhuvo no arvanto ni pāntu vṛṣṭim parijmā vāto dadātu
Griffith: May the swift-moving Gods protect and bless us, and Vata send us rain, wha wanders round us.
Devanāgarī: मयोभुवो नो अर्वन्तो नि पान्तु वृष्टिं परिज्मा वातो ददातु
pada pāṭha: mā | atra | pūṣan | āghr̥ṇe | irasyaḥ | varūtrī | yat | rāti-sācaḥ | ca | rāsan || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | naḥ | arvantaḥ | ni | pāntu | vr̥ṣṭim | pari-jmā | vātaḥ | dadātu ||7.40.6||

IAST: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhair ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ
Griffith: Now have both worlds been praised by the Vasisthas, and holy Mitra, Varuna, and Agni.
Devanāgarī: नू रोदसी अभिष्टुते वसिष्ठैरृतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | abhistute ityabhi-stute | vasiṣṭhaiḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.40.7||

IAST: yacchantu candrā upamaṁ no arkaṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May they, bright Deities, make our song supremest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: यच्छन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कं यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | abhistute ityabhi-stute | vasiṣṭhaiḥ | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.40.7||

IAST: prātar agnim prātar indraṁ havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā
Griffith: AGNI at dawn, and Indra we invoke at dawn, and Varuna and Mitra, and the Asvins twain.
Devanāgarī: प्रातरग्निं प्रातरिन्द्रं हवामहे प्रातर्मित्रावरुणा प्रातरश्विना
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | agnim | prātaḥ | indram | havāmahe | prātaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | prātaḥ | aśvinā || prātaḥ | bhagam | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | prātariti | somam | uta | rudram | huvema ||7.41.1||

IAST: prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim prātaḥ somam uta rudraṁ huvema
Griffith: Bhaga at dawn, Pusan, and Brahmanaspati, Soma at dawn, Rudra we will invoke at dawn.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्भगं पूषणं ब्रह्मणस्पतिं प्रातः सोममुत रुद्रं हुवेम
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ | agnim | prātaḥ | indram | havāmahe | prātaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | prātaḥ | aśvinā || prātaḥ | bhagam | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | prātariti | somam | uta | rudram | huvema ||7.41.1||

IAST: prātarjitam bhagam ugraṁ huvema vayam putram aditer yo vidhartā
Griffith: We will invoke strong, early-conquering Bhaga, the Son of Aditi, the great supporter:
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्जितं भगमुग्रं हुवेम वयं पुत्रमदितेर्यो विधर्ता
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-jitam | bhagam | ugram | huvema | vayam | putram | aditeḥ | yaḥ | vi-dhartā || ādhraḥ | cit | yam | manyamānaḥ | turaḥ | cit | rājā | cit | yam | bhagam | bhakṣi | iti | āha ||7.41.2||

IAST: ādhraś cid yam manyamānas turaś cid rājā cid yam bhagam bhakṣīty āha
Griffith: Thinking of whom, the poor, yea, even the mighty, even the King himself says, Give me Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: आध्रश्चिद्यं मन्यमानस्तुरश्चिद्राजा चिद्यं भगं भक्षीत्याह
pada pāṭha: prātaḥ-jitam | bhagam | ugram | huvema | vayam | putram | aditeḥ | yaḥ | vi-dhartā || ādhraḥ | cit | yam | manyamānaḥ | turaḥ | cit | rājā | cit | yam | bhagam | bhakṣi | iti | āha ||7.41.2||

IAST: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satyarādho bhagemāṁ dhiyam ud avā dadan naḥ
Griffith: Bhaga our guide, Bhaga whose gifts are faithful, favour this song, and give us wealth, O Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: भग प्रणेतर्भग सत्यराधो भगेमां धियमुदवा ददन्नः
pada pāṭha: bhaga | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | bhaga | satya-rādhaḥ | bhaga | imām | dhiyam | ut | ava | dadat | naḥ || bhaga | pra | naḥ | janaya | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | bhaga | pra | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-vantaḥ | syāma ||7.41.3||

IAST: bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhir aśvair bhaga pra nṛbhir nṛvantaḥ syāma
Griffith: Bhaga, augment our store of kine and horses, Bhaga, may we be rich in men and heroes.
Devanāgarī: भग प्र णो जनय गोभिरश्वैर्भग प्र नृभिर्नृवन्तः स्याम
pada pāṭha: bhaga | pranetariti pra-netaḥ | bhaga | satya-rādhaḥ | bhaga | imām | dhiyam | ut | ava | dadat | naḥ || bhaga | pra | naḥ | janaya | gobhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | bhaga | pra | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-vantaḥ | syāma ||7.41.3||

IAST: utedānīm bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām
Griffith: So may felicity be ours at present, and when the day approaches, and at noontide;
Devanāgarī: उतेदानीं भगवन्तः स्यामोत प्रपित्व उत मध्ये अह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: uta | idānīm | bhaga-vantaḥ | syāma | uta | pra-pitve | uta | madhye | ahnām || uta | ut-itā | magha-van | sūryasya | vayam | devānām | su-matau | syāma ||7.41.4||

IAST: utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṁ devānāṁ sumatau syāma
Griffith: And may we still, O Bounteous One, at sunset be happy in the Deities' loving-kindness.
Devanāgarī: उतोदिता मघवन्सूर्यस्य वयं देवानां सुमतौ स्याम
pada pāṭha: uta | idānīm | bhaga-vantaḥ | syāma | uta | pra-pitve | uta | madhye | ahnām || uta | ut-itā | magha-van | sūryasya | vayam | devānām | su-matau | syāma ||7.41.4||

IAST: bhaga eva bhagavām̐ astu devās tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
Griffith: May Bhaga verily be bliss-bestower, and through him, Gods! may happiness attend us.
Devanāgarī: भग एव भगवाँ अस्तु देवास्तेन वयं भगवन्तः स्याम
pada pāṭha: bhagaḥ | eva | bhaga-vān | astu | devāḥ | tena | vayam | bhaga-vantaḥ | syāma || tam | tvā | bhaga | sarvaḥ | it | johavīti | saḥ | naḥ | bhaga | puraḥ-etā | bhava | iha ||7.41.5||

IAST: taṁ tvā bhaga sarva ij johavīti sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha
Griffith: As such, O Bhaga, all with might invoke thee: as such be thou our Champion here, O Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा भग सर्व इज्जोहवीति स नो भग पुरएता भवेह
pada pāṭha: bhagaḥ | eva | bhaga-vān | astu | devāḥ | tena | vayam | bhaga-vantaḥ | syāma || tam | tvā | bhaga | sarvaḥ | it | johavīti | saḥ | naḥ | bhaga | puraḥ-etā | bhava | iha ||7.41.5||

IAST: sam adhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya
Griffith: To this our worship may all Dawns incline them, and come to the pure place like Dadhikravan.
Devanāgarī: समध्वरायोषसो नमन्त दधिक्रावेव शुचये पदाय
pada pāṭha: sam | adhvarāya | uṣasaḥ | namanta | dadhikrāvā-iva | śucaye | padāya || arvācīnam | vasu-vidam | bhagam | naḥ | ratham-iva | aśvāḥ | vājinaḥ | ā | vahantu ||7.41.6||

IAST: arvācīnaṁ vasuvidam bhagaṁ no ratham ivāśvā vājina ā vahantu
Griffith: As strong steeds draw a chariot may they bring us hitherward Bhaga who discovers treasure.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीनं वसुविदं भगं नो रथमिवाश्वा वाजिन आ वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: sam | adhvarāya | uṣasaḥ | namanta | dadhikrāvā-iva | śucaye | padāya || arvācīnam | vasu-vidam | bhagam | naḥ | ratham-iva | aśvāḥ | vājinaḥ | ā | vahantu ||7.41.6||

IAST: aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
Griffith: May blessed Mornings dawn on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes,
Devanāgarī: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो वीरवतीः सदमुच्छन्तु भद्राः
pada pāṭha: aśva-vatīḥ | go-matīḥ | naḥ | uṣasaḥ | vīra-vatīḥ | sadam | ucchantu | bhadrāḥ || ghr̥tam | duhānāḥ | viśvataḥ | pra-pītāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.41.7||

IAST: ghṛtaṁ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: घृतं दुहाना विश्वतः प्रपीता यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: aśva-vatīḥ | go-matīḥ | naḥ | uṣasaḥ | vīra-vatīḥ | sadam | ucchantu | bhadrāḥ || ghr̥tam | duhānāḥ | viśvataḥ | pra-pītāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.41.7||

IAST: pra brahmāṇo aṅgiraso nakṣanta pra krandanur nabhanyasya vetu
Griffith: LET Brahmans and Angirases come forward, and let the roar of cloudy heaven surround us.
Devanāgarī: प्र ब्रह्माणो अङ्गिरसो नक्षन्त प्र क्रन्दनुर्नभन्यस्य वेतु
pada pāṭha: pra | brahmāṇaḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | nakṣanta | pra | krandanuḥ | nabhanyasya | vetu || pra | dhenavaḥ | uda-prutaḥ | navanta | yujyātām | adrī iti | adhvarasya | peśaḥ ||7.42.1||

IAST: pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātām adrī adhvarasya peśaḥ
Griffith: Loud low the Milch-kine swimming in the waters: set be the stones that grace our holy service.
Devanāgarī: प्र धेनव उदप्रुतो नवन्त युज्यातामद्री अध्वरस्य पेशः
pada pāṭha: pra | brahmāṇaḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | nakṣanta | pra | krandanuḥ | nabhanyasya | vetu || pra | dhenavaḥ | uda-prutaḥ | navanta | yujyātām | adrī iti | adhvarasya | peśaḥ ||7.42.1||

IAST: sugas te agne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaś ca
Griffith: Fair, Agni, is thy long-known path to travel: yoke for the juice tfiy bay, thy ruddy horses,
Devanāgarī: सुगस्ते अग्ने सनवित्तो अध्वा युक्ष्वा सुते हरितो रोहितश्च
pada pāṭha: su-gaḥ | te | agne | sana-vittaḥ | adhvā | yukṣva | sute | haritaḥ | rohitaḥ | ca || ye | vā | sadman | aruṣāḥ | vīra-vāhaḥ | huve | devānām | janimāni | sattaḥ ||7.42.2||

IAST: ye vā sadmann aruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṁ janimāni sattaḥ
Griffith: Or red steeds, Hero-bearing, for the chamber. Seated, I call the Deities' generations.
Devanāgarī: ये वा सद्मन्नरुषा वीरवाहो हुवे देवानां जनिमानि सत्तः
pada pāṭha: su-gaḥ | te | agne | sana-vittaḥ | adhvā | yukṣva | sute | haritaḥ | rohitaḥ | ca || ye | vā | sadman | aruṣāḥ | vīra-vāhaḥ | huve | devānām | janimāni | sattaḥ ||7.42.2||

IAST: sam u vo yajñam mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke
Griffith: They glorify your sacrifice with worship, yet the glad Priest near them is left unequalled.
Devanāgarī: समु वो यज्ञं महयन्नमोभिः प्र होता मन्द्रो रिरिच उपाके
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | yajñam | mahayan | namaḥ-bhiḥ | pra | hotā | mandraḥ | ririce | upāke || yajasva | su | puru-anīka | devān | ā | yajñiyām | aramatim | vavr̥tyāḥ ||7.42.3||

IAST: yajasva su purvaṇīka devān ā yajñiyām aramatiṁ vavṛtyāḥ
Griffith: Bring the Gods hither, thou of many aspects: turn hitherward Aramati the Holy.
Devanāgarī: यजस्व सु पुर्वणीक देवाना यज्ञियामरमतिं ववृत्याः
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | yajñam | mahayan | namaḥ-bhiḥ | pra | hotā | mandraḥ | ririce | upāke || yajasva | su | puru-anīka | devān | ā | yajñiyām | aramatim | vavr̥tyāḥ ||7.42.3||

IAST: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīr atithir āciketat
Griffith: What time the Guest hath made himself apparent, at ease reclining in the rich man's dwelling,
Devanāgarī: यदा वीरस्य रेवतो दुरोणे स्योनशीरतिथिराचिकेतत्
pada pāṭha: yadā | vīrasya | revataḥ | duroṇe | syona-śīḥ | atithiḥ | ā-ciketat || su-prītaḥ | agniḥ | su-dhitaḥ | dame | ā | saḥ | viśe | dāti | vāryam | iyatyai ||7.42.4||

IAST: suprīto agniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryam iyatyai
Griffith: Agni, well-pleased, well-placed within the chamber gives to a house like this wealth worth the choosing
Devanāgarī: सुप्रीतो अग्निः सुधितो दम आ स विशे दाति वार्यमियत्यै
pada pāṭha: yadā | vīrasya | revataḥ | duroṇe | syona-śīḥ | atithiḥ | ā-ciketat || su-prītaḥ | agniḥ | su-dhitaḥ | dame | ā | saḥ | viśe | dāti | vāryam | iyatyai ||7.42.4||

IAST: imaṁ no agne adhvaraṁ juṣasva marutsv indre yaśasaṁ kṛdhī naḥ
Griffith: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni; glorify it with Indra and the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं जुषस्व मरुत्स्विन्द्रे यशसं कृधी नः
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | agne | adhvaram | juṣasva | marut-su | indre | yaśasam | kr̥dhi | naḥ || ā | naktā | barhiḥ | sadatām | uṣasā | uśantā | mitrāvaruṇā | yaja | iha ||7.42.5||

IAST: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatām uṣāsośantā mitrāvaruṇā yajeha
Griffith: Here on our grass let Night and Dawn be seated: bring longing Varuna and Mitra hither.
Devanāgarī: आ नक्ता बर्हिः सदतामुषासोशन्ता मित्रावरुणा यजेह
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | agne | adhvaram | juṣasva | marut-su | indre | yaśasam | kr̥dhi | naḥ || ā | naktā | barhiḥ | sadatām | uṣasā | uśantā | mitrāvaruṇā | yaja | iha ||7.42.5||

IAST: evāgniṁ sahasyaṁ vasiṣṭho rāyaskāmo viśvapsnyasya staut
Griffith: Thus hath Vasistha praised victorious Agni, yearning for wealth that giveth all subsistence.
Devanāgarī: एवाग्निं सहस्यं वसिष्ठो रायस्कामो विश्वप्स्न्यस्य स्तौत्
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | sahasyam | vasiṣṭhaḥ | rāyaḥ-kāmaḥ | viśva-psnyasya | staut || iṣam | rayim | paprathat | vājam | asme iti | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.42.6||

IAST: iṣaṁ rayim paprathad vājam asme yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May he bestow on us food, strength, and riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषं रयिं पप्रथद्वाजमस्मे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | agnim | sahasyam | vasiṣṭhaḥ | rāyaḥ-kāmaḥ | viśva-psnyasya | staut || iṣam | rayim | paprathat | vājam | asme iti | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.42.6||

IAST: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ pṛthivī iṣadhyai
Griffith: SING out the pious at your sacrifices to move with adorations Earth and Heaven-
Devanāgarī: प्र वो यज्ञेषु देवयन्तो अर्चन्द्यावा नमोभिः पृथिवी इषध्यै
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | yajñeṣu | deva-yantaḥ | arcan | dyāvā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | pr̥thivī iti | iṣadhyai || yeṣām | brahmāṇi | asamāni | viprāḥ | viṣvak | vi-yanti | vaninaḥ | na | śākhāḥ ||7.43.1||

IAST: yeṣām brahmāṇy asamāni viprā viṣvag viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ
Griffith: The Holy Singers, whose unmatched devotions, like a tree's branches, part in all directions.
Devanāgarī: येषां ब्रह्माण्यसमानि विप्रा विष्वग्वियन्ति वनिनो न शाखाः
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | yajñeṣu | deva-yantaḥ | arcan | dyāvā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | pr̥thivī iti | iṣadhyai || yeṣām | brahmāṇi | asamāni | viprāḥ | viṣvak | vi-yanti | vaninaḥ | na | śākhāḥ ||7.43.1||

IAST: pra yajña etu hetvo na saptir ud yacchadhvaṁ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ
Griffith: Let sacrifice proceed like some fleet courser: with one accord lift ye on high the ladles.
Devanāgarī: प्र यज्ञ एतु हेत्वो न सप्तिरुद्यच्छध्वं समनसो घृताचीः
pada pāṭha: pra | yajñaḥ | etu | hetvaḥ | na | saptiḥ | ut | yacchadhvam | sa-manasaḥ | ghr̥tācīḥ || str̥ṇīta | barhiḥ | adhvarāya | sādhu | ūrdhvā | śocīṁṣi | deva-yūni | asthuḥ ||7.43.2||

IAST: stṛṇīta barhir adhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṁṣi devayūny asthuḥ
Griffith: Strew sacred grass meet for the solenm service: bright flames that love the Gods have mounted upward.
Devanāgarī: स्तृणीत बर्हिरध्वराय साधूर्ध्वा शोचींषि देवयून्यस्थुः
pada pāṭha: pra | yajñaḥ | etu | hetvaḥ | na | saptiḥ | ut | yacchadhvam | sa-manasaḥ | ghr̥tācīḥ || str̥ṇīta | barhiḥ | adhvarāya | sādhu | ūrdhvā | śocīṁṣi | deva-yūni | asthuḥ ||7.43.2||

IAST: ā putrāso na mātaraṁ vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāso barhiṣaḥ sadantu
Griffith: Like babes in arms reposing on their mother, let the Gods sit upon the grass's summit.
Devanāgarī: आ पुत्रासो न मातरं विभृत्राः सानौ देवासो बर्हिषः सदन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | putrāsaḥ | na | mātaram | vi-bhr̥trāḥ | sānau | devāsaḥ | barhiṣaḥ | sadantu || ā | viśvācī | vidathyām | anaktu | agne | mā | naḥ | deva-tātā | mr̥dhaḥ | kariti kaḥ ||7.43.3||

IAST: ā viśvācī vidathyām anaktv agne mā no devatātā mṛdhas kaḥ
Griffith: Let general fire make bright the flame of worship: scorn us not, Agni, in the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वाची विदथ्यामनक्त्वग्ने मा नो देवताता मृधस्कः
pada pāṭha: ā | putrāsaḥ | na | mātaram | vi-bhr̥trāḥ | sānau | devāsaḥ | barhiṣaḥ | sadantu || ā | viśvācī | vidathyām | anaktu | agne | mā | naḥ | deva-tātā | mr̥dhaḥ | kariti kaḥ ||7.43.3||

IAST: te sīṣapanta joṣam ā yajatrā ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughā duhānāḥ
Griffith: Gladly the Gods have let themselves be honoured, milking the copious streams of holy Order.
Devanāgarī: ते सीषपन्त जोषमा यजत्रा ऋतस्य धाराः सुदुघा दुहानाः
pada pāṭha: te | sīṣapanta | joṣam | ā | yajatrāḥ | r̥tasya | dhārāḥ | su-dughāḥ | duhānāḥ || jyeṣṭham | vaḥ | adya | mahaḥ | ā | vasūnām | ā | gantana | sa-manasaḥ | yati | stha ||7.43.4||

IAST: jyeṣṭhaṁ vo adya maha ā vasūnām ā gantana samanaso yati ṣṭha
Griffith: The highest might to-day is yours, the Vasits': come ye, as many as ye are, one-minded.
Devanāgarī: ज्येष्ठं वो अद्य मह आ वसूनामा गन्तन समनसो यति ष्ठ
pada pāṭha: te | sīṣapanta | joṣam | ā | yajatrāḥ | r̥tasya | dhārāḥ | su-dughāḥ | duhānāḥ || jyeṣṭham | vaḥ | adya | mahaḥ | ā | vasūnām | ā | gantana | sa-manasaḥ | yati | stha ||7.43.4||

IAST: evā no agne vikṣv ā daśasya tvayā vayaṁ sahasāvann āskrāḥ
Griffith: So, Agni, send us wealth among the people: may we be closely knit to thee, O Victor,
Devanāgarī: एवा नो अग्ने विक्ष्वा दशस्य त्वया वयं सहसावन्नास्क्राः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | agne | vikṣu | ā | daśasya | tvayā | vayam | sahasā-van | āskrāḥ || rāyā | yujā | sadha-mādaḥ | ariṣṭāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.43.5||

IAST: rāyā yujā sadhamādo ariṣṭā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Unharmed, and rich, and taking joy together. Preserve us evermore, ye ods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: राया युजा सधमादो अरिष्टा यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | agne | vikṣu | ā | daśasya | tvayā | vayam | sahasā-van | āskrāḥ || rāyā | yujā | sadha-mādaḥ | ariṣṭāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.43.5||

IAST: dadhikrāṁ vaḥ prathamam aśvinoṣasam agniṁ samiddham bhagam ūtaye huve
Griffith: I CALL on Dadhikras, the first, to give you aid, the Asvins, Bhaga, Dawn, and Agni kindled well,
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रां वः प्रथममश्विनोषसमग्निं समिद्धं भगमूतये हुवे
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | vaḥ | prathamam | aśvinā | uṣasam | agnim | sam-iddham | bhagam | ūtaye | huve || indram | viṣṇum | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | ādityān | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | apaḥ | svariti svaḥ ||7.44.1||

IAST: indraṁ viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇas patim ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ
Griffith: Indra, and Visnu, Pusan, Brahmanaspati, Adityas, Heaven and Earth, the Waters, and the Light.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं विष्णुं पूषणं ब्रह्मणस्पतिमादित्यान्द्यावापृथिवी अपः स्वः
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | vaḥ | prathamam | aśvinā | uṣasam | agnim | sam-iddham | bhagam | ūtaye | huve || indram | viṣṇum | pūṣaṇam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | ādityān | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | apaḥ | svariti svaḥ ||7.44.1||

IAST: dadhikrām u namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ
Griffith: When, rising, to the sacrifice we hasten, awaking Dadhikras with adorations.
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रामु नमसा बोधयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञमुपप्रयन्तः
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | namasā | bodhayantaḥ | ut-īrāṇāḥ | yajñam | upa-prayantaḥ || iḷām | devīm | barhiṣi | sādayantaḥ | aśvinā | viprā | su-havā | huvema ||7.44.2||

IAST: iḻāṁ devīm barhiṣi sādayanto 'śvinā viprā suhavā huvema
Griffith: Seating on sacred grass the Goddess Ila. let us invoke the sage swift-hearing Asvins.
Devanāgarī: इळां देवीं बर्हिषि सादयन्तोऽश्विना विप्रा सुहवा हुवेम
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | namasā | bodhayantaḥ | ut-īrāṇāḥ | yajñam | upa-prayantaḥ || iḷām | devīm | barhiṣi | sādayantaḥ | aśvinā | viprā | su-havā | huvema ||7.44.2||

IAST: dadhikrāvāṇam bubudhāno agnim upa bruva uṣasaṁ sūryaṁ gām
Griffith: While I am thus arousing Dadhikravan I speak to Agni, Earth, and Dawn, and Surya,
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रावाणं बुबुधानो अग्निमुप ब्रुव उषसं सूर्यं गाम्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvāṇam | bubudhānaḥ | agnim | upa | bruve | uṣasam | sūryam | gām || bradhnam | mam̐ścatoḥ | varuṇasya | babhrum | te | viśvā | asmat | duḥ-itā | yavayantu ||7.44.3||

IAST: bradhnam mam̐ścator varuṇasya babhruṁ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu
Griffith: The red, the brown of Varuna ever mindful: may they ward off from us all grief and trouble.
Devanāgarī: ब्रध्नं माँश्चतोर्वरुणस्य बभ्रुं ते विश्वास्मद्दुरिता यावयन्तु
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvāṇam | bubudhānaḥ | agnim | upa | bruve | uṣasam | sūryam | gām || bradhnam | mam̐ścatoḥ | varuṇasya | babhrum | te | viśvā | asmat | duḥ-itā | yavayantu ||7.44.3||

IAST: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājy arvāgre rathānām bhavati prajānan
Griffith: Foremost is Dadhikravan, vigorous courser; in forefront of the cars, his way he knoweth,
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रावा प्रथमो वाज्यर्वाग्रे रथानां भवति प्रजानन्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvā | prathamaḥ | vājī | arvā | agre | rathānām | bhavati | pra-jānan || sam-vidānaḥ | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ādityebhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ ||7.44.4||

IAST: saṁvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhir vasubhir aṅgirobhiḥ
Griffith: Closely allied with Surya and with Morning, Adityas, and Angirases, and Vasus.
Devanāgarī: संविदान उषसा सूर्येणादित्येभिर्वसुभिरङ्गिरोभिः
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvā | prathamaḥ | vājī | arvā | agre | rathānām | bhavati | pra-jānan || sam-vidānaḥ | uṣasā | sūryeṇa | ādityebhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ ||7.44.4||

IAST: ā no dadhikrāḥ pathyām anaktv ṛtasya panthām anvetavā u
Griffith: May Dadhikras prepare the way we travel that we may pass along the path of Order.
Devanāgarī: आ नो दधिक्राः पथ्यामनक्त्वृतस्य पन्थामन्वेतवा उ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | dadhi-krāḥ | pathyām | anaktu | r̥tasya | panthām | anu-etavai | ūm̐ iti || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | daivyam | śardhaḥ | agniḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | viśve | mahiṣāḥ | amūrāḥ ||7.44.5||

IAST: śṛṇotu no daivyaṁ śardho agniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣā amūrāḥ
Griffith: May Agni bear us, and the Heavenly Army: hear us all Mighty Ones whom none deceiveth.
Devanāgarī: शृणोतु नो दैव्यं शर्धो अग्निः शृण्वन्तु विश्वे महिषा अमूराः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | dadhi-krāḥ | pathyām | anaktu | r̥tasya | panthām | anu-etavai | ūm̐ iti || śr̥ṇotu | naḥ | daivyam | śardhaḥ | agniḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | viśve | mahiṣāḥ | amūrāḥ ||7.44.5||

IAST: ā devo yātu savitā suratno 'ntarikṣaprā vahamāno aśvaiḥ
Griffith: MAY the God Savitar, rich in goodly treasures, filling the region, borne by steeds, come hither,
Devanāgarī: आ देवो यातु सविता सुरत्नोऽन्तरिक्षप्रा वहमानो अश्वैः
pada pāṭha: ā | devaḥ | yātu | savitā | su-ratnaḥ | antarikṣa-prāḥ | vahamānaḥ | aśvaiḥ || haste | dadhānaḥ | naryā | purūṇi | ni-veśayan | ca | pra-suvan | ca | bhūma ||7.45.1||

IAST: haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañ ca prasuvañ ca bhūma
Griffith: In his hand holding much that makes men happy, lulling to slumber and arousing creatures.
Devanāgarī: हस्ते दधानो नर्या पुरूणि निवेशयञ्च प्रसुवञ्च भूम
pada pāṭha: ā | devaḥ | yātu | savitā | su-ratnaḥ | antarikṣa-prāḥ | vahamānaḥ | aśvaiḥ || haste | dadhānaḥ | naryā | purūṇi | ni-veśayan | ca | pra-suvan | ca | bhūma ||7.45.1||

IAST: ud asya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antām̐ anaṣṭām
Griffith: Golden, sublime, and easy in their motion, his arms extend unto the bounds of heaven.
Devanāgarī: उदस्य बाहू शिथिरा बृहन्ता हिरण्यया दिवो अन्ताँ अनष्टाम्
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | bāhū iti | śithirā | br̥hantā | hiraṇyayā | divaḥ | antān | anaṣṭām || nūnam | saḥ | asya | mahimā | paniṣṭa | sūraḥ | cit | asmai | anu | dāt | apasyām ||7.45.2||

IAST: nūnaṁ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraś cid asmā anu dād apasyām
Griffith: Now shall that mightiness of his he lauded: even Surya yields to him in active vigour.
Devanāgarī: नूनं सो अस्य महिमा पनिष्ट सूरश्चिदस्मा अनु दादपस्याम्
pada pāṭha: ut | asya | bāhū iti | śithirā | br̥hantā | hiraṇyayā | divaḥ | antān | anaṣṭām || nūnam | saḥ | asya | mahimā | paniṣṭa | sūraḥ | cit | asmai | anu | dāt | apasyām ||7.45.2||

IAST: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatir vasūni
Griffith: May this God Savitar, the Strong and Mighty, the Lord of precious wealth, vouchsafe us treasures.
Devanāgarī: स घा नो देवः सविता सहावा साविषद्वसुपतिर्वसूनि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | saha-vā | ā | sāviṣat | vasu-patiḥ | vasūni || vi-śrayamāṇaḥ | amatim | urūcīm | marta-bhojanam | adha | rāsate | naḥ ||7.45.3||

IAST: viśrayamāṇo amatim urūcīm martabhojanam adha rāsate naḥ
Griffith: May he, advancing his far-spreading lustre, bestow on us the food that feedeth mortals.
Devanāgarī: विश्रयमाणो अमतिमुरूचीं मर्तभोजनमध रासते नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | saha-vā | ā | sāviṣat | vasu-patiḥ | vasūni || vi-śrayamāṇaḥ | amatim | urūcīm | marta-bhojanam | adha | rāsate | naḥ ||7.45.3||

IAST: imā giraḥ savitāraṁ sujihvam pūrṇagabhastim īḻate supāṇim
Griffith: These songs praise Savitar whose tongue is pleasant, praise him whose arms are full, whose hands are lovel
Devanāgarī: इमा गिरः सवितारं सुजिह्वं पूर्णगभस्तिमीळते सुपाणिम्
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | giraḥ | savitāram | su-jihvam | pūrṇa-gabhastim | īḷate | su-pāṇim || citram | vayaḥ | br̥hat | asme iti | dadhātu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.45.4||

IAST: citraṁ vayo bṛhad asme dadhātu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: High vital strength, and manifold, may he grant us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: चित्रं वयो बृहदस्मे दधातु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | giraḥ | savitāram | su-jihvam | pūrṇa-gabhastim | īḷate | su-pāṇim || citram | vayaḥ | br̥hat | asme iti | dadhātu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.45.4||

IAST: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane giraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne
Griffith: To Rudra bring these songs, whose bow is firm and strong, the self-dependent God with swiftly-flying shaf
Devanāgarī: इमा रुद्राय स्थिरधन्वने गिरः क्षिप्रेषवे देवाय स्वधाव्ने
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | rudrāya | sthira-dhanvane | giraḥ | kṣipra-iṣave | devāya | svadhā-vne || aṣāḷhāya | sahamānāya | vedhase | tigma-āyudhāya | bharata | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ ||7.46.1||

IAST: aṣāḻhāya sahamānāya vedhase tigmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ
Griffith: The Wise, the Conqueror whom none may overcome, armed with sharp-pointed weapons: may he hear our call.
Devanāgarī: अषाळ्हाय सहमानाय वेधसे तिग्मायुधाय भरता शृणोतु नः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | rudrāya | sthira-dhanvane | giraḥ | kṣipra-iṣave | devāya | svadhā-vne || aṣāḷhāya | sahamānāya | vedhase | tigma-āyudhāya | bharata | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ ||7.46.1||

IAST: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati
Griffith: He through his lordship thinks on beings of the earth, on heavenly beings through his high imperial sway.
Devanāgarī: स हि क्षयेण क्षम्यस्य जन्मनः साम्राज्येन दिव्यस्य चेतति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | kṣayeṇa | kṣamyasya | janmanaḥ | sām-rājyena | divyasya | cetati || avan | avantīḥ | upa | naḥ | duraḥ | cara | anamīvaḥ | rudra | jāsu | naḥ | bhava ||7.46.2||

IAST: avann avantīr upa no duraś carānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava
Griffith: Come willingly to our doors that gladly welcome thee, and heal all sickness, Rudra., in our families.
Devanāgarī: अवन्नवन्तीरुप नो दुरश्चरानमीवो रुद्र जासु नो भव
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | kṣayeṇa | kṣamyasya | janmanaḥ | sām-rājyena | divyasya | cetati || avan | avantīḥ | upa | naḥ | duraḥ | cara | anamīvaḥ | rudra | jāsu | naḥ | bhava ||7.46.2||

IAST: yā te didyud avasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sā vṛṇaktu naḥ
Griffith: May thy bright arrow which, shot down by thee from heaven, flieth upon the earth, pass us uninjured by.
Devanāgarī: या ते दिद्युदवसृष्टा दिवस्परि क्ष्मया चरति परि सा वृणक्तु नः
pada pāṭha: yā | te | didyut | ava-sr̥ṣṭā | divaḥ | pari | kṣmayā | carati | pari | sā | vr̥ṇaktu | naḥ || sahasram | te | su-apivāta | bheṣajā | mā | naḥ | tokeṣu | tanayeṣu | ririṣaḥ ||7.46.3||

IAST: sahasraṁ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nas tokeṣu tanayeṣu rīriṣaḥ
Griffith: Thou, very gracious God, bast thousand medicines: inflict no evil on our sons or progeny.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रं ते स्वपिवात भेषजा मा नस्तोकेषु तनयेषु रीरिषः
pada pāṭha: yā | te | didyut | ava-sr̥ṣṭā | divaḥ | pari | kṣmayā | carati | pari | sā | vr̥ṇaktu | naḥ || sahasram | te | su-apivāta | bheṣajā | mā | naḥ | tokeṣu | tanayeṣu | ririṣaḥ ||7.46.3||

IAST: mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḻitasya
Griffith: Slay us not, nor abandon us, O Rudra let not thy noose, when thou art angry, seize us.
Devanāgarī: मा नो वधी रुद्र मा परा दा मा ते भूम प्रसितौ हीळितस्य
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vadhīḥ | rudra | mā | parā | dāḥ | mā | te | bhūma | pra-sitau | hīḷitasya || ā | naḥ | bhaja | barhiṣi | jīva-śaṁse | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.46.4||

IAST: ā no bhaja barhiṣi jīvaśaṁse yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Give us trimmed grass and fame among the living. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: आ नो भज बर्हिषि जीवशंसे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vadhīḥ | rudra | mā | parā | dāḥ | mā | te | bhūma | pra-sitau | hīḷitasya || ā | naḥ | bhaja | barhiṣi | jīva-śaṁse | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.46.4||

IAST: āpo yaṁ vaḥ prathamaṁ devayanta indrapānam ūrmim akṛṇvateḻaḥ
Griffith: MAY we obtain this day from you, O Waters, that wave of pure refreshment, which the pious
Devanāgarī: आपो यं वः प्रथमं देवयन्त इन्द्रपानमूर्मिमकृण्वतेळः
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | yam | vaḥ | prathamam | dava-yantaḥ | indra-pānam | ūrmim | akr̥ṇvata | iḷaḥ || tam | vaḥ | vayam | śucim | aripram | adya | ghr̥ta-pruṣam | madhu-mantam | vanema ||7.47.1||

IAST: taṁ vo vayaṁ śucim aripram adya ghṛtapruṣam madhumantaṁ vanema
Griffith: Made erst the special beverage of Indra, bright, stainless, rich in sweets and dropping fatness.
Devanāgarī: तं वो वयं शुचिमरिप्रमद्य घृतप्रुषं मधुमन्तं वनेम
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | yam | vaḥ | prathamam | dava-yantaḥ | indra-pānam | ūrmim | akr̥ṇvata | iḷaḥ || tam | vaḥ | vayam | śucim | aripram | adya | ghr̥ta-pruṣam | madhu-mantam | vanema ||7.47.1||

IAST: tam ūrmim āpo madhumattamaṁ vo 'pāṁ napād avatv āśuhemā
Griffith: May the Floods' Offspring, he whose course is rapid, protect that wave most rich in sweets, O Waters,
Devanāgarī: तमूर्मिमापो मधुमत्तमं वोऽपां नपादवत्वाशुहेमा
pada pāṭha: tam | ūrmim | āpaḥ | madhumat-tamam | vaḥ | apām | napāt | avatu | āśu-hemā || yasmin | indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | mādayāte | tam | aśyāma | deva-yantaḥ | vaḥ | adya ||7.47.2||

IAST: yasminn indro vasubhir mādayāte tam aśyāma devayanto vo adya
Griffith: That shall make Indra and the Vasus joyful. This may we gain from you to-day, we pious.
Devanāgarī: यस्मिन्निन्द्रो वसुभिर्मादयाते तमश्याम देवयन्तो वो अद्य
pada pāṭha: tam | ūrmim | āpaḥ | madhumat-tamam | vaḥ | apām | napāt | avatu | āśu-hemā || yasmin | indraḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | mādayāte | tam | aśyāma | deva-yantaḥ | vaḥ | adya ||7.47.2||

IAST: śatapavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīr devīr devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
