Griffith: All-purifying, joying in their nature, to paths of Gods the Goddesses move onward.
Devanāgarī: शतपवित्राः स्वधया मदन्तीर्देवीर्देवानामपि यन्ति पाथः
pada pāṭha: śata-pavitrāḥ | svadhayā | madantīḥ | devīḥ | devānām | api | yanti | pāthaḥ || tāḥ | indrasya | na | minanti | vratāni | sindhu-bhyaḥ | havyam | ghr̥ta-vat | juhota ||7.47.3||

IAST: tā indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyo havyaṁ ghṛtavaj juhota
Griffith: They never violate the laws of Indra. Present the oil-rich offering to the Rivers.
Devanāgarī: ता इन्द्रस्य न मिनन्ति व्रतानि सिन्धुभ्यो हव्यं घृतवज्जुहोत
pada pāṭha: śata-pavitrāḥ | svadhayā | madantīḥ | devīḥ | devānām | api | yanti | pāthaḥ || tāḥ | indrasya | na | minanti | vratāni | sindhu-bhyaḥ | havyam | ghr̥ta-vat | juhota ||7.47.3||

IAST: yāḥ sūryo raśmibhir ātatāna yābhya indro aradad gātum ūrmim
Griffith: Whom Surya with his bright beams hath attracted, and Indra dug the path for them to travel,
Devanāgarī: याः सूर्यो रश्मिभिराततान याभ्य इन्द्रो अरदद्गातुमूर्मिम्
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | sūryaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | ā-tatāna | yābhyaḥ | indraḥ | aradat | gātum | ūrmim || te | sindhavaḥ | varivaḥ | dhātana | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.47.4||

IAST: te sindhavo varivo dhātanā no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these Streams give us ample room and freedom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: ते सिन्धवो वरिवो धातना नो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | sūryaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | ā-tatāna | yābhyaḥ | indraḥ | aradat | gātum | ūrmim || te | sindhavaḥ | varivaḥ | dhātana | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.47.4||

IAST: ṛbhukṣaṇo vājā mādayadhvam asme naro maghavānaḥ sutasya
Griffith: YE liberal Heroes, Vajas and Rbhuksans, come and delight you with our flowing Soma.
Devanāgarī: ऋभुक्षणो वाजा मादयध्वमस्मे नरो मघवानः सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | vājāḥ | mādayadhvam | asme iti | naraḥ | magha-vānaḥ | sutasya || ā | vaḥ | arvācaḥ | kratavaḥ | na | yātām | vi-bhvaḥ | ratham | naryam | vartayantu ||7.48.1||

IAST: ā vo 'rvācaḥ kratavo na yātāṁ vibhvo rathaṁ naryaṁ vartayantu
Griffith: May your strength, Vibhus, as ye come to meet us, turn hitherward your car that brings men profit.
Devanāgarī: आ वोऽर्वाचः क्रतवो न यातां विभ्वो रथं नर्यं वर्तयन्तु
pada pāṭha: r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | vājāḥ | mādayadhvam | asme iti | naraḥ | magha-vānaḥ | sutasya || ā | vaḥ | arvācaḥ | kratavaḥ | na | yātām | vi-bhvaḥ | ratham | naryam | vartayantu ||7.48.1||

IAST: ṛbhur ṛbhubhir abhi vaḥ syāma vibhvo vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṁsi
Griffith: May we as Rbhu with your Rbhus conquer strength with our strength, as Vibhus with the Vibhus.
Devanāgarī: ऋभुरृभुभिरभि वः स्याम विभ्वो विभुभिः शवसा शवांसि
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | abhi | vaḥ | syāma | vi-bhvaḥ | vibhu-bhiḥ | śavasā | śavāṁsi || vājaḥ | asmān | avatu | vāja-sātau | indreṇa | yujā | taruṣema | vr̥tram ||7.48.2||

IAST: vājo asmām̐ avatu vājasātāv indreṇa yujā taruṣema vṛtram
Griffith: May Vaja aid us in the fight for booty, and helped by Indra may we quell the foeman.
Devanāgarī: वाजो अस्माँ अवतु वाजसाताविन्द्रेण युजा तरुषेम वृत्रम्
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | abhi | vaḥ | syāma | vi-bhvaḥ | vibhu-bhiḥ | śavasā | śavāṁsi || vājaḥ | asmān | avatu | vāja-sātau | indreṇa | yujā | taruṣema | vr̥tram ||7.48.2||

IAST: te cid dhi pūrvīr abhi santi śāsā viśvām̐ arya uparatāti vanvan
Griffith: For they rule many tribes with high dominion, and conquer all their foes in close encounter.
Devanāgarī: ते चिद्धि पूर्वीरभि सन्ति शासा विश्वाँ अर्य उपरताति वन्वन्
pada pāṭha: te | cit | hi | pūrvīḥ | abhi | santi | śāsā | viśvān | aryaḥ | upara-tāti | vanvan || indraḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | aryaḥ | śatroḥ | mithatyā | kr̥ṇavan | vi | nr̥mṇam ||7.48.3||

IAST: indro vibhvām̐ ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatror mithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam
Griffith: May Indra, Vibhvan, Vaja, and Rbhuksan destroy by turns the wicked foeman's valour.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विभ्वाँ ऋभुक्षा वाजो अर्यः शत्रोर्मिथत्या कृणवन्वि नृम्णम्
pada pāṭha: te | cit | hi | pūrvīḥ | abhi | santi | śāsā | viśvān | aryaḥ | upara-tāti | vanvan || indraḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | aryaḥ | śatroḥ | mithatyā | kr̥ṇavan | vi | nr̥mṇam ||7.48.3||

IAST: nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve 'vase sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: Now, Deities, give us ample room and freedom: be all of you, one-minded, our protection.
Devanāgarī: नू देवासो वरिवः कर्तना नो भूत नो विश्वेऽवसे सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: nu | devāsaḥ | varivaḥ | kartana | naḥ | bhūta | naḥ | viśve | avase | sa-joṣāḥ || sam | asme iti | iṣam | vasavaḥ | dadīran | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.48.4||

IAST: sam asme iṣaṁ vasavo dadīran yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: So let the Vasus grant us strength and vigour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: समस्मे इषं वसवो ददीरन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | devāsaḥ | varivaḥ | kartana | naḥ | bhūta | naḥ | viśve | avase | sa-joṣāḥ || sam | asme iti | iṣam | vasavaḥ | dadīran | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.48.4||

IAST: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yanty aniviśamānāḥ
Griffith: FORTH from the middle of the flood the Waters-their chief the Sea-flow cleansing, never sleeping.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रज्येष्ठाः सलिलस्य मध्यात्पुनाना यन्त्यनिविशमानाः
pada pāṭha: samudra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | salilasya | madhyāt | punānāḥ | yanti | ani-viśamānāḥ || indraḥ | yāḥ | vajrī | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | rarāda | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.1||

IAST: indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu
Griffith: Indra, the Bull, the Thunderer, dug their channels: here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो या वज्री वृषभो रराद ता आपो देवीरिह मामवन्तु
pada pāṭha: samudra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | salilasya | madhyāt | punānāḥ | yanti | ani-viśamānāḥ || indraḥ | yāḥ | vajrī | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | rarāda | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.1||

IAST: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayaṁjāḥ
Griffith: Waters which come from heaven, or those that wander dug from the earth, or flowing free by nature,
Devanāgarī: या आपो दिव्या उत वा स्रवन्ति खनित्रिमा उत वा याः स्वयंजाः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | āpaḥ | divyāḥ | uta | vā | sravanti | khanitrimāḥ | uta | vā | yāḥ | svayam-jāḥ || samudra-arthāḥ | yāḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.2||

IAST: samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakās tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu
Griffith: Bright, purifying, speeding to the Ocean, here let those Waters. Goddesses, protect me.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रार्था याः शुचयः पावकास्ता आपो देवीरिह मामवन्तु
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | āpaḥ | divyāḥ | uta | vā | sravanti | khanitrimāḥ | uta | vā | yāḥ | svayam-jāḥ || samudra-arthāḥ | yāḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.2||

IAST: yāsāṁ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām
Griffith: Those amid whom goes Varuna the Sovran, he who discriminates men's truth and falsehood-
Devanāgarī: यासां राजा वरुणो याति मध्ये सत्यानृते अवपश्यञ्जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: yāsām | rājā | varuṇaḥ | yāti | madhye | satyānr̥te iti | ava-paśyan | janānām || madhu-ścutaḥ | śucayaḥ | yāḥ | pāvakāḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.3||

IAST: madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakās tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu
Griffith: Distilling meath, the bright, the purifying, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect me.
Devanāgarī: मधुश्चुतः शुचयो याः पावकास्ता आपो देवीरिह मामवन्तु
pada pāṭha: yāsām | rājā | varuṇaḥ | yāti | madhye | satyānr̥te iti | ava-paśyan | janānām || madhu-ścutaḥ | śucayaḥ | yāḥ | pāvakāḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.3||

IAST: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjam madanti
Griffith: They from whom Varuna the King, and Soma, and all the Deities drink strength and vigour,
Devanāgarī: यासु राजा वरुणो यासु सोमो विश्वे देवा यासूर्जं मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: yāsu | rājā | varuṇaḥ | yāsu | somaḥ | viśve | devāḥ | yāsu | ūrjam | madanti || vaiśvānaraḥ | yāsu | agniḥ | pra-viṣṭaḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.4||

IAST: vaiśvānaro yāsv agniḥ praviṣṭas tā āpo devīr iha mām avantu
Griffith: They into whom Vaisvanara Agni entered, here let those Waters, Goddesses, protect Me.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरो यास्वग्निः प्रविष्टस्ता आपो देवीरिह मामवन्तु
pada pāṭha: yāsu | rājā | varuṇaḥ | yāsu | somaḥ | viśve | devāḥ | yāsu | ūrjam | madanti || vaiśvānaraḥ | yāsu | agniḥ | pra-viṣṭaḥ | tāḥ | āpaḥ | devīḥ | iha | mām | avantu ||7.49.4||

IAST: ā mām mitrāvaruṇeha rakṣataṁ kulāyayad viśvayan mā na ā gan
Griffith: O MITRA-VARUNA, guard and protect me here: let not that come to me which nests within and swells.
Devanāgarī: आ मां मित्रावरुणेह रक्षतं कुलाययद्विश्वयन्मा न आ गन्
pada pāṭha: ā | mām | mitrāvaruṇā | iha | rakṣatam | kulāyayat | vi-śvayat | mā | naḥ | ā | gan || ajakā-vam | duḥ-dr̥śīkam | tiraḥ | dadhe | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.1||

IAST: ajakāvaṁ durdṛśīkaṁ tiro dadhe mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
Griffith: I drive afar the scorpion hateful to the sight: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
Devanāgarī: अजकावं दुर्दृशीकं तिरो दधे मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत्त्सरुः
pada pāṭha: ā | mām | mitrāvaruṇā | iha | rakṣatam | kulāyayat | vi-śvayat | mā | naḥ | ā | gan || ajakā-vam | duḥ-dr̥śīkam | tiraḥ | dadhe | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.1||

IAST: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanam bhuvad aṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat
Griffith: Eruption that appears upon the twofold joints, and that which overspreads the ankles and the knees,
Devanāgarī: यद्विजामन्परुषि वन्दनं भुवदष्ठीवन्तौ परि कुल्फौ च देहत्
pada pāṭha: yat | vi-jāman | paruṣi | vandanam | bhuvat | aṣṭhīvantau | pari | kulphau | ca | dehat || agniḥ | tat | śocan | apa | bādhatām | itaḥ | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.2||

IAST: agniṣ ṭac chocann apa bādhatām ito mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
Griffith: May the refulgent Agni banish far away let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
Devanāgarī: अग्निष्टच्छोचन्नप बाधतामितो मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत्त्सरुः
pada pāṭha: yat | vi-jāman | paruṣi | vandanam | bhuvat | aṣṭhīvantau | pari | kulphau | ca | dehat || agniḥ | tat | śocan | apa | bādhatām | itaḥ | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.2||

IAST: yac chalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yad oṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam
Griffith: The poison that is formed upon the Salmali, that which is found in streams, that which the plants produce
Devanāgarī: यच्छल्मलौ भवति यन्नदीषु यदोषधीभ्यः परि जायते विषम्
pada pāṭha: yat | śalmalau | bhavati | yat | nadīṣu | yat | oṣadhībhyaḥ | pari | jāyate | viṣam || viśve | devāḥ | niḥ | itaḥ | tat | suvantu | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.3||

IAST: viśve devā nir itas tat suvantu mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
Griffith: All this may all the Gods banish and drive away: let not the winding worm touch me and wound my foot.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा निरितस्तत्सुवन्तु मा मां पद्येन रपसा विदत्त्सरुः
pada pāṭha: yat | śalmalau | bhavati | yat | nadīṣu | yat | oṣadhībhyaḥ | pari | jāyate | viṣam || viśve | devāḥ | niḥ | itaḥ | tat | suvantu | mā | mām | padyena | rapasā | vidat | tsaruḥ ||7.50.3||

IAST: yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīr anudakāś ca yāḥ
Griffith: The steep declivities, the valleys, and the heights, the channels full of water, and the waterless-
Devanāgarī: याः प्रवतो निवत उद्वत उदन्वतीरनुदकाश्च याः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | pra-vataḥ | ni-vataḥ | ut-vataḥ | udan-vatīḥ | anudakāḥ | ca | yāḥ || tāḥ | asmabhyam | payasā | pinvamānāḥ | śivāḥ | devīḥ | aśipadāḥ | bhavantu | sarvāḥ | nadyaḥ | aśimidāḥ | bhavantu ||7.50.4||

IAST: tā asmabhyam payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīr aśipadā bhavantu sarvā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu
Griffith: May those who swell with water, gracious Goddesses, never afflict us with the Sipada disease, may all t
Devanāgarī: ता अस्मभ्यं पयसा पिन्वमानाः शिवा देवीरशिपदा भवन्तु सर्वा नद्यो अशिमिदा भवन्तु
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | pra-vataḥ | ni-vataḥ | ut-vataḥ | udan-vatīḥ | anudakāḥ | ca | yāḥ || tāḥ | asmabhyam | payasā | pinvamānāḥ | śivāḥ | devīḥ | aśipadāḥ | bhavantu | sarvāḥ | nadyaḥ | aśimidāḥ | bhavantu ||7.50.4||

IAST: ādityānām avasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śaṁtamena
Griffith: THROUGH the Adityas' most auspicious shelter, through their most recent succour may we conquer.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यानामवसा नूतनेन सक्षीमहि शर्मणा शंतमेन
pada pāṭha: ādityānām | avasā | nūtanena | sakṣīmahi | śarmaṇā | śam-tamena || anāgāḥ-tve | aditi-tve | turāsaḥ | imam | yajñam | dadhatu | śroṣamāṇāḥ ||7.51.1||

IAST: anāgāstve adititve turāsa imaṁ yajñaṁ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: May they, the Mighty, giving ear, establish this sacrifice, to make us free and sinless.
Devanāgarī: अनागास्त्वे अदितित्वे तुरास इमं यज्ञं दधतु श्रोषमाणाः
pada pāṭha: ādityānām | avasā | nūtanena | sakṣīmahi | śarmaṇā | śam-tamena || anāgāḥ-tve | aditi-tve | turāsaḥ | imam | yajñam | dadhatu | śroṣamāṇāḥ ||7.51.1||

IAST: ādityāso aditir mādayantām mitro aryamā varuṇo rajiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Let Aditi rejoice and the Adityas, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, most righteous.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यासो अदितिर्मादयन्तां मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो रजिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: ādityāsaḥ | aditiḥ | mādayantām | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | rajiṣṭhāḥ || asmākam | santu | bhuvanasya | gopāḥ | pibantu | somam | avase | naḥ | adya ||7.51.2||

IAST: asmākaṁ santu bhuvanasya gopāḥ pibantu somam avase no adya
Griffith: May they, the Guardians of the world, protect us, and, to show favour, drink this day our Soma.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं सन्तु भुवनस्य गोपाः पिबन्तु सोममवसे नो अद्य
pada pāṭha: ādityāsaḥ | aditiḥ | mādayantām | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | rajiṣṭhāḥ || asmākam | santu | bhuvanasya | gopāḥ | pibantu | somam | avase | naḥ | adya ||7.51.2||

IAST: ādityā viśve marutaś ca viśve devāś ca viśva ṛbhavaś ca viśve
Griffith: All Universal Deities, the Maruts, all the Adityas, yea, and all the Rbhus,
Devanāgarī: आदित्या विश्वे मरुतश्च विश्वे देवाश्च विश्व ऋभवश्च विश्वे
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | viśve | marutaḥ | ca | viśve | devāḥ | ca | viśve | r̥bhavaḥ | ca | viśve || indraḥ | agniḥ | aśvinā | tustuvānāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.51.3||

IAST: indro agnir aśvinā tuṣṭuvānā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Indra, and Agni, and the Asvins, lauded. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो अग्निरश्विना तुष्टुवाना यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ādityāḥ | viśve | marutaḥ | ca | viśve | devāḥ | ca | viśve | r̥bhavaḥ | ca | viśve || indraḥ | agniḥ | aśvinā | tustuvānāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.51.3||

IAST: ādityāso aditayaḥ syāma pūr devatrā vasavo martyatrā
Griffith: MAY we be free from every bond, Adityas! a castle among Gods and men, ye Vasus.
Devanāgarī: आदित्यासो अदितयः स्याम पूर्देवत्रा वसवो मर्त्यत्रा
pada pāṭha: ādityāsaḥ | aditayaḥ | syāma | pūḥ | deva-trā | vasavaḥ | martya-trā || sanema | mitrāvaruṇā | sanantaḥ | bhavema | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhavantaḥ ||7.52.1||

IAST: sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ
Griffith: Winning, may we win Varuna and Mitra, and, being, may we be, O Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: सनेम मित्रावरुणा सनन्तो भवेम द्यावापृथिवी भवन्तः
pada pāṭha: ādityāsaḥ | aditayaḥ | syāma | pūḥ | deva-trā | vasavaḥ | martya-trā || sanema | mitrāvaruṇā | sanantaḥ | bhavema | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | bhavantaḥ ||7.52.1||

IAST: mitras tan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya gopāḥ
Griffith: May Varuna and Mitra grant this blessing, our Guardians, shelter to our seed and offspring.
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्तन्नो वरुणो मामहन्त शर्म तोकाय तनयाय गोपाः
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | mamahanta | śarma | tokāya | tanayāya | gopāḥ || mā | vaḥ | bhujema | anya-jātam | enaḥ | mā | tat | karma | vasavaḥ | yat | cayadhve ||7.52.2||

IAST: mā vo bhujemānyajātam eno mā tat karma vasavo yac cayadhve
Griffith: Let us not suffer for another's trespass. nor do the thing that ye, O Vasus, punish.
Devanāgarī: मा वो भुजेमान्यजातमेनो मा तत्कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | mamahanta | śarma | tokāya | tanayāya | gopāḥ || mā | vaḥ | bhujema | anya-jātam | enaḥ | mā | tat | karma | vasavaḥ | yat | cayadhve ||7.52.2||

IAST: turaṇyavo 'ṅgiraso nakṣanta ratnaṁ devasya savitur iyānāḥ
Griffith: The ever-prompt Angirases, imploring riches from Savitar the God, obtained them.
Devanāgarī: तुरण्यवोऽङ्गिरसो नक्षन्त रत्नं देवस्य सवितुरियानाः
pada pāṭha: turaṇyavaḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | nakṣanta | ratnam | devasya | savituḥ | iyānāḥ || pitā | ca | tat | naḥ | mahān | yajatraḥ | viśve | devāḥ | sa-manasaḥ | juṣanta ||7.52.3||

IAST: pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta
Griffith: So may our Father who is great and holy, and all the Gods, accordant, grant this favour.
Devanāgarī: पिता च तन्नो महान्यजत्रो विश्वे देवाः समनसो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: turaṇyavaḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | nakṣanta | ratnam | devasya | savituḥ | iyānāḥ || pitā | ca | tat | naḥ | mahān | yajatraḥ | viśve | devāḥ | sa-manasaḥ | juṣanta ||7.52.3||

IAST: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḻe bṛhatī yajatre
Griffith: AS priest with solemn rites and adorations I worship Heaven and Earth, the High and Holy.
Devanāgarī: प्र द्यावा यज्ञैः पृथिवी नमोभिः सबाध ईळे बृहती यजत्रे
pada pāṭha: pra | dyāvā | yajñaiḥ | pr̥thivī iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | sa-bādhaḥ | īḷe | br̥hatī iti | yajatre iti || te iti | cit | hi | pūrve | kavayaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | puraḥ | mahī iti | dadhire | devaputre iti deva-putre ||7.53.1||

IAST: te cid dhi pūrve kavayo gṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre
Griffith: To them, great Parents of the Gods, have sages of ancient time, singing, assigned precedence.
Devanāgarī: ते चिद्धि पूर्वे कवयो गृणन्तः पुरो मही दधिरे देवपुत्रे
pada pāṭha: pra | dyāvā | yajñaiḥ | pr̥thivī iti | namaḥ-bhiḥ | sa-bādhaḥ | īḷe | br̥hatī iti | yajatre iti || te iti | cit | hi | pūrve | kavayaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | puraḥ | mahī iti | dadhire | devaputre iti deva-putre ||7.53.1||

IAST: pra pūrvaje pitarā navyasībhir gīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṁ sadane ṛtasya
Griffith: With newest hymns set in the seat of Order, those the Two Parents, born before all others,
Devanāgarī: प्र पूर्वजे पितरा नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिः कृणुध्वं सदने ऋतस्य
pada pāṭha: pra | pūrvaje iti pūrva-je | pitarā | navyasībhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | kr̥ṇudhvam | sadane iti | r̥tasya || ā | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | daivyena | janena | yātam | mahi | vām | varūtham ||7.53.2||

IAST: ā no dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātam mahi vāṁ varūtham
Griffith: Come, Heaven and Earth, with the Celestial People, hither to us, for strong is your protection.
Devanāgarī: आ नो द्यावापृथिवी दैव्येन जनेन यातं महि वां वरूथम्
pada pāṭha: pra | pūrvaje iti pūrva-je | pitarā | navyasībhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | kr̥ṇudhvam | sadane iti | r̥tasya || ā | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | daivyena | janena | yātam | mahi | vām | varūtham ||7.53.2||

IAST: uto hi vāṁ ratnadheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse
Griffith: Yea, Heaven and Earth, ye hold in your possession full many a treasure for the liberal giver.
Devanāgarī: उतो हि वां रत्नधेयानि सन्ति पुरूणि द्यावापृथिवी सुदासे
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | ratna-dheyāni | santi | purūṇi | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | su-dāse || asme iti | dhattam | yat | asat | askr̥dhoyu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.53.3||

IAST: asme dhattaṁ yad asad askṛdhoyu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Grant us that wealth which comes in free abundance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे धत्तं यदसदस्कृधोयु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | ratna-dheyāni | santi | purūṇi | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | su-dāse || asme iti | dhattam | yat | asat | askr̥dhoyu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.53.3||

IAST: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhy asmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ
Griffith: ACKNOWLEDGE us, O Guardian of the Homestead: bring no disease, and give us happy entrance.
Devanāgarī: वास्तोष्पते प्रति जानीह्यस्मान्स्वावेशो अनमीवो भवा नः
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | prati | jānīhi | asmān | su-āveśaḥ | anamīvaḥ | bhava | naḥ || yat | tvā | īmahe | prati | tat | naḥ | juṣasva | śam | naḥ | bhava | dvi-pade | śam | catuḥ-pade ||7.54.1||

IAST: yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṁ no bhava dvipade śaṁ catuṣpade
Griffith: Whate'er we ask of thee, be pleased to grant it, and prosper thou quadrupeds and bipeds.
Devanāgarī: यत्त्वेमहे प्रति तन्नो जुषस्व शं नो भव द्विपदे शं चतुष्पदे
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | prati | jānīhi | asmān | su-āveśaḥ | anamīvaḥ | bhava | naḥ || yat | tvā | īmahe | prati | tat | naḥ | juṣasva | śam | naḥ | bhava | dvi-pade | śam | catuḥ-pade ||7.54.1||

IAST: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi gayasphāno gobhir aśvebhir indo
Griffith: Protector of the Home, be our promoter: increase our wealth in kine and steeds, O Indu.
Devanāgarī: वास्तोष्पते प्रतरणो न एधि गयस्फानो गोभिरश्वेभिरिन्दो
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | pra-taraṇaḥ | naḥ | edhi | gaya-sphānaḥ | gobhiḥ | aśvebhiḥ | indo iti || ajarāsaḥ | te | sakhye | syāma | pitā-iva | putrān | prati | naḥ | juṣasva ||7.54.2||

IAST: ajarāsas te sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva
Griffith: May we be ever-youthful in thy friendship: be pleased in us as in his sons a father.
Devanāgarī: अजरासस्ते सख्ये स्याम पितेव पुत्रान्प्रति नो जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | pra-taraṇaḥ | naḥ | edhi | gaya-sphānaḥ | gobhiḥ | aśvebhiḥ | indo iti || ajarāsaḥ | te | sakhye | syāma | pitā-iva | putrān | prati | naḥ | juṣasva ||7.54.2||

IAST: vāstoṣ pate śagmayā saṁsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā gātumatyā
Griffith: Through thy dear fellowship that bringeth welfare, may we be victors, Guardian of the Dwelling!
Devanāgarī: वास्तोष्पते शग्मया संसदा ते सक्षीमहि रण्वया गातुमत्या
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | śagmayā | sam-sadā | te | sakṣīmahi | raṇvayā | gātu-matyā || pāhi | kṣeme | uta | yoge | varam | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.54.3||

IAST: pāhi kṣema uta yoge varaṁ no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Protect our happiness in rest and labour. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: पाहि क्षेम उत योगे वरं नो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vāstoḥ | pate | śagmayā | sam-sadā | te | sakṣīmahi | raṇvayā | gātu-matyā || pāhi | kṣeme | uta | yoge | varam | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.54.3||

IAST: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇy āviśan
Griffith: VASTOSPATI, who killest all disease and wearest every form,
Devanāgarī: अमीवहा वास्तोष्पते विश्वा रूपाण्याविशन्
pada pāṭha: amīva-hā | vāstoḥ | pate | viśvā | rūpāṇi | ā-viśan || sakhā | su-śevaḥ | edhi | naḥ ||7.55.1||

IAST: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ
Griffith: Be an auspicious Friend to us.
Devanāgarī: सखा सुशेव एधि नः
pada pāṭha: amīva-hā | vāstoḥ | pate | viśvā | rūpāṇi | ā-viśan || sakhā | su-śevaḥ | edhi | naḥ ||7.55.1||

IAST: yad arjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅga yacchase
Griffith: When, O bright Son of Sarama, thou showest, tawny-hued! thy teeth,
Devanāgarī: यदर्जुन सारमेय दतः पिशङ्ग यच्छसे
pada pāṭha: yat | arjuna | sārameya | dataḥ | piśaṅga | yacchase || vi-iva | bhrājante | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | upa | srakveṣu | bapsataḥ | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.2||

IAST: vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa
Griffith: They gleam like lances' points within thy mouth when thou wouldst bite; go thou to steep.
Devanāgarī: वीव भ्राजन्त ऋष्टय उप स्रक्वेषु बप्सतो नि षु स्वप
pada pāṭha: yat | arjuna | sārameya | dataḥ | piśaṅga | yacchase || vi-iva | bhrājante | r̥ṣṭayaḥ | upa | srakveṣu | bapsataḥ | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.2||

IAST: stenaṁ rāya sārameya taskaraṁ vā punaḥsara
Griffith: Sarama's Son, retrace thy way: bark at the robber and the thief.
Devanāgarī: स्तेनं राय सारमेय तस्करं वा पुनःसर
pada pāṭha: stenam | rāya | sārameya | taskaram | vā | punaḥ-sara || stotr̥̄n | indrasya | rāyasi | kim | asmān | ducchuna-yase | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.3||

IAST: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni ṣu svapa
Griffith: At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dust thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.
Devanāgarī: स्तोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान्दुच्छुनायसे नि षु स्वप
pada pāṭha: stenam | rāya | sārameya | taskaram | vā | punaḥ-sara || stotr̥̄n | indrasya | rāyasi | kim | asmān | ducchuna-yase | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.3||

IAST: tvaṁ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ
Griffith: Be on thy guard against the boar, and let the boar beware of thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं सूकरस्य दर्दृहि तव दर्दर्तु सूकरः
pada pāṭha: tvam | sūkarasya | dardr̥hi | tava | dardartu | sūkaraḥ || stotr̥̄n | indrasya | rāyasi | kim | asmān | ducchuna-yase | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.4||

IAST: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān ducchunāyase ni ṣu svapa
Griffith: At Indra's singers barkest thou? Why dost thou seek to terrify us? Go to sleep.
Devanāgarī: स्तोतॄनिन्द्रस्य रायसि किमस्मान्दुच्छुनायसे नि षु स्वप
pada pāṭha: tvam | sūkarasya | dardr̥hi | tava | dardartu | sūkaraḥ || stotr̥̄n | indrasya | rāyasi | kim | asmān | ducchuna-yase | ni | su | svapa ||7.55.4||

IAST: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ
Griffith: Sleep mother, let the father sleep, sleep dog and master of the house.
Devanāgarī: सस्तु माता सस्तु पिता सस्तु श्वा सस्तु विश्पतिः
pada pāṭha: sastu | mātā | sastu | pitā | sastu | śvā | sastu | viśpatiḥ || sasantu | sarve | jñātayaḥ | sastu | ayam | abhitaḥ | janaḥ ||7.55.5||

IAST: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastv ayam abhito janaḥ
Griffith: Let all the kinsmen sleep, sleep all the people who are round about.
Devanāgarī: ससन्तु सर्वे ज्ञातयः सस्त्वयमभितो जनः
pada pāṭha: sastu | mātā | sastu | pitā | sastu | śvā | sastu | viśpatiḥ || sasantu | sarve | jñātayaḥ | sastu | ayam | abhitaḥ | janaḥ ||7.55.5||

IAST: ya āste yaś ca carati yaś ca paśyati no janaḥ
Griffith: The man who sits, the man who walks, and whosoever looks on us,
Devanāgarī: य आस्ते यश्च चरति यश्च पश्यति नो जनः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āste | yaḥ | ca | carati | yaḥ | ca | paśyati | naḥ | janaḥ || teṣām | sam | hanmaḥ | akṣāṇi | yathā | idam | harmyam | tathā ||7.55.6||

IAST: teṣāṁ saṁ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṁ harmyaṁ tathā
Griffith: Of these we closely shut the eyes, even as we closely shut this house.
Devanāgarī: तेषां सं हन्मो अक्षाणि यथेदं हर्म्यं तथा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āste | yaḥ | ca | carati | yaḥ | ca | paśyati | naḥ | janaḥ || teṣām | sam | hanmaḥ | akṣāṇi | yathā | idam | harmyam | tathā ||7.55.6||

IAST: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrād udācarat
Griffith: The Bull who hath a thousand horns, who rises up from out the sea,-
Devanāgarī: सहस्रशृङ्गो वृषभो यः समुद्रादुदाचरत्
pada pāṭha: sahasra-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yaḥ | samudrāt | ut-ācarat || tena | sahasyena | vayam | ni | janān | svāpayāmasi ||7.55.7||

IAST: tenā sahasyenā vayaṁ ni janān svāpayāmasi
Griffith: By him the Strong and Mighty One we lull and make the people sleep.
Devanāgarī: तेना सहस्येना वयं नि जनान्स्वापयामसि
pada pāṭha: sahasra-śr̥ṅgaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yaḥ | samudrāt | ut-ācarat || tena | sahasyena | vayam | ni | janān | svāpayāmasi ||7.55.7||

IAST: proṣṭheśayā vahyeśayā nārīr yās talpaśīvarīḥ
Griffith: The women sleeping in the court, lying without, or stretched on beds,
Devanāgarī: प्रोष्ठेशया वह्येशया नारीर्यास्तल्पशीवरीः
pada pāṭha: proṣṭhe-śayāḥ | vahye-śayāḥ | nārīḥ | yāḥ | talpa-śīvarīḥ || striyaḥ | yāḥ | puṇya-gandhāḥ | tāḥ | sarvāḥ | svāpayāmasi ||7.55.8||

IAST: striyo yāḥ puṇyagandhās tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi
Griffith: The matrons with their odorous sweetsthese, one and all, we lull to sleep.
Devanāgarī: स्त्रियो याः पुण्यगन्धास्ताः सर्वाः स्वापयामसि
pada pāṭha: proṣṭhe-śayāḥ | vahye-śayāḥ | nārīḥ | yāḥ | talpa-śīvarīḥ || striyaḥ | yāḥ | puṇya-gandhāḥ | tāḥ | sarvāḥ | svāpayāmasi ||7.55.8||

IAST: ka īṁ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḻā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ
Griffith: Wno are these radiant men in serried rank, Rudra's young heroes borne by noble steeds?
Devanāgarī: क ईं व्यक्ता नरः सनीळा रुद्रस्य मर्या अध स्वश्वाः
pada pāṭha: ke | īm | vi-aktāḥ | naraḥ | sa-nīḷāḥ | rudrasya | maryāḥ | adha | su-aśvāḥ ||7.56.1||

IAST: nakir hy eṣāṁ janūṁṣi veda te aṅga vidre mitho janitram
Griffith: Verily no one knoweth whence they sprang: they, and they only, know each other's birth.
Devanāgarī: नकिर्ह्येषां जनूंषि वेद ते अङ्ग विद्रे मिथो जनित्रम्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | hi | eṣām | janūṁṣi | vede | te | aṅga | vidre | mithaḥ | janitram ||7.56.2||

IAST: abhi svapūbhir mitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran
Griffith: They strew each other with their blasts, these Hawks: they strove together, roaring like the wind.
Devanāgarī: अभि स्वपूभिर्मिथो वपन्त वातस्वनसः श्येना अस्पृध्रन्
pada pāṭha: abhi | sva-pūbhiḥ | mithaḥ | vapanta | vāta-svanasaḥ | śyenāḥ | aspr̥dhran ||7.56.3||

IAST: etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśnir yad ūdho mahī jabhāra
Griffith: A sage was he who knew these mysteries, what in her udder mighty Prsni bore.
Devanāgarī: एतानि धीरो निण्या चिकेत पृश्निर्यदूधो मही जभार
pada pāṭha: etāni | dhīraḥ | niṇyā | ciketa | pr̥śniḥ | yat | ūdhaḥ | mahī | jabhāra ||7.56.4||

IAST: sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhir astu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam
Griffith: Ever victorious, through the Maruts, be this band of Heroes, nursing manly strength,
Devanāgarī: सा विट् सुवीरा मरुद्भिरस्तु सनात्सहन्ती पुष्यन्ती नृम्णम्
pada pāṭha: sā | viṭ | su-vīrā | marut-bhiḥ | astu | sanāt | sahantī | puṣyantī | nr̥mṇam ||7.56.5||

IAST: yāmaṁ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhir ugrāḥ
Griffith: Most bright in splendour, flectest on their way, close-knit to glory, strong with varied power.
Devanāgarī: यामं येष्ठाः शुभा शोभिष्ठाः श्रिया सम्मिश्ला ओजोभिरुग्राः
pada pāṭha: yāmam | yeṣṭhāḥ | śubhā | śobhiṣṭhāḥ | śriyā | sam-miślāḥ | ojaḥ-bhiḥ | ugrāḥ ||7.56.6||

IAST: ugraṁ va ojaḥ sthirā śavāṁsy adhā marudbhir gaṇas tuviṣmān
Griffith: Yea, mighty is your power and firm your strength: so, potent, with the Maruts, be the band.
Devanāgarī: उग्रं व ओजः स्थिरा शवांस्यधा मरुद्भिर्गणस्तुविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: ugram | vaḥ | ojaḥ | sthirā | śavāṁsi | adha | marut-bhiḥ | gaṇaḥ | tuviṣmān ||7.56.7||

IAST: śubhro vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṁsi dhunir munir iva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ
Griffith: Bright is your spirit, wrathful are your minds: your bold troop's minstrel is like one inspired.
Devanāgarī: शुभ्रो वः शुष्मः क्रुध्मी मनांसि धुनिर्मुनिरिव शर्धस्य धृष्णोः
pada pāṭha: śubhraḥ | vaḥ | śuṣmaḥ | krudhmī | manāṁsi | dhuniḥ | muniḥ-iva | śardhasya | dhr̥ṣṇoḥ ||7.56.8||

IAST: sanemy asmad yuyota didyum mā vo durmatir iha praṇaṅ naḥ
Griffith: Ever avert your blazing shaft from us, and let not your displeasure reach us here
Devanāgarī: सनेम्यस्मद्युयोत दिद्युं मा वो दुर्मतिरिह प्रणङ्नः
pada pāṭha: sanemi | asmat | yuyota | didyum | mā | vaḥ | duḥ-matiḥ | iha | praṇak | naḥ ||7.56.9||

IAST: priyā vo nāma huve turāṇām ā yat tṛpan maruto vāvaśānāḥ
Griffith: Your dear names, conquering Maruts, we invoke, calling aloud till we are satisfied.
Devanāgarī: प्रिया वो नाम हुवे तुराणामा यत्तृपन्मरुतो वावशानाः
pada pāṭha: priyā | vaḥ | nāma | huve | turāṇām | ā | yat | tr̥pat | marutaḥ | vāvaśānāḥ ||7.56.10||

IAST: svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ suniṣkā uta svayaṁ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
Griffith: Well-armed, impetuous in their haste, they deck themselves, their forms, with oblations: to you, the pure
Devanāgarī: स्वायुधास इष्मिणः सुनिष्का उत स्वयं तन्वः शुम्भमानाः
pada pāṭha: su-āyudhāsaḥ | iṣmiṇaḥ | su-niṣkāḥ | uta | svayam | tanvaḥ | śumbhamānāḥ ||7.56.11||

IAST: śucī vo havyā marutaḥ śucīnāṁ śuciṁ hinomy adhvaraṁ śucibhyaḥ
Griffith: Pure, Maruts, pure yourselves, are your oblations: to you, the pure, pure sacrifice I offer.
Devanāgarī: शुची वो हव्या मरुतः शुचीनां शुचिं हिनोम्यध्वरं शुचिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: śucī | vaḥ | havyā | marutaḥ | śucīnām | śucim | hinomi | adhvaram | śuci-bhyaḥ || r̥tena | satyam | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | āyan | śuci-janmānaḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ ||7.56.12||

IAST: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpa āyañ chucijanmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
Griffith: By Law they came to truth, the Law's observers, bright by their birth, and pure, and sanctifying.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन सत्यमृतसाप आयञ्छुचिजन्मानः शुचयः पावकाः
pada pāṭha: śucī | vaḥ | havyā | marutaḥ | śucīnām | śucim | hinomi | adhvaram | śuci-bhyaḥ || r̥tena | satyam | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | āyan | śuci-janmānaḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ ||7.56.12||

IAST: aṁseṣv ā marutaḥ khādayo vo vakṣaḥsu rukmā upaśiśriyāṇāḥ
Griffith: Your rings, O Maruts, rest upon your shoulders, and chains of gold are twined upon your bosoms.
Devanāgarī: अंसेष्वा मरुतः खादयो वो वक्षस्सु रुक्मा उपशिश्रियाणाः
pada pāṭha: aṁseṣu | ā | marutaḥ | khādayaḥ | vaḥ | vakṣaḥ-su | rukmāḥ | upa-śiśriyāṇāḥ || vi | vi-dyutaḥ | na | vr̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ | rucānāḥ | anu | svadhām | āyudhaiḥ | yacchamānāḥ ||7.56.13||

IAST: vi vidyuto na vṛṣṭibhī rucānā anu svadhām āyudhair yacchamānāḥ
Griffith: Gleaming with drops of rain, like lightning-flashes, after your wont ye whirl about your weapons.
Devanāgarī: वि विद्युतो न वृष्टिभी रुचाना अनु स्वधामायुधैर्यच्छमानाः
pada pāṭha: aṁseṣu | ā | marutaḥ | khādayaḥ | vaḥ | vakṣaḥ-su | rukmāḥ | upa-śiśriyāṇāḥ || vi | vi-dyutaḥ | na | vr̥ṣṭi-bhiḥ | rucānāḥ | anu | svadhām | āyudhaiḥ | yacchamānāḥ ||7.56.13||

IAST: pra budhnyā va īrate mahāṁsi pra nāmāni prayajyavas tiradhvam
Griffith: Wide in the depth of air spread forth your glories, far, most adorable, ye bear your titles.
Devanāgarī: प्र बुध्न्या व ईरते महांसि प्र नामानि प्रयज्यवस्तिरध्वम्
pada pāṭha: pra | budhnyā | vaḥ | īrate | mahāṁsi | pra | nāmāni | pra-yajyavaḥ | tiradhvam || sahasriyam | damyam | bhāgam | etam | gr̥ha-medhīyam | marutaḥ | juṣadhvam ||7.56.14||

IAST: sahasriyaṁ damyam bhāgam etaṁ gṛhamedhīyam maruto juṣadhvam
Griffith: Maruts, accept this thousandfold allotment of household sacrifice and household treasure.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रियं दम्यं भागमेतं गृहमेधीयं मरुतो जुषध्वम्
pada pāṭha: pra | budhnyā | vaḥ | īrate | mahāṁsi | pra | nāmāni | pra-yajyavaḥ | tiradhvam || sahasriyam | damyam | bhāgam | etam | gr̥ha-medhīyam | marutaḥ | juṣadhvam ||7.56.14||

IAST: yadi stutasya maruto adhīthetthā viprasya vājino havīman
Griffith: If, Maruts, ye regard the praise recited here at this mighty singer invocation,
Devanāgarī: यदि स्तुतस्य मरुतो अधीथेत्था विप्रस्य वाजिनो हवीमन्
pada pāṭha: yadi | stutasya | marutaḥ | adhi-itha | itthā | viprasya | vājinaḥ | havīman || makṣu | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | dāta | nu | cit | yam | anyaḥ | ā-dabhat | arāvā ||7.56.15||

IAST: makṣū rāyaḥ suvīryasya dāta nū cid yam anya ādabhad arāvā
Griffith: Vouchsafe us quickly wealth with noble heroes, wealth which no man uho hateth us may injure.
Devanāgarī: मक्षू रायः सुवीर्यस्य दात नू चिद्यमन्य आदभदरावा
pada pāṭha: yadi | stutasya | marutaḥ | adhi-itha | itthā | viprasya | vājinaḥ | havīman || makṣu | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | dāta | nu | cit | yam | anyaḥ | ā-dabhat | arāvā ||7.56.15||

IAST: atyāso na ye marutaḥ svañco yakṣadṛśo na śubhayanta maryāḥ
Griffith: The Maruts, fleet as coursers, while they deck them like youths spectators of a festal meeting,
Devanāgarī: अत्यासो न ये मरुतः स्वञ्चो यक्षदृशो न शुभयन्त मर्याः
pada pāṭha: atyāsaḥ | na | ye | marutaḥ | su-añcaḥ | yakṣa-dr̥śaḥ | na | śubhayanta | maryāḥ || te | harmye-sthāḥ | śiśavaḥ | na | śubhrāḥ | vatsāsaḥ | na | pra-kīḷinaḥ | payaḥ-dhāḥ ||7.56.16||

IAST: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavo na śubhrā vatsāso na prakrīḻinaḥ payodhāḥ
Griffith: Linger, like beauteous colts, about the dwelling, like frisking calves, these who pour down the water.
Devanāgarī: ते हर्म्येष्ठाः शिशवो न शुभ्रा वत्सासो न प्रक्रीळिनः पयोधाः
pada pāṭha: atyāsaḥ | na | ye | marutaḥ | su-añcaḥ | yakṣa-dr̥śaḥ | na | śubhayanta | maryāḥ || te | harmye-sthāḥ | śiśavaḥ | na | śubhrāḥ | vatsāsaḥ | na | pra-kīḷinaḥ | payaḥ-dhāḥ ||7.56.16||

IAST: daśasyanto no maruto mṛḻantu varivasyanto rodasī sumeke
Griffith: So may the Maruts help us and be gracious, bringing free room to lovely Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: दशस्यन्तो नो मरुतो मृळन्तु वरिवस्यन्तो रोदसी सुमेके
pada pāṭha: daśasyantaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷantu | varivasyantaḥ | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || āre | go-hā | nr̥-hā | vadhaḥ | vaḥ | astu | sumrebhiḥ | asme iti | vasavaḥ | namadhvam ||7.56.17||

IAST: āre gohā nṛhā vadho vo astu sumnebhir asme vasavo namadhvam
Griffith: Far be your bolt that slayeth men and cattle. Ye Vasus, turn yourselves to us with blessings.
Devanāgarī: आरे गोहा नृहा वधो वो अस्तु सुम्नेभिरस्मे वसवो नमध्वम्
pada pāṭha: daśasyantaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | mr̥ḷantu | varivasyantaḥ | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || āre | go-hā | nr̥-hā | vadhaḥ | vaḥ | astu | sumrebhiḥ | asme iti | vasavaḥ | namadhvam ||7.56.17||

IAST: ā vo hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīṁ rātim maruto gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: The priest, when seated, loudly calls you, Maruts, praising in song your universal bounty.
Devanāgarī: आ वो होता जोहवीति सत्तः सत्राचीं रातिं मरुतो गृणानः
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | hotā | johavīti | sattaḥ | satrācīm | rātim | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ || yaḥ | īvataḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | asti | gopāḥ | saḥ | advayāvī | havate | vaḥ | ukthaiḥ ||7.56.18||

IAST: ya īvato vṛṣaṇo asti gopāḥ so advayāvī havate va ukthaiḥ
Griffith: He, Bulls! who hath so much in his possession, free from duplicity, with hymns invokes you.
Devanāgarī: य ईवतो वृषणो अस्ति गोपाः सो अद्वयावी हवते व उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | hotā | johavīti | sattaḥ | satrācīm | rātim | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ || yaḥ | īvataḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | asti | gopāḥ | saḥ | advayāvī | havate | vaḥ | ukthaiḥ ||7.56.18||

IAST: ime turam maruto rāmayantīme sahaḥ sahasa ā namanti
Griffith: These Maruts bring the swift man to a stand-still, and strength with mightier strength they break and hum
Devanāgarī: इमे तुरं मरुतो रामयन्तीमे सहः सहस आ नमन्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | turam | marutaḥ | ramayanti | ime | sahaḥ | sahasaḥ | ā | namanti || ime | śaṁsam | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pānti | guru | dveṣaḥ | araruṣe | dadhanti ||7.56.19||

IAST: ime śaṁsaṁ vanuṣyato ni pānti guru dveṣo araruṣe dadhanti
Griffith: These guard the singer from the man who hates him and lay their sore displeasure on the wicked.
Devanāgarī: इमे शंसं वनुष्यतो नि पान्ति गुरु द्वेषो अररुषे दधन्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | turam | marutaḥ | ramayanti | ime | sahaḥ | sahasaḥ | ā | namanti || ime | śaṁsam | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pānti | guru | dveṣaḥ | araruṣe | dadhanti ||7.56.19||

IAST: ime radhraṁ cin maruto junanti bhṛmiṁ cid yathā vasavo juṣanta
Griffith: These Maruts rouse even the poor and needy: the Vasus love him as an active champion.
Devanāgarī: इमे रध्रं चिन्मरुतो जुनन्ति भृमिं चिद्यथा वसवो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: ime | radhram | cit | marutaḥ | junanti | bhr̥mim | cit | yathā | vasavaḥ | juṣanta || apa | bādhadhvam | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | tamāṁsi | dhatta | viśvam | tanayam | tokam | asme iti ||7.56.20||

IAST: apa bādhadhvaṁ vṛṣaṇas tamāṁsi dhatta viśvaṁ tanayaṁ tokam asme
Griffith: Drive to a distance, O ye Bulls, the darkness: give us full store of children and descendants.
Devanāgarī: अप बाधध्वं वृषणस्तमांसि धत्त विश्वं तनयं तोकमस्मे
pada pāṭha: ime | radhram | cit | marutaḥ | junanti | bhr̥mim | cit | yathā | vasavaḥ | juṣanta || apa | bādhadhvam | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | tamāṁsi | dhatta | viśvam | tanayam | tokam | asme iti ||7.56.20||

IAST: mā vo dātrān maruto nir arāma mā paścād daghma rathyo vibhāge
Griffith: Never, O Maruts, may we lose your bounty, nor, car-borne Lords! be hitidmost when ye deal it.
Devanāgarī: मा वो दात्रान्मरुतो निरराम मा पश्चाद्दघ्म रथ्यो विभागे
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | dātrāt | marutaḥ | niḥ | arāma | mā | paścāt | dadhma | rathyaḥ | vi-bhāge || ā | naḥ | spārhe | bhajatana | vasavye | yat | īm | su-jātam | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vaḥ | asti ||7.56.21||

IAST: ā naḥ spārhe bhajatanā vasavye yad īṁ sujātaṁ vṛṣaṇo vo asti
Griffith: Give us a share in that delightful treasure, the genuine wealth that, Bulls! is your possession.
Devanāgarī: आ नः स्पार्हे भजतना वसव्ये यदीं सुजातं वृषणो वो अस्ति
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | dātrāt | marutaḥ | niḥ | arāma | mā | paścāt | dadhma | rathyaḥ | vi-bhāge || ā | naḥ | spārhe | bhajatana | vasavye | yat | īm | su-jātam | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vaḥ | asti ||7.56.21||

IAST: saṁ yad dhananta manyubhir janāsaḥ śūrā yahvīṣv oṣadhīṣu vikṣu
Griffith: What time the men in fury rush together for running streams, for pastures, and for houses.
Devanāgarī: सं यद्धनन्त मन्युभिर्जनासः शूरा यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | hananta | manyu-bhiḥ | janāsaḥ | śūrāḥ | yahvīṣu | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu || adha | sma | naḥ | marutaḥ | rudriyāsaḥ | trātāraḥ | bhūta | pr̥tanāsu | aryaḥ ||7.56.22||

IAST: adha smā no maruto rudriyāsas trātāro bhūta pṛtanāsv aryaḥ
Griffith: Then, O ye Maruts, ye who spring from Rudra, be our protectors in the strife with foemen.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा नो मरुतो रुद्रियासस्त्रातारो भूत पृतनास्वर्यः
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | hananta | manyu-bhiḥ | janāsaḥ | śūrāḥ | yahvīṣu | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu || adha | sma | naḥ | marutaḥ | rudriyāsaḥ | trātāraḥ | bhūta | pr̥tanāsu | aryaḥ ||7.56.22||

IAST: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇy ukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit
Griffith: Full many a deed ye did for our forefathers worthy of lauds which, even of old, they sang you.
Devanāgarī: भूरि चक्र मरुतः पित्र्याण्युक्थानि या वः शस्यन्ते पुरा चित्
pada pāṭha: bhūri | cakra | marutaḥ | pitryāṇi | ukthāni | yā | vaḥ | śasyante | purā | cit || marut-bhiḥ | ugraḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sāḷhā | marut-bhiḥ | it | sanitā | vājam | arvā ||7.56.23||

IAST: marudbhir ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḻhā marudbhir it sanitā vājam arvā
Griffith: lle strong man, with the Maruts, wins in battle, the charger, with the Maruts, gains the booty.
Devanāgarī: मरुद्भिरुग्रः पृतनासु साळ्हा मरुद्भिरित्सनिता वाजमर्वा
pada pāṭha: bhūri | cakra | marutaḥ | pitryāṇi | ukthāni | yā | vaḥ | śasyante | purā | cit || marut-bhiḥ | ugraḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sāḷhā | marut-bhiḥ | it | sanitā | vājam | arvā ||7.56.23||

IAST: asme vīro marutaḥ śuṣmy astu janānāṁ yo asuro vidhartā
Griffith: Ours, O ye Maruts, be the vigorous Hero, the Lord Divine of men, the strong Sustainer,
Devanāgarī: अस्मे वीरो मरुतः शुष्म्यस्तु जनानां यो असुरो विधर्ता
pada pāṭha: asme iti | vīraḥ | marutaḥ | śuṣmī | astu | janānām | yaḥ | asuraḥ | vi-dhartā || apaḥ | yena | su-kṣitaye | tarema | adha | svam | okaḥ | abhi | vaḥ | syāma ||7.56.24||

IAST: apo yena sukṣitaye taremādha svam oko abhi vaḥ syāma
Griffith: With whom to fair lands we may cross the waters, and dwell in our own home with you beside us.
Devanāgarī: अपो येन सुक्षितये तरेमाध स्वमोको अभि वः स्याम
pada pāṭha: asme iti | vīraḥ | marutaḥ | śuṣmī | astu | janānām | yaḥ | asuraḥ | vi-dhartā || apaḥ | yena | su-kṣitaye | tarema | adha | svam | okaḥ | abhi | vaḥ | syāma ||7.56.24||

IAST: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnir āpa oṣadhīr vanino juṣanta
Griffith: May Indra, Mitra, Varuna and Agni, Waters, and Plants, and Trees accept our praises.
Devanāgarī: तन्न इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निराप ओषधीर्वनिनो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | juṣanta || śarman | syāma | marutām | upa-sthe | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.56.25||

IAST: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May we find shelter in the Marut's bosom. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: शर्मन्स्याम मरुतामुपस्थे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | āpaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | vaninaḥ | juṣanta || śarman | syāma | marutām | upa-sthe | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.56.25||

IAST: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṁ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti
Griffith: YEA, through the power of your sweet juice, ye Holy! the Marut host is glad at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: मध्वो वो नाम मारुतं यजत्राः प्र यज्ञेषु शवसा मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | vaḥ | nāma | mārutam | yajatrāḥ | pra | yajñeṣu | śavasā | madanti || ye | rejayanti | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | pinvanti | utsam | yat | ayāsuḥ | ugrāḥ ||7.57.1||

IAST: ye rejayanti rodasī cid urvī pinvanty utsaṁ yad ayāsur ugrāḥ
Griffith: They cause even spacious heaven and earth to tremble, they make the spring flow when they come, the Mig
Devanāgarī: ये रेजयन्ति रोदसी चिदुर्वी पिन्वन्त्युत्सं यदयासुरुग्राः
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | vaḥ | nāma | mārutam | yajatrāḥ | pra | yajñeṣu | śavasā | madanti || ye | rejayanti | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | pinvanti | utsam | yat | ayāsuḥ | ugrāḥ ||7.57.1||

IAST: nicetāro hi maruto gṛṇantam praṇetāro yajamānasya manma
Griffith: The Maruts watch the man who sings their praises, promoters of the thought of him who worships.
Devanāgarī: निचेतारो हि मरुतो गृणन्तं प्रणेतारो यजमानस्य मन्म
pada pāṭha: ni-cetāraḥ | hi | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇantam | pra-netāraḥ | yajamānasya | manma || asmākam | adya | vidatheṣu | barhiḥ | ā | vītaye | sadata | pipriyāṇāḥ ||7.57.2||

IAST: asmākam adya vidatheṣu barhir ā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ
Griffith: Seat you on sacred grass in our assembly, this day, with friendly minds, to share the banquet.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमद्य विदथेषु बर्हिरा वीतये सदत पिप्रियाणाः
pada pāṭha: ni-cetāraḥ | hi | marutaḥ | gr̥ṇantam | pra-netāraḥ | yajamānasya | manma || asmākam | adya | vidatheṣu | barhiḥ | ā | vītaye | sadata | pipriyāṇāḥ ||7.57.2||

IAST: naitāvad anye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmair āyudhais tanūbhiḥ
Griffith: No others gleam so brightly as these Maruts with their own forms, their golden gauds, their weapons.
Devanāgarī: नैतावदन्ये मरुतो यथेमे भ्राजन्ते रुक्मैरायुधैस्तनूभिः
pada pāṭha: na | etāvat | anye | marutaḥ | yathā | ime | bhrājante | rukmaiḥ | āyudhaiḥ | tanūbhiḥ || ā | rodasī iti | viśva-piśaḥ | piśānāḥ | samānam | añji | añjate | śubhe | kam ||7.57.3||

IAST: ā rodasī viśvapiśaḥ piśānāḥ samānam añjy añjate śubhe kam
Griffith: With all adornments, decking earth and heaven, they heighten, for bright show, their common splendour.
Devanāgarī: आ रोदसी विश्वपिशः पिशानाः समानमञ्ज्यञ्जते शुभे कम्
pada pāṭha: na | etāvat | anye | marutaḥ | yathā | ime | bhrājante | rukmaiḥ | āyudhaiḥ | tanūbhiḥ || ā | rodasī iti | viśva-piśaḥ | piśānāḥ | samānam | añji | añjate | śubhe | kam ||7.57.3||

IAST: ṛdhak sā vo maruto didyud astu yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma
Griffith: Far from us be your blazing dart, O Maruts, when we, through human frailty, sin against you.
Devanāgarī: ऋधक्सा वो मरुतो दिद्युदस्तु यद्व आगः पुरुषता कराम
pada pāṭha: r̥dhak | sā | vaḥ | marutaḥ | didyut | astu | yat | vaḥ | āgaḥ | puruṣatā | karāma || mā | vaḥ | tasyām | api | bhūma | yajatrāḥ | asme iti | vaḥ | astu | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā ||7.57.4||

IAST: mā vas tasyām api bhūmā yajatrā asme vo astu sumatiś caniṣṭhā
Griffith: Let us not he exposed to that, ye Holy! May your most loving favour still attend us.
Devanāgarī: मा वस्तस्यामपि भूमा यजत्रा अस्मे वो अस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा
pada pāṭha: r̥dhak | sā | vaḥ | marutaḥ | didyut | astu | yat | vaḥ | āgaḥ | puruṣatā | karāma || mā | vaḥ | tasyām | api | bhūma | yajatrāḥ | asme iti | vaḥ | astu | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā ||7.57.4||

IAST: kṛte cid atra maruto raṇantānavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
Griffith: May even what we have done delight the Maruts, the blameless Ones, the bright, the purifying.
Devanāgarī: कृते चिदत्र मरुतो रणन्तानवद्यासः शुचयः पावकाः
pada pāṭha: kr̥te | cit | atra | marutaḥ | raṇanta | anavadyāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ || pra | naḥ | avata | sumati-bhiḥ | yajatrāḥ | pra | vājebhiḥ | tirata | puṣyase | naḥ ||7.57.5||

IAST: pra ṇo 'vata sumatibhir yajatrāḥ pra vājebhis tirata puṣyase naḥ
Griffith: Further us, O ye Holy, with your kindness: advance us mightily that we may prosper.
Devanāgarī: प्र णोऽवत सुमतिभिर्यजत्राः प्र वाजेभिस्तिरत पुष्यसे नः
pada pāṭha: kr̥te | cit | atra | marutaḥ | raṇanta | anavadyāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ || pra | naḥ | avata | sumati-bhiḥ | yajatrāḥ | pra | vājebhiḥ | tirata | puṣyase | naḥ ||7.57.5||

IAST: uta stutāso maruto vyantu viśvebhir nāmabhir naro havīṁṣi
Griffith: And may the Maruts, praised by all their titles, Heroes, enjoy the taste of our oblations.
Devanāgarī: उत स्तुतासो मरुतो व्यन्तु विश्वेभिर्नामभिर्नरो हवींषि
pada pāṭha: uta | stutāsaḥ | marutaḥ | vyantu | viśvebhiḥ | nāma-bhiḥ | naraḥ | havīṁṣi || dadāta | naḥ | amr̥tasya | pra-jāyai | jigr̥ta | rāyaḥ | sūnr̥tā | maghāni ||7.57.6||

IAST: dadāta no amṛtasya prajāyai jigṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtā maghāni
Griffith: Give us of Amrta for the sake of offspring: awake the excellent fair stores of riches.
Devanāgarī: ददात नो अमृतस्य प्रजायै जिगृत रायः सूनृता मघानि
pada pāṭha: uta | stutāsaḥ | marutaḥ | vyantu | viśvebhiḥ | nāma-bhiḥ | naraḥ | havīṁṣi || dadāta | naḥ | amr̥tasya | pra-jāyai | jigr̥ta | rāyaḥ | sūnr̥tā | maghāni ||7.57.6||

IAST: ā stutāso maruto viśva ūtī acchā sūrīn sarvatātā jigāta
Griffith: Hither, ye Maruts, praised, with all your succours, with all felicity come to our princes,
Devanāgarī: आ स्तुतासो मरुतो विश्व ऊती अच्छा सूरीन्सर्वताता जिगात
pada pāṭha: ā | stutāsaḥ | marutaḥ | viśve | ūtī | accha | sūrīn | sarva-tātā | jigāta || ye | naḥ | tmanā | śatinaḥ | vardhayanti | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.57.7||

IAST: ye nas tmanā śatino vardhayanti yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Who, of themselves, a hundredfold increase us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: ये नस्त्मना शतिनो वर्धयन्ति यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | stutāsaḥ | marutaḥ | viśve | ūtī | accha | sūrīn | sarva-tātā | jigāta || ye | naḥ | tmanā | śatinaḥ | vardhayanti | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.57.7||

IAST: pra sākamukṣe arcatā gaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnas tuviṣmān
Griffith: SING to the troop that pours down rain in common, the Mighty Company of celestial nature.
Devanāgarī: प्र साकमुक्षे अर्चता गणाय यो दैव्यस्य धाम्नस्तुविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: pra | sākam-ukṣe | arcata | gaṇāya | yaḥ | daivyasya | dhāmnaḥ | tuviṣmān || uta | kṣodanti | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | nakṣante | nākam | niḥ-r̥teḥ | avaṁśāt ||7.58.1||

IAST: uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṁ nirṛter avaṁśāt
Griffith: They make the world-halves tremble with their greatness: from depths of earth and sky they reach to heav
Devanāgarī: उत क्षोदन्ति रोदसी महित्वा नक्षन्ते नाकं निरृतेरवंशात्
pada pāṭha: pra | sākam-ukṣe | arcata | gaṇāya | yaḥ | daivyasya | dhāmnaḥ | tuviṣmān || uta | kṣodanti | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā | nakṣante | nākam | niḥ-r̥teḥ | avaṁśāt ||7.58.1||

IAST: janūś cid vo marutas tveṣyeṇa bhīmāsas tuvimanyavo 'yāsaḥ
Griffith: Yea, your birth, Maruts, was with wild commotion, ye who move swiftly, fierce in wrath, terrific.
Devanāgarī: जनूश्चिद्वो मरुतस्त्वेष्येण भीमासस्तुविमन्यवोऽयासः
pada pāṭha: janūḥ | cit | vaḥ | marutaḥ | tveṣyeṇa | bhīmāsaḥ | tuvi-manyavaḥ | ayāsaḥ || pra | ye | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | ojasā | uta | santi | viśvaḥ | vaḥ | yāman | bhayate | svaḥ-dr̥k ||7.58.2||

IAST: pra ye mahobhir ojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk
Griffith: Ye all-surpassing in your might and vigour, each looker on the light fears at your coming.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये महोभिरोजसोत सन्ति विश्वो वो यामन्भयते स्वर्दृक्
pada pāṭha: janūḥ | cit | vaḥ | marutaḥ | tveṣyeṇa | bhīmāsaḥ | tuvi-manyavaḥ | ayāsaḥ || pra | ye | mahaḥ-bhiḥ | ojasā | uta | santi | viśvaḥ | vaḥ | yāman | bhayate | svaḥ-dr̥k ||7.58.2||

IAST: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣann in marutaḥ suṣṭutiṁ naḥ
Griffith: Give ample vital power unto our princes let our fair praises gratify the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्वयो मघवद्भ्यो दधात जुजोषन्निन्मरुतः सुष्टुतिं नः
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dadhāta | jujoṣan | it | marutaḥ | su-stutim | naḥ || gataḥ | na | adhvā | vi | tirāti | jantum | pra | naḥ | spārhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | tireta ||7.58.3||

IAST: gato nādhvā vi tirāti jantum pra ṇaḥ spārhābhir ūtibhis tireta
Griffith: As the way travelled helpeth people onward, so further us with your delightful succours.
Devanāgarī: गतो नाध्वा वि तिराति जन्तुं प्र णः स्पार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेत
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | vayaḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dadhāta | jujoṣan | it | marutaḥ | su-stutim | naḥ || gataḥ | na | adhvā | vi | tirāti | jantum | pra | naḥ | spārhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | tireta ||7.58.3||

IAST: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī
Griffith: Your favoured singer counts his wealth by hundreds: the strong steed whom ye favour wins a thousand.
Devanāgarī: युष्मोतो विप्रो मरुतः शतस्वी युष्मोतो अर्वा सहुरिः सहस्री
pada pāṭha: yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | vipraḥ | marutaḥ | śatasvī | yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | arvā | sahuriḥ | sahasrī || yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | sam-rāṭ | uta | hanti | vr̥tram | pra | tat | vaḥ | astu | dhūtayaḥ | deṣṇam ||7.58.4||

IAST: yuṣmotaḥ samrāḻ uta hanti vṛtram pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam
Griffith: The Sovran whom ye aid destroys the foeman. May this your gift, ye Shakers, be distinguished.
Devanāgarī: युष्मोतः सम्राळुत हन्ति वृत्रं प्र तद्वो अस्तु धूतयो देष्णम्
pada pāṭha: yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | vipraḥ | marutaḥ | śatasvī | yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | arvā | sahuriḥ | sahasrī || yuṣmā-ūtaḥ | sam-rāṭ | uta | hanti | vr̥tram | pra | tat | vaḥ | astu | dhūtayaḥ | deṣṇam ||7.58.4||

IAST: tām̐ ā rudrasya mīḻhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṁsante marutaḥ punar naḥ
Griffith: I call, as such, the Sons of bounteous Rudra: will not the Maruts turn again to us-ward?
Devanāgarī: ताँ आ रुद्रस्य मीळ्हुषो विवासे कुविन्नंसन्ते मरुतः पुनर्नः
pada pāṭha: tān | ā | rudrasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ | vivāse | kuvit | naṁsante | marutaḥ | punaḥ | naḥ || yat | sasvartā | jihīḷire | yat | āviḥ | ava | tat | enaḥ | īmahe | turāṇām ||7.58.5||

IAST: yat sasvartā jihīḻire yad āvir ava tad ena īmahe turāṇām
Griffith: What secret sin or open stirs their anger, that we implore the Swift Ones to forgive us.
Devanāgarī: यत्सस्वर्ता जिहीळिरे यदाविरव तदेन ईमहे तुराणाम्
pada pāṭha: tān | ā | rudrasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ | vivāse | kuvit | naṁsante | marutaḥ | punaḥ | naḥ || yat | sasvartā | jihīḷire | yat | āviḥ | ava | tat | enaḥ | īmahe | turāṇām ||7.58.5||

IAST: pra sā vāci suṣṭutir maghonām idaṁ sūktam maruto juṣanta
Griffith: This eulogy of the Bounteous hath been spoken: accept, ye Maruts, this our hymn of praises.
Devanāgarī: प्र सा वाचि सुष्टुतिर्मघोनामिदं सूक्तं मरुतो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: pra | sā | vāci | su-stutiḥ | maghonām | idam | su-uktam | marutaḥ | juṣanta || ārāt | cit | dveṣaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yuyota | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.58.6||

IAST: ārāc cid dveṣo vṛṣaṇo yuyota yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Ye Bulls, keep those who hate us at a distance. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: आराच्चिद्द्वेषो वृषणो युयोत यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: pra | sā | vāci | su-stutiḥ | maghonām | idam | su-uktam | marutaḥ | juṣanta || ārāt | cit | dveṣaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yuyota | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.58.6||

IAST: yaṁ trāyadhva idam-idaṁ devāso yaṁ ca nayatha
Griffith: WHOMSO ye rescue here and there, whomso ye guide, O Deities,
Devanāgarī: यं त्रायध्व इदमिदं देवासो यं च नयथ
pada pāṭha: yam | trāyadhve | idam-idam | devāsaḥ | yam | ca | nayatha || tasmai | agne | varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | marutaḥ | śarma | yacchata ||7.59.1||

IAST: tasmā agne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yacchata
Griffith: To him give shelter, Agni, Mitra, Varuna, ye Maruts, and thou Aryaman.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा अग्ने वरुण मित्रार्यमन्मरुतः शर्म यच्छत
pada pāṭha: yam | trāyadhve | idam-idam | devāsaḥ | yam | ca | nayatha || tasmai | agne | varuṇa | mitra | aryaman | marutaḥ | śarma | yacchata ||7.59.1||

IAST: yuṣmākaṁ devā avasāhani priya ījānas tarati dviṣaḥ
Griffith: Through your kind favour, Gods, on some auspicious day, the worshipper subdues his foes.
Devanāgarī: युष्माकं देवा अवसाहनि प्रिय ईजानस्तरति द्विषः
pada pāṭha: yuṣmākam | devāḥ | avasā | ahani | priye | ījānaḥ | tarati | dviṣaḥ || pra | saḥ | kṣayam | tirate | vi | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | yaḥ | vaḥ | varāya | dāśati ||7.59.2||

IAST: pra sa kṣayaṁ tirate vi mahīr iṣo yo vo varāya dāśati
Griffith: That man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.
Devanāgarī: प्र स क्षयं तिरते वि महीरिषो यो वो वराय दाशति
pada pāṭha: yuṣmākam | devāḥ | avasā | ahani | priye | ījānaḥ | tarati | dviṣaḥ || pra | saḥ | kṣayam | tirate | vi | mahīḥ | iṣaḥ | yaḥ | vaḥ | varāya | dāśati ||7.59.2||

IAST: nahi vaś caramaṁ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṁsate
Griffith: Vasistha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all.
Devanāgarī: नहि वश्चरमं चन वसिष्ठः परिमंसते
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | caramam | cana | vasiṣṭhaḥ | pari-maṁsate || asmākam | adya | marutaḥ | sute | sacā | viśve | pibata | kāminaḥ ||7.59.3||

IAST: asmākam adya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ
Griffith: O Maruts, of our Soma juice effused to-day drink all of you with eager haste.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमद्य मरुतः सुते सचा विश्वे पिबत कामिनः
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | caramam | cana | vasiṣṭhaḥ | pari-maṁsate || asmākam | adya | marutaḥ | sute | sacā | viśve | pibata | kāminaḥ ||7.59.3||

IAST: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṁ naraḥ
Griffith: Your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye, Heroes, grant your gifts.
Devanāgarī: नहि व ऊतिः पृतनासु मर्धति यस्मा अराध्वं नरः
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | ūtiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | mardhati | yasmai | arādhvam | naraḥ || abhi | vaḥ | ā | avart | su-matiḥ | navīyasī | tūyam | yāta | pipīṣavaḥ ||7.59.4||

IAST: abhi va āvart sumatir navīyasī tūyaṁ yāta pipīṣavaḥ
Griffith: May your most recent favour turn to us again. Come quickly, ye who fain would drink.
Devanāgarī: अभि व आवर्त्सुमतिर्नवीयसी तूयं यात पिपीषवः
pada pāṭha: nahi | vaḥ | ūtiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | mardhati | yasmai | arādhvam | naraḥ || abhi | vaḥ | ā | avart | su-matiḥ | navīyasī | tūyam | yāta | pipīṣavaḥ ||7.59.4||

IAST: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṁsi pītaye
Griffith: Come hitherward to drink the juice, O ye whose bounties give you joy.
Devanāgarī: ओ षु घृष्विराधसो यातनान्धांसि पीतये
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | ghr̥ṣvi-rādhasaḥ | yātana | andhāṁsi | pītaye || imā | vaḥ | havyā | marutaḥ | rare | hi | kam | mo iti | su | anyatra | gantana ||7.59.5||

IAST: imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kam mo ṣv anyatra gantana
Griffith: These offerings are for you, these, Maruts, I present. Go not to any place but this.
Devanāgarī: इमा वो हव्या मरुतो ररे हि कं मो ष्वन्यत्र गन्तन
pada pāṭha: o iti | su | ghr̥ṣvi-rādhasaḥ | yātana | andhāṁsi | pītaye || imā | vaḥ | havyā | marutaḥ | rare | hi | kam | mo iti | su | anyatra | gantana ||7.59.5||

IAST: ā ca no barhiḥ sadatāvitā ca naḥ spārhāṇi dātave vasu
Griffith: Sit on our sacred grass, be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long,
Devanāgarī: आ च नो बर्हिः सदताविता च नः स्पार्हाणि दातवे वसु
pada pāṭha: ā | caḥ | naḥ | barhiḥ | sadata | avita | ca | naḥ | spārhāṇi | dātave | vasu || asredhantaḥ | marutaḥ | somye | madhau | svāhā | iha | mādayādhvai ||7.59.6||

IAST: asredhanto marutaḥ somye madhau svāheha mādayādhvai
Griffith: To take delight, ye Maruts, Friends of all, with Svaha, in sweet Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अस्रेधन्तो मरुतः सोम्ये मधौ स्वाहेह मादयाध्वै
pada pāṭha: ā | caḥ | naḥ | barhiḥ | sadata | avita | ca | naḥ | spārhāṇi | dātave | vasu || asredhantaḥ | marutaḥ | somye | madhau | svāhā | iha | mādayādhvai ||7.59.6||

IAST: sasvaś cid dhi tanvaḥ śumbhamānā ā haṁsāso nīlapṛṣṭhā apaptan
Griffith: Decking the beauty of their forms in secret the Swans with purple backs have flown down hither.
Devanāgarī: सस्वश्चिद्धि तन्वः शुम्भमाना आ हंसासो नीलपृष्ठा अपप्तन्
pada pāṭha: sasvariti | cit | hi | tanvaḥ | śumbhamānāḥ | ā | haṁsāsaḥ | nīla-pr̥ṣṭhāḥ | apaptan || viśvam | śardhaḥ | abhitaḥ | mā | ni | seda | naraḥ | na | raṇvāḥ | savane | madantaḥ ||7.59.7||

IAST: viśvaṁ śardho abhito mā ni ṣeda naro na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ
Griffith: Around me all the Company hath settled, like joyous Heroes glad in our libation.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं शर्धो अभितो मा नि षेद नरो न रण्वाः सवने मदन्तः
pada pāṭha: sasvariti | cit | hi | tanvaḥ | śumbhamānāḥ | ā | haṁsāsaḥ | nīla-pr̥ṣṭhāḥ | apaptan || viśvam | śardhaḥ | abhitaḥ | mā | ni | seda | naraḥ | na | raṇvāḥ | savane | madantaḥ ||7.59.7||

IAST: yo no maruto abhi durhṛṇāyus tiraś cittāni vasavo jighāṁsati
Griffith: Maruts, the man whose wrath is hard to master, he who would slay us ere we think, O Vasus,
Devanāgarī: यो नो मरुतो अभि दुर्हृणायुस्तिरश्चित्तानि वसवो जिघांसति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | abhi | duḥ-hr̥ṇāyuḥ | tiraḥ | cittāni | vasavaḥ | jighāṁsati || druhaḥ | pāśān | prati | saḥ | mucīṣṭa | tapiṣṭhena | hanmanā | hantana | tam ||7.59.8||

IAST: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanā hantanā tam
Griffith: May he be tangled in the toils of mischief; smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.
Devanāgarī: द्रुहः पाशान्प्रति स मुचीष्ट तपिष्ठेन हन्मना हन्तना तम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | marutaḥ | abhi | duḥ-hr̥ṇāyuḥ | tiraḥ | cittāni | vasavaḥ | jighāṁsati || druhaḥ | pāśān | prati | saḥ | mucīṣṭa | tapiṣṭhena | hanmanā | hantana | tam ||7.59.8||

IAST: sāṁtapanā idaṁ havir marutas taj jujuṣṭana
Griffith: O Maruts, ye consuming Gods, enjoy this offering brought for you,
Devanāgarī: सांतपना इदं हविर्मरुतस्तज्जुजुष्टन
pada pāṭha: sān-tapanāḥ | idam | haviḥ | marutaḥ | tat | jujuṣṭana || yuṣmāka | ūtī | riśādasaḥ ||7.59.9||

IAST: yuṣmākotī riśādasaḥ
Griffith: To help us, ye who slay the foe.
Devanāgarī: युष्माकोती रिशादसः
pada pāṭha: sān-tapanāḥ | idam | haviḥ | marutaḥ | tat | jujuṣṭana || yuṣmāka | ūtī | riśādasaḥ ||7.59.9||

IAST: gṛhamedhāsa ā gata maruto māpa bhūtana
Griffith: Sharers of household sacrifice, come, Maruts, stay not far away,
Devanāgarī: गृहमेधास आ गत मरुतो माप भूतन
pada pāṭha: gr̥ha-medhāsaḥ | ā | gata | marutaḥ | mā | apa | bhūtana || yuṣmāka | ūtī | su-dānavaḥ ||7.59.10||

IAST: yuṣmākotī sudānavaḥ
Griffith: That ye may help us, Bounteous Ones.
Devanāgarī: युष्माकोती सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: gr̥ha-medhāsaḥ | ā | gata | marutaḥ | mā | apa | bhūtana || yuṣmāka | ūtī | su-dānavaḥ ||7.59.10||

IAST: iheha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūryatvacaḥ
Griffith: Here, Self-strong Maruts, yea, even here. ye Sages with your sunbright skins
Devanāgarī: इहेह वः स्वतवसः कवयः सूर्यत्वचः
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | vaḥ | sva-tavasaḥ | kavayaḥ | sūrya-tvacaḥ || yajñam | marutaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇe ||7.59.11||

IAST: yajñam maruta ā vṛṇe
Griffith: I dedicate your sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: यज्ञं मरुत आ वृणे
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | vaḥ | sva-tavasaḥ | kavayaḥ | sūrya-tvacaḥ || yajñam | marutaḥ | ā | vr̥ṇe ||7.59.11||

IAST: tryambakaṁ yajāmahe sugandhim puṣṭivardhanam
Griffith: Tryambaka we worship, sweet augmenter of prosperity.
Devanāgarī: त्र्यम्बकं यजामहे सुगन्धिं पुष्टिवर्धनम्
pada pāṭha: tri-ambakam | yajāmahe | su-gandhim | puṣṭi-vardhanam || urvārukam-iva | bandhanāt | mr̥tyoḥ | mukṣīya | mā | amr̥tāt ||7.59.12||

IAST: urvārukam iva bandhanān mṛtyor mukṣīya māmṛtāt
Griffith: As from its stem the cucumber, so may I be released from death, not reft of immortality.
Devanāgarī: उर्वारुकमिव बन्धनान्मृत्योर्मुक्षीय मामृतात्
pada pāṭha: tri-ambakam | yajāmahe | su-gandhim | puṣṭi-vardhanam || urvārukam-iva | bandhanāt | mr̥tyoḥ | mukṣīya | mā | amr̥tāt ||7.59.12||

IAST: yad adya sūrya bravo 'nāgā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam
Griffith: WHEN thou, O Sun, this day, arising sinless, shalt speak the truth to Varuna and Mitra,
Devanāgarī: यदद्य सूर्य ब्रवोऽनागा उद्यन्मित्राय वरुणाय सत्यम्
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūrya | bravaḥ | anāgāḥ | ut-yan | mitrāya | varuṇāya | satyam || vayam | deva-trā | adite | syāma | tava | priyāsaḥ | aryaman | gr̥ṇantaḥ ||7.60.1||

IAST: vayaṁ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman gṛṇantaḥ
Griffith: O Aditi, may all the Deities love us, and thou, O Aryaman, while we are singing.
Devanāgarī: वयं देवत्रादिते स्याम तव प्रियासो अर्यमन्गृणन्तः
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūrya | bravaḥ | anāgāḥ | ut-yan | mitrāya | varuṇāya | satyam || vayam | deva-trā | adite | syāma | tava | priyāsaḥ | aryaman | gr̥ṇantaḥ ||7.60.1||

IAST: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe ud eti sūryo abhi jman
Griffith: Looking on man, O Varuna and Mitra, this Sun ascendeth up by both the pathways,
Devanāgarī: एष स्य मित्रावरुणा नृचक्षा उभे उदेति सूर्यो अभि ज्मन्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | ubhe iti | ut | eti | sūryaḥ | abhi | jman || viśvasya | sthātuḥ | jagataḥ | ca | gopāḥ | r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan ||7.60.2||

IAST: viśvasya sthātur jagataś ca gopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
Griffith: Guardian of all things fixt, of all that moveth, beholding good and evil acts of mortals.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य स्थातुर्जगतश्च गोपा ऋजु मर्तेषु वृजिना च पश्यन्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | nr̥-cakṣāḥ | ubhe iti | ut | eti | sūryaḥ | abhi | jman || viśvasya | sthātuḥ | jagataḥ | ca | gopāḥ | r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan ||7.60.2||

IAST: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṁ vahanti sūryaṁ ghṛtācīḥ
Griffith: He from their home hath yoked the Seven gold Coursers who, dropping oil and fatness, carry Surya.
Devanāgarī: अयुक्त सप्त हरितः सधस्थाद्या ईं वहन्ति सूर्यं घृताचीः
pada pāṭha: ayukta | sapta | haritaḥ | sadha-sthāt | yāḥ | īm | vahanti | sūryam | ghr̥tācīḥ || dhāmāni | mitrāvaruṇā | yuvākuḥ | sam | yaḥ | yūthā-iva | janimāni | caṣṭe ||7.60.3||

IAST: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṁ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe
Griffith: Yours, Varuna and Mitra, he surveyeth the worlds and living creatures like a herdsman.
Devanāgarī: धामानि मित्रावरुणा युवाकुः सं यो यूथेव जनिमानि चष्टे
pada pāṭha: ayukta | sapta | haritaḥ | sadha-sthāt | yāḥ | īm | vahanti | sūryam | ghr̥tācīḥ || dhāmāni | mitrāvaruṇā | yuvākuḥ | sam | yaḥ | yūthā-iva | janimāni | caṣṭe ||7.60.3||

IAST: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthur ā sūryo aruhac chukram arṇaḥ
Griffith: Your coursers rich in store of sweets have mounted: to the bright ocean Surya hath ascended,
Devanāgarī: उद्वां पृक्षासो मधुमन्तो अस्थुरा सूर्यो अरुहच्छुक्रमर्णः
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | asthuḥ | ā | sūryaḥ | aruhat | śukram | arṇaḥ || yasmai | ādityāḥ | adhvanaḥ | radanti | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.60.4||

IAST: yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: For whom the Adityas make his pathway ready, Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, accordant.
Devanāgarī: यस्मा आदित्या अध्वनो रदन्ति मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणः सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | asthuḥ | ā | sūryaḥ | aruhat | śukram | arṇaḥ || yasmai | ādityāḥ | adhvanaḥ | radanti | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||7.60.4||

IAST: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrer mitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi
Griffith: For these, even Aryaman, Varuna and Mitra, are the chastisers of all guile and falsehood.
Devanāgarī: इमे चेतारो अनृतस्य भूरेर्मित्रो अर्यमा वरुणो हि सन्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | cetāraḥ | anr̥tasya | bhūreḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | hi | santi || ime | r̥tasya | vavr̥dhuḥ | duroṇe | śagmāsaḥ | putrāḥ | aditeḥ | adabdhāḥ ||7.60.5||

IAST: ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhur duroṇe śagmāsaḥ putrā aditer adabdhāḥ
Griffith: These, Aditi's Sons, infallible and mighty, have waxen in the home of law Eternal.
Devanāgarī: इम ऋतस्य वावृधुर्दुरोणे शग्मासः पुत्रा अदितेरदब्धाः
pada pāṭha: ime | cetāraḥ | anr̥tasya | bhūreḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | hi | santi || ime | r̥tasya | vavr̥dhuḥ | duroṇe | śagmāsaḥ | putrāḥ | aditeḥ | adabdhāḥ ||7.60.5||

IAST: ime mitro varuṇo dūḻabhāso 'cetasaṁ cic citayanti dakṣaiḥ
Griffith: These, Mitra, Varuna whom none deceiveth, with great power quicken even the fool to wisdom,
Devanāgarī: इमे मित्रो वरुणो दूळभासोऽचेतसं चिच्चितयन्ति दक्षैः
pada pāṭha: ime | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | duḥ-dabhāsaḥ | acetasam | cit | citayanti | dakṣaiḥ || api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatantaḥ | tiraḥ | cit | aṁhaḥ | su-pathā | nayanti ||7.60.6||

IAST: api kratuṁ sucetasaṁ vatantas tiraś cid aṁhaḥ supathā nayanti
Griffith: And, wakening, moreover, thoughtful insight, lead it by easy paths o'er grief and trouble.
Devanāgarī: अपि क्रतुं सुचेतसं वतन्तस्तिरश्चिदंहः सुपथा नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | duḥ-dabhāsaḥ | acetasam | cit | citayanti | dakṣaiḥ || api | kratum | su-cetasam | vatantaḥ | tiraḥ | cit | aṁhaḥ | su-pathā | nayanti ||7.60.6||

IAST: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāś cikitvāṁso acetasaṁ nayanti
Griffith: They ever vigilant, with eyes that close not, caring for heaven and earth, lead on the thoughtless.
Devanāgarī: इमे दिवो अनिमिषा पृथिव्याश्चिकित्वांसो अचेतसं नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | divaḥ | ani-miṣā | pr̥thivyāḥ | cikitvāṁsaḥ | acetasam | nayanti || pra-vrāje | cit | nadyaḥ | gādham | asti | pāram | naḥ | asya | viṣpitasya | parṣan ||7.60.7||

IAST: pravrāje cin nadyo gādham asti pāraṁ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan
Griffith: Even in the river's bed there is a shallow. across this broad expanse may they conduct us.
Devanāgarī: प्रव्राजे चिन्नद्यो गाधमस्ति पारं नो अस्य विष्पितस्य पर्षन्
pada pāṭha: ime | divaḥ | ani-miṣā | pr̥thivyāḥ | cikitvāṁsaḥ | acetasam | nayanti || pra-vrāje | cit | nadyaḥ | gādham | asti | pāram | naḥ | asya | viṣpitasya | parṣan ||7.60.7||

IAST: yad gopāvad aditiḥ śarma bhadram mitro yacchanti varuṇaḥ sudāse
Griffith: When Aditi and Varuna and Mitra, like guardians, give Sudas their friendly shelter,
Devanāgarī: यद्गोपावददितिः शर्म भद्रं मित्रो यच्छन्ति वरुणः सुदासे
pada pāṭha: yat | gopāvat | aditiḥ | śarma | bhadram | mitraḥ | yacchanti | varuṇaḥ | su-dāse || tasmin | ā | tokam | tanayam | dadhānāḥ | mā | karma | deva-heḷanam | turāsaḥ ||7.60.8||

IAST: tasminn ā tokaṁ tanayaṁ dadhānā mā karma devaheḻanaṁ turāsaḥ
Griffith: Granting him sons and lineal succession, let us not, bold ones! move the Gods to anger.
Devanāgarī: तस्मिन्ना तोकं तनयं दधाना मा कर्म देवहेळनं तुरासः
pada pāṭha: yat | gopāvat | aditiḥ | śarma | bhadram | mitraḥ | yacchanti | varuṇaḥ | su-dāse || tasmin | ā | tokam | tanayam | dadhānāḥ | mā | karma | deva-heḷanam | turāsaḥ ||7.60.8||

IAST: ava vediṁ hotrābhir yajeta ripaḥ kāś cid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ
Griffith: May he with ofierings purify the altar from any stains of Varuna's reviler.
Devanāgarī: अव वेदिं होत्राभिर्यजेत रिपः काश्चिद्वरुणध्रुतः सः
pada pāṭha: ava | vedim | hotrābhiḥ | yajeta | ripaḥ | kāḥ | cit | varuṇa-dhrutaḥ | saḥ || pari | dveṣaḥ-bhiḥ | aryamā | vr̥ṇaktu | urum | su-dāse | vr̥ṣaṇau | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.60.9||

IAST: pari dveṣobhir aryamā vṛṇaktūruṁ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam
Griffith: Aryaman save us us all those who hate us: give room and freedom to Sudas, ye Mighty.
Devanāgarī: परि द्वेषोभिरर्यमा वृणक्तूरुं सुदासे वृषणा उ लोकम्
pada pāṭha: ava | vedim | hotrābhiḥ | yajeta | ripaḥ | kāḥ | cit | varuṇa-dhrutaḥ | saḥ || pari | dveṣaḥ-bhiḥ | aryamā | vr̥ṇaktu | urum | su-dāse | vr̥ṣaṇau | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.60.9||

IAST: sasvaś cid dhi samṛtis tveṣy eṣām apīcyena sahasā sahante
Griffith: Hid from our eyes is their resplendent meeting: by their mysterious might they hold dominion.
Devanāgarī: सस्वश्चिद्धि समृतिस्त्वेष्येषामपीच्येन सहसा सहन्ते
pada pāṭha: sasvariti | cit | hi | sam-r̥tiḥ | tveṣī | eṣām | apīcyena | sahasā | sahante || yuṣmat | bhiyā | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | rejamānāḥ | dakṣasya | cit | mahinā | mr̥ḷata | naḥ ||7.60.10||

IAST: yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḻatā naḥ
Griffith: Heroes! we cry trembling in fear before you, even in the greatness of your power have mercy.
Devanāgarī: युष्मद्भिया वृषणो रेजमाना दक्षस्य चिन्महिना मृळता नः
pada pāṭha: sasvariti | cit | hi | sam-r̥tiḥ | tveṣī | eṣām | apīcyena | sahasā | sahante || yuṣmat | bhiyā | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | rejamānāḥ | dakṣasya | cit | mahinā | mr̥ḷata | naḥ ||7.60.10||

IAST: yo brahmaṇe sumatim āyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ
Griffith: He who wins favour for his prayer by worship, that he may gain him strength and highest riches,
Devanāgarī: यो ब्रह्मणे सुमतिमायजाते वाजस्य सातौ परमस्य रायः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | brahmaṇe | su-matim | ā-yajāte | vājasya | sātau | paramasya | rāyaḥ || sīkṣanta | manyum | magha-vānaḥ | aryaḥ | uru | kṣayāya | cakrire | su-dhātu ||7.60.11||

IAST: sīkṣanta manyum maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu
Griffith: That good man's mind the Mighty Ones will follow: they have brought comfort to his spacious dwelling.
Devanāgarī: सीक्षन्त मन्युं मघवानो अर्य उरु क्षयाय चक्रिरे सुधातु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | brahmaṇe | su-matim | ā-yajāte | vājasya | sātau | paramasya | rāyaḥ || sīkṣanta | manyum | magha-vānaḥ | aryaḥ | uru | kṣayāya | cakrire | su-dhātu ||7.60.11||

IAST: iyaṁ deva purohitir yuvabhyāṁ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri
Griffith: This priestly task, Gods! Varuna and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि
pada pāṭha: iyam | devā | puraḥ-hitiḥ | yuva-bhyām | yajñeṣu | mitrāvaruṇau | akāri || viśvāni | duḥ-gā | pipr̥tam | tiraḥ | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.60.12||

IAST: viśvāni durgā pipṛtaṁ tiro no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि दुर्गा पिपृतं तिरो नो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | devā | puraḥ-hitiḥ | yuva-bhyām | yajñeṣu | mitrāvaruṇau | akāri || viśvāni | duḥ-gā | pipr̥tam | tiraḥ | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.60.12||

IAST: ud vāṁ cakṣur varuṇa supratīkaṁ devayor eti sūryas tatanvān
Griffith: O VARUNA and Mitra, Surya spreading the beauteous light of you Twain Gods ariseth.
Devanāgarī: उद्वां चक्षुर्वरुण सुप्रतीकं देवयोरेति सूर्यस्ततन्वान्
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | cakṣuḥ | varuṇā | su-pratīkam | devayoḥ | eti | sūryaḥ | tatanvān || abhi | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanāni | caṣṭe | saḥ | manyum | martyeṣu | ā | ciketa ||7.61.1||

IAST: abhi yo viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyum martyeṣv ā ciketa
Griffith: He who beholdetb all existing creatures observetb well the zeal that is in mortals.
Devanāgarī: अभि यो विश्वा भुवनानि चष्टे स मन्युं मर्त्येष्वा चिकेत
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | cakṣuḥ | varuṇā | su-pratīkam | devayoḥ | eti | sūryaḥ | tatanvān || abhi | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanāni | caṣṭe | saḥ | manyum | martyeṣu | ā | ciketa ||7.61.1||

IAST: pra vāṁ sa mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvā vipro manmāni dīrghaśrud iyarti
Griffith: The holy sage, renowned afar, directeth his hymns to you, O Varuna and Mitra,-
Devanāgarī: प्र वां स मित्रावरुणावृतावा विप्रो मन्मानि दीर्घश्रुदियर्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | saḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | r̥ta-vā | vipraḥ | manmāni | dīrgha-śrut | iyarti || yasya | brahmāṇi | sukratū iti su-kratū | avāthaḥ | ā | yat | kratvā | na | śaradaḥ | pr̥ṇaithe iti ||7.61.2||

IAST: yasya brahmāṇi sukratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe
Griffith: He whose devotions, sapient Gods, ye favour so that ye fill, as 'twere, with power his autumns.
Devanāgarī: यस्य ब्रह्माणि सुक्रतू अवाथ आ यत्क्रत्वा न शरदः पृणैथे
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | saḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | r̥ta-vā | vipraḥ | manmāni | dīrgha-śrut | iyarti || yasya | brahmāṇi | sukratū iti su-kratū | avāthaḥ | ā | yat | kratvā | na | śaradaḥ | pr̥ṇaithe iti ||7.61.2||

IAST: proror mitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra diva ṛṣvād bṛhataḥ sudānū
Griffith: From the wide earth, O Varuna and Mitra from the great lofty heaven, ye, Bounteous Givers, -
Devanāgarī: प्रोरोर्मित्रावरुणा पृथिव्याः प्र दिव ऋष्वाद्बृहतः सुदानू
pada pāṭha: pra | uroḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | pr̥thivyāḥ | pra | divaḥ | r̥ṣvāt | br̥hataḥ | sudānū iti su-dānū || spaśaḥ | dadhāthe iti | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu | r̥dhak | yataḥ | ani-miṣam | rakṣamāṇā ||7.61.3||

IAST: spaśo dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣv ṛdhag yato animiṣaṁ rakṣamāṇā
Griffith: Have in the fields and houses set your warder-, who visit every spot and watch unceasing.
Devanāgarī: स्पशो दधाथे ओषधीषु विक्ष्वृधग्यतो अनिमिषं रक्षमाणा
pada pāṭha: pra | uroḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | pr̥thivyāḥ | pra | divaḥ | r̥ṣvāt | br̥hataḥ | sudānū iti su-dānū || spaśaḥ | dadhāthe iti | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu | r̥dhak | yataḥ | ani-miṣam | rakṣamāṇā ||7.61.3||

IAST: śaṁsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmo rodasī badbadhe mahitvā
Griffith: I praise the strength of Varuna and Mitra that strength, by mightiness, keeps both worlds asunder.
Devanāgarī: शंसा मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धाम शुष्मो रोदसी बद्बधे महित्वा
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dhāma | śuṣmaḥ | rodasī iti | badbadhe | mahi-tvā || ayan | māsāḥ | ayajvanām | avīrāḥ | pra | yajña-manmā | vr̥janam | tirāte ||7.61.4||

IAST: ayan māsā ayajvanām avīrāḥ pra yajñamanmā vṛjanaṁ tirāte
Griffith: Heroless pass the months of the ungodly he who loves sacrifice makes his home enduring.
Devanāgarī: अयन्मासा अयज्वनामवीराः प्र यज्ञमन्मा वृजनं तिराते
pada pāṭha: śaṁsa | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dhāma | śuṣmaḥ | rodasī iti | badbadhe | mahi-tvā || ayan | māsāḥ | ayajvanām | avīrāḥ | pra | yajña-manmā | vr̥janam | tirāte ||7.61.4||

IAST: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇāv imā vāṁ na yāsu citraṁ dadṛśe na yakṣam
Griffith: Steers, all infallible are these your people in whom no wondrous thing is seen, no worship.
Devanāgarī: अमूरा विश्वा वृषणाविमा वां न यासु चित्रं ददृशे न यक्षम्
pada pāṭha: amūrā | viśvā | vr̥ṣaṇau | imāḥ | vām | na | yāsu | citram | dadr̥śe | na | yakṣam || druhaḥ | sacante | anr̥tā | janānām | na | vām | niṇyāni | acite | abhūvan ||7.61.5||

IAST: druhaḥ sacante anṛtā janānāṁ na vāṁ niṇyāny acite abhūvan
Griffith: Guile follows close the men who are untruthful: no secrets may be hidden from your knowledge.
Devanāgarī: द्रुहः सचन्ते अनृता जनानां न वां निण्यान्यचिते अभूवन्
pada pāṭha: amūrā | viśvā | vr̥ṣaṇau | imāḥ | vām | na | yāsu | citram | dadr̥śe | na | yakṣam || druhaḥ | sacante | anr̥tā | janānām | na | vām | niṇyāni | acite | abhūvan ||7.61.5||

IAST: sam u vāṁ yajñam mahayaṁ namobhir huve vām mitrāvaruṇā sabādhaḥ
Griffith: I will exalt your sacrifice with homage: as priest, I, Mitra-Varuna, invoke you.
Devanāgarī: समु वां यज्ञं महयं नमोभिर्हुवे वां मित्रावरुणा सबाधः
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | vām | yajñam | mahayam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | huve | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | sa-bādhaḥ || pra | vām | manmāni | r̥case | navāni | kr̥tāni | brahma | jujuṣan | imāni ||7.61.6||

IAST: pra vām manmāny ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣann imāni
Griffith: May these new hymns and prayers that I have fashioned delight you to the profit of the singer.
Devanāgarī: प्र वां मन्मान्यृचसे नवानि कृतानि ब्रह्म जुजुषन्निमानि
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | vām | yajñam | mahayam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | huve | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | sa-bādhaḥ || pra | vām | manmāni | r̥case | navāni | kr̥tāni | brahma | jujuṣan | imāni ||7.61.6||

IAST: iyaṁ deva purohitir yuvabhyāṁ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāv akāri
Griffith: This priestly task, Gods! Varuna and Mitra! hath been performed for you at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: इयं देव पुरोहितिर्युवभ्यां यज्ञेषु मित्रावरुणावकारि
pada pāṭha: iyam | devā | puraḥ-hitiḥ | yuva-bhyām | yajñeṣu | mitrāvaruṇau | akāri || viśvāni | duḥ-gā | pipr̥tam | tiraḥ | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.61.7||

IAST: viśvāni durgā pipṛtaṁ tiro no yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Convey us safely over every peril. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि दुर्गा पिपृतं तिरो नो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | devā | puraḥ-hitiḥ | yuva-bhyām | yajñeṣu | mitrāvaruṇau | akāri || viśvāni | duḥ-gā | pipr̥tam | tiraḥ | naḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.61.7||

IAST: ut sūryo bṛhad arcīṁṣy aśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: SURYA hath sent aloft his beams of splendour o'er all the tribes of men in countless places.
Devanāgarī: उत्सूर्यो बृहदर्चींष्यश्रेत्पुरु विश्वा जनिम मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: ut | sūryaḥ | br̥hat | arcīṁṣi | aśret | puru | viśvā | janima | mānuṣāṇām || samaḥ | divā | dadr̥śe | rocamānaḥ | kratvā | kr̥taḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | kartr̥-bhiḥ | bhūt ||7.62.1||

IAST: samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt
Griffith: Together with the heaven he shines apparent, formed by his Makers well with power and wisdom.
Devanāgarī: समो दिवा ददृशे रोचमानः क्रत्वा कृतः सुकृतः कर्तृभिर्भूत्
pada pāṭha: ut | sūryaḥ | br̥hat | arcīṁṣi | aśret | puru | viśvā | janima | mānuṣāṇām || samaḥ | divā | dadr̥śe | rocamānaḥ | kratvā | kr̥taḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | kartr̥-bhiḥ | bhūt ||7.62.1||

IAST: sa sūrya prati puro na ud gā ebhiḥ stomebhir etaśebhir evaiḥ
Griffith: So hast thou mounted up before us, Surya, through these our praises, with fleet dappled horses.
Devanāgarī: स सूर्य प्रति पुरो न उद्गा एभिः स्तोमेभिरेतशेभिरेवैः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sūrya | prati | puraḥ | naḥ | ut | gāḥ | ebhiḥ | stomebhiḥ | etaśebhiḥ | evaiḥ || pra | naḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vocaḥ | anāgasaḥ | aryamṇe | agnaye | ca ||7.62.2||

IAST: pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco 'nāgaso aryamṇe agnaye ca
Griffith: Declare us free from all offence to Mitra, and Varuna, and Aryaman, and Agni.
Devanāgarī: प्र नो मित्राय वरुणाय वोचोऽनागसो अर्यम्णे अग्नये च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sūrya | prati | puraḥ | naḥ | ut | gāḥ | ebhiḥ | stomebhiḥ | etaśebhiḥ | evaiḥ || pra | naḥ | mitrāya | varuṇāya | vocaḥ | anāgasaḥ | aryamṇe | agnaye | ca ||7.62.2||

IAST: vi naḥ sahasraṁ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ
Griffith: May holy Agni, Varuna, and Mitra send down their riches upon us in thousands.
Devanāgarī: वि नः सहस्रं शुरुधो रदन्त्वृतावानो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | sahasram | śurudhaḥ | radantu | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | ā | naḥ | kāmam | pūpurantu | stavānāḥ ||7.62.3||

IAST: yacchantu candrā upamaṁ no arkam ā naḥ kāmam pūpurantu stavānāḥ
