Griffith: May they, the Bright Ones, make our praise-song perfect, and, when we laud them, grant us all our wishes
Devanāgarī: यच्छन्तु चन्द्रा उपमं नो अर्कमा नः कामं पूपुरन्तु स्तवानाः
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | sahasram | śurudhaḥ | radantu | r̥ta-vānaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ || yacchantu | candrāḥ | upa-mam | naḥ | arkam | ā | naḥ | kāmam | pūpurantu | stavānāḥ ||7.62.3||

IAST: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṁ no ye vāṁ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve
Griffith: O undivided Heaven and Earth, preserve us, us, Lofty Ones! your nobIy-born descendants.
Devanāgarī: द्यावाभूमी अदिते त्रासीथां नो ये वां जज्ञुः सुजनिमान ऋष्वे
pada pāṭha: dyāvābhūmī iti | adite | trāsīthām | naḥ | ye | vām | jajñuḥ | su-janimānaḥ | r̥ṣve iti || mā | heḷe | bhūma | varuṇasya | vāyoḥ | mā | mitrasya | priya-tamasya | nr̥ṇām ||7.62.4||

IAST: mā heḻe bhūma varuṇasya vāyor mā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām
Griffith: Let us not anger Varuna, nor Vayu, nor him, the dearest Friend of mortals, Mitra.
Devanāgarī: मा हेळे भूम वरुणस्य वायोर्मा मित्रस्य प्रियतमस्य नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: dyāvābhūmī iti | adite | trāsīthām | naḥ | ye | vām | jajñuḥ | su-janimānaḥ | r̥ṣve iti || mā | heḷe | bhūma | varuṇasya | vāyoḥ | mā | mitrasya | priya-tamasya | nr̥ṇām ||7.62.4||

IAST: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṁ jīvase na ā no gavyūtim ukṣataṁ ghṛtena
Griffith: Stretch forth your arms and let our lives be lengthened: with fatness dew the pastures of our cattle.
Devanāgarī: प्र बाहवा सिसृतं जीवसे न आ नो गव्यूतिमुक्षतं घृतेन
pada pāṭha: pra | bāhavā | sisr̥tam | jīvase | naḥ | ā | naḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam | ghr̥tena || ā | naḥ | jane | śravayatam | yuvānā | śrutam | me | mitrāvaruṇā | havā | imā ||7.62.5||

IAST: ā no jane śravayataṁ yuvānā śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havemā
Griffith: Ye Youthful, make us famed among the people: hear, Mitra-Varuna, these mine invocations.
Devanāgarī: आ नो जने श्रवयतं युवाना श्रुतं मे मित्रावरुणा हवेमा
pada pāṭha: pra | bāhavā | sisr̥tam | jīvase | naḥ | ā | naḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam | ghr̥tena || ā | naḥ | jane | śravayatam | yuvānā | śrutam | me | mitrāvaruṇā | havā | imā ||7.62.5||

IAST: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nas tmane tokāya varivo dadhantu
Griffith: Now Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children.
Devanāgarī: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा नस्त्मने तोकाय वरिवो दधन्तु
pada pāṭha: nu | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | naḥ | tmane | tokāya | varivaḥ | dadhantu || su-gā | naḥ | viśvā | su-pathāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.62.6||

IAST: sugā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सुगा नो विश्वा सुपथानि सन्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | naḥ | tmane | tokāya | varivaḥ | dadhantu || su-gā | naḥ | viśvā | su-pathāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.62.6||

IAST: ud v eti subhago viśvacakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryo mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: COMMON to all mankind, auspicious Surya, he who beholdeth all, is mounting upward;
Devanāgarī: उद्वेति सुभगो विश्वचक्षाः साधारणः सूर्यो मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | eti | su-bhagaḥ | viśva-cakṣāḥ | sādhāraṇaḥ | sūryaḥ | mānuṣāṇām || cakṣuḥ | mitrasya | varuṇasya | devaḥ | carma-iva | yaḥ | sam-avivyak | tamāṁsi ||7.63.1||

IAST: cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasya devaś carmeva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṁsi
Griffith: The God, the eye of Varuna and Mitra, who rolled up darkness like a piece of leather.
Devanāgarī: चक्षुर्मित्रस्य वरुणस्य देवश्चर्मेव यः समविव्यक्तमांसि
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | eti | su-bhagaḥ | viśva-cakṣāḥ | sādhāraṇaḥ | sūryaḥ | mānuṣāṇām || cakṣuḥ | mitrasya | varuṇasya | devaḥ | carma-iva | yaḥ | sam-avivyak | tamāṁsi ||7.63.1||

IAST: ud v eti prasavītā janānām mahān ketur arṇavaḥ sūryasya
Griffith: Surya's great ensign, restless as the billow, that urgeth men to action, is advancing:
Devanāgarī: उद्वेति प्रसवीता जनानां महान्केतुरर्णवः सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | eti | pra-savitā | janānām | mahān | ketuḥ | arṇavaḥ | sūryasya || samānam | cakram | pari-āvivr̥tsan | yat | etaśaḥ | vahati | dhūḥ-su | yuktaḥ ||7.63.2||

IAST: samānaṁ cakram paryāvivṛtsan yad etaśo vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ
Griffith: Onward he still would roll the wheel well-rounded, which Etasa, harnessed to the car-pole, moveth.
Devanāgarī: समानं चक्रं पर्याविवृत्सन्यदेतशो वहति धूर्षु युक्तः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | eti | pra-savitā | janānām | mahān | ketuḥ | arṇavaḥ | sūryasya || samānam | cakram | pari-āvivr̥tsan | yat | etaśaḥ | vahati | dhūḥ-su | yuktaḥ ||7.63.2||

IAST: vibhrājamāna uṣasām upasthād rebhair ud ety anumadyamānaḥ
Griffith: Refulgent from the bosom of the Mornings, he in Whom singers take delight ascendeth.
Devanāgarī: विभ्राजमान उषसामुपस्थाद्रेभैरुदेत्यनुमद्यमानः
pada pāṭha: vi-bhrājamānaḥ | uṣasām | upa-sthāt | rebhaiḥ | ut | eti | anu-madyamānaḥ || eṣaḥ | me | devaḥ | savitā | cacchanda | yaḥ | samānam | na | pra-mināti | dhāma ||7.63.3||

IAST: eṣa me devaḥ savitā cacchanda yaḥ samānaṁ na pramināti dhāma
Griffith: This Savitar, God, is my chief joy and pleasure, who breaketh not the universal statute.
Devanāgarī: एष मे देवः सविता चच्छन्द यः समानं न प्रमिनाति धाम
pada pāṭha: vi-bhrājamānaḥ | uṣasām | upa-sthāt | rebhaiḥ | ut | eti | anu-madyamānaḥ || eṣaḥ | me | devaḥ | savitā | cacchanda | yaḥ | samānam | na | pra-mināti | dhāma ||7.63.3||

IAST: divo rukma urucakṣā ud eti dūrearthas taraṇir bhrājamānaḥ
Griffith: Golden, far-seeing, from the heaven he riseth: far is his goal, he hasteth on resplendent.
Devanāgarī: दिवो रुक्म उरुचक्षा उदेति दूरेअर्थस्तरणिर्भ्राजमानः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | rukmaḥ | uru-cakṣāḥ | ut | eti | dūre-arthaḥ | taraṇiḥ | bhrājamānaḥ || nūnam | janāḥ | sūryeṇa | pra-sūtāḥ | ayan | arthāni | kr̥ṇavan | apāṁsi ||7.63.4||

IAST: nūnaṁ janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtā ayann arthāni kṛṇavann apāṁsi
Griffith: Men, verily, inspirited by Surya speed to their aims and do the work assigned them.
Devanāgarī: नूनं जनाः सूर्येण प्रसूता अयन्नर्थानि कृणवन्नपांसि
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | rukmaḥ | uru-cakṣāḥ | ut | eti | dūre-arthaḥ | taraṇiḥ | bhrājamānaḥ || nūnam | janāḥ | sūryeṇa | pra-sūtāḥ | ayan | arthāni | kr̥ṇavan | apāṁsi ||7.63.4||

IAST: yatrā cakrur amṛtā gātum asmai śyeno na dīyann anv eti pāthaḥ
Griffith: Where the irrunortals have prepared his pathway he flieth through the region like a falcon.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा चक्रुरमृता गातुमस्मै श्येनो न दीयन्नन्वेति पाथः
pada pāṭha: yatra | cakruḥ | amr̥tāḥ | gātum | asmai | śyenaḥ | na | dīyan | anu | eti | pāthaḥ || prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | vidhema | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | uta | havyaiḥ ||7.63.5||

IAST: prati vāṁ sūra udite vidhema namobhir mitrāvaruṇota havyaiḥ
Griffith: With homage and oblations will we serve you, O Mitra-Varuna, when the Sun hath risen.
Devanāgarī: प्रति वां सूर उदिते विधेम नमोभिर्मित्रावरुणोत हव्यैः
pada pāṭha: yatra | cakruḥ | amr̥tāḥ | gātum | asmai | śyenaḥ | na | dīyan | anu | eti | pāthaḥ || prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | vidhema | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | uta | havyaiḥ ||7.63.5||

IAST: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nas tmane tokāya varivo dadhantu
Griffith: Now Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman vouchsafe us freedom and room, for us and for our children.
Devanāgarī: नू मित्रो वरुणो अर्यमा नस्त्मने तोकाय वरिवो दधन्तु
pada pāṭha: nu | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | naḥ | tmane | tokāya | varivaḥ | dadhantu || su-gā | naḥ | viśvā | su-pathāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.63.6||

IAST: sugā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May we find paths all fair and good to travel. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सुगा नो विश्वा सुपथानि सन्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | aryamā | naḥ | tmane | tokāya | varivaḥ | dadhantu || su-gā | naḥ | viśvā | su-pathāni | santu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.63.6||

IAST: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyām pra vāṁ ghṛtasya nirṇijo dadīran
Griffith: YE Twain who rule, in heaven and earth, the region, clothed be your clouds in robes of oil and fatness.
Devanāgarī: दिवि क्षयन्ता रजसः पृथिव्यां प्र वां घृतस्य निर्णिजो ददीरन्
pada pāṭha: divi | kṣayantā | rajasaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pra | vām | ghr̥tasya | niḥ-nijaḥ | dadīran || havyam | naḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | su-jātaḥ | rājā | su-kṣatraḥ | varuṇaḥ | juṣanta ||7.64.1||

IAST: havyaṁ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta
Griffith: May the imperial Varuna, and Mitra, and high-born Aryaman accept our presents.
Devanāgarī: हव्यं नो मित्रो अर्यमा सुजातो राजा सुक्षत्रो वरुणो जुषन्त
pada pāṭha: divi | kṣayantā | rajasaḥ | pr̥thivyām | pra | vām | ghr̥tasya | niḥ-nijaḥ | dadīran || havyam | naḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | su-jātaḥ | rājā | su-kṣatraḥ | varuṇaḥ | juṣanta ||7.64.1||

IAST: ā rājānā maha ṛtasya gopā sindhupatī kṣatriyā yātam arvāk
Griffith: Kings, guards of rrtighty everlasting Order, come hitherward, ye Princes, Lords of Rivers.
Devanāgarī: आ राजाना मह ऋतस्य गोपा सिन्धुपती क्षत्रिया यातमर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ā | rājānā | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopā | sindhupatī iti sindhu-patī | kṣatriyā | yātam | arvāk || iḷām | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | uta | vr̥ṣṭim | ava | divaḥ | invatam | jīradānū iti jīra-dānū ||7.64.2||

IAST: iḻāṁ no mitrāvaruṇota vṛṣṭim ava diva invataṁ jīradānū
Griffith: Send us from heaven, O Varuna and Mitra, rain and sweet food, ye who pour down your bounties.
Devanāgarī: इळां नो मित्रावरुणोत वृष्टिमव दिव इन्वतं जीरदानू
pada pāṭha: ā | rājānā | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopā | sindhupatī iti sindhu-patī | kṣatriyā | yātam | arvāk || iḷām | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | uta | vr̥ṣṭim | ava | divaḥ | invatam | jīradānū iti jīra-dānū ||7.64.2||

IAST: mitras tan no varuṇo devo aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhir nayantu
Griffith: May the dear God, and Varuna and Mitra conduct us by the most effective pathways,
Devanāgarī: मित्रस्तन्नो वरुणो देवो अर्यः प्र साधिष्ठेभिः पथिभिर्नयन्तु
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | devaḥ | aryaḥ | pra | sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | nayantu || bravat | yathā | naḥ | āt | ariḥ | su-dāse | iṣā | madema | saha | deva-gopāḥ ||7.64.3||

IAST: bravad yathā na ād ariḥ sudāsa iṣā madema saha devagopāḥ
Griffith: That foes may say unto Sudas our chieftain, May, we, too, joy in food with Gods to guard us.
Devanāgarī: ब्रवद्यथा न आदरिः सुदास इषा मदेम सह देवगोपाः
pada pāṭha: mitraḥ | tat | naḥ | varuṇaḥ | devaḥ | aryaḥ | pra | sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | nayantu || bravat | yathā | naḥ | āt | ariḥ | su-dāse | iṣā | madema | saha | deva-gopāḥ ||7.64.3||

IAST: yo vāṁ gartam manasā takṣad etam ūrdhvāṁ dhītiṁ kṛṇavad dhārayac ca
Griffith: Him who hath wrought for you this car in spirit, who makes the song rise upward and sustains it,
Devanāgarī: यो वां गर्तं मनसा तक्षदेतमूर्ध्वां धीतिं कृणवद्धारयच्च
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | gartam | manasā | takṣat | etam | ūrdhvām | dhītim | kr̥ṇavat | dhārayat | ca || ukṣethām | mitrāvaruṇā | ghr̥tena | tā | rājānā | su-kṣitīḥ | tarpayethām ||7.64.4||

IAST: ukṣethām mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tā rājānā sukṣitīs tarpayethām
Griffith: Bedew with fatness, Varuna nd Mitra ye Kings, make glad the pleasant dwelling-places.
Devanāgarī: उक्षेथां मित्रावरुणा घृतेन ता राजाना सुक्षितीस्तर्पयेथाम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | gartam | manasā | takṣat | etam | ūrdhvām | dhītim | kr̥ṇavat | dhārayat | ca || ukṣethām | mitrāvaruṇā | ghr̥tena | tā | rājānā | su-kṣitīḥ | tarpayethām ||7.64.4||

IAST: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṁ somaḥ śukro na vāyave 'yāmi
Griffith: To you this laud, O Varuna and Mitra is offered like bright Soma juice to Vayu.
Devanāgarī: एष स्तोमो वरुण मित्र तुभ्यं सोमः शुक्रो न वायवेऽयामि
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | tubhyam | somaḥ | śukraḥ | na | vāyave | ayāmi || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.64.5||

IAST: aviṣṭaṁ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṁdhīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टं धियो जिगृतं पुरंधीर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | tubhyam | somaḥ | śukraḥ | na | vāyave | ayāmi || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.64.5||

IAST: prati vāṁ sūra udite sūktair mitraṁ huve varuṇam pūtadakṣam
Griffith: WITH hymns I call you, when the Sun hath risen, Mitra, and Varuna whose thoughts are holy,
Devanāgarī: प्रति वां सूर उदिते सूक्तैर्मित्रं हुवे वरुणं पूतदक्षम्
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | su-uktaiḥ | mitram | huve | varuṇam | pūta-dakṣam || yayoḥ | asuryam | akṣitam | jyeṣṭham | viśvasya | yāman | ā-citā | jigatnu ||7.65.1||

IAST: yayor asuryam akṣitaṁ jyeṣṭhaṁ viśvasya yāmann ācitā jigatnu
Griffith: Whose Power Divine, supreme and everlasting, comes with good heed at each man's supplication.
Devanāgarī: ययोरसुर्यमक्षितं ज्येष्ठं विश्वस्य यामन्नाचिता जिगत्नु
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | su-uktaiḥ | mitram | huve | varuṇam | pūta-dakṣam || yayoḥ | asuryam | akṣitam | jyeṣṭham | viśvasya | yāman | ā-citā | jigatnu ||7.65.1||

IAST: tā hi devānām asurā tāv aryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatam ūrjayantīḥ
Griffith: For they are Asuras of Gods, the friendly make, both of you, our lands exceeding fruitful.
Devanāgarī: ता हि देवानामसुरा तावर्या ता नः क्षितीः करतमूर्जयन्तीः
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | devānām | asurā | tau | aryā | tā | naḥ | kṣitīḥ | karatam | ūrjayantīḥ || aśyāma | mitrāvaruṇā | vayam | vām | dyāvā | ca | yatra | pīpayan | ahā | ca ||7.65.2||

IAST: aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayaṁ vāṁ dyāvā ca yatra pīpayann ahā ca
Griffith: May we obtain you, Varuna and Mitra, wherever Heaven and Earth and days may bless us.
Devanāgarī: अश्याम मित्रावरुणा वयं वां द्यावा च यत्र पीपयन्नहा च
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | devānām | asurā | tau | aryā | tā | naḥ | kṣitīḥ | karatam | ūrjayantīḥ || aśyāma | mitrāvaruṇā | vayam | vām | dyāvā | ca | yatra | pīpayan | ahā | ca ||7.65.2||

IAST: tā bhūripāśāv anṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya
Griffith: Bonds of the sinner, they bear many nooses: the wicked mortal hardly may escape them.
Devanāgarī: ता भूरिपाशावनृतस्य सेतू दुरत्येतू रिपवे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: tā | bhūri-pāśau | anr̥tasya | setū iti | duratyetū iti duḥ-atyetū | ripave | martyāya || r̥tasya | mitrāvaruṇā | pathā | vām | apaḥ | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | tarema ||7.65.3||

IAST: ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vām apo na nāvā duritā tarema
Griffith: Varuna-Mitra, may your path of Order bear us o'er trouble as a boat o'er waters.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य मित्रावरुणा पथा वामपो न नावा दुरिता तरेम
pada pāṭha: tā | bhūri-pāśau | anr̥tasya | setū iti | duratyetū iti duḥ-atyetū | ripave | martyāya || r̥tasya | mitrāvaruṇā | pathā | vām | apaḥ | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | tarema ||7.65.3||

IAST: ā no mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṁ ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam iḻābhiḥ
Griffith: Come, taste our offering, Varuna and Mitra: bedew our pasture wil sweet food and fatness.
Devanāgarī: आ नो मित्रावरुणा हव्यजुष्टिं घृतैर्गव्यूतिमुक्षतमिळाभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | havya-juṣṭim | ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam | iḷābhiḥ || prati | vām | atra | varam | ā | janāya | pr̥ṇītam | udnaḥ | divyasya | cāroḥ ||7.65.4||

IAST: prati vām atra varam ā janāya pṛṇītam udno divyasya cāroḥ
Griffith: Pour down in plenty here upon the people the choicest of your fair celestial water.
Devanāgarī: प्रति वामत्र वरमा जनाय पृणीतमुद्नो दिव्यस्य चारोः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | havya-juṣṭim | ghr̥taiḥ | gavyūtim | ukṣatam | iḷābhiḥ || prati | vām | atra | varam | ā | janāya | pr̥ṇītam | udnaḥ | divyasya | cāroḥ ||7.65.4||

IAST: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṁ somaḥ śukro na vāyave 'yāmi
Griffith: To you this laud, O Varuna and Mitra, is offered, like bright Soma juice to Vayu.
Devanāgarī: एष स्तोमो वरुण मित्र तुभ्यं सोमः शुक्रो न वायवेऽयामि
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | tubhyam | somaḥ | śukraḥ | na | vāyave | ayāmi || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.65.5||

IAST: aviṣṭaṁ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṁdhīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Favour our songs of praise, wake thought and spirit. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टं धियो जिगृतं पुरंधीर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | stomaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | tubhyam | somaḥ | śukraḥ | na | vāyave | ayāmi || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.65.5||

IAST: pra mitrayor varuṇayoḥ stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ
Griffith: LET our strong hymn of praise go forth, the laud of Mitra-Varuna,
Devanāgarī: प्र मित्रयोर्वरुणयोः स्तोमो न एतु शूष्यः
pada pāṭha: pra | mitrayoḥ | varuṇayoḥ | stomaḥ | naḥ | etu | śūṣyaḥ || namasvān | tuvi-jātayoḥ ||7.66.1||

IAST: namasvān tuvijātayoḥ
Griffith: With homage to that high-born Pair;
Devanāgarī: नमस्वान्तुविजातयोः
pada pāṭha: pra | mitrayoḥ | varuṇayoḥ | stomaḥ | naḥ | etu | śūṣyaḥ || namasvān | tuvi-jātayoḥ ||7.66.1||

IAST: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā
Griffith: The Two exceeding wise, the Sons of Daksa, whom the gods ordained
Devanāgarī: या धारयन्त देवाः सुदक्षा दक्षपितरा
pada pāṭha: yā | dhārayanta | devāḥ | su-dakṣā | dakṣa-pitarā || asuryāya | pra-mahasā ||7.66.2||

IAST: asuryāya pramahasā
Griffith: For lordship, excellently great.
Devanāgarī: असुर्याय प्रमहसा
pada pāṭha: yā | dhārayanta | devāḥ | su-dakṣā | dakṣa-pitarā || asuryāya | pra-mahasā ||7.66.2||

IAST: tā naḥ stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām
Griffith: Such, Guardians of our homes and us, O Mitra-Varuna, fulfil
Devanāgarī: ता नः स्तिपा तनूपा वरुण जरितॄणाम्
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | sti-pā | tanū-pā | varuṇa | jaritr̥̄ṇām || mitra | sādhayatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.66.3||

IAST: mitra sādhayataṁ dhiyaḥ
Griffith: The thoughts of those who sing your praise.
Devanāgarī: मित्र साधयतं धियः
pada pāṭha: tā | naḥ | sti-pā | tanū-pā | varuṇa | jaritr̥̄ṇām || mitra | sādhayatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.66.3||

IAST: yad adya sūra udite 'nāgā mitro aryamā
Griffith: So when the Sun hath risen to-day, may sinless Mitra, Aryaman,
Devanāgarī: यदद्य सूर उदितेऽनागा मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūre | ut-ite | anāgāḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || suvāti | savitā | bhagaḥ ||7.66.4||

IAST: suvāti savitā bhagaḥ
Griffith: Bhaga, and Savitar sendus forth.
Devanāgarī: सुवाति सविता भगः
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | sūre | ut-ite | anāgāḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || suvāti | savitā | bhagaḥ ||7.66.4||

IAST: suprāvīr astu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ
Griffith: May this our home be guarded well forward, ye Bounteous, on the way,
Devanāgarī: सुप्रावीरस्तु स क्षयः प्र नु यामन्सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: supra-avīḥ | astu | saḥ | kṣayaḥ | pra | nu | yāman | su-dānavaḥ || ye | naḥ | aṁhaḥ | ati-piprati ||7.66.5||

IAST: ye no aṁho 'tipiprati
Griffith: Who bear us safely o'er distress.
Devanāgarī: ये नो अंहोऽतिपिप्रति
pada pāṭha: supra-avīḥ | astu | saḥ | kṣayaḥ | pra | nu | yāman | su-dānavaḥ || ye | naḥ | aṁhaḥ | ati-piprati ||7.66.5||

IAST: uta svarājo aditir adabdhasya vratasya ye
Griffith: And those Self-reigning, Aditi, whose statute is inviolate,
Devanāgarī: उत स्वराजो अदितिरदब्धस्य व्रतस्य ये
pada pāṭha: uta | sva-rājaḥ | aditiḥ | adabdhasya | vratasya | ye || mahaḥ | rājānaḥ | īśate ||7.66.6||

IAST: maho rājāna īśate
Griffith: The Kings who rule a vast domain.
Devanāgarī: महो राजान ईशते
pada pāṭha: uta | sva-rājaḥ | aditiḥ | adabdhasya | vratasya | ye || mahaḥ | rājānaḥ | īśate ||7.66.6||

IAST: prati vāṁ sūra udite mitraṁ gṛṇīṣe varuṇam
Griffith: Soon as the Sun hath risen, to you, to Mitra-Varuna, I sing,
Devanāgarī: प्रति वां सूर उदिते मित्रं गृणीषे वरुणम्
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | mitram | gr̥ṇīṣe | varuṇam || aryamaṇam | riśādasam ||7.66.7||

IAST: aryamaṇaṁ riśādasam
Griffith: And Aryaman who slays the foe.
Devanāgarī: अर्यमणं रिशादसम्
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | sūre | ut-ite | mitram | gr̥ṇīṣe | varuṇam || aryamaṇam | riśādasam ||7.66.7||

IAST: rāyā hiraṇyayā matir iyam avṛkāya śavase
Griffith: With wealth of gold may this my song bring unmolested power and might,
Devanāgarī: राया हिरण्यया मतिरियमवृकाय शवसे
pada pāṭha: rāyā | hiraṇya-yā | matiḥ | iyam | avr̥kāya | śavase || iyam | viprā | medha-sātaye ||7.66.8||

IAST: iyaṁ viprā medhasātaye
Griffith: And, Brahmans, gain the sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: इयं विप्रा मेधसातये
pada pāṭha: rāyā | hiraṇya-yā | matiḥ | iyam | avr̥kāya | śavase || iyam | viprā | medha-sātaye ||7.66.8||

IAST: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha
Griffith: May we be thine, God Varuna, and with our princes, Mitra, thine.
Devanāgarī: ते स्याम देव वरुण ते मित्र सूरिभिः सह
pada pāṭha: te | syāma | deva | varuṇa | te | mitra | sūri-bhiḥ | saha || iṣam | svariti svaḥ | ca | dhīmahi ||7.66.9||

IAST: iṣaṁ svaś ca dhīmahi
Griffith: Food and Heaven's light will we obtain.
Devanāgarī: इषं स्वश्च धीमहि
pada pāṭha: te | syāma | deva | varuṇa | te | mitra | sūri-bhiḥ | saha || iṣam | svariti svaḥ | ca | dhīmahi ||7.66.9||

IAST: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso 'gnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Many are they who strengthen Law, Sun-eyed, with Agni for their tongue,
Devanāgarī: बहवः सूरचक्षसोऽग्निजिह्वा ऋतावृधः
pada pāṭha: bahavaḥ | sūra-cakṣasaḥ | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || trīṇi | ye | yemuḥ | vidathāni | dhīti-bhiḥ | viśvāni | paribhūti-bhiḥ ||7.66.10||

IAST: trīṇi ye yemur vidathāni dhītibhir viśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ
Griffith: They who direct the three great gatherings with their thoughts, yea, all things with surpassing might.
Devanāgarī: त्रीणि ये येमुर्विदथानि धीतिभिर्विश्वानि परिभूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: bahavaḥ | sūra-cakṣasaḥ | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ || trīṇi | ye | yemuḥ | vidathāni | dhīti-bhiḥ | viśvāni | paribhūti-bhiḥ ||7.66.10||

IAST: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradam māsam ād ahar yajñam aktuṁ cād ṛcam
Griffith: They who have stablished year and month and then the day, night, sacrifice and holy verse,
Devanāgarī: वि ये दधुः शरदं मासमादहर्यज्ञमक्तुं चादृचम्
pada pāṭha: vi | ye | dadhuḥ | śaradam | māsam | āt | ahaḥ | yajñam | aktum | ca | āt | r̥cam || anāpyam | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | kṣatram | rājānaḥ | āśata ||7.66.11||

IAST: anāpyaṁ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṁ rājāna āśata
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the Kings, have won dominion which none else may gain.
Devanāgarī: अनाप्यं वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा क्षत्रं राजान आशत
pada pāṭha: vi | ye | dadhuḥ | śaradam | māsam | āt | ahaḥ | yajñam | aktum | ca | āt | r̥cam || anāpyam | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | kṣatram | rājānaḥ | āśata ||7.66.11||

IAST: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite
Griffith: So at the rising of the Sun we think of you with hymns to-day,
Devanāgarī: तद्वो अद्य मनामहे सूक्तैः सूर उदिते
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | adya | manāmahe | su-uktaiḥ | sūre | ut-ite || yat | ohate | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | yūyam | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||7.66.12||

IAST: yad ohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ
Griffith: Even as Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman deserve: ye are the charioteers of Law.
Devanāgarī: यदोहते वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा यूयमृतस्य रथ्यः
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | adya | manāmahe | su-uktaiḥ | sūre | ut-ite || yat | ohate | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | yūyam | r̥tasya | rathyaḥ ||7.66.12||

IAST: ṛtāvāna ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdho ghorāso anṛtadviṣaḥ
Griffith: True to Law, born in Law the strengtheners of Law, terrible, haters of the false,
Devanāgarī: ऋतावान ऋतजाता ऋतावृधो घोरासो अनृतद्विषः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānaḥ | r̥ta-jātāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | ghorāsaḥ | anr̥ta-dviṣaḥ || teṣām | vaḥ | sumne | succhardiḥ-tame | naraḥ | syāma | ye | ca | sūrayaḥ ||7.66.13||

IAST: teṣāṁ vaḥ sumne succhardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ
Griffith: In their felicity which gives the best defence may we men and our princes dwell.
Devanāgarī: तेषां वः सुम्ने सुच्छर्दिष्टमे नरः स्याम ये च सूरयः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānaḥ | r̥ta-jātāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | ghorāsaḥ | anr̥ta-dviṣaḥ || teṣām | vaḥ | sumne | succhardiḥ-tame | naraḥ | syāma | ye | ca | sūrayaḥ ||7.66.13||

IAST: ud u tyad darśataṁ vapur diva eti pratihvare
Griffith: Uprises, on the slope of heaven, that marvel that attracts die sight
Devanāgarī: उदु त्यद्दर्शतं वपुर्दिव एति प्रतिह्वरे
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tyat | darśatam | vapuḥ | divaḥ | eti | prati-hvare || yat | īm | āśuḥ | vahati | devaḥ | etaśaḥ | viśvasmai | cakṣase | aram ||7.66.14||

IAST: yad īm āśur vahati deva etaśo viśvasmai cakṣase aram
Griffith: As swift celestial Etasa bears it away, prepared for every eye to see.
Devanāgarī: यदीमाशुर्वहति देव एतशो विश्वस्मै चक्षसे अरम्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tyat | darśatam | vapuḥ | divaḥ | eti | prati-hvare || yat | īm | āśuḥ | vahati | devaḥ | etaśaḥ | viśvasmai | cakṣase | aram ||7.66.14||

IAST: śīrṣṇaḥ-śīrṣṇo jagatas tasthuṣas patiṁ samayā viśvam ā rajaḥ
Griffith: Lord of each single head, of fixt and moving things, equally through the whole expanse,
Devanāgarī: शीर्ष्णःशीर्ष्णो जगतस्तस्थुषस्पतिं समया विश्वमा रजः
pada pāṭha: śīrṣṇaḥ-śīrṣṇaḥ | jagataḥ | tasthuṣaḥ | patim | samayā | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ || sapta | svasāraḥ | suvitāya | sūryam | vahanti | haritaḥ | rathe ||7.66.15||

IAST: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryaṁ vahanti harito rathe
Griffith: The Seven sister Bays bear Surya on his car, to bring us wealth and happiness.
Devanāgarī: सप्त स्वसारः सुविताय सूर्यं वहन्ति हरितो रथे
pada pāṭha: śīrṣṇaḥ-śīrṣṇaḥ | jagataḥ | tasthuṣaḥ | patim | samayā | viśvam | ā | rajaḥ || sapta | svasāraḥ | suvitāya | sūryam | vahanti | haritaḥ | rathe ||7.66.15||

IAST: tac cakṣur devahitaṁ śukram uccarat
Griffith: A hundred autumns may we see that bright Eye, God-ordained, arise
Devanāgarī: तच्चक्षुर्देवहितं शुक्रमुच्चरत्
pada pāṭha: tat | cakṣuḥ | deva-hitam | śukram | ut-carat || paśyema | śaradaḥ | śatam | jīvema | śaradaḥ | śatam ||7.66.16||

IAST: paśyema śaradaḥ śataṁ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
Griffith: A hundred autumns may we live.
Devanāgarī: पश्येम शरदः शतं जीवेम शरदः शतम्
pada pāṭha: tat | cakṣuḥ | deva-hitam | śukram | ut-carat || paśyema | śaradaḥ | śatam | jīvema | śaradaḥ | śatam ||7.66.16||

IAST: kāvyebhir adābhyā yātaṁ varuṇa dyumat
Griffith: Infallible through your wisdom, come hither, resplendent Varuna,
Devanāgarī: काव्येभिरदाभ्या यातं वरुण द्युमत्
pada pāṭha: kāvyebhiḥ | adābhyā | ā | yātam | varuṇa | dyu-mat || mitraḥ | ca | soma-pītaye ||7.66.17||

IAST: mitraś ca somapītaye
Griffith: And Mitra, to the Soma draught.
Devanāgarī: मित्रश्च सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: kāvyebhiḥ | adābhyā | ā | yātam | varuṇa | dyu-mat || mitraḥ | ca | soma-pītaye ||7.66.17||

IAST: divo dhāmabhir varuṇa mitraś cā yātam adruhā
Griffith: Come as the laws of Heaven ordain, Varuna, Mitra, void of guile:
Devanāgarī: दिवो धामभिर्वरुण मित्रश्चा यातमद्रुहा
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | dhāma-bhiḥ | varuṇa | mitraḥ | ca | ā | yātam | adruhā || pibatam | somam | ātujī ityā-tujī ||7.66.18||

IAST: pibataṁ somam ātujī
Griffith: Press near and drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: पिबतं सोममातुजी
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | dhāma-bhiḥ | varuṇa | mitraḥ | ca | ā | yātam | adruhā || pibatam | somam | ātujī ityā-tujī ||7.66.18||

IAST: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇāv āhutiṁ narā
Griffith: Come, Mitra, Varuna, accept, Heroes, our sacrificial gift:
Devanāgarī: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा जुषाणावाहुतिं नरा
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | mitrāvaruṇā | juṣāṇau | ā-hutim | narā || pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||7.66.19||

IAST: pātaṁ somam ṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: Drink Soma, ye who strengthen Law.
Devanāgarī: पातं सोममृतावृधा
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | mitrāvaruṇā | juṣāṇau | ā-hutim | narā || pātam | somam | r̥ta-vr̥dhā ||7.66.19||

IAST: prati vāṁ rathaṁ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena
Griffith: I WITH a holy heart that brings oblation will sing forth praise to meet your car, ye Princes,
Devanāgarī: प्रति वां रथं नृपती जरध्यै हविष्मता मनसा यज्ञियेन
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | ratham | nr̥patī iti nr̥-patī | jaradhyai | haviṣmatā | manasā | yajñiyena || yaḥ | vām | dūtaḥ | na | dhiṣṇyau | ajīgaḥ | accha | sūnuḥ | na | pitarā | vivakmi ||7.67.1||

IAST: yo vāṁ dūto na dhiṣṇyāv ajīgar acchā sūnur na pitarā vivakmi
Griffith: Which, Much-desired! hath wakened as your envoy. I call you hither as a son his parents.
Devanāgarī: यो वां दूतो न धिष्ण्यावजीगरच्छा सूनुर्न पितरा विवक्मि
pada pāṭha: prati | vām | ratham | nr̥patī iti nr̥-patī | jaradhyai | haviṣmatā | manasā | yajñiyena || yaḥ | vām | dūtaḥ | na | dhiṣṇyau | ajīgaḥ | accha | sūnuḥ | na | pitarā | vivakmi ||7.67.1||

IAST: aśocy agniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaś cid antāḥ
Griffith: Brightly hath Agni shone by us enkindled: the limits even of darkness were apparent.
Devanāgarī: अशोच्यग्निः समिधानो अस्मे उपो अदृश्रन्तमसश्चिदन्ताः
pada pāṭha: aśoci | agniḥ | sam-idhānaḥ | asme iti | upo iti | adr̥śran | tamasaḥ | cit | antāḥ || aceti | ketuḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | śriye | divaḥ | duhituḥ | jāyamānaḥ ||7.67.2||

IAST: aceti ketur uṣasaḥ purastāc chriye divo duhitur jāyamānaḥ
Griffith: Eastward is seen the Banner of the Morning, the Banner born to give Heaven's Daughter glory.
Devanāgarī: अचेति केतुरुषसः पुरस्ताच्छ्रिये दिवो दुहितुर्जायमानः
pada pāṭha: aśoci | agniḥ | sam-idhānaḥ | asme iti | upo iti | adr̥śran | tamasaḥ | cit | antāḥ || aceti | ketuḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | śriye | divaḥ | duhituḥ | jāyamānaḥ ||7.67.2||

IAST: abhi vāṁ nūnam aśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān
Griffith: With hymns the deft priest is about you, Asvins, the eloquent priest attends you now, Nasatyas.
Devanāgarī: अभि वां नूनमश्विना सुहोता स्तोमैः सिषक्ति नासत्या विवक्वान्
pada pāṭha: abhi | vām | nūnam | aśvinā | su-hotā | stomaiḥ | sisakti | nāsatyā | vivakvān || pūrvībhiḥ | yātam | pathyābhiḥ | arvāk | svaḥ-vidā | vasu-matā | rathena ||7.67.3||

IAST: pūrvībhir yātam pathyābhir arvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena
Griffith: Come by the paths that ye are wont to travel, on car that finds the light, laden with treasure.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीभिर्यातं पथ्याभिरर्वाक्स्वर्विदा वसुमता रथेन
pada pāṭha: abhi | vām | nūnam | aśvinā | su-hotā | stomaiḥ | sisakti | nāsatyā | vivakvān || pūrvībhiḥ | yātam | pathyābhiḥ | arvāk | svaḥ-vidā | vasu-matā | rathena ||7.67.3||

IAST: avor vāṁ nūnam aśvinā yuvākur huve yad vāṁ sute mādhvī vasūyuḥ
Griffith: When, suppliant for your help, Lovers of Sweetness! I seeking wealth call you to our libation,
Devanāgarī: अवोर्वां नूनमश्विना युवाकुर्हुवे यद्वां सुते माध्वी वसूयुः
pada pāṭha: avoḥ | vām | nūnam | aśvinā | yuvākuḥ | huve | yat | vām | sute | mādhvī iti | vasu-yuḥ || ā | vām | vahantu | sthavirāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | pibāthaḥ | asme iti | su-sutā | madhūni ||7.67.4||

IAST: ā vāṁ vahantu sthavirāso aśvāḥ pibātho asme suṣutā madhūni
Griffith: Hitherward let your vigorous horses bear you: drink ye with us the well-pressed Soma juices.
Devanāgarī: आ वां वहन्तु स्थविरासो अश्वाः पिबाथो अस्मे सुषुता मधूनि
pada pāṭha: avoḥ | vām | nūnam | aśvinā | yuvākuḥ | huve | yat | vām | sute | mādhvī iti | vasu-yuḥ || ā | vām | vahantu | sthavirāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | pibāthaḥ | asme iti | su-sutā | madhūni ||7.67.4||

IAST: prācīm u devāśvinā dhiyam me 'mṛdhrāṁ sātaye kṛtaṁ vasūyum
Griffith: Bring forward, Asvins, Gods, to its fulfilment my never-wearied prayer that asks for riches.
Devanāgarī: प्राचीमु देवाश्विना धियं मेऽमृध्रां सातये कृतं वसूयुम्
pada pāṭha: prācīm | ūm̐ iti | devā | aśvinā | dhiyam | me | amr̥dhrām | sātaye | kr̥tam | vasu-yum || viśvāḥ | aviṣṭam | vāje | ā | puram-dhīḥ | tā | naḥ | śaktam | śacīpatī iti śacī-patī | śacībhiḥ ||7.67.5||

IAST: viśvā aviṣṭaṁ vāja ā puraṁdhīs tā naḥ śaktaṁ śacīpatī śacībhiḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us all high spirit in the combat, and with your powers, O Lords of Power, assist us.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा अविष्टं वाज आ पुरंधीस्ता नः शक्तं शचीपती शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: prācīm | ūm̐ iti | devā | aśvinā | dhiyam | me | amr̥dhrām | sātaye | kr̥tam | vasu-yum || viśvāḥ | aviṣṭam | vāje | ā | puram-dhīḥ | tā | naḥ | śaktam | śacīpatī iti śacī-patī | śacībhiḥ ||7.67.5||

IAST: aviṣṭaṁ dhīṣv aśvinā na āsu prajāvad reto ahrayaṁ no astu
Griffith: Favour us in these prayers of ours, O Asvins. May we have genial vigour, ne'er to fail us.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टं धीष्वश्विना न आसु प्रजावद्रेतो अह्रयं नो अस्तु
pada pāṭha: aviṣṭam | dhīṣu | aśvinā | naḥ | āsu | prajā-vat | retaḥ | ahrayam | naḥ | astu || ā | vām | toke | tanaye | tūtujānāḥ | su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema ||7.67.6||

IAST: ā vāṁ toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ suratnāso devavītiṁ gamema
Griffith: So may we, strong in children and descendants, go, wealthy, to the banquet that awaits you.
Devanāgarī: आ वां तोके तनये तूतुजानाः सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम
pada pāṭha: aviṣṭam | dhīṣu | aśvinā | naḥ | āsu | prajā-vat | retaḥ | ahrayam | naḥ | astu || ā | vām | toke | tanaye | tūtujānāḥ | su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema ||7.67.6||

IAST: eṣa sya vām pūrvagatveva sakhye nidhir hito mādhvī rāto asme
Griffith: Lovers of Sweetness, we have brought this treasure to you as 'twere an envoy sent for friendship.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य वां पूर्वगत्वेव सख्ये निधिर्हितो माध्वी रातो अस्मे
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | vām | pūrvagatvā-iva | sakhye | ni-dhiḥ | hitaḥ | mādhvī iti | rātaḥ | asme iti || aheḷatā | manasā | ā | yātam | arvāk | aśnantā | havyam | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu ||7.67.7||

IAST: aheḻatā manasā yātam arvāg aśnantā havyam mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
Griffith: Come unto us with spirits free from anger, in homes of men enjoying our oblation.
Devanāgarī: अहेळता मनसा यातमर्वागश्नन्ता हव्यं मानुषीषु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | vām | pūrvagatvā-iva | sakhye | ni-dhiḥ | hitaḥ | mādhvī iti | rātaḥ | asme iti || aheḷatā | manasā | ā | yātam | arvāk | aśnantā | havyam | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu ||7.67.7||

IAST: ekasmin yoge bhuraṇā samāne pari vāṁ sapta sravato ratho gāt
Griffith: With one, the same, intention, ye swift movers, o'er the Seven Rivers hath your chariot travelled.
Devanāgarī: एकस्मिन्योगे भुरणा समाने परि वां सप्त स्रवतो रथो गात्
pada pāṭha: ekasmin | yoge | bhuraṇā | samāne | pari | vām | sapta | sravataḥ | rathaḥ | gāt || na | vāyanti | su-bhvaḥ | deva-yuktāḥ | ye | vām | dhūḥ-su | taraṇayaḥ | vahanti ||7.67.8||

IAST: na vāyanti subhvo devayuktā ye vāṁ dhūrṣu taraṇayo vahanti
Griffith: Yoked by the Gods, your strong steeds never weary while speeding forward at the pole they bear you.
Devanāgarī: न वायन्ति सुभ्वो देवयुक्ता ये वां धूर्षु तरणयो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: ekasmin | yoge | bhuraṇā | samāne | pari | vām | sapta | sravataḥ | rathaḥ | gāt || na | vāyanti | su-bhvaḥ | deva-yuktāḥ | ye | vām | dhūḥ-su | taraṇayaḥ | vahanti ||7.67.8||

IAST: asaścatā maghavadbhyo hi bhūtaṁ ye rāyā maghadeyaṁ junanti
Griffith: Exhaustless be your bounty to our princes who with their wealth incite the gift of riches,
Devanāgarī: असश्चता मघवद्भ्यो हि भूतं ये राया मघदेयं जुनन्ति
pada pāṭha: asaścatā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | hi | bhūtam | ye | rāyā | magha-deyam | junanti || pra | ye | bandhum | sūnr̥tābhiḥ | tirante | gavyā | pr̥ñcantaḥ | aśvyā | maghāni ||7.67.9||

IAST: pra ye bandhuṁ sūnṛtābhis tirante gavyā pṛñcanto aśvyā maghāni
Griffith: Who further friendship with their noble natures, combining wealth in kine with wealth in herses.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये बन्धुं सूनृताभिस्तिरन्ते गव्या पृञ्चन्तो अश्व्या मघानि
pada pāṭha: asaścatā | maghavat-bhyaḥ | hi | bhūtam | ye | rāyā | magha-deyam | junanti || pra | ye | bandhum | sūnr̥tābhiḥ | tirante | gavyā | pr̥ñcantaḥ | aśvyā | maghāni ||7.67.9||

IAST: nū me havam ā śṛṇutaṁ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṁ vartir aśvināv irāvat
Griffith: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Asvins, to the home where food aboundeth.
Devanāgarī: नू मे हवमा शृणुतं युवाना यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत्
pada pāṭha: nu | me | havam | ā | śr̥ṇutam | yuvānā | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat || dhattam | ratnāni | jaratam | ca | sūrīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.67.10||

IAST: dhattaṁ ratnāni jarataṁ ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: धत्तं रत्नानि जरतं च सूरीन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | havam | ā | śr̥ṇutam | yuvānā | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat || dhattam | ratnāni | jaratam | ca | sūrīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.67.10||

IAST: ā śubhrā yātam aśvinā svaśvā giro dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ
Griffith: COME, radiant Asvins, with your noble horses: accept your servant's hymns, ye Wonder-Workers:
Devanāgarī: आ शुभ्रा यातमश्विना स्वश्वा गिरो दस्रा जुजुषाणा युवाकोः
pada pāṭha: ā | śubhrā | yātam | aśvinā | su-aśvā | giraḥ | dasrā | jujuṣāṇā | yuvākoḥ || havyāni | ca | prati-bhr̥tā | vītam | nāḥ ||7.68.1||

IAST: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Enjoy oblations which we bring to greet you.
Devanāgarī: हव्यानि च प्रतिभृता वीतं नः
pada pāṭha: ā | śubhrā | yātam | aśvinā | su-aśvā | giraḥ | dasrā | jujuṣāṇā | yuvākoḥ || havyāni | ca | prati-bhr̥tā | vītam | nāḥ ||7.68.1||

IAST: pra vām andhāṁsi madyāny asthur araṁ gantaṁ haviṣo vītaye me
Griffith: The gladdening juices stand prepared before you: come quickly and partake of mine oblation.
Devanāgarī: प्र वामन्धांसि मद्यान्यस्थुररं गन्तं हविषो वीतये मे
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | andhāṁsi | madyāni | asthuḥ | aram | gantam | haviṣaḥ | vītaye | me || tiraḥ | aryaḥ | havanāni | śrutam | naḥ ||7.68.2||

IAST: tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Pass by the calling of our foe and bear us.
Devanāgarī: तिरो अर्यो हवनानि श्रुतं नः
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | andhāṁsi | madyāni | asthuḥ | aram | gantam | haviṣaḥ | vītaye | me || tiraḥ | aryaḥ | havanāni | śrutam | naḥ ||7.68.2||

IAST: pra vāṁ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṁsy aśvinā śatotiḥ
Griffith: Your chariot with a hundred aids, O Asvins, beareth you swift as thought across the regions,
Devanāgarī: प्र वां रथो मनोजवा इयर्ति तिरो रजांस्यश्विना शतोतिः
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | rathaḥ | manaḥ-javāḥ | iyarti | tiraḥ | rajāṁsi | aśvinā | śata-ūtiḥ || asmabhyam | sūryāvasū iti | iyānaḥ ||7.68.3||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ
Griffith: Speeding to us, O ye whose wealth is Surya.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं सूर्यावसू इयानः
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | rathaḥ | manaḥ-javāḥ | iyarti | tiraḥ | rajāṁsi | aśvinā | śata-ūtiḥ || asmabhyam | sūryāvasū iti | iyānaḥ ||7.68.3||

IAST: ayaṁ ha yad vāṁ devayā u adrir ūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām
Griffith: What time this stone of yours, the Gods' adorer, upraised, sounds forth for you as Soma-presser,
Devanāgarī: अयं ह यद्वां देवया उ अद्रिरूर्ध्वो विवक्ति सोमसुद्युवभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | ha | yat | vām | deva-yāḥ | ūm̐ iti | adriḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | vivakti | soma-sut | yuva-bhyām || ā | valgū iti | vipraḥ | vavr̥tīta | havyaiḥ ||7.68.4||

IAST: ā valgū vipro vavṛtīta havyaiḥ
Griffith: Let the priest bring you, Fair Ones, through oblations.
Devanāgarī: आ वल्गू विप्रो ववृतीत हव्यैः
pada pāṭha: ayam | ha | yat | vām | deva-yāḥ | ūm̐ iti | adriḥ | ūrdhvaḥ | vivakti | soma-sut | yuva-bhyām || ā | valgū iti | vipraḥ | vavr̥tīta | havyaiḥ ||7.68.4||

IAST: citraṁ ha yad vām bhojanaṁ nv asti ny atraye mahiṣvantaṁ yuyotam
Griffith: The nourishment ye have is, truly, wondrous: ye gave thereof a quickening store to Atri,
Devanāgarī: चित्रं ह यद्वां भोजनं न्वस्ति न्यत्रये महिष्वन्तं युयोतम्
pada pāṭha: citram | ha | yat | vām | bhojanam | nu | asti | ni | atraye | mahiṣvantam | yuyotam || yaḥ | vām | omānam | dadhate | priyaḥ | san ||7.68.5||

IAST: yo vām omānaṁ dadhate priyaḥ san
Griffith: Who being dear to you, receives your favour.
Devanāgarī: यो वामोमानं दधते प्रियः सन्
pada pāṭha: citram | ha | yat | vām | bhojanam | nu | asti | ni | atraye | mahiṣvantam | yuyotam || yaḥ | vām | omānam | dadhate | priyaḥ | san ||7.68.5||

IAST: uta tyad vāṁ jurate aśvinā bhūc cyavānāya pratītyaṁ havirde
Griffith: That gift, which all may gain, ye gave Cyavana, when he grew old, who offered you oblations,
Devanāgarī: उत त्यद्वां जुरते अश्विना भूच्च्यवानाय प्रतीत्यं हविर्दे
pada pāṭha: uta | tyat | vām | jurate | aśvinā | bhūt | cyavānāya | pratītyam | haviḥ-de || adhi | yat | varpaḥ | itaḥ-ūti | dhatthaḥ ||7.68.6||

IAST: adhi yad varpa itaūti dhatthaḥ
Griffith: When ye bestowed on him enduring beauty.
Devanāgarī: अधि यद्वर्प इतऊति धत्थः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyat | vām | jurate | aśvinā | bhūt | cyavānāya | pratītyam | haviḥ-de || adhi | yat | varpaḥ | itaḥ-ūti | dhatthaḥ ||7.68.6||

IAST: uta tyam bhujyum aśvinā sakhāyo madhye jahur durevāsaḥ samudre
Griffith: What time his wicked friends abandoned Bhujyu, O Asvins, in the middle of the ocean,
Devanāgarī: उत त्यं भुज्युमश्विना सखायो मध्ये जहुर्दुरेवासः समुद्रे
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | bhujyum | aśvinā | sakhāyaḥ | madhye | juhuḥ | duḥ-evāsaḥ | samudre || niḥ | īm | parṣat | arāvā | yaḥ | yuvākuḥ ||7.68.7||

IAST: nir īm parṣad arāvā yo yuvākuḥ
Griffith: Your horse delivered him, your faithful servant.
Devanāgarī: निरीं पर्षदरावा यो युवाकुः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | bhujyum | aśvinā | sakhāyaḥ | madhye | juhuḥ | duḥ-evāsaḥ | samudre || niḥ | īm | parṣat | arāvā | yaḥ | yuvākuḥ ||7.68.7||

IAST: vṛkāya cij jasamānāya śaktam uta śrutaṁ śayave hūyamānā
Griffith: Ye lent your aid to Vrka when exhausted, and listened when invoked to Sayu's calling.
Devanāgarī: वृकाय चिज्जसमानाय शक्तमुत श्रुतं शयवे हूयमाना
pada pāṭha: vr̥kāya | cit | jasamānāya | śaktam | uta | śrutam | śayave | hūyamānā || yau | aghnyām | apinvatam | apaḥ | na | staryam | cit | śaktī | aśvinā | śacībhiḥ ||7.68.8||

IAST: yāv aghnyām apinvatam apo na staryaṁ cic chakty aśvinā śacībhiḥ
Griffith: Ye made the cow pour forth her milk like water, and, Asvins, strengthened with your strength the barren
Devanāgarī: यावघ्न्यामपिन्वतमपो न स्तर्यं चिच्छक्त्यश्विना शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: vr̥kāya | cit | jasamānāya | śaktam | uta | śrutam | śayave | hūyamānā || yau | aghnyām | apinvatam | apaḥ | na | staryam | cit | śaktī | aśvinā | śacībhiḥ ||7.68.8||

IAST: eṣa sya kārur jarate sūktair agre budhāna uṣasāṁ sumanmā
Griffith: With his fair hymns this singer, too, extols you, waking with glad thoughts at the break of morning.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य कारुर्जरते सूक्तैरग्रे बुधान उषसां सुमन्मा
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | kāruḥ | jarate | su-uktaiḥ | agre | budhānaḥ | uṣasām | su-manmā || iṣā | tam | vardhat | aghnyā | payaḥ-bhiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.68.9||

IAST: iṣā taṁ vardhad aghnyā payobhir yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May the cow nourish him with milk to feed llim. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इषा तं वर्धदघ्न्या पयोभिर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | kāruḥ | jarate | su-uktaiḥ | agre | budhānaḥ | uṣasām | su-manmā || iṣā | tam | vardhat | aghnyā | payaḥ-bhiḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.68.9||

IAST: ā vāṁ ratho rodasī badbadhāno hiraṇyayo vṛṣabhir yātv aśvaiḥ
Griffith: MAY your gold chariot, drawn by vigorous horses, come to us, blocking up the earth and heaven,
Devanāgarī: आ वां रथो रोदसी बद्बधानो हिरण्ययो वृषभिर्यात्वश्वैः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rathaḥ | rodasī iti | badbadhānaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | yātu | aśvaiḥ || ghr̥ta-vartaniḥ | pavi-bhiḥ | rucānaḥ | iṣām | voḷhā | nr̥-patiḥ | vājinī-vān ||7.69.1||

IAST: ghṛtavartaniḥ pavibhī rucāna iṣāṁ voḻhā nṛpatir vājinīvān
Griffith: Bright with its fellies while its way drops fatness, food-laden, rich in coursers, man's protector.
Devanāgarī: घृतवर्तनिः पविभी रुचान इषां वोळ्हा नृपतिर्वाजिनीवान्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rathaḥ | rodasī iti | badbadhānaḥ | hiraṇyayaḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | yātu | aśvaiḥ || ghr̥ta-vartaniḥ | pavi-bhiḥ | rucānaḥ | iṣām | voḷhā | nr̥-patiḥ | vājinī-vān ||7.69.1||

IAST: sa paprathāno abhi pañca bhūmā trivandhuro manasā yātu yuktaḥ
Griffith: Let it approach, yoked by thewill, three-seated, extending far and wide o'er fivefold beings,
Devanāgarī: स पप्रथानो अभि पञ्च भूमा त्रिवन्धुरो मनसा यातु युक्तः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | paprathānaḥ | abhi | pañca | bhūma | tri-vandhuraḥ | manasā | ā | yātu | yuktaḥ || viśaḥ | yena | gacchathaḥ | deva-yantīḥ | kutra | cit | yāmam | aśvinā | dadhānā ||7.69.2||

IAST: viśo yena gacchatho devayantīḥ kutrā cid yāmam aśvinā dadhānā
Griffith: Whereon ye visit God-adoring races, bending your course whither ye will, O Asvins.
Devanāgarī: विशो येन गच्छथो देवयन्तीः कुत्रा चिद्याममश्विना दधाना
pada pāṭha: saḥ | paprathānaḥ | abhi | pañca | bhūma | tri-vandhuraḥ | manasā | ā | yātu | yuktaḥ || viśaḥ | yena | gacchathaḥ | deva-yantīḥ | kutra | cit | yāmam | aśvinā | dadhānā ||7.69.2||

IAST: svaśvā yaśasā yātam arvāg dasrā nidhim madhumantam pibāthaḥ
Griffith: Renowned, with noble horses, come ye hither: drink, Wondrous Pair, the cup that holds sweet juices.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वा यशसा यातमर्वाग्दस्रा निधिं मधुमन्तं पिबाथः
pada pāṭha: su-aśvā | yaśasā | ā | yātam | arvāk | dasrā | ni-dhim | madhu-mantam | pibāthaḥ || vi | vām | rathaḥ | vadhvā | yādamānaḥ | antān | divaḥ | bādhate | vartani-bhyām ||7.69.3||

IAST: vi vāṁ ratho vadhvā yādamāno 'ntān divo bādhate vartanibhyām
Griffith: Your car whereon your Spouse is wont to travel marks with its track the farthest ends of heaven.
Devanāgarī: वि वां रथो वध्वा यादमानोऽन्तान्दिवो बाधते वर्तनिभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: su-aśvā | yaśasā | ā | yātam | arvāk | dasrā | ni-dhim | madhu-mantam | pibāthaḥ || vi | vām | rathaḥ | vadhvā | yādamānaḥ | antān | divaḥ | bādhate | vartani-bhyām ||7.69.3||

IAST: yuvoḥ śriyam pari yoṣāvṛṇīta sūro duhitā paritakmyāyām
Griffith: When night was turning to the grey of morning the Maiden, Surya's Daughter, chose your splendour.
Devanāgarī: युवोः श्रियं परि योषावृणीत सूरो दुहिता परितक्म्यायाम्
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | śriyam | pari | yoṣā | avr̥ṇīta | sūraḥ | duhitā | pari-takmyāyām || yat | deva-yantam | avathaḥ | śacībhiḥ | pari | ghraṁsam | omanā | vām | vayaḥ | gāt ||7.69.4||

IAST: yad devayantam avathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṁsam omanā vāṁ vayo gāt
Griffith: When with your power and might ye aid the pious he comes through heat to life by your assistance.
Devanāgarī: यद्देवयन्तमवथः शचीभिः परि घ्रंसमोमना वां वयो गात्
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | śriyam | pari | yoṣā | avr̥ṇīta | sūraḥ | duhitā | pari-takmyāyām || yat | deva-yantam | avathaḥ | śacībhiḥ | pari | ghraṁsam | omanā | vām | vayaḥ | gāt ||7.69.4||

IAST: yo ha sya vāṁ rathirā vasta usrā ratho yujānaḥ pariyāti vartiḥ
Griffith: O Chariot-borne, this car of yours invested with rays of light comes harnessed to our dwelling.
Devanāgarī: यो ह स्य वां रथिरा वस्त उस्रा रथो युजानः परियाति वर्तिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ha | syaḥ | vām | rathirā | vaste | usrāḥ | rathaḥ | yujānaḥ | pari-yāti | vartiḥ || tena | naḥ | śam | yoḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | ni | aśvinā | vahatam | yajñe | asmin ||7.69.5||

IAST: tena naḥ śaṁ yor uṣaso vyuṣṭau ny aśvinā vahataṁ yajñe asmin
Griffith: Herewith, O Asvins, while the dawn is breaking, to this our sacrifice bring peace and blessing.
Devanāgarī: तेन नः शं योरुषसो व्युष्टौ न्यश्विना वहतं यज्ञे अस्मिन्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ha | syaḥ | vām | rathirā | vaste | usrāḥ | rathaḥ | yujānaḥ | pari-yāti | vartiḥ || tena | naḥ | śam | yoḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | ni | aśvinā | vahatam | yajñe | asmin ||7.69.5||

IAST: narā gaureva vidyutaṁ tṛṣāṇāsmākam adya savanopa yātam
Griffith: Like the wild cattle thirsty for the lightning, Heroes, come nigh this day to our libations.
Devanāgarī: नरा गौरेव विद्युतं तृषाणास्माकमद्य सवनोप यातम्
pada pāṭha: narā | gaurā-iva | vi-dyutam | tr̥ṣāṇā | asmākam | adya | savanā | upa | yātam || puru-trā | hi | vām | mati-bhiḥ | havante | mā | vām | anye | ni | yaman | deva-yantaḥ ||7.69.6||

IAST: purutrā hi vām matibhir havante mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ
Griffith: Men call on you with hymns in many places, but let not other worshippers detain you.
Devanāgarī: पुरुत्रा हि वां मतिभिर्हवन्ते मा वामन्ये नि यमन्देवयन्तः
pada pāṭha: narā | gaurā-iva | vi-dyutam | tr̥ṣāṇā | asmākam | adya | savanā | upa | yātam || puru-trā | hi | vām | mati-bhiḥ | havante | mā | vām | anye | ni | yaman | deva-yantaḥ ||7.69.6||

IAST: yuvam bhujyum avaviddhaṁ samudra ud ūhathur arṇaso asridhānaiḥ
Griffith: Bhujyu, abandoned in the midst of ocean, ye raised from out the water with your horses,
Devanāgarī: युवं भुज्युमवविद्धं समुद्र उदूहथुरर्णसो अस्रिधानैः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | bhujyum | ava-viddham | samudre | ut | ūhathuḥ | arṇasaḥ | asridhānaiḥ || patatri-bhiḥ | aśramaiḥ | avyathi-bhiḥ | daṁsanābhiḥ | aśvinā | pārayantā ||7.69.7||

IAST: patatribhir aśramair avyathibhir daṁsanābhir aśvinā pārayantā
Griffith: Uninjured, winged, flagging not, undaunted, with deeds of wonder saving him, O Asvins.
Devanāgarī: पतत्रिभिरश्रमैरव्यथिभिर्दंसनाभिरश्विना पारयन्ता
pada pāṭha: yuvam | bhujyum | ava-viddham | samudre | ut | ūhathuḥ | arṇasaḥ | asridhānaiḥ || patatri-bhiḥ | aśramaiḥ | avyathi-bhiḥ | daṁsanābhiḥ | aśvinā | pārayantā ||7.69.7||

IAST: nū me havam ā śṛṇutaṁ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṁ vartir aśvināv irāvat
Griffith: Now hear, O Youthful Twain, mine invocation: come, Asvins, to the home where food aboundeth.
Devanāgarī: नू मे हवमा शृणुतं युवाना यासिष्टं वर्तिरश्विनाविरावत्
pada pāṭha: nu | me | havam | ā | śr̥ṇutam | yuvānā | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat || dhattam | ratnāni | jaratam | ca | sūrīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.69.8||

IAST: dhattaṁ ratnāni jarataṁ ca sūrīn yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us wealth, do honour to our nobles. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: धत्तं रत्नानि जरतं च सूरीन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | havam | ā | śr̥ṇutam | yuvānā | yāsiṣṭam | vartiḥ | aśvinau | irā-vat || dhattam | ratnāni | jaratam | ca | sūrīn | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.69.8||

IAST: ā viśvavārāśvinā gataṁ naḥ pra tat sthānam avāci vām pṛthivyām
Griffith: RICH in all blessings, Asvins come ye hither: this place on earth is called your own possession,
Devanāgarī: आ विश्ववाराश्विना गतं नः प्र तत्स्थानमवाचि वां पृथिव्याम्
pada pāṭha: ā | viśva-vārā | aśvinā | gatam | naḥ | pra | tat | sthānam | avāci | vām | pr̥thivyām || aśvaḥ | na | vājī | śuna-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | asthāt | ā | yat | sedathuḥ | dhruvase | na | yonim ||7.70.1||

IAST: aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthād ā yat sedathur dhruvase na yonim
Griffith: Like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth, whereon, as in a lap, ye seat you firmly.
Devanāgarī: अश्वो न वाजी शुनपृष्ठो अस्थादा यत्सेदथुर्ध्रुवसे न योनिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | viśva-vārā | aśvinā | gatam | naḥ | pra | tat | sthānam | avāci | vām | pr̥thivyām || aśvaḥ | na | vājī | śuna-pr̥ṣṭhaḥ | asthāt | ā | yat | sedathuḥ | dhruvase | na | yonim ||7.70.1||

IAST: siṣakti sā vāṁ sumatiś caniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe
Griffith: This most delightful eulogy awaits you in the man's house drink-offering hath been heated,
Devanāgarī: सिषक्ति सा वां सुमतिश्चनिष्ठातापि घर्मो मनुषो दुरोणे
pada pāṭha: sisakti | sā | vām | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā | atāpi | gharmaḥ | manuṣaḥ | duroṇe || yaḥ | vām | samudrān | saritaḥ | piparti | eta-gvā | cit | na | su-yujā | yujānaḥ ||7.70.2||

IAST: yo vāṁ samudrān saritaḥ piparty etagvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ
Griffith: Which bringeth you over the seas and rivers, yoking as'twere two well-matched shining horses.
Devanāgarī: यो वां समुद्रान्सरितः पिपर्त्येतग्वा चिन्न सुयुजा युजानः
pada pāṭha: sisakti | sā | vām | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā | atāpi | gharmaḥ | manuṣaḥ | duroṇe || yaḥ | vām | samudrān | saritaḥ | piparti | eta-gvā | cit | na | su-yujā | yujānaḥ ||7.70.2||

IAST: yāni sthānāny aśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣv oṣadhīṣu vikṣu
Griffith: Whatever dwellings ye possess, O Asvins, in fields of men or in the streams of heaven,
Devanāgarī: यानि स्थानान्यश्विना दधाथे दिवो यह्वीष्वोषधीषु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: yāni | sthānāni | aśvinā | dadhāthe iti | divaḥ | yahvīṣu | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu || ni | parvatasya | mūrdhani | sadantā | iṣam | janāya | dāśuṣe | vahantā ||7.70.3||

IAST: ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṁ janāya dāśuṣe vahantā
Griffith: Resting upon the summit of the mountain, or bringing food to him who gives oblation,
Devanāgarī: नि पर्वतस्य मूर्धनि सदन्तेषं जनाय दाशुषे वहन्ता
pada pāṭha: yāni | sthānāni | aśvinā | dadhāthe iti | divaḥ | yahvīṣu | oṣadhīṣu | vikṣu || ni | parvatasya | mūrdhani | sadantā | iṣam | janāya | dāśuṣe | vahantā ||7.70.3||

IAST: caniṣṭaṁ devā oṣadhīṣv apsu yad yogyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: Delight yourselves, ye Gods, in plants and waters when Rsis give them and ye find they suit You.
Devanāgarī: चनिष्टं देवा ओषधीष्वप्सु यद्योग्या अश्नवैथे ऋषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: caniṣṭam | devau | oṣadhīṣu | ap-su | yat | yogyāḥ | aśnavaithe iti | r̥ṣīṇām || purūṇi | ratnā | dadhatau | ni | asme iti | anu | pūrvāṇi | cakhyathuḥ | yugāni ||7.70.4||

IAST: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau ny asme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathur yugāni
Griffith: Enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.
Devanāgarī: पुरूणि रत्ना दधतौ न्यस्मे अनु पूर्वाणि चख्यथुर्युगानि
pada pāṭha: caniṣṭam | devau | oṣadhīṣu | ap-su | yat | yogyāḥ | aśnavaithe iti | r̥ṣīṇām || purūṇi | ratnā | dadhatau | ni | asme iti | anu | pūrvāṇi | cakhyathuḥ | yugāni ||7.70.4||

IAST: śuśruvāṁsā cid aśvinā purūṇy abhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: Asvins, though ye have heard them oft aforetime, regard the many prayers which Rsis offer.
Devanāgarī: शुश्रुवांसा चिदश्विना पुरूण्यभि ब्रह्माणि चक्षाथे ऋषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: śuśru-vāṁsā | cit | aśvinā | purūṇi | abhi | brahmāṇi | cakṣāthe iti | r̥ṣīṇām || prati | pra | yātam | varam | ā | janāya | asme iti | vām | astu | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā ||7.70.5||

IAST: prati pra yātaṁ varam ā janāyāsme vām astu sumatiś caniṣṭhā
Griffith: Come to the man even as his heart desireth: may we enjoy your most delightful favour.
Devanāgarī: प्रति प्र यातं वरमा जनायास्मे वामस्तु सुमतिश्चनिष्ठा
pada pāṭha: śuśru-vāṁsā | cit | aśvinā | purūṇi | abhi | brahmāṇi | cakṣāthe iti | r̥ṣīṇām || prati | pra | yātam | varam | ā | janāya | asme iti | vām | astu | su-matiḥ | caniṣṭhā ||7.70.5||

IAST: yo vāṁ yajño nāsatyā haviṣmān kṛtabrahmā samaryo bhavāti
Griffith: Come to the sacrifice offered you, Nasatyas, with men, oblations, and prayer duly uttered.
Devanāgarī: यो वां यज्ञो नासत्या हविष्मान्कृतब्रह्मा समर्यो भवाति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | yajñaḥ | nāsatyā | haviṣmān | kr̥ta-brahmā | sa-maryaḥ | bhavāti || upa | pra | yātam | varam | ā | vasiṣṭham | imā | brahmāṇi | r̥cyante | yuva-bhyām ||7.70.6||

IAST: upa pra yātaṁ varam ā vasiṣṭham imā brahmāṇy ṛcyante yuvabhyām
Griffith: Come to Vasistha as his heart desireth, for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.
Devanāgarī: उप प्र यातं वरमा वसिष्ठमिमा ब्रह्माण्यृच्यन्ते युवभ्याम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | yajñaḥ | nāsatyā | haviṣmān | kr̥ta-brahmā | sa-maryaḥ | bhavāti || upa | pra | yātam | varam | ā | vasiṣṭham | imā | brahmāṇi | r̥cyante | yuva-bhyām ||7.70.6||

IAST: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīr imāṁ suvṛktiṁ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
Griffith: This is the thought, this is the song, O Asvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, with favour.
Devanāgarī: इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीरिमां सुवृक्तिं वृषणा जुषेथाम्
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | iyam | aśvinā | gīḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || imā | brahmāṇi | yuva-yūni | agman | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.70.7||

IAST: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūny agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्माणि युवयून्यग्मन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | iyam | aśvinā | gīḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || imā | brahmāṇi | yuva-yūni | agman | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.70.7||

IAST: apa svasur uṣaso nag jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīr aruṣāya panthām
Griffith: THE Night retireth from the Dawn her Sister; the Dark one yieldeth to the Red her pathway.
Devanāgarī: अप स्वसुरुषसो नग्जिहीते रिणक्ति कृष्णीररुषाय पन्थाम्
pada pāṭha: apa | svasuḥ | uṣasaḥ | nak | jihīte | riṇakti | kr̥ṣṇīḥ | aruṣāya | panthām || aśva-maghā | go-maghā | vām | huvema | divā | naktam | śarum | asmat | yuyotam ||7.71.1||

IAST: aśvāmaghā gomaghā vāṁ huvema divā naktaṁ śarum asmad yuyotam
Griffith: Let us invoke you rich in steeds and cattle - by day and night keep far from us the arrow.
Devanāgarī: अश्वामघा गोमघा वां हुवेम दिवा नक्तं शरुमस्मद्युयोतम्
pada pāṭha: apa | svasuḥ | uṣasaḥ | nak | jihīte | riṇakti | kr̥ṣṇīḥ | aruṣāya | panthām || aśva-maghā | go-maghā | vām | huvema | divā | naktam | śarum | asmat | yuyotam ||7.71.1||

IAST: upāyātaṁ dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmam aśvinā vahantā
Griffith: Bearing rich treasure in your car, O Asvins, come to the mortal who presents oblation.
Devanāgarī: उपायातं दाशुषे मर्त्याय रथेन वाममश्विना वहन्ता
pada pāṭha: upa-āyātam | dāśuṣe | martyāya | rathena | vāmam | aśvinā | vahantā || yuyutam | asmat | anirām | amīvām | divā | naktam | mādhvī iti | trāsīthām | naḥ ||7.71.2||

IAST: yuyutam asmad anirām amīvāṁ divā naktam mādhvī trāsīthāṁ naḥ
Griffith: Keep at a distance penury and sickness; Lovers of Sweetness, day and night preserve us.
Devanāgarī: युयुतमस्मदनिराममीवां दिवा नक्तं माध्वी त्रासीथां नः
pada pāṭha: upa-āyātam | dāśuṣe | martyāya | rathena | vāmam | aśvinā | vahantā || yuyutam | asmat | anirām | amīvām | divā | naktam | mādhvī iti | trāsīthām | naḥ ||7.71.2||

IAST: ā vāṁ ratham avamasyāṁ vyuṣṭau sumnāyavo vṛṣaṇo vartayantu
Griffith: May your strong horses, seeking bliss, bring hither your chariot at the earliest flush of morning.
Devanāgarī: आ वां रथमवमस्यां व्युष्टौ सुम्नायवो वृषणो वर्तयन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | ratham | avamasyām | vi-uṣṭau | sumna-yavaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vartayantu || syūma-gabhastim | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | ā | aśvinā | vasu-mantam | vahethām ||7.71.3||

IAST: syūmagabhastim ṛtayugbhir aśvair āśvinā vasumantaṁ vahethām
Griffith: With coursers yoked by Law drive hither, Asvins, your car whose reins are light, laden with treasure.
Devanāgarī: स्यूमगभस्तिमृतयुग्भिरश्वैराश्विना वसुमन्तं वहेथाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | ratham | avamasyām | vi-uṣṭau | sumna-yavaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vartayantu || syūma-gabhastim | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | ā | aśvinā | vasu-mantam | vahethām ||7.71.3||

IAST: yo vāṁ ratho nṛpatī asti voḻhā trivandhuro vasumām̐ usrayāmā
Griffith: The chariot, Princes, that conveys you, moving at daylight, triple-seated, fraught with riches,
Devanāgarī: यो वां रथो नृपती अस्ति वोळ्हा त्रिवन्धुरो वसुमाँ उस्रयामा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | rathaḥ | nr̥patī iti nr̥-patī | asti | voḷhā | tri-vandhuraḥ | vasu-mān | usra-yāmā || ā | naḥ | enā | nāsatyā | upa | yātam | abhi | yat | vām | viśva-psnyaḥ | jigāti ||7.71.4||

IAST: ā na enā nāsatyopa yātam abhi yad vāṁ viśvapsnyo jigāti
Griffith: Even with this come unto us, Nasatyas, that laden with all food it may approach us.
Devanāgarī: आ न एना नासत्योप यातमभि यद्वां विश्वप्स्न्यो जिगाति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | rathaḥ | nr̥patī iti nr̥-patī | asti | voḷhā | tri-vandhuraḥ | vasu-mān | usra-yāmā || ā | naḥ | enā | nāsatyā | upa | yātam | abhi | yat | vām | viśva-psnyaḥ | jigāti ||7.71.4||

IAST: yuvaṁ cyavānaṁ jaraso 'mumuktaṁ ni pedava ūhathur āśum aśvam
Griffith: Ye freed Cyavana from old age and weakness: ye brought the courser fleet of food to Pedu.
Devanāgarī: युवं च्यवानं जरसोऽमुमुक्तं नि पेदव ऊहथुराशुमश्वम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | cyavānam | jarasaḥ | amumuktam | ni | pedave | ūhathuḥ | āśum | aśvam || niḥ | aṁhasaḥ | tamasaḥ | spartam | atrim | ni | jāhuṣam | śithire | dhātam | antariti ||7.71.5||

IAST: nir aṁhasas tamasaḥ spartam atriṁ ni jāhuṣaṁ śithire dhātam antaḥ
Griffith: Ye rescued Atri from distress and darkness, and loosed for Jahusa the bonds that bound him.
Devanāgarī: निरंहसस्तमसः स्पर्तमत्रिं नि जाहुषं शिथिरे धातमन्तः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | cyavānam | jarasaḥ | amumuktam | ni | pedave | ūhathuḥ | āśum | aśvam || niḥ | aṁhasaḥ | tamasaḥ | spartam | atrim | ni | jāhuṣam | śithire | dhātam | antariti ||7.71.5||

IAST: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīr imāṁ suvṛktiṁ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
Griffith: This is the thought, this is the song, O Asvins: accept this hymn of ours, ye Steers, With favour.
Devanāgarī: इयं मनीषा इयमश्विना गीरिमां सुवृक्तिं वृषणा जुषेथाम्
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | iyam | aśvinā | gīḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || imā | brahmāṇi | yuva-yūni | agman | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.71.6||

IAST: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūny agman yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: इमा ब्रह्माणि युवयून्यग्मन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | iyam | aśvinā | gīḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || imā | brahmāṇi | yuva-yūni | agman | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.71.6||

IAST: ā gomatā nāsatyā rathenāśvāvatā puruścandreṇa yātam
Griffith: COME, O Nasatyas, on your car resplendent, rich in abundant wealth of kine and horses.
Devanāgarī: आ गोमता नासत्या रथेनाश्वावता पुरुश्चन्द्रेण यातम्
pada pāṭha: ā | go-matā | nāsatyā | rathena | aśva-vatā | puru-candreṇa | yātam || abhi | vām | viśvāḥ | ni-yutaḥ | sacante | spārhayā | śriyā | tanvā | śubhānā ||7.72.1||

IAST: abhi vāṁ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā
Griffith: As harnessed steeds, all our laudations follow you whose forms shine with most delightful beauty.
Devanāgarī: अभि वां विश्वा नियुतः सचन्ते स्पार्हया श्रिया तन्वा शुभाना
pada pāṭha: ā | go-matā | nāsatyā | rathena | aśva-vatā | puru-candreṇa | yātam || abhi | vām | viśvāḥ | ni-yutaḥ | sacante | spārhayā | śriyā | tanvā | śubhānā ||7.72.1||

IAST: ā no devebhir upa yātam arvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena
Griffith: Come with the Gods associate, come ye hither to us, Nasatyas, with your car accordant.
Devanāgarī: आ नो देवेभिरुप यातमर्वाक्सजोषसा नासत्या रथेन
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devebhiḥ | upa | yātam | arvāk | sa-joṣasā | nāsatyā | rathena || yuvoḥ | hi | naḥ | sakhyā | pitryāṇi | samānaḥ | bandhuḥ | uta | tasya | vittam ||7.72.2||

IAST: yuvor hi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samāno bandhur uta tasya vittam
Griffith: Twixt you and us there is ancestral friendship and common kin: remember and regard it.
Devanāgarī: युवोर्हि नः सख्या पित्र्याणि समानो बन्धुरुत तस्य वित्तम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devebhiḥ | upa | yātam | arvāk | sa-joṣasā | nāsatyā | rathena || yuvoḥ | hi | naḥ | sakhyā | pitryāṇi | samānaḥ | bandhuḥ | uta | tasya | vittam ||7.72.2||

IAST: ud u stomāso aśvinor abudhrañ jāmi brahmāṇy uṣasaś ca devīḥ
Griffith: Awakened are the songs that praise the Asvins, the kindred prayers and the Celestial Mornings.
Devanāgarī: उदु स्तोमासो अश्विनोरबुध्रञ्जामि ब्रह्माण्युषसश्च देवीः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | stomāsaḥ | aśvinoḥ | abudhran | jāmi | brahmāṇi | uṣasaḥ | ca | devīḥ || ā-vivāsan | rodasī iti | dhiṣṇye iti | ime iti | accha | vipraḥ | nāsatyā | vivakti ||7.72.3||

IAST: āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyeme acchā vipro nāsatyā vivakti
Griffith: Inviting those we long for, Earth and Heaven, the singer calleth these Nasatyas hither.
Devanāgarī: आविवासन्रोदसी धिष्ण्येमे अच्छा विप्रो नासत्या विवक्ति
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | stomāsaḥ | aśvinoḥ | abudhran | jāmi | brahmāṇi | uṣasaḥ | ca | devīḥ || ā-vivāsan | rodasī iti | dhiṣṇye iti | ime iti | accha | vipraḥ | nāsatyā | vivakti ||7.72.3||

IAST: vi ced ucchanty aśvinā uṣāsaḥ pra vām brahmāṇi kāravo bharante
Griffith: What time the Dawns break forth in light, O Asvins, to you the poets offer their devotions.
Devanāgarī: वि चेदुच्छन्त्यश्विना उषासः प्र वां ब्रह्माणि कारवो भरन्ते
pada pāṭha: vi | ca | it | ucchanti | aśvinau | uṣasaḥ | pra | vām | brahmāṇi | kāravaḥ | bharante || ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | br̥hat | agnayaḥ | sam-idhā | jarante ||7.72.4||

IAST: ūrdhvam bhānuṁ savitā devo aśred bṛhad agnayaḥ samidhā jarante
Griffith: God Savitar hath sent aloft his splendour, and fires sing praises with the kindled fuel.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद्बृहदग्नयः समिधा जरन्ते
pada pāṭha: vi | ca | it | ucchanti | aśvinau | uṣasaḥ | pra | vām | brahmāṇi | kāravaḥ | bharante || ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | br̥hat | agnayaḥ | sam-idhā | jarante ||7.72.4||

IAST: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād āśvinā yātam adharād udaktāt
Griffith: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nasatyas, come, Asvins, from below and from above us.
Devanāgarī: आ पश्चातान्नासत्या पुरस्तादाश्विना यातमधरादुदक्तात्
pada pāṭha: ā | paścātāt | nāsatyā | ā | purastāt | ā | aśvinā | yātam | adharāt | udaktāt || ā | viśvataḥ | pāñca-janyena | rāyā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.72.5||

IAST: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वतः पाञ्चजन्येन राया यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | paścātāt | nāsatyā | ā | purastāt | ā | aśvinā | yātam | adharāt | udaktāt || ā | viśvataḥ | pāñca-janyena | rāyā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.72.5||

IAST: atāriṣma tamasas pāram asya prati stomaṁ devayanto dadhānāḥ
Griffith: WE have o'erpassed the limit of this darkness while, worshipping the Gods, we sang their praises.
Devanāgarī: अतारिष्म तमसस्पारमस्य प्रति स्तोमं देवयन्तो दधानाः
pada pāṭha: atāriṣma | tamasaḥ | pāram | asya | prati | stomam | deva-yantaḥ | dadhānāḥ || puru-daṁsā | puru-tamā | purā-jā | amartyā | havate | aśvinā | gīḥ ||7.73.1||

IAST: purudaṁsā purutamā purājāmartyā havate aśvinā gīḥ
Griffith: The song invoketh both Immortal Asvins far-reaching, born of old, great WonderWorkers.
Devanāgarī: पुरुदंसा पुरुतमा पुराजामर्त्या हवते अश्विना गीः
pada pāṭha: atāriṣma | tamasaḥ | pāram | asya | prati | stomam | deva-yantaḥ | dadhānāḥ || puru-daṁsā | puru-tamā | purā-jā | amartyā | havate | aśvinā | gīḥ ||7.73.1||

IAST: ny u priyo manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yo yajate vandate ca
Griffith: And, O Nasatyas, man's dear Priest is seated, who brings to sacrifice and offers worship,
Devanāgarī: न्यु प्रियो मनुषः सादि होता नासत्या यो यजते वन्दते च
pada pāṭha: ni | ūm̐ iti | priyaḥ | manuṣaḥ | sādi | hotā | nāsatyā | yaḥ | yajate | vandate | ca || aśnītam | madhvaḥ | aśvinau | upāke | ā | vām | voce | vidatheṣu | prayasvān ||7.73.2||

IAST: aśnītam madhvo aśvinā upāka ā vāṁ voce vidatheṣu prayasvān
Griffith: Be near and taste the pleasant juice, O Asvins: with food, I call you to the sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: अश्नीतं मध्वो अश्विना उपाक आ वां वोचे विदथेषु प्रयस्वान्
pada pāṭha: ni | ūm̐ iti | priyaḥ | manuṣaḥ | sādi | hotā | nāsatyā | yaḥ | yajate | vandate | ca || aśnītam | madhvaḥ | aśvinau | upāke | ā | vām | voce | vidatheṣu | prayasvān ||7.73.2||

IAST: ahema yajñam pathām urāṇā imāṁ suvṛktiṁ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
Griffith: We choosing you, have let our worship follow its course: ye Steers, accept this hymn with favour.
Devanāgarī: अहेम यज्ञं पथामुराणा इमां सुवृक्तिं वृषणा जुषेथाम्
pada pāṭha: ahema | yajñam | pathām | urāṇāḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || śruṣṭīvā-iva | pra-iṣitaḥ | vām | abodhi | prati | stomaiḥ | jaramāṇaḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.73.3||

IAST: śruṣṭīveva preṣito vām abodhi prati stomair jaramāṇo vasiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Obeying you as your appointed servant, Vasistha singing hath with lauds aroused you.
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्टीवेव प्रेषितो वामबोधि प्रति स्तोमैर्जरमाणो वसिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: ahema | yajñam | pathām | urāṇāḥ | imām | su-vr̥ktim | vr̥ṣaṇā | juṣethām || śruṣṭīvā-iva | pra-iṣitaḥ | vām | abodhi | prati | stomaiḥ | jaramāṇaḥ | vasiṣṭhaḥ ||7.73.3||

IAST: upa tyā vahnī gamato viśaṁ no rakṣohaṇā sambhṛtā vīḻupāṇī
Griffith: And these Two Priests come nigh unto our people, united, demon-slayers, mighty-handed.
Devanāgarī: उप त्या वह्नी गमतो विशं नो रक्षोहणा सम्भृता वीळुपाणी
pada pāṭha: upa | tyā | vahnī iti | gamataḥ | viśam | naḥ | rakṣaḥ-hanā | sam-bhr̥tā | vīḷupāṇī iti vīḷu-pāṇī || sam | andhāṁsi | agmata | matsarāṇi | mā | naḥ | mardhiṣṭam | ā | gatam | śivena ||7.73.4||

IAST: sam andhāṁsy agmata matsarāṇi mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gataṁ śivena
Griffith: The juices that exhilarate are mingled. Injure us not, but come with happy fortune.
Devanāgarī: समन्धांस्यग्मत मत्सराणि मा नो मर्धिष्टमा गतं शिवेन
pada pāṭha: upa | tyā | vahnī iti | gamataḥ | viśam | naḥ | rakṣaḥ-hanā | sam-bhr̥tā | vīḷupāṇī iti vīḷu-pāṇī || sam | andhāṁsi | agmata | matsarāṇi | mā | naḥ | mardhiṣṭam | ā | gatam | śivena ||7.73.4||

IAST: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād āśvinā yātam adharād udaktāt
Griffith: Come from the west, come from the cast, Nasatyas, come, Asvins, from below and from above us.
Devanāgarī: आ पश्चातान्नासत्या पुरस्तादाश्विना यातमधरादुदक्तात्
pada pāṭha: ā | paścātāt | nāsatyā | ā | purastāt | ā | aśvinā | yātam | adharāt | udaktāt || ā | viśvataḥ | pāñca-janyena | rāyā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.73.5||

IAST: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Bring wealth from all sides for the Fivefold People. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वतः पाञ्चजन्येन राया यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | paścātāt | nāsatyā | ā | purastāt | ā | aśvinā | yātam | adharāt | udaktāt || ā | viśvataḥ | pāñca-janyena | rāyā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.73.5||

IAST: imā u vāṁ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā
Griffith: THESE morning sacrifices call you, Asvins, at the break of day.
Devanāgarī: इमा उ वां दिविष्टय उस्रा हवन्ते अश्विना
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | vām | diviṣṭayaḥ | usrā | havante | aśvinā || ayam | vām | ahve | avase | śacīvasū iti śacī-vasū | viśam-viśam | hi | gacchathaḥ ||7.74.1||

IAST: ayaṁ vām ahve 'vase śacīvasū viśaṁ-viśaṁ hi gacchathaḥ
Griffith: For help have I invoked you rich in power and might: for, house by house ye visit all.
Devanāgarī: अयं वामह्वेऽवसे शचीवसू विशंविशं हि गच्छथः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | vām | diviṣṭayaḥ | usrā | havante | aśvinā || ayam | vām | ahve | avase | śacīvasū iti śacī-vasū | viśam-viśam | hi | gacchathaḥ ||7.74.1||

IAST: yuvaṁ citraṁ dadathur bhojanaṁ narā codethāṁ sūnṛtāvate
Griffith: O Heroes, ye bestow wonderful nourishment. send it to him whose songs are sweet
Devanāgarī: युवं चित्रं ददथुर्भोजनं नरा चोदेथां सूनृतावते
pada pāṭha: yuvam | citram | dadathuḥ | bhojanam | narā | codethām | sūnr̥tā-vate || arvāk | ratham | sa-manasā | ni | yacchatam | pibatam | somyam | madhu ||7.74.2||

IAST: arvāg rathaṁ samanasā ni yacchatam pibataṁ somyam madhu
Griffith: Accordant, both of you, drive your car down to us, and drink the savoury Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाग्रथं समनसा नि यच्छतं पिबतं सोम्यं मधु
pada pāṭha: yuvam | citram | dadathuḥ | bhojanam | narā | codethām | sūnr̥tā-vate || arvāk | ratham | sa-manasā | ni | yacchatam | pibatam | somyam | madhu ||7.74.2||

IAST: ā yātam upa bhūṣatam madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā
Griffith: Approach ye and be near to us. drink, O ye Asvins, of the meath.
Devanāgarī: आ यातमुप भूषतं मध्वः पिबतमश्विना
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | upa | bhūṣatam | madhvaḥ | pibatam | aśvinā || dugdham | payaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | jenyāvasū iti | mā | naḥ | mardhiṣṭam | ā | gatam ||7.74.3||

IAST: dugdham payo vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gatam
Griffith: Draw forth the milk, ye Mighty, rich in genuine wealth: injure us not, and come to us.
Devanāgarī: दुग्धं पयो वृषणा जेन्यावसू मा नो मर्धिष्टमा गतम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | upa | bhūṣatam | madhvaḥ | pibatam | aśvinā || dugdham | payaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | jenyāvasū iti | mā | naḥ | mardhiṣṭam | ā | gatam ||7.74.3||

IAST: aśvāso ye vām upa dāśuṣo gṛhaṁ yuvāṁ dīyanti bibhrataḥ
Griffith: The horses that convey you in their rapid flight down to the worshipper's abode,
Devanāgarī: अश्वासो ये वामुप दाशुषो गृहं युवां दीयन्ति बिभ्रतः
pada pāṭha: aśvāsaḥ | ye | vām | upa | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | yuvām | dīyanti | bibhrataḥ || makṣuyu-bhiḥ | narā | hayebhiḥ | aśvinā | ā | devā | yātam | asmayū ityasma-yū ||7.74.4||

IAST: makṣūyubhir narā hayebhir aśvinā devā yātam asmayū
Griffith: With these your speedy coursers, Heroes, Asvins, come, ye Gods, come well-inclined to us.
Devanāgarī: मक्षूयुभिर्नरा हयेभिरश्विना देवा यातमस्मयू
pada pāṭha: aśvāsaḥ | ye | vām | upa | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥ham | yuvām | dīyanti | bibhrataḥ || makṣuyu-bhiḥ | narā | hayebhiḥ | aśvinā | ā | devā | yātam | asmayū ityasma-yū ||7.74.4||

IAST: adhā ha yanto aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ
Griffith: Yea, verily, our princes seek the Asvins in pursuit of food.
Devanāgarī: अधा ह यन्तो अश्विना पृक्षः सचन्त सूरयः
pada pāṭha: adha | ha | yantaḥ | aśvinā | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacanta | sūrayaḥ || tā | yaṁsataḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dhruvam | yaśaḥ | chardiḥ | asmabhyam | nāsatyā ||7.74.5||

IAST: tā yaṁsato maghavadbhyo dhruvaṁ yaśaś chardir asmabhyaṁ nāsatyā
Griffith: These shall give lasting glory to our liberal lords, and, both Nasatyas, shelter us.
Devanāgarī: ता यंसतो मघवद्भ्यो ध्रुवं यशश्छर्दिरस्मभ्यं नासत्या
pada pāṭha: adha | ha | yantaḥ | aśvinā | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacanta | sūrayaḥ || tā | yaṁsataḥ | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dhruvam | yaśaḥ | chardiḥ | asmabhyam | nāsatyā ||7.74.5||

IAST: pra ye yayur avṛkāso rathā iva nṛpātāro janānām
Griffith: Those who have led the way, like cars, offending none, those who are guardians of the men-
Devanāgarī: प्र ये ययुरवृकासो रथा इव नृपातारो जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | yayuḥ | avr̥kāsaḥ | rathāḥ-iva | nr̥-pātāraḥ | janānām || uta | svena | śavasā | śūśuvuḥ | naraḥ | uta | kṣiyanti | su-kṣitim ||7.74.6||

IAST: uta svena śavasā śūśuvur nara uta kṣiyanti sukṣitim
Griffith: Also through their own might the heroes have grown strong, and dwell in safe and happy homes.
Devanāgarī: उत स्वेन शवसा शूशुवुर्नर उत क्षियन्ति सुक्षितिम्
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | yayuḥ | avr̥kāsaḥ | rathāḥ-iva | nr̥-pātāraḥ | janānām || uta | svena | śavasā | śūśuvuḥ | naraḥ | uta | kṣiyanti | su-kṣitim ||7.74.6||

IAST: vy uṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānam āgāt
Griffith: BORN in the heavens the Dawn hath flushed, and showing her majesty is come as Law ordaineth.
Devanāgarī: व्युषा आवो दिविजा ऋतेनाविष्कृण्वाना महिमानमागात्
pada pāṭha: vi | uṣāḥ | āvaḥ | divi-jāḥ | r̥tena | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānā | mahimānam | ā | agāt || apa | druhaḥ | tamaḥ | āvaḥ | ajuṣṭam | aṅgiraḥ-tamā | pathyāḥ | ajīgariti ||7.75.1||

IAST: apa druhas tama āvar ajuṣṭam aṅgirastamā pathyā ajīgaḥ
Griffith: She hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness; best of Angirases, hath waked the pathways.
Devanāgarī: अप द्रुहस्तम आवरजुष्टमङ्गिरस्तमा पथ्या अजीगः
pada pāṭha: vi | uṣāḥ | āvaḥ | divi-jāḥ | r̥tena | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānā | mahimānam | ā | agāt || apa | druhaḥ | tamaḥ | āvaḥ | ajuṣṭam | aṅgiraḥ-tamā | pathyāḥ | ajīgariti ||7.75.1||

IAST: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhy uṣo mahe saubhagāya pra yandhi
Griffith: Rouse us this day to high and happy fortune: to great felicity, O Dawn, promote us.
Devanāgarī: महे नो अद्य सुविताय बोध्युषो महे सौभगाय प्र यन्धि
pada pāṭha: mahe | naḥ | adya | suvitāya | bodhi | uṣaḥ | mahe | saubhagāya | pra | yandhi || citram | rayim | yaśasam | dhehi | asme iti | devi | marteṣu | mānuṣi | śravasyum ||7.75.2||

IAST: citraṁ rayiṁ yaśasaṁ dhehy asme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum
Griffith: Vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches, famed among mortals, man-befriending Goddess!
Devanāgarī: चित्रं रयिं यशसं धेह्यस्मे देवि मर्तेषु मानुषि श्रवस्युम्
pada pāṭha: mahe | naḥ | adya | suvitāya | bodhi | uṣaḥ | mahe | saubhagāya | pra | yandhi || citram | rayim | yaśasam | dhehi | asme iti | devi | marteṣu | mānuṣi | śravasyum ||7.75.2||

IAST: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāś citrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āguḥ
Griffith: See, lovely Morning's everlasting splendours, bright with their varied colours, have approached us.
Devanāgarī: एते त्ये भानवो दर्शतायाश्चित्रा उषसो अमृतास आगुः
pada pāṭha: ete | tye | bhānavaḥ | darśatāyāḥ | citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | ā | aguḥ || janayantaḥ | daivyāni | vratāni | ā-pr̥ṇantaḥ | antarikṣā | vi | asthuḥ ||7.75.3||

IAST: janayanto daivyāni vratāny āpṛṇanto antarikṣā vy asthuḥ
Griffith: Filling the region of mid-air, producing the rites of holy worship, they have mounted.
Devanāgarī: जनयन्तो दैव्यानि व्रतान्यापृणन्तो अन्तरिक्षा व्यस्थुः
pada pāṭha: ete | tye | bhānavaḥ | darśatāyāḥ | citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | ā | aguḥ || janayantaḥ | daivyāni | vratāni | ā-pr̥ṇantaḥ | antarikṣā | vi | asthuḥ ||7.75.3||

IAST: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jigāti
Griffith: She yokes her chariot far away, and swiftly visits the lands where the Five Tribes are settled,
Devanāgarī: एषा स्या युजाना पराकात्पञ्च क्षितीः परि सद्यो जिगाति
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | yujānā | parākāt | pañca | kṣitīḥ | pari | sadyaḥ | jigāti || abhi-paśyantī | vayunā | janānām | divaḥ | duhitā | bhuvanasya | patnī ||7.75.4||

IAST: abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṁ divo duhitā bhuvanasya patnī
Griffith: Looking upon the works and ways of mortals, Daughter of Heaven, the world's Imperial Lady.
Devanāgarī: अभिपश्यन्ती वयुना जनानां दिवो दुहिता भुवनस्य पत्नी
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | yujānā | parākāt | pañca | kṣitīḥ | pari | sadyaḥ | jigāti || abhi-paśyantī | vayunā | janānām | divaḥ | duhitā | bhuvanasya | patnī ||7.75.4||

IAST: vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām
Griffith: She who is rich in spoil, the Spouse of Surya, wondrously opulent, rules all wealth and treasures.
Devanāgarī: वाजिनीवती सूर्यस्य योषा चित्रामघा राय ईशे वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: vājinī-vatī | sūryasya | yoṣā | citra-maghā | rāyaḥ | īśe | vasūnām || r̥ṣi-stutā | jarayantī | maghonī | uṣāḥ | ucchati | vahni-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānā ||7.75.5||

IAST: ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghony uṣā ucchati vahnibhir gṛṇānā
Griffith: Consumer of our youth, the seers extol her: lauded by priests rich Dawn shines out refulgent.
Devanāgarī: ऋषिष्टुता जरयन्ती मघोन्युषा उच्छति वह्निभिर्गृणाना
pada pāṭha: vājinī-vatī | sūryasya | yoṣā | citra-maghā | rāyaḥ | īśe | vasūnām || r̥ṣi-stutā | jarayantī | maghonī | uṣāḥ | ucchati | vahni-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānā ||7.75.5||

IAST: prati dyutānām aruṣāso aśvāś citrā adṛśrann uṣasaṁ vahantaḥ
Griffith: Apparent are the steeds of varied colour, the red steeds carrying resplendent Morning.
Devanāgarī: प्रति द्युतानामरुषासो अश्वाश्चित्रा अदृश्रन्नुषसं वहन्तः
pada pāṭha: prati | dyutānām | aruṣāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | citrāḥ | adr̥śran | uṣasam | vahantaḥ || yāti | śubhrā | viśva-piśā | rathena | dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | janāya ||7.75.6||

IAST: yāti śubhrā viśvapiśā rathena dadhāti ratnaṁ vidhate janāya
Griffith: On her all-lovely car she comes, the Fair One, and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.
Devanāgarī: याति शुभ्रा विश्वपिशा रथेन दधाति रत्नं विधते जनाय
pada pāṭha: prati | dyutānām | aruṣāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | citrāḥ | adr̥śran | uṣasam | vahantaḥ || yāti | śubhrā | viśva-piśā | rathena | dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | janāya ||7.75.6||

IAST: satyā satyebhir mahatī mahadbhir devī devebhir yajatā yajatraiḥ
Griffith: True with the True and Mighty with the Mighty, with Gods a Goddess, Holy with the Holy,
Devanāgarī: सत्या सत्येभिर्महती महद्भिर्देवी देवेभिर्यजता यजत्रैः
pada pāṭha: satyā | satyebhiḥ | mahatī | mahat-bhiḥ | devī | devebhiḥ | yajatā | yajatraiḥ || rujat | dr̥ḷhāni | dadat | usriyāṇām | prati | gāvaḥ | uṣasam | vāvaśanta ||7.75.7||

IAST: rujad dṛḻhāni dadad usriyāṇām prati gāva uṣasaṁ vāvaśanta
Griffith: She brake strong fences down and gave the cattle: the kine were lowing as they greeted Morning.
Devanāgarī: रुजद्दृळ्हानि दददुस्रियाणां प्रति गाव उषसं वावशन्त
pada pāṭha: satyā | satyebhiḥ | mahatī | mahat-bhiḥ | devī | devebhiḥ | yajatā | yajatraiḥ || rujat | dr̥ḷhāni | dadat | usriyāṇām | prati | gāvaḥ | uṣasam | vāvaśanta ||7.75.7||

IAST: nū no gomad vīravad dhehi ratnam uṣo aśvāvat purubhojo asme
Griffith: O Dawn, now give us wealth in kine and heroes, and horses, fraught with manifold enjoyment.
Devanāgarī: नू नो गोमद्वीरवद्धेहि रत्नमुषो अश्वावत्पुरुभोजो अस्मे
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | go-mat | vīra-vat | dhehi | ratnam | uṣaḥ | aśva-vat | puru-bhojaḥ | asme iti || mā | naḥ | barhiḥ | puruṣatā | nide | kaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.75.8||

IAST: mā no barhiḥ puruṣatā nide kar yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Protect our sacred grass from man's reproaches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: मा नो बर्हिः पुरुषता निदे कर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | go-mat | vīra-vat | dhehi | ratnam | uṣaḥ | aśva-vat | puru-bhojaḥ | asme iti || mā | naḥ | barhiḥ | puruṣatā | nide | kaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.75.8||

IAST: ud u jyotir amṛtaṁ viśvajanyaṁ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret
Griffith: SAVITAR God of all men hath sent upward his light, designed for all mankind, immortal.
Devanāgarī: उदु ज्योतिरमृतं विश्वजन्यं विश्वानरः सविता देवो अश्रेत्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | jyotiḥ | amr̥tam | viśva-janyam | viśvānaraḥ | savitā | devaḥ | aśret || kratvā | devānām | ajaniṣṭa | cakṣuḥ | āviḥ | akaḥ | bhuvanam | viśvam | uṣāḥ ||7.76.1||

IAST: kratvā devānām ajaniṣṭa cakṣur āvir akar bhuvanaṁ viśvam uṣāḥ
Griffith: Through the Gods' power that Eye was first created. Dawn hath made all the universe apparent.
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वा देवानामजनिष्ट चक्षुराविरकर्भुवनं विश्वमुषाः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | jyotiḥ | amr̥tam | viśva-janyam | viśvānaraḥ | savitā | devaḥ | aśret || kratvā | devānām | ajaniṣṭa | cakṣuḥ | āviḥ | akaḥ | bhuvanam | viśvam | uṣāḥ ||7.76.1||
