IAST: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrann amardhanto vasubhir iṣkṛtāsaḥ
Griffith: I see the paths which Gods are wont to travel, innocuous paths made ready by the Vasus.
Devanāgarī: प्र मे पन्था देवयाना अदृश्रन्नमर्धन्तो वसुभिरिष्कृतासः
pada pāṭha: pra | me | panthāḥ | deva-yānāḥ | adr̥śran | amardhantaḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | iṣkr̥tāsaḥ || abhūt | ūm̐ iti | ketuḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | pratīcī | ā | agāt | adhi | harmyebhyaḥ ||7.76.2||

IAST: abhūd u ketur uṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcy āgād adhi harmyebhyaḥ
Griffith: Eastward the flag of Dawn hath been uplifted; she hath come hither o'er the tops of houses.
Devanāgarī: अभूदु केतुरुषसः पुरस्तात्प्रतीच्यागादधि हर्म्येभ्यः
pada pāṭha: pra | me | panthāḥ | deva-yānāḥ | adr̥śran | amardhantaḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | iṣkr̥tāsaḥ || abhūt | ūm̐ iti | ketuḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | pratīcī | ā | agāt | adhi | harmyebhyaḥ ||7.76.2||

IAST: tānīd ahāni bahulāny āsan yā prācīnam uditā sūryasya
Griffith: Great is, in truth, the number of the Mornings which were aforetime at the Sun's uprising.
Devanāgarī: तानीदहानि बहुलान्यासन्या प्राचीनमुदिता सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: tāni | it | ahāni | bahulāni | āsan | yā | prācīnam | ut-itā | sūryasya || yataḥ | pari | jāraḥ-iva | ā-carantī | uṣaḥ | dadr̥kṣe | na | punaḥ | yatī-iva ||7.76.3||

IAST: yataḥ pari jāra ivācaranty uṣo dadṛkṣe na punar yatīva
Griffith: Since thou, O Dawn, hast been beheld repairing as to thy love, as one no more to leave him.
Devanāgarī: यतः परि जार इवाचरन्त्युषो ददृक्षे न पुनर्यतीव
pada pāṭha: tāni | it | ahāni | bahulāni | āsan | yā | prācīnam | ut-itā | sūryasya || yataḥ | pari | jāraḥ-iva | ā-carantī | uṣaḥ | dadr̥kṣe | na | punaḥ | yatī-iva ||7.76.3||

IAST: ta id devānāṁ sadhamāda āsann ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ
Griffith: They were the Gods' companions at the banquet, the ancient sages true to Law Eternal.
Devanāgarī: त इद्देवानां सधमाद आसन्नृतावानः कवयः पूर्व्यासः
pada pāṭha: te | it | devānām | sadha-mādaḥ | āsan | r̥ta-vānaḥ | kavayaḥ | pūrvyāsaḥ || gūḷham | jyotiḥ | pitaraḥ | anu | avindan | satya-mantrāḥ | ajanayan | uṣasam ||7.76.4||

IAST: gūḻhaṁ jyotiḥ pitaro anv avindan satyamantrā ajanayann uṣāsam
Griffith: The Fathers found the light that lay in darkness, and with effectual words begat the Morning.
Devanāgarī: गूळ्हं ज्योतिः पितरो अन्वविन्दन्सत्यमन्त्रा अजनयन्नुषासम्
pada pāṭha: te | it | devānām | sadha-mādaḥ | āsan | r̥ta-vānaḥ | kavayaḥ | pūrvyāsaḥ || gūḷham | jyotiḥ | pitaraḥ | anu | avindan | satya-mantrāḥ | ajanayan | uṣasam ||7.76.4||

IAST: samāna ūrve adhi saṁgatāsaḥ saṁ jānate na yatante mithas te
Griffith: Meeting together in the same enclosure, they strive not, ofone mind, one with another.
Devanāgarī: समान ऊर्वे अधि संगतासः सं जानते न यतन्ते मिथस्ते
pada pāṭha: samāne | ūrve | adhi | sam-gatāsaḥ | sam | jānate | na | yatante | mithaḥ | te || te | devānām | na | minanti | vratāni | amardhantaḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | yādamānāḥ ||7.76.5||

IAST: te devānāṁ na minanti vratāny amardhanto vasubhir yādamānāḥ
Griffith: They never break the Gods' eternal statutes, and injure none, in rivalry with Vasus.
Devanāgarī: ते देवानां न मिनन्ति व्रतान्यमर्धन्तो वसुभिर्यादमानाः
pada pāṭha: samāne | ūrve | adhi | sam-gatāsaḥ | sam | jānate | na | yatante | mithaḥ | te || te | devānām | na | minanti | vratāni | amardhantaḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | yādamānāḥ ||7.76.5||

IAST: prati tvā stomair īḻate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvāṁsaḥ
Griffith: Extolling thee, Blest Goddess, the Vasisthas, awake at early mom, with lauds implore thee.
Devanāgarī: प्रति त्वा स्तोमैरीळते वसिष्ठा उषर्बुधः सुभगे तुष्टुवांसः
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | stomaiḥ | īḷate | vasiṣṭhāḥ | uṣaḥ-budhaḥ | su-bhage | tustu-vāṁsaḥ || gavām | netrī | vāja-patnī | naḥ | uccha | uṣaḥ | su-jāte | prathamā | jarasva ||7.76.6||

IAST: gavāṁ netrī vājapatnī na ucchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva
Griffith: Leader of kine and Queen of all that strengthens, shine, come as first to us, O high-born Morning.
Devanāgarī: गवां नेत्री वाजपत्नी न उच्छोषः सुजाते प्रथमा जरस्व
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | stomaiḥ | īḷate | vasiṣṭhāḥ | uṣaḥ-budhaḥ | su-bhage | tustu-vāṁsaḥ || gavām | netrī | vāja-patnī | naḥ | uccha | uṣaḥ | su-jāte | prathamā | jarasva ||7.76.6||

IAST: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānām uṣā ucchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ
Griffith: She bringeth bounty and sweet charm of voices. The flushing Dawn is sung by the Vasisthas,
Devanāgarī: एषा नेत्री राधसः सूनृतानामुषा उच्छन्ती रिभ्यते वसिष्ठैः
pada pāṭha: eṣā | netrī | rādhasaḥ | sūnr̥tānām | uṣāḥ | ucchantī | ribhyate | vasiṣṭhaiḥ || dīrgha-śrutam | rayim | asme iti | dadhānā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.76.7||

IAST: dīrghaśrutaṁ rayim asme dadhānā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Giving us riches famed to distant places. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: दीर्घश्रुतं रयिमस्मे दधाना यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: eṣā | netrī | rādhasaḥ | sūnr̥tānām | uṣāḥ | ucchantī | ribhyate | vasiṣṭhaiḥ || dīrgha-śrutam | rayim | asme iti | dadhānā | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.76.7||

IAST: upo ruruce yuvatir na yoṣā viśvaṁ jīvam prasuvantī carāyai
Griffith: SHE hath shone brightly like a youthful woman, stirring to motion every living creature.
Devanāgarī: उपो रुरुचे युवतिर्न योषा विश्वं जीवं प्रसुवन्ती चरायै
pada pāṭha: upo iti | ruruce | yuvatiḥ | na | yoṣā | viśvam | jīvam | pra-suvantī | carāyai || abhūt | agniḥ | sam-idhe | mānuṣāṇām | akaḥ | jyotiḥ | bādhamānā | tamāṁsi ||7.77.1||

IAST: abhūd agniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇām akar jyotir bādhamānā tamāṁsi
Griffith: Agni hath come to feed on mortal? fuel. She hath made light and chased away the darkness.
Devanāgarī: अभूदग्निः समिधे मानुषाणामकर्ज्योतिर्बाधमाना तमांसि
pada pāṭha: upo iti | ruruce | yuvatiḥ | na | yoṣā | viśvam | jīvam | pra-suvantī | carāyai || abhūt | agniḥ | sam-idhe | mānuṣāṇām | akaḥ | jyotiḥ | bādhamānā | tamāṁsi ||7.77.1||

IAST: viśvam pratīcī saprathā ud asthād ruśad vāso bibhratī śukram aśvait
Griffith: Turned to this All, far-spreading, she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her.
Devanāgarī: विश्वं प्रतीची सप्रथा उदस्थाद्रुशद्वासो बिभ्रती शुक्रमश्वैत्
pada pāṭha: viśvam | pratīcī | sa-prathāḥ | ut | asthāt | ruśat | vāsaḥ | bibhratī | śukram | aśvait || hiraṇya-varṇā | sudr̥śīka-saṁdr̥k | gavām | mātā | netrī | ahnām | aroci ||7.77.2||

IAST: hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasaṁdṛg gavām mātā netry ahnām aroci
Griffith: She hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours, Mother of kine, Guide of the days she bringeth.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यवर्णा सुदृशीकसंदृग्गवां माता नेत्र्यह्नामरोचि
pada pāṭha: viśvam | pratīcī | sa-prathāḥ | ut | asthāt | ruśat | vāsaḥ | bibhratī | śukram | aśvait || hiraṇya-varṇā | sudr̥śīka-saṁdr̥k | gavām | mātā | netrī | ahnām | aroci ||7.77.2||

IAST: devānāṁ cakṣuḥ subhagā vahantī śvetaṁ nayantī sudṛśīkam aśvam
Griffith: Bearing the Gods' own Eye, auspicious Lady, leading her Courser white and fair to look on,
Devanāgarī: देवानां चक्षुः सुभगा वहन्ती श्वेतं नयन्ती सुदृशीकमश्वम्
pada pāṭha: devānām | cakṣuḥ | su-bhagā | vahantī | śvetam | nayantī | su-dr̥śīkam | aśvam || uṣāḥ | adarśi | raśmi-bhiḥ | vi-aktā | citra-maghā | viśvam | anu | pra-bhūtā ||7.77.3||

IAST: uṣā adarśi raśmibhir vyaktā citrāmaghā viśvam anu prabhūtā
Griffith: Distinguished by her bean-is Dawn shines apparent, come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.
Devanāgarī: उषा अदर्शि रश्मिभिर्व्यक्ता चित्रामघा विश्वमनु प्रभूता
pada pāṭha: devānām | cakṣuḥ | su-bhagā | vahantī | śvetam | nayantī | su-dr̥śīkam | aśvam || uṣāḥ | adarśi | raśmi-bhiḥ | vi-aktā | citra-maghā | viśvam | anu | pra-bhūtā ||7.77.3||

IAST: antivāmā dūre amitram ucchorvīṁ gavyūtim abhayaṁ kṛdhī naḥ
Griffith: Draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman: prepare for us wide pasture free from danger.
Devanāgarī: अन्तिवामा दूरे अमित्रमुच्छोर्वीं गव्यूतिमभयं कृधी नः
pada pāṭha: anti-vāmā | dūre | amitram | uccha | urvīm | gavyūtim | abhayam | kr̥dhi | naḥ || yavaya | dveṣaḥ | ā | bhara | vasūni | codaya | rādhaḥ | gr̥ṇate | maghoni ||7.77.4||

IAST: yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho gṛṇate maghoni
Griffith: Drive away those who hate us, bring us riches: pour bounty, opulent Lady, on the singer.
Devanāgarī: यावय द्वेष आ भरा वसूनि चोदय राधो गृणते मघोनि
pada pāṭha: anti-vāmā | dūre | amitram | uccha | urvīm | gavyūtim | abhayam | kr̥dhi | naḥ || yavaya | dveṣaḥ | ā | bhara | vasūni | codaya | rādhaḥ | gr̥ṇate | maghoni ||7.77.4||

IAST: asme śreṣṭhebhir bhānubhir vi bhāhy uṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ
Griffith: Send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us, giving us lengthened days, O Dawn, O Goddess,
Devanāgarī: अस्मे श्रेष्ठेभिर्भानुभिर्वि भाह्युषो देवि प्रतिरन्ती न आयुः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | śreṣṭhebhiḥ | bhānu-bhiḥ | vi | bhāhi | uṣaḥ | devi | pra-tirantī | naḥ | āyuḥ || iṣam | ca | naḥ | dadhatī | viśva-vāre | go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | ca | rādhaḥ ||7.77.5||

IAST: iṣaṁ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre gomad aśvāvad rathavac ca rādhaḥ
Griffith: Granting us food, thou who hast all things precious, and bounty rich in chariots, kine, and horses.
Devanāgarī: इषं च नो दधती विश्ववारे गोमदश्वावद्रथवच्च राधः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | śreṣṭhebhiḥ | bhānu-bhiḥ | vi | bhāhi | uṣaḥ | devi | pra-tirantī | naḥ | āyuḥ || iṣam | ca | naḥ | dadhatī | viśva-vāre | go-mat | aśva-vat | ratha-vat | ca | rādhaḥ ||7.77.5||

IAST: yāṁ tvā divo duhitar vardhayanty uṣaḥ sujāte matibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: O Usas, nobly-born, Daughter of Heaven, whom the Vasisthas with their hymns make mighty,
Devanāgarī: यां त्वा दिवो दुहितर्वर्धयन्त्युषः सुजाते मतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: yām | tvā | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | vardhayanti | uṣaḥ | su-jāte | mati-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || sā | asmāsu | dhāḥ | rayim | r̥ṣvam | br̥hantam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.77.6||

IAST: sāsmāsu dhā rayim ṛṣvam bṛhantaṁ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सास्मासु धा रयिमृष्वं बृहन्तं यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: yām | tvā | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | vardhayanti | uṣaḥ | su-jāte | mati-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || sā | asmāsu | dhāḥ | rayim | r̥ṣvam | br̥hantam | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.77.6||

IAST: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrann ūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante
Griffith: WE have beheld her earliest lights approaching: her many glories part, on high, asunder.
Devanāgarī: प्रति केतवः प्रथमा अदृश्रन्नूर्ध्वा अस्या अञ्जयो वि श्रयन्ते
pada pāṭha: prati | ketavaḥ | prathamāḥ | adr̥śran | ūrdhvāḥ | asyāḥ | añjayaḥ | vi | śrayante || uṣaḥ | arvācā | br̥hatā | rathena | jyotiṣmatā | vāmam | asmabhyam | vakṣi ||7.78.1||

IAST: uṣo arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmam asmabhyaṁ vakṣi
Griffith: On car sublime, refulgent, wending hither, O Usas, bring the Wealth that makes us happy.
Devanāgarī: उषो अर्वाचा बृहता रथेन ज्योतिष्मता वाममस्मभ्यं वक्षि
pada pāṭha: prati | ketavaḥ | prathamāḥ | adr̥śran | ūrdhvāḥ | asyāḥ | añjayaḥ | vi | śrayante || uṣaḥ | arvācā | br̥hatā | rathena | jyotiṣmatā | vāmam | asmabhyam | vakṣi ||7.78.1||

IAST: prati ṣīm agnir jarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhir gṛṇantaḥ
Griffith: The fire well-kindIed sings aloud to greet her, and with their hymns the priests are chaming welcome.
Devanāgarī: प्रति षीमग्निर्जरते समिद्धः प्रति विप्रासो मतिभिर्गृणन्तः
pada pāṭha: prati | sīm | agniḥ | jarate | sam-iddhaḥ | prati | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ || uṣāḥ | yāti | jyotiṣā | bādhamānā | viśvā | tamāṁsi | duḥ-itā | apa | devī ||7.78.2||

IAST: uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṁsi duritāpa devī
Griffith: Usas approaches in her splendour, driving all evil darkness far away, the Goddess.
Devanāgarī: उषा याति ज्योतिषा बाधमाना विश्वा तमांसि दुरिताप देवी
pada pāṭha: prati | sīm | agniḥ | jarate | sam-iddhaḥ | prati | viprāsaḥ | mati-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ || uṣāḥ | yāti | jyotiṣā | bādhamānā | viśvā | tamāṁsi | duḥ-itā | apa | devī ||7.78.2||

IAST: etā u tyāḥ praty adṛśran purastāj jyotir yacchantīr uṣaso vibhātīḥ
Griffith: Apparent eastward are those lights of Morning, sending out lustre, as they rise, around them.
Devanāgarī: एता उ त्याः प्रत्यदृश्रन्पुरस्ताज्ज्योतिर्यच्छन्तीरुषसो विभातीः
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tyāḥ | prati | adr̥śran | purastāt | jyotiḥ | yacchantīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ || ajījanan | sūryam | yajñam | agnim | apācīnam | tamaḥ | agāt | ajuṣṭam ||7.78.3||

IAST: ajījanan sūryaṁ yajñam agnim apācīnaṁ tamo agād ajuṣṭam
Griffith: She hath brought forth Sun, sacrifice, and Agni, and far away hath fled detested darkness.
Devanāgarī: अजीजनन्सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निमपाचीनं तमो अगादजुष्टम्
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tyāḥ | prati | adr̥śran | purastāt | jyotiḥ | yacchantīḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ || ajījanan | sūryam | yajñam | agnim | apācīnam | tamaḥ | agāt | ajuṣṭam ||7.78.3||

IAST: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyanty uṣasaṁ vibhātīm
Griffith: Rich Daughter of the Sky, we all behold her, yea, all men look on Dawn as she is breaking.
Devanāgarī: अचेति दिवो दुहिता मघोनी विश्वे पश्यन्त्युषसं विभातीम्
pada pāṭha: aceti | divaḥ | duhitā | maghonī | viśve | paśyanti | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm || ā | asthāt | ratham | svadhayā | yujyamānam | ā | yam | aśvāsaḥ | su-yujaḥ | vahanti ||7.78.4||

IAST: āsthād rathaṁ svadhayā yujyamānam ā yam aśvāsaḥ suyujo vahanti
Griffith: fler car that moves self-harnessed hath she mounted, the car drawn onward by her well-yoked horses.
Devanāgarī: आस्थाद्रथं स्वधया युज्यमानमा यमश्वासः सुयुजो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: aceti | divaḥ | duhitā | maghonī | viśve | paśyanti | uṣasam | vi-bhātīm || ā | asthāt | ratham | svadhayā | yujyamānam | ā | yam | aśvāsaḥ | su-yujaḥ | vahanti ||7.78.4||

IAST: prati tvādya sumanaso budhantāsmākāso maghavāno vayaṁ ca
Griffith: Inspired with loving thoughts this day to greet thee, we and our wealthy nobles have awakened.
Devanāgarī: प्रति त्वाद्य सुमनसो बुधन्तास्माकासो मघवानो वयं च
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | adya | su-manasaḥ | budhanta | asmākāsaḥ | magha-vānaḥ | vayam | ca || tilvilāyadhvam | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.78.5||

IAST: tilvilāyadhvam uṣaso vibhātīr yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Show yourselves fruitful, Dawns, as ye are rising. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: तिल्विलायध्वमुषसो विभातीर्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | adya | su-manasaḥ | budhanta | asmākāsaḥ | magha-vānaḥ | vayam | ca || tilvilāyadhvam | uṣasaḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.78.5||

IAST: vy uṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānām pañca kṣitīr mānuṣīr bodhayantī
Griffith: ROUSING the lands where men's Five Tribes are settled, Dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people.
Devanāgarī: व्युषा आवः पथ्या जनानां पञ्च क्षितीर्मानुषीर्बोधयन्ती
pada pāṭha: vi | uṣāḥ | āvaḥ | pathyā | janānām | pañca | kṣitīḥ | mānuṣīḥ | bodhayantī || susaṁdr̥k-bhiḥ | ukṣa-bhiḥ | bhānum | aśret | vi | sūryaḥ | rodasī iti | cakṣasā | āvarityāvaḥ ||7.79.1||

IAST: susaṁdṛgbhir ukṣabhir bhānum aśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ
Griffith: She hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen. The Sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: सुसंदृग्भिरुक्षभिर्भानुमश्रेद्वि सूर्यो रोदसी चक्षसावः
pada pāṭha: vi | uṣāḥ | āvaḥ | pathyā | janānām | pañca | kṣitīḥ | mānuṣīḥ | bodhayantī || susaṁdr̥k-bhiḥ | ukṣa-bhiḥ | bhānum | aśret | vi | sūryaḥ | rodasī iti | cakṣasā | āvarityāvaḥ ||7.79.1||

IAST: vy añjate divo anteṣv aktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante
Griffith: They paint their bright rays on the sky's far limits. the Dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle.
Devanāgarī: व्यञ्जते दिवो अन्तेष्वक्तून्विशो न युक्ता उषसो यतन्ते
pada pāṭha: vi | añjate | divaḥ | anteṣu | aktūn | viśaḥ | na | yuktāḥ | uṣasaḥ | yatante || sam | te | gāvaḥ | tamaḥ | ā | vartayanti | jyotiḥ | yacchanti | savitā-iva | bāhū iti ||7.79.2||

IAST: saṁ te gāvas tama ā vartayanti jyotir yacchanti saviteva bāhū
Griffith: Thy cattle, closely shutting up the darkness, as Savitar spreads his arms, give forth their lustre.
Devanāgarī: सं ते गावस्तम आ वर्तयन्ति ज्योतिर्यच्छन्ति सवितेव बाहू
pada pāṭha: vi | añjate | divaḥ | anteṣu | aktūn | viśaḥ | na | yuktāḥ | uṣasaḥ | yatante || sam | te | gāvaḥ | tamaḥ | ā | vartayanti | jyotiḥ | yacchanti | savitā-iva | bāhū iti ||7.79.2||

IAST: abhūd uṣā indratamā maghony ajījanat suvitāya śravāṁsi
Griffith: Wealthy, most like to Indra, Dawn hath risen, and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare.
Devanāgarī: अभूदुषा इन्द्रतमा मघोन्यजीजनत्सुविताय श्रवांसि
pada pāṭha: abhūt | uṣāḥ | indra-tamā | maghonī | ajījanat | suvitāya | śravāṁsi || vi | divaḥ | devī | duhitā | dadhāti | aṅgiraḥ-tamā | su-kr̥te | vasūni ||7.79.3||

IAST: vi divo devī duhitā dadhāty aṅgirastamā sukṛte vasūni
Griffith: Daughter of Heaven, a Goddess, she distributes, best of Angirases, treasures to the pious.
Devanāgarī: वि दिवो देवी दुहिता दधात्यङ्गिरस्तमा सुकृते वसूनि
pada pāṭha: abhūt | uṣāḥ | indra-tamā | maghonī | ajījanat | suvitāya | śravāṁsi || vi | divaḥ | devī | duhitā | dadhāti | aṅgiraḥ-tamā | su-kr̥te | vasūni ||7.79.3||

IAST: tāvad uṣo rādho asmabhyaṁ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado gṛṇānā
Griffith: Bestow on us, O Dawn, that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises;
Devanāgarī: तावदुषो राधो अस्मभ्यं रास्व यावत्स्तोतृभ्यो अरदो गृणाना
pada pāṭha: tāvat | uṣaḥ | rādhaḥ | asmabhyam | rāsva | yāvat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | aradaḥ | gr̥ṇānā || yām | tvā | jajñuḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | raveṇa | vi | dr̥ḷhasya | duraḥ | adreḥ | aurṇoḥ ||7.79.4||

IAST: yāṁ tvā jajñur vṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḻhasya duro adrer aurṇoḥ
Griffith: Thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened: thou didst unbar the firm-set mountain's portals.
Devanāgarī: यां त्वा जज्ञुर्वृषभस्या रवेण वि दृळ्हस्य दुरो अद्रेरौर्णोः
pada pāṭha: tāvat | uṣaḥ | rādhaḥ | asmabhyam | rāsva | yāvat | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | aradaḥ | gr̥ṇānā || yām | tvā | jajñuḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | raveṇa | vi | dr̥ḷhasya | duraḥ | adreḥ | aurṇoḥ ||7.79.4||

IAST: devaṁ-devaṁ rādhase codayanty asmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī
Griffith: Impelling every God to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices,
Devanāgarī: देवंदेवं राधसे चोदयन्त्यस्मद्र्यक्सूनृता ईरयन्ती
pada pāṭha: devam-devam | rādhase | codayantī | asmadryak | sūnr̥tāḥ | īrayantī || vi-ucchantī | naḥ | sanaye | dhiyaḥ | dhāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.79.5||

IAST: vyucchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us thoughts, for profit, as thou breakest. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: व्युच्छन्ती नः सनये धियो धा यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: devam-devam | rādhase | codayantī | asmadryak | sūnr̥tāḥ | īrayantī || vi-ucchantī | naḥ | sanaye | dhiyaḥ | dhāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.79.5||

IAST: prati stomebhir uṣasaṁ vasiṣṭhā gīrbhir viprāsaḥ prathamā abudhran
Griffith: THE priests, Vasisthas, are the first awakened to welcome Usas with their songs and praises,
Devanāgarī: प्रति स्तोमेभिरुषसं वसिष्ठा गीर्भिर्विप्रासः प्रथमा अबुध्रन्
pada pāṭha: prati | stomebhiḥ | uṣasam | vasiṣṭhāḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | viprāsaḥ | prathamāḥ | abudhran || vi-vartayantīm | rajasī iti | samante iti sam-ante | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvatīm | bhuvanāni | viśvā ||7.80.1||

IAST: vivartayantīṁ rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīm bhuvanāni viśvā
Griffith: Who makes surrounding regions part asunder,and shows apparent all existing creatures.
Devanāgarī: विवर्तयन्तीं रजसी समन्ते आविष्कृण्वतीं भुवनानि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: prati | stomebhiḥ | uṣasam | vasiṣṭhāḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | viprāsaḥ | prathamāḥ | abudhran || vi-vartayantīm | rajasī iti | samante iti sam-ante | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvatīm | bhuvanāni | viśvā ||7.80.1||

IAST: eṣā syā navyam āyur dadhānā gūḍhvī tamo jyotiṣoṣā abodhi
Griffith: Giving fresh life when she hath hid the darkness, this Dawn hath wakened there with new-born lustre.
Devanāgarī: एषा स्या नव्यमायुर्दधाना गूढ्वी तमो ज्योतिषोषा अबोधि
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | navyam | āyuḥ | dadhānā | gūḍhvī | tamaḥ | jyotiṣā | uṣāḥ | abodhi || agre | eti | yuvatiḥ | ahrayāṇā | pra | acikitat | sūryam | yajñam | agnim ||7.80.2||

IAST: agra eti yuvatir ahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryaṁ yajñam agnim
Griffith: Youthful and unrestrained she cometh forward: she hath turned thoughts to Sun and fire and worship.
Devanāgarī: अग्र एति युवतिरह्रयाणा प्राचिकितत्सूर्यं यज्ञमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | navyam | āyuḥ | dadhānā | gūḍhvī | tamaḥ | jyotiṣā | uṣāḥ | abodhi || agre | eti | yuvatiḥ | ahrayāṇā | pra | acikitat | sūryam | yajñam | agnim ||7.80.2||

IAST: aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
Griffith: May blessed Mornings shine on us for ever, with wealth of kine, of horses, and of heroes,
Devanāgarī: अश्वावतीर्गोमतीर्न उषासो वीरवतीः सदमुच्छन्तु भद्राः
pada pāṭha: aśva-vatīḥ | go-matīḥ | naḥ | uṣasaḥ | vīra-vatīḥ | sadam | ucchantu | bhadrāḥ || ghr̥tam | duhānāḥ | viśvataḥ | pra-pītāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.80.3||

IAST: ghṛtaṁ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Streaming with all abundance, pouring fatness. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: घृतं दुहाना विश्वतः प्रपीता यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: aśva-vatīḥ | go-matīḥ | naḥ | uṣasaḥ | vīra-vatīḥ | sadam | ucchantu | bhadrāḥ || ghr̥tam | duhānāḥ | viśvataḥ | pra-pītāḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.80.3||

IAST: praty u adarśy āyaty ucchantī duhitā divaḥ
Griffith: ADVANCING, sending forth her rays, the Daughter of the Sky is seen.
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यु अदर्श्यायत्युच्छन्ती दुहिता दिवः
pada pāṭha: prati | ūm̐ iti | adarśi | ā-yatī | ucchantī | duhitā | divaḥ || apo iti | mahi | vyayati | cakṣase | tamaḥ | jyotiḥ | kr̥ṇoti | sūnarī ||7.81.1||

IAST: apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī
Griffith: Uncovering, that we may see, the mighty gloom, the friendly Lady makes the light.
Devanāgarī: अपो महि व्ययति चक्षसे तमो ज्योतिष्कृणोति सूनरी
pada pāṭha: prati | ūm̐ iti | adarśi | ā-yatī | ucchantī | duhitā | divaḥ || apo iti | mahi | vyayati | cakṣase | tamaḥ | jyotiḥ | kr̥ṇoti | sūnarī ||7.81.1||

IAST: ud usriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacām̐ udyan nakṣatram arcivat
Griffith: The Sun ascending, the refulgent Star, pours down his beams together with the Dawn.
Devanāgarī: उदुस्रियाः सृजते सूर्यः सचाँ उद्यन्नक्षत्रमर्चिवत्
pada pāṭha: ut | usriyāḥ | sr̥jate | sūryaḥ | sacā | ut-yat | nakṣatram | arci-vat || tava | it | uṣaḥ | vi-uṣi | sūryasya | ca | sam | bhaktena | gamemahi ||7.81.2||

IAST: taved uṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca sam bhaktena gamemahi
Griffith: O Dawn, at thine arising, and the Sun's, may we attain the share allotted us.
Devanāgarī: तवेदुषो व्युषि सूर्यस्य च सं भक्तेन गमेमहि
pada pāṭha: ut | usriyāḥ | sr̥jate | sūryaḥ | sacā | ut-yat | nakṣatram | arci-vat || tava | it | uṣaḥ | vi-uṣi | sūryasya | ca | sam | bhaktena | gamemahi ||7.81.2||

IAST: prati tvā duhitar diva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi
Griffith: Promptly we woke to welcome thee, O Usas, Daughter of the Sky,
Devanāgarī: प्रति त्वा दुहितर्दिव उषो जीरा अभुत्स्महि
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | duhitaḥ | divaḥ | uṣaḥ | jīrāḥ | abhutsmahi || yā | vahasi | puru | spārham | vanan-vati | ratnam | na | dāśuṣe | mayaḥ ||7.81.3||

IAST: yā vahasi puru spārhaṁ vananvati ratnaṁ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ
Griffith: Thee, Bounteous One, who bringest all we long to have, and to the offerer health and wealth.
Devanāgarī: या वहसि पुरु स्पार्हं वनन्वति रत्नं न दाशुषे मयः
pada pāṭha: prati | tvā | duhitaḥ | divaḥ | uṣaḥ | jīrāḥ | abhutsmahi || yā | vahasi | puru | spārham | vanan-vati | ratnam | na | dāśuṣe | mayaḥ ||7.81.3||

IAST: ucchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṁhanā mahi prakhyai devi svar dṛśe
Griffith: Thou, dawning, workest fain to light the great world, yea, heaven, Goddess! that it may be seen.
Devanāgarī: उच्छन्ती या कृणोषि मंहना महि प्रख्यै देवि स्वर्दृशे
pada pāṭha: ucchantī | yā | kr̥ṇoṣi | maṁhanā | mahi | pra-khyai | devi | svaḥ | dr̥śe || tasyāḥ | te | ratna-bhājaḥ | īmahe | vayam | syāma | mātuḥ | na | sūnavaḥ ||7.81.4||

IAST: tasyās te ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṁ syāma mātur na sūnavaḥ
Griffith: We yearn to be thine own, Dealer of Wealth: may we be to this Mother like her sons.
Devanāgarī: तस्यास्ते रत्नभाज ईमहे वयं स्याम मातुर्न सूनवः
pada pāṭha: ucchantī | yā | kr̥ṇoṣi | maṁhanā | mahi | pra-khyai | devi | svaḥ | dr̥śe || tasyāḥ | te | ratna-bhājaḥ | īmahe | vayam | syāma | mātuḥ | na | sūnavaḥ ||7.81.4||

IAST: tac citraṁ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam
Griffith: Bring us that wondrous bounty, Dawn, that shall be famed most far away.
Devanāgarī: तच्चित्रं राध आ भरोषो यद्दीर्घश्रुत्तमम्
pada pāṭha: tat | citram | rādhaḥ | ā | bhara | uṣaḥ | yat | dīrghaśrut-tamam || yat | te | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | marta-bhojanam | tat | rāsva | bhunajāmahai ||7.81.5||

IAST: yat te divo duhitar martabhojanaṁ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai
Griffith: What, Child of Heaven, thou hast of nourishment for man, bestow thou on us to enjoy.
Devanāgarī: यत्ते दिवो दुहितर्मर्तभोजनं तद्रास्व भुनजामहै
pada pāṭha: tat | citram | rādhaḥ | ā | bhara | uṣaḥ | yat | dīrghaśrut-tamam || yat | te | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | marta-bhojanam | tat | rāsva | bhunajāmahai ||7.81.5||

IAST: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṁ vasutvanaṁ vājām̐ asmabhyaṁ gomataḥ
Griffith: Give to our princes opulence and immortal fame, and strength in herds of kine to us.
Devanāgarī: श्रवः सूरिभ्यो अमृतं वसुत्वनं वाजाँ अस्मभ्यं गोमतः
pada pāṭha: śravaḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | amr̥tam | vasu-tvanam | vājān | asmabhyam | go-mataḥ || codayitrī | maghonaḥ | sūnr̥tā-vatī | uṣāḥ | ucchat | apa | sridhaḥ ||7.81.6||

IAST: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvaty uṣā ucchad apa sridhaḥ
Griffith: May she who prompts the wealthy, Lady of sweet strains, may Usas dawn our foes away.
Devanāgarī: चोदयित्री मघोनः सूनृतावत्युषा उच्छदप स्रिधः
pada pāṭha: śravaḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | amr̥tam | vasu-tvanam | vājān | asmabhyam | go-mataḥ || codayitrī | maghonaḥ | sūnr̥tā-vatī | uṣāḥ | ucchat | apa | sridhaḥ ||7.81.6||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā yuvam adhvarāya no viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam
Griffith: GRANT us your strong protection, IndraVaruna, our people, and our family, for sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा युवमध्वराय नो विशे जनाय महि शर्म यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | yuvam | adhvarāya | naḥ | viśe | janāya | mahi | śarma | yacchatam || dīrgha-prayajyum | ati | yaḥ | vanuṣyati | vayam | jayema | pr̥tanāsu | duḥ-dhyaḥ ||7.82.1||

IAST: dīrghaprayajyum ati yo vanuṣyati vayaṁ jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ
Griffith: May we subdue in fight our evil-hearted foes, him who attacks the man steadfast in lengthened rites.
Devanāgarī: दीर्घप्रयज्युमति यो वनुष्यति वयं जयेम पृतनासु दूढ्यः
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | yuvam | adhvarāya | naḥ | viśe | janāya | mahi | śarma | yacchatam || dīrgha-prayajyum | ati | yaḥ | vanuṣyati | vayam | jayema | pr̥tanāsu | duḥ-dhyaḥ ||7.82.1||

IAST: samrāḻ anyaḥ svarāḻ anya ucyate vām mahāntāv indrāvaruṇā mahāvasū
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, mighty and very rich One of you is called Monarch and One Autocrat.
Devanāgarī: सम्राळन्यः स्वराळन्य उच्यते वां महान्ताविन्द्रावरुणा महावसू
pada pāṭha: sam-rāṭ | anyaḥ | sva-rāṭ | anyaḥ | ucyate | vām | mahāntau | indrāvaruṇā | mahāvasū iti mahā-vasū || viśve | devāsaḥ | parame | vi-omani | sam | vām | ojaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | sam | balam | dadhuḥ ||7.82.2||

IAST: viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani saṁ vām ojo vṛṣaṇā sam balaṁ dadhuḥ
Griffith: All Gods in the most lofty region of the air have, O ye Steers, combined all power and might in you.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवासः परमे व्योमनि सं वामोजो वृषणा सं बलं दधुः
pada pāṭha: sam-rāṭ | anyaḥ | sva-rāṭ | anyaḥ | ucyate | vām | mahāntau | indrāvaruṇā | mahāvasū iti mahā-vasū || viśve | devāsaḥ | parame | vi-omani | sam | vām | ojaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇā | sam | balam | dadhuḥ ||7.82.2||

IAST: anv apāṁ khāny atṛntam ojasā sūryam airayataṁ divi prabhum
Griffith: Ye with your strength have pierced the fountains of the floods: the Sun have ye brought forward as the Lo
Devanāgarī: अन्वपां खान्यतृन्तमोजसा सूर्यमैरयतं दिवि प्रभुम्
pada pāṭha: anu | apām | khāni | atr̥ntam | ojasā | ā | sūryam | airayatam | divi | pra-bhum || indrāvaruṇā | made | asya | māyinaḥ | apinvatam | apitaḥ | pinvatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.82.3||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā made asya māyino 'pinvatam apitaḥ pinvataṁ dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Cheered by this magic draught ye, Indra-Varuna, made the dry places stream, made songs of praise flow fo
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा मदे अस्य मायिनोऽपिन्वतमपितः पिन्वतं धियः
pada pāṭha: anu | apām | khāni | atr̥ntam | ojasā | ā | sūryam | airayatam | divi | pra-bhum || indrāvaruṇā | made | asya | māyinaḥ | apinvatam | apitaḥ | pinvatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.82.3||

IAST: yuvām id yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayo yuvāṁ kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ
Griffith: In battels and in frays we ministering priests, kneeling upon our knees for furtherance of our weal,
Devanāgarī: युवामिद्युत्सु पृतनासु वह्नयो युवां क्षेमस्य प्रसवे मितज्ञवः
pada pāṭha: yuvām | it | yut-su | pr̥tanāsu | vahnayaḥ | yuvām | kṣemasya | pra-save | mita-jñavaḥ || īśānā | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | kāravaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | su-havā | havāmahe ||7.82.4||

IAST: īśānā vasva ubhayasya kārava indrāvaruṇā suhavā havāmahe
Griffith: Invoke you, only you, the Lords of twofold wealth, you prompt to hear, we bards, O Indra-Varuna.
Devanāgarī: ईशाना वस्व उभयस्य कारव इन्द्रावरुणा सुहवा हवामहे
pada pāṭha: yuvām | it | yut-su | pr̥tanāsu | vahnayaḥ | yuvām | kṣemasya | pra-save | mita-jñavaḥ || īśānā | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | kāravaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | su-havā | havāmahe ||7.82.4||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā yad imāni cakrathur viśvā jātāni bhuvanasya majmanā
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, as ye created all these creatures of the world by your surpassing might,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा यदिमानि चक्रथुर्विश्वा जातानि भुवनस्य मज्मना
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | yat | imāni | cakrathuḥ | viśvā | jātāni | bhuvanasya | majmanā || kṣemeṇa | mitraḥ | varuṇam | duvasyati | marut-bhiḥ | ugraḥ | śubham | anyaḥ | īyate ||7.82.5||

IAST: kṣemeṇa mitro varuṇaṁ duvasyati marudbhir ugraḥ śubham anya īyate
Griffith: In peace and quiet Mitra waits on Varuna, the Other, awful, with the Maruis seeks renown.
Devanāgarī: क्षेमेण मित्रो वरुणं दुवस्यति मरुद्भिरुग्रः शुभमन्य ईयते
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | yat | imāni | cakrathuḥ | viśvā | jātāni | bhuvanasya | majmanā || kṣemeṇa | mitraḥ | varuṇam | duvasyati | marut-bhiḥ | ugraḥ | śubham | anyaḥ | īyate ||7.82.5||

IAST: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣa ojo mimāte dhruvam asya yat svam
Griffith: That Varuna's high worth may shine preeminent, these Twain have measured each his proper power and might.
Devanāgarī: महे शुल्काय वरुणस्य नु त्विष ओजो मिमाते ध्रुवमस्य यत्स्वम्
pada pāṭha: mahe | śulkāya | varuṇasya | nu | tviṣe | ojaḥ | mimāte iti | dhruvam | asya | yat | svam || ajāmim | anyaḥ | śnathayantam | ā | atirat | dabhrebhiḥ | anyaḥ | pra | vr̥ṇoti | bhūyasaḥ ||7.82.6||

IAST: ajāmim anyaḥ śnathayantam ātirad dabhrebhir anyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ
Griffith: The One subdueth the destructive enemy; the Other with a few furthereth many a man.
Devanāgarī: अजामिमन्यः श्नथयन्तमातिरद्दभ्रेभिरन्यः प्र वृणोति भूयसः
pada pāṭha: mahe | śulkāya | varuṇasya | nu | tviṣe | ojaḥ | mimāte iti | dhruvam | asya | yat | svam || ajāmim | anyaḥ | śnathayantam | ā | atirat | dabhrebhiḥ | anyaḥ | pra | vr̥ṇoti | bhūyasaḥ ||7.82.6||

IAST: na tam aṁho na duritāni martyam indrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutaś cana
Griffith: No trouble, no misfortune, Indra-Varuna, no woe from any side assails the mortal man
Devanāgarī: न तमंहो न दुरितानि मर्त्यमिन्द्रावरुणा न तपः कुतश्चन
pada pāṭha: na | tam | aṁhaḥ | na | duḥ-itāni | martyam | indrāvaruṇā | na | tapaḥ | kutaḥ | cana || yasya | devā | gacchathaḥ | vīthaḥ | adhvaram | na | tam | martasya | naśate | pari-hvr̥tiḥ ||7.82.7||

IAST: yasya devā gacchatho vītho adhvaraṁ na tam martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ
Griffith: Whose sacrifice, O Gods, ye visit and enjoy: ne'er doth the crafty guile of mortal injure him.
Devanāgarī: यस्य देवा गच्छथो वीथो अध्वरं न तं मर्तस्य नशते परिह्वृतिः
pada pāṭha: na | tam | aṁhaḥ | na | duḥ-itāni | martyam | indrāvaruṇā | na | tapaḥ | kutaḥ | cana || yasya | devā | gacchathaḥ | vīthaḥ | adhvaram | na | tam | martasya | naśate | pari-hvr̥tiḥ ||7.82.7||

IAST: arvāṅ narā daivyenāvasā gataṁ śṛṇutaṁ havaṁ yadi me jujoṣathaḥ
Griffith: With your divine protection, Heroes, come to us: mine invncation hear, if ye be pleased therewith.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाङ्नरा दैव्येनावसा गतं शृणुतं हवं यदि मे जुजोषथः
pada pāṭha: arvāk | narā | daivyena | avasā | ā | gatam | śr̥ṇutam | havam | yadi | me | jujoṣathaḥ || yuvoḥ | hi | sakhyam | uta | vā | yat | āpyam | mārḍīkam | indrāvaruṇā | ni | yacchatam ||7.82.8||

IAST: yuvor hi sakhyam uta vā yad āpyam mārḍīkam indrāvaruṇā ni yacchatam
Griffith: Bestow ye upon us, O Indra-Varuna, your friendship and your kinship and your favouring grace.
Devanāgarī: युवोर्हि सख्यमुत वा यदाप्यं मार्डीकमिन्द्रावरुणा नि यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: arvāk | narā | daivyena | avasā | ā | gatam | śr̥ṇutam | havam | yadi | me | jujoṣathaḥ || yuvoḥ | hi | sakhyam | uta | vā | yat | āpyam | mārḍīkam | indrāvaruṇā | ni | yacchatam ||7.82.8||

IAST: asmākam indrāvaruṇā bhare-bhare puroyodhā bhavataṁ kṛṣṭyojasā
Griffith: In battle after battle, Indra-Varuna, be ye our Champions, ye who are the peoples' strength,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमिन्द्रावरुणा भरेभरे पुरोयोधा भवतं कृष्ट्योजसा
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indrāvaruṇā | bhare-bhare | puraḥ-yodhā | bhavatam | kr̥ṣṭi-ojasā || yat | vām | havante | ubhaye | adha | spr̥dhi | naraḥ | tokasya | tanayasya | sātiṣu ||7.82.9||

IAST: yad vāṁ havanta ubhaye adha spṛdhi naras tokasya tanayasya sātiṣu
Griffith: When both opposing bands invoke you for the fight, and men that they may gain offspring and progeny.
Devanāgarī: यद्वां हवन्त उभये अध स्पृधि नरस्तोकस्य तनयस्य सातिषु
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indrāvaruṇā | bhare-bhare | puraḥ-yodhā | bhavatam | kr̥ṣṭi-ojasā || yat | vām | havante | ubhaye | adha | spr̥dhi | naraḥ | tokasya | tanayasya | sātiṣu ||7.82.9||

IAST: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṁ yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ
Griffith: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा द्युम्नं यच्छन्तु महि शर्म सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | dyumnam | yacchantu | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || avadhram | jyotiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devasya | ślokam | savituḥ | manāmahe ||7.82.10||

IAST: avadhraṁ jyotir aditer ṛtāvṛdho devasya ślokaṁ savitur manāmahe
Griffith: We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.
Devanāgarī: अवध्रं ज्योतिरदितेरृतावृधो देवस्य श्लोकं सवितुर्मनामहे
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | dyumnam | yacchantu | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || avadhram | jyotiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devasya | ślokam | savituḥ | manāmahe ||7.82.10||

IAST: yuvāṁ narā paśyamānāsa āpyam prācā gavyantaḥ pṛthuparśavo yayuḥ
Griffith: LOOKING to you and your alliance, O ye Men, armed with broad axes they went forward, fain for spoil.
Devanāgarī: युवां नरा पश्यमानास आप्यं प्राचा गव्यन्तः पृथुपर्शवो ययुः
pada pāṭha: yuvām | narā | paśyamānāsaḥ | āpyam | prācā | gavyantaḥ | pr̥thu-parśavaḥ | yayuḥ || dāsā | ca | vr̥trā | hatam | āryāṇi | ca | su-dāsam | indrāvaruṇā | avasā | avatam ||7.83.1||

IAST: dāsā ca vṛtrā hatam āryāṇi ca sudāsam indrāvaruṇāvasāvatam
Griffith: Ye smote and slew his Dasa and his Aryan enemies, and helped Sudas with favour, Indra-Varuna.
Devanāgarī: दासा च वृत्रा हतमार्याणि च सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणावसावतम्
pada pāṭha: yuvām | narā | paśyamānāsaḥ | āpyam | prācā | gavyantaḥ | pr̥thu-parśavaḥ | yayuḥ || dāsā | ca | vr̥trā | hatam | āryāṇi | ca | su-dāsam | indrāvaruṇā | avasā | avatam ||7.83.1||

IAST: yatrā naraḥ samayante kṛtadhvajo yasminn ājā bhavati kiṁ cana priyam
Griffith: Where heroes come together with their banners raised, in the encounter where is naught for us to love,
Devanāgarī: यत्रा नरः समयन्ते कृतध्वजो यस्मिन्नाजा भवति किं चन प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | naraḥ | sam-ayante | kr̥ta-dhvajaḥ | yasmin | ājā | bhavati | kim | cana | priyam || yatra | bhayante | bhuvanā | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | tatra | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | adhi | vocatam ||7.83.2||

IAST: yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svardṛśas tatrā na indrāvaruṇādhi vocatam
Griffith: Where all things that behold the light are terrified, there did ye comfort us, O Indra-Varuna.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा भयन्ते भुवना स्वर्दृशस्तत्रा न इन्द्रावरुणाधि वोचतम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | naraḥ | sam-ayante | kr̥ta-dhvajaḥ | yasmin | ājā | bhavati | kim | cana | priyam || yatra | bhayante | bhuvanā | svaḥ-dr̥śaḥ | tatra | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | adhi | vocatam ||7.83.2||

IAST: sam bhūmyā antā dhvasirā adṛkṣatendrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣa āruhat
Griffith: The boundaries of earth were seen all dark with dust: O Indra-Varuna, the shout went up to heaven.
Devanāgarī: सं भूम्या अन्ता ध्वसिरा अदृक्षतेन्द्रावरुणा दिवि घोष आरुहत्
pada pāṭha: sam | bhūmyāḥ | antāḥ | dhvasirāḥ | adr̥kṣata | indrāvaruṇā | divi | ghoṣaḥ | ā | aruhat || asthuḥ | janānām | upa | mām | arātayaḥ | arvāk | avasā | havana-śrutā | ā | gatam ||7.83.3||

IAST: asthur janānām upa mām arātayo 'rvāg avasā havanaśrutā gatam
Griffith: The enmities of the people compassed me about. Ye heard my calling and ye came to me with help.
Devanāgarī: अस्थुर्जनानामुप मामरातयोऽर्वागवसा हवनश्रुता गतम्
pada pāṭha: sam | bhūmyāḥ | antāḥ | dhvasirāḥ | adr̥kṣata | indrāvaruṇā | divi | ghoṣaḥ | ā | aruhat || asthuḥ | janānām | upa | mām | arātayaḥ | arvāk | avasā | havana-śrutā | ā | gatam ||7.83.3||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhir aprati bhedaṁ vanvantā pra sudāsam āvatam
Griffith: With your resistless weapons, Indra-Varuna, ye conquered Bheda and ye gave Sudas your aid.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा वधनाभिरप्रति भेदं वन्वन्ता प्र सुदासमावतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | vadhanābhiḥ | aprati | bhedam | vanvantā | pra | su-dāsam | āvatam || brahmāṇi | eṣām | śr̥ṇutam | havīmani | satyā | tr̥tsūnām | abhavat | puraḥ-hitiḥ ||7.83.4||

IAST: brahmāṇy eṣāṁ śṛṇutaṁ havīmani satyā tṛtsūnām abhavat purohitiḥ
Griffith: Ye heard the prayers of these amid the cries of war: effectual was the service of the Trtsus' priest.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माण्येषां शृणुतं हवीमनि सत्या तृत्सूनामभवत्पुरोहितिः
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | vadhanābhiḥ | aprati | bhedam | vanvantā | pra | su-dāsam | āvatam || brahmāṇi | eṣām | śr̥ṇutam | havīmani | satyā | tr̥tsūnām | abhavat | puraḥ-hitiḥ ||7.83.4||

IAST: indrāvaruṇāv abhy ā tapanti māghāny aryo vanuṣām arātayaḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, the wickedness of foes and mine assailants' hatred sorely trouble me.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणावभ्या तपन्ति माघान्यर्यो वनुषामरातयः
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇau | abhi | ā | tapanti | mā | aghāni | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātayaḥ || yuvam | hi | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | rājathaḥ | adha | sma | naḥ | avatam | pārye | divi ||7.83.5||

IAST: yuvaṁ hi vasva ubhayasya rājatho 'dha smā no 'vatam pārye divi
Griffith: Ye Twain are Lords of riches both of earth and heaven: so grant to us your aid on the decisive day.
Devanāgarī: युवं हि वस्व उभयस्य राजथोऽध स्मा नोऽवतं पार्ये दिवि
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇau | abhi | ā | tapanti | mā | aghāni | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātayaḥ || yuvam | hi | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | rājathaḥ | adha | sma | naḥ | avatam | pārye | divi ||7.83.5||

IAST: yuvāṁ havanta ubhayāsa ājiṣv indraṁ ca vasvo varuṇaṁ ca sātaye
Griffith: The men of both the hosts invoked you in the fight, Indra and Varuna, that they might win the wealth,
Devanāgarī: युवां हवन्त उभयास आजिष्विन्द्रं च वस्वो वरुणं च सातये
pada pāṭha: yuvām | havante | ubhayāsaḥ | ājiṣu | indram | ca | vasvaḥ | varuṇam | ca | sātaye || yatra | rāja-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | ni-bādhitam | pra | su-dāsam | āvatam | tr̥tsu-bhiḥ | saha ||7.83.6||

IAST: yatra rājabhir daśabhir nibādhitam pra sudāsam āvataṁ tṛtsubhiḥ saha
Griffith: What time ye helped Sudas, with all the Trtsu folk, when the Ten Kings had pressed him down in their at
Devanāgarī: यत्र राजभिर्दशभिर्निबाधितं प्र सुदासमावतं तृत्सुभिः सह
pada pāṭha: yuvām | havante | ubhayāsaḥ | ājiṣu | indram | ca | vasvaḥ | varuṇam | ca | sātaye || yatra | rāja-bhiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | ni-bādhitam | pra | su-dāsam | āvatam | tr̥tsu-bhiḥ | saha ||7.83.6||

IAST: daśa rājānaḥ samitā ayajyavaḥ sudāsam indrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ
Griffith: Ten Kings who worshipped not, O Indra-Varuna, confederate, in war prevailed not o'er Sudas.
Devanāgarī: दश राजानः समिता अयज्यवः सुदासमिन्द्रावरुणा न युयुधुः
pada pāṭha: daśa | rājānaḥ | sam-itāḥ | ayajyavaḥ | su-dāsam | indrāvaruṇā | na | yuyudhuḥ || satyā | nr̥ṇām | adma-sadām | upa-stutiḥ | devāḥ | eṣām | abhavan | deva-hūtiṣu ||7.83.7||

IAST: satyā nṛṇām admasadām upastutir devā eṣām abhavan devahūtiṣu
Griffith: True was the boast of heroes sitting at the feast: so at their invocations Gods were on their side.
Devanāgarī: सत्या नृणामद्मसदामुपस्तुतिर्देवा एषामभवन्देवहूतिषु
pada pāṭha: daśa | rājānaḥ | sam-itāḥ | ayajyavaḥ | su-dāsam | indrāvaruṇā | na | yuyudhuḥ || satyā | nr̥ṇām | adma-sadām | upa-stutiḥ | devāḥ | eṣām | abhavan | deva-hūtiṣu ||7.83.7||

IAST: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvataḥ sudāsa indrāvaruṇāv aśikṣatam
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, ye gave Sudas your aid when the Ten Kings in battle compassed him about,
Devanāgarī: दाशराज्ञे परियत्ताय विश्वतः सुदास इन्द्रावरुणावशिक्षतम्
pada pāṭha: dāśa-rājñe | pari-yattāya | viśvataḥ | su-dāse | indrāvaruṇau | aśikṣatam || śvityañcaḥ | yatra | namasā | kapardinaḥ | dhiyā | dhī-vantaḥ | asapanta | tr̥tsavaḥ ||7.83.8||

IAST: śvityañco yatra namasā kapardino dhiyā dhīvanto asapanta tṛtsavaḥ
Griffith: There where the white-robed Trtsus with their braided hair, skilled in song worshipped you with homage a
Devanāgarī: श्वित्यञ्चो यत्र नमसा कपर्दिनो धिया धीवन्तो असपन्त तृत्सवः
pada pāṭha: dāśa-rājñe | pari-yattāya | viśvataḥ | su-dāse | indrāvaruṇau | aśikṣatam || śvityañcaḥ | yatra | namasā | kapardinaḥ | dhiyā | dhī-vantaḥ | asapanta | tr̥tsavaḥ ||7.83.8||

IAST: vṛtrāṇy anyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratāny anyo abhi rakṣate sadā
Griffith: One of you Twain destroys the Vrtras in the fight, the Other evermore maintains his holy Laws.
Devanāgarī: वृत्राण्यन्यः समिथेषु जिघ्नते व्रतान्यन्यो अभि रक्षते सदा
pada pāṭha: vr̥trāṇi | anyaḥ | sam-itheṣu | jighnate | vratāni | anyaḥ | abhi | rakṣate | sadā || havāmahe | vām | vr̥ṣaṇā | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | asme iti | indrāvaruṇā | śarma | yacchatam ||7.83.9||

IAST: havāmahe vāṁ vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhir asme indrāvaruṇā śarma yacchatam
Griffith: We call on you, ye Mighty, with our hymns of praise. Vouchsafe us your protection, Indra-Varuna.
Devanāgarī: हवामहे वां वृषणा सुवृक्तिभिरस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा शर्म यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥trāṇi | anyaḥ | sam-itheṣu | jighnate | vratāni | anyaḥ | abhi | rakṣate | sadā || havāmahe | vām | vr̥ṣaṇā | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | asme iti | indrāvaruṇā | śarma | yacchatam ||7.83.9||

IAST: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṁ yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ
Griffith: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, and Aryaman vouchsafe us glory and great shelter spreading far.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे इन्द्रो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा द्युम्नं यच्छन्तु महि शर्म सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | dyumnam | yacchantu | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || avadhram | jyotiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devasya | ślokam | savituḥ | manāmahe ||7.83.10||

IAST: avadhraṁ jyotir aditer ṛtāvṛdho devasya ślokaṁ savitur manāmahe
Griffith: We think of the beneficent light of Aditi, and Savitar's song of praise, the God who strengthens Law.
Devanāgarī: अवध्रं ज्योतिरदितेरृतावृधो देवस्य श्लोकं सवितुर्मनामहे
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā | dyumnam | yacchantu | mahi | śarma | sa-prathaḥ || avadhram | jyotiḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | devasya | ślokam | savituḥ | manāmahe ||7.83.10||

IAST: ā vāṁ rājānāv adhvare vavṛtyāṁ havyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
Griffith: KINGS, Indra-Varuna, I would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage.
Devanāgarī: आ वां राजानावध्वरे ववृत्यां हव्येभिरिन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rājānau | adhvare | vavr̥tyām | havyebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ || pra | vām | ghr̥tācī | bāhvoḥ | dadhānā | pari | tmanā | viṣu-rūpā | jigāti ||7.84.1||

IAST: pra vāṁ ghṛtācī bāhvor dadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jigāti
Griffith: Held in both arms the ladle, dropping fatness, goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.
Devanāgarī: प्र वां घृताची बाह्वोर्दधाना परि त्मना विषुरूपा जिगाति
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | rājānau | adhvare | vavr̥tyām | havyebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ || pra | vām | ghr̥tācī | bāhvoḥ | dadhānā | pari | tmanā | viṣu-rūpā | jigāti ||7.84.1||

IAST: yuvo rāṣṭram bṛhad invati dyaur yau setṛbhir arajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ
Griffith: Dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage.
Devanāgarī: युवो राष्ट्रं बृहदिन्वति द्यौर्यौ सेतृभिररज्जुभिः सिनीथः
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | rāṣṭram | br̥hat | invati | dyauḥ | yau | setr̥-bhiḥ | arajju-bhiḥ | sinīthaḥ || pari | naḥ | heḷaḥ | varuṇasya | vr̥jyāḥ | urum | naḥ | indraḥ | kr̥ṇavat | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.84.2||

IAST: pari no heḻo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṁ na indraḥ kṛṇavad u lokam
Griffith: Far from us still be Varuna's displeasure may Indra give us spacious room to dwell in.
Devanāgarī: परि नो हेळो वरुणस्य वृज्या उरुं न इन्द्रः कृणवदु लोकम्
pada pāṭha: yuvoḥ | rāṣṭram | br̥hat | invati | dyauḥ | yau | setr̥-bhiḥ | arajju-bhiḥ | sinīthaḥ || pari | naḥ | heḷaḥ | varuṇasya | vr̥jyāḥ | urum | naḥ | indraḥ | kr̥ṇavat | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||7.84.2||

IAST: kṛtaṁ no yajñaṁ vidatheṣu cāruṁ kṛtam brahmāṇi sūriṣu praśastā
Griffith: Make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies: make ye our prayers approved among our princes.
Devanāgarī: कृतं नो यज्ञं विदथेषु चारुं कृतं ब्रह्माणि सूरिषु प्रशस्ता
pada pāṭha: kr̥tam | naḥ | yajñam | vidatheṣu | cārum | kr̥tam | brahmāṇi | sūriṣu | pra-śastā || upo iti | rayiḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | naḥ | etu | pra | naḥ | spārhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | tiretam ||7.84.3||

IAST: upo rayir devajūto na etu pra ṇaḥ spārhābhir ūtibhis tiretam
Griffith: May God-sent riches come for our possession: further ye us with your delightful succours.
Devanāgarī: उपो रयिर्देवजूतो न एतु प्र णः स्पार्हाभिरूतिभिस्तिरेतम्
pada pāṭha: kr̥tam | naḥ | yajñam | vidatheṣu | cārum | kr̥tam | brahmāṇi | sūriṣu | pra-śastā || upo iti | rayiḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | naḥ | etu | pra | naḥ | spārhābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ | tiretam ||7.84.3||

IAST: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṁ rayiṁ dhattaṁ vasumantam purukṣum
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure, food, and every blessing;
Devanāgarī: अस्मे इन्द्रावरुणा विश्ववारं रयिं धत्तं वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indrāvaruṇā | viśva-vāram | rayim | dhattam | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || pra | yaḥ | ādityaḥ | anr̥tā | mināti | amitā | śūraḥ | dayate | vasūni ||7.84.4||

IAST: pra ya ādityo anṛtā mināty amitā śūro dayate vasūni
Griffith: For the Aditya, banisher of falsehood, the Hero, dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.
Devanāgarī: प्र य आदित्यो अनृता मिनात्यमिता शूरो दयते वसूनि
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indrāvaruṇā | viśva-vāram | rayim | dhattam | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || pra | yaḥ | ādityaḥ | anr̥tā | mināti | amitā | śūraḥ | dayate | vasūni ||7.84.4||

IAST: iyam indraṁ varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
Griffith: May this my song reach Varuna and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring.
Devanāgarī: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः प्रावत्तोके तनये तूतुजाना
pada pāṭha: iyam | indram | varuṇam | aṣṭa | me | gīḥ | pra | āvat | toke | tanaye | tūtujānā || su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.84.5||

IAST: suratnāso devavītiṁ gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: To the Gods' banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | indram | varuṇam | aṣṭa | me | gīḥ | pra | āvat | toke | tanaye | tūtujānā || su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.84.5||

IAST: punīṣe vām arakṣasam manīṣāṁ somam indrāya varuṇāya juhvat
Griffith: FOR you I deck a harmless hymn, presenting the Soma juice to Varuna and Indra-
Devanāgarī: पुनीषे वामरक्षसं मनीषां सोममिन्द्राय वरुणाय जुह्वत्
pada pāṭha: punīṣe | vām | arakṣasam | manīṣām | somam | indrāya | varuṇāya | juhvat || ghr̥ta-pratīkām | uṣasam | na | devīm | tā | naḥ | yāman | uruṣyatām | abhīke ||7.85.1||

IAST: ghṛtapratīkām uṣasaṁ na devīṁ tā no yāmann uruṣyatām abhīke
Griffith: A hymn that shines like heavenly Dawn with fatness. May they be near us on the march and guard us.
Devanāgarī: घृतप्रतीकामुषसं न देवीं ता नो यामन्नुरुष्यतामभीके
pada pāṭha: punīṣe | vām | arakṣasam | manīṣām | somam | indrāya | varuṇāya | juhvat || ghr̥ta-pratīkām | uṣasam | na | devīm | tā | naḥ | yāman | uruṣyatām | abhīke ||7.85.1||

IAST: spardhante vā u devahūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti
Griffith: Here where the arrows fall amid the banners both hosts invoke the Gods in emulation.
Devanāgarī: स्पर्धन्ते वा उ देवहूये अत्र येषु ध्वजेषु दिद्यवः पतन्ति
pada pāṭha: spardhante | vai | ūm̐ iti | deva-hūye | atra | yeṣu | dhvajeṣu | didyavaḥ | patanti || yuvam | tān | indrāvaruṇau | amitrān | hatam | parācaḥ | śarvā | viṣūcaḥ ||7.85.2||

IAST: yuvaṁ tām̐ indrāvaruṇāv amitrān hatam parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, smite back those-our foemen,yea, smite them withyour shaft to every quarter.
Devanāgarī: युवं ताँ इन्द्रावरुणावमित्रान्हतं पराचः शर्वा विषूचः
pada pāṭha: spardhante | vai | ūm̐ iti | deva-hūye | atra | yeṣu | dhvajeṣu | didyavaḥ | patanti || yuvam | tān | indrāvaruṇau | amitrān | hatam | parācaḥ | śarvā | viṣūcaḥ ||7.85.2||

IAST: āpaś cid dhi svayaśasaḥ sadaḥsu devīr indraṁ varuṇaṁ devatā dhuḥ
Griffith: Self-lucid in their seats, e'en heavenly Waters endowed with Godhead Varuna and Indra.
Devanāgarī: आपश्चिद्धि स्वयशसः सदस्सु देवीरिन्द्रं वरुणं देवता धुः
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | cit | hi | sva-yaśasaḥ | sadaḥ-su | devīḥ | indram | varuṇam | devatā | dhuriti dhuḥ || kr̥ṣṭīḥ | anyaḥ | dhārayati | pra-viktāḥ | vr̥trāṇi | anyaḥ | apratīni | hanti ||7.85.3||

IAST: kṛṣṭīr anyo dhārayati praviktā vṛtrāṇy anyo apratīni hanti
Griffith: One of these holds the folk distinct and sundered, the Other smites and slays resistless foemen.
Devanāgarī: कृष्टीरन्यो धारयति प्रविक्ता वृत्राण्यन्यो अप्रतीनि हन्ति
pada pāṭha: āpaḥ | cit | hi | sva-yaśasaḥ | sadaḥ-su | devīḥ | indram | varuṇam | devatā | dhuriti dhuḥ || kr̥ṣṭīḥ | anyaḥ | dhārayati | pra-viktāḥ | vr̥trāṇi | anyaḥ | apratīni | hanti ||7.85.3||

IAST: sa sukratur ṛtacid astu hotā ya āditya śavasā vāṁ namasvān
Griffith: Wise be the priest and skilled in Law Eternal, who with his sacred gifts and oration.
Devanāgarī: स सुक्रतुरृतचिदस्तु होता य आदित्य शवसा वां नमस्वान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | r̥ta-cit | astu | hotā | yaḥ | ādityā | śavasā | vām | namasvān || ā-vavartat | avase | vām | haviṣmān | asat | it | saḥ | suvitāya | prayasvān ||7.85.4||

IAST: āvavartad avase vāṁ haviṣmān asad it sa suvitāya prayasvān
Griffith: Brings you to aid us with your might, Adityas: let him have viands to promote his welfare.
Devanāgarī: आववर्तदवसे वां हविष्मानसदित्स सुविताय प्रयस्वान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-kratuḥ | r̥ta-cit | astu | hotā | yaḥ | ādityā | śavasā | vām | namasvān || ā-vavartat | avase | vām | haviṣmān | asat | it | saḥ | suvitāya | prayasvān ||7.85.4||

IAST: iyam indraṁ varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
Griffith: May this my song reach Varuna and Indra, and, strongly urging, win me sons and offspring.
Devanāgarī: इयमिन्द्रं वरुणमष्ट मे गीः प्रावत्तोके तनये तूतुजाना
pada pāṭha: iyam | indram | varuṇam | aṣṭa | me | gīḥ | pra | āvat | toke | tanaye | tūtujānā || su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.85.5||

IAST: suratnāso devavītiṁ gamema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: To the Gods' banquet may we go with riches. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods with blessings.
Devanāgarī: सुरत्नासो देववीतिं गमेम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: iyam | indram | varuṇam | aṣṭa | me | gīḥ | pra | āvat | toke | tanaye | tūtujānā || su-ratnāsaḥ | deva-vītim | gamema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.85.5||

IAST: dhīrā tv asya mahinā janūṁṣi vi yas tastambha rodasī cid urvī
Griffith: WISE, verily, are creatures through his greatness who stayed ever, spacious heaven and earth asunder;
Devanāgarī: धीरा त्वस्य महिना जनूंषि वि यस्तस्तम्भ रोदसी चिदुर्वी
pada pāṭha: dhīrā | tu | asya | mahinā | janūṁṣi | vi | yaḥ | tastambha | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti || pra | nākam | r̥ṣvam | nunude | br̥hantam | dvitā | nakṣatram | paprathat | ca | bhūma ||7.86.1||

IAST: pra nākam ṛṣvaṁ nunude bṛhantaṁ dvitā nakṣatram paprathac ca bhūma
Griffith: Who urged the high and mighty sky to motion, the Star of old, and spread the earth before him.
Devanāgarī: प्र नाकमृष्वं नुनुदे बृहन्तं द्विता नक्षत्रं पप्रथच्च भूम
pada pāṭha: dhīrā | tu | asya | mahinā | janūṁṣi | vi | yaḥ | tastambha | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti || pra | nākam | r̥ṣvam | nunude | br̥hantam | dvitā | nakṣatram | paprathat | ca | bhūma ||7.86.1||

IAST: uta svayā tanvā saṁ vade tat kadā nv antar varuṇe bhuvāni
Griffith: With mine own heart I commune on the question how Varuna and I may be united.
Devanāgarī: उत स्वया तन्वा सं वदे तत्कदा न्वन्तर्वरुणे भुवानि
pada pāṭha: uta | svayā | tanvā | sam | vade | tat | kadā | nu | antaḥ | varuṇe | bhuvāni || kim | me | havyam | ahr̥ṇānaḥ | juṣeta | kadā | mr̥ḷīkam | su-manāḥ | abhi | khyam ||7.86.2||

IAST: kim me havyam ahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḻīkaṁ sumanā abhi khyam
Griffith: What gift of mine will he accept unangered? When may I calmly look and find him gracious?
Devanāgarī: किं मे हव्यमहृणानो जुषेत कदा मृळीकं सुमना अभि ख्यम्
pada pāṭha: uta | svayā | tanvā | sam | vade | tat | kadā | nu | antaḥ | varuṇe | bhuvāni || kim | me | havyam | ahr̥ṇānaḥ | juṣeta | kadā | mr̥ḷīkam | su-manāḥ | abhi | khyam ||7.86.2||

IAST: pṛcche tad eno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛccham
Griffith: Fain to know this in I question others: I seek the wise, O Varuna, and ask them.
Devanāgarī: पृच्छे तदेनो वरुण दिदृक्षूपो एमि चिकितुषो विपृच्छम्
pada pāṭha: pr̥cche | tat | enaḥ | varuṇa | didr̥kṣu | upo iti | emi | cikituṣaḥ | vi-pr̥ccham || samānam | it | me | kavayaḥ | cit | āhuḥ | ayam | ha | tubhyam | varuṇaḥ | hr̥ṇīte ||7.86.3||

IAST: samānam in me kavayaś cid āhur ayaṁ ha tubhyaṁ varuṇo hṛṇīte
Griffith: This one same answer even the sages gave me, "Surely this Varuna is angry with thee."
Devanāgarī: समानमिन्मे कवयश्चिदाहुरयं ह तुभ्यं वरुणो हृणीते
pada pāṭha: pr̥cche | tat | enaḥ | varuṇa | didr̥kṣu | upo iti | emi | cikituṣaḥ | vi-pr̥ccham || samānam | it | me | kavayaḥ | cit | āhuḥ | ayam | ha | tubhyam | varuṇaḥ | hr̥ṇīte ||7.86.3||

IAST: kim āga āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṁ yat stotāraṁ jighāṁsasi sakhāyam
Griffith: What, Varuna, hath been my chief transgression, that thou wouldst slay the friend who sings thy praises?
Devanāgarī: किमाग आस वरुण ज्येष्ठं यत्स्तोतारं जिघांससि सखायम्
pada pāṭha: kim | āgaḥ | āsa | varuṇa | jyeṣṭham | yat | stotāram | jighāṁsasi | sakhāyam || pra | tat | me | vocaḥ | duḥ-dabha | svadhā-vaḥ | ava | tvā | anenāḥ | namasā | turaḥ | iyām ||7.86.4||

IAST: pra tan me voco dūḻabha svadhāvo 'va tvānenā namasā tura iyām
Griffith: Tell me, Unconquerable Lord, and quickly sinless will I approach thee with mine homage.
Devanāgarī: प्र तन्मे वोचो दूळभ स्वधावोऽव त्वानेना नमसा तुर इयाम्
pada pāṭha: kim | āgaḥ | āsa | varuṇa | jyeṣṭham | yat | stotāram | jighāṁsasi | sakhāyam || pra | tat | me | vocaḥ | duḥ-dabha | svadhā-vaḥ | ava | tvā | anenāḥ | namasā | turaḥ | iyām ||7.86.4||

IAST: ava drugdhāni pitryā sṛjā no 'va yā vayaṁ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ
Griffith: Free us from sins committed by our fathers, from those wherein we have ourselves offended.
Devanāgarī: अव द्रुग्धानि पित्र्या सृजा नोऽव या वयं चकृमा तनूभिः
pada pāṭha: ava | drugdhāni | pitryā | sr̥ja | naḥ | ava | yā | vayam | cakr̥ma | tanūbhiḥ || ava | rājan | paśu-tr̥pam | na | tāyum | sr̥ja | vatsam | na | dāmnaḥ | vasiṣṭham ||7.86.5||

IAST: ava rājan paśutṛpaṁ na tāyuṁ sṛjā vatsaṁ na dāmno vasiṣṭham
Griffith: O King, loose, like a thief who feeds the cattle, as from the cord a calf, set free Vasistha.
Devanāgarī: अव राजन्पशुतृपं न तायुं सृजा वत्सं न दाम्नो वसिष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: ava | drugdhāni | pitryā | sr̥ja | naḥ | ava | yā | vayam | cakr̥ma | tanūbhiḥ || ava | rājan | paśu-tr̥pam | na | tāyum | sr̥ja | vatsam | na | dāmnaḥ | vasiṣṭham ||7.86.5||

IAST: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyur vibhīdako acittiḥ
Griffith: Not our own will betrayed us, but seduction, thoughtlessness, Varuna wine, dice, or anger.
Devanāgarī: न स स्वो दक्षो वरुण ध्रुतिः सा सुरा मन्युर्विभीदको अचित्तिः
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | svaḥ | dakṣaḥ | varuṇa | dhrutiḥ | sā | surā | manyuḥ | vi-bhīdakaḥ | acittiḥ || asti | jyāyān | kanīyasaḥ | upa-are | svapnaḥ | cana | it | anr̥tasya | pra-yotā ||7.86.6||

IAST: asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaś caned anṛtasya prayotā
Griffith: The old is near to lead astray the younger: even sleep removeth not all evil-doing.
Devanāgarī: अस्ति ज्यायान्कनीयस उपारे स्वप्नश्चनेदनृतस्य प्रयोता
pada pāṭha: na | saḥ | svaḥ | dakṣaḥ | varuṇa | dhrutiḥ | sā | surā | manyuḥ | vi-bhīdakaḥ | acittiḥ || asti | jyāyān | kanīyasaḥ | upa-are | svapnaḥ | cana | it | anr̥tasya | pra-yotā ||7.86.6||

IAST: araṁ dāso na mīḻhuṣe karāṇy ahaṁ devāya bhūrṇaye 'nāgāḥ
Griffith: Slavelike may I do service to the Bounteous, serve, free from sin, the God inclined to anger.
Devanāgarī: अरं दासो न मीळ्हुषे कराण्यहं देवाय भूर्णयेऽनागाः
pada pāṭha: aram | dāsaḥ | na | mīḷhuṣe | karāṇi | aham | devāya | bhūrṇaye | anāgāḥ || acetayat | acitaḥ | devaḥ | aryaḥ | gr̥tsam | rāye | kavi-taraḥ | junāti ||7.86.7||

IAST: acetayad acito devo aryo gṛtsaṁ rāye kavitaro junāti
Griffith: This gentle Lord gives wisdom to the simple: the wiser God leads on the wise to riches.
Devanāgarī: अचेतयदचितो देवो अर्यो गृत्सं राये कवितरो जुनाति
pada pāṭha: aram | dāsaḥ | na | mīḷhuṣe | karāṇi | aham | devāya | bhūrṇaye | anāgāḥ || acetayat | acitaḥ | devaḥ | aryaḥ | gr̥tsam | rāye | kavi-taraḥ | junāti ||7.86.7||

IAST: ayaṁ su tubhyaṁ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaś cid astu
Griffith: O Lord, O Varuna, may this laudation come close to thed and lie within thy spirit.
Devanāgarī: अयं सु तुभ्यं वरुण स्वधावो हृदि स्तोम उपश्रितश्चिदस्तु
pada pāṭha: ayam | su | tubhyam | varuṇa | svadhā-vaḥ | hr̥di | stomaḥ | upa-sr̥itaḥ | cit | astu || śam | naḥ | kṣeme | śam | ūm̐ iti | yoge | naḥ | astu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.86.8||

IAST: śaṁ naḥ kṣeme śam u yoge no astu yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May it be well with us in rest and labour. Preserve us ever-more, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: शं नः क्षेमे शमु योगे नो अस्तु यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ayam | su | tubhyam | varuṇa | svadhā-vaḥ | hr̥di | stomaḥ | upa-sr̥itaḥ | cit | astu || śam | naḥ | kṣeme | śam | ūm̐ iti | yoge | naḥ | astu | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.86.8||

IAST: radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṁsi samudriyā nadīnām
Griffith: VARUNA cut a pathway out for Surya, and led the watery floods of rivers onward.
Devanāgarī: रदत्पथो वरुणः सूर्याय प्रार्णांसि समुद्रिया नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: radat | pathaḥ | varuṇaḥ | sūryāya | pra | arṇāṁsi | samudriyā | nadīnām || sargaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭaḥ | arvatīḥ | r̥ta-yan | cakāra | mahīḥ | avanīḥ | aha-bhyaḥ ||7.87.1||

IAST: sargo na sṛṣṭo arvatīr ṛtāyañ cakāra mahīr avanīr ahabhyaḥ
Griffith: The Mares, as in a race, speed on in order. He made great channels for the days to follow.
Devanāgarī: सर्गो न सृष्टो अर्वतीरृतायञ्चकार महीरवनीरहभ्यः
pada pāṭha: radat | pathaḥ | varuṇaḥ | sūryāya | pra | arṇāṁsi | samudriyā | nadīnām || sargaḥ | na | sr̥ṣṭaḥ | arvatīḥ | r̥ta-yan | cakāra | mahīḥ | avanīḥ | aha-bhyaḥ ||7.87.1||

IAST: ātmā te vāto raja ā navīnot paśur na bhūrṇir yavase sasavān
Griffith: The wind, thy breath, hath sounded through the region like a wild beast that seeks his food in pastures.
Devanāgarī: आत्मा ते वातो रज आ नवीनोत्पशुर्न भूर्णिर्यवसे ससवान्
pada pāṭha: ātmā | te | vātaḥ | rajaḥ | ā | navīnot | paśuḥ | na | bhūrṇiḥ | yavase | sasa-vān || antaḥ | mahī iti | br̥hatī iti | rodasī iti | ime iti | viśvā | te | dhāma | varuṇa | priyāṇi ||7.87.2||

IAST: antar mahī bṛhatī rodasīme viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi
Griffith: Within these two, exalted Earth and Heaven, O Varuna, are all the forms thou lovest.
Devanāgarī: अन्तर्मही बृहती रोदसीमे विश्वा ते धाम वरुण प्रियाणि
pada pāṭha: ātmā | te | vātaḥ | rajaḥ | ā | navīnot | paśuḥ | na | bhūrṇiḥ | yavase | sasa-vān || antaḥ | mahī iti | br̥hatī iti | rodasī iti | ime iti | viśvā | te | dhāma | varuṇa | priyāṇi ||7.87.2||

IAST: pari spaśo varuṇasya smadiṣṭā ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke
Griffith: Varuna's spies, sent forth upon their errand, survey the two world-halves well formed and fashioned.
Devanāgarī: परि स्पशो वरुणस्य स्मदिष्टा उभे पश्यन्ति रोदसी सुमेके
pada pāṭha: pari | spaśaḥ | varuṇasya | smat-iṣṭāḥ | ubhe iti | paśyanti | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || r̥ta-vānaḥ | kavayaḥ | yajña-dhīrāḥ | pra-cetasaḥ | ye | iṣayanta | manma ||7.87.3||

IAST: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayo yajñadhīrāḥ pracetaso ya iṣayanta manma
Griffith: Wise are they, holy, skilled in sacrifices, the furtherers of the praise-songs of the prudent.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावानः कवयो यज्ञधीराः प्रचेतसो य इषयन्त मन्म
pada pāṭha: pari | spaśaḥ | varuṇasya | smat-iṣṭāḥ | ubhe iti | paśyanti | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || r̥ta-vānaḥ | kavayaḥ | yajña-dhīrāḥ | pra-cetasaḥ | ye | iṣayanta | manma ||7.87.3||

IAST: uvāca me varuṇo medhirāya triḥ sapta nāmāghnyā bibharti
Griffith: To me who understand hath Varuna spoken, the names borne by the Cow are three times seven.
Devanāgarī: उवाच मे वरुणो मेधिराय त्रिः सप्त नामाघ्न्या बिभर्ति
pada pāṭha: uvāca | me | varuṇaḥ | medhirāya | triḥ | sapta | nāma | aghnyā | bibharti || vidvān | padasya | guhyā | na | vocat | yugāya | vipraḥ | uparāya | śikṣan ||7.87.4||

IAST: vidvān padasya guhyā na vocad yugāya vipra uparāya śikṣan
Griffith: The sapient God, knowing the place's secret, shall speak as 'twere to teach the race that cometh.
Devanāgarī: विद्वान्पदस्य गुह्या न वोचद्युगाय विप्र उपराय शिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: uvāca | me | varuṇaḥ | medhirāya | triḥ | sapta | nāma | aghnyā | bibharti || vidvān | padasya | guhyā | na | vocat | yugāya | vipraḥ | uparāya | śikṣan ||7.87.4||

IAST: tisro dyāvo nihitā antar asmin tisro bhūmīr uparāḥ ṣaḍvidhānāḥ
Griffith: On him three heavens rest and are supported, and the three earths are there in sixfold order.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो द्यावो निहिता अन्तरस्मिन्तिस्रो भूमीरुपराः षड्विधानाः
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | dyāvaḥ | ni-hitāḥ | antaḥ | asmin | tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | uparāḥ | ṣaṭ-vidhānāḥ || gr̥tsaḥ | rājā | varuṇaḥ | cakre | etam | divi | pra-īṅkham | hiraṇyayam | śubhe | kam ||7.87.5||

IAST: gṛtso rājā varuṇaś cakra etaṁ divi preṅkhaṁ hiraṇyayaṁ śubhe kam
Griffith: The wise King Varuna hath made in heaven that Golden Swing to cover it with glory.
Devanāgarī: गृत्सो राजा वरुणश्चक्र एतं दिवि प्रेङ्खं हिरण्ययं शुभे कम्
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | dyāvaḥ | ni-hitāḥ | antaḥ | asmin | tisraḥ | bhūmīḥ | uparāḥ | ṣaṭ-vidhānāḥ || gr̥tsaḥ | rājā | varuṇaḥ | cakre | etam | divi | pra-īṅkham | hiraṇyayam | śubhe | kam ||7.87.5||

IAST: ava sindhuṁ varuṇo dyaur iva sthād drapso na śveto mṛgas tuviṣmān
Griffith: Like Varuna from heaven he sinks in Sindhu, like a white-shining spark, a strong wild creature.
Devanāgarī: अव सिन्धुं वरुणो द्यौरिव स्थाद्द्रप्सो न श्वेतो मृगस्तुविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: ava | sindhum | varuṇaḥ | dyauḥ-iva | sthāt | drapsaḥ | na | śvetaḥ | mr̥gaḥ | tuviṣmān || gambhīra-śaṁsaḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-mānaḥ | supāra-kṣatraḥ | sataḥ | asya | rājā ||7.87.6||

IAST: gambhīraśaṁso rajaso vimānaḥ supārakṣatraḥ sato asya rājā
Griffith: Ruling in depths and meting out the region, great saving power hath he, this world's Controller.
Devanāgarī: गम्भीरशंसो रजसो विमानः सुपारक्षत्रः सतो अस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: ava | sindhum | varuṇaḥ | dyauḥ-iva | sthāt | drapsaḥ | na | śvetaḥ | mr̥gaḥ | tuviṣmān || gambhīra-śaṁsaḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-mānaḥ | supāra-kṣatraḥ | sataḥ | asya | rājā ||7.87.6||

IAST: yo mṛḻayāti cakruṣe cid āgo vayaṁ syāma varuṇe anāgāḥ
Griffith: Before this Varuna may we be sinless him who shows mercy even to the sinner-
Devanāgarī: यो मृळयाति चक्रुषे चिदागो वयं स्याम वरुणे अनागाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mr̥ḷayāti | cakruṣe | cit | āgaḥ | vayam | syāma | varuṇe | anāgāḥ || anu | vratāni | aditeḥ | r̥dhantaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.87.7||

IAST: anu vratāny aditer ṛdhanto yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: While we are keeping Aditi's ordinances. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अनु व्रतान्यदितेरृधन्तो यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mr̥ḷayāti | cakruṣe | cit | āgaḥ | vayam | syāma | varuṇe | anāgāḥ || anu | vratāni | aditeḥ | r̥dhantaḥ | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.87.7||

IAST: pra śundhyuvaṁ varuṇāya preṣṭhām matiṁ vasiṣṭha mīḻhuṣe bharasva
Griffith: PRESENT to Varuna thine hymn, Vasistha, bright, most delightful to the Bounteous Giver,
Devanāgarī: प्र शुन्ध्युवं वरुणाय प्रेष्ठां मतिं वसिष्ठ मीळ्हुषे भरस्व
pada pāṭha: pra | śundhyuvam | varuṇāya | preṣṭhām | matim | vasiṣṭha | mīḷhuṣe | bharasva || yaḥ | īm | arvāñcam | karate | yajatram | sahasra-magham | vr̥ṣaṇam | br̥hantam ||7.88.1||

IAST: ya īm arvāñcaṁ karate yajatraṁ sahasrāmaghaṁ vṛṣaṇam bṛhantam
Griffith: Who bringeth on to us the Bull, the lofty, the Holy, laden with a thousand treasures.
Devanāgarī: य ईमर्वाञ्चं करते यजत्रं सहस्रामघं वृषणं बृहन्तम्
pada pāṭha: pra | śundhyuvam | varuṇāya | preṣṭhām | matim | vasiṣṭha | mīḷhuṣe | bharasva || yaḥ | īm | arvāñcam | karate | yajatram | sahasra-magham | vr̥ṣaṇam | br̥hantam ||7.88.1||

IAST: adhā nv asya saṁdṛśaṁ jaganvān agner anīkaṁ varuṇasya maṁsi
Griffith: And now, as I am come before his presence, I take the face of Varuna for Agni's.
Devanāgarī: अधा न्वस्य संदृशं जगन्वानग्नेरनीकं वरुणस्य मंसि
pada pāṭha: adha | nu | asya | sam-dr̥śam | jaganvān | agneḥ | anīkam | varuṇasya | maṁsi || svaḥ | yat | aśman | adhi-pāḥ | ūm̐ iti | andhaḥ | abhi | mā | vapuḥ | dr̥śaye | ninīyāt ||7.88.2||

IAST: svar yad aśmann adhipā u andho 'bhi mā vapur dṛśaye ninīyāt
Griffith: So might he bring-Lord also of the darkness-the light in heaven that I may see its beauty!
Devanāgarī: स्वर्यदश्मन्नधिपा उ अन्धोऽभि मा वपुर्दृशये निनीयात्
pada pāṭha: adha | nu | asya | sam-dr̥śam | jaganvān | agneḥ | anīkam | varuṇasya | maṁsi || svaḥ | yat | aśman | adhi-pāḥ | ūm̐ iti | andhaḥ | abhi | mā | vapuḥ | dr̥śaye | ninīyāt ||7.88.2||

IAST: ā yad ruhāva varuṇaś ca nāvam pra yat samudram īrayāva madhyam
Griffith: When Varuna and I embark together and urge our boat into the midst of ocean,
Devanāgarī: आ यद्रुहाव वरुणश्च नावं प्र यत्समुद्रमीरयाव मध्यम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | ruhāva | varuṇaḥ | ca | nāvam | pra | yat | samudram | īrayāva | madhyam || adhi | yat | apām | snu-bhiḥ | carāva | pra | pra-īṅkhe | īṅkhayāvahai | śubhe | kam ||7.88.3||

IAST: adhi yad apāṁ snubhiś carāva pra preṅkha īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam
Griffith: We, when we ride o'er ridges of the waters, will swing within that swing and there be happy.
Devanāgarī: अधि यदपां स्नुभिश्चराव प्र प्रेङ्ख ईङ्खयावहै शुभे कम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yat | ruhāva | varuṇaḥ | ca | nāvam | pra | yat | samudram | īrayāva | madhyam || adhi | yat | apām | snu-bhiḥ | carāva | pra | pra-īṅkhe | īṅkhayāvahai | śubhe | kam ||7.88.3||

IAST: vasiṣṭhaṁ ha varuṇo nāvy ādhād ṛṣiṁ cakāra svapā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: Varuna placed Vasistha in the vessel, and deftly with his niight made him a Rsi.
Devanāgarī: वसिष्ठं ह वरुणो नाव्याधादृषिं चकार स्वपा महोभिः
pada pāṭha: vasiṣṭham | ha | varuṇaḥ | nāvi | ā | adhāt | r̥ṣim | cakāra | su-apāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || stotāram | vipraḥ | sudina-tve | ahvām | yāt | nu | dyāvaḥ | tatanan | yāt | uṣasaḥ ||7.88.4||

IAST: stotāraṁ vipraḥ sudinatve ahnāṁ yān nu dyāvas tatanan yād uṣāsaḥ
Griffith: When days shone bright the Sage made him a singer, while the heavens broadened and the Dawns were lengt
Devanāgarī: स्तोतारं विप्रः सुदिनत्वे अह्नां यान्नु द्यावस्ततनन्यादुषासः
pada pāṭha: vasiṣṭham | ha | varuṇaḥ | nāvi | ā | adhāt | r̥ṣim | cakāra | su-apāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || stotāram | vipraḥ | sudina-tve | ahvām | yāt | nu | dyāvaḥ | tatanan | yāt | uṣasaḥ ||7.88.4||

IAST: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yad avṛkam purā cit
Griffith: What hath become of those our ancient friendships, when without enmity we walked together?
Devanāgarī: क्व त्यानि नौ सख्या बभूवुः सचावहे यदवृकं पुरा चित्
pada pāṭha: kva | tyāni | nau | sakhyā | babhūvuḥ | sacāvahe iti | yat | avr̥kam | purā | cit || br̥hantam | mānam | varuṇa | svadhā-vaḥ | sahasra-dvāram | jagama | gr̥ham | te ||7.88.5||

IAST: bṛhantam mānaṁ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ sahasradvāraṁ jagamā gṛhaṁ te
Griffith: I, Varuna, thou glorious Lord, have entered thy lofty home, thine house with thousand portals.
Devanāgarī: बृहन्तं मानं वरुण स्वधावः सहस्रद्वारं जगमा गृहं ते
pada pāṭha: kva | tyāni | nau | sakhyā | babhūvuḥ | sacāvahe iti | yat | avr̥kam | purā | cit || br̥hantam | mānam | varuṇa | svadhā-vaḥ | sahasra-dvāram | jagama | gr̥ham | te ||7.88.5||

IAST: ya āpir nityo varuṇa priyaḥ san tvām āgāṁsi kṛṇavat sakhā te
Griffith: If he, thy true ally, hath sinned against thee, still, Varuna, he is the friend thou lovedst.
Devanāgarī: य आपिर्नित्यो वरुण प्रियः सन्त्वामागांसि कृणवत्सखा ते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āpiḥ | nityaḥ | varuṇa | priyaḥ | san | tvām | āgāṁsi | kr̥ṇavat | sakhā | te || mā | te | enasvantaḥ | yakṣin | bhujema | yandhi | sma | vipraḥ | stuvate | varūtham ||7.88.6||

IAST: mā ta enasvanto yakṣin bhujema yandhi ṣmā vipraḥ stuvate varūtham
Griffith: Let us not, Living One, as sinners I know thee: give shelter, as a Sage, to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: मा त एनस्वन्तो यक्षिन्भुजेम यन्धि ष्मा विप्रः स्तुवते वरूथम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | āpiḥ | nityaḥ | varuṇa | priyaḥ | san | tvām | āgāṁsi | kr̥ṇavat | sakhā | te || mā | te | enasvantaḥ | yakṣin | bhujema | yandhi | sma | vipraḥ | stuvate | varūtham ||7.88.6||

IAST: dhruvāsu tvāsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyanto vy asmat pāśaṁ varuṇo mumocat
Griffith: While we abide in these fixed habitations, and from the lap of Aditi win favour,
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवासु त्वासु क्षितिषु क्षियन्तो व्यस्मत्पाशं वरुणो मुमोचत्
pada pāṭha: dhruvāsu | tvā | āsu | kṣitiṣu | kṣiyantaḥ | vi | asmat | pāśam | varuṇaḥ | mumocat || avaḥ | vanvānāḥ | aditeḥ | upa-sthāt | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.88.7||

IAST: avo vanvānā aditer upasthād yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May Varuna untie the bond that binds us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: अवो वन्वाना अदितेरुपस्थाद्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: dhruvāsu | tvā | āsu | kṣitiṣu | kṣiyantaḥ | vi | asmat | pāśam | varuṇaḥ | mumocat || avaḥ | vanvānāḥ | aditeḥ | upa-sthāt | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.88.7||

IAST: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṁ gṛhaṁ rājann ahaṁ gamam
Griffith: LET me not yet, King Varuna, enter into the house of clay:
Devanāgarī: मो षु वरुण मृन्मयं गृहं राजन्नहं गमम्
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | varuṇa | mr̥t-mayam | gr̥ham | rājan | aham | gamam || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.1||

IAST: mṛḻā sukṣatra mṛḻaya
Griffith: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.
Devanāgarī: मृळा सुक्षत्र मृळय
pada pāṭha: mo iti | su | varuṇa | mr̥t-mayam | gr̥ham | rājan | aham | gamam || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.1||

IAST: yad emi prasphurann iva dṛtir na dhmāto adrivaḥ
Griffith: When, Thunderer! I move along tremulous like a wind-blown skin,
Devanāgarī: यदेमि प्रस्फुरन्निव दृतिर्न ध्मातो अद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: yat | emi | prasphuran-iva | dr̥tiḥ | na | dhmātaḥ | adri-vaḥ || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.2||

IAST: mṛḻā sukṣatra mṛḻaya
Griffith: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.
Devanāgarī: मृळा सुक्षत्र मृळय
pada pāṭha: yat | emi | prasphuran-iva | dr̥tiḥ | na | dhmātaḥ | adri-vaḥ || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.2||

IAST: kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṁ jagamā śuce
Griffith: O Bright and Powerful God, through want of strength I erred and went astray
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वः समह दीनता प्रतीपं जगमा शुचे
pada pāṭha: kratvaḥ | samaha | dīnatā | prati-īpam | jagama | śuce || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.3||

IAST: mṛḻā sukṣatra mṛḻaya
Griffith: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.
Devanāgarī: मृळा सुक्षत्र मृळय
pada pāṭha: kratvaḥ | samaha | dīnatā | prati-īpam | jagama | śuce || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.3||

IAST: apām madhye tasthivāṁsaṁ tṛṣṇāvidaj jaritāram
Griffith: Thirst found thy worshipper though he stood in the midst of water-fijods:
Devanāgarī: अपां मध्ये तस्थिवांसं तृष्णाविदज्जरितारम्
pada pāṭha: apām | madhye | tasthi-vāṁsam | tr̥ṣṇā | avidat | jaritāram || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.4||

IAST: mṛḻā sukṣatra mṛḻaya
Griffith: Have mercy, spare me, Mighty Lord.
Devanāgarī: मृळा सुक्षत्र मृळय
pada pāṭha: apām | madhye | tasthi-vāṁsam | tr̥ṣṇā | avidat | jaritāram || mr̥ḷa | su-kṣatra | mr̥ḷaya ||7.89.4||

IAST: yat kiṁ cedaṁ varuṇa daivye jane 'bhidroham manuṣyāś carāmasi
Griffith: O Varuna, whatever the offence may be which we as men commit against the heavenly host,
Devanāgarī: यत्किं चेदं वरुण दैव्ये जनेऽभिद्रोहं मनुष्याश्चरामसि
pada pāṭha: yat | kim | ca | idam | varuṇa | daivye | jane | abhi-droham | manuṣyāḥ | carāmasi || acittī | yat | tava | dharma | yuyopima | mā | naḥ | tasmāt | enasaḥ | deva | ririṣaḥ ||7.89.5||

IAST: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nas tasmād enaso deva rīriṣaḥ
Griffith: When through our want of thought we violate thy laws, punish us not, O God, for that iniquity.
Devanāgarī: अचित्ती यत्तव धर्मा युयोपिम मा नस्तस्मादेनसो देव रीरिषः
pada pāṭha: yat | kim | ca | idam | varuṇa | daivye | jane | abhi-droham | manuṣyāḥ | carāmasi || acittī | yat | tava | dharma | yuyopima | mā | naḥ | tasmāt | enasaḥ | deva | ririṣaḥ ||7.89.5||

IAST: pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vām adhvaryubhir madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ
Griffith: To you pure juice, rich in meath, are offered by priest: through longing for the Pair of Heroes.
Devanāgarī: प्र वीरया शुचयो दद्रिरे वामध्वर्युभिर्मधुमन्तः सुतासः
pada pāṭha: pra | vīra-yā | śucayaḥ | dadrire | vām | adhvaryu-bhiḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | sutāsaḥ || vaha | vāyo iti | ni-yutaḥ | yāhi | accha | piba | sutasya | andhasaḥ | madāya ||7.90.1||

IAST: vaha vāyo niyuto yāhy acchā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya
Griffith: Drive, Vayu, bring thine harnessed horses hither: drink the pressed Soma till it make thee joyful.
Devanāgarī: वह वायो नियुतो याह्यच्छा पिबा सुतस्यान्धसो मदाय
pada pāṭha: pra | vīra-yā | śucayaḥ | dadrire | vām | adhvaryu-bhiḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | sutāsaḥ || vaha | vāyo iti | ni-yutaḥ | yāhi | accha | piba | sutasya | andhasaḥ | madāya ||7.90.1||

IAST: īśānāya prahutiṁ yas ta ānaṭ chuciṁ somaṁ śucipās tubhyaṁ vāyo
Griffith: Whoso to thee, the Mighty, brings oblation, pure Soma unto thee, pure-drinking Vayu,
Devanāgarī: ईशानाय प्रहुतिं यस्त आनट् छुचिं सोमं शुचिपास्तुभ्यं वायो
pada pāṭha: īśānāya | pra-hutim | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | śucim | somam | śuci-pāḥ | tubhyam | vāyo iti || kr̥ṇoṣi | tam | martyeṣu | pra-śastam | jātaḥ-jātaḥ | jāyate | vājī | asya ||7.90.2||

IAST: kṛṇoṣi tam martyeṣu praśastaṁ jāto-jāto jāyate vājy asya
Griffith: That man thou makest famous among mortals: to him strong sons are born in quick succession.
Devanāgarī: कृणोषि तं मर्त्येषु प्रशस्तं जातोजातो जायते वाज्यस्य
pada pāṭha: īśānāya | pra-hutim | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | śucim | somam | śuci-pāḥ | tubhyam | vāyo iti || kr̥ṇoṣi | tam | martyeṣu | pra-śastam | jātaḥ-jātaḥ | jāyate | vājī | asya ||7.90.2||

IAST: rāye nu yaṁ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam
Griffith: The God whom both these worlds brought forth for riches, whom heavenly Dhisana for our wealth appointeth,
Devanāgarī: राये नु यं जज्ञतू रोदसीमे राये देवी धिषणा धाति देवम्
pada pāṭha: rāye | nu | yam | jajñatuḥ | rodasī iti | ime iti | rāye | devī | dhiṣaṇā | dhāti | devam || adha | vāyum | ni-yutaḥ | saścata | svāḥ | uta | śvetam | vasu-dhitim | nireke ||7.90.3||

IAST: adha vāyuṁ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṁ vasudhitiṁ nireke
Griffith: His team of harnessed horses waits on Vayu, and, foremost, on the radiant Treasure-bearer.
Devanāgarī: अध वायुं नियुतः सश्चत स्वा उत श्वेतं वसुधितिं निरेके
pada pāṭha: rāye | nu | yam | jajñatuḥ | rodasī iti | ime iti | rāye | devī | dhiṣaṇā | dhāti | devam || adha | vāyum | ni-yutaḥ | saścata | svāḥ | uta | śvetam | vasu-dhitim | nireke ||7.90.3||

IAST: ucchann uṣasaḥ sudinā ariprā uru jyotir vividur dīdhyānāḥ
Griffith: The spotless Dawns with fair bright days have broken; they found the spacious light when they were shining
Devanāgarī: उच्छन्नुषसः सुदिना अरिप्रा उरु ज्योतिर्विविदुर्दीध्यानाः
pada pāṭha: ucchan | uṣasaḥ | su-dināḥ | ariprāḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | vividuḥ | dīdhyānāḥ || gavyam | cit | ūrvam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruḥ | teṣām | anu | pra-divaḥ | sasruḥ | āpaḥ ||7.90.4||

IAST: gavyaṁ cid ūrvam uśijo vi vavrus teṣām anu pradivaḥ sasrur āpaḥ
Griffith: Eagerly they disclosed the stall of cattle: floods streamed for them as in the days aforetime.
Devanāgarī: गव्यं चिदूर्वमुशिजो वि वव्रुस्तेषामनु प्रदिवः सस्रुरापः
pada pāṭha: ucchan | uṣasaḥ | su-dināḥ | ariprāḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | vividuḥ | dīdhyānāḥ || gavyam | cit | ūrvam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruḥ | teṣām | anu | pra-divaḥ | sasruḥ | āpaḥ ||7.90.4||

IAST: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti
Griffith: These with their truthful spirit, shining brightly, move on provided with their natural insight.
Devanāgarī: ते सत्येन मनसा दीध्यानाः स्वेन युक्तासः क्रतुना वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: te | satyena | manasā | dīdhyānāḥ | svena | yuktāsaḥ | kratunā | vahanti || indravāyū iti | vīra-vāham | ratham | vām | īśānayoḥ | abhi | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacante ||7.90.5||

IAST: indravāyū vīravāhaṁ rathaṁ vām īśānayor abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante
Griffith: Viands attend the car that beareth Heroes, your car, ye Sovran Pair, Indra and Vayu.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रवायू वीरवाहं रथं वामीशानयोरभि पृक्षः सचन्ते
pada pāṭha: te | satyena | manasā | dīdhyānāḥ | svena | yuktāsaḥ | kratunā | vahanti || indravāyū iti | vīra-vāham | ratham | vām | īśānayoḥ | abhi | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacante ||7.90.5||

IAST: īśānāso ye dadhate svar ṇo gobhir aśvebhir vasubhir hiraṇyaiḥ
Griffith: May these who give us heavenly light, these rulers, with gifts of kine and horses, gold and treasures.
Devanāgarī: ईशानासो ये दधते स्वर्णो गोभिरश्वेभिर्वसुभिर्हिरण्यैः
pada pāṭha: īśānāsaḥ | ye | dadhate | svaḥ | naḥ | gobhiḥ | aśvebhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | hiraṇyaiḥ || indravāyū iti | sūrayaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | vīraiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sahyuḥ ||7.90.6||

IAST: indravāyū sūrayo viśvam āyur arvadbhir vīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ
Griffith: These princes, through full life, Indra and Vayu! o'ercome in battle with their steeds and heroes.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रवायू सूरयो विश्वमायुरर्वद्भिर्वीरैः पृतनासु सह्युः
pada pāṭha: īśānāsaḥ | ye | dadhate | svaḥ | naḥ | gobhiḥ | aśvebhiḥ | vasu-bhiḥ | hiraṇyaiḥ || indravāyū iti | sūrayaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | vīraiḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sahyuḥ ||7.90.6||

IAST: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasisthas, O Indra-Vayu, with our fair laudations.
Devanāgarī: अर्वन्तो न श्रवसो भिक्षमाणा इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: arvantaḥ | na | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ | indravāyū iti | sustuti-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || vāja-yantaḥ | su | avase | huvema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.90.7||

IAST: vājayantaḥ sv avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Exerting all our power call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वाजयन्तः स्ववसे हुवेम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: arvantaḥ | na | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ | indravāyū iti | sustuti-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || vāja-yantaḥ | su | avase | huvema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.90.7||

IAST: kuvid aṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devā anavadyāsa āsan
Griffith: WERE not in sooth, the Gods aforetime blameless, whose pleasure was increased by adoration?
Devanāgarī: कुविदङ्ग नमसा ये वृधासः पुरा देवा अनवद्यास आसन्
pada pāṭha: kuvit | aṅga | namasā | ye | vr̥dhāsaḥ | purā | devāḥ | anavadyāsaḥ | āsan || te | vāyave | manave | bādhitāya | avāsayan | uṣasam | sūryeṇa ||7.91.1||

IAST: te vāyave manave bādhitāyāvāsayann uṣasaṁ sūryeṇa
Griffith: For Vayu and for man in his affliction they caused the Morning to arise with Surya.
Devanāgarī: ते वायवे मनवे बाधितायावासयन्नुषसं सूर्येण
pada pāṭha: kuvit | aṅga | namasā | ye | vr̥dhāsaḥ | purā | devāḥ | anavadyāsaḥ | āsan || te | vāyave | manave | bādhitāya | avāsayan | uṣasam | sūryeṇa ||7.91.1||
