IAST: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya gopā māsaś ca pāthaḥ śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Guardians infallible, eager as envoys' preserve us safe through many months and autumns.
Devanāgarī: उशन्ता दूता न दभाय गोपा मासश्च पाथः शरदश्च पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: uśantā | dūtā | na | dabhāya | gopā | māsaḥ | ca | pāthaḥ | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ || indravāyū iti | su-stutiḥ | vām | iyānā | mārḍīkam | īṭṭe | suvitam | ca | navyam ||7.91.2||

IAST: indravāyū suṣṭutir vām iyānā mārḍīkam īṭṭe suvitaṁ ca navyam
Griffith: Addressed to you, our fair praise, Indra-Vayu, implores your favour and renewed well-being.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिर्वामियाना मार्डीकमीट्टे सुवितं च नव्यम्
pada pāṭha: uśantā | dūtā | na | dabhāya | gopā | māsaḥ | ca | pāthaḥ | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ || indravāyū iti | su-stutiḥ | vām | iyānā | mārḍīkam | īṭṭe | suvitam | ca | navyam ||7.91.2||

IAST: pīvoannām̐ rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ
Griffith: Wise, bright, arranger of his teams, he. seeketh men with rich food whose treasures are abundant.
Devanāgarī: पीवोअन्नाँ रयिवृधः सुमेधाः श्वेतः सिषक्ति नियुतामभिश्रीः
pada pāṭha: pīvaḥ-annān | rayi-vr̥dhaḥ | su-medhāḥ | śvetaḥ | sisakti | ni-yutām | abhi-śrīḥ || te | vāyave | sa-manasaḥ | vi | tasthuḥ | viśvā | it | naraḥ | su-apatyāni | cakruḥ ||7.91.3||

IAST: te vāyave samanaso vi tasthur viśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ
Griffith: They have arranged them of one mind with Vayu: the men have wrought all noble operations.
Devanāgarī: ते वायवे समनसो वि तस्थुर्विश्वेन्नरः स्वपत्यानि चक्रुः
pada pāṭha: pīvaḥ-annān | rayi-vr̥dhaḥ | su-medhāḥ | śvetaḥ | sisakti | ni-yutām | abhi-śrīḥ || te | vāyave | sa-manasaḥ | vi | tasthuḥ | viśvā | it | naraḥ | su-apatyāni | cakruḥ ||7.91.3||

IAST: yāvat taras tanvo yāvad ojo yāvan naraś cakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ
Griffith: So far as native power and strength permit you, so far as men behold whose eyes have vision,
Devanāgarī: यावत्तरस्तन्वो यावदोजो यावन्नरश्चक्षसा दीध्यानाः
pada pāṭha: yāvat | taraḥ | tanvaḥ | yāvat | ojaḥ | yāvat | naraḥ | cakṣasā | dīdhyānāḥ || śucim | somam | śuci-pā | pātam | asme iti | indravāyū iti | sadatam | barhiḥ | ā | idam ||7.91.4||

IAST: śuciṁ somaṁ śucipā pātam asme indravāyū sadatam barhir edam
Griffith: O ye pure-drinkers, drink with us pure Soma: sit on this sacred grass, Indra and Vayu.
Devanāgarī: शुचिं सोमं शुचिपा पातमस्मे इन्द्रवायू सदतं बर्हिरेदम्
pada pāṭha: yāvat | taraḥ | tanvaḥ | yāvat | ojaḥ | yāvat | naraḥ | cakṣasā | dīdhyānāḥ || śucim | somam | śuci-pā | pātam | asme iti | indravāyū iti | sadatam | barhiḥ | ā | idam ||7.91.4||

IAST: niyuvānā niyutaḥ spārhavīrā indravāyū sarathaṁ yātam arvāk
Griffith: Driving down teams that bear the lovely Heroes, hitherward, Indra-Vayu, come together.
Devanāgarī: नियुवाना नियुतः स्पार्हवीरा इन्द्रवायू सरथं यातमर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ni-yuvānā | ni-yutaḥ | spārha-vīrāḥ | indravāyū iti | sa-ratham | yātam | arvāk || idam | hi | vām | pra-bhr̥tam | madhvaḥ | agram | adha | prīṇānā | vi | mumuktam | asme iti ||7.91.5||

IAST: idaṁ hi vām prabhṛtam madhvo agram adha prīṇānā vi mumuktam asme
Griffith: To you this prime of savoury juice is offered: here loose your horses and be friendly-minded.
Devanāgarī: इदं हि वां प्रभृतं मध्वो अग्रमध प्रीणाना वि मुमुक्तमस्मे
pada pāṭha: ni-yuvānā | ni-yutaḥ | spārha-vīrāḥ | indravāyū iti | sa-ratham | yātam | arvāk || idam | hi | vām | pra-bhr̥tam | madhvaḥ | agram | adha | prīṇānā | vi | mumuktam | asme iti ||7.91.5||

IAST: yā vāṁ śataṁ niyuto yāḥ sahasram indravāyū viśvavārāḥ sacante
Griffith: Your hundred and your thousand teams, O Indra and Vayu, all-munificent, which attend you,
Devanāgarī: या वां शतं नियुतो याः सहस्रमिन्द्रवायू विश्ववाराः सचन्ते
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vām | śatam | ni-yutaḥ | yāḥ | sahasram | indravāyū iti | viśva-vārāḥ | sacante || ā | ābhiḥ | yātam | su-vidatrābhiḥ | arvāk | pātam | narā | prati-bhr̥tasya | madhvaḥ ||7.91.6||

IAST: ābhir yātaṁ suvidatrābhir arvāk pātaṁ narā pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ
Griffith: With these most gracious-minded come ye hither, and drink, O Heroes of the meath we offer.
Devanāgarī: आभिर्यातं सुविदत्राभिरर्वाक्पातं नरा प्रतिभृतस्य मध्वः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vām | śatam | ni-yutaḥ | yāḥ | sahasram | indravāyū iti | viśva-vārāḥ | sacante || ā | ābhiḥ | yātam | su-vidatrābhiḥ | arvāk | pātam | narā | prati-bhr̥tasya | madhvaḥ ||7.91.6||

IAST: arvanto na śravaso bhikṣamāṇā indravāyū suṣṭutibhir vasiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Like coursers seeking fame will we Vasisthas, O Indra-Vayu, with our fair laudations,
Devanāgarī: अर्वन्तो न श्रवसो भिक्षमाणा इन्द्रवायू सुष्टुतिभिर्वसिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: arvantaḥ | na | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ | indravāyū iti | sustuti-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || vāja-yantaḥ | su | avase | huvema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.91.7||

IAST: vājayantaḥ sv avase huvema yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Exerting all our powe-,, call you to aid us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वाजयन्तः स्ववसे हुवेम यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: arvantaḥ | na | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ | indravāyū iti | sustuti-bhiḥ | vasiṣṭhāḥ || vāja-yantaḥ | su | avase | huvema | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.91.7||

IAST: ā vāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṁ te niyuto viśvavāra
Griffith: O VAYU, drinker of the pure, be near us: a thousand teams are thine, Allbounteous Giver.
Devanāgarī: आ वायो भूष शुचिपा उप नः सहस्रं ते नियुतो विश्ववार
pada pāṭha: ā | vāyo iti | bhūṣa | śuci-pāḥ | upa | naḥ | sahasram | te | ni-yutaḥ | viśva-vāra || upo iti | te | andhaḥ | madyam | ayāmi | yasya | deva | dadhiṣe | pūrva-peyam ||7.92.1||

IAST: upo te andho madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam
Griffith: To thee the rapture-bringing juice is offered, whose first draught, God, thou takest as thy portion.
Devanāgarī: उपो ते अन्धो मद्यमयामि यस्य देव दधिषे पूर्वपेयम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vāyo iti | bhūṣa | śuci-pāḥ | upa | naḥ | sahasram | te | ni-yutaḥ | viśva-vāra || upo iti | te | andhaḥ | madyam | ayāmi | yasya | deva | dadhiṣe | pūrva-peyam ||7.92.1||

IAST: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣv asthāt somam indrāya vāyave pibadhyai
Griffith: Prompt at the holy rites forth came the presser with Soma-draughts for Indra and for Vayu,
Devanāgarī: प्र सोता जीरो अध्वरेष्वस्थात्सोममिन्द्राय वायवे पिबध्यै
pada pāṭha: pra | sotā | jīraḥ | adhvareṣu | asthāt | somam | indrāya | vāyave | pibadhyai || pra | yat | vām | madhvaḥ | agriyam | bharanti | adhvaryavaḥ | deva-yantaḥ | śacībhiḥ ||7.92.2||

IAST: pra yad vām madhvo agriyam bharanty adhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: When ministering priests with strong devotion bring to you Twain the first taste of the Soma.
Devanāgarī: प्र यद्वां मध्वो अग्रियं भरन्त्यध्वर्यवो देवयन्तः शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: pra | sotā | jīraḥ | adhvareṣu | asthāt | somam | indrāya | vāyave | pibadhyai || pra | yat | vām | madhvaḥ | agriyam | bharanti | adhvaryavaḥ | deva-yantaḥ | śacībhiḥ ||7.92.2||

IAST: pra yābhir yāsi dāśvāṁsam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe
Griffith: The teams wherewith thou seekest him who offers, within his home, O Viyu, to direct him,
Devanāgarī: प्र याभिर्यासि दाश्वांसमच्छा नियुद्भिर्वायविष्टये दुरोणे
pada pāṭha: pra | yābhiḥ | yāsi | dāśvāṁsam | accha | niyut-bhiḥ | vāyo iti | iṣṭaye | duroṇe || ni | naḥ | rayim | su-bhojasam | yuvasva | ni | vīram | gavyam | aśvyam | ca | rādhaḥ ||7.92.3||

IAST: ni no rayiṁ subhojasaṁ yuvasva ni vīraṁ gavyam aśvyaṁ ca rādhaḥ
Griffith: Therewith send wealth: to us with full enjoyment, a hero son and gifts of kine and horses.
Devanāgarī: नि नो रयिं सुभोजसं युवस्व नि वीरं गव्यमश्व्यं च राधः
pada pāṭha: pra | yābhiḥ | yāsi | dāśvāṁsam | accha | niyut-bhiḥ | vāyo iti | iṣṭaye | duroṇe || ni | naḥ | rayim | su-bhojasam | yuvasva | ni | vīram | gavyam | aśvyam | ca | rādhaḥ ||7.92.3||

IAST: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ
Griffith: Near to the Gods and making Indra joyful, devout and ofFering precious gifts to Vayu,
Devanāgarī: ये वायव इन्द्रमादनास आदेवासो नितोशनासो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: ye | vāyave | indra-mādanāsaḥ | ā-devāsaḥ | ni-tośanāsaḥ | aryaḥ || ghnantaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | sūri-bhiḥ | syāma | sasahvāṁsaḥ | yudhā | nr̥-bhiḥ | amitrān ||7.92.4||

IAST: ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṁso yudhā nṛbhir amitrān
Griffith: Allied with princes, smiting down the hostile, may we with heroes conquer foes in battle.
Devanāgarī: घ्नन्तो वृत्राणि सूरिभिः ष्याम सासह्वांसो युधा नृभिरमित्रान्
pada pāṭha: ye | vāyave | indra-mādanāsaḥ | ā-devāsaḥ | ni-tośanāsaḥ | aryaḥ || ghnantaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | sūri-bhiḥ | syāma | sasahvāṁsaḥ | yudhā | nr̥-bhiḥ | amitrān ||7.92.4||

IAST: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhir adhvaraṁ sahasriṇībhir upa yāhi yajñam
Griffith: With thy yoked teams in hundreds and in thousands come to our sacrifice and solemn worship.
Devanāgarī: आ नो नियुद्भिः शतिनीभिरध्वरं सहस्रिणीभिरुप याहि यज्ञम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | śatinībhiḥ | adhvaram | sahasriṇībhiḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam || vāyo iti | asmin | savane | mādayasva | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.92.5||

IAST: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Come, Vayu, make thee glad at this libation. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वायो अस्मिन्सवने मादयस्व यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | śatinībhiḥ | adhvaram | sahasriṇībhiḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam || vāyo iti | asmin | savane | mādayasva | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.92.5||

IAST: śuciṁ nu stomaṁ navajātam adyendrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā juṣethām
Griffith: SLAYERS of enemies, Indra and Agni, accept this day our new-born pure laudation.
Devanāgarī: शुचिं नु स्तोमं नवजातमद्येन्द्राग्नी वृत्रहणा जुषेथाम्
pada pāṭha: śucim | nu | stomam | nava-jātam | adya | indrāgnī iti | vr̥tra-hanā | juṣethām || ubhā | hi | vām | su-havā | johavīmi | tā | vājam | sadyaḥ | uśate | dheṣṭhā ||7.93.1||

IAST: ubhā hi vāṁ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṁ sadya uśate dheṣṭhā
Griffith: Again, again I call you prompt to listen, best to give quickly strength to him who craves it.
Devanāgarī: उभा हि वां सुहवा जोहवीमि ता वाजं सद्य उशते धेष्ठा
pada pāṭha: śucim | nu | stomam | nava-jātam | adya | indrāgnī iti | vr̥tra-hanā | juṣethām || ubhā | hi | vām | su-havā | johavīmi | tā | vājam | sadyaḥ | uśate | dheṣṭhā ||7.93.1||

IAST: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṁ sākaṁvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṁsā
Griffith: For ye were strong to gain, exceeding mighty, growing together, waxing in your vigour.
Devanāgarī: ता सानसी शवसाना हि भूतं साकंवृधा शवसा शूशुवांसा
pada pāṭha: tā | sānasī iti | śavasānā | hi | bhūtam | sākam-vr̥dhā | śavasā | śūśu-vāṁsā || kṣayantau | rāyaḥ | yavasasya | bhūreḥ | pr̥ṅktam | vājasya | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ ||7.93.2||

IAST: kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṁ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
Griffith: Lords of the pasture filled with ample riches, bestow upon us strength both fresh and lasting.
Devanāgarī: क्षयन्तौ रायो यवसस्य भूरेः पृङ्क्तं वाजस्य स्थविरस्य घृष्वेः
pada pāṭha: tā | sānasī iti | śavasānā | hi | bhūtam | sākam-vr̥dhā | śavasā | śūśu-vāṁsā || kṣayantau | rāyaḥ | yavasasya | bhūreḥ | pr̥ṅktam | vājasya | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ ||7.93.2||

IAST: upo ha yad vidathaṁ vājino gur dhībhir viprāḥ pramatim icchamānāḥ
Griffith: Yea when the strong have entered our assembly, and singers seeking with their hymns your favour,
Devanāgarī: उपो ह यद्विदथं वाजिनो गुर्धीभिर्विप्राः प्रमतिमिच्छमानाः
pada pāṭha: upo iti | ha | yat | vidatham | vājinaḥ | guḥ | dhībhiḥ | viprāḥ | pra-matim | icchamānāḥ || arvantaḥ | na | kāṣṭhām | nakṣamāṇāḥ | indrāgnī iti | johuvataḥ | naraḥ | te ||7.93.3||

IAST: arvanto na kāṣṭhāṁ nakṣamāṇā indrāgnī johuvato naras te
Griffith: They are like steeds who come into the race-course, those men who call aloud on Indra-Agni.
Devanāgarī: अर्वन्तो न काष्ठां नक्षमाणा इन्द्राग्नी जोहुवतो नरस्ते
pada pāṭha: upo iti | ha | yat | vidatham | vājinaḥ | guḥ | dhībhiḥ | viprāḥ | pra-matim | icchamānāḥ || arvantaḥ | na | kāṣṭhām | nakṣamāṇāḥ | indrāgnī iti | johuvataḥ | naraḥ | te ||7.93.3||

IAST: gīrbhir vipraḥ pramatim icchamāna īṭṭe rayiṁ yaśasam pūrvabhājam
Griffith: The singer, seeking with his hymns your favour, begs splendid riches of their first possessor.
Devanāgarī: गीर्भिर्विप्रः प्रमतिमिच्छमान ईट्टे रयिं यशसं पूर्वभाजम्
pada pāṭha: gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | pra-matim | icchamānaḥ | īṭṭe | rayim | yaśasam | pūrva-bhājam || indrāgnī iti | vr̥tra-hanā | su-vajrā | pra | naḥ | navyebhiḥ | tiratam | deṣṇaiḥ ||7.93.4||

IAST: indrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhis tirataṁ deṣṇaiḥ
Griffith: Further us with new bounties, Indra-Agni, armed with strong thunder, slayers of the foeman.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी वृत्रहणा सुवज्रा प्र नो नव्येभिस्तिरतं देष्णैः
pada pāṭha: gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | pra-matim | icchamānaḥ | īṭṭe | rayim | yaśasam | pūrva-bhājam || indrāgnī iti | vr̥tra-hanā | su-vajrā | pra | naḥ | navyebhiḥ | tiratam | deṣṇaiḥ ||7.93.4||

IAST: saṁ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite
Griffith: When two great hosts, arrayed against each other, meet clothed with brightness, in the fierce encounter
Devanāgarī: सं यन्मही मिथती स्पर्धमाने तनूरुचा शूरसाता यतैते
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | mahī iti | mithatī iti | spardhamāne iti | tanū-rucā | śūra-sātā | yataite iti || adeva-yum | vidathe | devayu-bhiḥ | satrā | hatam | soma-sutā | janena ||7.93.5||

IAST: adevayuṁ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṁ somasutā janena
Griffith: Stand ye beside the godly, smite the godless; and still assist the men who press the Soma.
Devanāgarī: अदेवयुं विदथे देवयुभिः सत्रा हतं सोमसुता जनेन
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | mahī iti | mithatī iti | spardhamāne iti | tanū-rucā | śūra-sātā | yataite iti || adeva-yum | vidathe | devayu-bhiḥ | satrā | hatam | soma-sutā | janena ||7.93.5||

IAST: imām u ṣu somasutim upa na endrāgnī saumanasāya yātam
Griffith: To this our Soma-pressing, Indra-Agni, come ye prepared to show your loving-kindness,
Devanāgarī: इमामु षु सोमसुतिमुप न एन्द्राग्नी सौमनसाय यातम्
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | soma-sutim | upa | naḥ | ā | indrāgnī iti | saumanasāya | yātam || nu | cit | hi | parimamnāthe iti pari-mamnāthe | asmān | ā | vām | śaśvat-bhiḥ | vavr̥tīya | vājaiḥ ||7.93.6||

IAST: nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmān ā vāṁ śaśvadbhir vavṛtīya vājaiḥ
Griffith: For not at any time have ye despised us. So may I draw you with all strengthenings hither.
Devanāgarī: नू चिद्धि परिमम्नाथे अस्माना वां शश्वद्भिर्ववृतीय वाजैः
pada pāṭha: imām | ūm̐ iti | su | soma-sutim | upa | naḥ | ā | indrāgnī iti | saumanasāya | yātam || nu | cit | hi | parimamnāthe iti pari-mamnāthe | asmān | ā | vām | śaśvat-bhiḥ | vavr̥tīya | vājaiḥ ||7.93.6||

IAST: so agna enā namasā samiddho 'cchā mitraṁ varuṇam indraṁ voceḥ
Griffith: So Agni, kindled mid this adoration, invite thou Mitra, Varuna, and Indra.
Devanāgarī: सो अग्न एना नमसा समिद्धोऽच्छा मित्रं वरुणमिन्द्रं वोचेः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agne | enā | namasā | sam-iddhaḥ | accha | mitram | varuṇam | indram | voceḥ || yat | sīm | āgaḥ | cakr̥ma | tat | su | mr̥ḷa | tat | aryamā | aditiḥ | śiśrathantu ||7.93.7||

IAST: yat sīm āgaś cakṛmā tat su mṛḻa tad aryamāditiḥ śiśrathantu
Griffith: Forgive whatever sin we have committed may Aryaman and Aditi remove it.
Devanāgarī: यत्सीमागश्चकृमा तत्सु मृळ तदर्यमादितिः शिश्रथन्तु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agne | enā | namasā | sam-iddhaḥ | accha | mitram | varuṇam | indram | voceḥ || yat | sīm | āgaḥ | cakr̥ma | tat | su | mr̥ḷa | tat | aryamā | aditiḥ | śiśrathantu ||7.93.7||

IAST: etā agna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīr yuvoḥ sacābhy aśyāma vājān
Griffith: While we accelerate these our sacrifices, may we win strength from both of you, O Agni:
Devanāgarī: एता अग्न आशुषाणास इष्टीर्युवोः सचाभ्यश्याम वाजान्
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | agne | āśuṣāṇāsaḥ | iṣṭīḥ | yuvoḥ | sacā | abhi | aśyāma | vājān || mā | indraḥ | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | marutaḥ | pari | khyan | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.93.8||

IAST: mendro no viṣṇur marutaḥ pari khyan yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Ne'er may the Maruts, Indra, Visnu slight us. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: मेन्द्रो नो विष्णुर्मरुतः परि ख्यन्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | agne | āśuṣāṇāsaḥ | iṣṭīḥ | yuvoḥ | sacā | abhi | aśyāma | vājān || mā | indraḥ | naḥ | viṣṇuḥ | marutaḥ | pari | khyan | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.93.8||

IAST: iyaṁ vām asya manmana indrāgnī pūrvyastutiḥ
Griffith: As rain from out the cloud, for you, Indra and Agni, from my soul
Devanāgarī: इयं वामस्य मन्मन इन्द्राग्नी पूर्व्यस्तुतिः
pada pāṭha: iyam | vām | asya | manmanaḥ | indrāgnī iti | pūrvya-stutiḥ || abhrāt | vr̥ṣṭiḥ-iva | ajani ||7.94.1||

IAST: abhrād vṛṣṭir ivājani
Griffith: This noblest praise hath been produced.
Devanāgarī: अभ्राद्वृष्टिरिवाजनि
pada pāṭha: iyam | vām | asya | manmanaḥ | indrāgnī iti | pūrvya-stutiḥ || abhrāt | vr̥ṣṭiḥ-iva | ajani ||7.94.1||

IAST: śṛṇutaṁ jaritur havam indrāgnī vanataṁ giraḥ
Griffith: Do ye, O Indra-Agni, hear the singer's call: accept his songs.
Devanāgarī: शृणुतं जरितुर्हवमिन्द्राग्नी वनतं गिरः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇutam | jarituḥ | havam | indrāgnī iti | vanatam | giraḥ || īśānā | pipyatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.94.2||

IAST: īśānā pipyataṁ dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Ye Rulers, grant his heart's desire.
Devanāgarī: ईशाना पिप्यतं धियः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇutam | jarituḥ | havam | indrāgnī iti | vanatam | giraḥ || īśānā | pipyatam | dhiyaḥ ||7.94.2||

IAST: mā pāpatvāya no narendrāgnī mābhiśastaye
Griffith: Give us not up to poverty, ye Heroes, Indra-Agni, nor
Devanāgarī: मा पापत्वाय नो नरेन्द्राग्नी माभिशस्तये
pada pāṭha: mā | pāpa-tvāya | naḥ | narā | indrāgnī iti | mā | abhi-śastaye || mā | naḥ | rīradhatam | nide ||7.94.3||

IAST: mā no rīradhataṁ nide
Griffith: To slander and reproach of men.
Devanāgarī: मा नो रीरधतं निदे
pada pāṭha: mā | pāpa-tvāya | naḥ | narā | indrāgnī iti | mā | abhi-śastaye || mā | naḥ | rīradhatam | nide ||7.94.3||

IAST: indre agnā namo bṛhat suvṛktim erayāmahe
Griffith: To Indra and to Agni we bring reverence, high and holy hymn,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रे अग्ना नमो बृहत्सुवृक्तिमेरयामहे
pada pāṭha: indre | agnā | namaḥ | br̥hat | su-vr̥ktim | ā | īrayāmahe || dhiyā | dhenāḥ | avasyavaḥ ||7.94.4||

IAST: dhiyā dhenā avasyavaḥ
Griffith: And, craving help, softwords with prayer.
Devanāgarī: धिया धेना अवस्यवः
pada pāṭha: indre | agnā | namaḥ | br̥hat | su-vr̥ktim | ā | īrayāmahe || dhiyā | dhenāḥ | avasyavaḥ ||7.94.4||

IAST: tā hi śaśvanta īḻata itthā viprāsa ūtaye
Griffith: For all these holy singers here implore these Twain to succour them,
Devanāgarī: ता हि शश्वन्त ईळत इत्था विप्रास ऊतये
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śaśvantaḥ | īḷate | itthā | viprāsaḥ | ūtaye || sa-bādhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||7.94.5||

IAST: sabādho vājasātaye
Griffith: And priests that they may win them strength.
Devanāgarī: सबाधो वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śaśvantaḥ | īḷate | itthā | viprāsaḥ | ūtaye || sa-bādhaḥ | vāja-sātaye ||7.94.5||

IAST: tā vāṁ gīrbhir vipanyavaḥ prayasvanto havāmahe
Griffith: Eager to laudyou, we with songs invoke you, bearing sacred food,
Devanāgarī: ता वां गीर्भिर्विपन्यवः प्रयस्वन्तो हवामहे
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipanyavaḥ | prayasvantaḥ | havāmahe || medha-sātā | saniṣyavaḥ ||7.94.6||

IAST: medhasātā saniṣyavaḥ
Griffith: Fain for success in sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: मेधसाता सनिष्यवः
pada pāṭha: tā | vām | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vipanyavaḥ | prayasvantaḥ | havāmahe || medha-sātā | saniṣyavaḥ ||7.94.6||

IAST: indrāgnī avasā gatam asmabhyaṁ carṣaṇīsahā
Griffith: Indra and Agni, come to us with favour, ye who conquer men:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी अवसा गतमस्मभ्यं चर्षणीसहा
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | avasā | ā | gatam | asmabhyam | carṣaṇi-sahā || mā | naḥ | duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||7.94.7||

IAST: mā no duḥśaṁsa īśata
Griffith: Let not the wicked master us.
Devanāgarī: मा नो दुःशंस ईशत
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | avasā | ā | gatam | asmabhyam | carṣaṇi-sahā || mā | naḥ | duḥ-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||7.94.7||

IAST: mā kasya no araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṅ martyasya
Griffith: At no time let the injurious blow of hostile mortal fall on us:
Devanāgarī: मा कस्य नो अररुषो धूर्तिः प्रणङ्मर्त्यस्य
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | naḥ | araruṣaḥ | dhūrtiḥ | praṇak | martyasya || indrāgnī iti | śarma | yacchatam ||7.94.8||

IAST: indrāgnī śarma yacchatam
Griffith: O Indra-Agni, shelter us.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी शर्म यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | naḥ | araruṣaḥ | dhūrtiḥ | praṇak | martyasya || indrāgnī iti | śarma | yacchatam ||7.94.8||

IAST: gomad dhiraṇyavad vasu yad vām aśvāvad īmahe
Griffith: Whatever wealth we crave of you, in gold, in cattle, or in steeds,
Devanāgarī: गोमद्धिरण्यवद्वसु यद्वामश्वावदीमहे
pada pāṭha: go-mat | hiraṇya-vat | vasu | yat | vām | aśva-vat | īmahe || indrāgnī iti | tat | vanemahi ||7.94.9||

IAST: indrāgnī tad vanemahi
Griffith: That, Indra-Agni, let us gain;
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी तद्वनेमहि
pada pāṭha: go-mat | hiraṇya-vat | vasu | yat | vām | aśva-vat | īmahe || indrāgnī iti | tat | vanemahi ||7.94.9||

IAST: yat soma ā sute nara indrāgnī ajohavuḥ
Griffith: When heroes prompt in worship call Indra and Agni, Lords of steeds,
Devanāgarī: यत्सोम आ सुते नर इन्द्राग्नी अजोहवुः
pada pāṭha: yat | some | ā | sute | naraḥ | indrāgnī iti | ajohavuḥ || sapti-vantā | saparyavaḥ ||7.94.10||

IAST: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ
Griffith: Beside the Soma juice effused.
Devanāgarī: सप्तीवन्ता सपर्यवः
pada pāṭha: yat | some | ā | sute | naraḥ | indrāgnī iti | ajohavuḥ || sapti-vantā | saparyavaḥ ||7.94.10||

IAST: ukthebhir vṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cid ā girā
Griffith: Call hither with the song and lauds those who best slay the foemen, those
Devanāgarī: उक्थेभिर्वृत्रहन्तमा या मन्दाना चिदा गिरा
pada pāṭha: ukthebhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tamā | yā | mandānā | cit | ā | girā || āṅgūṣaiḥ | ā-vivāsataḥ ||7.94.11||

IAST: āṅgūṣair āvivāsataḥ
Griffith: Who take delight in hymns of praise.
Devanāgarī: आङ्गूषैराविवासतः
pada pāṭha: ukthebhiḥ | vr̥trahan-tamā | yā | mandānā | cit | ā | girā || āṅgūṣaiḥ | ā-vivāsataḥ ||7.94.11||

IAST: tāv id duḥśaṁsam martyaṁ durvidvāṁsaṁ rakṣasvinam
Griffith: Slay ye the wicked man whose thought is evil of the demon kind.
Devanāgarī: ताविद्दुःशंसं मर्त्यं दुर्विद्वांसं रक्षस्विनम्
pada pāṭha: tau | it | duḥ-śaṁsam | martyam | duḥ-vidvāṁsam | rakṣasvinam || ā-bhogam | hanmanā | hatam | uda-dhim | hanmanā | hatam ||7.94.12||

IAST: ābhogaṁ hanmanā hatam udadhiṁ hanmanā hatam
Griffith: Slay him who stays the waters, slay the Serpent with your deadly dart.
Devanāgarī: आभोगं हन्मना हतमुदधिं हन्मना हतम्
pada pāṭha: tau | it | duḥ-śaṁsam | martyam | duḥ-vidvāṁsam | rakṣasvinam || ā-bhogam | hanmanā | hatam | uda-dhim | hanmanā | hatam ||7.94.12||

IAST: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇam āyasī pūḥ
Griffith: THIS stream Sarasvati with fostering current comes forth, our sure defence, our fort of iron.
Devanāgarī: प्र क्षोदसा धायसा सस्र एषा सरस्वती धरुणमायसी पूः
pada pāṭha: pra | kṣodasā | dhāyasā | sasre | eṣā | sarasvatī | dharuṇam | āyasī | pūḥ || pra-bābadhānā | rathyā-iva | yāti | viśvāḥ | apaḥ | mahinā | sindhuḥ | anyāḥ ||7.95.1||

IAST: prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhur anyāḥ
Griffith: As on a car, the flood flows on, surpassing in majesty and might all other waters.
Devanāgarī: प्रबाबधाना रथ्येव याति विश्वा अपो महिना सिन्धुरन्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | kṣodasā | dhāyasā | sasre | eṣā | sarasvatī | dharuṇam | āyasī | pūḥ || pra-bābadhānā | rathyā-iva | yāti | viśvāḥ | apaḥ | mahinā | sindhuḥ | anyāḥ ||7.95.1||

IAST: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṁ śucir yatī giribhya ā samudrāt
Griffith: Pure in her course from mountains to the ocean, alone of streams Sarasvati hath listened.
Devanāgarī: एकाचेतत्सरस्वती नदीनां शुचिर्यती गिरिभ्य आ समुद्रात्
pada pāṭha: ekā | acetat | sarasvatī | nadīnām | śuciḥ | yatī | giri-bhyaḥ | ā | samudrāt || rāyaḥ | cetantī | bhuvanasya | bhūreḥ | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | duduhe | nāhuṣāya ||7.95.2||

IAST: rāyaś cetantī bhuvanasya bhūrer ghṛtam payo duduhe nāhuṣāya
Griffith: Thinking of wealth and the great world of creatures, she poured for Nahusa her milk and fatness.
Devanāgarī: रायश्चेतन्ती भुवनस्य भूरेर्घृतं पयो दुदुहे नाहुषाय
pada pāṭha: ekā | acetat | sarasvatī | nadīnām | śuciḥ | yatī | giri-bhyaḥ | ā | samudrāt || rāyaḥ | cetantī | bhuvanasya | bhūreḥ | ghr̥tam | payaḥ | duduhe | nāhuṣāya ||7.95.2||

IAST: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśur vṛṣabho yajñiyāsu
Griffith: Friendly to man he grew among the women, a strong young Steer amid the Holy Ladies.
Devanāgarī: स वावृधे नर्यो योषणासु वृषा शिशुर्वृषभो यज्ञियासु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vavr̥dhe | naryaḥ | yoṣaṇāsu | vr̥ṣā | śiśuḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yajñiyāsu || saḥ | vājinam | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dadhāti | vi | sātaye | tanvam | mamr̥jīta ||7.95.3||

IAST: sa vājinam maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvam māmṛjīta
Griffith: He gives the fleet steed to our wealthy princes, and decks their bodies for success in battle.
Devanāgarī: स वाजिनं मघवद्भ्यो दधाति वि सातये तन्वं मामृजीत
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vavr̥dhe | naryaḥ | yoṣaṇāsu | vr̥ṣā | śiśuḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yajñiyāsu || saḥ | vājinam | maghavat-bhyaḥ | dadhāti | vi | sātaye | tanvam | mamr̥jīta ||7.95.3||

IAST: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhagā yajṇe asmin
Griffith: May this Sarasvati be pleased and listen at this our sacrifice, auspicious Lady,
Devanāgarī: उत स्या नः सरस्वती जुषाणोप श्रवत्सुभगा यज्णे अस्मिन्
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | naḥ | sarasvatī | juṣāṇā | upa | śravat | su-bhagā | yajñe | asmin || mitajñu-bhiḥ | namasyaiḥ | iyānā | rāyā | yujā | cit | ut-tarā | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||7.95.4||

IAST: mitajñubhir namasyair iyānā rāyā yujā cid uttarā sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: When we with reverence, on our knees, implore her close-knit to wealth, most kind to those she loveth.
Devanāgarī: मितज्ञुभिर्नमस्यैरियाना राया युजा चिदुत्तरा सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: uta | syā | naḥ | sarasvatī | juṣāṇā | upa | śravat | su-bhagā | yajñe | asmin || mitajñu-bhiḥ | namasyaiḥ | iyānā | rāyā | yujā | cit | ut-tarā | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||7.95.4||

IAST: imā juhvānā yuṣmad ā namobhiḥ prati stomaṁ sarasvati juṣasva
Griffith: These offerings have ye made with adoration: say this, Sarasvati, and accept our praises;
Devanāgarī: इमा जुह्वाना युष्मदा नमोभिः प्रति स्तोमं सरस्वति जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: imā | juhvānāḥ | yuṣmat | ā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | prati | stomam | sarasvati | juṣasva || tava | śarman | priya-tame | dadhānāḥ | upa | stheyāma | śaraṇam | na | vr̥kṣam ||7.95.5||

IAST: tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṁ na vṛkṣam
Griffith: And, placing us under thy dear protection, may we approach thee, as a tree, for shelter.
Devanāgarī: तव शर्मन्प्रियतमे दधाना उप स्थेयाम शरणं न वृक्षम्
pada pāṭha: imā | juhvānāḥ | yuṣmat | ā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | prati | stomam | sarasvati | juṣasva || tava | śarman | priya-tame | dadhānāḥ | upa | stheyāma | śaraṇam | na | vr̥kṣam ||7.95.5||

IAST: ayam u te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhage vy āvaḥ
Griffith: For thee, O Blest Sarasvati, Vasistha hath here unbarred the doors d sacred Order.
Devanāgarī: अयमु ते सरस्वति वसिष्ठो द्वारावृतस्य सुभगे व्यावः
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | te | sarasvati | vasiṣṭhaḥ | dvārau | r̥tasya | su-bhage | vi | āvarityāvaḥ || vardha | śubhre | stuvate | rāsi | vājān | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.95.6||

IAST: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Wax, Bright One, and give strength to him who lauds thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings
Devanāgarī: वर्ध शुभ्रे स्तुवते रासि वाजान्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: ayam | ūm̐ iti | te | sarasvati | vasiṣṭhaḥ | dvārau | r̥tasya | su-bhage | vi | āvarityāvaḥ || vardha | śubhre | stuvate | rāsi | vājān | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.95.6||

IAST: bṛhad u gāyiṣe vaco 'suryā nadīnām
Griffith: I SING a lofty song, for she is mightiest, most divine of Streams.
Devanāgarī: बृहदु गायिषे वचोऽसुर्या नदीनाम्
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | ūm̐ iti | gāyiṣe | vacaḥ | asuryā | nadīnām || sarasvatīm | it | mahaya | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | stomaiḥ | vasiṣṭha | rodasī iti ||7.96.1||

IAST: sarasvatīm in mahayā suvṛktibhiḥ stomair vasiṣṭha rodasī
Griffith: Sarasvati will I exalt with hymns and lauds, and, O Vasistha, Heaven and Earth.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वतीमिन्महया सुवृक्तिभिः स्तोमैर्वसिष्ठ रोदसी
pada pāṭha: br̥hat | ūm̐ iti | gāyiṣe | vacaḥ | asuryā | nadīnām || sarasvatīm | it | mahaya | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | stomaiḥ | vasiṣṭha | rodasī iti ||7.96.1||

IAST: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ
Griffith: When in the fulness of their strength the Purus dwell, Beauteous One, on thy two grassy banks,
Devanāgarī: उभे यत्ते महिना शुभ्रे अन्धसी अधिक्षियन्ति पूरवः
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | yat | te | mahinā | śubhre | andhasī iti | adhi-kṣiyanti | pūravaḥ || sā | naḥ | bodhi | avitrī | marut-sakhā | coda | rādhaḥ | maghonām ||7.96.2||

IAST: sā no bodhy avitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām
Griffith: Favour us thou who hast the Maruts for thy friends: stir up the bounty of our chiefs.
Devanāgarī: सा नो बोध्यवित्री मरुत्सखा चोद राधो मघोनाम्
pada pāṭha: ubhe iti | yat | te | mahinā | śubhre | andhasī iti | adhi-kṣiyanti | pūravaḥ || sā | naḥ | bodhi | avitrī | marut-sakhā | coda | rādhaḥ | maghonām ||7.96.2||

IAST: bhadram id bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvaty akavārī cetati vājinīvatī
Griffith: So may Sarasvati auspicious send good luck; she, rich in spoil, is never niggardly in thought,
Devanāgarī: भद्रमिद्भद्रा कृणवत्सरस्वत्यकवारी चेतति वाजिनीवती
pada pāṭha: bhadram | it | bhadrā | kr̥ṇavat | sarasvatī | akava-arī | cetati | vājinī-vatī || gr̥ṇānā | jamadagni-vat | stuvānā | ca | vasiṣṭha-vat ||7.96.3||

IAST: gṛṇānā jamadagnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat
Griffith: When praised in jamadagni's way and lauded as Vasistha lauds.
Devanāgarī: गृणाना जमदग्निवत्स्तुवाना च वसिष्ठवत्
pada pāṭha: bhadram | it | bhadrā | kr̥ṇavat | sarasvatī | akava-arī | cetati | vājinī-vatī || gr̥ṇānā | jamadagni-vat | stuvānā | ca | vasiṣṭha-vat ||7.96.3||

IAST: janīyanto nv agravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: We call upon Sarasvan, as unmarried men who long for wives,
Devanāgarī: जनीयन्तो न्वग्रवः पुत्रीयन्तः सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: jani-yantaḥ | nu | agravaḥ | putri-yantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ || sarasvantam | havāmahe ||7.96.4||

IAST: sarasvantaṁ havāmahe
Griffith: As liberal men who yearn for sons.
Devanāgarī: सरस्वन्तं हवामहे
pada pāṭha: jani-yantaḥ | nu | agravaḥ | putri-yantaḥ | su-dānavaḥ || sarasvantam | havāmahe ||7.96.4||

IAST: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ
Griffith: Be thou our kind protector, O Sarasvan, with those waves of thine
Devanāgarī: ये ते सरस्व ऊर्मयो मधुमन्तो घृतश्चुतः
pada pāṭha: ye | te | sarasvaḥ | ūrmayaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ || tebhiḥ | naḥ | avitā | bhava ||7.96.5||

IAST: tebhir no 'vitā bhava
Griffith: Laden with sweets and dropping oil.
Devanāgarī: तेभिर्नोऽविता भव
pada pāṭha: ye | te | sarasvaḥ | ūrmayaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | ghr̥ta-ścutaḥ || tebhiḥ | naḥ | avitā | bhava ||7.96.5||

IAST: pīpivāṁsaṁ sarasvataḥ stanaṁ yo viśvadarśataḥ
Griffith: May we enjoy Sarasvan's breast, all-beautiful, that swells with streams,
Devanāgarī: पीपिवांसं सरस्वतः स्तनं यो विश्वदर्शतः
pada pāṭha: pīpi-vāṁsam | sarasvataḥ | stanam | yaḥ | viśva-darśataḥ || bhakṣīmahi | pra-jām | iṣam ||7.96.6||

IAST: bhakṣīmahi prajām iṣam
Griffith: May we gain food and progeny.
Devanāgarī: भक्षीमहि प्रजामिषम्
pada pāṭha: pīpi-vāṁsam | sarasvataḥ | stanam | yaḥ | viśva-darśataḥ || bhakṣīmahi | pra-jām | iṣam ||7.96.6||

IAST: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti
Griffith: WHERE Heaven and Earth combine in men's assembly, and ttose who love the Gods delight in worship,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञे दिवो नृषदने पृथिव्या नरो यत्र देवयवो मदन्ति
pada pāṭha: yajñe | divaḥ | nr̥-sadane | pr̥thivyāḥ | naraḥ | yatra | deva-yavaḥ | madanti || indrāya | yatra | savanāni | sunve | gamat | madāya | prathamam | vayaḥ | ca ||7.97.1||

IAST: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve gaman madāya prathamaṁ vayaś ca
Griffith: Where the libations are effused for Indra, may he come first to drink and make him stronger.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राय यत्र सवनानि सुन्वे गमन्मदाय प्रथमं वयश्च
pada pāṭha: yajñe | divaḥ | nr̥-sadane | pr̥thivyāḥ | naraḥ | yatra | deva-yavaḥ | madanti || indrāya | yatra | savanāni | sunve | gamat | madāya | prathamam | vayaḥ | ca ||7.97.1||

IAST: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe 'vāṁsi bṛhaspatir no maha ā sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: We crave the heavenly grace of Gods to guard us-so may Brhaspati, O friends, exalt us-
Devanāgarī: आ दैव्या वृणीमहेऽवांसि बृहस्पतिर्नो मह आ सखायः
pada pāṭha: ā | daivyā | vr̥ṇīmahe | avāṁsi | br̥haspatiḥ | naḥ | mahe | ā | sakhāyaḥ || yathā | bhavema | mīḷhuṣe | anāgāḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | dātā | parā-vataḥ | pitā-iva ||7.97.2||

IAST: yathā bhavema mīḻhuṣe anāgā yo no dātā parāvataḥ piteva
Griffith: That he, the Bounteous God, may find us sintess, who giveth from a distance like a father.
Devanāgarī: यथा भवेम मीळ्हुषे अनागा यो नो दाता परावतः पितेव
pada pāṭha: ā | daivyā | vr̥ṇīmahe | avāṁsi | br̥haspatiḥ | naḥ | mahe | ā | sakhāyaḥ || yathā | bhavema | mīḷhuṣe | anāgāḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | dātā | parā-vataḥ | pitā-iva ||7.97.2||

IAST: tam u jyeṣṭhaṁ namasā havirbhiḥ suśevam brahmaṇas patiṁ gṛṇīṣe
Griffith: That Brahmanaspati, most High and Gracious, I glorify with offerings and with homage.
Devanāgarī: तमु ज्येष्ठं नमसा हविर्भिः सुशेवं ब्रह्मणस्पतिं गृणीषे
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | jyeṣṭham | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ | su-śevam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | gr̥ṇīṣe || indram | ślokaḥ | mahi | daivyaḥ | sisaktu | yaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | deva-kr̥tasya | rājā ||7.97.3||

IAST: indraṁ śloko mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yo brahmaṇo devakṛtasya rājā
Griffith: May the great song of praise divine, reach Indra who is the King of prayer the Gods' creation.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं श्लोको महि दैव्यः सिषक्तु यो ब्रह्मणो देवकृतस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | jyeṣṭham | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ | su-śevam | brahmaṇaḥ | patim | gr̥ṇīṣe || indram | ślokaḥ | mahi | daivyaḥ | sisaktu | yaḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | deva-kr̥tasya | rājā ||7.97.3||

IAST: sa ā no yoniṁ sadatu preṣṭho bṛhaspatir viśvavāro yo asti
Griffith: May that Brhaspati who brings all blessings, most dearly loved, be seated by our altar.
Devanāgarī: स आ नो योनिं सदतु प्रेष्ठो बृहस्पतिर्विश्ववारो यो अस्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ā | naḥ | yonim | sadatu | preṣṭhaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | viśva-vāraḥ | yaḥ | asti || kāmaḥ | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | tam | dāt | parṣat | naḥ | ati | saścataḥ | ariṣṭān ||7.97.4||

IAST: kāmo rāyaḥ suvīryasya taṁ dāt parṣan no ati saścato ariṣṭān
Griffith: Heroes and wealth we crave; may he bestow them, and bear us safe beyond the men who vex us.
Devanāgarī: कामो रायः सुवीर्यस्य तं दात्पर्षन्नो अति सश्चतो अरिष्टान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | ā | naḥ | yonim | sadatu | preṣṭhaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | viśva-vāraḥ | yaḥ | asti || kāmaḥ | rāyaḥ | su-vīryasya | tam | dāt | parṣat | naḥ | ati | saścataḥ | ariṣṭān ||7.97.4||

IAST: tam ā no arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsur amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ
Griffith: To us these Deathless Ones, erst born, have granted this laud of ours which gives the Immortal pleasure.
Devanāgarī: तमा नो अर्कममृताय जुष्टमिमे धासुरमृतासः पुराजाः
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | naḥ | arkam | amr̥tāya | juṣṭam | ime | dhāsuḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | purā-jāḥ || śuci-krandam | yajatam | pastyānām | br̥haspatim | anarvāṇam | huvema ||7.97.5||

IAST: śucikrandaṁ yajatam pastyānām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇaṁ huvema
Griffith: Let us invoke Brhaspati, the foeless, the clear-voiced God, the Holy One of households
Devanāgarī: शुचिक्रन्दं यजतं पस्त्यानां बृहस्पतिमनर्वाणं हुवेम
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | naḥ | arkam | amr̥tāya | juṣṭam | ime | dhāsuḥ | amr̥tāsaḥ | purā-jāḥ || śuci-krandam | yajatam | pastyānām | br̥haspatim | anarvāṇam | huvema ||7.97.5||

IAST: taṁ śagmāso aruṣāso aśvā bṛhaspatiṁ sahavāho vahanti
Griffith: Him, this Brhaspati, his red-hued horses, drawing together, full of strength, bring hither.
Devanāgarī: तं शग्मासो अरुषासो अश्वा बृहस्पतिं सहवाहो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: tam | śagmāsaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | br̥haspatim | saha-vāhaḥ | vahanti || sahaḥ | cit | yasya | nīla-vat | sadha-stham | nabhaḥ | na | rūpam | aruṣam | vasānāḥ ||7.97.6||

IAST: sahaś cid yasya nīlavat sadhasthaṁ nabho na rūpam aruṣaṁ vasānāḥ
Griffith: Robed in red colour like the cloud, they carry the Lord of Might whose friendship gives a dwelling.
Devanāgarī: सहश्चिद्यस्य नीलवत्सधस्थं नभो न रूपमरुषं वसानाः
pada pāṭha: tam | śagmāsaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | aśvāḥ | br̥haspatim | saha-vāhaḥ | vahanti || sahaḥ | cit | yasya | nīla-vat | sadha-stham | nabhaḥ | na | rūpam | aruṣam | vasānāḥ ||7.97.6||

IAST: sa hi śuciḥ śatapatraḥ sa śundhyur hiraṇyavāśīr iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ
Griffith: For he is pure, with hundred wings, refulgent, with sword of gold, impetuous, winning sunlight.
Devanāgarī: स हि शुचिः शतपत्रः स शुन्ध्युर्हिरण्यवाशीरिषिरः स्वर्षाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | śuciḥ | śata-patraḥ | saḥ | śundhyuḥ | hiraṇya-vāśīḥ | iṣiraḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ || br̥haspatiḥ | saḥ | su-āveśaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | puru | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ā-sutim | kariṣṭhaḥ ||7.97.7||

IAST: bṛhaspatiḥ sa svāveśa ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhya āsutiṁ kariṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Sublime Brhaspati, easy of access granteth his friends most bountiful refreshment.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिः स स्वावेश ऋष्वः पुरू सखिभ्य आसुतिं करिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | śuciḥ | śata-patraḥ | saḥ | śundhyuḥ | hiraṇya-vāśīḥ | iṣiraḥ | svaḥ-sāḥ || br̥haspatiḥ | saḥ | su-āveśaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | puru | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ā-sutim | kariṣṭhaḥ ||7.97.7||

IAST: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatiṁ vāvṛdhatur mahitvā
Griffith: Both Heaven and Earth, divine, the Deity's Parents, have made Brhaspati increase in grandeur.
Devanāgarī: देवी देवस्य रोदसी जनित्री बृहस्पतिं वावृधतुर्महित्वा
pada pāṭha: devī iti | devasya | rodasī iti | janitrī iti | br̥haspatim | vāvr̥dhatuḥ | mahi-tvā || dakṣāyyāya | dakṣata | sakhāyaḥ | karat | brahmaṇe | su-tarā | su-gādhā ||7.97.8||

IAST: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karad brahmaṇe sutarā sugādhā
Griffith: Glorify him, O friends, who merits glory: may he give prayer fair way and easy passage.
Devanāgarī: दक्षाय्याय दक्षता सखायः करद्ब्रह्मणे सुतरा सुगाधा
pada pāṭha: devī iti | devasya | rodasī iti | janitrī iti | br̥haspatim | vāvr̥dhatuḥ | mahi-tvā || dakṣāyyāya | dakṣata | sakhāyaḥ | karat | brahmaṇe | su-tarā | su-gādhā ||7.97.8||

IAST: iyaṁ vām brahmaṇas pate suvṛktir brahmendrāya vajriṇe akāri
Griffith: This, Brahmanaspati, is your laudation prayer hath been made to thunderwielding Indra.
Devanāgarī: इयं वां ब्रह्मणस्पते सुवृक्तिर्ब्रह्मेन्द्राय वज्रिणे अकारि
pada pāṭha: iyam | vām | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | su-vr̥ktiḥ | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe | akāri || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | jajastam | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātīḥ ||7.97.9||

IAST: aviṣṭaṁ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṁdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ
Griffith: Favour our songs, wake up our thought and spirit: destroy the godless and our foemen's malice.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टं धियो जिगृतं पुरंधीर्जजस्तमर्यो वनुषामरातीः
pada pāṭha: iyam | vām | brahmaṇaḥ | pate | su-vr̥ktiḥ | brahma | indrāya | vajriṇe | akāri || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | jajastam | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātīḥ ||7.97.9||

IAST: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya
Griffith: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Brhaspati, and thou, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते युवमिन्द्रश्च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yuvam | indraḥ | ca | vasvaḥ | divyasya | īśāthe iti | uta | pārthivasya || dhattam | rayim | stuvate | kīraye | cit | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.97.10||

IAST: dhattaṁ rayiṁ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: धत्तं रयिं स्तुवते कीरये चिद्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yuvam | indraḥ | ca | vasvaḥ | divyasya | īśāthe iti | uta | pārthivasya || dhattam | rayim | stuvate | kīraye | cit | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.97.10||

IAST: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṁ dugdham aṁśuṁ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
Griffith: PRIESTS, offer to the Lord of all the people the milked-out stalk of Soma, radiant-coloured.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवोऽरुणं दुग्धमंशुं जुहोतन वृषभाय क्षितीनाम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | aruṇam | dugdham | aṁśum | juhotana | vr̥ṣabhāya | kṣitīnām || gaurāt | vedīyān | ava-pānam | indraḥ | viśvāhā | it | yāti | suta-somam | icchan ||7.98.1||

IAST: gaurād vedīyām̐ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam icchan
Griffith: No wild-bull knows his drinking-place like Indra who ever seeks him who hath pressed the Soma,
Devanāgarī: गौराद्वेदीयाँ अवपानमिन्द्रो विश्वाहेद्याति सुतसोममिच्छन्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryavaḥ | aruṇam | dugdham | aṁśum | juhotana | vr̥ṣabhāya | kṣitīnām || gaurāt | vedīyān | ava-pānam | indraḥ | viśvāhā | it | yāti | suta-somam | icchan ||7.98.1||

IAST: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṁ dive-dive pītim id asya vakṣi
Griffith: Thou dost desire to drink, each day that passes, the pleasant food which thou hast had aforetime,
Devanāgarī: यद्दधिषे प्रदिवि चार्वन्नं दिवेदिवे पीतिमिदस्य वक्षि
pada pāṭha: yat | dadhiṣe | pra-divi | cāru | annam | dive-dive | pītim | it | asya | vakṣi || uta | hr̥dā | uta | manasā | juṣāṇaḥ | uśan | indra | pra-sthitān | pāhi | somān ||7.98.2||

IAST: uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān
Griffith: O Indra, gratified in heart and spirit, drink eagerly the Soma set before thee.
Devanāgarī: उत हृदोत मनसा जुषाण उशन्निन्द्र प्रस्थितान्पाहि सोमान्
pada pāṭha: yat | dadhiṣe | pra-divi | cāru | annam | dive-dive | pītim | it | asya | vakṣi || uta | hr̥dā | uta | manasā | juṣāṇaḥ | uśan | indra | pra-sthitān | pāhi | somān ||7.98.2||

IAST: jajñānaḥ somaṁ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca
Griffith: Thou, newly-born, for strength didst drink the Soma; the Mother told thee of thy future greatness.
Devanāgarī: जज्ञानः सोमं सहसे पपाथ प्र ते माता महिमानमुवाच
pada pāṭha: jajñānaḥ | somam | sahase | papātha | pra | te | mātā | mahimānam | uvāca || ā | indra | paprātha | uru | antarikṣam | yudhā | devebhyaḥ | varivaḥ | cakartha ||7.98.3||

IAST: endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṁ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha
Griffith: O Indra, thou hast filled mid-air's wide region, and given the Gods by battle room and freedom.
Devanāgarī: एन्द्र पप्राथोर्वन्तरिक्षं युधा देवेभ्यो वरिवश्चकर्थ
pada pāṭha: jajñānaḥ | somam | sahase | papātha | pra | te | mātā | mahimānam | uvāca || ā | indra | paprātha | uru | antarikṣam | yudhā | devebhyaḥ | varivaḥ | cakartha ||7.98.3||

IAST: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān
Griffith: When thou hast urged the arrocrant to combat, proud in their strength of arm, we will subdue them.
Devanāgarī: यद्योधया महतो मन्यमानान्साक्षाम तान्बाहुभिः शाशदानान्
pada pāṭha: yat | yodhayāḥ | mahataḥ | manyamānān | sākṣāma | tān | bāhu-bhiḥ | śāśadānān || yat | vā | nr̥-bhiḥ | vr̥taḥ | indra | abhi-yudhyāḥ | tam | tvayā | ājim | sauśravasam | jayema ||7.98.4||

IAST: yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṁ tvayājiṁ sauśravasaṁ jayema
Griffith: Or, Indra, when thou fightest girt by heroes, we in the glorious fray with thee will conquer.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा नृभिर्वृत इन्द्राभियुध्यास्तं त्वयाजिं सौश्रवसं जयेम
pada pāṭha: yat | yodhayāḥ | mahataḥ | manyamānān | sākṣāma | tān | bāhu-bhiḥ | śāśadānān || yat | vā | nr̥-bhiḥ | vr̥taḥ | indra | abhi-yudhyāḥ | tam | tvayā | ājim | sauśravasam | jayema ||7.98.4||

IAST: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra
Griffith: I will declare the earliest deeds of Indra, and recent acts which Maghavan hath accomplished.
Devanāgarī: प्रेन्द्रस्य वोचं प्रथमा कृतानि प्र नूतना मघवा या चकार
pada pāṭha: pra | indrasya | vocam | prathamā | kr̥tāni | pra | nūtanā | magha-vā | yā | cakāra || yadā | it | adevīḥ | asahiṣṭa | māyāḥ | atha | abhavat | kevalaḥ | somaḥ | asya ||7.98.5||

IAST: yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya
Griffith: When he had conquered godless wiles and magic, Soma became his own entire possession.
Devanāgarī: यदेददेवीरसहिष्ट माया अथाभवत्केवलः सोमो अस्य
pada pāṭha: pra | indrasya | vocam | prathamā | kr̥tāni | pra | nūtanā | magha-vā | yā | cakāra || yadā | it | adevīḥ | asahiṣṭa | māyāḥ | atha | abhavat | kevalaḥ | somaḥ | asya ||7.98.5||

IAST: tavedaṁ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṁ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya
Griffith: Thine is this world of flocks and herds around thee, which with the eye of Surya thou beholdest.
Devanāgarī: तवेदं विश्वमभितः पशव्यं यत्पश्यसि चक्षसा सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: tava | idam | viśvam | abhitaḥ | paśavyam | yat | paśyasi | cakṣasā | sūryasya || gavām | asi | go-patiḥ | ekaḥ | indra | bhakṣīmahi | te | pra-yatasya | vasvaḥ ||7.98.6||

IAST: gavām asi gopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Indra, art alone the Lord of cattle; may we enjoy the treasure which thou givest.
Devanāgarī: गवामसि गोपतिरेक इन्द्र भक्षीमहि ते प्रयतस्य वस्वः
pada pāṭha: tava | idam | viśvam | abhitaḥ | paśavyam | yat | paśyasi | cakṣasā | sūryasya || gavām | asi | go-patiḥ | ekaḥ | indra | bhakṣīmahi | te | pra-yatasya | vasvaḥ ||7.98.6||

IAST: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya
Griffith: Ye Twain are Lords of wealth in earth and heaven, thou, O Brhaspati, and thou, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते युवमिन्द्रश्च वस्वो दिव्यस्येशाथे उत पार्थिवस्य
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yuvam | indraḥ | ca | vasvaḥ | divyasya | īśāthe iti | uta | pārthivasya || dhattam | rayim | stuvate | kīraye | cit | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.98.7||

IAST: dhattaṁ rayiṁ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: Mean though he be, give wealth to him who lauds you. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: धत्तं रयिं स्तुवते कीरये चिद्यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yuvam | indraḥ | ca | vasvaḥ | divyasya | īśāthe iti | uta | pārthivasya || dhattam | rayim | stuvate | kīraye | cit | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.98.7||

IAST: paro mātrayā tanvā vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti
Griffith: MEN come not nigh thy majesty who growest beyond all bound and measure with thy body.
Devanāgarī: परो मात्रया तन्वा वृधान न ते महित्वमन्वश्नुवन्ति
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | mātrayā | tanvā | vr̥dhāna | na | te | mahi-tvam | anu | aśnuvanti || ubhe iti | te | vidma | rajasī iti | pr̥thivyāḥ | viṣṇo iti | deva | tvam | paramasya | vitse ||7.99.1||

IAST: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse
Griffith: Both thy two regions of the earth, O Visnu, we know: thou God, knowest the highest also.
Devanāgarī: उभे ते विद्म रजसी पृथिव्या विष्णो देव त्वं परमस्य वित्से
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | mātrayā | tanvā | vr̥dhāna | na | te | mahi-tvam | anu | aśnuvanti || ubhe iti | te | vidma | rajasī iti | pr̥thivyāḥ | viṣṇo iti | deva | tvam | paramasya | vitse ||7.99.1||

IAST: na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa
Griffith: None who is born or being born, God Visnu, hath reached the utmost limit of thy grandeur.
Devanāgarī: न ते विष्णो जायमानो न जातो देव महिम्नः परमन्तमाप
pada pāṭha: na | te | viṣṇo iti | jāyamānaḥ | na | jātaḥ | deva | mahimnaḥ | param | antam | āpa || ut | astabhnāḥ | nākam | r̥ṣvam | br̥hantam | dādhartha | prācīm | kakubham | pr̥thivyāḥ ||7.99.2||

IAST: ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṁ dādhartha prācīṁ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: The vast high vault of heaven hast thou supported, and fixed earth's eastern pinnacle securely.
Devanāgarī: उदस्तभ्ना नाकमृष्वं बृहन्तं दाधर्थ प्राचीं ककुभं पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: na | te | viṣṇo iti | jāyamānaḥ | na | jātaḥ | deva | mahimnaḥ | param | antam | āpa || ut | astabhnāḥ | nākam | r̥ṣvam | br̥hantam | dādhartha | prācīm | kakubham | pr̥thivyāḥ ||7.99.2||

IAST: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṁ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā
Griffith: Rich in sweet food be ye, and rich in milch-kine, with fertile pastures, fain to do men service.
Devanāgarī: इरावती धेनुमती हि भूतं सूयवसिनी मनुषे दशस्या
pada pāṭha: irāvatī itīrā-vatī | dhenumatī iti dhenu-matī | hi | bhūtam | suyavasinī iti su-yavasinī | manuṣe | daśasyā || vi | astabhnāḥ | rodasī iti | viṣṇo iti | ete iti | dādhartha | pr̥thivīm | abhitaḥ | mayūkhaiḥ ||7.99.3||

IAST: vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ
Griffith: Both these worlds, Visnu, hast thou stayed asunder, and firmly fixed the earth with pegs around it.
Devanāgarī: व्यस्तभ्ना रोदसी विष्णवेते दाधर्थ पृथिवीमभितो मयूखैः
pada pāṭha: irāvatī itīrā-vatī | dhenumatī iti dhenu-matī | hi | bhūtam | suyavasinī iti su-yavasinī | manuṣe | daśasyā || vi | astabhnāḥ | rodasī iti | viṣṇo iti | ete iti | dādhartha | pr̥thivīm | abhitaḥ | mayūkhaiḥ ||7.99.3||

IAST: uruṁ yajñāya cakrathur u lokaṁ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam agnim
Griffith: Ye have made spacious room for sacrificing by generating Surya, Dawn, and Agni.
Devanāgarī: उरुं यज्ञाय चक्रथुरु लोकं जनयन्ता सूर्यमुषासमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: urum | yajñāya | cakrathuḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam | janayantā | sūryam | uṣasam | agnim || dāsasya | cit | vr̥ṣa-śiprasya | māyāḥ | jaghnathuḥ | narā | pr̥tanājyeṣu ||7.99.4||

IAST: dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu
Griffith: O Heroes, ye have conquered in your battles even the bull-jawed Dasa's wiles and magic.
Devanāgarī: दासस्य चिद्वृषशिप्रस्य माया जघ्नथुर्नरा पृतनाज्येषु
pada pāṭha: urum | yajñāya | cakrathuḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam | janayantā | sūryam | uṣasam | agnim || dāsasya | cit | vr̥ṣa-śiprasya | māyāḥ | jaghnathuḥ | narā | pr̥tanājyeṣu ||7.99.4||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū dṛṁhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṁ ca śnathiṣṭam
Griffith: Ye have destroyed, thou, Indra, and thou Visnu, Sambara's nine-and-ninety fenced castles.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू दृंहिताः शम्बरस्य नव पुरो नवतिं च श्नथिष्टम्
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | dr̥ṁhitāḥ | śambarasya | nava | puraḥ | navatim | ca | śnathiṣṭam || śatam | varcinaḥ | sahasram | ca | sākam | hathaḥ | aprati | asurasya | vīrān ||7.99.5||

IAST: śataṁ varcinaḥ sahasraṁ ca sākaṁ hatho apraty asurasya vīrān
Griffith: Ye Twain smote down a hundred times a thousand resistless heroes of the royal Varcin.
Devanāgarī: शतं वर्चिनः सहस्रं च साकं हथो अप्रत्यसुरस्य वीरान्
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | dr̥ṁhitāḥ | śambarasya | nava | puraḥ | navatim | ca | śnathiṣṭam || śatam | varcinaḥ | sahasram | ca | sākam | hathaḥ | aprati | asurasya | vīrān ||7.99.5||

IAST: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantorukramā tavasā vardhayantī
Griffith: This is the lofty hymn of praise, exalting the Lords of Mighty Stride, the strong and lofty.
Devanāgarī: इयं मनीषा बृहती बृहन्तोरुक्रमा तवसा वर्धयन्ती
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | br̥hatī | br̥hantā | uru-kramā | tavasā | vardhayantī || rare | vām | stomam | vidatheṣu | viṣṇo iti | pinvatam | iṣaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | indra ||7.99.6||

IAST: rare vāṁ stomaṁ vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣo vṛjaneṣv indra
Griffith: I laud you in the solemn synods, Visnu: pour ye food on us in our camps, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: ररे वां स्तोमं विदथेषु विष्णो पिन्वतमिषो वृजनेष्विन्द्र
pada pāṭha: iyam | manīṣā | br̥hatī | br̥hantā | uru-kramā | tavasā | vardhayantī || rare | vām | stomam | vidatheṣu | viṣṇo iti | pinvatam | iṣaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | indra ||7.99.6||

IAST: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
Griffith: O Visnu, unto thee my lips cry Vasat! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.
Devanāgarī: वषट् ते विष्णवास आ कृणोमि तन्मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: vaṣaṭ | te | viṣṇo iti | āsaḥ | ā | kr̥ṇomi | tat | me | juṣasva | śipi-viṣṭa | havyam || vardhantu | tvā | su-stutayaḥ | giraḥ | me | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.99.7||

IAST: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वर्धन्तु त्वा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vaṣaṭ | te | viṣṇo iti | āsaḥ | ā | kr̥ṇomi | tat | me | juṣasva | śipi-viṣṭa | havyam || vardhantu | tvā | su-stutayaḥ | giraḥ | me | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.99.7||

IAST: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urugāyāya dāśat
Griffith: NE'ER doth the man repent, who, seeking profit, bringeth his gift to the far-striding Visnu.
Devanāgarī: नू मर्तो दयते सनिष्यन्यो विष्णव उरुगायाय दाशत्
pada pāṭha: nu | martaḥ | dayate | saniṣyan | yaḥ | viṣṇave | uru-gāyāya | dāśat || pra | yaḥ | satrācā | manasā | yajāte | etāvantam | naryam | ā-vivāsāt ||7.100.1||

IAST: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṁ naryam āvivāsāt
Griffith: He who adoreth him with all his spirit winneth himself so great a benefactor.
Devanāgarī: प्र यः सत्राचा मनसा यजात एतावन्तं नर्यमाविवासात्
pada pāṭha: nu | martaḥ | dayate | saniṣyan | yaḥ | viṣṇave | uru-gāyāya | dāśat || pra | yaḥ | satrācā | manasā | yajāte | etāvantam | naryam | ā-vivāsāt ||7.100.1||

IAST: tvaṁ viṣṇo sumatiṁ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṁ dāḥ
Griffith: Thou, Visnu, constant in thy courses, gavest good-will to all men, and a hymn that lasteth,
Devanāgarī: त्वं विष्णो सुमतिं विश्वजन्यामप्रयुतामेवयावो मतिं दाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | viṣṇo iti | su-matim | viśva-janyām | apra-yutām | eva-yāvaḥ | matim | dāḥ || parcaḥ | yathā | naḥ | suvitasya | bhūreḥ | aśva-vataḥ | puru-candrasya | rāyaḥ ||7.100.2||

IAST: parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ
Griffith: That thou mightst move us to abundant comfort of very splendid wealth with store of horses.
Devanāgarī: पर्चो यथा नः सुवितस्य भूरेरश्वावतः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य रायः
pada pāṭha: tvam | viṣṇo iti | su-matim | viśva-janyām | apra-yutām | eva-yāvaḥ | matim | dāḥ || parcaḥ | yathā | naḥ | suvitasya | bhūreḥ | aśva-vataḥ | puru-candrasya | rāyaḥ ||7.100.2||

IAST: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṁ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā
Griffith: Three times strode forth this God in all his grandeur over this earth bright with a hundred splendours.
Devanāgarī: त्रिर्देवः पृथिवीमेष एतां वि चक्रमे शतर्चसं महित्वा
pada pāṭha: triḥ | devaḥ | pr̥thivīm | eṣaḥ | etām | vi | cakrame | śata-arcasam | mahi-tvā || pra | viṣṇuḥ | astu | tavasaḥ | tavīyān | tveṣam | hi | asya | sthavirasya | nāma ||7.100.3||

IAST: pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṁ hy asya sthavirasya nāma
Griffith: Foremost be Visnu, stronger than the strongest: for glorious is his name who lives for ever.
Devanāgarī: प्र विष्णुरस्तु तवसस्तवीयान्त्वेषं ह्यस्य स्थविरस्य नाम
pada pāṭha: triḥ | devaḥ | pr̥thivīm | eṣaḥ | etām | vi | cakrame | śata-arcasam | mahi-tvā || pra | viṣṇuḥ | astu | tavasaḥ | tavīyān | tveṣam | hi | asya | sthavirasya | nāma ||7.100.3||

IAST: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṁ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan
Griffith: Over this earth with mighty step strode Visnu, ready to give it for a home to Manu.
Devanāgarī: वि चक्रमे पृथिवीमेष एतां क्षेत्राय विष्णुर्मनुषे दशस्यन्
pada pāṭha: vi | cakrame | pr̥thivīm | eṣaḥ | etām | kṣetrāya | viṣṇuḥ | manuṣe | daśasyan || dhruvāsaḥ | asya | kīrayaḥ | janāsaḥ | uru-kṣitim | su-janimā | cakāra ||7.100.4||

IAST: dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṁ sujanimā cakāra
Griffith: In him the humble people trust for safety: he, nobly born, hath made them spacious dwellings.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवासो अस्य कीरयो जनास उरुक्षितिं सुजनिमा चकार
pada pāṭha: vi | cakrame | pr̥thivīm | eṣaḥ | etām | kṣetrāya | viṣṇuḥ | manuṣe | daśasyan || dhruvāsaḥ | asya | kīrayaḥ | janāsaḥ | uru-kṣitim | su-janimā | cakāra ||7.100.4||

IAST: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṁsāmi vayunāni vidvān
Griffith: To-day I laud this name, O gipivista, I, skilled in rules, the name of thee the Noble.
Devanāgarī: प्र तत्ते अद्य शिपिविष्ट नामार्यः शंसामि वयुनानि विद्वान्
pada pāṭha: pra | tat | te | adya | śipi-viṣṭa | nāma | aryaḥ | śaṁsāmi | vayunāni | vidvān || tam | tvā | gr̥ṇāmi | tavasam | atavyān | kṣayantam | asya | rajasaḥ | parāke ||7.100.5||

IAST: taṁ tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
Griffith: Yea, I the poor and weak praise thee the Mighty who dwellest in the realm beyond this region.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा गृणामि तवसमतव्यान्क्षयन्तमस्य रजसः पराके
pada pāṭha: pra | tat | te | adya | śipi-viṣṭa | nāma | aryaḥ | śaṁsāmi | vayunāni | vidvān || tam | tvā | gr̥ṇāmi | tavasam | atavyān | kṣayantam | asya | rajasaḥ | parāke ||7.100.5||

IAST: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi
Griffith: What was there to be blamed in thee, O Visnu, when thou declaredst, I am Sipivista?
Devanāgarī: किमित्ते विष्णो परिचक्ष्यं भूत्प्र यद्ववक्षे शिपिविष्टो अस्मि
pada pāṭha: kim | it | te | viṣṇo iti | pari-cakṣyam | bhūt | pra | yat | vavakṣe | śipi-viṣṭaḥ | asmi || mā | varpaḥ | asmat | apa | gūhaḥ | etat | yat | anya-rūpaḥ | sam-ithe | babhūtha ||7.100.6||

IAST: mā varpo asmad apa gūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha
Griffith: Hide not this form from us, nor keep it secret, since thou didst wear another shape in battle.
Devanāgarī: मा वर्पो अस्मदप गूह एतद्यदन्यरूपः समिथे बभूथ
pada pāṭha: kim | it | te | viṣṇo iti | pari-cakṣyam | bhūt | pra | yat | vavakṣe | śipi-viṣṭaḥ | asmi || mā | varpaḥ | asmat | apa | gūhaḥ | etat | yat | anya-rūpaḥ | sam-ithe | babhūtha ||7.100.6||

IAST: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
Griffith: O Visnu, unto thee my lips cry Vasat! Let this mine offering, Sipivista, please thee.
Devanāgarī: वषट् ते विष्णवास आ कृणोमि तन्मे जुषस्व शिपिविष्ट हव्यम्
pada pāṭha: vaṣaṭ | te | viṣṇo iti | āsaḥ | ā | kr̥ṇomi | tat | me | juṣasva | śipi-viṣṭa | havyam || vardhantu | tvā | su-stutayaḥ | giraḥ | me | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.100.7||

IAST: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May these my songs of eulogy exalt thee. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: वर्धन्तु त्वा सुष्टुतयो गिरो मे यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: vaṣaṭ | te | viṣṇo iti | āsaḥ | ā | kr̥ṇomi | tat | me | juṣasva | śipi-viṣṭa | havyam || vardhantu | tvā | su-stutayaḥ | giraḥ | me | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.100.7||

IAST: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiragrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ
Griffith: SPEAK forth three words, the words which light precedeth, which milk this udder that produceth nectar.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो वाचः प्र वद ज्योतिरग्रा या एतद्दुह्रे मधुदोघमूधः
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | vācaḥ | pra | vada | jyotiḥ-agrāḥ | yāḥ | etat | duhre | madhu-dogham | ūdhaḥ || saḥ | vatsam | kr̥ṇvan | garbham | oṣadhīnām | sadyaḥ | jātaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti ||7.101.1||

IAST: sa vatsaṁ kṛṇvan garbham oṣadhīnāṁ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti
Griffith: Quickly made manifest, the Bull hath bellowed, engendering the germ of plants, the Infant.
Devanāgarī: स वत्सं कृण्वन्गर्भमोषधीनां सद्यो जातो वृषभो रोरवीति
pada pāṭha: tisraḥ | vācaḥ | pra | vada | jyotiḥ-agrāḥ | yāḥ | etat | duhre | madhu-dogham | ūdhaḥ || saḥ | vatsam | kr̥ṇvan | garbham | oṣadhīnām | sadyaḥ | jātaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti ||7.101.1||

IAST: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṁ yo apāṁ yo viśvasya jagato deva īśe
Griffith: Giver of growth to plants, the God who ruleth over the waters and all moving creatures,
Devanāgarī: यो वर्धन ओषधीनां यो अपां यो विश्वस्य जगतो देव ईशे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vardhanaḥ | oṣadhīnām | yaḥ | apām | yaḥ | viśvasya | jagataḥ | devaḥ | īśe || saḥ | tri-dhātu | śaraṇam | śarma | yaṁsat | tri-vartu | jyotiḥ | su-abhiṣṭi | asme iti ||7.101.2||

IAST: sa tridhātu śaraṇaṁ śarma yaṁsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme
Griffith: Vouchsafe us triple shelter for our refuge, and threefold light to succour and befriend us.
Devanāgarī: स त्रिधातु शरणं शर्म यंसत्त्रिवर्तु ज्योतिः स्वभिष्ट्यस्मे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vardhanaḥ | oṣadhīnām | yaḥ | apām | yaḥ | viśvasya | jagataḥ | devaḥ | īśe || saḥ | tri-dhātu | śaraṇam | śarma | yaṁsat | tri-vartu | jyotiḥ | su-abhiṣṭi | asme iti ||7.101.2||

IAST: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṁ tanvaṁ cakra eṣaḥ
Griffith: Now he is sterile, now begetteth offspring, even as he willeth doth he change his figure.
Devanāgarī: स्तरीरु त्वद्भवति सूत उ त्वद्यथावशं तन्वं चक्र एषः
pada pāṭha: starīḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvat | bhavati | sūte | ūm̐ iti | tvat | yathā-vaśam | tanvam | cakre | eṣaḥ || pituḥ | payaḥ | prati | gr̥bhṇāti | mātā | tena | pitā | vardhate | tena | putraḥ ||7.101.3||

IAST: pituḥ payaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ
Griffith: The Father's genial flow bedews the Mother; therewith the Sire, therewith the son is nourished.
Devanāgarī: पितुः पयः प्रति गृभ्णाति माता तेन पिता वर्धते तेन पुत्रः
pada pāṭha: starīḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvat | bhavati | sūte | ūm̐ iti | tvat | yathā-vaśam | tanvam | cakre | eṣaḥ || pituḥ | payaḥ | prati | gr̥bhṇāti | mātā | tena | pitā | vardhate | tena | putraḥ ||7.101.3||

IAST: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ
Griffith: In him all living creatures have their being, and the three heavens with triplyflowing waters.
Devanāgarī: यस्मिन्विश्वानि भुवनानि तस्थुस्तिस्रो द्यावस्त्रेधा सस्रुरापः
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāni | bhuvanāni | tasthuḥ | tisraḥ | dyāvaḥ | tredhā | sasruḥ | āpaḥ || trayaḥ | kośāsaḥ | upa-secanāsaḥ | madhvaḥ | ścotanti | abhitaḥ | vi-rapśam ||7.101.4||

IAST: trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhvaḥ ścotanty abhito virapśam
Griffith: Three reservoirs that sprinkle down their treasure shed their sweet streams around him with a murmur.
Devanāgarī: त्रयः कोशास उपसेचनासो मध्वः श्चोतन्त्यभितो विरप्शम्
pada pāṭha: yasmin | viśvāni | bhuvanāni | tasthuḥ | tisraḥ | dyāvaḥ | tredhā | sasruḥ | āpaḥ || trayaḥ | kośāsaḥ | upa-secanāsaḥ | madhvaḥ | ścotanti | abhitaḥ | vi-rapśam ||7.101.4||

IAST: idaṁ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṁ taj jujoṣat
Griffith: May this my song to Sovran Lord Parjanya come near unto his heart and give him pleasure.
Devanāgarī: इदं वचः पर्जन्याय स्वराजे हृदो अस्त्वन्तरं तज्जुजोषत्
pada pāṭha: idam | vacaḥ | parjanyāya | sva-rāje | hr̥daḥ | astu | antaram | tat | jujoṣat || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ | santu | asme iti | su-pippalāḥ | oṣadhīḥ | deva-gopāḥ ||7.101.5||

IAST: mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devagopāḥ
Griffith: May we obtain the showers that bring enjoyment, and God-protected plants with goodly fruitage.
Devanāgarī: मयोभुवो वृष्टयः सन्त्वस्मे सुपिप्पला ओषधीर्देवगोपाः
pada pāṭha: idam | vacaḥ | parjanyāya | sva-rāje | hr̥daḥ | astu | antaram | tat | jujoṣat || mayaḥ-bhuvaḥ | vr̥ṣṭayaḥ | santu | asme iti | su-pippalāḥ | oṣadhīḥ | deva-gopāḥ ||7.101.5||

IAST: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṁ tasminn ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca
Griffith: He is the Bull of all, and their impregner lie holds the life of all things fixed and moving.
Devanāgarī: स रेतोधा वृषभः शश्वतीनां तस्मिन्नात्मा जगतस्तस्थुषश्च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | śaśvatīnām | tasmin | ātmā | jagataḥ | tusthuṣaḥ | ca || tat | mā | r̥tam | pātu | śata-śāradāya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.101.6||

IAST: tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
Griffith: May this rite save me till my hundredth autumn. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.
Devanāgarī: तन्म ऋतं पातु शतशारदाय यूयं पात स्वस्तिभिः सदा नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | retaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | śaśvatīnām | tasmin | ātmā | jagataḥ | tusthuṣaḥ | ca || tat | mā | r̥tam | pātu | śata-śāradāya | yūyam | pāta | svasti-bhiḥ | sadā | naḥ ||7.101.6||

IAST: parjanyāya pra gāyata divas putrāya mīḻhuṣe
Griffith: SING forth and laud Parjanya, son of Heaven, who sends the gift of rain
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्याय प्र गायत दिवस्पुत्राय मीळ्हुषे
pada pāṭha: parjanyāya | pra | gāyata | divaḥ | putrāya | mīḷhuṣe || saḥ | naḥ | yavasam | icchatu ||7.102.1||

IAST: sa no yavasam icchatu
Griffith: May he provide our pasturage.
Devanāgarī: स नो यवसमिच्छतु
pada pāṭha: parjanyāya | pra | gāyata | divaḥ | putrāya | mīḷhuṣe || saḥ | naḥ | yavasam | icchatu ||7.102.1||

IAST: yo garbham oṣadhīnāṁ gavāṁ kṛṇoty arvatām
Griffith: Parjanya is the God who forms in kine, in mares, in plants of earth,
Devanāgarī: यो गर्भमोषधीनां गवां कृणोत्यर्वताम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | garbham | oṣadhīnām | gavām | kr̥ṇoti | arvatām || parjanyaḥ | puruṣīṇām ||7.102.2||

IAST: parjanyaḥ puruṣīṇām
Griffith: And womankind, the germ of life.
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्यः पुरुषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | garbham | oṣadhīnām | gavām | kr̥ṇoti | arvatām || parjanyaḥ | puruṣīṇām ||7.102.2||

IAST: tasmā id āsye havir juhotā madhumattamam
Griffith: Offer and pour into his mouth oblation rich in savoury juice:
Devanāgarī: तस्मा इदास्ये हविर्जुहोता मधुमत्तमम्
pada pāṭha: tasmai | it | āsye | haviḥ | juhota | madhumat-tamam || iḷām | naḥ | sam-yatam | karat ||7.102.3||

IAST: iḻāṁ naḥ saṁyataṁ karat
Griffith: May he for ever give us food.
Devanāgarī: इळां नः संयतं करत्
pada pāṭha: tasmai | it | āsye | haviḥ | juhota | madhumat-tamam || iḷām | naḥ | sam-yatam | karat ||7.102.3||

IAST: saṁvatsaraṁ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ
Griffith: THEY who lay quiet for a year, the Brahmans who fulfil their vows,
Devanāgarī: संवत्सरं शशयाना ब्राह्मणा व्रतचारिणः
pada pāṭha: saṁvatsaram | śaśayānāḥ | brāhmaṇāḥ | vrata-cāriṇaḥ || vācam | parjanya-jinvitām | pra | maṇḍūkāḥ | avādiṣuḥ ||7.103.1||

IAST: vācam parjanyajinvitām pra maṇḍūkā avādiṣuḥ
Griffith: The Frogs have lifted up their voice, the voice Parjanya hath inspired.
Devanāgarī: वाचं पर्जन्यजिन्वितां प्र मण्डूका अवादिषुः
pada pāṭha: saṁvatsaram | śaśayānāḥ | brāhmaṇāḥ | vrata-cāriṇaḥ || vācam | parjanya-jinvitām | pra | maṇḍūkāḥ | avādiṣuḥ ||7.103.1||

IAST: divyā āpo abhi yad enam āyan dṛtiṁ na śuṣkaṁ sarasī śayānam
Griffith: What time on these, as on a dry skin lying in the pool's bed, the floods of heaven descended,
Devanāgarī: दिव्या आपो अभि यदेनमायन्दृतिं न शुष्कं सरसी शयानम्
pada pāṭha: divyāḥ | āpaḥ | abhi | yat | enam | āyan | dr̥tim | na | śuṣkam | sarasī iti | śayānam || gavām | aha | na | māyuḥ | vatsinīnām | maṇḍūkānām | vagnuḥ | atra | sam | eti ||7.103.2||

IAST: gavām aha na māyur vatsinīnām maṇḍūkānāṁ vagnur atrā sam eti
Griffith: The music of the Frogs comes forth in concert like the cows lowing with their calves beside them.
Devanāgarī: गवामह न मायुर्वत्सिनीनां मण्डूकानां वग्नुरत्रा समेति
pada pāṭha: divyāḥ | āpaḥ | abhi | yat | enam | āyan | dr̥tim | na | śuṣkam | sarasī iti | śayānam || gavām | aha | na | māyuḥ | vatsinīnām | maṇḍūkānām | vagnuḥ | atra | sam | eti ||7.103.2||

IAST: yad īm enām̐ uśato abhy avarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣy āgatāyām
Griffith: When at the coming of the Rains the water has poured upon them as they yearned and thirsted,
Devanāgarī: यदीमेनाँ उशतो अभ्यवर्षीत्तृष्यावतः प्रावृष्यागतायाम्
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | enān | uśataḥ | abhi | avarṣīt | tr̥ṣyā-vataḥ | prāvr̥ṣi | ā-gatāyām || akhkhalīkr̥tya | pitaram | na | putraḥ | anyaḥ | anyam | upa | vadantam | eti ||7.103.3||

IAST: akhkhalīkṛtyā pitaraṁ na putro anyo anyam upa vadantam eti
Griffith: One seeks another as he talks and greets him with cries of pleasure as a son his father.
Devanāgarī: अख्खलीकृत्या पितरं न पुत्रो अन्यो अन्यमुप वदन्तमेति
pada pāṭha: yat | īm | enān | uśataḥ | abhi | avarṣīt | tr̥ṣyā-vataḥ | prāvr̥ṣi | ā-gatāyām || akhkhalīkr̥tya | pitaram | na | putraḥ | anyaḥ | anyam | upa | vadantam | eti ||7.103.3||

IAST: anyo anyam anu gṛbhṇāty enor apām prasarge yad amandiṣātām
Griffith: Each of these twain receives the other kindly, while they are revelling in the flow of waters,
Devanāgarī: अन्यो अन्यमनु गृभ्णात्येनोरपां प्रसर्गे यदमन्दिषाताम्
pada pāṭha: anyaḥ | anyam | anu | gr̥bhṇāti | enoḥ | apām | pra-sarge | yat | amandiṣātām || maṇḍūkaḥ | yat | abhi-vr̥ṣṭaḥ | kaniskan | pr̥śniḥ | sam-pr̥ṅkte | haritena | vācam ||7.103.4||

IAST: maṇḍūko yad abhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛśniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam
Griffith: When the Frog moistened by the rain springs forward, and Green and Spotty both combine their voices.
Devanāgarī: मण्डूको यदभिवृष्टः कनिष्कन्पृश्निः सम्पृङ्क्ते हरितेन वाचम्
pada pāṭha: anyaḥ | anyam | anu | gr̥bhṇāti | enoḥ | apām | pra-sarge | yat | amandiṣātām || maṇḍūkaḥ | yat | abhi-vr̥ṣṭaḥ | kaniskan | pr̥śniḥ | sam-pr̥ṅkte | haritena | vācam ||7.103.4||

IAST: yad eṣām anyo anyasya vācaṁ śāktasyeva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ
Griffith: When one of these repeats the other's language, as he who learns the lesson of the teacher,
Devanāgarī: यदेषामन्यो अन्यस्य वाचं शाक्तस्येव वदति शिक्षमाणः
pada pāṭha: yat | eṣām | anyaḥ | anyasya | vācam | śāktasya-iva | vadati | śikṣamāṇaḥ || sarvam | tat | eṣām | samr̥dhā-iva | parva | yat | su-vācaḥ | vadathana | adhi | ap-su ||7.103.5||

IAST: sarvaṁ tad eṣāṁ samṛdheva parva yat suvāco vadathanādhy apsu
Griffith: Your every limb seems to be growing larger as ye converse with eloquence on the waters.
Devanāgarī: सर्वं तदेषां समृधेव पर्व यत्सुवाचो वदथनाध्यप्सु
pada pāṭha: yat | eṣām | anyaḥ | anyasya | vācam | śāktasya-iva | vadati | śikṣamāṇaḥ || sarvam | tat | eṣām | samr̥dhā-iva | parva | yat | su-vācaḥ | vadathana | adhi | ap-su ||7.103.5||

IAST: gomāyur eko ajamāyur ekaḥ pṛśnir eko harita eka eṣām
Griffith: Onc is Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat the other, one Frog is Green and one of them is Spotty.
Devanāgarī: गोमायुरेको अजमायुरेकः पृश्निरेको हरित एक एषाम्
pada pāṭha: go-māyuḥ | ekaḥ | aja-māyuḥ | ekaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | ekaḥ | haritaḥ | ekaḥ | eṣām || samānam | nāma | bibhrataḥ | vi-rūpāḥ | puru-trā | vācam | pipiśuḥ | vadantaḥ ||7.103.6||

IAST: samānaṁ nāma bibhrato virūpāḥ purutrā vācam pipiśur vadantaḥ
Griffith: They bear one common name, and yet they vary, and, talking, modulate the voice diversely.
Devanāgarī: समानं नाम बिभ्रतो विरूपाः पुरुत्रा वाचं पिपिशुर्वदन्तः
pada pāṭha: go-māyuḥ | ekaḥ | aja-māyuḥ | ekaḥ | pr̥śniḥ | ekaḥ | haritaḥ | ekaḥ | eṣām || samānam | nāma | bibhrataḥ | vi-rūpāḥ | puru-trā | vācam | pipiśuḥ | vadantaḥ ||7.103.6||

IAST: brāhmaṇāso atirātre na some saro na pūrṇam abhito vadantaḥ
Griffith: As Brahmans, sitting round the brimful vessel, talk at the Soma-rite of Atiratra,
Devanāgarī: ब्राह्मणासो अतिरात्रे न सोमे सरो न पूर्णमभितो वदन्तः
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | ati-rātre | na | some | saraḥ | na | pūrṇam | abhitaḥ | vadantaḥ || saṁvatsarasya | tat | ahariti | pari | stha | yat | maṇḍūkāḥ | prāvr̥ṣīṇam | babhūva ||7.103.7||

IAST: saṁvatsarasya tad ahaḥ pari ṣṭha yan maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇam babhūva
Griffith: So, Frogs, ye gather round the pool to honour this day of all the year, the first of Rain-time.
Devanāgarī: संवत्सरस्य तदहः परि ष्ठ यन्मण्डूकाः प्रावृषीणं बभूव
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | ati-rātre | na | some | saraḥ | na | pūrṇam | abhitaḥ | vadantaḥ || saṁvatsarasya | tat | ahariti | pari | stha | yat | maṇḍūkāḥ | prāvr̥ṣīṇam | babhūva ||7.103.7||

IAST: brāhmaṇāsaḥ somino vācam akrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam
Griffith: These Brahmans with the Soma juice, performing their year-long rite, have lifted up their voices;
Devanāgarī: ब्राह्मणासः सोमिनो वाचमक्रत ब्रह्म कृण्वन्तः परिवत्सरीणम्
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | sominaḥ | vācam | akrata | brahma | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | parivatsarīṇam || adhvaryavaḥ | gharmiṇaḥ | sisvidānāḥ | āviḥ | bhavanti | guhyāḥ | na | ke | cit ||7.103.8||

IAST: adhvaryavo gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānā āvir bhavanti guhyā na ke cit
Griffith: And these Adhvaryus, sweating with their kettles, come forth and show themselves, and none are hidden.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यवो घर्मिणः सिष्विदाना आविर्भवन्ति गुह्या न के चित्
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | sominaḥ | vācam | akrata | brahma | kr̥ṇvantaḥ | parivatsarīṇam || adhvaryavaḥ | gharmiṇaḥ | sisvidānāḥ | āviḥ | bhavanti | guhyāḥ | na | ke | cit ||7.103.8||

IAST: devahitiṁ jugupur dvādaśasya ṛtuṁ naro na pra minanty ete
Griffith: They keep the twelve month's God-appointed order, and never do the men neglect the season.
Devanāgarī: देवहितिं जुगुपुर्द्वादशस्य ऋतुं नरो न प्र मिनन्त्येते
pada pāṭha: deva-hitim | jugupuḥ | dvādaśasya | r̥tum | naraḥ | na | pra | minanti | ete || saṁvatsare | prāvr̥ṣi | ā-gatāyām | taptāḥ | gharmāḥ | aśnuvate | vi-sargam ||7.103.9||

IAST: saṁvatsare prāvṛṣy āgatāyāṁ taptā gharmā aśnuvate visargam
Griffith: Soon as the Rain-time in the year returneth, these who were heated kettles gain their freedom.
Devanāgarī: संवत्सरे प्रावृष्यागतायां तप्ता घर्मा अश्नुवते विसर्गम्
pada pāṭha: deva-hitim | jugupuḥ | dvādaśasya | r̥tum | naraḥ | na | pra | minanti | ete || saṁvatsare | prāvr̥ṣi | ā-gatāyām | taptāḥ | gharmāḥ | aśnuvate | vi-sargam ||7.103.9||

IAST: gomāyur adād ajamāyur adāt pṛśnir adād dharito no vasūni
Griffith: Cow-bellow and Goat-bleat have granted riches, and Green and Spotty have vouchsafed us treasure.
Devanāgarī: गोमायुरदादजमायुरदात्पृश्निरदाद्धरितो नो वसूनि
pada pāṭha: go-māyuḥ | adāt | aja-māyuḥ | adāt | pr̥śniḥ | adāt | haritaḥ | naḥ | vasūni || gavām | maṇḍūkāḥ | dadataḥ | śatāni | sahasra-sāve | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||7.103.10||

IAST: gavām maṇḍūkā dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ
Griffith: The Frogs who give us cows in hundreds lengthen our lives in this most fertilizing season.
Devanāgarī: गवां मण्डूका ददतः शतानि सहस्रसावे प्र तिरन्त आयुः
pada pāṭha: go-māyuḥ | adāt | aja-māyuḥ | adāt | pr̥śniḥ | adāt | haritaḥ | naḥ | vasūni || gavām | maṇḍūkāḥ | dadataḥ | śatāni | sahasra-sāve | pra | tirante | āyuḥ ||7.103.10||

IAST: indrāsomā tapataṁ rakṣa ubjataṁ ny arpayataṁ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ
Griffith: INDRA and Soma, burn, destroy the demon foe, send downward, O ye Bulls, those who add gloom to gloom.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा तपतं रक्ष उब्जतं न्यर्पयतं वृषणा तमोवृधः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | tapatam | rakṣaḥ | ubjatam | ni | arpayatam | vr̥ṣaṇā | tamaḥ-vr̥dhaḥ || parā | śr̥ṇītam | acitaḥ | ni | oṣatam | hatam | nudethām | ni | śiśītam | atriṇaḥ ||7.104.1||

IAST: parā śṛṇītam acito ny oṣataṁ hataṁ nudethāṁ ni śiśītam atriṇaḥ
Griffith: Annihilate the fools, slay them and burn them up: chase them away from us, pierce the voracious ones.
Devanāgarī: परा शृणीतमचितो न्योषतं हतं नुदेथां नि शिशीतमत्रिणः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | tapatam | rakṣaḥ | ubjatam | ni | arpayatam | vr̥ṣaṇā | tamaḥ-vr̥dhaḥ || parā | śr̥ṇītam | acitaḥ | ni | oṣatam | hatam | nudethām | ni | śiśītam | atriṇaḥ ||7.104.1||

IAST: indrāsomā sam aghaśaṁsam abhy aghaṁ tapur yayastu carur agnivām̐ iva
Griffith: Indra and Soma, let sin round the wicked boil like as a caldron set amid the flames of fire.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा समघशंसमभ्यघं तपुर्ययस्तु चरुरग्निवाँ इव
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | sam | agha-śaṁsam | abhi | agham | tapuḥ | yayastu | caruḥ | agnivān-iva || brahma-dviṣe | kravya-ade | ghora-cakṣase | dveṣaḥ | dhattam | anavāyam | kimīdine ||7.104.2||

IAST: brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattam anavāyaṁ kimīdine
Griffith: Against the foe of prayer, devourer of raw flesh, the vile fiend fierce of eye, keep ye perpetual hate.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मद्विषे क्रव्यादे घोरचक्षसे द्वेषो धत्तमनवायं किमीदिने
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | sam | agha-śaṁsam | abhi | agham | tapuḥ | yayastu | caruḥ | agnivān-iva || brahma-dviṣe | kravya-ade | ghora-cakṣase | dveṣaḥ | dhattam | anavāyam | kimīdine ||7.104.2||

IAST: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antar anārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam
Griffith: Indra and Soma, plunge the wicked in the depth, yea, cast them into darkness that hath no support,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्कृतो वव्रे अन्तरनारम्भणे तमसि प्र विध्यतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | duḥ-kr̥taḥ | vavre | antaḥ | anārambhaṇe | tamasi | pra | vidhyatam || yathā | na | ataḥ | punaḥ | ekaḥ | cana | ut-ayat | tat | vām | astu | sahase | manyu-mat | śavaḥ ||7.104.3||

IAST: yathā nātaḥ punar ekaś canodayat tad vām astu sahase manyumac chavaḥ
Griffith: So that not one of them may ever thence return: so may your wrathful might prevail and conquer them.
Devanāgarī: यथा नातः पुनरेकश्चनोदयत्तद्वामस्तु सहसे मन्युमच्छवः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | duḥ-kr̥taḥ | vavre | antaḥ | anārambhaṇe | tamasi | pra | vidhyatam || yathā | na | ataḥ | punaḥ | ekaḥ | cana | ut-ayat | tat | vām | astu | sahase | manyu-mat | śavaḥ ||7.104.3||

IAST: indrāsomā vartayataṁ divo vadhaṁ sam pṛthivyā aghaśaṁsāya tarhaṇam
Griffith: Indra and Soma, hurl your deadly crushing bolt down on the wicked fiend from heaven and from the earth.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवो वधं सं पृथिव्या अघशंसाय तर्हणम्
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vartayatam | divaḥ | vadham | sam | pr̥thivyāḥ | agha-śaṁsāya | tarhaṇam || ut | takṣatam | svaryam | parvatebhyaḥ | yena | rakṣaḥ | vavr̥dhānam | ni-jūrvathaḥ ||7.104.4||

IAST: ut takṣataṁ svaryam parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṁ nijūrvathaḥ
Griffith: Yea, forge out of the mountains your celestial dart wherewith ye burn to death the waxing demon race.
Devanāgarī: उत्तक्षतं स्वर्यं पर्वतेभ्यो येन रक्षो वावृधानं निजूर्वथः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vartayatam | divaḥ | vadham | sam | pr̥thivyāḥ | agha-śaṁsāya | tarhaṇam || ut | takṣatam | svaryam | parvatebhyaḥ | yena | rakṣaḥ | vavr̥dhānam | ni-jūrvathaḥ ||7.104.4||

IAST: indrāsomā vartayataṁ divas pary agnitaptebhir yuvam aśmahanmabhiḥ
Griffith: Indra and Soma, cast ye downward out of heaven your deadly darts of stone burning with fiery flame,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा वर्तयतं दिवस्पर्यग्नितप्तेभिर्युवमश्महन्मभिः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vartayatam | divaḥ | pari | agni-taptebhiḥ | yuvam | aśmahanma-bhiḥ || tapuḥ-vadhebhiḥ | ajarebhiḥ | atriṇaḥ | ni | parśāne | vidhyatam | yantu | ni-svaram ||7.104.5||

IAST: tapurvadhebhir ajarebhir atriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṁ yantu nisvaram
Griffith: Eternal, scorching darts; plunge the voracious ones within the depth, and let them sink without a sound
Devanāgarī: तपुर्वधेभिरजरेभिरत्रिणो नि पर्शाने विध्यतं यन्तु निस्वरम्
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vartayatam | divaḥ | pari | agni-taptebhiḥ | yuvam | aśmahanma-bhiḥ || tapuḥ-vadhebhiḥ | ajarebhiḥ | atriṇaḥ | ni | parśāne | vidhyatam | yantu | ni-svaram ||7.104.5||

IAST: indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvata iyam matiḥ kakṣyāśveva vājinā
Griffith: Indra and Soma, let this hymn control you both, even as the girth encompasses two vigorous steeds-
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा परि वां भूतु विश्वत इयं मतिः कक्ष्याश्वेव वाजिना
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | pari | vām | bhūtu | viśvataḥ | iyam | matiḥ | kakṣyā | aśvā-iva | vājinā || yām | vām | hotrām | pari-hinomi | medhayā | imā | brahmāṇi | nr̥patī iveti nr̥patī-iva | jinvatam ||7.104.6||

IAST: yāṁ vāṁ hotrām parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam
Griffith: The song of praise which I with wisdom offer you: do ye, as Lords of men, animate these my prayers.
Devanāgarī: यां वां होत्रां परिहिनोमि मेधयेमा ब्रह्माणि नृपतीव जिन्वतम्
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | pari | vām | bhūtu | viśvataḥ | iyam | matiḥ | kakṣyā | aśvā-iva | vājinā || yām | vām | hotrām | pari-hinomi | medhayā | imā | brahmāṇi | nr̥patī iveti nr̥patī-iva | jinvatam ||7.104.6||

IAST: prati smarethāṁ tujayadbhir evair hataṁ druho rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvataḥ
Griffith: In your impetuous manner think ye both thereon: destroy these evil beings, slay the treacherous fiends.
Devanāgarī: प्रति स्मरेथां तुजयद्भिरेवैर्हतं द्रुहो रक्षसो भङ्गुरावतः
pada pāṭha: prati | smarethām | tujayat-bhiḥ | evaiḥ | hatam | druhaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | bhaṅgura-vataḥ || indrāsomā | duḥ-kr̥te | mā | su-gam | bhūt | yaḥ | naḥ | kadā | cit | abhi-dāsati | druhā ||7.104.7||

IAST: indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūd yo naḥ kadā cid abhidāsati druhā
Griffith: Indra and Soma, let the wicked have no bliss who evermore assails us with malignity.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा दुष्कृते मा सुगं भूद्यो नः कदा चिदभिदासति द्रुहा
pada pāṭha: prati | smarethām | tujayat-bhiḥ | evaiḥ | hatam | druhaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | bhaṅgura-vataḥ || indrāsomā | duḥ-kr̥te | mā | su-gam | bhūt | yaḥ | naḥ | kadā | cit | abhi-dāsati | druhā ||7.104.7||

IAST: yo mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhir vacobhiḥ
Griffith: Whoso accuses me with words of falsehood when I pursue my way with guileless spirit,
Devanāgarī: यो मा पाकेन मनसा चरन्तमभिचष्टे अनृतेभिर्वचोभिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mā | pākena | manasā | carantam | abhi-caṣṭe | anr̥tebhiḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ || āpaḥ-iva | kāśinā | sam-gr̥bhītāḥ | asan | astu | asataḥ | indra | vaktā ||7.104.8||

IAST: āpa iva kāśinā saṁgṛbhītā asann astv āsata indra vaktā
Griffith: May he, the speaker of untruth, be, Indra, like water which the hollowed hand compresses.
Devanāgarī: आप इव काशिना संगृभीता असन्नस्त्वासत इन्द्र वक्ता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mā | pākena | manasā | carantam | abhi-caṣṭe | anr̥tebhiḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ || āpaḥ-iva | kāśinā | sam-gr̥bhītāḥ | asan | astu | asataḥ | indra | vaktā ||7.104.8||

IAST: ye pākaśaṁsaṁ viharanta evair ye vā bhadraṁ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ
Griffith: Those who destroy, as is their wont, the simple, and with their evil natures barm the righteous,
Devanāgarī: ये पाकशंसं विहरन्त एवैर्ये वा भद्रं दूषयन्ति स्वधाभिः
pada pāṭha: ye | pāka-śaṁsam | vi-harante | evaiḥ | ye | vā | bhadram | dūṣayanti | svadhābhiḥ || ahaye | vā | tān | pra-dadātu | somaḥ | ā | vā | dadhātu | niḥ-r̥teḥ | upa-sthe ||7.104.9||

IAST: ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirṛter upasthe
Griffith: May Soma give them over to the serpent, or to the lap of Nirrti consign them.
Devanāgarī: अहये वा तान्प्रददातु सोम आ वा दधातु निरृतेरुपस्थे
