pada pāṭha: ye | pāka-śaṁsam | vi-harante | evaiḥ | ye | vā | bhadram | dūṣayanti | svadhābhiḥ || ahaye | vā | tān | pra-dadātu | somaḥ | ā | vā | dadhātu | niḥ-r̥teḥ | upa-sthe ||7.104.9||

IAST: yo no rasaṁ dipsati pitvo agne yo aśvānāṁ yo gavāṁ yas tanūnām
Griffith: The fiend, O Agni, who designs to injure the essence of our food, kine, steeds, or bodies,
Devanāgarī: यो नो रसं दिप्सति पित्वो अग्ने यो अश्वानां यो गवां यस्तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | rasam | dipsati | pitvaḥ | agne | yaḥ | aśvānām | yaḥ | gavām | yaḥ | tanūnām || ripuḥ | stenaḥ | steya-kr̥t | dabhram | etu | ni | saḥ | hīyatām | tanvā | tanā | ca ||7.104.10||

IAST: ripuḥ stenaḥ steyakṛd dabhram etu ni ṣa hīyatāṁ tanvā tanā ca
Griffith: May he, the adversary, thief, and robber, sink to destruction, both himself and offspring.
Devanāgarī: रिपुः स्तेनः स्तेयकृद्दभ्रमेतु नि ष हीयतां तन्वा तना च
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | rasam | dipsati | pitvaḥ | agne | yaḥ | aśvānām | yaḥ | gavām | yaḥ | tanūnām || ripuḥ | stenaḥ | steya-kr̥t | dabhram | etu | ni | saḥ | hīyatām | tanvā | tanā | ca ||7.104.10||

IAST: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīr adho astu viśvāḥ
Griffith: May he be swept away, himself and children: may all the three earths press him down beneath them.
Devanāgarī: परः सो अस्तु तन्वा तना च तिस्रः पृथिवीरधो अस्तु विश्वाः
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | saḥ | astu | tanvā | tanā | ca | tisraḥ | pr̥thivīḥ | adhaḥ | astu | viśvāḥ || prati | śuṣyatu | yaśaḥ | asya | devāḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | divā | dipsati | yaḥ | ca | naktam ||7.104.11||

IAST: prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo no divā dipsati yaś ca naktam
Griffith: May his fair glory, O ye Gods, be blighted, who in the day or night would fain destroy us.
Devanāgarī: प्रति शुष्यतु यशो अस्य देवा यो नो दिवा दिप्सति यश्च नक्तम्
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | saḥ | astu | tanvā | tanā | ca | tisraḥ | pr̥thivīḥ | adhaḥ | astu | viśvāḥ || prati | śuṣyatu | yaśaḥ | asya | devāḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | divā | dipsati | yaḥ | ca | naktam ||7.104.11||

IAST: suvijñānaṁ cikituṣe janāya sac cāsac ca vacasī paspṛdhāte
Griffith: The prudent finds it easy to distinguish the true and false: their words oppose each other.
Devanāgarī: सुविज्ञानं चिकितुषे जनाय सच्चासच्च वचसी पस्पृधाते
pada pāṭha: su-vijñānam | cikituṣe | janāya | sat | ca | asat | ca | vacasī iti | paspr̥dhāte iti || tayoḥ | yat | satyam | yatarat | r̥jīyaḥ | tat | it | somaḥ | avati | hanti | asat ||7.104.12||

IAST: tayor yat satyaṁ yatarad ṛjīyas tad it somo 'vati hanty āsat
Griffith: Of these two that which is the true and honest, Soma protects, and brings the false to nothing.
Devanāgarī: तयोर्यत्सत्यं यतरदृजीयस्तदित्सोमोऽवति हन्त्यासत्
pada pāṭha: su-vijñānam | cikituṣe | janāya | sat | ca | asat | ca | vacasī iti | paspr̥dhāte iti || tayoḥ | yat | satyam | yatarat | r̥jīyaḥ | tat | it | somaḥ | avati | hanti | asat ||7.104.12||

IAST: na vā u somo vṛjinaṁ hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam
Griffith: Never doth Soma aid and guide the wicked or him who falsely claims the Warrior's title.
Devanāgarī: न वा उ सोमो वृजिनं हिनोति न क्षत्रियं मिथुया धारयन्तम्
pada pāṭha: na | vai | ūm̐ iti | somaḥ | vr̥jinam | hinoti | na | kṣatriyam | mithuyā | dhārayantam || hanti | rakṣaḥ | hanti | asat | vadantam | ubhau | indrasya | pra-sitau | śayāte iti ||7.104.13||

IAST: hanti rakṣo hanty āsad vadantam ubhāv indrasya prasitau śayāte
Griffith: He slays the fiend and him who speaks untruly: both lie entangled in the noose of Indra.
Devanāgarī: हन्ति रक्षो हन्त्यासद्वदन्तमुभाविन्द्रस्य प्रसितौ शयाते
pada pāṭha: na | vai | ūm̐ iti | somaḥ | vr̥jinam | hinoti | na | kṣatriyam | mithuyā | dhārayantam || hanti | rakṣaḥ | hanti | asat | vadantam | ubhau | indrasya | pra-sitau | śayāte iti ||7.104.13||

IAST: yadi vāham anṛtadeva āsa moghaṁ vā devām̐ apyūhe agne
Griffith: As if I worshipped deities of falsehood, or thought vain thoughts about the Gods, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: यदि वाहमनृतदेव आस मोघं वा देवाँ अप्यूहे अग्ने
pada pāṭha: yadi | vā | aham | anr̥ta-devaḥ | āsa | mogham | vā | devān | api-ūhe | agne || kim | asmabhyam | jāta-vedaḥ | hr̥ṇīṣe | drogha-vācaḥ | te | niḥ-r̥tham | sacantām ||7.104.14||

IAST: kim asmabhyaṁ jātavedo hṛṇīṣe droghavācas te nirṛthaṁ sacantām
Griffith: Why art thou angry with us, Jatavedas? Destruction fall on those who lie against thee!
Devanāgarī: किमस्मभ्यं जातवेदो हृणीषे द्रोघवाचस्ते निरृथं सचन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: yadi | vā | aham | anr̥ta-devaḥ | āsa | mogham | vā | devān | api-ūhe | agne || kim | asmabhyam | jāta-vedaḥ | hr̥ṇīṣe | drogha-vācaḥ | te | niḥ-r̥tham | sacantām ||7.104.14||

IAST: adyā murīya yadi yātudhāno asmi yadi vāyus tatapa pūruṣasya
Griffith: So may I die this day if I have harassed any man's life or if I be a demon.
Devanāgarī: अद्या मुरीय यदि यातुधानो अस्मि यदि वायुस्ततप पूरुषस्य
pada pāṭha: adya | murīya | yadi | yātu-dhānaḥ | asmi | yadi | vā | āyuḥ | tatapa | puruṣasya || adha | saḥ | vīraiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | vi | yūyāḥ | yaḥ | mā | mogham | yātu-dhāna | iti | āha ||7.104.15||

IAST: adhā sa vīrair daśabhir vi yūyā yo mā moghaṁ yātudhānety āha
Griffith: Yea, may he lose all his ten sons together who with false tongue hath called me Yatudhana.
Devanāgarī: अधा स वीरैर्दशभिर्वि यूया यो मा मोघं यातुधानेत्याह
pada pāṭha: adya | murīya | yadi | yātu-dhānaḥ | asmi | yadi | vā | āyuḥ | tatapa | puruṣasya || adha | saḥ | vīraiḥ | daśa-bhiḥ | vi | yūyāḥ | yaḥ | mā | mogham | yātu-dhāna | iti | āha ||7.104.15||

IAST: yo māyātuṁ yātudhānety āha yo vā rakṣāḥ śucir asmīty āha
Griffith: May Indra slay him with a mi weapon, and let the vilest of thy all creatures perish,
Devanāgarī: यो मायातुं यातुधानेत्याह यो वा रक्षाः शुचिरस्मीत्याह
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mā | ayātum | yātu-dhāna | iti | āha | yaḥ | vā | rakṣāḥ | śuciḥ | asmi | iti | āha || indraḥ | tam | hantu | mahatā | vadhena | viśvasya | jantoḥ | adhamaḥ | padīṣṭa ||7.104.16||

IAST: indras taṁ hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantor adhamas padīṣṭa
Griffith: The fiend who says that he is pure, who calls me a demon though devoid of demon nature.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्तं हन्तु महता वधेन विश्वस्य जन्तोरधमस्पदीष्ट
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | mā | ayātum | yātu-dhāna | iti | āha | yaḥ | vā | rakṣāḥ | śuciḥ | asmi | iti | āha || indraḥ | tam | hantu | mahatā | vadhena | viśvasya | jantoḥ | adhamaḥ | padīṣṭa ||7.104.16||

IAST: pra yā jigāti khargaleva naktam apa druhā tanvaṁ gūhamānā
Griffith: She too who wanders like an owl at night-time, hiding her body in her guile and malice,
Devanāgarī: प्र या जिगाति खर्गलेव नक्तमप द्रुहा तन्वं गूहमाना
pada pāṭha: pra | yā | jigāti | khargalā-iva | naktam | apa | druhā | tanvam | gūhamānā || vavrān | anantān | ava | sā | padīṣṭa | grāvāṇaḥ | ghnantu | rakṣasaḥ | upabdaiḥ ||7.104.17||

IAST: vavrām̐ anantām̐ ava sā padīṣṭa grāvāṇo ghnantu rakṣasa upabdaiḥ
Griffith: May she fall downward into endless caverns. May press-stones with loud ring destroy the demons.
Devanāgarī: वव्राँ अनन्ताँ अव सा पदीष्ट ग्रावाणो घ्नन्तु रक्षस उपब्दैः
pada pāṭha: pra | yā | jigāti | khargalā-iva | naktam | apa | druhā | tanvam | gūhamānā || vavrān | anantān | ava | sā | padīṣṭa | grāvāṇaḥ | ghnantu | rakṣasaḥ | upabdaiḥ ||7.104.17||

IAST: vi tiṣṭhadhvam maruto vikṣv icchata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭana
Griffith: Spread out, ye Maruts, search among the people: seize ye and grind the Raksasas to pieces,
Devanāgarī: वि तिष्ठध्वं मरुतो विक्ष्विच्छत गृभायत रक्षसः सं पिनष्टन
pada pāṭha: vi | tiṣṭhadhvam | marutaḥ | vikṣu | icchata | gr̥bhāyata | rakṣasaḥ | sam | pinaṣṭana || vayaḥ | ye | bhūtvī | patayanti | nakta-bhiḥ | ye | vā | ripaḥ | dadhire | deve | adhvare ||7.104.18||

IAST: vayo ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhir ye vā ripo dadhire deve adhvare
Griffith: Who fly abroad, transformed to birds, at night-time, or sully and pollute our holy worship.
Devanāgarī: वयो ये भूत्वी पतयन्ति नक्तभिर्ये वा रिपो दधिरे देवे अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: vi | tiṣṭhadhvam | marutaḥ | vikṣu | icchata | gr̥bhāyata | rakṣasaḥ | sam | pinaṣṭana || vayaḥ | ye | bhūtvī | patayanti | nakta-bhiḥ | ye | vā | ripaḥ | dadhire | deve | adhvare ||7.104.18||

IAST: pra vartaya divo aśmānam indra somaśitam maghavan saṁ śiśādhi
Griffith: Hurl down from heaven thy bolt of stone, O Indra: sharpen it, Maghavan, made keen by Soma.
Devanāgarī: प्र वर्तय दिवो अश्मानमिन्द्र सोमशितं मघवन्सं शिशाधि
pada pāṭha: pra | vartaya | divaḥ | aśmānam | indra | soma-śitam | magha-van | sam | śiśādhi || prāktāt | apāktāt | adharāt | udaktāt | abhi | jahi | rakṣasaḥ | parvatena ||7.104.19||

IAST: prāktād apāktād adharād udaktād abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena
Griffith: Forward, behind, and from above and under, smite down the demons with thy rocky weapon.
Devanāgarī: प्राक्तादपाक्तादधरादुदक्तादभि जहि रक्षसः पर्वतेन
pada pāṭha: pra | vartaya | divaḥ | aśmānam | indra | soma-śitam | magha-van | sam | śiśādhi || prāktāt | apāktāt | adharāt | udaktāt | abhi | jahi | rakṣasaḥ | parvatena ||7.104.19||

IAST: eta u tye patayanti śvayātava indraṁ dipsanti dipsavo 'dābhyam
Griffith: They fly, the demon dogs, and, bent on mischief, fain would they harm indomitable Indra.
Devanāgarī: एत उ त्ये पतयन्ति श्वयातव इन्द्रं दिप्सन्ति दिप्सवोऽदाभ्यम्
pada pāṭha: ete | ūm̐ iti | tye | patayanti | śva-yātavaḥ | indram | dipsanti | dipsavaḥ | adābhyam || śiśīte | śakraḥ | piśunebhyaḥ | vadham | nūnam | sr̥jat | aśanim | yātumat-bhyaḥ ||7.104.20||

IAST: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyo vadhaṁ nūnaṁ sṛjad aśaniṁ yātumadbhyaḥ
Griffith: Sakra makes sharp his weapon for the wicked: now, let him cast his bolt at fiendish wizards.
Devanāgarī: शिशीते शक्रः पिशुनेभ्यो वधं नूनं सृजदशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: ete | ūm̐ iti | tye | patayanti | śva-yātavaḥ | indram | dipsanti | dipsavaḥ | adābhyam || śiśīte | śakraḥ | piśunebhyaḥ | vadham | nūnam | sr̥jat | aśanim | yātumat-bhyaḥ ||7.104.20||

IAST: indro yātūnām abhavat parāśaro havirmathīnām abhy āvivāsatām
Griffith: Indra hath ever been the fiends' destroyer who spoil oblations of the Gods' invokers:
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो यातूनामभवत्पराशरो हविर्मथीनामभ्याविवासताम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | yātūnām | abhavat | parā-śaraḥ | haviḥ-mathīnām | abhi | ā-vivāsatām || abhi | it | ūm̐ iti | śakraḥ | paraśuḥ | yathā | vanam | pātrā-iva | bhindan | sataḥ | eti | rakṣasaḥ ||7.104.21||

IAST: abhīd u śakraḥ paraśur yathā vanam pātreva bhindan sata eti rakṣasaḥ
Griffith: Yea, Sakra, like an axe that splits the timber, attacks and smashes them like earthen vessels.
Devanāgarī: अभीदु शक्रः परशुर्यथा वनं पात्रेव भिन्दन्सत एति रक्षसः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | yātūnām | abhavat | parā-śaraḥ | haviḥ-mathīnām | abhi | ā-vivāsatām || abhi | it | ūm̐ iti | śakraḥ | paraśuḥ | yathā | vanam | pātrā-iva | bhindan | sataḥ | eti | rakṣasaḥ ||7.104.21||

IAST: ulūkayātuṁ śuśulūkayātuṁ jahi śvayātum uta kokayātum
Griffith: Destroy the fiend shaped like an owl or owlet, destroy him in the form of dog or cuckoo.
Devanāgarī: उलूकयातुं शुशुलूकयातुं जहि श्वयातुमुत कोकयातुम्
pada pāṭha: ulūka-yātum | śuśulūka-yātum | jahi | śva-yātum | uta | koka-yātum || suparṇa-yātum | uta | gr̥dhra-yātum | dr̥ṣadā-iva | pra | mr̥ṇa | rakṣaḥ | indra ||7.104.22||

IAST: suparṇayātum uta gṛdhrayātuṁ dṛṣadeva pra mṛṇa rakṣa indra
Griffith: Destroy him shaped as eagle or as vulture as with a stone, O Indra, crush the demon.
Devanāgarī: सुपर्णयातुमुत गृध्रयातुं दृषदेव प्र मृण रक्ष इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: ulūka-yātum | śuśulūka-yātum | jahi | śva-yātum | uta | koka-yātum || suparṇa-yātum | uta | gr̥dhra-yātum | dr̥ṣadā-iva | pra | mr̥ṇa | rakṣaḥ | indra ||7.104.22||

IAST: mā no rakṣo abhi naḍ yātumāvatām apocchatu mithunā yā kimīdinā
Griffith: Let not the fiend of witchcraft-workers reach us: may Dawn drive off the couples of Kimidins.
Devanāgarī: मा नो रक्षो अभि नड्यातुमावतामपोच्छतु मिथुना या किमीदिना
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | rakṣaḥ | abhi | naṭ | yātu-māvatām | apa | ucchatu | mithunā | yā | kimīdinā || pr̥thivī | naḥ | pārthivāt | pātu | aṁhasaḥ | antarikṣam | divyāt | pātu | asmān ||7.104.23||

IAST: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātv aṁhaso 'ntarikṣaṁ divyāt pātv asmān
Griffith: Earth keep us safe from earthly woe and trouble: from grief that comes from heaven mid-air preserve us.
Devanāgarī: पृथिवी नः पार्थिवात्पात्वंहसोऽन्तरिक्षं दिव्यात्पात्वस्मान्
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | rakṣaḥ | abhi | naṭ | yātu-māvatām | apa | ucchatu | mithunā | yā | kimīdinā || pr̥thivī | naḥ | pārthivāt | pātu | aṁhasaḥ | antarikṣam | divyāt | pātu | asmān ||7.104.23||

IAST: indra jahi pumāṁsaṁ yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām
Griffith: Slay the male demon, Indra! slay the female, joying and triumphing in arts of magic.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र जहि पुमांसं यातुधानमुत स्त्रियं मायया शाशदानाम्
pada pāṭha: indra | jahi | pumāṁsam | yātu-dhānam | uta | striyam | māyayā | śāśadānām || vi-grīvāsaḥ | mūra-devāḥ | r̥dantu | mā | te | dr̥śan | sūryam | ut-carantam ||7.104.24||

IAST: vigrīvāso mūradevā ṛdantu mā te dṛśan sūryam uccarantam
Griffith: Let the fools' gods with bent necks fall and perish, and see no more the Sun when he arises.
Devanāgarī: विग्रीवासो मूरदेवा ऋदन्तु मा ते दृशन्सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम्
pada pāṭha: indra | jahi | pumāṁsam | yātu-dhānam | uta | striyam | māyayā | śāśadānām || vi-grīvāsaḥ | mūra-devāḥ | r̥dantu | mā | te | dr̥śan | sūryam | ut-carantam ||7.104.24||

IAST: prati cakṣva vi cakṣvendraś ca soma jāgṛtam
Griffith: Look each one hither, look around Indra and Soma, watch ye well.
Devanāgarī: प्रति चक्ष्व वि चक्ष्वेन्द्रश्च सोम जागृतम्
pada pāṭha: prati | cakṣva | vi | cakṣva | indraḥ | ca | soma | jāgr̥tam || rakṣaḥ-bhyaḥ | vadham | asyatam | aśanim | yātumat-bhyaḥ ||7.104.25||

IAST: rakṣobhyo vadham asyatam aśaniṁ yātumadbhyaḥ
Griffith: Cast forth your weapon at the fiends, against the sorcerers hurl your bolts.
Devanāgarī: रक्षोभ्यो वधमस्यतमशनिं यातुमद्भ्यः
pada pāṭha: prati | cakṣva | vi | cakṣva | indraḥ | ca | soma | jāgr̥tam || rakṣaḥ-bhyaḥ | vadham | asyatam | aśanim | yātumat-bhyaḥ ||7.104.25||
